title: STEM Analyst – Impacts of Advanced Technologies APS Level 4/5-6
description:
Your Role

The Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG) is offering two ongoing positions as a STEM Analyst on the Impacts of Advanced Technologies.

You will develop a deep understanding of a range of technologies, and work with experts to foresee how these technologies will develop into the future. You will then creatively assess how these developments might strengthen or weaken Australia’s national interests, with a focus on Defence and national security.

The role involves desk-based technical research and analysis as part of a large team responsible for providing emerging technology and foresight advice to Defence and other government departments. You will be responsible for a technical area that corresponds to your current S&T skills, and will broaden your expertise into a range of fields relevant to Defence (for example AI, cyber, biotechnology, quantum and many others). You will be trained in role-specific analytic skills, including data analytics and foresight techniques. You will develop a sound understanding of the structure and decision-making processes of the Defence Department, to ensure your advice is tailored to have an impact. You will develop into a communications expert, able to concisely explain technical issues to busy, non-technical stakeholders. Outputs will include written reports, verbal briefings, multi-media and infographics. The role requires building networks across our own team of experts, as well as broader DSTG, Defence and intelligence.

Our Team

The technology analyst team is a part of the Defence Impacts of Emerging Technology (DIET) Group, within Strategy and Joint Force (SJF) Major Science and Technology Capability (MSTC), which is itself within the Joint and Operations Analysis Division of the Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG).

This team is organised under DSTG’s Strategic Futures Project, and works closely with the Critical Technology Foresight (CTF) Group. You will be joining a project team of approximately 25 staff, including technology analysts (like this position), experts in tools and methods (such as AI experts who write programs to assist the analysts) and social scientists (who evaluate the impact of technology on society).

The Strategic Futures Project is a centre of gravity within government for emerging technology and foresight advice. Our advice feeds into decision-making, such as for senior Defence committees, the Department’s S&T portfolio planning and capability planning for the ADF. We play a key role in whole-of-government decision-making via our strong linkages to the Critical Technology Policy Coordination Office in PM&C. We partner with DSTG’s 2000 experts, across Defence, policy and intelligence agencies, and with international experts.

Our team is passionate, professional, welcoming and inclusive.

Our Ideal Candidate

We are seeking an Australian citizen who is naturally curious and motivated to develop broad expertise across diverse emerging technologies. Candidates from all S&T disciplines will be considered, but we especially seek experts in the physical sciences, engineering or systems analysis. We seek science-communicators who are passionate about making an impact for the nation. Ideally you will have experience in the APS, academia or industry. A pre-existing interest in Defence is not required, but you must be open to developing this.

Application Closing Date: Friday 3 June, 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, reference DSTG/02119/22 on https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=B9B11BC9-9194-AB88-90BD-C88DBEBC300F

title: Configuration and Data Controller
description:
• All Systems GO! Be part of the next generation of defence technology
  • Ongoing career development and opportunity to work on a variety of interesting Defence projects
  • Enjoy flexibility , engaging work and a culture that embraces diversity and open-mindedness

At BAE Systems we are all systems go as we continue to drive innovation and seek passionate and talented people to join our business. We currently have a new opportunity as a Configuration and Data Controller within our Defence Manufacturing and Support business based in Edinburgh Parks, Adelaide.

What this opportunity will mean for you:

  • Purposeful work where your efforts are recognised in an environment where you can thrive
  • Joining an organisation that is passionate about developing some of the most impressive careers in the world
  • Industry-leading flexibility options to unlock the talent and diversity of every individual
  • Unique opportunities to contribute to programs of national significance whilst growing your skills
  • A strong safety culture, inclusive teams and work to be proud of, underpinned by a compelling set of values

Your new role:

An opportunity has arisen for a committed Configuration and Data Controller to apply their analytical skills and make a valuable contribution within our Defence Manufacturing and Support business.

Reporting to the Manufacturing and Support Engineering Manager, you will be part of an inclusive and supportive team, and will join our growing business in an exciting time on a permanent and full time basis.

Supported by a business wide Configuration Management network, this opportunity will see you:

  • Maintain the configuration and data management practices and systems within our Manufacturing and Support business
  • Undertake configuration and data management planning, including product and documentation identification and control
  • Perform configuration and data status accounting and reporting
  • Provide configuration and data management advice, support and training to internal and external stakeholders
  • Contribute to the integrity of the configuration management system including processes, tools and data
  • Perform other configuration management tasks including managing data, parts, software and documents
  • Ensure program documents are reviewed, approved and authorised in accordance with defined processes
  • Identify and investigate configuration and data problems and formulate strategies for their resolution

About you

As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you'll have:

  • Configuration or Data control/management experience or relevant experience in an engineering/technical environment.  Applicants with relevant experience within other industries are encouraged to apply
  • Good attention to detail and good communication skills with the ability to develop effective relationships with stakeholders
  • Strong computer literacy skills, analytical and problem solving skills
  • Self-motivation and the drive to improve current processes

Whilst not essential, a technical qualification or experience utilising engineering/manufacturing configuration data management systems, will be highly regarded.

Research shows that some candidates hesitate to apply for roles if they feel they don't meet 100% of the criteria. So, if this opportunity excites you and you have the right foundational experience and qualifications, we encourage you to apply. Whether it be for this role or another, your skills and competencies are of interest to us.

Clearances

As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance.

International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.

Further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html

Applications should be addressed to: Kon Yiannikopoulos, Talent Acquisition Specialist - Engineering, and made online here.  Whilst applications must be made online, confidential enquiries are very welcome via email: kon.yiannikopoulos@baesystems.com

Please be aware that pursuant to different State government health directions, vaccination mandates regarding your ability to attend our Company sites may be applicable.  Please be prepared to discuss your vaccination status with our recruiters as part of the recruitment process.

We are a 2021 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.

Our culture

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment where our people can thrive. For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of our employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation.

If you would like to know more information about how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives via this link .

To learn about other employment opportunities at BAE Systems, please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au

title: Multiple Data Analysts (APS4)
description:
About the ABS

We are Australia’s national statistical agency and an official source of independent, reliable information. We tell the real story of Australia, its economy, and its people by bringing life and meaning to numbers. We employ around 3,000 office/ work from home staff located across all capital cities and Geelong as well as 500 field-based interviewers.

About the roles

These are multiple permanent APS4 positions available full-time and part-time. Roles are based in Canberra, Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne, Adelaide, Hobart and Perth in our Macroeconomic Statistics, Industry Statistics, Population and Labour Statistics teams.

As a Data Analyst you will be expected to have some relevant work experience however, we will support you with training, coaching and development opportunities.

You will work in one of our divisional teams which have a diversity of work, people and locations. You will work collaboratively in a team of professionals to produce high quality statistics that Australia needs, and learn about relevant concepts, classifications, frameworks, data sources, methods and different types of analysis.

You will have opportunities to work on new developments such as evaluating and using new data sources and improving the processes and systems.  For example we have recently implemented the use of bank data to develop a monthly household spending indicator.

View this video for more information on the types of work/ teams – APS4 Data Analysts

Duties


Your responsibilities, depending on the role, may include:

  • analysing data from statistical collections or administrive sources and comparing against other sources
  • communicating findings, using judgement and real-world insights
  • applying statistical frameworks, classifications, standards and concepts that underpin the statistics
  • working with internal and external clients to develop fit for purpose specifications of data solutions requirements
  • critical thinking and reasoning: anticipating and analysing issues and developing logical conclusions
  • contributing to the design and testing of collection questionnaires and survey forms

We are seeking people who have:

  • sound, analytical, and creative skills, including the ability to problem solve and make decisions based on analytical evidence
  • ability to work in and add value to a team
  • good oral, and written communication skills
  • ability to work flexibly in a changing environment.

Desirable (but not essential) are:

  • previous work experience in a data compilation or statistical analysis role
  • previous experience of working in and contributing to a high performing team
  • academic qualifications in statistics, data science, mathematics, economics or other fields with a strong quantitative component

Benefits

  • Annual salary increases
  • Hybrid working (office and work from home)
  • Inclusion and diversity networks
  • Access to mentors and coaches
  • Christmas to New Year shutdown (without using your leave)


Applications close 11:30 PM AEDT, Sunday 6th February

title: Data Analyst - Funds Management
description:
About the Company:

Funds SA is a South Australian Government Corporation that invests and manages over AUD$42 billion on behalf of South Australian public-sector superannuation funds and approved public authorities.

Funds SA is a collaborative, innovative, and professional organisation with the primary aim of building prosperity for South Australians whilst achieving the highest return on investment possible.

Based in Adelaide and globally connected, Funds SA are well-known for their deep investment expertise. National and international partnerships and a “manager of managers” approach drive their pursuit of future financial prosperity through global market reach.

Funds SA prides itself on strong leadership driving a values led, supportive culture, focused on providing opportunities to learn, grow, and work with great people.

The Opportunity:
This is an exceptional opportunity emerging from commencement of a critical data analytics project , to join a high-performing team. Reporting to the Manager, Data you will work closely with the investment team members and key internal and external stakeholders.

You will be responsible for significant contribution to projects in addition to the BAU of the investment data management, across a multi-asset class portfolio.

Key responsibilities:
  • Contribute to investment data management - maintenance of investment systems and monitor and enhance data governance and quality frameworks across a multi-asset class portfolio;
  • Enhance portfolio exposure management capabilities, conduct analysis on parameters impacting exposure specifically to Funds SA;
  • Assist with providing and validating investment data and analytics for exposure, risk and performance reporting;
  • Support reporting on investment manager performance against custodian data;
  • Support continuous improvement initiatives across technical advancements and reporting;
  • Participate in a significant project to implement a new system; AND
  • Help initiate and drive process enhancements, supporting the team and management with other adhoc tasks.
What we are looking for:
  • Proven 3+ years’ experience in investment data analytics, database management and reporting, within funds management or superannuation is ideal, investment reporting experience will be considered;
  • Demonstrated experience in development and competency in SQL/Python, Agile Technologies will be ideal;
  • Experience in R-studio, C Sharp, Azure technologies and with project management experience will be looked upon favourably;
  • Mathematics/Engineering/Computer Science degree qualified is ideal, Finance or Statistics could be considered;
  • Strong understanding of Australian and international investment markets and instruments is a must, along with technology systems; AND
  • Strong written and verbal communication and stakeholder management skills are a must.
This is an exceptional opportunity for a data analyst to grow their career at a leading funds manager, which provides genuine professional development opportunities within a collaborative and high-performance culture.

If you are interested in learning more about this position, please contact Matt McGilton at 0439 028 222 at Nupur Gill at 0421 828 693 at Kaizen Recruitment or apply via the included link.

#SCR-nupur-gill
#SCR-matt-mcgilton

description:

  • Salary: $94,176 to $99,615 – ASO6 – Full Time / Ongoing Appointment

The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for the delivery of objective, high quality, professional and timely statistical analysis, interpretation and reporting of health related data that is critical to and addresses the information requirements of the Department for Health and Wellbeing

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role. title: ASO6 Data Analyst (Multiple Positions)
description:
The Data Analyst in the Performance Reporting and Analytics team is responsible for coordinating and undertaking a range of complex data analyses and writing high quality reports which can be used to identify policy and strategic implications. The work of the Data Analyst informs and complements the department’s business intelligence capability and capacity to analyse, manipulate and present data in ways that support the strategic directions of the agency and government.

Please note there are 2 x full-time (1.0 FTE) contracts up to 30 June 2023 and one full-time (1.0 FTE) ongoing role.

Please note to be employed by the department, applicants must be vaccinated against COVID-19 or have an approved medical exemption endorsed by a duly qualified medical practitioner. Unvaccinated people must comply with conditions for unvaccinated people as outlined in the Department’s website. Proof of vaccination status must be provided for sighting on request.

The successful applicant is required to gain a Department for Human Services (DHS) working with children check (WWCC) prior to being employed which is required to be renewed every five years before expiry. The incumbent will be required to undertake RRHAN –EC (Responding to Risks of Harm, Abuse and Neglect - Education Care) Facilitator Lead (Masterclass) extended course or the online (Fundamentals) course which will be required to be updated every three years.
For all other Special Conditions please refer to the Role Description.

Applicants are required to submit a CV, the Application Cover Sheet, Employment Declaration, and a written statement of no more than 1500 words. Written statements should address the criteria outlined in the Role Description. Applicants should include the name, address and contact number of three (3) referees, one being your current line manager.

Enquiries may be addressed to Sandra Pattison on Tel: 8226 1104 or Email: Sandra.pattison@sa.gov.au

For further information and details on how to apply for this vacancy, please go to iworkfor.sa.gov.au and search for vacancy number 484175.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working including part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role.

Closing date is 22/05/2022  5.00PM

title: Business Analyst
description:
At Advance, we build financial processing systems which use technologies on desktop, cloud and mobile.

You would be working as part of a team that is building a financial services application based on the Microsoft stack.

You will be responsible for analysis and specification creation for new features and changes as part of an existing insurance management system.

Part of your role will be to assist the project management function by ensuring that the deliverables will be met. The core project team has worked well together for many years.

You will need to:

  • Learn the system
  • Read and understand the existing specifications
  • Identify the key user requirements and existing system architecture
  • Communicate and document project progress

Essential Experience:

  • 3+ years of structured business & process analysis
  • Specification development
  • Project management

Desirable Experience:

  • Insurance or Finance industry

Qualifications

  • A degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science or related field

If you feel you have the right mix of experience, enthusiasm and prepared to do some hard work, then we want you.

title: Business Analyst - Data
description:
• July Start
  • Initial 12-month contract with a 12-month extension available
  • $950/day plus Super
  • Open to Australian Citizens

We are looking for an experienced business analyst with detailed data and analytics experience to work in the new Data and Analytics Office (DAO).

Responsibilities:

  • Working in multi-disciplinary teams to deliver data and analytics projects using Agile approaches.
  • Working with business to understand data requirements and issues.
  • Working with ICT and business systems teams to identify data and make data available for analysis.
  • Delivering robust, user-focused data insights using Power BI, and other BI tools.
  • Establishing productivity systems and processes – providing input into processes and systems (e.g. DevOps and Git) to manage work and share code.

Essential Criteria:

  • Active engagement with the business to understand data requirements and issues.
  • Assistance drafting business requirements and scoping material to suit business needs.
  • Assist with data analysis and investigation.
  • Work with ICT and Business Systems teams to confirm requirements, remediate issues and communicate with the business.
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications (in business analysis, computer science, science) or comparable industry experience.
  • Ability to obtain baseline clearance.

Desirable Criteria:

  • Azure DevOps for managing work activities.
  • Power BI experience.

Thank you for your application; due to the volume of applications we may not be able to respond to all applicants.

Best of luck with your job search.

title: BI Analyst
description:
Our client URGENTLY requires a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst for a 6 months + Contract in Darwin.

The BI Analyst will provide support and analysis for the development and maintenance of reports, dashboards and universes in the ICT Business Intelligence environment.

Skills and experience include:

  • Demonstrated experience in the development of reports and universes using SAP Business Objects v4
  • Demonstrated experience in the development of dashboards using Tableau
  • Demonstrated experience in the ability to identify, analyse, present and reconcile information from a variety of systems
  • Excellent knowledge in the administration of an SAP BI environment including the management of security groups and the promotion of objects through the environments

Utilities and / or Government experience highly-regarded!

Contract Extensions Highly Likely!

Top $'s Paid !

To change your lifestyle, grow your career and make a real impact, please forward your CV to Jobs@QualityPeople.com.au

Quality People is committed to all forms of workforce diversity and encourages applications from men and women of all ages and cultures, including indigenous Australians.

title: Data and Performance Analyst
description:
About the Role

As an expert in data analytics and with a specialist knowledge of various business intelligence tools, you will analyse and interpret complex data sets to provide innovative solutions that support university-wide performance monitoring, decision-making and compliance reporting activities. You will design, develop, and manage projects to support strategic decision making, and continually review and improve a suite of core performance reports and data analysis tools that are aligned with the University’s strategy.

You will lead the development and implementation of a quality training program for professional and academic staff and be highly skilled in the presentation of multifaceted data sets to a range of audiences.

About UniSA

The University of South Australia is Australia’s University of Enterprise. Our culture of innovation is anchored around global and national links to academic, research and industry partners. Our graduates are the new urban professionals, global citizens at ease with the world and ready to create and respond to change. Our research is inventive and adventurous and we create new knowledge that is central to global economic and social prosperity.

Core Responsibilities

  • Analyse and interpret qualitative and quantitative data through the application of various business intelligence tools
  • Provide specialist advice on institutional and market information for strategic planning, institutional benchmarking, and university-wide performance measurement
  • Evaluate, prioritise, and respond to data requests from key internal and external stakeholders
  • Utilise a variety of methods and tools to interpret and present complex data and information to audiences at all levels
  • Develop and maintain effective business partnerships, using a consultancy approach


Essential Skills and Experience

  • Relevant tertiary qualification and experience in a relevant field, or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education
  • Expertise in the use of Business Intelligence tools and statistical techniques
  • Ability to extract, manage and manipulate complex datasets
  • High level writing and presentation skills, and ability to present information in a clear and concise manner
  • Well-developed business partnership skills, with experience in negotiating and problem-solving with clients


Benefits

Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as:

  • Access to great personal development opportunities
  • Generous superannuation contributions of 17%
  • Flexible working conditions
  • Employee assistance and development programs
  • A range of salary packaging options, including vehicle leasing, laptops and car parking fees


Culture

As a University of Enterprise, we offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our staff are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm. We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results.

How to Apply

For a copy of the position description and to apply, please visit Working at UniSA. The online application form will list the specific selection criteria that you need to address.

Please address your cover letter to Jade Windsor, Senior Consultant: Recruitment Central . For further information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact UniSA Recruitment Central on +61 8 8302 1700 or via email at recruitment@unisa.edu.au using job reference number 4029 .

Applications close: 11.30pm Wednesday 1 June 2022

Applications welcomed from Australian or NZ citizens, Australian permanent residents and those who have the legal right to work in Australia for the term of appointment.

#LI-DNI

title: Data Engineer
description:
• Exciting opportunity to join SA's iconic RAA
  • 12 month full-time position based in Mile End- including working from home
  • Join a tight-knit team with a fun, inclusive and supportive culture

Who we are -

As one of the state's largest and most iconic organisations, we're proud to make things better for members and better for our community. More than 780,000 members choose us to deliver peace of mind through our trusted range of motor, home and travel products and services. We're also one of the state's largest employers (and growing!), with more than 1200 employees working collectively with the common goal to keep our members moving.

Your new opportunity

An exciting opportunity has become available to design and implement data warehouses, data marts and data stores for current and future needs and to enhance the value of data analytics. As an integral member of our team your role will be to:

  • Design data models to store new datasets or changes in requirements
  • Develop, test, document, implement and support data platform solutions to acquire data, transform it and prepare it for business consumption
  • Identify data discrepancies and data quality issues, and work to ensure data consistency and integrity
  • Diagnose and resolve data platform performance issues
  • Identify opportunities for process improvements within the team, such as automation and advise on solutions
  • Deliver quality and professional service to internal customers at RAA by identifying and responding to their needs

What will set you apart from the rest

At RAA we hire on cultural add first and technical fit second, however, to be successful in this role you will need:

  • In depth skills in analytics database platforms, including the Microsoft SQL Server stack and preferably Azure Data Factory
  • Demonstrated experience in data modelling, database design, implementation, and support
  • Strong ability to understand business requirements and translate into technical solutions
  • Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities
  • Excellent technical architecture and technical support documentation skills
  • Ability to conduct research into database issues, standards and products as required

What sets us apart from the rest

  • To ensure our employees feel valued, empowered and celebrated we provide a range of employee benefits including:
  • Free RAA premium road service & discounts on all RAA Products
  • Flexible Work Arrangements
  • Ongoing Training & Development Opportunities & Study Support Program
  • Wellbeing Facilities and Corporate Health Insurance Plan
  • On-site Cafe with Barista - plus much more!

How to apply

Simply hit "Apply for this job" to access further information found in the position description or follow the prompts to apply.

Applications Close: 9:00am Wednesday 1 June

Please note applications may be short-listed and progressed prior to the closing date.

We're committed to building a workplace that's diverse and inclusive, where employees are embraced for their unique qualities and valued for their contributions. We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in everyone, and helps us to give our members better service.

title: Operations Analyst
description:
hummgroup (ASX-HUM) is one of Australasia’s most successful and enduring fintech organisations with a proud legacy of rewriting the playbook for digital spending. We help people buy everything, everywhere, every day. Our Philosophy is to deliver creative and tailored financial solutions to our customers around the globe. we enable and empower our people to build lifetime relationships of value and opportunity for the benefit of you, our colleagues, customers and shareholders.

Sitting in the Technology portfolio, the Operations & Monitoring team is responsible for the execution, management, monitoring, support, and maintenance of our product technology. We are on the lookout for a Operations Analyst. The purpose of this role is to proactively support the day-to-day IT operations of the humm products.

You will be responsible for:

  • Proactively monitor production systems ensuring availability across all IT critical services meets or exceeds agreed service levels
  • Resolve and mitigate the impact of missed SLAs
  • Update monitoring and telemetry alerts and dashboards for relevant applications to provide a view of current system status and proactive alerts of any system issues or degradation in service.
  • Identify new candidates and provide input for additional monitoring and alerting
  • Completion of daily system checks to ensure system availability, and interpret the results
  • Set up, implement, and monitor Secure File transmissions to and from humm group
  • Providing Level 2 operational support for internally or externally developed applications, on which our internal & external customers are dependent
  • Investigating, analysing, and trouble-shooting issues, providing key input to Problem investigation of application incidents from an operational perspective
  • Ensure IT ticket requests and incidents, are prioritised, allocated and updated, working towards same day resolution of tickets where possible
  • Supporting operations overnight and weekends on a roster
  • Demonstrating high levels of communication and support to business stakeholders to maintain business confidence in application support
  • Produce and review operational documentation where a gap in documentation is identified to reduce key point dependencies
  • Analyse and review logs using complex searches
  • Provide input to improving operational support processes on an ongoing basis

About you:

  • A good understanding of SQL, Unix, Oracle DB advantageous
  • Knowledge of telemetry tools e.g. Elastic, Splunk, Dynatrace
  • Good problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, and an analytical mind and the ability to multi-task
  • Willingness to grow and learn new skills, such as Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.
  • High degree of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Demonstrated high level of interpersonal and communication skills
  • Proven ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently as required
  • Proven working experience in providing operations support or development experience
  • The ability to work under pressure
  • Exposure to Cloud based solutions and support
  • Willing to be rostered on overnight/weekend support

humm group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We adopt and encourage diversity through an open and inclusive culture that values and respects all our employees, customers and communities in which we live, work and are a part of.

We recognise you have a life outside work, and we encourage flexible working to enable you to balance your work and family commitments.

We have a recognition scheme for you, your colleagues, and peers - we encourage everyone to say thanks regularly, and to nominate each other for our company awards;

title: Data Engineer
description:
Unlock your potential and help us challenge the status quo, while doing the best work of your life. We want creative and passionate people on our team, who can go beyond what's possible to make lives better. What we do is centered around creating shared value for our stakeholders. And how we do things is what makes us unique. We know everyone's best work takes different shapes and forms, and we are committed to empowering and harnessing this difference. For us, development is continuous, learning is holistic, and How We Work Together is more than just a tagline.

Who are we? We are OZ Minerals, a modern mining company.

Your new role:

We are looking for passionate Data Engineers who aren't afraid to approach complex problems head on, have a ‘can do' attitude and take great pride in their work. You will play a key role in delivering high quality and innovative solutions / insights contributing to successful outcomes for the Company. Permanent and Contract roles available .

As a key member of our Digital, Robotics and Automation team, you will:
  • ​​​Work with a best of breed cloud technology stack - Airflow, Snowflake, dbt & Tableau
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team
  • Question the WHY; innovate and think differently.
  • Be empowered to take responsibility for your own deliverables.
  • Enjoy our flexible working culture, that focuses on WHAT you deliver, not WHERE you deliver it.
How you will create impact:
  • Focusing on partnerships and collaboration, contributing to the overall success of the team.
  • Continuous improvement of end-to-end processes, standards, and quality.
  • Take a lead in the Data and Analytics Community of Practice, in uplifting the data literacy of the organisation.
What we value:
  • Passionate about new technology, data and data driven insights
  • Strong experience in SQL and any programming language (i.e. Python, Java, C#) is a must
  • An agile approach to your work, managing fast-paced incremental delivery of value to stakeholders
  • The ability to bridge the gap between the business problem and the technical solution
  • Bringing creativity, diversity of thought, experience, and knowledge to deliver great outcomes.
To Apply:

If the above excites you, and even makes you a little nervous, then we want you to apply! It's an exciting and transformative time for us; and we need creative, collaborative, and great people like you.

#comeworkwithus

Applications close date: Friday 10 June 2022

title: Multiple Data Analysts (APS4)
description:
About the ABS

We are Australia’s national statistical agency and an official source of independent, reliable information. We tell the real story of Australia, its economy, and its people by bringing life and meaning to numbers. We employ around 3,000 office/ work from home staff located across all capital cities and Geelong as well as 500 field-based interviewers.

About the roles

These are multiple permanent APS4 positions available full-time and part-time. Roles are based in Canberra, Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne, Adelaide, Hobart and Perth in our Macroeconomic Statistics, Industry Statistics, Population and Labour Statistics teams.

As a Data Analyst you will be expected to have some relevant work experience however, we will support you with training, coaching and development opportunities.

You will work in one of our divisional teams which have a diversity of work, people and locations. You will work collaboratively in a team of professionals to produce high quality statistics that Australia needs, and learn about relevant concepts, classifications, frameworks, data sources, methods and different types of analysis.

You will have opportunities to work on new developments such as evaluating and using new data sources and improving the processes and systems.  For example we have recently implemented the use of bank data to develop a monthly household spending indicator.

View this video for more information on the types of work/ teams – APS4 Data Analysts

Duties


Your responsibilities, depending on the role, may include:

  • analysing data from statistical collections or administrive sources and comparing against other sources
  • communicating findings, using judgement and real-world insights
  • applying statistical frameworks, classifications, standards and concepts that underpin the statistics
  • working with internal and external clients to develop fit for purpose specifications of data solutions requirements
  • critical thinking and reasoning: anticipating and analysing issues and developing logical conclusions
  • contributing to the design and testing of collection questionnaires and survey forms

We are seeking people who have:

  • sound, analytical, and creative skills, including the ability to problem solve and make decisions based on analytical evidence
  • ability to work in and add value to a team
  • good oral, and written communication skills
  • ability to work flexibly in a changing environment.

Desirable (but not essential) are:

  • previous work experience in a data compilation or statistical analysis role
  • previous experience of working in and contributing to a high performing team
  • academic qualifications in statistics, data science, mathematics, economics or other fields with a strong quantitative component

Benefits

  • Annual salary increases
  • Hybrid working (office and work from home)
  • Inclusion and diversity networks
  • Access to mentors and coaches
  • Christmas to New Year shutdown (without using your leave)


Applications close 11:30 PM AEDT, Sunday 6th February

title: Support Analyst
description:
Bravura is seeking a Support Analyst to join our dynamic Corporate Systems team. The Support Analyst is responsible for understanding and evaluating internal client issues with software solutions in Bravura’s ERP Systems, data warehouse and reporting solutions, then helping to resolve those issues.

Strong analytical skills and a hunger for knowledge will help the successful candidate deliver quality outcomes for Bravura’s Internal clients. This position can be based in Adelaide, Sydney, or Melbourne with the flexibility to attend the office on an ad hoc basis.

The role will have responsibility for

  • Analysing issues raised by internal clients, determining the best course of action for resolution, actioning or facilitating that resolution
  • Documenting software bugs, data translation issues or workflow failure, working with the corporate systems team to ensure that the software delivered meets the requirements
  • Management of client raised helpdesk tickets to resolution
  • Analysis and replication of defects, and testing of software fixes
  • Actively improving software development and business processes


Key skills

  • Excellent communication and customer service skills
  • Proven ability of identifying software/data problems and translating these into effective, quality solutions
  • Ability to distinguish between software, environmental and user errors
  • A disciplined approach to planning and managing goals, coupled with the ability to prioritise deliverables
  • Results oriented, analytical and resourceful in finding solutions
  • A clear understanding of the Quote to cash lifecycle for professional service organisations, and financial/management reporting
  • A clear understanding of databases, systems integration, segregation of duties, security and data management


Qualifications and Experience

  • 3+ years’ experience in a similar Software support role
  • Familiarity with relational databases, SQL and the software development lifecycle
  • Experience working within helpdesk/service desk environment with ability to understand and act appropriately when presented with conflicting priorities
  • Tertiary education in Computer Science/Information Technology seen favourably
  • Advanced skills in one or more of the major programming languages, SQL and in the evaluation of hardware and software options seen favourably
  • Workday, MS project server, and TM1 administration experience seen favourably


What we offer you:

We are passionate about what we do, holding ourselves accountable to standards of excellence while celebrating our successes along the way. Our people are at the heart of our business. We work hard to provide a rich employee experience and a robust framework for ongoing career development.

  • A friendly, social and supportive global team that thrives on delivery & embraces diversity
  • We are enthusiastic and adventurous with a large global reach; we have employees, offices, and customers across the world utilising our award-winning solutions
  • Competitive salary and employee benefits scheme
  • Flexible working hours, we value work-life balance
  • Newly renovated offices that inspire Agile and collaborative ways of working


About Bravura Solutions

At Bravura Solutions, collaboration, diversity and excellence matter. We value your ideas, giving you room to be curious and innovate in an exciting, fast-paced, and flexible environment.


As a market leader and ASX 200 company, we are a trusted partner to over 350 leading financial services clients. We invest significantly in our technology hubs and innovation labs, which inspire and drive our creative, future-focused mindset. We take pride in developing cutting-edge technology solutions that support our clients to achieve financial security and prosperity for their customers.


How to apply?


If you are interested in joining an ASX listed fintech powering the world’s leading financial institutions, we would love to hear from you so apply online today.


Please note, as part of the job application process, you will be taken to Bravura Solutions’ careers portal. We don’t always work to fixed closing dates and will consider candidates as and when they apply.

title: Business Analyst
description:

About Bravura Solutions

At Bravura Solutions, collaboration, diversity and excellence matter. We value your ideas, giving you room to be curious and innovate in an exciting, fast-paced, and flexible environment.

As a market leader and ASX 200 company, we are a trusted partner to over 350 leading financial services clients. We invest significantly in our technology hubs and innovation labs, which inspire and drive our creative, future-focused mindset. title: Application Support Analyst
description:
humm group (ASX-HUM) is one of Australasia’s most successful and enduring fintech organisations with a proud legacy of rewriting the playbook for digital spending. We help people buy everything, everywhere, every day. Our product ecosystem of buy now pay later, credit cards, and business financing products has been designed around the core needs of today's shoppers, retailers, and small and medium enterprises.

What's so exciting about this role?

The Application Support team, which sits within the IT/Tech team at hummgroup , is a team focussed on supporting both internal and vendor applications. As an [JI1] [link removed] Application Support Analyst you are accountable for end-to-end responsibility for your area of focus and will need to be flexible and able to take on additional work as required, always putting the customer first.

What does an average day look like?

So as part of this crucial team, you will be responsible for:

  • Providing Level 2 support for internally or externally developed applications, on which our internal & external customers are dependent
  • Investigating, analysing and trouble-shooting issues, providing key input to Problem investigation of application incidents
  • Prioritising and working on IT ticket requests and incidents, working towards same day resolution of tickets where possible
  • Supporting operations overnight and weekends on a roster;
  • Demonstrating high levels of communication and support to business stakeholders in order to maintain business confidence in application support;
  • Ensuring availability across all IT critical services meets or exceeds agreed service levels;
  • Producing operational documentation where a gap in documentation is identified in order to reduce key point dependencies;
  • Completion of daily system checks to ensure system availability.

Who will thrive in this role?

You will be an experienced professional who is adept at utilising your expertise in the following technical areas:

  • Advanced problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, and an analytical mind
  • High degree of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Demonstrated high level of interpersonal and communication skills
  • Proven ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently as required
  • Proven working experience in providing application support or development experience
  • Strong client-facing and communication skills
  • Good at multi-tasking and troubleshooting
  • A good understanding of SQL, Unix, Oracle DB advantageous
  • Knowledge/experience working with BNPL or credit card products would be valuable

You’ll also consider have a growth mindset, eager to learn new skills from within your cross functional team as well as a genuine passion for technology solutions.

Working at hummgroup

This is an exceptional opportunity for someone who enjoys diversity in their role and the ability to think outside of the box!

How we humm – Feed your mind. Focus on impact. Feel their world. Famous for delivery and # FTB!

We champion flexible working practices, celebrate successes and believe in giving things a try through learning and applying emergent practices.

Opportunities like this don’t come around everyday, so if this is the role you’ve been searching for, apply today!

title: Technical Business Analyst
description:
Technical Business Analyst

Who we are

Daitum is an Australian AI scaleup on a mission to enable decision-makers in any organisation to make better business decisions. Our SaaS platform utilises state-of-the-art AI to finally allow decision makers to make the right call – all the time. Think areas like staff rostering, production scheduling, inventory management or logistics: Daitum crunches the numbers, compares millions of options and recommends an optimised course of action in no time.

Daitum’s mission is to remove all technical barriers that stand in the way of the widespread adoption of this awesome technology. Our team is made up of dedicated and intelligent individuals who believe in our mission, and who have an innovative mindset to bring that vision to life.

What you will work on

An integral member of the Customer Success team, you will be responsible for setting up Daitum’s cloud-based optimisation software to address specific customer needs.

Daitum’s software is highly configurable and can be set up to model any operational problem. You will work with customers and internal stakeholders to understand the customer’s unique operational requirements. Using your strong analytical and problem-solving skills, you will design and implement the optimisation model required to meet the customers’ requirements, possibly establishing and ensuring adoption of new user workflows in the process.

You will provide production support to ensure model implementations maximise the customer’s business value over time. Eventually you will own one or more of the standard domain models, becoming an expert in its capabilities and extending it to deliver more and more value to our customer base.

Who you are

You must be flexible, proactive, and have a passion for technology-based products. Strong analytical skills are essential. This is an excellent opportunity for someone looking to break into high-growth startups. You will have the opportunity to influence Daitum’s product roadmap and meaningfully level up the efficiency of our execution and delivery. Effective communication skills are essential to promote close collaboration with both Daitum’s customers and our technical team.

Nuts & bolts

This role is permanent full-time and based in Australia. Our headquarters are in Adelaide, with team members working a mixed office / remote. This role is Adelaide-based.

We offer:

  • A mixed office/from-home work arrangement
  • Opportunities for professional development and career advancement
  • Employee incentive schemes and equity in the company
  • Remote position or relocation support for the right candidate

Apply here by submitting your resume and a cover letter summarising your experience, outlining why you are interested in this role, and identifying how you believe you can contribute to our team. Only applicants with a cover letter will be considered.

Please note only people with the right to work permanently in Australia will be considered.

title: Business Analyst
description:
• Join a Regional Market Leader
  • Fulltime, Professional Growth Opportunity
  • Blue-chip & Government, Complex, Exciting Projects

Dialog (Dialog Information Technology) is a diverse organisation with over 1200 employees throughout Australia, providing a full range of technology solutions, and services to customers in private and public sectors.

Dialog’s consulting specialists help organisations get the best from their information technology investment – from short consultancy assignments through to major systems integration, application outsourcing or development projects.

Earlier this year we announced that we joined the NCS Group of companies (wholly owned by Singtel) which significantly builds out our scale and opportunities for our consultants to work in exciting programs that can and will define your career.

Our mission is simple and clear - we advance our clients corporate objectives and improve their business operations through the implementation of cost-effective IT solutions.

Work with the best for the best:
We are seeking accomplished Business Analysts to work closely with our clients to help them deliver complex programmes of work.

You will have brilliant communication skills, have a deeply inquiring mind that allows you to develop domain knowledge quickly. You will be fascinated by what is possible and how problems are solved with technology, and you will be proactive in suggesting suitable solutions for an optimal outcome for our customers.

In your tool kit you may have a technical background which could allow you to have a deeper solutioning conversation, or you come in from a pre business play; either way you will be a valuable member of our team with your curiosity and energised approach to helping our customers succeed.

Your path to success starts with you:
To be successful with us, you will have:

  • 6 + years of experience in large scale transformational programs with as focus on IaaS, PaaS and SaaS as a Business/Systems Analyst
  • Degree qualification in Commerce, Business. IT or equivalent experience
  • Strong Analytical and data modelling skills.
  • Intermediate excel skills (V Lookups, Pivot tables)
  • Power BI experience / knowledge (desirable)
  • Skilled in data story telling
  • Exceptional requirements gathering and documentation skills
  • Experience with use cases / user stories / wireframes / user navigation
  • Experience implementing web-based applications
  • Excellent stakeholder management skills and ability to resolve problems with conflicting needs / requirements from a diverse group
  • Experience in running requirements workshops / interviews
  • Ability to deal with complex data requirements
  • The ability to bridge business and technology, managing the relationships between key stakeholders and carefully navigating competing requirements to a successful outcome
  • A natural ability to influence and run workshops with multiple stakeholders and interest groups
  • The ability to be the trusted advisor and bridge between the projects and the business

Become part of our Vision:
We continually aim to create an employee experience that embraces diversity, inclusion and builds a community and sense of belonging.

Dialog's services range from strategic IT consulting through full life cycle application development and managed application services to long-term operational support.

Dialog's subsidiary companies provide complementary products and specialist services.

Established in 1979, Dialog has delivered innovative solutions to clients across all industries including all levels of government.

Visit our website www.dialog.com.au for more information.

PEOPLE, TECHNOLOGY, RETHINK EVERYTHING

title: Datacom at Modbury is HIRING - Full Time - Customer Service Roles
description:
Datacom is growing! As a result, we are hiring for Customer Support roles in Modbury, Adelaide. Learn practical skills, build long-lasting friendships all while working flexible hours! Be recognised and rewarded for your contributions while making a real difference to the lives of Australians.

As a Customer Service Representative, you will be providing essential services to people across Australia on behalf of our Australian Federal Government clients! In this role you'll be operating in a dynamic team environment with a focus on meeting quality outcomes for customers.

What your day will look like?

- Working to a rotating roster that ties into your lifestyle

- Receiving inbound calls and resolving enquires related to a variety of government services

- Learning new skills while on the job

- Recording customer interactions and process account information

- Managing customer expectations

- Collaborating within the Datacom Connect team

What you'll bring

To be successful in this role, you'll bring:

- An interest in customer service

- Patience and empathy towards people in difficult situations

- The ability to identify customer needs and provide support.

- A team player focus, working collaboratively to exceed expectations

- Flexibility and adaptability

- A love for learning new things

- Intermediate computer skills

- Proficient verbal and written communication skills

- Australian Citizenship

Benefits

Working at Datacom you are part of a team that connects people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in. With over 7,200 people across our global offices and an annual revenue of over AU $1.1 billion annually Datacom is one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. We offer:

- Fast paced, friendly and supportive team environment

- Paid training

- Rewards & Recognition programs, performance incentives, end of year parties - and more!

- Paid parental leave

- Monthly cake day, fresh fruit and regular monthly engagement events

- Retail discounts from leading retailers like Woolworths, Amazon and Apple

- Comprehensive training resources, with ongoing coaching and development

- Rapid career progression through our Datacom Academy, where you can work your way up and across the business

- A best-in-class employee assistance program run by Assure

- Employee referral programs - once you are in and you are loving it - you can refer a friend and get $500!

If you're looking for meaningful work with genuine career progression opportunities, training and development, we'd love to hear from you.

APPLY WITH US TODAY!

title: Behavioural Scientist / Psychologist
description:
The Australian Wine Research Institute is looking for someone to bring insights and practices from behavioural science and organisational psychology to our extension and adoption programs. These programs are designed to disseminate knowledge and promote practice change in the grape and wine sector.

The ideal candidate will hold a degree in psychology, behavioural science or a related discipline. Ability to design and manage projects, superior communication skills and teamwork experience are also prerequisites.

The Australian Wine Research Institute (AWRI) is the Australian grape and wine industry’s own research organisation. It supports a sustainable and successful grape and wine industry through world-class research, practical solutions and knowledge transfer. The AWRI has strong links with the wine industry and other research organisations and provides a stimulating and challenging work environment.

The position will be based at the Waite Research Precinct, Adelaide, SA and will work closely with several teams at the AWRI.

A position description is available from Behavioural Scientist/Psychologist Position Description. For further information, please contact the Group Manager – Industry Development and Support, Con Simos, on 0448889432 or con.simos@awri.com.au .

Applications should be completed via the online form at https://www.awri.com.au/about_the_awri/people/careers/ Only applications that are completed via the online application form will be considered. Applications will be assessed as they are received.

title: Data Scientist
company: Department of Education, Skills and Employment
description:
Position Summary

The National Skills Commission (NSC) is seeking an experienced Data Scientist for an Assistant Director role to lead the analysis and modelling of labour markets, skills, higher education sector and the vocational education and training (VET) sector using complex datasets. This will contribute to the NSC’s role in providing advice and national leadership on Australia’s labour market and current, emerging, and future workforce skills needs.

The Skills Intelligence team is a fast paced, high performing area in the NSC. Reporting to the Director of the Skills Intelligence team, the Data Scientist will be responsible for collaborating across our multi-disciplinary team to understand stakeholder needs and deliver fit-for-purpose strategic improvements to the Classification. You will perform data analysis and provide expert analytical knowledge to support the development, publication, and maintenance of the Australian Skills Classification.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Responsibilities of the EL1 Data Scientist may include:
  • Assist the Director in the management of a section.
  • Lead a small team of data analysts and qualitative researchers to deliver new profiles and improvements to the Classification.
  • Lead and manage a portfolio of methodological work, giving important methodological advice and assistance to other parts of the NSC and the wider department.
  • Establish and maintain strong collaborative relationships with a range of key internal and external stakeholders.
  • Undertake complex analytical tasks and produce timely, purpose-specific, and appropriate solutions, technical reports, and executive briefings.
  • Apply statistical computing languages (such as R, Python or SAS) and tools to manipulate data for analysis.

Qualifications and Education

  • Academic qualifications or equivalent experience in mathematics, statistics, data science, physics, economics/econometrics, computer science, engineering, bioinformatics, psychology, or another field with a strong quantitative component are highly desirable. A demonstrated ability to learn and apply new methods and technologies will also be highly regarded.

Capabilities

We are seeking individuals with the following skills and capabilities:

  • Demonstrated experience with Natural Language Processing techniques.
  • Knowledge/Experience in Labour Markets, higher education or VET would be an advantage but not essential.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team on multiple competing priorities of varying complexity and urgency while sustaining positive team culture.
  • Proven ability to work effectively and supervise staff in a multidisciplinary and geographically distributed team, and to supervise and develop specialist staff in a high-performance culture.
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills, and the ability to convey complex and sensitive information, and engage with a range of stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated experience in understanding business needs, technical requirements, undertaking business analysis and advising on business process improvements.
  • Ability to manage data science quality assurance.
  • Ability to identify business needs, understand policy context in a complex environment.
  • Experience in the use of visualisation tools such as R-shiny, Power BI and Qlik.
  • Experience working in an agile environment using tools such as DevOps.

For further information please review the job information pack and position description available here .

Job Reference Number: 22/0529 EXT Assistant Director (Data Scientist)

title: ETL Developer
