title: Business Intelligence Business Analyst
description:
• Fantastic opportunity to be part of a data analytics cloud transformation program
  • Full-time permanent role based at Mile End - including working from home
  • Join a great collaborative team with a fun, inclusive and supportive culture

Your new opportunity

This exciting role will have you translate business requirements into technical specifications for business intelligence (BI), designing data store solutions for engineers to implement. Your key tasks will be:

  • Conduct preliminary analysis with business stakeholders to gather data store requirements, which will support their analytic and reporting needs.
  • Document the scope of requests for work, to enable high level estimation and planning.
  • Document detailed analysis of business data store requirements, supporting both functional and non-functional specifications.
  • Develop detailed solution designs to provide technical specifications for engineers to build data stores for analytics and reporting usage.
  • Help business stakeholders perform test plans consistent with their requirements and help delivery teams manage changes in scope.

What will set you apart from the rest

At RAA we hire on cultural add first and technical fit second, however, to be successful in this role you will need:

  • Knowledge of business analysis and data warehouse design in a BI environment
  • Strong ability to understand business requirements and architectural solutions and translate into technical specifications for development
  • Understanding of data analysis, data integration and data modelling techniques
  • Experience working as a data warehouse developer desirable
  • Proven ability to communicate effectively with people of all levels

What sets us apart from the rest

  • To ensure our employees feel valued, empowered and celebrated, we provide a range of employee benefits including:
  • Flexible Work Arrangements including working from home
  • Free RAA premium road service & discounts on all RAA Products
  • Ongoing Training & Development Opportunities & Study Support Program
  • Wellbeing Facilities and Corporate Health Insurance Plan
  • On-site Cafe with Barista - plus much more!

Who we are -

As one of the state's largest and most iconic organisations, we're proud to make things better for members and better for our community. More than 780,000 members choose us to deliver peace of mind through our trusted range of motor, home and travel products and services. We're also one of the state's largest employers (and growing!), with more than 1200 employees working collectively with the common goal to keep our members moving.

How to apply

Simply hit "Apply for this job" to access further information found in the position description or follow the prompts to apply.

Please note applications may be short-listed and progressed prior to the closing date.

We're committed to building a workplace that's diverse and inclusive, where employees are embraced for their unique qualities and valued for their contributions. We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in everyone, and helps us to give our members better service.

title: Configuration and Data Controller
description:
• All Systems GO! Be part of the next generation of defence technology
  • Ongoing career development and opportunity to work on a variety of interesting Defence projects
  • Enjoy flexibility , engaging work and a culture that embraces diversity and open-mindedness

At BAE Systems we are all systems go as we continue to drive innovation and seek passionate and talented people to join our business. We currently have a new opportunity as a Configuration and Data Controller within our Defence Manufacturing and Support business based in Edinburgh Parks, Adelaide.

What this opportunity will mean for you:

  • Purposeful work where your efforts are recognised in an environment where you can thrive
  • Joining an organisation that is passionate about developing some of the most impressive careers in the world
  • Industry-leading flexibility options to unlock the talent and diversity of every individual
  • Unique opportunities to contribute to programs of national significance whilst growing your skills
  • A strong safety culture, inclusive teams and work to be proud of, underpinned by a compelling set of values

Your new role:

An opportunity has arisen for a committed Configuration and Data Controller to apply their analytical skills and make a valuable contribution within our Defence Manufacturing and Support business.

Reporting to the Manufacturing and Support Engineering Manager, you will be part of an inclusive and supportive team, and will join our growing business in an exciting time on a permanent and full time basis.

Supported by a business wide Configuration Management network, this opportunity will see you:

  • Maintain the configuration and data management practices and systems within our Manufacturing and Support business
  • Undertake configuration and data management planning, including product and documentation identification and control
  • Perform configuration and data status accounting and reporting
  • Provide configuration and data management advice, support and training to internal and external stakeholders
  • Contribute to the integrity of the configuration management system including processes, tools and data
  • Perform other configuration management tasks including managing data, parts, software and documents
  • Ensure program documents are reviewed, approved and authorised in accordance with defined processes
  • Identify and investigate configuration and data problems and formulate strategies for their resolution

About you

As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you'll have:

  • Configuration or Data control/management experience or relevant experience in an engineering/technical environment.  Applicants with relevant experience within other industries are encouraged to apply
  • Good attention to detail and good communication skills with the ability to develop effective relationships with stakeholders
  • Strong computer literacy skills, analytical and problem solving skills
  • Self-motivation and the drive to improve current processes

Whilst not essential, a technical qualification or experience utilising engineering/manufacturing configuration data management systems, will be highly regarded.

Research shows that some candidates hesitate to apply for roles if they feel they don't meet 100% of the criteria. So, if this opportunity excites you and you have the right foundational experience and qualifications, we encourage you to apply. Whether it be for this role or another, your skills and competencies are of interest to us.

Clearances

As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance.

International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.

Further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html

Applications should be addressed to: Kon Yiannikopoulos, Talent Acquisition Specialist - Engineering, and made online here.  Whilst applications must be made online, confidential enquiries are very welcome via email: kon.yiannikopoulos@baesystems.com

Please be aware that pursuant to different State government health directions, vaccination mandates regarding your ability to attend our Company sites may be applicable.  Please be prepared to discuss your vaccination status with our recruiters as part of the recruitment process.

We are a 2021 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.

Our culture

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment where our people can thrive. For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of our employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation.

If you would like to know more information about how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives via this link .

To learn about other employment opportunities at BAE Systems, please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au

title: Data Engineer
description:
Data Action (DA) has over 30 years' experience as a specialist software and services provider to the alternate banking and financial services industry. Operating nationally and servicing a broad client base including customer owned banks, credit unions, neobanks and financial services membership organisations, DA's focus of supporting the financial wellbeing of Australians is echoed through our values:

  • No goldfish - Go beyond your bowl, share knowledge, stay curious and keep learning.
  • Fail forward - Learn from mistakes and keep moving forward.
  • Cheer loudly - Be proud of the team's results and celebrate successes.
  • Own it - Throw yourself in and own your work, taking responsibility until the end.
  • Think Client - Put yourself in our Client's shoes - consider the impact for their customers and deliver.

DA has evolved to become a provider of core banking and digital platforms and services to some of Australia's leading customer-owned, challenger banks, aggregators, and the financial services industry, aligned with our purpose - powering innovation in banking.

DA operates nationally with close to 300 staff based in Adelaide, Sydney, Melbourne, and Brisbane - enhancing the banking experience of more than 1.43 million Australians via its core banking and digital platforms, powering customer transactions across 3.2 million accounts every day.

About the Role:

The Data Engineer is primarily responsible for the successful conversion and migration of core banking systems onto and off the DA CBS and ancillary systems.

Other responsibilities include helping other teams, being involved in projects, assisting in gathering requirements, and other migration tasks as needed at DA and to DA Clients and/or potential Clients.

Primarily the Data Engineer works with the DA Core Banking System (CBS) but needs to be aware of the relationship between the CBS and ancillary products and works diligently to resolve any issues in communication between the CBS and any products that interface to it.

Key responsibilities of the role include:

  • As part of the merger and conversion of Financial Institutions (FI) onto the DA CBS, the Data Engineer will liaise with financial institution (FI) staff and analyse and document their requirements and determine the best way to implement the requirements onto the DA CBS
  • During a merger and conversion, be proactive in identifying and communicating any gaps to the project team
  • Knowledge sharing both internally and externally on CBS areas of expertise (as well as any other subject matter expertise)
  • Assist in pre-sales, talking to potential customers or assisting with RFI's/RFP's as well as involvement in the discovery process before a merger/conversion.

What You'll Need to Succeed:

  • Qualifications in Data Analysis, Science or Engineering or equivalent industry experience
  • Advanced experience with Structured Query Language (SQL)/Transact-SQL (T-SQL) programming
  • Experience in designing Extract Transform Load (ETL) solutions
  • Experience with Python or Java programming
  • Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
  • Experience within an environment eliciting and documenting effective business requirements
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts
  • Ability to identify user requirements and problems and respond appropriately.

DA understands the importance of having quality people in our business and provides unique opportunities for the right people to become an integral part of our team.  We offer avenues for professional development and career progression for committed individuals.

If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you! Please be sure to combine a covering letter addressing the key criteria set out above as the first page of your resume.

To be considered for this role you will need to be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident, or have a current visa that permits you to work in Australia.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
BI Reporting Expert needed for Adelaide Tech Company

  • Huge impact, loads of autonomy and opportunities for growth
  • Flexible office / work from home arrangements
  • We've even got dogs in the office, what's not to like?

Guided by a domain expert, your reports will be used across the globe to make multi-million dollar operational decisions.

About Us

One of the great challenges in the world right now is the need to move to greener energy and technology solutions. To do that the world needs more copper, steel and rare earth metals than ever before. So here’s the challenge: to go green the world needs (much) more mining, but mining already contributes to about 6% of global greenhouse gas emissions every year.

At MaxMine we work to improve mining efficiency - we focus on what we can do today to improve that situation. We’ve demonstrated productivity improvements of 15% on some sites with corresponding reductions in effective greenhouse gas emissions by 5-10% from current operational baselines. Our client base is growing and our analytics services are rapidly expanding.

In short, we solve real problems with innovative and tangible solutions that actually stick. With your help, we hope to make it even better!

About You

You are a business analyst and report developer that is motivated by working on interesting and innovative products. We are looking for people that have a knack for reading a problem statement and finding the solution in a complex system of data. You are keen to get stuck in and solve big, challenging problems. Not afraid to get your hands dirty in order to deliver a big outcome for clients.

  • You are a curious person and a problem solver.
  • Ideally have experience developing visualisations and reports using SQL and BI tools
  • You prefer simple and effective, over complicated and efficient.
  • You like to solve problems once, so that they stay solved.
  • You want your work to matter, to make an impact

Your Skills

We are currently seeking expressions of interest from current candidates who have some of the following:

  • Passion for telling stories with data and making the complex simple
  • Some interest in design, design thinking and product thinking (thinking beyond just the visualisation)
  • Experience working with a low-code visualisation tool such as PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, QuickSight, TIBCO Spotfire
  • Some understanding of SQL and databases
  • Solved real world problems using data analytics and reporting
  • Strong communication skills, able to provide analysis and reporting that suits the context and audience
  • Attention to detail producing tested, repeatable analysis

Our Technology

We work with a range of technologies across the full spectrum of dev-ops and data-science. Our platform is based on:

  • AWS, Snowflake, DBT and Power BI
  • SQL and Python programming languages
  • Git, Bitbucket, JIRA, Confluence

We expect you to be able to build, maintain and evolve our low-code visualisation stack, which is currently Power BI connected to Snowflake.

There is also scope to bring new technologies to our platform team where they fit within our existing technology and can deliver business value.

Our Values

Our team's cohesion and success draws from a culture of shared values.

  • Impact: We move the needle for our customers, people and environment.
  • Finishing: We celebrate when things are done.
  • Excellence: We take pride in our work. Quality output, with a sense of urgency.
  • Customer: We play the long game, as one team.
  • Ubuntu: We believe ‘I am because we are’.
  • Playful spirit: We have a good laugh.

What We Offer

  • Lots of chances to learn and grow – you’ll be surrounded by some of the brightest minds in the city, part of a culture which values sharing knowledge every day
  • A chance to join a rapidly scaling start-up
  • The opportunity to shape your role, our team and our product

If this sounds like you, please apply via seek and check out our website at maxmine.com.au

title: Data Scientist
company: Department of Education, Skills and Employment
description:
Position Summary

The National Skills Commission (NSC) is seeking an experienced Data Scientist for an Assistant Director role to lead the analysis and modelling of labour markets, skills, higher education sector and the vocational education and training (VET) sector using complex datasets. This will contribute to the NSC’s role in providing advice and national leadership on Australia’s labour market and current, emerging, and future workforce skills needs.

The Skills Intelligence team is a fast paced, high performing area in the NSC. Reporting to the Director of the Skills Intelligence team, the Data Scientist will be responsible for collaborating across our multi-disciplinary team to understand stakeholder needs and deliver fit-for-purpose strategic improvements to the Classification. You will perform data analysis and provide expert analytical knowledge to support the development, publication, and maintenance of the Australian Skills Classification.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Responsibilities of the EL1 Data Scientist may include:
  • Assist the Director in the management of a section.
  • Lead a small team of data analysts and qualitative researchers to deliver new profiles and improvements to the Classification.
  • Lead and manage a portfolio of methodological work, giving important methodological advice and assistance to other parts of the NSC and the wider department.
  • Establish and maintain strong collaborative relationships with a range of key internal and external stakeholders.
  • Undertake complex analytical tasks and produce timely, purpose-specific, and appropriate solutions, technical reports, and executive briefings.
  • Apply statistical computing languages (such as R, Python or SAS) and tools to manipulate data for analysis.

Qualifications and Education

  • Academic qualifications or equivalent experience in mathematics, statistics, data science, physics, economics/econometrics, computer science, engineering, bioinformatics, psychology, or another field with a strong quantitative component are highly desirable. A demonstrated ability to learn and apply new methods and technologies will also be highly regarded.

Capabilities

We are seeking individuals with the following skills and capabilities:

  • Demonstrated experience with Natural Language Processing techniques.
  • Knowledge/Experience in Labour Markets, higher education or VET would be an advantage but not essential.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team on multiple competing priorities of varying complexity and urgency while sustaining positive team culture.
  • Proven ability to work effectively and supervise staff in a multidisciplinary and geographically distributed team, and to supervise and develop specialist staff in a high-performance culture.
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills, and the ability to convey complex and sensitive information, and engage with a range of stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated experience in understanding business needs, technical requirements, undertaking business analysis and advising on business process improvements.
  • Ability to manage data science quality assurance.
  • Ability to identify business needs, understand policy context in a complex environment.
  • Experience in the use of visualisation tools such as R-shiny, Power BI and Qlik.
  • Experience working in an agile environment using tools such as DevOps.

For further information please review the job information pack and position description available here .

Job Reference Number: 22/0529 EXT Assistant Director (Data Scientist)

title: Service Management Analyst
description:
• Service Management Analyst
  • Customer Services & Technology Division
  • Adelaide Based, Full Time position

How will I help?

The Technology Service Desk is the voice of our internal customers and within the Service Enablement team you will be undertaking analysis, to producing insights and recommendations, that will insure there is continuous improvement of our service and increase our performance, having a real impact on our customers’ experience.

In this role you will work across two key areas: Shift Left and Automation Identification. Our Shift left strategy is to identify volume that is currently resolved by upper technical support teams that could be onboarded to be resolved within the Technology Service Desk. While Automation Identification would seek to identify instances of troubleshooting that could be transferred into a One-Click Automated Solution. The identification is the key piece here, you are not expected to also create the automation.

What will I do?

  • Liaise with stakeholders within the department and across Customer Services & Technology to understand situations and enable problems to be defined with clarity and precision, solicit requirements, and deliver actionable insights and recommendations
  • Contribute to the capability to determine insights, utilising a range of data sources, and recommendations for shift left and automation opportunities
  • Contribute to initiatives for Continuous Service Improvement
  • Perform trend analysis against agreed performance baselines
  • Contribute to the definition, review and enhancement of methods, tools, policies, and standards to meet the requirements for assigned area of responsibility

What’s in it for me?

Joining Westpac has many benefits besides building a long and stable career. You’ll be able to purchase leave to facilitate your dreams or obligations and you’ll be encouraged to participate in the community through paid volunteer leave and secondments. You’ll also be entitled to a suite of online learning, training modules and career planning tools to grow with us.

What do I need?

Essential:

  • Experience using predictive modelling to highlight insight and automation opportunities, highly desirable if this experience involves the use of Splunk
  • Experience applying machine learning techniques, statistical and data mining techniques (regression, statistical tests and proper usage, random forest, clustering, decision tree learning, deep learning text mining etc.) in solving real-life problems, preferably in ITSM domain
  • Ability to apply your skills and experience to a team early in their data journey.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively, as part of a team
  • Ability to communicate with confidence, care and genuine interest. Taking personal responsibility for delighting your customers and building their trust.
  • Ability to present information, analysis and technical constructs to both technical and non-technical audiences

Desired:

  • Ability to establish productive working relationships with the business and strategic partner colleagues
  • Completed or in-progress tertiary qualification in Business Intelligence / Data Analytics or similar discipline
  • Knowledge and experience working with data from ServiceNow

What is it like to work in Westpac?

We aim to provide one big, supportive team to help us reach our vision to become one of the world’s great service companies. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs.

How do I Apply?

Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.

As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply. The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We’ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they’re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.

The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.

By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy, and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.

title: Data & Analytics Technical Consultant (Work from anywhere)
description:
Exposé is one of Australia’s leading Data & Analytics Consultancies. We have offices in Adelaide and Melbourne and team members all over Australia! We are super proud to provide a fantastic work culture, flexible working arrangements, access to leading-edge technology and projects, professional development and much more!

At exposé, culture comes first (happy employee = happy client = happy employer), and we believe that is why our amazing team are motivated to get up out of bed to come to work every day.

We are currently looking to fill multiple positions in our team at the mid to senior levels. As a consultant, you will be supported and trained to become a leading Data Specialist, involved in challenging projects from start to end. Putting your professional mark on work.

About the role:

In this role, you will work collaboratively with our team and clients to create insightful solutions to help clients make informed decisions. Use your Data Engineering skills and experience to analyse, integrate, model, and move data to create data and analytics solutions for our clients. Let’s help our clients “do better with data”!

Technical Requirements for the role:

  • Strong experience in on-premise and cloud-based technologies and creation of hybrid solutions
  • Strong Microsoft Azure Data Services experience is preferable
  • AWS or Google Cloud platform is advantageous

Conventional Business Intelligence - >4 years’ experience

  • Data integration, ETL, Data architecture, and modelling
  • Reporting
  • Database management systems (RDBMS) and its architecture
  • Semantic models (multi-dimensional)

Advanced Analytics - >2 years’ experience in one or more areas

  • IoT
  • Machine learning
  • Interactive visualisations
  • Semantic models (Tabular/Columnar)
  • Big data solutions
  • Real-time data streams
  • Mobile integration
  • Data lakes & Databricks

Other Requirements:

  • A relevant tertiary qualification is highly advantageous
  • Microsoft/AWS certifications are highly advantageous
  • Ability to solve client business problems using Data and Analytical solutions
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must
  • Prior experience in client-facing roles, exceptional interpersonal & relationship building skills
  • Current police clearance or be willing to obtain one at short notice

Please note that this is not a Data Scientist role - data science experience and qualifications are a bonus. Still, we require a Technical Consultant who has the depth and breadth of skills across the entire Data Analytics landscape.

Why join Exposé?

  • Second to none culture –join our Purple Peeps Team!
  • Flexible working arrangements (you can work from anywhere in Australia)
  • Excellent employee benefits, including technology & professional development allowances and paid development days off!
  • We're a collaborative bunch that loves getting together and making a positive difference across our team and clients.
  • We are actively involved in the community, regularly hosting networking events and supporting our staff to speak at relevant forums and events.

Suppose you want to work with some of the most talented Data & Analytics technologists in the market who are genuinely passionate about what they do. In that case, this could be your opportunity to join a secure and growing consultancy.

Please apply via Seek or reach out to Oli or Caila at oliver.blaquiere@exposedata.com.au or caila.hancl@exposedata.com.au for more information and a confidential chat.

*Exposé will not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies.

title: Data & Analytics Associate / Senior Associate
description:
As an Associate/ Senior Associate in our Digital Operations and Automation team, you’ll work with teams across Consulting to help clients create value at the intersection of human and digital. You’ll help some of the largest organisations across Australia and the Asia Pacific region to create value and improve the way they work; from digitising operations, shifting to contemporary operating models and ways of working, improving the way they operate, and reducing costs.

About you:

As a Data & Analytics Associate/ Senior Associate in our Digital Operations and Automation team within Digital Transformation your impact will be seen by:

  • Development of data models to help clients with tracking results of key indicators to drive greater performance outcomes;
  • Working with clients to obtain critical performance data in order to measure performance
  • Delivering crucial business insights to clients through data analytics and data visualisation, to improve performance or reduce costs;
  • Helping clients to understand operations by using a range of performance optimisation methodologies, data analysis and work with these organisations on how to respond to their rapidly changing environments;
  • Supporting colleagues with data insights and data visualisation through clear, responsive and effective communication;
  • Working in, as well as driving complex change programs

You have experience in working in a fast moving, client focused and project based environment - this may include experience working within a consulting firm or corporate environment. You also have an operational background and experience in driving performance improvement.  You will have a quantitative background with a qualification in mathematics, statistics, business intelligence, engineering or similar. You will need to have excellent analytical and problem solving skills, as well as being able to communicate effectively and impactfully with clients and stakeholders. Proficiency in some of the following toolsets is required – Microsoft Excel, PowerBI, SQL, Tableau.

You are agile, people-focused, motivated to succeed, analytically minded and commercially astute. You have strong attention to detail and exceptional standards in quality. Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Consulting teams deliver practical advice that speaks straight to the heart of client business  issues and deliver innovative results. You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders.

You’re also keen to learn, to take up opportunities to improve your craft and continuously work towards the success of our clients. You are fascinated by the future and how the forces of change are influencing how we work, play and live. Most importantly, you’re keen and willing to learn to succeed in your role, and you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.

For significant parts of our client base we will require Australian citizenship and eligibility to hold an AGSVA issued security clearance.

PwC is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, as well as visitors to our offices and events.

PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff, contractors, clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices, attend client sites, undertake work-related travel, or attend work-related events, subject to limited exemptions. For more information: https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html

title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst

  • Lead and work on a national program in healthcare
  • Flexible hours & location throughout Australia (work from home up to 60 hours per month)
  • $75-85 per hour

Public Pathology Australia advances government owned and operated pathology services across Australia.  We seek a data expert to further develop and run a national benchmarking program, which compares activity, workforce and cost across public hospital laboratories.

We are seeking a Data Analyst who will be responsible for:

  • Improving a national benchmarking program for pathology laboratories.
  • Providing data analysis for the benchmarking program and Public Pathology Australia.
  • Providing advice and improvement, supporting KPI development and reporting.
  • Providing insightful reports by use of data analytic skills.
  • Providing high level communication and engagement skills for reporting performance information internally and externally, including facilitating or presenting at workshops and forums.

Selection criteria

To be considered for this role, you will need the following skills, experience and qualifications:

  1. Tertiary qualifications relevant to the role and extensive professional experience in data analytical services in a complex organisation.
  2. Superior analytical, data extraction, processing and database modeling skills, including advanced proficiency and experience in the use of Microsoft Power BI, Excel, Access and other products, to undertake complex analysis.
  3. High level understanding of pathology tests and services and high level understanding of pathology related and/or health data systems including workforce and financial data systems.
  4. Demonstrated prominent level problem solving and reporting skills including benchmarking services, activity and cost modelling, dashboard and data visualisation reporting. Ability to process big data and provide insights for management and members.
  5. Demonstrated ability to effectively document processes and procedures including writing reports and technical manuals.
  6. Demonstrated high level  interpersonal, negotiation, written and verbal communication skills and a proven ability to build and maintain collaborative working relationships with a diverse range of stakeholders and positively interact and influence to achieve best outcomes.
  7. Proven ability in delivering results within projected and short timeframes and meeting project expectations with quality outcomes.
  • We offer an initial 1 year contract.
  • Work from home part time up to 60 hours per month.
  • $75-85 per hour.

About us: www.publicpathology.org.au

For a position description, please email contact@publicpathology.org.au .

Interested applicants are urged to apply before COB 23 May 2022 by emailing CV and response to selection criteria to contact@publicpathology.org.au .

For further information, contact Public Pathology Australia’s CEO Jenny Sikorski on 0466 576 221 , ceo@publicpathology.org.au.

title: Business Analyst
description:
• Fantastic opportunity to join a rapidly growing IT department
  • Initial 12-month full-time contract based at Mile End
  • Join a tight-knit team with a fun, inclusive and supportive culture

Your new opportunity

Due to internal movement we now have an exciting opportunity available that will have you lead the bridge between the RAA Travel business and IS to understand requests for change and projects and to facilitate their scoping, investigation, design and delivery. In addition, you will:

  • Facilitate and deliver analysis outputs, including As-Is/To-Be process maps, business requirements, solution outlines, functional specifications and report specifications
  • Liaise with relevant stakeholders to facilitate high level effort estimates and solution designs
  • Undertake preliminary analysis of requests for change to understand and document their scope sufficient for high level estimation and planning
  • Assist with configuration of travel systems and provide support with analysing root cause of reported issues
  • Develop and maintain relevant process maps, forms, templates associated with business analysis

What will set you apart from the rest

At RAA we hire on cultural add first and technical fit second, however, to be successful in this role you will need:

  • Business analysis experience
  • Demonstrated knowledge of business analysis principles and practices, including technical analysis
  • Proven ability to communicate effectively with people of all levels both verbally, in writing and presentations, including the ability to produce documentation and reports of high quality
  • Demonstrated knowledge of technical analysis including data mapping, system integration and configuration of business rules in systems
  • Travel systems experience within a project is highly desirable (ie. Online booking technology, GDS, Mid-office systems)

What sets us apart from the rest

  • To ensure our employees feel valued, empowered and celebrated we provide a range of employee benefits including:
  • Free RAA premium road service & discounts on all RAA Products
  • Flexible Work Arrangements
  • Ongoing Training & Development Opportunities & Study Support Program
  • Wellbeing Facilities and Corporate Health Insurance Plan
  • On-site Cafe with Barista - plus much more!

How to apply

Simply hit "Apply for this job" to access further information found in the position description or follow the prompts to apply.

Applications Close: 9:00am Friday 27 May 2022

Please note applications may be short-listed and progressed prior to the closing date.

We're committed to building a workplace that's diverse and inclusive, where employees are embraced for their unique qualities and valued for their contributions. We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in everyone, and helps us to give our members better service.

Who we are -

As one of the state's largest and most iconic organisations, we're proud to make things better for members and better for our community. More than 780,000 members choose us to deliver peace of mind through our trusted range of motor, home and travel products and services. We're also one of the state's largest employers (and growing!), with more than 1200 employees working collectively with the common goal to keep our members moving.

title: Digital Platform Analyst
salary: Increase your take home pay with salary sacrifice
description:
ECH are dedicated to ensuring a seamless digital experience for staff and clients. This is a great opportunity to step into a newly formed role and help support our digital strategy.

The role

The Digital Platform Analyst will be responsible for providing technical expertise and support to promote and maximise the use of our digital platforms. Utilising your knowledge of Dynamics 365, Power Platform and SharePoint Online you will contribute to the ongoing improvement and utilisation of these platforms.

What it’s like at ECH

  • We’re proud of what we do, we’re proud of how we work together and we’re proud of the impact that ECH has on people’s lives.
  • We’re future focused. We don’t stay still. We are always in search of new ways to improve the lives of older South Australians.
  • Our people drive our success and how we work together is as important as what we deliver.
  • Diversity is in our DNA. We seek out and celebrate diversity in all its forms and tap into the richness of ideas, experiences and perspectives that it brings.
  • We grow our people. Everyone has the opportunity to grow, develop and build their career with ECH.
  • At ECH we are integrating work and life. We are embracing technology and new ways of working which support a new level of flexibility for our people.
  • Whether it be face-to-face, on-the-job or online, we love learning because we know it makes us better.

What you’ll be doing

Advising product owners and Digital team about new solution functionality, along with:

  • Provision of 2nd level support and escalation to relevant vendor
  • Delivering small platform change requests and upgrades
  • Regularly review usage of platform applications and provide advice on improvements

Who we’re looking for

An enthusiastic person who can take the initiative and has:

  • Strong communication skills, with proven experience interacting with both technical and business users
  • The ability to understand business and technical processes utilises this knowledge to problem solve
  • Demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
  • Commitment to provide exceptional customer service

But also someone who:

  • Is kind, even if they’re a bit stressed out
  • Likes what we do – caring for people in the community
  • Is dynamic and energetic
  • Is flexible and adaptable
  • Loves diversity
  • Will contribute their ideas and hard work to make ECH better every day.

Head over to our website to see the full position description

You will need

  • COVID-19 vaccination (including booster if eligible)

It’d also be helpful if you had:

  • A current Police Check

If you don’t, that’s ok, we can help with this.

More about ECH

ECH is a not-for-profit organisation in the Health Care Sector. This means that you can salary package up to $18,549 per annum to reduce your tax.  We also offer a range of perks through our Employee Benefits Program (eg. discounted gym memberships).

You will be provided with full training and support including all equipment that is required to succeed in this role.

Just in case you missed it, we love diversity at ECH. So if you’re a person living with a disability, you’re from a culturally or linguistically diverse background, part of the LGBTI community or an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander person we definitely want you to apply for this role.

If you need more reasons to want to join ECH, have a look through our website to see the amazing ways in which we support ageing South Australians. While you are there, check out the videos on our Employment page from some of our amazing staff and hear about their jobs and why they love working for ECH.

So, if you think this might be the job for you and you feel aligned to who we are and what we do then we’d love you to APPLY NOW.

Applications close: 31 May, 2022 at 5pm, and should be addressed to Carly Sutherland, HR Officer

In submitting your application, you agree to our ECH Recruitment Process Terms and Conditions

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
About the role:

The Senior Data Analyst will contribute to the agencies strategic approach to data and insights, which includes delivering statistical advices, analyses and publications. The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for working with disparate data sources, including financial, demographic and geospatial data sources, to extract, consolidate and analyse regulatory data for different audiences, internal and external to AFSA.

As the Senior Data Analyst, you will:

  • Actively contribute to the Data Analytics Section’s commitment to delivering high quality statistical advices, timely reports and the development of regulatory program insights.
  • Support the Assistant Director of Data Analytics to deliver statistical publications, data quality initiatives, data integrity and data analyses to internal and external stakeholders.
  • Interpret data requirements and extract regulatory program data to service ad-hoc data requests and support the development of data-driven insights.
  • Analyse datasets utilising tools like Excel, SQL and other analytical products to contribute to regulatory program insights and data integrity.
  • Develop dashboards, codify business requirements and deliver program insights using PowerBI and/or Tableau.
  • Apply data storytelling skills and communicate effectively with a diverse range of stakeholders from both technical and non-technical backgrounds.
  • Actively contribute to data sharing activities and promote data linkage initiatives by applying current privacy and data governance practices.

About you

To be successful in this role, you will have:

  • A tertiary qualification in applied finance, engineering, mathematics, statistics or other quantitative discipline.
  • Demonstrated experience (3 – 6 years) working as a Data Analyst in the financial services, regulation or other related industry delivering reports and publications.
  • Strong data storytelling and data visualisation skills, with the ability to communicate findings to a range of stakeholders.
  • Strong understanding of data management best practices and the Australian public data system.
  • Demonstrated competence in data analysis and statistical modelling using tools such as Stata, SAS, R, Python etc is desirable but not essential.

Why AFSA?

You will enjoy excellent conditions including generous superannuation (15.4%), a modern work environment, and flexibility to balance work and personal life.

We are a workplace committed to providing an environment that values diversity and supports staff to reach their full potential.

We encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, peoples from culturally diverse backgrounds and people with disabilities.

Applications Close: Sunday, 22 May 2022

title: Financial Analyst
salary: Competitive salary plus access to salary packaging
description:
Financial Analyst

Provide financial insights as part of a supportive and collaborative finance team in our new office space in the Tonsley Innovation District.
  • Full time, permanent | Hybrid working arrangements
  • Develop your skills within a supportive and collaborative environment
  • Contribute your financial knowledge in a hands-on role
About Bedford

Bedford changes the lives of people with disability by building capacity, independence, and wellbeing. We do this by providing a broad suite of NDIS support services including employment opportunities and social participation activities. We offer exceptional tailored services to meet individual goals, in the workplace and in the community. We build healthy relationships, foster skills to last a lifetime, and pride ourselves on providing hands-on support to plan all areas of our clients’ lives. Above all, we promote individual choice and control to empower people with disability to live fulfilled and happy lives.

About the Role

This full time, permanent position, reporting into the Financial Controller, is located at our Tonsley site situated within the new Innovation Precinct. With a focus on building stakeholder relationships and strong accounting knowledge this role will collaborate with finance business partners and other managers throughout Bedford.

Responsibilities include
  • Analyse and interpret past and current financial data
  • Review end of month data and provide insights to the finance business partners
  • Research and gather financial information to report on performance and trends
  • Help to develop and improve financial reporting
  • Analyse accounting standards
  • Journaling and reconciliations
  • Other duties as directed
About You

You will be a degree qualified and experienced financial analyst who holds yourself to a high standard. You will also enjoy working in a vibrant and collaborative environment with a diverse team of 20 finance professionals, who take a hands-on approach to their work and are willing to contribute to the success of others in the team.

You will also have
  • Degree qualification in Accounting or similar
  • CPA / CA (highly regarded)
  • Strong written and verbal communication
  • High level of accuracy and attention to detail
For this role the following documents must be provided prior to a formal offer of employment with Bedford Phoenix Incorporated.
  • An acceptable clearance to work in the disability sector (DHS / DCSI / NDIS)
  • A National Police Clearance (no older than six months)
  • Evidence of right to work in Australia
  • Evidence of full vaccination with a TGA-approved COVID-19 vaccine or an acceptable exemption*
What’s in it for you?
  • Generous salary packaging, up to $15,900 tax free p/a
  • Onsite parking
  • Onsite cafes and eateries
  • Contribute to an organisation that helps change the lives of people with disability
  • A new office in the Tonsley Innovation Precinct

If you would like to enquire further about this opportunity, please contact David Derrick, General Manager, Finance and Commercial on 0422 453 133 . All enquires will be treated in confidence.

Applications close 31st May 2022.

For a copy of the Position Description, please go to the careers page of our website at bedfordgroup.com.au/careers

*This position is within the disability sector and is subject to the relevant Emergency Management Directions. This currently requires proof of full COVID vaccination (two doses plus a booster) with a TGA-approved vaccine or evidence of an acceptable exemption from SA Health prior to being appointed to this role. Please visit legislation.sa.gov.au/legislation/CV19 for further information.

Bedford values diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace and encourage applications from First Nations, people with disability and people of all gender identities.

title: Data Warehouse Consultant
description:
About the Company

Our client is a management consulting services company that has a great city fringe location and has clients both in the private and government sector. They are busy with lots of interesting projects and require an experienced Data Warehouse designer/developer to join the team ASAP.


About the role

As a Data Warehouse Consultant, you will bring end to end experience and skills in Data warehouse architecture, data modelling, data integration, BI and Data visualisation.

You will have experience working with various stakeholders and ability to understanding data needs for a business.

There is no specific Data Warehouse or BI technologies required as consultants often work with many technologies and able research and pick up new ones when required.


Skills and experience

  • Client Consulting experience in Data and Analytics
  • Experience delivering Data Warehouse projects, on prem or Cloud Environments
  • Knowledge in relational and big data architectures, data warehousing, data integration, data modelling, data optimisation and data analysis techniques
  • Interest and knowledgeable in Big Data, Data Ecosystem and data governance technologies
  • Knowledgeable in Cloud Data Warehouse services
  • Experienced with public cloud platforms and cloud infrastructure
  • Experienced building end to end data pipelines using on-premise or cloud based data platforms
  • Exposed to ETL/ELT and governance tools
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills



For more information or a confidential discussion, please contact Jessica Gadsby on (08) 8112 7417 quoting reference 246191.

To apply please click the 'Apply Now' button.

title: SSTP Reporting & Workforce Data Analyst
salary: Enjoy 6-weeks of leave and flexible work!
description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to utilise your data analytics and reporting expertise for a cause that will truly make a difference? ASC's recent AUKUS [link removed] partnership has resulted in the establishment of a Sovereign Shipbuilding Talent Pool (SSTP) that will build Australia's capability for the future, nuclear-powered submarine build. An industry leading and one-of-a-kind program of work that has not been seen in Australia since ASC originally built the Collins Class fleet of submarines over 3 decades ago.

This permanent opportunity is based out of Osborne, SA and will support various streams of work across the SSTP Program Management Office.

What will you need to succeed in this role?

  • Relevant qualification or;
  • Recent experience in a Data and Analytics/Workforce Reporting role,
  • Ability to effectively explore issues and develop successful solutions,
  • Ability to influence senior internal and external stakeholders,
  • Strong understanding and demonstrated ability to perform in Workforce Planning,
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel and database management,
  • Experience in the use of Power BI is desirable,
  • Operational experience in Defence, complex manufacturing, mining or construction will be highly regarded,
  • Excellent attention to detail, communication skills and problem solving skills.

As a Reporting Analyst at ASC, you will:

  • Work as part of the Program Management Office and be supported by the Workforce Planning Team.
  • Contribute to the SSTP (Sovereign Shipbuilding Talent Pool) program producing Workforce data and reporting.
  • Provide quantitative and qualitative analytics to enable the SSTP Program to make recommendations, influence key business decisions and monitor and assess the execution of the program.
  • Ensure the SSTP team have the right reporting and information to make data driven decisions and ensure ASC maintains accurate and prompt reporting to the customer – Commonwealth of Australia (CoA) to meet contractual KPIs.

Operating in a complex and diverse environment, this role requires a high degree of flexibility and responsiveness to support ad-hoc requests. Your primary focus will be within the SSTP program, however based on capability and workload you may be asked to support other programs of work within ASC.

This role requires the ability to work to deadlines that are often very tight whilst ensuring quality outcomes are provided with effective consultation in rapidly changing environments and priorities.

The incumbent will contribute to a positive people culture that values continuous improvement and develops new processes and procedures in line with the Company’s focus on ‘Lean’ thinking.

About our offer

We offer more than just a challenging and rewarding career.  We have put together a range of programs, initiatives and benefits that help empower our employees to reach their personal and professional goals to ensure their career with us is both challenging and rewarding.

  • Staff training and leadership development programs
  • Additional 2 weeks of leave
  • Paid parental leave
  • Salary sacrificing options
  • Paid defence reservist leave
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Onsite cafeteria & parking

Eligibility

The successful candidate must provide ASC with a current National Police Clearance prior as well as be eligible for an Australian Defence Security Clearance.  Access protected US Defence Technology will be taken into account in assessing an applicant's suitability for this role.

ASC also requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to ensure the safety and wellbeing of our people. If you are applying for a role at ASC please consider this new requirement when submitting your application. ASC will also adhere to any relevant health directives that may be made that affects our workforce.

If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply now. Applications close 20th May 2022. Early applications are encouraged.

title: ERP & Data Operations Manager
description:
Southcott Pty Ltd is one of Australia's leading Hydraulic businesses offering system design, supplier, manufacturer and distribution.  Southcott manufacture hydraulic components and import leading brands such as Walvoil, Casappa, Command Controls, Faster, Gates Hose, Child Couplings and power units. We sell our products through a network of branches and distributors across the country. Founded in 1886, we believe our relentless ambition, customer centricity and focus on people have contributed significantly to our success to date.

Southcott Pty Ltd is embarking on a transformational journey to support our significant growth agenda. We are seeking an ERP & Data Operations Manager to help enable the organisation to achieve success through planning, delivering & managing data strategies and related applications to support Southcott’s transition to a data led culture.  Your role will be pivotal in the ERP implementation project and will continue post-implementation to support the business in maximising the ongoing benefits of the solution as well as enabling the business to drive insights from its data.

This is a newly created role and is a great opportunity for an experienced and commercially minded individual to add value through your passion for data.

Reporting to the Head of Business Operations, you will be able to view the business through a holistic data lens as well as play in the detail. You will be experienced and comfortable playing in the application, infrastructure and analysis domains and will be adept at partnering with different business functions, to work collaboratively to drive better customer and business outcomes.

Specifically, this role will:

  • Administer and manage the Cloud based ERP system, BI Applications & SQL Databases
  • Coordinate with providers & IT Team - system implementations, upgrades and modifications
  • Oversee the operational maintenance of ERP functions & application access with the IT Team
  • Review & improve data integration design to drive performance & maintenance efficiencies
  • Manage and improve data pipelines & partner with wider IT team on application integrations & infrastructure
  • Own and drive data hygiene amongst users through controls/process & governance, collaborating with stakeholders for optimal outcomes
  • Drive effectiveness of the ERP & Data systems, partnering with key stakeholders to ensure business alignment & enhanced user experience
  • Assist with the system design of quality assurance practices
  • Participate in any change management projects to identify potential risks/impacts of wider system changes
  • Provide analysis support for large datasets in applicable programme

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Applied Maths, Information Technology, Data Science or related qualifications or equivalent experience
  • Significant experience as a System Administrator for a cloud-based ERP/BI application
  • Significant experience with DBMS (MySQL, SQL server or equivalent)
  • Technical proficiency regarding Database design development, Data models, Data Analysis & Insights, techniques for data mining
  • Experience in Tableau, COGNOS, managing large data sets and process improvement training and / qualifications would be looked on favourably
  • Demonstrated change agility and resilience
  • Strong business partnering and stakeholder management skills
  • Superior interpersonal and verbal and written communications skills
  • Strong influencing skills
  • Ability to manage workloads and meet delivery deadlines
  • A demonstrated commitment to ongoing professional development

We have a significant growth agenda and encourage you to apply if believe you can contribute to our journey. For a confidential discussion about this role, please call Clare Kelly, Head of People & Culture on 08 8228 2423 . Otherwise, please apply via SEEK.

title: Corporate Finance Analyst, Analysis and Reporting
description:
• Department for Health and Wellbeing, Corporate and System Support Services – Finance, Performance Monitoring and Reporting
  • Salary: $94,176 to $99,615 – ASO6 – Full Time / Ongoing Appointment

The Corporate Finance Analyst will be:

  • Contributing to the development, implementation and maintenance of a reporting and performance framework across SA Health including the reporting and monitoring of monthly financial, activity and workforce information.
  • Contributing to the development, implementation and maintenance of a range of complex financial analyses.
  • Providing a range of timely and accurate financial and management reports including:
    • preparing monthly management reports;
    • providing specific financial information for the preparation of the monthly Portfolio Management reports; and
    • preparing a broad range of other documents, reports or submissions as required.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role. Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory Criminal History Check and appropriate immunisation requirements. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants are encouraged to apply. Job ref: 786740

Vaccination Requirements

COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement under the Emergency Management (Healthcare Setting Workers Vaccination) (COVID-19) Directions 2021 to work in a SA Health/health care setting.

Kristy Harvey

Phone: 7425 3611

Wednesday, 01 June 2022 - 11.55PM
