title: CUSTOMER SERVICE-TRAINEE
description:
Bring your passion for exceptional customer service to this role!

Statewide Appliance Spares is looking for a bright enthusiastic person interested in developing their customer service skills. This person will enjoy problem-solving and finding solutions, with a willingness to learn & become a vital member of our team.

For over 35 years, Statewide Appliance Spares has been a leading national distributor and retailer of appliance spare parts and equipment for the most popular domestic and commercial appliance manufacturers. Brands supported by Statewide Appliance Spares include LG, Panasonic, Electrolux, Fisher & Paykel, Samsung, Fujitsu, Bosch and many more.

We are seeking a reliable person to join our dedicated customer service and spare parts team to fill a permanent fulltime position in our busy office and warehouse.

The purpose of the role is primarily for the efficient interpretation of customer telephone and email enquiries for price and availability of appliance spare parts, accurate processing of orders and effectively addressing any customer queries or issues. Also the successful person will need to be willing to be trained in related activities such as counter sales, warehouse work, stock ordering, stock control and administration.


The main duties and responsibilities for this role will be to:

  • Efficiently & attentively respond to customer enquiries by phone or email
  • Efficiently conduct spare parts identification and interpretation
  • Effectively communicate with customers and process sales orders
  • Assist in front counter sales when necessary
  • Order stock, follow-up and goods receiving when necessary
  • Provide backup support for other customer service activities

The successful person MUST have the following skills and attributes:

  • A bright and enthusiastic personality
  • Competent in using computers and data entry is essential
  • Be flexible in performing a variety of tasks as required
  • Proven to be self-motivated, reliable and responsible
  • Display professional and confident communication skills
  • Ability to learn quickly & possess a willingness to continually develop

In addition you should have:

  • Some retail or other customer service experience
  • Effective telephone communication skills
  • An efficient and well organised nature
  • The ability to follow processes and procedures in a team environment
  • A track record of being reliable, flexible and eager to learn new skills
  • An interest in electronics, computers or how appliances work is desirable but not essential

Statewide Appliance Spares is an organisation that understands the importance of having good people within its business. Your commitment and contribution will be recognised with competitive pay and conditions.

If you are ready to develop your skills and join a successful company that sells and distributes spare parts for some of the most recognised appliance brands throughout Australia, with a passion for exceptional customer service and problem-solving, then we would like to hear from you. Apply to the Chief Executive Officer today. (Previous applicants need not apply)

title: RQmedia - SEM expert - Google
description:
Make your mark at RQmedia - hiring experienced SEM professionals.

We are a full funnel - omni channel media agency who specialise in e-commerce.

No matter where you live, we are interested in talking to you.

This is an outstanding opportunity for an experienced SEM exec. Join RQmedia and kick our customers' performance goals.  You need to be results driven, accountable for your strategy and optimisation decisions, be a great communicator and thrive in the fast paced industry.

SEM Advertising executive will have:

  • Proven Google ads implementation for ecommerce over a number of years
  • Customer Results Oriented - the only thing that matters is meeting and exceeding our customers' business goals
  • Able to work across a large number of customers
  • Know all Google ad formats and how to optimise them

    Required as a minimum:
  • 5+ years SEM experience
  • Know Google Ads inside out - this is essential
  • Knowledge of Facebook/Instagram advertising an advantage
  • Confident presenter and communicator
  • Ability to deliver customer promises and KPIs
  • Excellent English writing ability
  • Excellent communication skills and a team player
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet scheduled due dates
  • Ability to analyse, report and act on data

If this sounds like you, and you would like to secure a position in a market-leading media agency , send your resume , a short cover letter via Seek addressing the criteria above.

This job is only open to Australian permanent residents and citizens. No Agencies please.

title: Data Consultant (SA/WA/NT)
description:
The Australian Research Data Commons (ARDC) is a transformational initiative that is enabling access to nationally significant, leading edge data intensive eInfrastructure, platforms, skills and collections of high-quality data for the Australian research community and industry.

The purpose of the ARDC is to provide Australian researchers with a competitive advantage through data.

We are looking to welcome to the team an experienced and highly effective individual to the position of Data Consultant . You will understand the research sector in Western Australia, South Australia and the Northern Territory.  You will have experience working in a commonwealth funded research environment and be able to bring your skills and knowledge to the role to help advance the ARDC’s mission in WA, SA and the NT.

The purpose of this key role is to work at international, national, and local levels with current and prospective partners to communicate ARDC’s capabilities, identify upcoming research challenges and potential solutions, and build communities that promote best practice in activities relating to ARDC’s data, platform, infrastructure, and skills programs.

In this role you will experience a diverse range of exciting challenges in a unique and fast paced environment.  We can guarantee that no day will be the same!

The ideal candidate will have a PhD or comparable experience working in academic research and/or a thorough understanding of the research process. They will have worked in or closely with (local/national/international) research organisations and facilities and will have successfully engaged with diverse groups of stakeholders within institutions, research facilities and/or research groups.

On offer is a competitive remuneration package depending on the successful candidates skills and experience. This role is employed through the University of Adelaide and is based in Adelaide. While this role is primarily based in South Australia it is also responsible for WA and NT engagements and some national programs and domestic and international travel may be required.

You can access the Position Description here:

https://bit.ly/ARDCdataconsultant

If you would like to find out more about the role please contact:

Keith Russell, Manager Engagements on 0427 452 342 or via email keith.russell@ardc.edu.au

Applications close on Friday 10 June 2022.

To submit an application please click 'Apply for this job' and include your current CV, response to the Key Selection Criteria from the Position Description and two referees. Please address applications to Keith Russell.

No agencies please

title: Senior Business Support Analyst
description:
Senior Business Support Analyst – 23668

  • Permanent
  • Lockleys, SA but open to Sydney, NSW

How will I Help?
As a Senior Business Support Analyst, you will be working with a variety of stakeholders across the Westpac Group, you will be responsible for driving and improving Mortgage Operations customer's experience through your reports, insights, and models. Within our team, you will work closely with other business owners, technical owners, data scientists, insights analysts, data analysts and business subject matter experts to deliver analytic products and projects. Your strong technical skills and ability to automate, wrangle, transform and present data into actionable insights and advice will ensure your success in this position.

What’s in it for me?
You’ll play a significant part of the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our purpose is helping Australians succeed. So we’ll back you in the development of your career, internal career prospects, and flexible working. You’ll also keep learning to grown, backed by a fantastic team of people with a can-do, supportive structure.

What do I need?
The ideal candidates should be passionate and curious about using analytics and data in different novel ways to help our business grow, have a curious, growth mindset, and be able to work in a high-impact fast environment.

Knowledge

  • Bachelor or post graduate qualification in Computer Science, Mathematics or Statistics preferred
  • A strong understanding of technology and business systems strategically and operationally
  • Knowledge of financial services and operation disciplines

Experience

  • 4+ years of experience in creating and maintaining dashboards, datasets and reports for business stakeholders.
  • Ability to extract actionable insights and create presentations for non-technical business stakeholders
  • technical solution design: ability to convert and explain business problems into technical specifications
  • Experience in collaborating with cross functional teams to deliver outcomes for business stakeholders. Ability to present and communicate to both technical and business stakeholders
  • Technical proficiency in the below domains:
    • analytics, data wrangling, ETL and understanding of analytical databases (not limited to)
      • Coding: SQL, SAS, Python, R, or other
      • Microsoft: Excel, VBA, Powerpoint, Power Platform
      • Database experience: Teradata, IBM DB2, Sybase
    • Visualisation and/or front end application development: Tableau, Qliksense/Qlikview, Power BI

Optional

  • Statistical and mathematical understanding in model building,
  • Cloud & Big Data: Azure/AWS, Spark, HBase, HDFS

What is it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team of people who love helping others succeed. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs.

How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.

As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.

The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We’ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they’re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.

The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.

By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy, and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.

title: Systems Analyst
description:
Your Role

Be part of an organization that takes pride in making a difference within the education sector and thrives on promoting a positive work culture. Their dynamic and collaborative IT function is seeking to hire a Systems Analyst / Configuration Analyst who will partner with various stakeholders to ensure that a number of applications within their eco-system is performing at optimal levels.

You will apply your in-depth disciplinary knowledge in platforms / applications / systems configuration, in contributing to the development of new techniques, improvement of processes and work-flow within a number of applications and ensuring system configuration accurately reflects business requirements for a number of modules within multiple platforms. You will be integrating subject matter expertise to analyze complex business problems to be solved within automated systems, configure system settings and options, identify gaps and provide technical expertise to scale current systems, processes and procedures.

What critical skills are needed for you to consider someone for this position?

  • Sound experience in configuration and release management
  • Experience in supporting and maintaining Commercial-Off-The-Shelf applications and/or Software as a Service / enterprise applications and systems (ideally workforce management and/or CRM applications)
  • Knowledge and experience in the design and execution of application upgrades (including planning, test plan, execution)
  • Demonstrated ability to identify technical solutions for business problems
  • Knowledge and understanding of database technologies such as SQL or Postgres
  • Experience with the following tech (desirable):

  • SQL Server 2014, 2016, 2019
  • Azure - Service Fabric, Azure AD & DevOPS
  • Windows 7/10 & Server 2008R2 environment

Whilst the role will be based in Adelaide, our client places emphasis on flexible work philosophy.

.

.

.

To be considered for the role click the 'apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Sonia Robertson on 08 74220613 or email: srobertson@paxus.com.au and quote the above job reference number.

Paxus values diversity and welcomes applications from Indigenous Australians, people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people living with a disability. If you require an adjustment to the recruitment process please contact me on the above contact details.

title: STEM Analyst – Impacts of Advanced Technologies APS Level 4/5-6
description:
Your Role

The Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG) is offering two ongoing positions as a STEM Analyst on the Impacts of Advanced Technologies.

You will develop a deep understanding of a range of technologies, and work with experts to foresee how these technologies will develop into the future. You will then creatively assess how these developments might strengthen or weaken Australia’s national interests, with a focus on Defence and national security.

The role involves desk-based technical research and analysis as part of a large team responsible for providing emerging technology and foresight advice to Defence and other government departments. You will be responsible for a technical area that corresponds to your current S&T skills, and will broaden your expertise into a range of fields relevant to Defence (for example AI, cyber, biotechnology, quantum and many others). You will be trained in role-specific analytic skills, including data analytics and foresight techniques. You will develop a sound understanding of the structure and decision-making processes of the Defence Department, to ensure your advice is tailored to have an impact. You will develop into a communications expert, able to concisely explain technical issues to busy, non-technical stakeholders. Outputs will include written reports, verbal briefings, multi-media and infographics. The role requires building networks across our own team of experts, as well as broader DSTG, Defence and intelligence.

Our Team

The technology analyst team is a part of the Defence Impacts of Emerging Technology (DIET) Group, within Strategy and Joint Force (SJF) Major Science and Technology Capability (MSTC), which is itself within the Joint and Operations Analysis Division of the Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG).

This team is organised under DSTG’s Strategic Futures Project, and works closely with the Critical Technology Foresight (CTF) Group. You will be joining a project team of approximately 25 staff, including technology analysts (like this position), experts in tools and methods (such as AI experts who write programs to assist the analysts) and social scientists (who evaluate the impact of technology on society).

The Strategic Futures Project is a centre of gravity within government for emerging technology and foresight advice. Our advice feeds into decision-making, such as for senior Defence committees, the Department’s S&T portfolio planning and capability planning for the ADF. We play a key role in whole-of-government decision-making via our strong linkages to the Critical Technology Policy Coordination Office in PM&C. We partner with DSTG’s 2000 experts, across Defence, policy and intelligence agencies, and with international experts.

Our team is passionate, professional, welcoming and inclusive.

Our Ideal Candidate

We are seeking an Australian citizen who is naturally curious and motivated to develop broad expertise across diverse emerging technologies. Candidates from all S&T disciplines will be considered, but we especially seek experts in the physical sciences, engineering or systems analysis. We seek science-communicators who are passionate about making an impact for the nation. Ideally you will have experience in the APS, academia or industry. A pre-existing interest in Defence is not required, but you must be open to developing this.

Application Closing Date: Friday 3 June, 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, reference DSTG/02119/22 on https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=B9B11BC9-9194-AB88-90BD-C88DBEBC300F

title: Logistics Analyst
description:
We’re on a quest to improve everyday life for millions of people and the world around us. To reinvent the way we cook, clean, and care. It is embodied in everything we do. Every idea, product and human interaction. The trend hunters who want to revolutionise the fashion industry. The foodies who strive to make taste an experience. The health enthusiasts who search for ways to make our environment even cleaner and brighter for today and the future.

Join us to create solutions and experiences that enrich daily lives and the health of our planet.

Your Role

Carefully planning and running the logistics schedules as part of a close-knit team, you will also balance the needs of stakeholders and colleagues across all functions to ensure the efficient transportation of products. It’s a dynamic, responsible role that requires a flexible approach to changing priorities, delivering solutions and looking ahead to see how we can deliver even better for our customers. You will have an up-to-date view of production and material in transit as well as business strategic priorities to ensure financial goals are met.

A Typical Day

As a Logistics Analyst you will be responsible for logistics planning to ensure the smooth flow of internal and external material for Dudley Park manufacturing operations. Your objective will be to ensure high levels of customer service ensuring Electrolux meets its financial goals through scheduling and delivery of materials on time to production.  You will be part of various functions within the logistics team that may involve Kanban scheduling, electronic ordering, scheduling, shortage reporting and follow up. Your day may include:

  • Prepare and review low stock reports
  • Create, review and analyse component requirements
  • Monitor goods receiving
  • Manage Direct to Site suppliers
  • Follow through urgent order from point of dispatch to line side delivery
  • Monitor stock and correct stock discrepancies
  • Maintain record of supplier decks and maintain supplier deck details
  • Maintain accurate Logistics Lead times within the corporate database
  • Manage cost KPI’s as per Business Plan Development
  • Periodically review freight methods and rates for most practical and cost- effective methods
  • Prepare stock reports
  • Report on shortages to the factory through the daily components meeting
  • Liaise and work closely with other departments including Production, Manufacturing Engineering and Purchasing

Core Competencies

Agile – You work with urgency, analysing and adapting to different situations, quickly understanding changes and reacting confidently and decisively.

Analytical – With an eye for detail and the ability to interpret complex data, you can also translate this into meaningful, useful information that informs decision-making.

A Self-Starter – You can join the dots to take us from where we are to where we want to be, mapping the clear routes and strategies essential to achieving our goals.

Organised – You set the pace and the priorities, and then you bring a methodical approach to meeting your goals.

Collaborative – You build trust, good working relationships and communicate effectively with your colleagues and across functions.

Who You Are

  • Good working knowledge of global shipping practices
  • Experience in a global project involving multiple stakeholders including suppliers, freight forwarders via web-based applications
  • Ability to work under pressure
  • Good planning and organisational skills
  • Tertiary qualification in logistics, material planning or similar discipline
  • Computer skills with high competence level in Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Word, Access etc

Keeping you Healthy and Safe

We want you to return home in even better shape than when you started, so we need you to help us do this by making sure you follow a few simple steps. We need you to:

  • Make sure you take reasonable care for your own health and safety, and
  • Take reasonable care that what you do (or what you don’t do when you should have) doesn’t affect the health and safety of others, and
  • Follow reasonable instructions that we might give from time-to-time, such as reporting incidents and hazards, and
  • Follow policies or procedures, so long as it’s reasonable and we’ve told you about it, and
  • Attend training that helps you to work safely

Company Description

Electrolux is a leading global appliance company that has shaped living for the better for more than 100 years. We reinvent taste, care and wellbeing experiences for millions of people, always striving to be at the forefront of sustainability in society through our solutions and operations. Under our brands, including Electrolux, AEG and Frigidaire, we sell approximately 60 million household products in approximately 120 markets every year. In 2020 Electrolux had sales of SEK 116 billion and employed 48,000 people around the world. For more information go to www.electroluxgroup.com.

title: Business Analyst -Digital Analytics
description:
• Phenomenal Career progression opportunities available
  • Permanent Opportunity

How will I help?

As the Business Analyst, you will be joining our vibrant Digital Team within Customer Assist where your role is paramount to helping contribute the delivery of Westpac’s vision and strategic priorities. You will plan and lead digital communication channels through various campaigns and in BAU. Your role will be critical to the Collections team as you navigate across the bank to drive towards achieving premium consumer experience at every level, both to internal and external stakeholders.

You will be collaborating with Product Owners to conduct stakeholder analysis, eliciting requirements from key stakeholder groups through a variety of facilitation methods including interviews and workshops. You will analyse, identify, and recommend approaches to deliver the goals and objectives of project and business initiatives, build solutions, develop, and document detailed business process specifications, business requirements and system functional/non-functional specifications and review and revise documentation in light of any new information. Your focus to role will be on delivering Email as a channel, own and build out a roadmap for Westpac Live, collaborate across team, and be the point of contact with ISG and Group Digital to identify current and new digital channels that Digital Collections can built towards.

What’s in it for me?
You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.

What do I need?

  • Experience as a Business Analyst
  • Demonstrated understanding of Business Analysis Frameworks and/or methodologies.
  • Exemplify a high level of self-motivation, organisation, and communication.
  • A well founded understanding of technology and business systems strategically and operationally.

What is it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team of people who love helping others succeed. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs.

How do I Apply?

Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.

As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.

The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We’ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they’re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.

The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.

By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy, and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.

title: Data Engineer
description:
• All Systems GO! Be part of the next generation of defence technology
  • Design, build and preparation of data platforms using Tableau and other visualisation tools
  • Enjoy flexibility , engaging work and a culture that embraces diversity and open-mindedness
  • This role could be  based in Adelaide or Melbourne.

At BAE Systemswe are all systems go as we continue to drive innovation and seek passionate and talented people to join our business. We currently have a unique opportunity as a Data Engineer within our Central Business function, the role could be based in Adelaide, SA or Melbourne, Victoria.

What this opportunity will mean for you:

  • Purposeful work where your efforts are recognized in an environment where you can thrive
  • Joining an organisation that is passionate about developing some of the most impressive careers in the world
  • Industry-leading flexibility options to unlock the talent and diversity of every individual
  • Unique opportunities to contribute to programs of national significance whilst growing your skills
  • A strong safety culture, inclusive teams and work to be proud of, underpinned by a compelling set of values

Your new role:

As the Data Engineer , you will be responsible for the design, build and preparation of data platforms and the associated integration from systems of record to facilitate analysis, visualisation and communication of data and analytics.

You will interact with business and IT teams and Senior Stakeholders on a regular basis to support them and the broader business by providing guidance on reporting and analytics dashboard design and build to facilitate accurate and timely reporting, insights, and analysis to better inform their decision-making.

You will provide advice and coaching on taking evidenced based approaches and undertake detailed analysis of prioritised analytics programs.

In terms of specific responsibilities, you will:

  • Ensure integrity of any integration between source systems/systems of record and relevant data platforms
  • Ensure efficient, sustainable and best practice design and build of data platforms to facilitate efficient analysis
  • Ensure security requirements are adhered to and appropriate data sets are available to relevant teams and users within our company so as to ensure our Commonwealth obligations are met and adhered to
  • Liaise with key stakeholders to assist them to communicate and interpret reporting to support decision-making.
  • Work with relevant stakeholders and provide guidance on data structures to deliver impactful reporting and analytics.
  • Provide coaching, training and guidance to the data and information community on data and analysis.
  • Provide thought leadership towards key enterprise wide dashboards and analytic solutions
  • Stay up to date with the latest analytics methods and data model design practices
  • Development and continuous improvement of enterprise data management for effective use of analytics and reporting solution
  • Design and change management of enterprise database structures and data extraction and loading.
  • Work with user community to ensure agreed frameworks and governance is adhered to
  • Address Ad hoc data queries from senior stakeholders as required (ELT).
  • Engage with internal and external stakeholders to develop suitable solutions.

About you

As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you'll have:

  • Demonstrated experience working as Data Engineer
  • Broad experience with Tableau tools including server administration of Tableau with Server and Data Administration and Management
  • Significant experience in designing solutions to capture, transform and analyse large and complex data sets. ODI and Informatica are an advantage
  • Significant experience in designing and maintaining data repositories to allow data to be analysed quickly and efficiently within the agreed governance frameworks
  • Proven track record of success working on analytics projects
  • Broad experience with any of the Analytics tools (ideally with Tableau, but other tools like Qlik or Power BI will be considered)
  • Experience in designing, implementing and extending data mart & warehouse solutions
  • Experience in the implementation of Analytics Solutions that incorporate Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
  • Experience in managing internal customers and devising fit for purpose governance models around reporting and data
  • Experience in managing and leading Analytics Communities of Practice
  • Experience in Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) will be an advantage
  • Experience in Oracle E-Business Suite will be an advantage

A Degree level qualification in IT disciplines related to data management and database management and design is desirable in the role.

Clearances

As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance.

International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.

Further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html

Applications should be addressed to: Calvin Ebenezer - Talent Acquisition Specialist - IM&T and made online here. Confidential enquiries are welcome via email: calvin.ebenezer@baesystems.com

Please be aware that pursuant to different State government health directions, vaccination mandates regarding your ability to attend our Company sites may be applicable.  Please be prepared to discuss your vaccination status with our recruiters as part of the recruitment process.

We are a 2021 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.

Our culture

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment where our people can thrive. For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of our employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation.

If you would like to know more information about how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives via this link .

To learn about other employment opportunities at BAE Systems, please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au

title: GIS Analyst
description:
• Career opportunity at Beach Energy
  • Provide support across the business
  • Adelaide based

We now have an opportunity for a GIS Analyst to join Beach Energy in our Adelaide office. This role will provide cartographic content for internal/external stakeholders, building maps using Geographic Information Systems (GIS) to support business functions for incorporating location intelligence across the business.

About the Role

You will be required to manage spatial data, location intelligence services and provide technical support to the users by ensuring data integrity, efficient workflows, and integration of spatial data across the company. In addition, this role is required to support the Web GIS functions at Beach Energy (ArcGIS Enterprise) including the Web Portal management.

Key responsibilities will include:

  • Developing high quality maps with advanced cartographic and mapping functions, according to the energy industry standards for supporting the diverse stakeholder business groups at Beach Energy.
  • Proficiency in the use of GIS to develop multi-purpose maps using ArcGIS PRO with advance spatial analysis, geoprocessing tools and automated spatial data transformations for supporting the regular operations and decision support systems.
  • Establishing positive and productive working relationships with key stakeholders to understand the spatial information requirements for creating custom maps, spatial datasets for maintaining an efficient spatial information services.
  • Prioritising mapping functions and spatial information services in busy office environment for achieving the highest business performance.
  • Supporting the spatial system for Portal data management and maintaining a series of Apps and dashboards for 24/7 operations.

About You

We are looking for a technically proficient individual with extensive experience in GIS and mapping functions. To be successful, you will need a practical knowledge of the ESRI - ArcGIS product suite and the ability to effectively use geoscience software including Petrosys/DBmap.

  • Extensive experience in a similar role with exposure to advance mapping functions and spatial information service delivery is essential.
  • Expertise on advance spatial data management and effective information visualizations in spatial context.
  • An ability to work unsupervised and to prioritise workloads, meet deadlines and work under pressure.

Previous experience in the oil and gas industry is desirable or a demonstrated ability to quickly pick up technical language and a strong interest in the industry is essential.

Finally, you must be a team player, well presented and above all an exemplary communicator.

If you are a highly motivated, enthusiastic person and have a desire to contribute to a professional and inclusive team then apply now.

About Us

Beach Energy is a proud South Australian, Energy exploration and production company headquartered in Adelaide.

For more than 60 years, Beach has operated onshore and offshore, oil and natural gas production across South Australia, Western Australia, Victoria, and New Zealand.

We seek to deliver long-term value to our shareholders, and focus on the safety of our people, their work environment, and the sustainability of our practices and environment we work in.

Working with Beach, you will make a difference in the delivery of key oil and gas projects within a growth organisation.

At Beach our values govern our decisions and interactions. Our values are Safety, Creativity, Respect, Integrity, Performance and Teamwork .

How to Apply

Beach is committed to improving gender diversity and Indigenous participation; we encourage all applications.

Please submit your cover letter and updated CV by 1 June 2022.

For this opportunity you must be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident.

To keep our community safe, candidates are required to comply with COVID related state specific public health orders.

title: Corporate Finance Analyst, Analysis and Reporting
description:
• Department for Health and Wellbeing, Corporate and System Support Services – Finance, Performance Monitoring and Reporting
  • Salary: $94,176 to $99,615 – ASO6 – Full Time / Ongoing Appointment

The Corporate Finance Analyst will be:

  • Contributing to the development, implementation and maintenance of a reporting and performance framework across SA Health including the reporting and monitoring of monthly financial, activity and workforce information.
  • Contributing to the development, implementation and maintenance of a range of complex financial analyses.
  • Providing a range of timely and accurate financial and management reports including:
    • preparing monthly management reports;
    • providing specific financial information for the preparation of the monthly Portfolio Management reports; and
    • preparing a broad range of other documents, reports or submissions as required.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role. Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory Criminal History Check and appropriate immunisation requirements. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants are encouraged to apply. title: Contracts Analyst - ICT
description:
• Work onsite at one of Australia's leading resources organisations
  • 12 month assignment offering full time hours
  • Immediate start, Adelaide, Brisbane or Perth CBD location


About The Company

Santos is a leading independent producer of oil and gas committed to ever-cleaner energy and fuels production. With operations across Australia, Papua New Guinea, Timor-Leste and North America, Santos has been supplying reliable and affordable energy to Australia and the Asia-Pacific for over 65 years.

As customer demand evolves, Santos plans to grow its cleaner energy and clean fuels through carbon capture and storage, nature-based offsets, energy efficiency and use of renewables in its operations. With a strong, low-cost base business supplying oil and gas and plans to develop cleaner energy and clean fuels, Santos remains resilient, value accretive and at the leading edge of the energy transition.


About The Role

Working in procurement services from the national head office location, you will deliver end to end contracting and procurement services in support of corporate, onshore and offshore development projects for the Information Systems category.

Specifically, this role will be accountable for:

  • Cost benchmarking and analysis of IS/IT products, infrastructure and services, and providing recommendations that are informed by market intelligence and that balance risk and value
  • Supplier relationship management activities for contracts under management, including negotiation with potential suppliers and fostering positive relationships with existing vendors
  • Ensuring development and execution of sourcing strategies and category plans to achieve lowest total cost outcomes whilst accommodating delivery of scope growth
  • Lodging variations and claims within contract terms, to maintain annual contract value
  • Complying with Supply Chain Standards ensuring requirements are complied with or modified as required



About You

Ideally, you will have:

  • Degree qualifications in Supply Chain Management, Business, Law, Engineering or similar
  • Strong experience in a similar position within procurement, contracts or category analysis
  • Previous experience managing contracts for IT/ICT services and products
  • A solutions-focused approach to problem solving, customer service and team work

If this sounds like you, and you have the required experience, skills, and qualifications for this contract opportunity, please 'Apply' today. Your Chandler Macleod Consultant will be in contact to discuss your application further. We look forward to hearing from you.

Please note: to be considered for this position, you must have current work rights in Australia (i.e. Australian Citizenship, permanent residency or an eligible working visa with no restrictions for full time work).

title: Analyst Programmer
description:
• Department for Health and Wellbeing, Digital Health SA – Technology and Infrastructure, Application Services
  • Salary: $82,042 to $91,245 – ASO5 – Full Time / Ongoing Appointment

Your new company
The mission at SA Health is to lead and deliver a comprehensive and sustainable health system that aims to ensure healthier, longer, and better lives for all South Australians. They aim to achieve their objectives by strengthening primary health care, enhancing hospital care, reforming mental health care, and improving the health of Aboriginal people.

SA Health is committed to a health system that produces positive health outcomes by focusing on health promotion, illness prevention and early intervention. SA Health work with other government agencies and the community to address the environmental, socioeconomic, biological and behavioural determinants of health, and to achieve equitable health outcomes for all South Australians.

Your new role
The Analyst Programmer is responsible to the Manager, Application Development for coordinating and undertaking application and interface development, application maintenance, analysis, design, and programming functions services.

The role delivers a range of technical planning, design, implementation, coding and testing activities, ensuring methodical development, using agreed workflow processes under a defined Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).

What you'll need to succeed

  • Experience with C# .NET with .NET core.
  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as jQuery, AngularJS, and React.
  • Experience with Microsoft SQL Server 2012-2016 .
  • Knowledge of working in an Agile environment.
  • Great interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Some experience writing accurate technical documentation.
  • Some experience working with Azure DevOPS/GIT
  • The ability to provide support to team members and stakeholders
  • Experience in delivering application development and administration services and functions to support complex computer systems within a large organisation including providing technical advice and producing and maintaining a broad range of technical and user documentation.
  • Experience in coordinating and providing maintenance services for business-critical computer software systems in a multiuser environment including utilising a variety of tools, operating systems, and programs to conduct system testing, maintenance and reporting.
  • Experience in the use of systems analysis and design, structured programming, and data analysis methodologies, analysing business requirements for system enhancements and providing accurate estimates for the delivery of all activities in the Software Development Life Cycle.
  • Proven knowledge of ITIL the Software Development Life Cycle and project management processes and methodologies and knowledge of relevant government ICT policies and agency program activities.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role. Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory Criminal History Check and appropriate immunisation requirements. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants are encouraged to apply. title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
• Senior Business Analyst
  • Competitive Rates
  • 12 Month Federal Contract

Overview
Ignite are seeking a skilled Business Analyst to join as a contractor for a large Federal Client. You will be part of a team helping replace core telecommunications capabilities with modern technology and ensure service continuity for core platforms. This includes replacing existing data network capabilities, unified communications, customer contact management and other telephony services.
Your role will revolve around the use of modern data analysis and presentation tools, including Power BI or similar, will be a significant advantage. Analysts may be required to work across multiple projects to assist with resource levelling across the programme.

Locations
Canberra : 2600
Melbourne : 3001
Brisbane : 4001
Sydney : 2000
Adelaide : 5001

Key Responsibilities
  • Proactively share subject matter expert technical advice , support, and recommendations on the implementation of telecommunication services in a complex environment.
  • Establish and manage data management processes including quality control.
  • Negotiate, engage and manage relationships with other agencies and multiple service providers to support the seamless delivery of programme outcomes.
  • Provide technical expertise and mentorship.

Desirable Skills
  • Business process improvement (SFIA level 5 [BPRE]).
  • User experience analysis (SFIA level 3 [UNAN]).
  • Data modelling and design (SFIA level 2 [DTAN]).
  • Demonstrated high level experience in any of the following areas:
    • satellite data and / or telephony
    • data analysis and migration
    • systems integration.
    • telecommunications services
    • data carriage
Please note to be eligible for this position you must be an Australian Citizen with the ability to obtain a Baseline Security Clearance

Working from home requests are assessed on a case by case basis, with a focus on flex.

holt.fowler@igniteco.com | 02 6113 7542 | ID 365407

title: Vehicle Supply Chain Analyst
description:
Vehicle Supply Chain Analyst

Mitsubishi Motors Australia Ltd. (MMAL) drives people and businesses to achieve their ambition through the technology, design, and product advantages in our range of cars, SUVs, and Utes. As An agile organisation of passionate and driven professionals, we take pride in over 11 million people around the world choosing our vehicles.

If you would like to drive your ambition and contribute to our growing market share, our reputation for quality and be part of an agile organization, we want to hear from you! ­­

Our role

Based in our Adelaide Head Office, the Vehicle Supply Chain Analyst role is a shared full-time role with one other Vehicle Supply Chain Analyst and reports to the Senior Manager - Vehicle Supply Chain, as a member of the Vehicle Operations team. The primary responsibility is to support the achievement of Mitsubishi Motors Australia Limited (MMAL) sales objectives through the monitoring and maintenance of supply chain processes to facilitate the import, distribution & sale of vehicles.

How you will make an impact

  • Facilitate MMAL's vehicles at all stages within the supply chain incl import, distribution, and sale
  • Monitor and maintain MMAL's vehicle management system
  • Place vehicle orders with suppliers on a timely basis
  • Facilitate the forecasting, ordering, and delivery of all direct fleet sales
  • Liaise with direct customers, dealers, and the fleet sales team
  • Recommend and implement improvements to day-to-day processes and systems (e.g. SAP)
  • Create reports & provide insightful data analysis

What you will need to join our team

  • Tertiary qualification in Business, Commerce, Logistics, Maths (or similar) or
  • Experience working in an Inventory or Analytical environment
  • Experience with complex systems based process management
  • Proven experience recommending and implementing process improvements
  • Understanding of supply chain principles
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills - proven experience in communicating effectively with all levels of management
  • Experience using business reporting tools and SAP & COGNOS would be an advantage

What we offer

A career with Mitsubishi Motors Australia Limited will be both challenging and rewarding, providing growth opportunities and the prospects to advance your career, you will be part of a diverse and dynamic work environment where you will have access to employee benefits and volunteer days.

Additionally, Mitsubishi Motors Australia Limited offers a competitive remuneration and benefits package, along with the opportunity to lease Mitsubishi vehicles and access to discounts on new Mitsubishi vehicles for family and friends.

Drive your ambition and apply now

Express your interest in joining us by submitting a cover letter and resume.

title: Tableau Analytics Consultant
description:
About the job:

This role is a key position within a professional, friendly team of data specialists. The successful candidate will take a key role in delivery of Tableau projects and provides an opportunity for a variety of work including reporting & dashboards, integration and data science.

What DataSpark is like to work at:

DataSpark is a small, fast-paced team with terrific clients and interesting projects. Lots of dashboard development work, a bunch of data integration and wrangling.

The core of the team culture is that we're here for our clients and not the other way around. The successful candidate will demonstrate that they share our customer-first priority.

Although we are based in Adelaide, we have an extensive set of clients across Australia and New Zealand and are open to candidates working remotely.

Essential requirements:

  • Experience in a consulting role working directly with clients (internal or external).
  • Able to work both within a team and independently and manage multiple tasks and priorities.
  • Intermediate to strong Tableau software skills.
  • Imaginative. A good eye for detail. Good team player.

Desirable skills, experience and attributes (although not essential ideally you will have at least one of these):

  • Database and SQL
  • ETL or integration development
  • Experience with other BI/DA suites
  • Data Science

In your application, please provide a cover letter with the following details.

  • What attracted you to apply for this role?
  • What experience and skills do you believe make you a good fit for this role?
  • What career and professional development opportunities are important to you?
  • What is your definition of customer service?

To be upfront we would like to advise that this job is not a good fit for you if you want to:

  • Be placed at a customer site for months at a time. Instead, we run a remote delivery model with the team working together to achieve awesome things for our clients.
  • Spend all of your time doing pure data science. Instead, we spend a lot of our time coming up with innovative solutions to customer challenges, wrangling data and building dashboards.
  • Do one job at a time and the same thing every day. Instead...well, we work in a data analytics agency!

If this role sounds like it might suit you, please send through your resume with your updated cover letter, outlining your answers to the details written above.

title: Contracts Analyst - ICT
description:
• Work onsite at one of Australia's leading resources organisations
  • 12 month assignment. offering full time hours
  • Immediate start, Adelaide, Brisbane or Perth CBD location


About The Company

Santos is a leading independent producer of oil and gas committed to ever-cleaner energy and fuels production. With operations across Australia, Papua New Guinea, Timor-Leste and North America, Santos has been supplying reliable and affordable energy to Australia and the Asia-Pacific for over 65 years.

As customer demand evolves, Santos plans to grow its cleaner energy and clean fuels through carbon capture and storage, nature-based offsets, energy efficiency and use of renewables in its operations. With a strong, low-cost base business supplying oil and gas and plans to develop cleaner energy and clean fuels, Santos remains resilient, value accretive and at the leading edge of the energy transition.


About The Role

Working in procurement services from the national head office location, you will deliver end to end contracting and procurement services in support of corporate, onshore and offshore development projects for the Information Systems category.

Specifically, this role will be accountable for:

  • Cost benchmarking and analysis of IS/IT products, infrastructure and services, and providing recommendations that are informed by market intelligence and that balance risk and value
  • Supplier relationship management activities for contracts under management, including negotiation with potential suppliers and fostering positive relationships with existing vendors
  • Ensuring development and execution of sourcing strategies and category plans to achieve lowest total cost outcomes whilst accommodating delivery of scope growth
  • Lodging variations and claims within contract terms, to maintain annual contract value
  • Complying with Supply Chain Standards ensuring requirements are complied with or modified as required


About You

Ideally, you will have:

  • Degree qualifications in Supply Chain Management, Business, Law, Engineering or similar
  • Strong experience in a similar position within procurement, contracts or category analysis
  • Previous experience managing contracts for IT/ICT services and products
  • A solutions-focused approach to problem solving, customer service and team work

If this sounds like you, and you have the required experience, skills, and qualifications for this contract opportunity, please 'Apply' today. Your Chandler Macleod Consultant will be in contact to discuss your application further. We look forward to hearing from you.

Please note: to be considered for this position, you must have current work rights in Australia (i.e. Australian Citizenship, permanent residency or an eligible working visa with no work restrictions).

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Pioneering, innovative and solutions-focused, Junction has led South Australia in providing a wide range of services and quality housing for more than 40 years.  With extensive experience and expertise, the organisation supports people to not just survive, but thrive in life.


An exciting opportunity now exists for a Financial Analyst to join Junction’s collaborative and high performing finance team. Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, this position is responsible for providing high-level management support to the leadership group through the provision of a contemporary finance service. The breadth of this role will encompass preparation of financial reports and sophisticated financial models that will provide accurate information on Junction’s profitability, solvency, stability, and liquidity based on a robust set of assumptions. In addition, this role will lead and create a continuous improvement culture whilst assisting the CFO to develop, implement and review policies and procedures, all of which will provide positive outcomes and assist the organisation to achieve its strategic objectives.


The successful candidate will demonstrate strong experience in financial reporting and modelling, ideally with experience in a similar role. Technical proficiency in financial forecasting and planning software and Microsoft Excel is essential, along with a strong analytical mindset and natural initiative and motivation to introduce sustainable creative solutions. Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills will be critical to your success, along with a values alignment with the collaborative, high performing team who positively empower each other to succeed. Qualifications in Accounting or equivalent field are essential.


Confidential enquiries can be made to Katherine Scott or Jedda Gito at Morton Philips on 08 8210 8510 .  Applications can be made in MS Word format directly via Seek.

title: Data Services Specialist
description:
Location: NSW / VIC / SA

Type: Permanent, full-time position

Your part in a changing world

At QBE, we’re driven by our purpose – to give people the confidence to achieve their ambitions .

We are an international insurer and reinsurer offering a diverse portfolio of commercial, personal and specialty products, as well as risk management solutions. Our product portfolio includes property, motor, crop, energy, marine and aviation. We employee a team of more than 11,800 people, in 27 countries around the world.

Data Services Specialist

A high performing team is an organisation's number one asset. QBE has an ambitious journey ahead, so we will be making a large investment to ensure we have the right skills and roles to get us there.

With the objective of becoming simpler, stronger and more customer-centred, several new roles have been created across QBE.

An exciting opportunity of Data Services Specialist has become available within the Data and Analytics division of the Australia and New Zealand Operations (ANZO). Reporting to Data Performance and Insights Manager, this role will provide the support that business through the development of its data and analytics platform. With demonstrated knowledge and experience within data delivery, ETL, data management, solution design and delivery, you will be given a fantastic opportunity to support the business in a period of change and growth. Moreover, you will play an advisory role, providing technical guidance to teams within various business units.

The Opportunity:

Design and development of data engineering assets and scalable feature engineering frameworks to support various Business Unit’s data demands and internal data science activities.

  • Evaluate feature importance and manage production of data features.
  • Code, test, and document new or modified data models and ETL tools to create robust and scalable data assets for reporting and analytics.
  • Build ETL data assets using Microsoft ETL tool stack as per ETL Framework.
  • Expand and increase data platform capabilities to resolve new data problems and challenges by identifying, sourcing, and integrating new data.
  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc
  • Peer review code and promote dev ops culture within data services team
  • Implement solutions that adhere to architecture best practices.
  • Contribute to our ambition to develop a best practice Data and Analytics platform, leveraging next generation technologies.
  • Define and build the data pipelines that will enable faster, better, data-informed decision-making within the business.
  • Proactively identify rationalisation opportunities and implement changes to the reporting suite to increase customer usage and reduce wasted effort.
  • Ensure data integrity within reports and dashboards by reviewing data, identifying and resolving gaps and inconsistencies, and escalating as required to foster a partnered approach to data accuracy for business reporting purposes.

What does success look like?

  • Bachelor degree in Information Technology or other related discipline.
  • 5-8 years experience within data management, solution design and delivery.
  • Solid experience using: MS Stack: Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS and Power BI and SQL
  • Passionate in learning about new data tools and best practices
  • Experience in working in Agile teams, able to lead a team and working independently
  • Advanced communication, influencing and negotiation skills, with the ability to articulate and present technical concepts to business leaders.
  • Strong working knowledge of the end-to-end data management lifecycle and data quality management.
  • Experience working MongoDB, Graph databases, programming languages (R, Python, Spark ETL SQL VStudio), CI/tools (Bamboo, or similar), GitHub, Jira and Confluence.

We are here to support you. We value our employee’s experience with us and are proud to have been recognised for the following awards:

  • 2021 LinkedIn Top Employer and HRD Employer of Choice
  • Ranked 6th place in the AAGE Top Graduate Employers 2021 as voted by graduates
  • 2020 Best Workplace Diversity & Inclusion and Excellence Award for Best Health & Wellbeing at the Australian HR Awards
  • Top 20 Workplaces for Dads in 2019 and 2020 (HBF Direct Advice for Dads)
  • Gold Employer status in both the 2019 and 2020 Australian Workplace Equality Index (AWEI) – the definitive national benchmark on LGBTI workplace inclusion.

We offer a range of benefits to help provide holistic support for your work life, whatever your circumstance. As a QBE employee, we will offer you:

  • ‘Hybrid Working’ – a mix of working in the office and at home to enhance your work/life balance
  • Our ‘At My Best’ wellbeing program
  • Access to ‘Share the Care’ – 12 weeks’ gender-equal flexible leave for all new parents, including paid superannuation
  • The ability to maximise retirement savings through voluntary super contributions and company matching
  • Income protection insurance and reimbursed Death and Total Permanent Disability insurance premiums
  • Access to REACH My Best - free holistic wellbeing coaching, nutritional, financial and legal advice, and confidential counselling
  • Access to Family and Domestic Violence leave and support through QBE’s Family Domestic Violence First Responder Network
  • A sustained commitment to Reconciliation, having launched our first Reconciliation Action Plan in 2015
  • Discounts on insurance products, car hire, hotels, goods and services
  • Benefits through our various sports and arts sponsorship partners such as free and discounted tickets.

Join us.

Click APPLY to submit your application. Successful applicants will need to complete work rights, police and credit checks through our online provider as a condition of employment.

QBE takes a risk and compliance approach to vaccination and strongly encourages our employees to be vaccinated. All roles in Victoria and Northern Territory require full COVID-19 vaccination and for vaccination status to be maintained in line with government requirements. Other roles may also require that full vaccination status be maintained. We will ask you to share your status as part of the application process. We won’t be able to progress with applications where candidates choose not to disclose their status for roles that require vaccination in line with our risk and compliance approach.

QBE recognise the value of diverse perspectives and experience. We are committed to an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected for who they are. If we can provide support with access requirements, alternative work arrangements or you would like to connect with one of our networks please contact us at recruitment@qbe.com .

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
• Full Time- Permanent
  • ASX Top 50 Leading Energy Infrastructure Company
  • Brisbane, QLD; Adelaide, SA

About Us

APA is a leading Australian energy infrastructure business. We own and/or manage and operate a diverse, $21 billion portfolio of gas, electricity, solar and wind assets. Consistent with our purpose to strengthen communities through responsible energy, we deliver approximately half of the nation’s gas usage and connect Victoria with South Australia and New South Wales with Queensland through our investments in electricity transmission assets. We are also one of the largest owners and operators of renewable power generation assets in Australia, with wind and solar projects across the country. Our operations span every mainland state and territory in the country and we employ more than 1900 people.

Our vision is to be world class in energy solutions.

The Role

We now have an exciting opportunity available for a Senior Business Analyst to join our Transformation and Technology team in Brisbane, QLD or Adelaide, SA on a full time permanent basis.

Reporting to the Solutions and Delivery Manager, you will play a key role in providing support involves all aspects of system and business analysis, including root cause analysis, as well as the identification, documentation, and justification of solution requirements.

Key Responsibilities

  • Prepare / update Business Analysis artefacts in line with the delivery methodology and framework
  • Conduct requirements elicitation and process definition workshops
  • Preparation of RFP documentation and Vendor Workbook and assist with evaluation of vendor submissions
  • Assess the proposed solution, ensuring full traceability of the solution to the requirements
  • Gap analysis and mapping of current / future processes
  • Business case input / development and business process re-engineering
  • Provide support to the Solutions and Delivery Manager, Project Managers, Change Managers and relevant Applications resources as required e.g. development of Business Case, Project Schedule, Vendor Evaluation, Training activities, Operational Support, and progress updates, as required for the project

About You

  • 5+ years’ experience in business and systems analysis, requirements analysis, process modelling and design validation
  • Demonstrated experience as a Senior Business Analyst within enterprise project environments
  • Formal training in Business Analysis and Business Process Modelling (certification an advantage e.g. CBAP certification through the IIBA)
  • Demonstrated knowledge of and experience with best practice business analysis frameworks and processes e.g. the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK)
  • Knowledge of project management and software development lifecycles and frameworks (e.g. Agile, PMBOK, PRINCE2)
  • Demonstrated experience in gathering and understanding customer requirements in context of complex interdependent systems
  • Experience in communicating information effectively and appropriately to senior managers and business stakeholders
  • Experience in using a range of tools and techniques for elicitation and analysis purposes e.g. Process / Data Modelling, UML / Use Cases, Workshop Facilitation, Interviews, Surveys
  • Experience fostering relationships with business stakeholders (management / staff), service providers and external stakeholders (e.g. vendors, regulatory bodies etc.
  • Demonstrated experience recommending improvements to business processes, ensuring business goals are met
  • Excellent written, interpersonal, and oral communication skills.  Strong influencing and negotiating skills

Sound like your kind of career? We’d love to hear from you.

APA is an equal opportunity employer. The safety and sustainability of our people, community and environment is our focus. We embrace diversity in our people to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we operate in.

When you join us on this journey to success, you will have access to targeted career development programs, competitive remuneration, employee benefits, work–life balance and wellbeing programs.

Role closes Monday, 30 May 2022. Role Reference number 2051.

Applicants must be eligible to work in Australia to be considered.

APA Group is not accepting submissions from recruitment agencies for this role.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

Visit us on apa.com.au/careers

title: Application Support Analyst
salary: Great salary and benefits on offer
description:
We are seeking a Applications Support Engineer committed to delivering exceptional customer service with prior experience in providing 1st and 2nd level support for enterprise wide applications.

The Opportunity

As level 2 support you will act as first point of contact for our Level 1 support team for all support incidents requiring technical investigation.

You will;

  • Diagnose issues and identify a fix and / or workaround as needed within client specific SLA requirements.
  • Collaborate with technical support, product support, infrastructure support and analytics teams if an incident needs a deeper investigation.
  • Collaborate with client's internal technology teams as needed to ensure successful incident resolution.
  • Provide ongoing updates to the customer about the progress.
  • Develop deep understanding of the platform and client's business processes and technology environment to facilitate swift resolution of the support issues.
  • Review old and ongoing incidents to resolve or wescalate for furhter investigation.
  • Share feedback about frequent support issues with product team and learning and enablement team to ensure ongoing improvements.
  • Contribute to the internal knowledge base and wiki .
  • Participation in rostered on-call (shared across the team).

About you

  • 3+ years of experience in providing technical support for a large ERP with stringent SLAs.
  • Focus on delivering exceptional customer service.
  • Strong interpersonal and client communication skills.
  • Demonstrated resilience to handle challenges and solve complex client problems.
  • Experience is using service management tools like Zendesk, Remedy, ServiceNow, etc.
  • Experience in supporting SaaS based applications.
  • Experience in working in Linux based environment.

If you have the skills and ability to be successful in this position, we'd love to hear from you.

Simon Bedson
Technology & Digital
Senior Consultant
Let's Connect

+61 08 82146204
