title: Behavioural Scientist / Psychologist
description:
The Australian Wine Research Institute is looking for someone to bring insights and practices from behavioural science and organisational psychology to our extension and adoption programs. These programs are designed to disseminate knowledge and promote practice change in the grape and wine sector.

The ideal candidate will hold a degree in psychology, behavioural science or a related discipline. Ability to design and manage projects, superior communication skills and teamwork experience are also prerequisites.

The Australian Wine Research Institute (AWRI) is the Australian grape and wine industry’s own research organisation. It supports a sustainable and successful grape and wine industry through world-class research, practical solutions and knowledge transfer. The AWRI has strong links with the wine industry and other research organisations and provides a stimulating and challenging work environment.

The position will be based at the Waite Research Precinct, Adelaide, SA and will work closely with several teams at the AWRI.

A position description is available from Behavioural Scientist/Psychologist Position Description. For further information, please contact the Group Manager – Industry Development and Support, Con Simos, on 0448889432 or con.simos@awri.com.au .

Applications should be completed via the online form at https://www.awri.com.au/about_the_awri/people/careers/ Only applications that are completed via the online application form will be considered. Applications will be assessed as they are received.

title: Credit Assessor
description:
THE BASICS

We are seeking an ambitious and enthusiastic Credit Assessor to join one of Australia’s leading credit risk teams. This role represents an opportunity to support an incredibly exciting, fast-growing financial technology company (‘FinTech’), that offers substantial personal and professional development opportunities.


THE COMPANY

OurMoneyMarket and its brand ‘Handypay’ (together ‘OMM’) is one of Australia’s fastest growing FinTech companies, recently featuring in the AFR Fast Starter List and Deloitte Fast Tech 50 . Based on the Deloitte Fast Tech 50 list, OMM is the fastest growing FinTech in Australia and the fast-growing business in Adelaide.

Our mission is to ‘Make Money Simple’. We offer personal finance management tools and a range of consumer finance solutions (personal loans, interest-free payment plans, car loans, and more), so you can turn maybe someday, into today!


ABOUT THE ROLE

You will be responsible for preparing credit application files for decisioning by a credit manager. As a Credit Assessor, your role will entail:

  • Assessing credit risk and providing pricing and outcome recommendations for personal loan applications;
  • Accurately assessing a customer’s loan application and validating data in line with policy and regulations;
  • Following up customers daily for the information required to complete an assessment;
  • Being responsible for the quality of files to ensure correct and complete information is available to enable settlement to proceed.
  • Developing strong credit assessment and structuring skills by working with a diverse customer set;
  • Responding to enquiries and qualifying customers for finance by completing the application process with customers over the phone and via email.
  • Providing outstanding customer service to OMM’s customers and vendor partners. This includes assisting with group inbox management, resolving loan and account enquiries, appeals or complaints in a timely manner.


ABOUT YOU

  • Good quantitative and analytical skills
  • Great interpersonal skills and ability to build rapport
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills


WHAT WE OFFER

We will offer you:

  • A competitive salary to reward the very best
  • An environment where you will be able to personally and professionally take yourself to a new level
  • Opportunities to be part of our leadership development programmes, where you can gain experience in Treasury, Finance, Marketing, Sales, Software Engineering, Product Management and more!
  • A collaborative, respectful, team culture, where you will work closely with executive management
  • Discounts on consumer finance products
  • A place where you can make a huge impact, and everyone will love you for it!


HOW TO APPLY

Simple follow the links to apply!

title: IT Data Engineer
description:
Eldercare is a leading not-for-profit aged care provider in South Australia with an excess of 1600 employees. Our workplace culture embraces teamwork, innovation and a dedication to our purpose of delivering peace of mind with our care.

About the Role:

  • Based at our Head Office in Eastwood
  • Full-time permanent role
  • Flexible working arrangements

We are currently seeking to appoint an IT Data Engineer to lead our IT Data team and to assist in all aspects of Eldercare’s Data Warehouses, System Integrations and Business Intelligence environments including architecture and design, tool selection, implementation, development, testing, administration and maintenance, support, and troubleshooting.

You will report to the IT Manager and be an integral part of a broader IT team. You will be required to provide subject matter expertise and guidance for business and IT staff in how to best use the data structures and data design for Business Intelligence Reporting.

To be successful in this role, you will have:

  • A minimum of 7 years DWH and ETL experience.
  • Experience working within a professional, service-oriented business environment.
  • Tertiary qualification Business Information, Computer Science, or a related field and / or an equivalent combination of education, training and work experience.
  • Experience in all aspects of Data Warehouses including theory (Inmon, Kimball), architecture and design, tool selection, implementation, development, administration and maintenance, support and troubleshooting.
  • Advanced SQL, ETL, Data Modelling skills.
  • Experience and knowledge in System Integrations such as API Management, ESB, SOAP, XML.
  • Experience with using Microsoft SQL Server and Microsoft Power BI

We can offer you:

  • Attractive staff benefits such as salary sacrificing
  • A supportive team environment that encourages professional development
  • Role variety, providing the opportunity to increase your skillset
  • Free onsite undercover car parking
  • An opportunity to contribute to the care and quality of life for our residents

Eldercare encourage you to apply if you are a committed and results-driven individual who is passionate about delivering high-quality outcomes whilst modelling the behaviours underpinning Eldercare's values of respect, accountability and connection.

Please contact Troy Seidel, IT Manager, on 0405 869 107 or email troy.seidel@eldercare.net.au to learn more about this opportunity.

Applications close 9am Monday 23 May 2022.

To work for Eldercare, you are required to have a police clearance valid for working in aged care (vulnerable) and clearance needs to be less than 12 months since date of issue.

Under the Emergency Management (Residential Aged Care Facilities) (COVID-19) Direction, to work in a residential aged care facility:

  • from 1 June 2021, you must provide evidence of your seasonal influenza vaccination or a valid medical exemption
  • from 29 January 2022, you must have two doses of a TGA approved COVID-19 vaccine and within 4 weeks of becoming eligible in accordance with ATAGI guidelines receives a booster dose, or a medical exemption endorsed by the Chief Public Officer or her delegate.

Eldercare welcomes and respects the diversity that our residents, staff and volunteers bring. Regardless of their culture, religion, spirituality, age, gender, sexuality, disability, socio-economic background or personal experiences, our people are included and respected.

Eldercare is proud to be a Rainbow Tick accredited organisation. We are committed to supporting our lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and intersex (LGBTI) residents, staff and volunteers to ensure they feel included and safe.

Eldercare encourages respectful relationships and does not accept any form of gender‑based violence in the workplace. Eldercare is committed to preventing violence against women and is proud to be a White Ribbon accredited workplace to support victims of abuse.

All employees can expect to receive fair and equal treatment and to be free from discrimination in all aspects of their life with Eldercare.

Eldercare is proud to provide a smoke-free environment across all sites.

title: Clinical Product Analyst
description:
ABOUT ALCIDION

The world of healthcare is evolving.  At Alcidion, we are playing our part.  Every day, we help healthcare organisations to embrace smart technology.  We make a positive difference to patient outcomes and we have a simple purpose, that is, to transform healthcare, together with our customers.  We are a focused team of like-minded people with a set of skills and products that create a unique offering in the global healthcare market.  The Alcidion Group of companies brings together the very best in technology and health sector knowledge to deliver solutions that make healthcare better for everyone.

THE ROLE

Are you looking for your next exciting career move? This could be it! Have you moved away from your healthcare work and are looking for the next step? This could be it!

We are looking for a candidate with clinical background as well as experience in IT or Business Analysis.

The Clinical Product Analyst role is instrumental in defining and delivering continual product improvements and innovation throughout the product delivery cycle, that align with the product vision and strategy. The Clinical Product Analyst is a key member of the Product Management team with a broad scope that covers both product discovery and product delivery.

The Clinical Product Analyst works closely with User Experience Designers, Product Specialists / Product Managers, Software Engineers and Architects as well as members of the Quality Assurance team to define new features that solve our customer’s problems. The Clinical Product Analyst is a key advocate for the Product and for our customers and by being detail-oriented will ensure any feature created is being designed and delivered to solve the underlying business problem. The Product Analyst functions across multiple streams of work, documents workflows and has a strong ability to document business requirements and technical requirements.

HOW YOU WILL ADD VALUE TO THE TEAM

This role is diverse, and each day may not look the same! With the opportunity to make this role your own, some key responsibilities will include:

  • Work with the stakeholders to elicit, document, organise and prioritise business requirements, and translate these into system requirements for Alcidion’s products.
  • Obtain deep knowledge of Alcidion’s product suite.
  • Provide detailed product and clinical information to relevant stakeholders; including engineering teams, implementation teams, product specialists, the Product Manager and pre-sales / sales as required.
  • Analyse information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following as needed: Functional Requirements, Business Requirements Documents, Use Cases, User Stories, User Story Maps and Journey Maps.
  • Liaise with members of the product and engineering team to ensure system requirements meet the needs. This will include the Product Manager, product specialists, designers, engineers, architects, testers and the quality team.
  • Work with the product team to ensure all relevant key stakeholders are informed of the progress of product development and to manage stakeholder expectations.
  • Work with product team to ensure the successful and timely delivery of the product changes and ensuring that the product changes achieve the desired outcome for customers and for Alcidion.
  • Ensure all work is undertaken in alignment with Alcidion’s processes and procedures.
  • Conduct the necessary testing and systems analysis.
  • Collaborate and communicate effectively with clients.
  • Ensure requirements align with regulatory compliance obligations.
  • Other duties as required.

HOW YOU WILL BEST SUCCEED

To best help you hit the ground running, you will have:

  • Experience as a business analyst in a software development environment
  • Clinical / Healthcare experience working within hospital or ambulatory care settings
  • Previous experience in working with customers and prospects to document business requirements
  • Exposure to an Agile software development environment
  • Exposure in User Experience Design, User-Centered Design and User Interface Design
  • Experience in close collaboration with a range of internal and external stakeholders and cross-functional teams
  • Ability to clearly document both technical and functional requirements including the ability to understand and facilitate the documentation of use cases and workflows is essential
  • Tertiary qualifications in a clinical, business or technology discipline
  • Highly regarded: Business Analyst certification

BENEFITS OF WORKING AT ALCIDION

What will you love about working with Alcidion?

  • Flexible working is welcomed and can include flexible start and finish times and work from home options
  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Professional development options
  • Health & wellbeing initiatives
  • A desire to make work life fun!

STATEMENT OF POSTING

  • You must have the right to live and work in Australia to be considered for this position.
  • Prospective employees will be required to undertake pre-employment checks, which may include referee, criminal record, academic and employment history checks as required.
  • Alcidion is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive culture and encourage all interested applicants to apply.
  • To keep our employees and customers safe, having had three COVID-19 vaccinations is a requirement of employment with Alcidion, unless a medical exemption applies.
  • No agency enquiries or applications please.

HOW TO APPLY

If you are excited by the idea of working with a great team of like-minded individuals and believe you fit the criteria above, please submit your resume and include a cover letter detailing how you meet the requirements of the role and why you would love to work for Alcidion.

title: Science Team Leader – Data Science (Hamilton, New Zealand)
description:
The role and opportunity

Please note this role is based in Hamilton, New Zealand.

We are looking for a strong people leader to join the Digital Agriculture leadership team and lead the Data Science - Ruakura Team at AgResearch.

As a Science Team leader, your role will be split between, 50% team leadership and 50% as a senior statistician. As a Science Team Leader you will lead a team of scientists that advocate data science principles, working collaboratively in multi-disciplinary project teams to apply new technologies and to develop data-driven solutions for New Zealand’s agricultural sector. The second part of your role will be as a consulting senior statistician.

This role will ensure current and future capability is aligned to the Science Plan, while ensuring an innovation pipeline and culture of innovation excellence continues to be achieved.  We are looking for someone with proven leadership experience and someone that relishes getting the best out of their people.

This leadership role will lead the Data Science - Ruakura Team, ensuring it has the current and future capability requirements (both personnel and science-based infrastructure/equipment) which are aligned to the Science Plan as well as ensuring a vital science driven innovation pipeline and Culture of Innovation Excellence.  You will provide direction and oversight for career progression opportunities, science expertise, staff allocation/deployment and champion science creativity and quality for the team.

What you will be doing

  • Lead a high performing team in unlocking business value by coaching, developing, and managing employees to deliver innovative solutions.
  • Ensure the members of their science team are directed towards and valued as critical contributors to projects that produce high quality science and innovation aligned to the strategic and operational needs of our Science Plan.
  • Maximise allocation of science and innovation employee capabilities by integrating them into AgResearch project design and research investment activities.
  • Implement decision-making frameworks that can inform our critical investments in staff development, recruitment and external capability partnering.

Your ideal background

  • PhD (or equivalent experience) in statistics, data science or mathematics is preferred. Ideally at a senior level.
  • Experience in the leadership/supervision of individuals/groups in science, innovation or technology, including setting and reviewing their progress against objectives and individual development.
  • Proven experience in developing individuals and mentorship.
  • Ability to work with senior leaders.

Our benefits

When your work environment fits your values and your lifestyle, it is a better place to be. Our campuses are green, open, and developing, allowing you to enjoy your work and be productive at the same time – we offer flexibility (work from home, flexible hours) and generous benefits to make sure our people feel supported and enjoy being part of the AgResearch team.

You can view the complete list here: http://www.agresearchcareers.co.nz/working-here/our-benefits/

How to apply

This role will suit a passionate, talented and collaborative person who is motivated to drive their career forward within this vital New Zealand organisation. If this sounds like you, apply today using the link below, including a cover letter detailing why you feel you would be suitable for this position.

For further information, please contact Penny Hall, HR Advisor, on penny.hall@agresearch.co.nz .

To apply, or to view the full Position Description for this role, please go to our Careers Page http://www.agresearchcareers.co.nz/

Applications close: Wednesday 1 June 2022.

title: Team Leader, Information, Analysis and Reporting
description:
The South Australian Certificate of Education Board (SACE Board) of South Australia’s primary role is the provision of the South Australian Certificate of Education (SACE) to government, non-government and international schools.

Our purpose is to “shape education so that students thrive” which is achieved through working closely with our stakeholders to inspire, innovate and create the best outcomes for students and their communities so that SACE Graduates are capable to construct their own futures to contribute to a sustainable and socially just world.

The IMPACT you will drive at the SACE Board

The Team Leader, Information Analysis and Reporting has been created to lead and manage a team to deliver on the proactive reporting, implementation and evaluation of activities and projects for the SACE Board of South Australia (SACE Board). The role also seeks continuous improvement opportunities and keeps abreast of current trends to build upon the information, analysis and reporting capabilities.

What you will BRING

  • Proven ability to understand complex business problems and processes, and consequent data required to analyse and provide solutions.
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret and represent and communicate data analysis and trends to stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated analytical and critical thinking skills, including an ability to engage in research related educational discussion and debate.
  • Knowledge of tools and techniques in educational research including recent developments and validity, reliability and equity issues.
  • Demonstrated understanding of the functionality associated with the SACE Board’s IT systems.

Qualifications

Tertiary qualifications in Data Science or related discipline is desirable.

Special Conditions

  • Intrastate travel to regional and remote locations; international and interstate travel may be required.
  • Some out-of-hours work.
  • The incumbent works under the SACE Board of South Australia Act 1983 .
  • Appointment is subject to a satisfactory Working with Children Check from the Department of Human Services and in accordance with the SACE Board policy.

What we can OFFER you!

  • A supportive and dynamic team environment that values the work that you do.
  • Professional development in education, project management and engagement.
  • Salary Sacrifice Benefits.
  • Flexible work and wellbeing provisions.

Remuneration

ASO7 classification level. Salary range $103,387 to $111,759 per annum plus super.

APPLYING with Us

If you are passionate about young people and their education, we want to hear from you!

For further information including the role description and to apply, please https://iworkfor.sa.gov.au/page.php?pageID=160&windowUID=0&AdvertID=638869#brs_jbcontent

ENQUIRIES to,

Ines Sodano, Head of Business Operations, Ines.sodano@sa.gov.au or telephone 8115 4899

Applications close: 11:45pm on Sunday 22 May 2022

title: Data Governance Advisor
description:
What’s your ambition? Is it a big goal or small steps? Professional or personal? We’d like to know, because we make your ambitions our business.

JLL Technologies is a specialised group within JLL. We deliver unparalleled digital advisory, implementation, and services solutions to organizations globally. We provide best-in-class technologies to bring digital ambitions to life aligning technology, people, and processes. Our goal is to leverage technology to increase the value and liquidity of the world's buildings, while enhancing the productivity and the happiness of those that occupy them.

What this opportunity involves:

We’re looking for a Data Governance Advisor, who is a confident self-starter to join our successful JLL Technologies team, a leading provider of Technical Solutions.

You will be responsible for building a solid and long-term data governance program aimed at reducing organisational risks for our highly regarded major telecommunications client!

A snapshot of the role:

  • Collaborate with account team to understand main data process challenges, and create data governance roadmap based on priorities
  • Identify areas for improvement, make the recommendations and drive deployment of those
  • Provide knowledge management support for the account, particularly by establishing and documenting data flows and processes
  • Support the account’s data governance and management activities across service lines on an ongoing basis to ensure data consistency and integrity
  • Coordinate business requirements for data quality and be the contact point of implementation team for data quality program implementation

Sound like the job you are looking for? Before you apply it’s also worth knowing what we are looking for:

To be successful, you’ll demonstrate the ability to manage, manipulate and analyse raw data, draw conclusions and develop actionable recommendations using technology.

You will have a proven track record of results as we’ll expect you to act decisively, think big and manage your time to meet deadlines in a fast-paced, high volume environment.

What you can expect from us:
At JLL, we value your health and wellbeing which is why we are excited to announce a whole raft of new benefits through our WHEREFIT partnership! WHEREFIT provides you with access to exclusive corporate discounts of up to 40% off at leading fitness and wellbeing brands across Australia. With over 2,000 unique offers across gyms, activewear, studios, healthy meals, supplements, accessories, self-care and more, there is something for everyone so you can perform at your best!


You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things. Keep those ambitions in sight and imagine where JLL can take you...

JLL is committed to developing and maintaining a diverse workforce. As an organisation, we don’t just accept that we are a place of many different people, but we embrace it, we celebrate it, and we proactively support the needs that difference brings. JLL is committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, gender, age, sexual orientation or disability, and that is why, for more than a decade, we continue to rank among the World’s Most Ethical Companies. We are dedicated to offering veterans from all ranks and services a successful civilian career as they transition out of the military. We recognise and appreciate the skills acquired in their service careers as vital and transferable to our workforce.

Apply today, quoting job reference number JDREQ201303


Please note, although developing relationships with agencies forms a component of the JLL talent acquisition strategy, on this occasion agency submissions will not be accepted.

title: Text Analytics Team Lead Executive Level 2 (S&T Level 6)
description:
Text Analytics Team Lead

  • Inspire and mentor a small team of text analytics researchers and engineers
  • Contribute to innovation of scientific research in a Defence environment
  • Enjoy flexible working arrangements

This exciting role involves inspiring a small high-performing team of scientists and researchers that contribute to the development of science and technology in the domains of multilingual text and content analytics to high international standards. The ideal applicant will have experience and a passion for computational linguistics. You will represent DSTG on Australian and international groups within the text and content analytics domains. This role will contribute to a culture of innovation that drives our More Together: Defence Science and Technology Strategy.

As the Text Analytics Team Lead, you will:
Lead a research program to develop multilingual text analytics for processing, enriching and translating unstructured text content; as well as build linguistic resources, language models and advanced content analytics solutions.

  • Develop initiatives on priority science areas relating to multilingual text and content analytics for Defence and national security agencies.
  • Provide high-level technical and administrative advice in the field of multilingual text and content analytics.
  • Supervise and mentor staff to promote a healthy culture that values staff, innovation and excellence in science.
  • Manage allocated resources, set work area priorities, manage workflows, develop strategies and evaluate business outcomes.
  • Manage stakeholder relationships and play a key role in building relationships with Defence and national security agencies, and their international equivalents, as well as academia and industry.
  • Report research findings to Defence partners and the scientific community through high quality scientific reports, briefs, publications and presentations.

About our Team
Intelligence, Surveillance and Space Division (ISSD) undertakes internationally-recognised research and development into technologies aimed at enhancing national capability for Defence and national agency decision makers.

The role is within Identity Intelligence group, within Intelligence Analysis branch in ISSD.

Identity Intelligence works closely with Defence and other elements of Australia’s national power to deliver tools and technologies that better prepare Defence to respond to grey-zone activities. The group enhances Defence’s video, imagery, and multilingual text and speech capabilities to identify and characterise persons of interest and detect misinformation and disinformation within contested information environments. The group also aims to understand and defend the vulnerabilities inherent in deploying new identification technologies and the information they are applied to.


Our Ideal Candidate
We are looking for a motivated team player who is able to understand the broad strategic context and has sound stakeholder engagement skills.


To succeed in in this role, you must be able to demonstrate the following:

  • Specialised knowledge and research experience in multilingual text and content analytics to generate new knowledge and produce enhanced capabilities for clients and sponsors.
  • Ability to lead the development of Science & Technology (S&T) initiatives.
  • Ability to think strategically, problem solve and operate with considerable autonomy to achieve corporate impact.
  • Sound communication skills, both written and verbal, with an ability to foster effective stakeholder relationships.
  • Adaptability and resilience in a dynamically changing environment.
  • Working collaboratively across different teams, harnessing diverse views and encouraging an inclusive team culture.
  • Supervise, mentor and develop staff.
  • Commitment towards ongoing self-improvement and professional development.

Application closing date: Sunday the 29th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference DSTG/02005/22 on

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=9C7896E7-2B42-0DDB-D044-C88BE12833E2

title: EAM Business Support Analyst
description:
About Us

APA is a leading Australian energy infrastructure business. We own and/or manage and operate a diverse, $21 billion portfolio of gas, electricity, solar and wind assets. Consistent with our purpose to strengthen communities through responsible energy, we deliver approximately half of the nation’s gas usage and connect Victoria with South Australia and New South Wales with Queensland through our investments in electricity transmission assets. We are also one of the largest owners and operators of renewable power generation assets in Australia, with wind and solar projects across the country. Our operations span every mainland state and territory in the country and we employ more than 1900 people.

Our vision is to be world class in energy solutions.

The Role

We now have an opportunity available for a EAM Business Support Analyst to join our Networks Services team in Adelaide, SA or Thomastown, Vic or Eagle Farm, QLD on a 15 month fixed term contract.

Reporting to the EAM Business Support Manager you will play a key role in providing Enterprise Asset Management support across APA.

Key Responsibilities

  • Work alongside Group IT for Maximo enhancements and fixes.
  • Liaise with operational and finance business units across APA to gather and refine requirements
  • Support enhancements to business process and system including testing and communication to end users.
  • Answer queries and troubleshoot issues to resolve problems
  • Provide training as required
  • Process & procedures maintenance (including training material).

About You

  • Demonstrated understanding of Maximo.
  • A good understanding or background in Finance or Procure to Pay Processes.
  • Experience in the delivery of improved processes and workflows.
  • Ability to discuss requirements with stakeholders to produce high quality written documentation.
  • Ability to perform impact analysis on requested changes to requirements.
  • Ability to analyse, classify, document and control changes to the requirements baseline.
  • Highly self-motivated and willing to accept additional responsibilities.
  • Ability to work under pressure, be fluid with tasks and meet deadlines with attention to detail.

Sound like your kind of career? We’d love to hear from you.

APA is an equal opportunity employer. The safety and sustainability of our people, community and environment is our focus. We embrace diversity in our people to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we operate in.

When you join us on this journey to success, you will have access to targeted career development programs, competitive remuneration, employee benefits, work–life balance and wellbeing programs.

Role closes Sunday 22nd May. Role Reference number 2010.

Applicants must be eligible to work in Australia to be considered.

APA Group is not accepting submissions from recruitment agencies for this role.

title: Graduate Digital Support Analyst
description:
Data Action (DA) has over 30 years' experience as a specialist software and services provider to the alternate banking and financial services industry. Operating nationally and servicing a broad client base including customer owned banks, credit unions, neobanks and financial services membership organisations, DA's focus of supporting the financial wellbeing of Australians is echoed through our values:

  • No goldfish - Go beyond your bowl, share knowledge, stay curious and keep learning.
  • Fail forward - Learn from mistakes and keep moving forward.
  • Cheer loudly - Be proud of the team's results and celebrate successes.
  • Own it - Throw yourself in and own your work, taking responsibility until the end.
  • Think Client - Put yourself in our Client's shoes - consider the impact for their customers and deliver.

DA has evolved to become a provider of core banking and digital platforms and services to some of Australia's leading customer-owned, challenger banks, aggregators, and the financial services industry, aligned with our purpose - powering innovation in banking.

DA operates nationally with close to 300 staff based in Adelaide, Sydney, and Melbourne - enhancing the banking experience of more than 1.43 million Australians via its core banking and digital platforms, powering customer transactions across 3.2 million accounts every day.

About the Role:

Our Digital Support Analysts operate and support products provided to our clients - to analyse and problem solve issues presented through testing and/or production environments. This includes, but not limited to, improving operational support including monitoring and alerting of application anomalies by introducing new technologies, deployment processes, test automation and operational excellence practices.

The application of creative solutions to problems and provide timely and accurate communications with clients is a critical component of the role.

You Will be Responsible for:

  • Product upgrade and maintenance deployments
  • Supporting progressive and transparent change management processes
  • Level 1 and Level 2 product support
  • Developing an understanding of the customer's business in specific areas and their use of the system
  • Providing guidance to customers on "how to" and "why" type queries
  • Fault investigation and resolution including the raising of defects, creation and execution of scripts
  • UAT co-ordination including environment preparation, switching on and configuration of new functionality
  • Contributing to the development of new functionality by ensuring solutions are technically sound and always make sure the Application Support team has appropriate knowledge, procedures and documentation in place to support the product suite
  • Assisting in software build upgrades.

What You'll Need to Succeed:

  • Tertiary qualifications in information technology or an aligning field
  • Experience supporting commercial applications using .net or equivalent
  • Understanding of the change management methodologies
  • Understanding of web-based technologies and internet fundamentals is desirable
  • Experience working in a DeVops environment will be highly regarded, as well as experience/certifications in AWS or Azure.

Our Graduate are offered on a 2-year fixed term engagement, with 6-monthly salary increases up to 10% of base salary, based on work performance. Our desire is for you to transition to a permanent role at the end of the two year period. However, you are eligible to move to a permanent position before the end of the Graduate Program if you are doing great work!

DA offers exciting opportunities for professional development and we have a strong focus on career progression for our employees. Flexible and supportive working arrangements are encouraged.

If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you! Please be sure to combine a covering letter addressing the key criteria set out above as the first page of your resume.

To be considered for this role you will need to be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident, or have a current visa that permits you to work in Australia.

We will never ask you to pay for any services or training as part of applying for a position at DA.

title: Property Analyst & Project Assistant
description:
Would you like to make a difference?

Do you love tackling complex real-world problems?

Does the opportunity to shape how our cities and regions grow sound exciting?

Do you enjoy thinking outside of the box and working on diverse projects?

Are you searching for a role which will let your creative side flourish?

If you resonate with the above, we’d love to hear from you!

About Us

Our mission is to inspire and transform communities through unlocking large scale transformative real estate projects. We specialise in partnering transactions and advice. We are driven to make the impossible possible. And bring to life the unimagined.

Life with us is anything but boring.  From masterplanned communities to tourism marinas, to world-class entertainment precincts, sports and leisure destinations, new agri-tourism icons, carbon neutral apartment living, to shaping the retail and cultural identity of an entire CBD.  Our projects have impact. And that’s just the start…

If you share our core values of Creativity, Curiosity, Authenticity, Accountability and Community - we’d love you to join us on this journey.

So what’s the role?

We are seeking a driven and passionate individual to join our growing team as a Property Analyst & Project Assistant on a part-time or permanent basis.

Daily activities of the role

  • Undertake benchmarking of comparable projects - compile information on financial and non-financial performance, pricing, key success factors, size of market, customer profile, etc.
  • Collate market information including transaction evidence, market performance and demographic profiles.
  • Summarise findings from research and identify relevant takeaways with supporting visual aids and images. Ensuring report / presentations have a clear structure with key information of value to the client clearly outlined.
  • Provide input to the creation of compelling marketing collateral.
  • Review of and assistance with preparation of custom financial and development feasibility models
  • Help coordinate and attend meetings and workshops.
  • Assist in the preparation of submissions / fee proposals.
  • Input into client communication including providing project and transaction progress updates.
  • Provide project administration support including monitoring project progress and profitability using project management software.
  • Create content for company social media accounts.

The boutique size of our company provides exposure to a wide range of projects and the opportunity to develop a diverse skill set through the development delivery process.  This provides accelerated growth opportunities for those with demonstrated capacity, drive and initiative.

The successful candidate will have a strong desire to upskill, the ability to work independently to undertake requested research, develop options for discussion with managers, and have a high standard of oral and written / visual communication.

The Technical Stuff

Candidates with background qualifications (or currently studying) in any of the following disciplines will be highly regarded:

  • Project Management
  • Development Management
  • Architecture / Town Planning / Urban Design
  • Property

You can apply via Seek or by sending your CV and a cover letter to: jess.heimburger@alineagroup.com.au .

title: Change Analyst
description:
Who we are:

Since 1839, Elders has been an integral part of Australia's rural business landscape. With over 180 years of knowledge, experience and advice for its clients, Elders continues to focus on their commitment to the future of Australian agriculture.

The Opportunity:

Elders are ready to embark on a transformation program which will technically enhance the way they work and provide far more efficient outcomes to their customers and employees.

As the Change Analyst, you will be a key member of the System Modernisation team and assist the Change Team in the development and delivery of the overarching change strategy.

Key responsibilities :

  • Support the Engagement Manager & Change Lead to manage and coordinate change data, documents and reports in accordance with project requirements.

  • In conjunction with the Change Lead, develop and deliver effective change plans and change reporting to document and communicate change activities.

  • Support delivery of communication, engagement and training activities on the program.

  • Analyse As-Is vs To-Be processes and prepare change impact assessment.

  • Undertake current and future state gap analysis and assess changes and impacts to ensure that strategy and transition planning meet program objectives.

  • Support business readiness assessments and change engagement activities.

What we are looking for:

You will have proven experience in a business or change analyst role delivering outcomes for a multi project digital transformation program.

You will be a skilled communicator with a consultative approach and the ability to develop relationships among many stakeholders at all levels.

Demonstrated experience in conducting change analysis and change impact assessments will be the key to your success.

If you are ready to take the next step in your career, this is an exciting opportunity to be a key member of the change program at Elders, a company that promotes a positive and healthy work-life balance for employees. The role will be offered as a 24 month fixed term contract with potential to extend.

For further information please contact Brett Hughes at EGM Recruitment on 0422 970 313 .

title: Estimating Analyst
description:
Great opportunity to develop your career and gain experience with a leading global manufacturer

The Detmold Group is a leading manufacturer of specialised paper and board packaging products with 6 manufacturing locations and over 22 sales offices in 15 countries. We supply to a diverse range of customers including some of the world’s leading brands. We are a business that is proud of our Brand, our People, and our Products

Reporting to the Estimating Manager within the Group Innovation and Sustainability team, the position of Estimating Analyst is responsible for supporting the Estimating team and our sales professionals in the accurate and timely creation of product quotations for our valued customers.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Providing accurate and timely Estimating support and commercial advice to the business
  • Inputting a range of data into the quoting system whilst ensuring accuracy and completeness in preparation of price estimates for customers
  • Liaising with internal stakeholders and providing a high-level customer service for new business quote related questions and processes
  • Monitoring and providing feedback to sales teams and managers on data quality and input improvement
  • Proactive identification of improvement opportunities and drive various initiatives

As the incumbent becomes familiar with the role and our business, they must have the capability to build a sound understanding of our Estimating process and learn about our products and the capabilities of our factories in order to be able to effectively make decisions and manage the quoting workflow for the benefit of the Estimating team, our sales community and our customers.

The successful candidate will ideally possess the following:

  • Systems and process thinking, attention to detail and have solid numerical and analytical skills
  • Strong computer skills, Microsoft Excel and other MS Office products
  • The ability to deal with diversity as this role engages with people across our company, in our factories and sales teams, in all the countries in which we operate
  • Resilience and ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • The ability to show initiative and be proactive in problem solving and issue management

It is essential that you demonstrate excellent communication skills with the ability to engage across multiple stakeholders. Experience in a similar position in a manufacturing environment within estimating, planning, or administration will be highly regarded.

To learn more about our organisation and to apply for this position, please visit our website www.detmoldgroup.com

Confidential telephone enquiries are welcome to Lesley Mackman on 08 8448 5119 or via email: lesley.mackman@detmoldgroup.com

Employee safety is our priority, and we want our people to be 100% SAFE.

The Detmold Group has been tirelessly working to keep its employees, customers, and communities safe during the COVID-19 pandemic. This is in line with Detmold Group’s commitment to our people, customers and communities being “100% safe”. Therefore, Detmold requires all new employees to be fully vaccinated and require appropriate evidence to be provided of vaccination confirmation or of government approved exemption. Therefore, please consider this requirement when submitting your application .

title: Business Data and Systems Analyst
description:
Why Join Can:Do Group?
• Flexible working arrangements, including compressed working week, and work from home
• Competitive remuneration with access to generous NFP salary packaging (Up to $15,900 + entertainment card)
• Two days special paid Christmas leave
• Two days Wellbeing leave

About the Position:
We are looking for an experienced Business Data and Systems Analyst to support in the delivery of an end-to-end CRM system integration.
• Evaluating business processes for efficiency, cost, and other valuable metrics.
• Communicating insights with key stakeholders and preparing strategic recommendations for process adjustments, procedures, and performance improvements.
• Data analysis with designing and maintaining data systems and databases, data mining and cleansing in preparation for analysis and preparation of reports or dashboards.

Our ideal candidate has:
• Bachelor in Information Technology, or Business Administration or equivalent experience.
• Demonstrated experience in Business systems Analysis, with a focused on writing user stories for business transformation programs, in particular CRM Implementation Programs and other integrated systems.
• Experience working with SaaS/Cloud Based Business applications, tools and systems Integration.
• Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Productivity tools like Excel Macro, MS Word, Visio, PowerPoint, SharePoint and Power BI.

About us:
At Can:Do (Can:Do Hearing & Can:Do 4Kids) we strive together to build inclusive communities and give people the skills to live a life without limits.  Be it through speech or sign, touch or technology, we will support every person who is Deaf, blind, hard of hearing, has low vision or other sensory needs to be the best they can be.

With over 140 years of experience, we are the leading experts in specialist sensory services in South Australia.

Caring   |   Connected   |   Courageous   |   Conscientious

Salary for this role being commensurate with qualifications and experience. In addition to the base salary, you can access generous salary packaging options that may significantly increase your take-home pay.

People from diverse backgrounds and/or with lived experience of disability are encouraged to apply.

For enquiries relating to this role please email: abbey.carter@candogroup.com.au

For more information about us please visit www.candogroup.com.au

Applications close: 11 May 2022

title: Data Manager Deals & Contracts
description:
Data Manager Deals & Contracts

•             Symbion EBOS Data Manager Position

•             Full-Time Role

•             Dynamic Team Culture

•             Supply Chain - Master Data, Deals & Pricing Department

•             Close proximity to the City of Adelaide

EBOS Group is the largest and most diversified Australasian marketer, wholesaler and distributor of healthcare, medical and pharmaceutical products. It is also a leading Australasian animal care products marketer and distributor.

With more than 3,500 employees in 61 locations across Australia and New Zealand, EBOS Group is a major contributor to the healthcare of millions of people throughout the region and a leader in animal care.

Founded on a philosophy of growth and fresh thinking, EBOS Group strives for leadership in its business segments. By valuing its people and its partnerships, the Group is well positioned to expand further through a combination of acquisitions and organic development.

An exciting opportunity exists for an enthusiastic individual to join our Master Data, Deals & Pricing team based in Adelaide, South Australia. We are seeking someone with a focus on data integrity, deadlines, and a liking for problem-solving.

Key Responsibilities include:

  • Managing Master Data for Symbion
  • Maintain supplier relationships and deal with internal and external enquiries in a professional and courteous manner
  • Interpreting complex agreements and executing
  • Preparing and instructing pricing setup
  • Understanding of claims and cost recovery processes
  • Ability to investigate and resolve in-depth queries
  • Data compliance and privacy responsibilities
  • Maintaining and reviewing data for accuracy
  • Completing quality assurance checks
  • Assisting other team members and areas of the business
  • Ability to provide cross-training to staff
  • Leadership responsibilities
  • Regular Reporting utilising MS Office; Excel, Access Database, etc
  • Adhering to SOPs
  • Filing
  • Project work

The successful applicant will have skills and experience in:

  • Proven experience in data entry, Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook
  • Strong communication skills
  • Ability to work as part of a dynamic team
  • Excellent analytical and numerical skills with a commitment to accuracy and attention to detail
  • Liaise with management to drive process improvements

The successful candidate will be a highly motivated, confident, and dynamic leader. They will be process driven, have an analytical focus, possess well-developed problem-solving skills and high attention to detail. MS Excel and Access skills are important for this role, as is the ability to understand complex and sophisticated business systems and processes.

This represents an excellent opportunity for an aspiring individual who seeks to work for a leading organisation in a team-focused environment. It offers the chance to see the direct impact of your effort as you work closely with the National Supply Chain Team to deliver superior, customer-focused outcomes.

This is a unique opportunity to work in a company where you are valued, given the recognition you deserve and suitably rewarded for your hard work.

EBOS Group is committed to developing and creating an inclusive workplace that embraces and celebrates diversity and inclusion.  We recognise that a diverse workplace improves our ability to attract, retain, motivate and develop talent, create an engaged workforce, deliver quality services to our customers and to support the growth of EBOS Group.

EBOS is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from people of all ages, nationalities and cultures including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

Pre-employment checks may be required and will be discussed with the successful candidate.

If you believe that you have the necessary attributes to succeed in this challenging and rewarding role please click ‘Apply’ now.

title: AH-MAZING Marketing Data Analyst/Paid Media Buyer
description:
Want to be part of a brand that values health, wellness, and FUN?!

Are you an inspiring leader who’s passionate about digital marketing/analytics and dedicated to building a brand and community through effective content strategies and advertisements?

Do you want to inspire others to be their happiest and healthiest selves?

If we’ve got your attention and you’re screaming a big YES to all of the above, then have we got an opportunity for you!

At Happy Way, we’re on the hunt for an AH-MAZING Marketing Data Analyst/Paid Media Buyer to join our creative team at Happy Way HQ in Adelaide, SA. This is an in-house position, so you must be living in Australia’s most liveable city!

We’re looking for someone who not only aligns with our brand values, but radiates feel-good vibes, oozes positivity, and loves to work hard whilst having fun along the way—you’re the missing ingredient in our protein smoothie!

SO WHAT’S THIS DREAM ROLE YOU ASK?

Reporting to Happy Way’s senior management team, the focus of your role will be monitoring all things digital marketing and data analytics across our paid platforms and social media channels, as well as creating and implementing effective ad campaigns to increase engagement and build our community. You will work closely with our marketing stakeholders and CEOs, sharing insights and ideas, and effectively plan growth strategies for the brand. You will also collaborate with our creative team, leading and driving projects to achieve results.

Because of the diversity and depth of this role, we require an experienced marketing guru that can confidently identify opportunities, initiate and implement ideas and see them through to the final product! We want someone who is confident in their abilities and a passionate team player, who is focused on inspiring and nurturing relationships with our team, our community, and beyond!


WHAT WILL BE ON YOUR WEEKLY CHECKLIST

  • Work as a trusted advisor to the company CEOs, with the responsibility of creating an effective modern analytics system at Happy Way.
  • Lead data/insights across the marketing team.
  • Collaborate daily with our growth and marketing stakeholders to establish priorities and key growth paths for the brand.
  • Design and build dashboards in data studio/super metrics to determine clear o/results, creating a clean reporting space for all marketing metrics.
  • Suggest and perform analysis of landing pages, A/B tests, audiences, segments, ads, and creatives.
  • Constantly review and monitor all paid platforms to avoid any data integrity issues.
  • Launch and manage effective advertising campaigns across multiple paid channels as required, to increase our brand awareness, build upon our community, and nurture relationships with our existing customer base, essentially meeting our new customer and retention goals.
  • Forecast and understand desired customer acquisition costs, revenue benchmarks, and advanced data analytics (specifically, Lifetime Value data)—this is to provide actionable insights and develop new tests to run, with the goal of increasing the overall ROI of the funnel. (This includes studying other funnels, books, webinars, etc. for ideas).
  • Strategize and apply learnings across other paid acquisition channels (i.e., Facebook, Google, YouTube, TikTok).
  • Drive target audience segmentation, attribution modeling, lead generation analytics, paid and unpaid channels optimizations.
  • Assist with the development and maintenance of our business data warehouse.
  • Effectively translate business requirements to technical specialists (developers and engineers).

WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics, or an equivalent degree.
  • 1-3 years of experience planning, developing, executing, and optimizing paid advertising campaigns for direct-to-consumer products with $15k+ in monthly spend.
  • 1-3 years of experience creating and managing paid funnels while having an undeniable passion for lead generation marketing.
  • 1-3 years of experience using analytics to provide strategic recommendations and drive business growth.
  • Outstanding understanding of all marketing channels (content, email, social media, SEO, SEM, Display, Affiliate).
  • An exceptional communicator, with the ability to give and receive constructive feedback whilst ensuring there’s clarity on objectives and results.
  • Nurture and develop relationships with team members, senior management, and brand associates, being the go-to person for all things digital marketing and analytics.
  • Must have a unique combination of humility (willing to do the dirty work) and ambition and drive to work towards a collective goal.
  • Perfect understanding of all marketing metrics (CPA, CPL, CLV, CTR, CAC, ROI, ROAS).
  • Proficiency in SQL, Data Science, and Python.
  • A natural instinct to think outside the box and take risks—only after careful examination of the opportunity, potential costs, and determining that your chosen course of action is the most effective.
  • A desire to lead the team towards a common goal, delegating effectively with limited supervision.

WHAT YOU’LL GET FROM US!

  • A fun, engaging, and supportive team culture that’s passionate about growth and development.
  • Inspiring office space to work your magic in, just on the city fringe—our pups love it too!
  • Competitive salary.
  • Discounts on the best protein and health supplements out there!
  • Invites to team bonding days and events.
  • Did we mention regular office treats made by our Happy Way nutritionist?! YUM!

THE BIG PICTURE

At Happy Way, our mission is to connect, inspire and empower the world, creating a community that values health, well-being, happiness, and FUN!

We not only care about the well-being of each other but we also care deeply about the well-being of our planet—giving back to Mother Nature and prioritizing sustainability is something we’re focused on as a brand. We’re determined to have a positive social and environmental impact and understand that we have an opportunity to do more than just create nutritious, drool-worthy health food supplements—we’re here to build connection, encourage growth, and sprinkle our feel-good vibes everywhere, so it creates a ripple effect across the globe!


So, why not choose to live life the Happy Way?!

If this sounds like you and you want to be a part of our story, please apply now—we can’t wait to meet you!

(only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.)

title: Data Quality Leader - Data Management Unit
description:
Your new company
South Australia Police (SAPOL) provides a diverse range of services to the community.  These services are aimed at producing a safe and peaceful environment by the minimisation of crime and disorder.  It is a large complex organisation which, because of the nature of its operations, is constantly subject to public scrutiny and accountability.  It provides services to a range of different locations (over 100) spread across the State on a 24 hour a day basis. SAPOL’s vision is to provide a visible, responsive police service for all South Australians. All SAPOL employees are guided by Our Values of Service, Integrity, Courage, Leadership, Collaboration and Respect. SAPOL is an organisation with a proud history and an exciting vision for the future.

Your new role
The Data Quality Leader is accountable to the Manager, Data Management Unit for the development, implementation and coordination of approved programs and projects as required within SAPOL that promote and maintain the accuracy, reliability, integrity and consistency of data within SAPOL Information Systems.  This includes development and implementation of continuous improvement strategies and best practice standards that contribute towards the achievement of corporate goals and objectives. Within this role you will be responsible for the direct management and supervision of staff that includes Data Analysts. Your day-to-day duties will involve project management and looking for quality improvement across systems and processes. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are required as you will be engaging and collaborating with different areas across the business and representing the team at key meetings. Your technical knowledge of ICT systems will help you to succeed in this role, as well as a generalist data quality experience.

What you will need to succeed

  • Demonstrated experience leading, supervising and mentoring staff.
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively under limited supervision, to examine and analyse complex and diverse work practices.
  • Experience in the development and implementation of agency wide policies, procedures and standards.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for stakeholder engagement and change management functions.
  • Experience working in data quality – cleansing, reporting and monitoring activities, project management and the ability to provide innovative solutions to complex problems.

Special Conditions

  • Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory Criminal History Check and compliant Immunisation screening.
  • Incumbent may be assigned to other duties at this remuneration level or equivalent.
  • Some out of hours work and intra/interstate travel may be required.

Salary
ASO6 - $94,176 - $99,615 per annum.

Next steps
If you have the necessary experience as a Data Quality Leader then please apply via the link below with your CV, cover letter and response to the selection criteria or contact Sarah Ormandy at SAPOLapplications@hays.com.au .

Application Instructions:
Please click on ‘Apply’ which will direct you to iworkforSA and further information will be provided on how to apply.

Applications Close: 2/6/2022 at 5:00 PM

title: Application Support Analyst
description:
About Tic:Toc
Faster. Smarter. Simpler.

Tic:Toc is a world-leading fintech company based in Adelaide.

We use technology and Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) to reimagine financial services processes and create superior experiences for our customers. And we’re growing fast.

You will find an environment waiting for you that is creative, friendly and a lot of fun. We are passionate about what we do, and it shows.

Tic:Toc expects and supports you to challenge traditional thinking and take risks. We are straight-talking and our team is full of bold, brave and energised talent.

The position
As an Application Support Analyst at Tic:Toc, you’ll be working within the Reliability Squad to ensure our customers get the most out of our products and services.

You’ll be a customer advocate, taking their queries and problems and making sure they have a positive Tic:Toc experience (both internally and externally).

This newly created role will see you contribute to the setting up of the Application Support function as we expand our Service offering and work with the team to build systems and processes to deliver top notch support and services.

Working within a scale-up, you’ll know our products inside and out, knowing when they are purring under the hood and when to escalate to our Systems Engineer, Data Engineers, Software Engineers or Management for support. You’ll be a key element in making sure we deliver our promises.

Here’s a few other things you’ll do:
  • Perform 1st and 2nd line support on application support related tickets in our Service Desk System (We use JIRA + other tools).
  • Work with the other Service Desk members to triage and allocate tickets.
  • Develop systems and processes to enable world class customer service within tight SLAs.
  • Know our products inside and out, to know when things are right, and wrong.
  • Guiding our customers to get the most from our products (Both internal and external customers/stakeholders).
  • Assisting with onboarding and hyper care of new clients.
You will bring to us
  • Be passionate about providing great service
  • Have an innovative approach to solving technical problems and be passionate about continuous improvement
  • Have excellent written and verbal communications skills
What you’ll get in return
  • We offer an attractive remuneration package + generous employee share plans;
  • We offer flexible working hours and work from home arrangements to balance your work and lifestyle;
  • We offer opportunities to expand career development outside of your everyday including providing leadership training and opportunities;
  • We also offer 1:1 Training, Learning Programs and Mentoring to help you succeed;
  • We have a vibrant culture and workspace to help you do great work;
  • You’ll be part of a company that’s growing rapidly, building products customer’s love.
Whilst all of our job opportunities have specific criteria, if the above describes who you are but you don’t tick all of our boxes, we still encourage you to apply. If you have any questions, you can get in touch with Karam Singh our Talent Sourcer at ksingh@tictoc.com.au or 0401799479 .

title: Technical Business Analyst
description:

  • Provision of technical architecture and infrastructure assessment of the project solutions

Required:

title: Senior Business Analyst, Business Transformation
salary: Attractive salary of $104,576 per annum plus Super
description:
As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be the face of projects, representing the business and technical teams to help Ahpra re-imagine our ways of working and uplift our capabilities with exciting new technology and process enhancements. We would love to hear from candidates who want to come along for this journey.

  • Great team and collaborative environment
  • Multiple Locations (Adelaide, Sydney or Melbourne)
  • Flexible Working (Half office/Half Home arrangements)
  • Contract till end October 2023, possible extension

The Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (Ahpra) works in partnership with 15 National Boards to implement the national regulatory scheme for health professionals. The purpose of health practitioner regulation is to protect the public by ensuring that only health practitioners who have the skills, qualifications and knowledge to provide safe care are registered.

Ahpra is committed to providing a culturally safe work environment that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate and serve.

Reporting to the Business Analyst Lead, Business Transformation, the Senior Business Analyst, Business Transformation will be central to our success, producing functional and non-functional business requirement specifications, process maps, user stories, acceptance criteria, and designs across multiple initiatives and business areas to support the delivery of business outcomes.

In this role you will:

Be part of an exciting transformation program, focused on delivering improved future state experiences to staff and end-users.

  • Join a team focused on high performance, service and continuous improvement, and collaborate with business stakeholders to represent their needs aligned to the future state vision
  • Collate, document and analyse high-quality business requirements, user stories, and functional requirement specifications, and support through the build, test and implement phases that align with our future state
  • Provide advice and recommendations on business solutions to support the design and development of various system solutions to improve delivery and service levels.
  • Manage the alignment and traceability of stakeholder requirements across the program, project, and development lifecycle.

As the ideal candidate, you will demonstrate the following:

  • Demonstrated competencies across all BABoK v.3 knowledge areas
  • Advanced experience in business process modelling and associated standard operating procedures using industry standard tools and techniques
  • Demonstrated experience in advanced business analysis, preferably within Digital Transformation projects and programs, with a technical understanding of delivery platforms
  • Experience in delivery of BA best-practice approach by developing quality user stories, acceptance criteria, test plans and scripts
  • Very strong understanding of user-centred design principles
  • Degree in Business or equivalent and/or relevant experience.
  • Experience with Salesforce desired but not essential

Role Description: Senior Business Analyst Business Transformation (RD Final) (2).pdf

What we offer:

  • A friendly and supportive working culture with an active social club
  • Discounts on Medibank Private Health Insurance and selected gym memberships
  • Great work/life balance and flexible working from home arrangements available
  • Central location and sophisticated open plan workspaces in a 5-star rated building
  • Hybrid working from home available
  • Generous entitlements and Attractive salary of $104,576 per annum plus 10% Superannuation

To apply:

  • Click ‘Apply for this job’ to submit your application.
  • Your application must include a current resume and cover letter addressing the 'Qualifications & Experience" section of the Role Description (2 page maximum)
  • Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa. Work eligibility will be checked as part of the recruitment process
  • Applications must be submitted by 11.30pm on 30 May 2022
  • For any queries or a confidential discussion regarding this position, please email recruitment@ahpra.gov.au

Offer of employment is subject to successful background (pre-employment screening) and Criminal History checks.

We strongly encourage people of all abilities to apply, particularly people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage, and those who may experience diversity or disability related barriers in securing employment.  If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application.
