title: Business Analyst - Sydney/Auckland/Adelaide
description:
hummgroup (ASX-HUM) is one of Australasia’s most successful and enduring fintech organisations with a proud legacy of rewriting the playbook for digital spending. We help people buy everything, everywhere, every day. Our Philosophy is to deliver creative and tailored financial solutions to our customers around the globe. we enable and empower our people to build lifetime relationships of value and opportunity for the benefit of you, our colleagues, customers and shareholders.

Sitting in the hummgroup technology portfolio, The Business Analyst will play the critical role in providing the link between the product and technical delivery teams with a key focus on ensuring that the product is meeting and in some cases exceeding the market requirements.

You will be responsible for:

  • Working closely with the product team and the technical delivery team
  • Attending and contributing to all Agile Ceremonies as the subject matter expert in the topics being worked on and in the backlog
  • Be a thought leader in Business Analysis practices at humm group and contribute to the practice of Business Analysis
  • Utilize your superior stakeholder management skills and experience to facilitate relationships within the rest of the business and third-party vendors
  • Partner with senior internal and client stakeholders to achieve key outcomes
  • Lead and assist in conducting internal and client facing walkthroughs of business requirements to ensure they are accurately documented.
  • Supporting testing, training and implementation activities to ensure successful delivery of the solution
  • Outstanding ability to analyse, isolate and interpret business needs and develop appropriate technical solutions
  • Outstanding technical specification writing/documentation skills
  • An appreciation of both IT and business strategy
  • Strong customer service focus
  • Advanced knowledge of business process re-engineering
  • Strong visual, verbal, and written communication skills that enable you to lead and facilitate interactions with team members and to drive positive outcomes.
  • Experience in leading workshops and training sessions
  • Experience in agile transformation/transition

About you:

  • Previous experience in a Business Analyst role
  • Agile - experience (writing user stories, defining acceptance criteria)
  • Demonstrated experience around various types of Digital projects (Online, mobile or tablet)
  • Banking / Financial Services / payments experience nice to have
  • Proven track record of working with engineering/development teams
  • Building strong relationships with stakeholders
  • Self-motivated and can work autonomously or in a team environment
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

humm group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We adopt and encourage diversity through an open and inclusive culture that values and respects all our employees, customers and communities in which we live, work and are a part of.

title: Governance and Reporting Analyst
description:
Governance and Reporting Analyst

About the Company

The Department for Infrastructure and Transport delivers expert planning policy, efficient transport, and valuable social and economic infrastructure to the South Australian community that enhances the lifestyles of South Australians every day.

We are passionate about our purpose and are seeking candidates that share in our vision and our values of collaboration, honesty, excellence, enjoyment and respect .

About the role

We are seeking an experienced professional to both coordinate, and undertake a range of complex functions such as; investigations, preparation of recommendation reports, maintaining records and systems, while contributing to the development of programs, ongoing services, projects, and performance benchmarking.

Key outcomes required of the role

  • Provide governance of complex functions associated with programs and projects that are consistent with agency strategies, policies and priorities to deliver the Section’s objectives.
  • Develop and maintain reports, prepare presentations and funding submissions to state Cabinet and the Commonwealth
  • Liaising and negotiating with internal and external stakeholders to progress and provide input into programs and projects.
  • Maintain a pipeline of initiatives and forward works and develop submissions for funding.
  • Demonstrate ability to work under limited direction, with experience in coordinating and/or implementing a broad range of complex functions associated with assigned programs, projects, systems, policies and/or services
  • Process high volumes of quality, accurate, and detailed work, and synthesise information to provide recommendations in reports and correspondence.

About the Person

As a Governance and Reporting Analyst, you will have extensive experience within a similar role, and a strong desire to influence transport strategies that benefit the South Australian community. For success in this role, you will have exceptional written and verbal communications skills, presenting as analytical, solution-focused and strategic with great attention to detail. It is essential to maintain considerable organisation, adaptability, motivation, and a desire to contribute to the delivery of exceptional services for our South Australian community.

For a copy of the position description or for further information, please contact Claire Aldridge, Recruitment Associate at Harrison McMillan via claire.aldridge@harrisonmcmillan.com.au or contact the office on 08 7071 7273 .

title: Credit Assessor
description:
THE BASICS

We are seeking an ambitious and enthusiastic Credit Assessor to join one of Australia’s leading credit risk teams. This role represents an opportunity to support an incredibly exciting, fast-growing financial technology company (‘FinTech’), that offers substantial personal and professional development opportunities.


THE COMPANY

OurMoneyMarket and its brand ‘Handypay’ (together ‘OMM’) is one of Australia’s fastest growing FinTech companies, recently featuring in the AFR Fast Starter List and Deloitte Fast Tech 50 . Based on the Deloitte Fast Tech 50 list, OMM is the fastest growing FinTech in Australia and the fast-growing business in Adelaide.

Our mission is to ‘Make Money Simple’. We offer personal finance management tools and a range of consumer finance solutions (personal loans, interest-free payment plans, car loans, and more), so you can turn maybe someday, into today!


ABOUT THE ROLE

You will be responsible for preparing credit application files for decisioning by a credit manager. As a Credit Assessor, your role will entail:

  • Assessing credit risk and providing pricing and outcome recommendations for personal loan applications;
  • Accurately assessing a customer’s loan application and validating data in line with policy and regulations;
  • Following up customers daily for the information required to complete an assessment;
  • Being responsible for the quality of files to ensure correct and complete information is available to enable settlement to proceed.
  • Developing strong credit assessment and structuring skills by working with a diverse customer set;
  • Responding to enquiries and qualifying customers for finance by completing the application process with customers over the phone and via email.
  • Providing outstanding customer service to OMM’s customers and vendor partners. This includes assisting with group inbox management, resolving loan and account enquiries, appeals or complaints in a timely manner.


ABOUT YOU

  • Good quantitative and analytical skills
  • Great interpersonal skills and ability to build rapport
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills


WHAT WE OFFER

We will offer you:

  • A competitive salary to reward the very best
  • An environment where you will be able to personally and professionally take yourself to a new level
  • Opportunities to be part of our leadership development programmes, where you can gain experience in Treasury, Finance, Marketing, Sales, Software Engineering, Product Management and more!
  • A collaborative, respectful, team culture, where you will work closely with executive management
  • Discounts on consumer finance products
  • A place where you can make a huge impact, and everyone will love you for it!


HOW TO APPLY

Simple follow the links to apply!

title: Geology Manager
description:
Geology Manager

About Alligator Energy

Alligator Energy Ltd (AGE or Alligator) is experiencing rapid growth as we develop our Samphire Uranium Project in South Australia, advance our three other exploration projects in uranium, nickel, cobalt, plus evaluate future resource, project and M&A opportunities. We are seeking an experienced Geology Manager to join our team working on the Samphire Uranium Project to advance its resource, geological and geoscience development in addition to AGE’s other exploration projects.

About the Role

Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, your role as Geology Manager will be instrumental in leading the relevant technical aspects of the Samphire project to transition from its current inferred resource through to indicated status and feasibility studies as a pre-curser to decision to mine. You will also apply your expertise into Alligator’s other exploration projects. This is a leadership role with a strong technical and management component. In this role you will:

  • Develop an understanding of the regional and project geology, hydrogeology, geophysics, and historical drilling to expand the existing resource in AGE’s Samphire tenement holdings.
  • Seek to understand the value drivers for the Samphire Project; assess and communicate technical risk, including the geological uncertainties and potential impacts for ISR operations.
  • Management and oversight of all Samphire drilling programs, including planning, performance, cost control, administration, logistics and reporting.
  • Implementation of WHS policies and procedures to ensure field operations exceed statutory requirements in addition to measurement and communication of WHS performance indicators.
  • Mentor, supervise & professionally develop your team as it expands.
  • Responsible for ensuring compliance with all regulatory requirements, ensuring work program approvals and reporting support program execution timelines.
  • Implement value-add software/platforms for continuous improvement of geological data management and analysis.
  • Ensure respectful relationships and an open communication are maintained with all landowners, indigenous groups, and community in the region.
  • Evaluation of additional exploration and resource project opportunities.
  • Reporting to the CEO / Board as required.

We are seeking candidates with the following:

  • Degree qualified (or higher) in Geology/Geoscience.
  • Highly proficient in QA/QC, geological data analysis and attention to detail.
  • Prior experience in exploration and/or delineation of sedimentary-hosted uranium deposits including roll-front mapping.
  • Demonstrated experience in Australian Resource and Reserve reporting standards (JORC) of exploration results and mineral resource estimates for uranium.
  • Familiarity in unconformity-type uranium geological models (prior experience in exploring in these terrains would be highly regarded).
  • Demonstrated proficiency in downhole-well log interpretation software and well-log interpretation.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in 3D geological modelling and GIS software (Vulcan, Leapfrog, Micromine, QGIS, MapInfo or others).
  • Prior experience in supervision and managing drilling programs, contractors, and related stakeholders (landholders, indigenous groups, regulators etc.)
  • Prior experience in exploration field crew management
  • Experience in statutory tenement reporting to SA Government regulators and obtaining approvals for field work programs.
  • Demonstrated experience in tenement management.
  • Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills including both written and verbal.

You can find out more about Alligator Energy here: https://alligatorenergy.com.au. Applications will close Friday 27 May 2022.

title: Credit Analyst
description:
About us

Rabobank is the world’s leading specialist in food and agribusiness banking. One of our key strengths lies in our people who have a deep understanding of agriculture and are committed to adding long-term value for clients. Our commitment to our employees and clients is at the heart of everything we do.

Country Banking forms the core business of Rabobank Australia and has 61 branches across Australia. Country Banking enjoys a reputation as the leading provider of specialised banking services in the Food and Agribusiness sector. Country Banking Australia within Rabobank Australia and New Zealand Group (RANZG) is an important contributor to Rabobank globally.

About the role

Credit Analysts are responsible for providing valuable support to Account Managers to ensure commercial and prudential requirements are met for their portfolio of agribusiness customers. This includes financial analysis and credit writing for moderately complex agribusiness submissions working with stakeholders to meet client expectations.

Your primary responsibilities will include:

  • Collaborating with Rural Managers to deliver client outcomes
  • Analysing and interpret financial statements, identifying industry trends
  • Engaging in preparation of loan applications
  • Evaluating credit risks and make recommendations regarding client’s business proposals
  • Developing and fostering strong working relationships with all key stakeholders

Skills and experience

  • Interested in food and agribusiness with previous experience in a similar role
  • Client focused with a positive attitude
  • Works effectively through team collaboration
  • Articulate with strong verbal and written skills
  • Analytical with sound agribusiness financial literacy

Our Values, Vision and Mission

Rabobank Australia fully embraces inclusion and belonging and delivers positive experiences for our people and clients. Our great working conditions, broad learning and development programmes and the opportunity to work together for the greater good are reasons why our employees love working here. We are committed to our values; we are client focussed, action oriented, purposeful and courageous in our work.  We are professional and considerate and bring out the best in each other and are committed to keep learning.   We have an open culture, where you can be yourself and be valued for who you are.

What we're proud to offer you:

  • Rabo@Anywhere is the hybrid way of working at Rabobank. It aims to provide an approach to work that empowers our employees to benefit from working remotely, or from a Rabobank office/branch when it makes sense to do so.
  • Rabobank values the development of its people and has a great Education Assistance Program to assist with professional development.
  • An inclusive Parental Leave policy that supports you and your family while giving you the freedom and flexibility to enjoy this special time (Primary carer up-to 14 weeks paid leave)
  • We realise sometimes 4 weeks Annual Leave isn't enough! At Rabobank we provide an incentive for eligible employees to receive 1 extra week Annual Leave. With an option to also purchase another 2 weeks Annual Leave.
  • Rabobank recognises that employees need to protect their financial wellbeing, in the event of serious illness, injury, or even death. Rabobank provides eligible permanent employees with employer-funded Death, Temporary & Permanent Disability (TPD) and Income Protection Insurance.
  • As part of Rabobank's global Corporate Social Responsibility, Workplace Giving aims to encourage employees to contribute to our community. Rabo Workplace Giving program matches employee donations to selected Social Partners.

Rabobank is committed to diversity and inclusion and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to ethnicity, sex/sex characteristics, gender (inclusive of all genders), gender expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability, age or other diversity characteristics not mentioned.

Rabobank is not accepting submissions from recruitment agencies for this role.

Only Australian citizens or permanent residents will be considered.

title: Portfolio Reporting Assurance Analyst
description:
Portfolio Reporting Assurance Analyst

About the Company

The Department for Infrastructure and Transport delivers expert planning policy, efficient transport, and valuable social and economic infrastructure to the South Australian community that enhances the lifestyles of South Australians every day.

We are passionate about our purpose and are seeking candidates that share in our vision and our values of collaboration, honesty, excellence, enjoyment and respect.

About the role

The Portfolio Reporting Assurance Analyst is accountable for ensuring that information provided to our executives, DIT committees, Infrastructure Cabinet committees, and Ministers office is complete, up-to-date and reflects the DIT position on a range of matters. The successful candidate will be responsible for coordinating and undertaking a range of complex functions associated with, assigned discrete programs, projects, systems and/or services that are consistent with agency strategies, policies and priorities, which deliver business objectives.

Key outcomes required of the role

  • Undertaking investigations, preparing reports with recommendations, maintaining records and systems and contributing to the development of programs, services and projects and performance benchmarking.
  • Liaising and negotiating with internal and external stakeholders and service providers to address concerns associated with, and to progress and provide input into, assigned programs, projects, systems and/or services.
  • Undertaking a broad range of research and analysis to provide advice, information and correspondence that supports the delivery of assigned agency programs, projects, systems, policies and/or services.
  • Supporting and/or contributing to the development and implementation of relevant and effective policies, strategies, standards, guidelines and procedures to meet program or Section goals and objectives.
  • Contributing to a high standard of customer service for internal and external clients and quality management and risk.

About the Person

To be considered for this role you will need to have a high level of both written and verbal communications skills, extensive Analytical skills, and Power BI system knowledge is highly desirable. You will have well-developed communication and stakeholder management skills, effectively liaising at a multi-disciplinary level, resolve conflict, facilitate successful and positive negotiations, formulating solutions to problems.

A successful candidate will work under limited direction to manage customer enquiries by utilising a sound knowledge of related government programs, policies and/or legislation that impact on the functions of the role and the Agency.

To apply for this role please submit a CV in Word format

For a confidential discussion regarding the role please, or a copy of the Position Description, please contact:

Claire Aldridge
Recruitment Partner
Harrison McMillan
claire.aldridge@harrisonmcmillan.com.au
08 7071 7273 .

title: Senior Business Analyst X 2
description:
• All Systems GO! Drive the next generation of defence capability delivery
  • As a Senior Business Analyst contribute to programs of national significance
  • Enjoy flexibility , engaging work and a culture that embraces diversity and open-mindedness

At BAE Systemswe are all systems go as we continue to drive innovation and seek passionate and talented people to join our business. We currently have two exciting opportunitities for Senior Business Analysts within Maritime Australia based at the Osborne Naval Shipyard.

What this opportunity will mean for you:

  • Purposeful work where your efforts are recognized in an environment where you can thrive
  • Joining an organisation that is passionate about developing some of the most impressive careers in the world
  • Industry-leading flexibility options to unlock the talent and diversity of every individual
  • Unique opportunities to contribute to programs of national significance whilst growing your skills
  • A strong safety culture, inclusive teams and work to be proud of, underpinned by a compelling set of values
  • Maritime Australia  now operates on a 9 day fortnight which is a great opportunity to support flexible working

Your new role:

As the Senior Business Analyst reporting into the Business Analysis Lead you will be responsible for the delivery of a range of business analysis services to enable the mobilisation and digital transformation of our Maritime IM&T environment. This could include ad-hoc analysis, problem/opportunity assessment, enhancement of deployed systems through to performing the business analysis role for the full project lifecycle from identification to implementation of new capability into the business.

More specifically you will:

  • Engage with business and IM&T teams to capture business problems and opportunities, and analyse current processes to identify areas for improvement.
  • Develop business analysis work plans including stakeholder identification, engagement/workshop planning, technique selection and outcome definition.
  • Be responsible for the requirements management process through eliciting, prioritising and influencing business or customer requirements including management for traceability, change and reuse.
  • Analyse captured requirements and manage the process to determine and justify valid innovative solutions that are feasible, cost effective, meet business goals and objectives, and deliver value.
  • Undertake activities associated with the development, testing, delivery and transition of a solution for business acceptance.
  • Manage stakeholders through effective expectation and prioritisation management, and mapping of requirements to stakeholder needs.
  • Build positive working relationships to ensure alignment on approach and solution delivery against the roadmaps and digital direction of the program.
  • Provide guidance and advice on current technology initiatives and business analysis techniques.
  • Proactively seek ways to improve the way the team delivers services and capability to the business or customer.

About you

As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you'll have:

  • Significant experience in business analysis spanning across multiple business capability domains and/or complex integrated system environments
  • A strong business analysis skillset to underpin your adaptability and flexibility to work across a range of different analysis tasks and problem domains
  • Experience working in cross functional delivery teams (project managers, business analysts, architects, technical leads, subject matter experts, change managers)
  • Broad stakeholder communication skills, strong customer focus able to utilise negotiation skills and manage potential conflicts
  • Ability to interpret and clarify ambiguous requirements
  • Demonstrated critical thinking and problem solving in the area of breaking down complex problems, determining innovative solutions, and validating solutions against customer needs
  • Demonstrated proficiency in business process mapping
  • Experience working in a relevant industry is helpful, but not required

Whilst not essential, qualifications in business or information technology and certification from the International Institute of Business Analysis and ITIL will be an advantage.

Clearances

As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance.

International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.

Further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html

Our culture

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment where our people can thrive. For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of our employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation.

title: Team Leader, Information, Analysis and Reporting
description:
The South Australian Certificate of Education Board (SACE Board) of South Australia’s primary role is the provision of the South Australian Certificate of Education (SACE) to government, non-government and international schools.

Our purpose is to “shape education so that students thrive” which is achieved through working closely with our stakeholders to inspire, innovate and create the best outcomes for students and their communities so that SACE Graduates are capable to construct their own futures to contribute to a sustainable and socially just world.

The IMPACT you will drive at the SACE Board

The Team Leader, Information Analysis and Reporting has been created to lead and manage a team to deliver on the proactive reporting, implementation and evaluation of activities and projects for the SACE Board of South Australia (SACE Board). The role also seeks continuous improvement opportunities and keeps abreast of current trends to build upon the information, analysis and reporting capabilities.

What you will BRING

  • Proven ability to understand complex business problems and processes, and consequent data required to analyse and provide solutions.
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret and represent and communicate data analysis and trends to stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated analytical and critical thinking skills, including an ability to engage in research related educational discussion and debate.
  • Knowledge of tools and techniques in educational research including recent developments and validity, reliability and equity issues.
  • Demonstrated understanding of the functionality associated with the SACE Board’s IT systems.

Qualifications

Tertiary qualifications in Data Science or related discipline is desirable.

Special Conditions

  • Intrastate travel to regional and remote locations; international and interstate travel may be required.
  • Some out-of-hours work.
  • The incumbent works under the SACE Board of South Australia Act 1983 .
  • Appointment is subject to a satisfactory Working with Children Check from the Department of Human Services and in accordance with the SACE Board policy.

What we can OFFER you!

  • A supportive and dynamic team environment that values the work that you do.
  • Professional development in education, project management and engagement.
  • Salary Sacrifice Benefits.
  • Flexible work and wellbeing provisions.

Remuneration

ASO7 classification level. Salary range $103,387 to $111,759 per annum plus super.

APPLYING with Us

If you are passionate about young people and their education, we want to hear from you!

For further information including the role description and to apply, please https://iworkfor.sa.gov.au/page.php?pageID=160&windowUID=0&AdvertID=638869#brs_jbcontent

ENQUIRIES to,

Ines Sodano, Head of Business Operations, Ines.sodano@sa.gov.au or telephone 8115 4899

Applications close: 11:45pm on Sunday 22 May 2022

title: Data Quality and Governance Analyst
description:
Be a part of the team working to make South Australia's public education world-class by 2028. The Department for Education is committed to developing an education system where all children and young people reach their potential, enabled by world-class digital technology and systems.

The department's intent is to deliver high performing, world class information and communication services. The edAnalytics Hub Program is a key project being delivered to consolidate and replace disparate and end of life data and reporting systems across HR, Finance and Student areas, with a modern enterprise data and analytics solution.

To support this vision, the Department for Education is now seeking a Data Quality & Governance Analyst to join the edAnalytics Hub Program to deliver excellence in reviewing and developing data governance processes and procedures for the design, implementation and evaluation of data. The Data Quality and Governance Analyst works collaboratively and with flexibility across divisional teams based on peak workloads and priorities and contributes to achieving the department's operational and strategic data requirements.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate the development, implementation and review of data quality and governance
  • Identify, evaluate, and improve data governance processes and procedures across existing and new enterprise systems
  • Act as a subject matter expert for data quality and governance activities
  • Provide consultancy services to divisional management and staff in relation to emerging issues and trends regarding Data Quality and Governance
  • Provide advice and reporting on the management and operation of functions related to the department's Data Governance framework, including support to relevant committees and bodies required to oversee and implement this framework

Key Requirements:

  • Significant experience in developing and implementing enterprise Data Quality and Governance frameworks in large organisations
  • Proven experience implementing, evaluating, and contributing to the development of strategic and operational policies
  • High level of interpersonal and written communication
  • Ability to work autonomously under broad direction, both independently and as apart of a team
  • Relevant qualification in project management or business analysis
  • This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is passionate about making a real difference in the lives of South Australian children and young people.

This role is vital to the continued success in contributing to an organisation that is dedicated to quality and integrity, and on a steadfast trajectory toward world-class education.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply please click apply or call Dione Chrisakis on +61 8 82163512 for a confidential discussion.

title: Analyst Programmer
description:
The South Australian Certificate of Education Board (SACE Board) of South Australia’s primary role is the provision of the South Australian Certificate of Education (SACE) to government, non-government and international schools.

Our purpose is to “shape education so that students thrive” which is achieved through working closely with our stakeholders to inspire, innovate and create the best outcomes for students and their communities so that SACE Graduates are capable to construct their own futures to contribute to a sustainable and socially just world.

The IMPACT you will drive at the SACE Board
The Analyst Programmer is accountable to the Applications Development Team Leader for contributing to the availability of relevant and effective information systems for the SACE Board of South Australia by developing, implementing and maintaining SACE applications. The Analyst Programmer will also provide leadership support to the Applications Development Team Leader.

What you will BRING

Essential Knowledge / Skills / Experience

  • Ability to communicate and negotiate effectively verbally and in writing with both technical and non-technical staff, including the presentation of comprehensive information and concepts to individuals and groups.
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively and collaboratively within and across teams in order to achieve agreed outcomes.
  • Proven ability to determine priorities, meet tight deadlines and produce high standard work under pressure.
  • Experience in development of web applications using Java/JEE and Java frameworks (such as Spring, Spring MVC and Hibernate) and experience with JavaScript, JSP, AJAX, CSS, XHTML and relational databases such as MS SQL.
  • Experience in all aspects of the software development lifecycle and proven ability to manage the initiation, development and implementation of application specific improvements and produce supporting technical documentation.
  • Proven ability to manage and control the release of software throughout the development lifecycle and into business operation.

Qualifications
An appropriate tertiary qualification in Information Technology or related discipline is desirable.

Special Conditions

  • Intrastate travel to regional and remote locations; international and interstate travel may be required.
  • A current driver’s licence is required.
  • Some out-of-hours work.
  • The incumbent works under the SACE Board of South Australia Act 1983 .
  • An intense time of activity within the SACE Board of South Australia occurs between October and December.  For some roles, the incumbent would not normally be able to take planned leave during this period.

Appointment is subject to a satisfactory working with children check obtained through the Department of Human Services to be renewed every 5 years before expiry.

What we can OFFER you!

  • A supportive and dynamic team environment that values the work that you do.

ASO5 classification level.  Salary range $82,042 - $91,245 per annum.

title: Completions Management Systems Analyst
description:
• All Systems GO! Be part of the next generation of defence technology
  • Unique opportunity to be involved in the Digital Transformation of a large Engineering project
  • Enjoy flexibility , engaging work and a culture that embraces diversity and open-mindedness

At BAE Systemswe are all systems go as we continue to drive innovation and seek passionate and talented people to join our business. We currently have a new opportunity as a Completions Management Systems Analyst within our Maritime Australia based in either Adelaide, South Australia or Melbourne, Victoria.

What this opportunity will mean for you:

  • Purposeful work where your efforts are recognized in an environment where you can thrive
  • Joining an organisation that is passionate about developing some of the most impressive careers in the world
  • Being involved in a digital transformation project
  • Unique opportunities to contribute to programs of national significance whilst growing your skills
  • A strong safety culture, inclusive teams and work to be proud of, underpinned by a compelling set of values

Your new role:

As Completions Management Systems Analyst you will be responsible for delivery of a new completions management approach within Maritime Business, as part of a Digital Shipyard project. You will also be the in-house subject matter expert on Completions Management

More specifically you will:

  • Scope business requirements for managing completion activities; facilitate workshops with internal stakeholders and partners to develop effective process and software solutions.
  • Deploy end user mobile computing into the shipyard, as part of Digital Work Management.
  • Work with Big Data integrations between shipyard systems.
  • Work with the supplier to align configuration and development of the toolset to meet business requirements.
  • Work with IM&T Project Teams and software OEM to plan, monitor and control delivery against implementation plan.
  • Lead in development and testing of new capabilities within the system - identifying and managing observations and defects to completion.
  • Develop a suite of user level/work package level metrics and management reports to enable effective use of completions data.
  • Manage the configuration of completions information.
  • Lead a Completions Management working group to actively manage the development of the system.
  • Develop and roll out an end user training for all levels of user and training materials.

About you

As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you'll have:

  • Ideally previous experience of configuring and managing Completions Management toolsets, from companies such as Orbit, Wood Group, Hexagon, Mods or Lucy.
  • But essentially knowledge of quality, testing, commissioning and acceptance requirements within large Engineering Projects.
  • Previous experience working with suppliers to define and deliver requirements.
  • Previous experience developing business processes.
  • Knowledge of completions approach and the ability to make decisions around the setup and upkeep of a Completions Management system
  • Good people management, communication and report writing skills in order to effectively work with business stakeholders.
  • Ability to document future business requirements, proactively make improvements to the systems/processes involved then lead the team towards those targets.
  • Ability to develop system users and self through identifying relevant training and personal development opportunities.

Clearances

As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance.

International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.
