title: Senior Data Engineer
company: Mott MacDonald Australia and New Zealand
description:
Mott MacDonald Australia is a dynamic and innovative engineering, management and development consultancy working with high profile clients across Australia and globally. We are wholly independent, employee owned company with strong local leadership and autonomy.

Our successes over the past years has seen us take significant roles on a range of Australian landmark and country shaping projects. We are looking for a highly motivated individual to become a Data Engineer within our new Technical Solutions Team. You will be working from our Adelaide office in the Adelaide CBD, and will be supporting the global business.

The Technical Solutions Team is focused on helping our clients in 'Realising the true value of information', to deliver better outcomes across the planning, delivery, and operation of their asset base. We facilitate this vison through our digital twin platform Moata.

Working as a Data Engineer for our Technical Solutions Team, you will be working cross-functionally with business domain experts, analytics, and engineering teams to deliver leading-edge solutions to our infrastructure clients. By working together, you will help solve complex problems and develop innovative solutions in the field of physical and digital infrastructure.

Your role will be to support our data team in Australia and across the Globe. This will involve helping with the delivery of client projects but also establishing better visualisation, tooling and quality assurance systems for continual improvement. This is a great role for people passionate about working with data and data systems, and who love solving problems. In short, we are looking for someone who takes pride in the craft and wants to be part of a team of talented software developers, data scientists and data engineers working to further the growth of our business.

Responsibilities

  • Partner with Data Engineers, Data architects, domain experts, data analysts and other teams to build foundational data sets and visualisations that are trusted, well understood, aligned with business strategy, and enable self-service.
  • Support and maintain analytics tech ecosystem (ETL and BI tools)
  • Assist with the configuration of real-time datasets in Moata (using Python, Azure and SQL)
  • Document data pipelines and data lineage.
  • Continuously identify areas of improvement and ensure application of standards and best practices

As a Data Engineer you will have a chance to work with, and learn from the other members of our team, including software developers and data scientist.

The key skills required for the role are:

  • Educated to Bachelors level in the fields of Science or Mathematics.
  • Experience in data engineering/data science
  • Experience in PowerBI.
  • Experience in SQL (PostgreSQL preferred).
  • Software development experience in Python.
  • Experience in cloud solutions including serverless.
  • Experience with time series/Azure/geospatial and data analysis beneficial.
  • Experience in Agile.

In turn, you'll be working on a range of significant projects that shape the communities in which we live. You will build connections with our international expertise and bring this knowledge to our clients and to their projects.

There's no time like the present to make a change.

title: Technology PMO and Reporting Specialist
description:
Technology PMO and Reporting Specialist

  • Opportunity for an experienced project management and reporting specialist
  • Work with leading industry technology
  • Join a wholly owned South Australian organisation that offers WFH flexibilities

About the Company

SA Water is proud to deliver an important and essential service to 1.7 million customers every day. For more than 160 years, we have been working together with South Australians to ensure a reliable supply of safe, clean water and a dependable sewage system.

About the role

As the Technology PMO and Reporting Specialist you will be responsible for leading the Technology PMO, providing visibility for all information technology teams with reporting and analysis, and delivering actionable insight from internal systems and data sources.

Along with this you will also be responsible for the following:

  • Collaborate with IT teams to establish, document, and define business/project metrics and KPIs
  • Design, build and maintain recurring reports and dashboards to track and measure project progress
  • Identify areas of improvement for current project management processes, methods and tools
  • Contribute to the development and oversee the implementation and administration of IT PMO policies, procedures and systems
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with key internal and external stakeholders

About the Person

The ideal candidate for this position will have a strong background in project management, have proven leadership skills and be analytical in their thinking. You will show high attention to detail and have excellent communication, time management and organisational skills. The ideal candidate will also have excellent negotiation skills and show the ability to be adaptable, responsive and collaborative in a fast-paced environment.

Key requirements of the role include:

  • Experience working in a project management environment and an understanding of project management methodologies
  • Analytical, conceptual thinking and problem solving skills within a technology environment
  • Experience in corporate reporting and analysis of performance metrics
  • Ability to positively influence stakeholders at all levels
  • PowerBI, SharePoint and Project Online skills and experience highly advantageous

If you have a passion to work within a diverse, customer-centred business, filled with passionate and self-motivated people, where fresh thinking is valued and innovation is embraced, we want to hear from you. If you relish working in an evolving environment, have a desire to work collaboratively amongst a wealth of talent, partake in rewarding work with a purpose in an exciting industry, SA Water as an organisation is a great place to be.

SA Water believe great outcomes for their customers are best delivered by a diverse and inclusive team that reflects our community. That's why SA Water encourage people seeking flexible working arrangements and from all backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, to apply and join the SA Water team.

For a copy of the position description or for further information, please contact Hannah Villani, Recruitment Partner at Harrison McMillan via Hannah.villani@harrisonmcmillan.com.au or contact the office on 08 7071 7273 .

title: Analyst, Fraud Operations
description:
A career that gives you more

Your career at NAB is about more than money, it's about serving our customers well and helping our communities prosper. We currently have Analyst opportunities to join the following teams in Fraud Operations:

  • Fraud Assist Services
  • Digital Fraud & Scams
  • Card Fraud & Merchant Fraud
  • Identity Fraud Services
  • Customer Investigations

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Conduct in depth fraud investigations;
  • Facilitate the provision of an efficient and high-quality service to internal and external customers;
  • Work with service portfolio leads to provide recommendations to uplift standards, policies, strategies, and best practices as identified through investigations;
  • Maintain awareness and comply with all aspects of policy, procedure and statutory requirement, in order to maximise efficiency and minimise risk to the Group and its employees;
  • Provide on the job training and coaching for team members or less experienced colleagues; and
  • Be responsible for preparing reporting and insights on all relevant quality control reviews and checks.

What you will bring

The successful candidate must be able to work autonomously with the ability to think outside the box. Good attention to detail is essential in this role.

  • Must have proven and successful service delivery experience in a similar environment or anti-crime industry;
  • Strong resilience;
  • You will have a naturally inquisitive and analytical mind, and strong ability to problem solve;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; and
  • Experience in a customer service or contact centre environment will be highly regarded.

By joining NAB in a pivotal Banking role, you are committing to putting our customers’ needs first every time. You will be ambitious for growth; always curious and learning from colleagues. You will speak honestly, always valuing the time and opinion of others. You will own your work, doing what’s right, even when it’s hard.

NAB, invested in you

We are committed to gender equality and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and have a diverse and inclusive workforce. We have committed $70bn in financing to help address climate change and provide 2 days of paid leave each year through our employee volunteering program to support community organisations.

We support our colleagues to be their best by offering a wide range of educational, financial, lifestyle, health & well-being benefits. For more information please visit here.

FCO offers its colleagues with membership to the Association of Certified Anti-Money laundering Specialists (ACAMS). This is a unique value proposition for our colleagues, allowing them to consume globally recognised financial crime compliance training in a digital, modular, on-the-go format.

To avoid disappointment, you are encouraged to have a minimum of 18 months tenure in your current role and you should have your people leader’s endorsement to apply and participate in the selection process.  Further information is available HERE .

If you think this role is the right fit for you, we invite you to apply. Let’s explore who you are and what drives you.

Please note candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the job advert.

To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status.

title: ICT Business Analyst APS Level 5
description:
The Role

The Business Transformation Section is seeking to fill an APS 5 Business Analyst position with self-motivated, collaborative team member that will join our dynamic and strategic work area. This is an exciting opportunity for anyone seeking to work in an agile, fast paced and challenging environment. This role will provide support to achieve our section goal - Deliver a contemporary vetting capability to protect Australia's national security interest through the provision of a trusted and assured workforce, for the whole of government and industry partners.

As a Business Analyst in our Business Transformation section, you will research, analyse and provide specialist technical support on business processes and systems for the current and future Vetting Systems. You will communicate business analysis findings to senior staff and business partners on complex issues, innovations and improvements. You will be a key member of our system testing team, through a business lens you will be reviewing systems tests, coordinating user testing and conducting business verification testing. Working in a collaborative team environment, you will share your expertise with others to support team priorities and deliverables in alignment with project goals.

This role presents a unique and exciting opportunity, being a member of an Integrated Project Team (featuring members from different parts of Defence, an Industry Prime Systems Integrator and an Industry Organisational Change partner), responsible for delivering a critical whole of Government ICT transformation.

About our Team

The Australian Government Security Vetting Agency (AGSVA) is the central vetting agency for the Australian Government and conducts security clearance assessments for federal, state and territory agencies. The Business Transformation Section is responsible for the Vetting Transformation project, which will transform AGSVA’s current operating model and business processes, supported by a new ICT system. The Section also manages the current eVetting system, reporting, investigating and analysing information from the eVetting system, and business improvement activities.

Our Ideal Candidate

AGSVA’s Business Transformation Section is seeking enthusiastic and motivated individuals to join our team. To be successful in the role you will need to be a dynamic team member who can actively build relationships with stakeholders to solve problems and influence change whilst always striving for continuous improvement. You will be able to actively engage in an integrated work environment and be strategic in your thinking and planning.

Ideal candidate will have:

  • Excellent time management with the ability to meet deadlines.
  • Strong communication skills both written and oral.
  • Relevant technical skills and experience including application support, testing and basic architecture/infrastructure knowledge.
  • Passion for working in a high performing team, willingness to be collaborative and flexible in a diverse and integrated environment.
  • An innovative approach to your work that applies holistic thinking and continuous improvement of business processes; and
  • A high degree of self-motivation and a positive attitude to transformation.

Application Closing date: Sunday the 22th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference SEG/01961/22 on Link: https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=71122121-E37A-04F2-2D64-C879F7BB6A4C

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
Defense company looking for a Senior Business Analyst to work in an iconic project related to software and hardware products.

Our client is a tier 1 defense organization which needs support in a lot of projects related to their software and hardware enhancements. They need someone who can be in the office 4 times per week in Osbourne and AUSTRALIAN CITIZENS only with eligiblity for a baseline clearance.

As the Senior Business Analyst/Business Analyst you will work closely with relevant Project Managers to deliver a range of business analysis services. This could include ad-hoc analysis, problem/opportunity assessment, enhancement of deployed systems through to support of the full project lifecycle to implement new capability into the business.

This role reports to the Business Analysis Lead your strong business analysis skillset will underpin your adaptability to work through a range of different analysis tasks and problem domains.


* Develop and execute a plan of work including initial stakeholder identification, determining analysis techniques, planning of analysis activities including identification and consideration of external factors that will impact requirements.
* Execute and manage the requirements analysis process through eliciting, prioritising and classification of business or customer requirements. Initiatives and projects will span multiple or complex business domains, the role will need to ensure the needs/requirements of the business or customer are accurately documented and managed for traceability, change and reuse
* Execute and manage the process through which business or customer requirements are analysed to determine and justify validated innovative solutions that are feasible, cost effective, meet business or customer goals, objectives and deliver value.
* Execute and manage activities associated with the development, testing, delivery and transition of a solution for business or customer acceptance including collaboration with Change and Training teams to successfully deliver the change to the business.
* Generation and maintenance of required analysis artefacts to support delivery of analysis services including (but not limited to); stakeholder maps, problem/opportunity analysis, business/functional requirements documentation, use cases, process maps, vendor selection (RFx) documentation, test and acceptance documentation.
* Manage stakeholders through effective expectation and prioritisation management
* Establish a positive working relationship with IM&T and additional Business groups to develop a strong team environment that is aligned on approach and solution delivery against the roadmaps and the digital direction of the program.
* Develop strong stakeholder networks and working knowledge of the business domains and the processes/toolsets that support delivery of the required program outcomes.
* Provide guidance and advice on current technology initiatives and business analysis techniques, and proactively seek ways to improve the way the team delivers services and capability to the business or customer.
Skills and experience required:
* Significant experience in business analysis spanning across multiple business capability domains
* Broad stakeholder communication skills (cross functional), strong customer focus able to utilise negotiation skills, manage potential conflicts and build trusted relationships
* Ability to interpret and clarify ambiguous requirements.
* Demonstrated business analysis skills, critical thinking and problem solving in the area of breaking down complex problems, determining innovative solutions, and validating solutions against customer needs and requirements
* Proficient skills in process mapping (BPMN2)
* Skills or experience in the engineering, production planning or manufacturing space and/or complex integrated system environments (preferred - not essential)


Whilst not essential, qualifications in business or information technology and certification from the International Institute of Business Analysis and ITIL will be an advantage.

Do not miss out on an opportunity to work for a great Defense project.

For a confidential discussion and further information, please call Kevin Gonzalez, our Business Analysis Talent Specialist based in the Adelaide office, on 08 7081 1080 or 0425 723 396 . You can also send your CV to kevin.gonzalez@hudson.com or apply with your MS Word copy of your resumes via the link provided.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
• Multiple progression opportunities
  • High employee satisfaction
  • Mentoring programs
  • Build your profile

Providing excellent working conditions, and a focus on enabling a work / life balance, multiple career progression opportunities and many opportunities to receive mentoring from experienced managers it is easy to understand why our client is regarded as one of Adelaide’s leading employers.

You will be encouraged to use your flair and initiative to ensure that key stakeholders gain maximum value from the support offered by this role.

The Financial Analyst provides support in the development of budgets, monitoring financial performance and reporting activities in a key business unit.

There will be numerous opportunities to build your profile with senior executives and take advantage of the many career opportunities available.

Participation in business improvement and other projects in the boarder business will provide the opportunity to expand your experiences and skills while raising your profile with key decision makers.

If you enjoy drawing conclusions from financial information and using this analysis to identify opportunities for improvement, this role has much to offer.

Your desire to make a difference in improving  processes, systems and reporting outputs will be embraced by your stakeholders.

Experience with a Tier 1 or 2 ERP  (i.e. SAP, Oracle, JDE, Technology One) is preferred.

Completion of or working toward  CPA / CA qualifications is essential.

Interacting with a broad cross section of stakeholders is a key requirement of this role, therefore you should be an accomplished communicator with a proactive approach comfortable initiating conversations with stakeholders.

To Apply

To find out more about this opportunity please contact Peter Goodwin CA – Director Goodwin Recruit on 08 7087 2130 or submit an application in W ord format only to peter@goodwinrecruit.com.au quoting: “Financial Analyst”.

title: Airpower Teaming System (ATS) - Finance Cost Analyst (P2)
salary: Permanent role. Benefits. Role based in Brisbane.
description:
About Us

Boeing Defence Australia (BDA) is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force.

Joining us is a chance to make your mark, working with a diverse team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.

We currently employ more than 2,500 people across 14 sites in Australia and three international locations and have a range of opportunities available as we plan for future growth.

The Opportunity

We are expanding our Commercial team that is supporting the cutting-edge Loyal Wingman Airpower Teaming System (ATS) and are seeking a Finance Cost Analyst. We're looking for "can-do" self-starters, who enjoy working in a diverse team exploring new technology.

Boeing is taking another bold step in aerospace and advanced manufacturing.  The Loyal Wingman ATS is the first military aircraft to be designed, engineered and manufactured in Australia in more than 50 years.  This unmanned teaming aircraft is Boeing's first military aircraft to be designed and developed outside the U.S and uses artificial intelligence to extend the capabilities of manned and unmanned platforms.  This cutting-edge project is aiming to unlock global Defence and aerospace opportunities for Boeing and Queensland.  In March 2022, in the latest exciting landmark, the aircraft received the official designation, 'MQ-28A' at the RAAF's naming ceremony.

The role would ideally be based in Brisbane, however offers the opportunity for flexible working arrangements including ability to perform some days remotely from home and flexible working hours.  This role offers the opportunity to challenge yourself in a fast-paced environment with plenty of changes that keeps the work interesting and provides the opportunity for exposure to the broader Boeing enterprise.

Responsibilities

Work with our existing Finance team to assist with:

  • Development of cost forecasts, weekly financial reporting and quarterly Estimate at Completion
  • Analysis of Cost performance and recommendations on impacts & actions
  • Pricing of minor contract change proposals
  • Review of financial data with program and leadership stakeholders
  • Stakeholder management including liaising with CAMs, capabilities and Program Leadership

Experience/Qualifications

  • Bachelor Degree in finance, business or commerce; or equivalent experience in the workforce
  • Strong excel skills
  • Experience with Deltek Cobra cost management program or equivalent advantageous
  • Familiarity with cost forecasting and EAC development advantageous
  • Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements

As a BDA employee, you will join other innovative, ethical people who have the critical skills required to develop and deliver world class capabilities and systems to protect Australia and its national interests.

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are core values. We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

Benefits

  • Flexible working options
  • Study assistance
  • Salary packaging
  • Employee Incentive Program
  • Global opportunities

Boeing has implemented a new COVID-19 Vaccination Policy in Australia that requires all new Boeing Australia hires to show proof of being fully vaccinated from COVID-19, or have an approved medical exemption. This role is categorised as Group 2 under the Boeing Australia COVID-19 Vaccination and Safety Controls Policy.

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. Female applicants, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and ex-defence personnel are encouraged to apply.

If you are ready to join an innovative industry leader and would like to register your interest in working for Boeing, please click Apply Now.

title: Microsoft BI Consultant
salary: up to $160K pkg (inc super) dep. on exp.
description:
As some with significant professional work experience in Business Intelligence (BI) and Analytics and an expert with SQL Server, Microsoft BI (MSBI) - SSIS / SSRS / SSAS, Power BI , and ideally experience in Azure data tools - Data Factory, Databricks etc - you understand the value of data to help solve business problems.
You will also have a passion for data visualisation whether it's developing models, prototypes, reports or dashboards.

You’re happy to roll up your sleeves and see projects through from end-to-end including mapping business processes, conduct requirements analysis and documentation. Most importantly you understand that your role is all about helping our clients source, transform and interpret data into actionable metrics to optimise their business.

Our team of broadly experienced Consultants, work on a diverse portfolio of client, projects, and innovation initiatives - some of which will make you the envy of your peers.


Applicants must hold Australian Citizenship, Permanent Residency (PR), or other permanent work rights – DWS are unable to sponsor or support visas.



Required skills and experience:
  • Previous experience in a similar role as a Microsoft BI / Analytics Specialist
  • Advanced skills in SQL Server
  • Significant, commercial, hands-on experience across the Microsoft BI stack (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS)
  • An expert in Power BI
  • Experience working in a complex enterprise data warehouse environment
  • Solid Agile environment experience
  • Knowledge and experience of DWH , BI , and analytics best practice
  • Ability to develop requirements into actionable business analytics strategies, roadmaps, and BI solutions
  • Able to quickly build strong relationships with decision-makers , and become their trusted advisor
  • Knowledge of Azure data tools; Databricks , Data Factory , Data Lake etc. Python and R would be beneficial, but are not essential

Working at DWS offers you:
  • Ongoing professional and career development
  • Paid learning and certifications (chosen entirely by you), with completion bonuses
  • An active social club that host regular, subsidised events
  • Corporate discounts on a range of services and products, including health insurance, gym memberships, Apple products and much more

About Us:
Established in 1991, DWS is a professional Technology Consultancy and part of HCL Technologies. With offices across Australia, we have over 800 employees in Melbourne, Sydney, Adelaide, Brisbane and Canberra; providing services to a broad range of blue-chip corporate clients, as well as Federal, State and Local Government agencies. We provide a wide range of services including; IT consulting, managed application services, project management, customer driven innovation, digital transformation, data and business analytics, strategic advisory and productivity, and robotic process automation.


Applicants must hold Australian Citizenship, Permanent Residency (PR), or other permanent work rights – DWS are unable to sponsor or support visas.



Ready for a new challenge? Click APPLY now!
www.dws.com.au

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
This is your opportunity to join a business engaged in a multi-year program to replace core business systems and significantly refine and improve business efficiency and customer experience.

You will enjoy, professionally challenging projects, working in a talented team of genuine professionals and contributing to a business that makes a measurable difference to the social wellbeing of families in South Australia.

Maintaining a strong focus on business unit stakeholder engagement and support, you will champion the improvement of business processes and contribute significantly to delivering integrated whole of business solutions.

You will work closely with project delivery teams and will be responsible for:
  • Undertaking business analysis to support the design and implementation of new business applications, systems enhancements and integrations
  • Maintaining a strong focus on business unit stakeholder engagement and support
  • Championing the improvement of business processes in projects and across the transformation project portfolio
  • Significantly contributing to achieving integrated whole of business solutions and the transition from “bespoke” to “off the shelf” solutions
You will demonstrate:
  • Significant BA experience, ideally working in teams involved in transitioning businesses from inhouse systems to integrated COTS solutions
  • Excellent business and stakeholder engagement ability
  • A proven ability to analyse and resolve problems, recommending effective solutions
  • Sound experience with, and knowledge of, the theories, principles and practices of IT business analysis
  • Demonstrated experience with business process re-engineering, workflow analysis, rules analysis, impact analysis, data models, use case modelling etc.
  • Experience in working within both Agile and Waterfall project delivery frameworks
  • An understanding of software testing processes
A relevant degree will be highly regarded.

This position offers a rare and professionally challenging opportunity for a Senior BA to broaden their experience, while contributing to the design and delivery of a significant refresh of core business applications. The salary offered will reflect the importance of this position and the successful candidate will also enjoy attractive employee benefits.

To find out more please call Lee Haakmeester from Tasman Human Resource Consulting on (08) 7220 8695 or 0488 067 485 .

While all applications will be acknowledged, only candidates who have a right to work in Australia through citizenship or holding an appropriate visa can be considered. If you are not an Australian citizen, please provide clear evidence of your current visa status in your application.

title: ICT Business Analyst APS Level 5
description:
The Role

The Business Transformation Section is seeking to fill an APS 5 Business Analyst position with self-motivated, collaborative team member that will join our dynamic and strategic work area. This is an exciting opportunity for anyone seeking to work in an agile, fast paced and challenging environment. This role will provide support to achieve our section goal - Deliver a contemporary vetting capability to protect Australia's national security interest through the provision of a trusted and assured workforce, for the whole of government and industry partners.

As a Business Analyst in our Business Transformation section, you will research, analyse and provide specialist technical support on business processes and systems for the current and future Vetting Systems. You will communicate business analysis findings to senior staff and business partners on complex issues, innovations and improvements. You will be a key member of our system testing team, through a business lens you will be reviewing systems tests, coordinating user testing and conducting business verification testing. Working in a collaborative team environment, you will share your expertise with others to support team priorities and deliverables in alignment with project goals.

This role presents a unique and exciting opportunity, being a member of an Integrated Project Team (featuring members from different parts of Defence, an Industry Prime Systems Integrator and an Industry Organisational Change partner), responsible for delivering a critical whole of Government ICT transformation.

About our Team

The Australian Government Security Vetting Agency (AGSVA) is the central vetting agency for the Australian Government and conducts security clearance assessments for federal, state and territory agencies. The Business Transformation Section is responsible for the Vetting Transformation project, which will transform AGSVA’s current operating model and business processes, supported by a new ICT system. The Section also manages the current eVetting system, reporting, investigating and analysing information from the eVetting system, and business improvement activities.

Our Ideal Candidate

AGSVA’s Business Transformation Section is seeking enthusiastic and motivated individuals to join our team. To be successful in the role you will need to be a dynamic team member who can actively build relationships with stakeholders to solve problems and influence change whilst always striving for continuous improvement. You will be able to actively engage in an integrated work environment and be strategic in your thinking and planning.

Ideal candidate will have:

  • Excellent time management with the ability to meet deadlines.
  • Strong communication skills both written and oral.
  • Relevant technical skills and experience including application support, testing and basic architecture/infrastructure knowledge.
  • Passion for working in a high performing team, willingness to be collaborative and flexible in a diverse and integrated environment.
  • An innovative approach to your work that applies holistic thinking and continuous improvement of business processes; and
  • A high degree of self-motivation and a positive attitude to transformation.

Application Closing date: Sunday the 22th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference SEG/01961/22 on Link: https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=71122121-E37A-04F2-2D64-C879F7BB6A4C

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
About Us

Bridgestone is a global leader in sustainable mobility and advanced solutions, providing products, services and solutions for a world in motion. We have a long-held tradition of excellence supported by a commitment to offer the highest quality products and services to all customers. Through our mission of "Serving Society with Superior Quality" Bridgestone strives to be a company trusted by the community and valued by its employees.

About the role

Reporting directly to the SAP Business Applications Manager, you will work closely with the Business Systems team to provide high levels of customer service to the company’s end users. Your key responsibilities will include interpreting, analysing and documenting business reporting requirements, identifying solutions to fulfil business needs and developing solutions to contribute to the continuous improvement of business processes and procedures primarily focused on SAP ERP and SAP BW systems. You will also be responsible for designing specification documents, writing test cases, processing and implementing change requests and assisting management with the implementation of various systems projects as required.

About you

This is an excellent opportunity to build on your prior business analyst experience with a multi-national organisation. This role offers broad scope and will require exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities, coupled with high-level written and oral communication skills. Your flexibility, initiative and outstanding ability to develop and maintain relationships at all levels will add further to your success.

  • Tertiary qualifications in IT, Computer Science or a Business related discipline are highly desirable.
  • Experience in Data Modelling with SAP BW and business reporting within SAP Business Objects will be very well regarded.

This is an excellent opportunity for an enthusiastic, dynamic and proactive individual to join a National icon that provides exceptional working conditions and a positive and engaged organisational culture.

What we offer

The successful candidate will be rewarded with a competitive salary and staff discounts. You will also join a globally recognised company that values its employees. Working in a City Fringe location with your own undercover carpark.

To apply, please provide a Cover Letter and Resume quoting reference number: S21215

title: Business Analyst
description:
Data Action (DA) has over 30 years' experience as a specialist software and services provider to the alternate banking and financial services industry. Operating nationally and servicing a broad client base including customer owned banks, credit unions, neobanks and financial services membership organisations, DA's focus of supporting the financial wellbeing of Australians is echoed through our values:

  • No goldfish - Go beyond your bowl, share knowledge, stay curious and keep learning.
  • Fail forward - Learn from mistakes and keep moving forward.
  • Cheer loudly - Be proud of the team's results and celebrate successes.
  • Own it - Throw yourself in and own your work, taking responsibility until the end.
  • Think Client - Put yourself in our Client's shoes - consider the impact for their customers and deliver.

DA has evolved to become a provider of core banking and digital platforms and services to some of Australia's leading customer-owned, challenger banks, aggregators, and the financial services industry, aligned with our purpose - powering innovation in banking.

DA operates nationally with close to 300 staff based in Adelaide, Sydney, Melbourne, and Brisbane - enhancing the banking experience of more than 1.43 million Australians via its core banking and digital platforms, powering customer transactions across 3.2 million accounts every day.

About the Role:

Our BA's work with multiple customers and stakeholders to shape business requirements relating to software changes and product direction primarily related to mobile applications.

You will work with a team of passionate and energetic Business Analysts who enjoy being constantly challenged, and working within an exciting environment of rapid change and transformation.

You will be responsible for:

  • Liaising with customers to elicit and define requirements that align with and support business, user and system needs
  • Assessing and documenting current state
  • Working with business and project teams to document future state
  • Facilitating workshops, engaging internal and external stakeholders, as required
  • Collaborating with designers, developers and third-party suppliers to conceptualize, develop and articulate solutions
  • Producing functional and non-technical requirements to deliver solutions for both business and IT
  • Leading minor projects, such as following Change Requests through to development and release.

To be successful in this role, you must be able to demonstrate:

  • Relevant Bachelor's degree in IT/Business, or similar
  • Demonstrated experience working in an Agile development team, e.g. Scrum or Kanban
  • Demonstrated experience working with development teams on web and app based systems
  • Strong analytical capability (the ability to extract business requirements, look for business process simplification and challenge the status quo)
  • High attention to detail with the focus on seeking effective business and customer outcomes
  • Strong requirements elicitation capabilities, including workshop facilitation
  • A proven track record of delivering clear and detailed process maps, quality business and technical requirements, and screen mock-ups
  • Excellent stakeholder management, written and verbal communications skills
  • Ability to build rapport with both business and technically-focused professionals.

DA offers exciting opportunities for professional development and we have a strong focus on career progression for our employees. Flexible and supportive working arrangements are encouraged.

If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you! Please be sure to combine a covering letter addressing the key criteria set out above as the first page of your resume.

To be considered for this role you will need to be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident, or have a current visa that permits you to work in Australia.

title: Geology Manager
description:
Geology Manager

About Alligator Energy

Alligator Energy Ltd (AGE or Alligator) is experiencing rapid growth as we develop our Samphire Uranium Project in South Australia, advance our three other exploration projects in uranium, nickel, cobalt, plus evaluate future resource, project and M&A opportunities. We are seeking an experienced Geology Manager to join our team working on the Samphire Uranium Project to advance its resource, geological and geoscience development in addition to AGE’s other exploration projects.

About the Role

Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, your role as Geology Manager will be instrumental in leading the relevant technical aspects of the Samphire project to transition from its current inferred resource through to indicated status and feasibility studies as a pre-curser to decision to mine. You will also apply your expertise into Alligator’s other exploration projects. This is a leadership role with a strong technical and management component. In this role you will:

  • Develop an understanding of the regional and project geology, hydrogeology, geophysics, and historical drilling to expand the existing resource in AGE’s Samphire tenement holdings.
  • Seek to understand the value drivers for the Samphire Project; assess and communicate technical risk, including the geological uncertainties and potential impacts for ISR operations.
  • Management and oversight of all Samphire drilling programs, including planning, performance, cost control, administration, logistics and reporting.
  • Implementation of WHS policies and procedures to ensure field operations exceed statutory requirements in addition to measurement and communication of WHS performance indicators.
  • Mentor, supervise & professionally develop your team as it expands.
  • Responsible for ensuring compliance with all regulatory requirements, ensuring work program approvals and reporting support program execution timelines.
  • Implement value-add software/platforms for continuous improvement of geological data management and analysis.
  • Ensure respectful relationships and an open communication are maintained with all landowners, indigenous groups, and community in the region.
  • Evaluation of additional exploration and resource project opportunities.
  • Reporting to the CEO / Board as required.

We are seeking candidates with the following:

  • Degree qualified (or higher) in Geology/Geoscience.
  • Highly proficient in QA/QC, geological data analysis and attention to detail.
  • Prior experience in exploration and/or delineation of sedimentary-hosted uranium deposits including roll-front mapping.
  • Demonstrated experience in Australian Resource and Reserve reporting standards (JORC) of exploration results and mineral resource estimates for uranium.
  • Familiarity in unconformity-type uranium geological models (prior experience in exploring in these terrains would be highly regarded).
  • Demonstrated proficiency in downhole-well log interpretation software and well-log interpretation.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in 3D geological modelling and GIS software (Vulcan, Leapfrog, Micromine, QGIS, MapInfo or others).
  • Prior experience in supervision and managing drilling programs, contractors, and related stakeholders (landholders, indigenous groups, regulators etc.)
  • Prior experience in exploration field crew management
  • Experience in statutory tenement reporting to SA Government regulators and obtaining approvals for field work programs.
  • Demonstrated experience in tenement management.
  • Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills including both written and verbal.

You can find out more about Alligator Energy here: https://alligatorenergy.com.au. Applications will close Friday 27 May 2022.

title: Business Consultant
description:
CSSP is the leading supplier of construction management software solutions in Australia and has been providing solutions to the construction industry in Australia and the surrounding area since 1983. As part of the JDM Technology Group (JDM), a global software company that works exclusively in construction, their large customer base is spread across Australia, New Zealand, Asia and the Middle East. CSSP staff have over 250 man-years experience in construction industry software development and systems integration projects, and this is enhanced by the experience of, and collaboration with, the other companies in the JDM Group.

CSSP develops, supports, and owns all their software and is dedicated to contributing to its customers' long-term success. By combining existing technologies with additional products, CSSP has an ongoing commitment to developing world class products in strategic markets, for local and overseas clients.

CSSP are committed to long-term relationships with their customers and endeavour to provide excellence of service combined with a promise to support their products for as long as customers require.

The Business Consultant will assist in the development of strong relationships with CSSP CHEOPS customers through implementation, training, and support of all modules of the CHEOPS software and will also provide value added business consulting services.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop strong, consultative relationships with CSSP CHEOPS customers
  • Implementation, training, and support of all modules of the CHEOPS software
  • Specify CHEOPS enhancements or developments in conjunction with clients
  • Development of marketing, support, installation, implementation, and support to clients
  • Mentor and train staff to ensure technical knowledge is passed on to all appropriate staff
  • Develop and maintain implementations and support training documentation

Key requirements:

  • Advanced experience as an Accountant (ideally with working knowledge of accounting systems within the construction industry)
  • A clear understanding of accounting policies and procedure within the construction industry
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills
  • Highly analytical with strong problem-solving skills
  • An ability to work autonomously
  • Experience in documentation and/or user requirement gathering
  • Strong influencing skills and an ability to facilitate client meetings and workshops

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply please click apply or call Tom Moore on 08 8216 3516 for a confidential discussion.

title: SharePoint Administrator / Applications analyst
description:
Our client is offering a permanent role for a SharePoint Administrator / Application Analyst to join their tenured and friendly team. The role will be based in Brisbane but remote / flexible working is an option.

What a day looks like:

  • Administer and manage the sharepoint environment
  • Troubleshoot and resolve SharePoint technical issues for end users in a timely manner - proactively communicate anticipated timelines for resolution
  • Be the go-to person in relation to SharePoint - management, configuration
  • Participate in training and support of new and existing users in maximising their effective use of SharePoint
  • Develop, configure and maintain document libraries, lists, site collections and other content structure and permissions
  • General 2nd and 3rd level support and troubleshooting of internal and external sites consisting of Oracle and SQL Server databases, IIS Websites and APIs, service bus, .NET apps, Delphi apps, F5s, SAP B1, SharePoint.
  • Website and Server Auditing
  • Reporting from Oracle and SQL Server data sources
  • Powershell scripting for administrative and discovery tasks

Requirements (Flexible)

  • Minimum of 3 years' experience in administering and supporting SharePoint
  • Experience in managing enterprise scale SharePoint environments
  • Experience supporting SharePoint 2013/2016/Online functionality and supporting large bespoke customisations
  • Proven skills/experience in web administration - c#, .net, javascript
  • Experience in application support or product support or software support roles or system support
  • Proficient understanding of SharePoint
  • PowerShell scripting - Automation
  • System administration in Windows and Linux environments

Benefits

  • Globally recognised brand
  • Experienced and tenured team
  • Flexible working benefits
  • Diverse and interesting work
  • Opportunity to increase salary with on-call roster
  • Learn and be exposed to a wide array of technologies across infrastructure, security, applications and development
  • Professional development

If this sounds like an interesting role to you, please click Apply and our Senior Consultant (Chris Brydon) will get in touch with you.

title: Business Analyst
description:
What you’ll be doing

This role will interpret requirements into software specifications to ensure high-quality software delivery.  With your strong analytical skills, you will problem-solve client-raised helpdesk tickets; analyse and replicate defects, test software fixes; and actively improve software development and business processes. You may also provide onsite client consulting as required.

Main Activities

  • Gathering, understanding, and evaluating client requirements and translating those requirements into software solution designs
  • Monitoring and actioning tickets raised in client helpdesk effectively, within defined timeframes
  • Triaging, diagnosing, and articulating defects or service issues raised by clients, routing to the appropriate teams as required.
  • Assisting in release management and co-ordination of resources including development and testing
  • Creating and executing System Test plans, functional test plans, and regression testing

To be successful in this role you will have

  • Experience with software development lifecycle, rational databases, and SQL will be favored
  • Be a natural at solving problems with the ability to suggest changes with confidence, clearly articulating the rationale
  • Ability to distinguish between software, environmental and user errors.
  • Tertiary education in Computer Science/Information Technology seen favorably.
  • A reputation for excellent communication skills both verbal and written
  • An aptitude for working to challenging deadlines and budgets on a continual basis

Benefits and Remuneration

  • Flexible working policy
  • Relaxed, friendly, tight-knit and collaborative team in a fabulous location
  • Comprehensive benefits scheme with a focus on our employee’s well-being
  • Communicative leaders that encourage and coach self-development
  • A leading company with a large global reach; we have employees, offices, and customers across the world utilising our award-winning solutions.

To apply

If you’re interested in this opportunity, apply online today as we don't always work to fixed closing dates and may start considering applications as and when they are received so we encourage you to apply early.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
