title: Analyst Programmer
description:
The South Australian Certificate of Education Board (SACE Board) of South Australia’s primary role is the provision of the South Australian Certificate of Education (SACE) to government, non-government and international schools.

Our purpose is to “shape education so that students thrive” which is achieved through working closely with our stakeholders to inspire, innovate and create the best outcomes for students and their communities so that SACE Graduates are capable to construct their own futures to contribute to a sustainable and socially just world.

The IMPACT you will drive at the SACE Board
The Analyst Programmer is accountable to the Applications Development Team Leader for contributing to the availability of relevant and effective information systems for the SACE Board of South Australia by developing, implementing and maintaining SACE applications. The Analyst Programmer will also provide leadership support to the Applications Development Team Leader.

What you will BRING

Essential Knowledge / Skills / Experience

  • Ability to communicate and negotiate effectively verbally and in writing with both technical and non-technical staff, including the presentation of comprehensive information and concepts to individuals and groups.
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively and collaboratively within and across teams in order to achieve agreed outcomes.
  • Proven ability to determine priorities, meet tight deadlines and produce high standard work under pressure.
  • Experience in development of web applications using Java/JEE and Java frameworks (such as Spring, Spring MVC and Hibernate) and experience with JavaScript, JSP, AJAX, CSS, XHTML and relational databases such as MS SQL.
  • Experience in all aspects of the software development lifecycle and proven ability to manage the initiation, development and implementation of application specific improvements and produce supporting technical documentation.
  • Proven ability to manage and control the release of software throughout the development lifecycle and into business operation.

Qualifications
An appropriate tertiary qualification in Information Technology or related discipline is desirable.

Special Conditions

  • Intrastate travel to regional and remote locations; international and interstate travel may be required.
  • A current driver’s licence is required.
  • Some out-of-hours work.
  • The incumbent works under the SACE Board of South Australia Act 1983 .
  • An intense time of activity within the SACE Board of South Australia occurs between October and December.  For some roles, the incumbent would not normally be able to take planned leave during this period.

Appointment is subject to a satisfactory working with children check obtained through the Department of Human Services to be renewed every 5 years before expiry.

What we can OFFER you!

  • A supportive and dynamic team environment that values the work that you do.
  • Professional development opportunities.
  • Salary Sacrifice Benefits.
  • Flexible work and wellbeing provisions.

Remuneration
ASO5 classification level.  Salary range $82,042 - $91,245 per annum.

APPLYING with Us

If you are passionate about young people and their education, we want to hear from you!

For further information including the role description and to apply, please go to www.iworkfor.sa.gov.au

ENQUIRIES to
Sam Godfrey, Applications Development Team Leader on 08 8115 4789 or sam.godfrey@sa.gov.au

Applications close: 25/05/2022 at 11:45pm

title: Senior Business Analyst – Technology (SCADA)
description:
Senior Business Analyst – Technology (SCADA)


About the Company

SA Water is proud to deliver an important and essential service to 1.7 million customers every day. For more than 160 years, we have been working together with South Australians to ensure a reliable supply of safe, clean water services across the state, both regionally and locally.

About the role

An exciting opening exists within our Technology unit, offering the desired candidate the opportunity to join an organisation which heavily focuses on its customers satisfaction, broader community needs, and the assurance of continuity in the delivery of exceptional service.

The Technology Senior Business Analyst (SCADA) will partner with stakeholders to provide business analysis services and deliverables and help to lead and support the business to define their needs and consider the technology impact, and by doing so, contributing to the Business Groups objectives in meeting their strategic goals.


About the Person

The successful candidate with be a highly dynamic and professional Senior Business Analyst with demonstrated skills, knowledge and experience providing business analysis services to SCADA and related operations projects, as well as a demonstrated knowledge of both business and information technology, who will drive appropriate business solutions, through contributing to the development and maintenance of technology strategies.

In addition, the Senior Business Analyst – Technology, will also require:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Electrical Engineering, IT, Business or Computer Science (or equivalent experience) are essential
  • Demonstrated skills, knowledge and experience working on SCADA projects (essential)
  • Demonstrated experience working as part of multi-disciplinary teams that have adopted agile principles and lean thinking to deliver significant technology capabilities
  • Proven skills and experience acquired working in the relevant OT (Operational Technology) domain
  • Demonstrated knowledge of water and wastewater systems (highly regarded)
  • Demonstrated leadership skills to influence key stakeholders (desired)
  • Practice in effectively managing expectations of multiple stakeholders
  • Exceptional time management, able to juggle competing priorities
  • Extremely motivated, outcome-driven, dynamic with great rapport-building skills
  • A hands-on, solution-focused approach

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide support to business units across the organisation in identifying business needs and the way in which technology can support these requirements (primarily working with the Operations Business Group)
  • Establish and maintain relationships with stakeholders to uphold an understanding of their business problems and objectives
  • Elicit, manage and communicate ‘requirements’ throughout their lifecycle in a way that supports the chosen delivery model, solution type and market approach
  • Provide quality assurance and ensure business analysis services, either provided by external parties or SA Water staff, are delivered as ‘fit for purpose’
  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of technology strategies, roadmaps and guidelines aligned to business strategic directions and plans that define how technology will enable the business to operate and transform
  • Collaborate with Technology Strategy Teams consisting of digital capability experts from the Solution Architecture and Business Analysis disciplines responsible for delivering technology strategy
  • Actively manage goals, behavioural expectations and plan development activities in Performance Appraisal and Development Plan (PADP) process

Benefits:

  • Attractive and competitive salary
  • Flexible, working from home arrangements
  • Working with a company that values growth and support of its employees, customers, the wider community
  • Contributing to the sustainability of a significant, essential public service
  • Working for a highly reputable organisation
  • Backed by a supportive, inclusive, and value-aligned team culture


If you have a passion to work within a diverse, customer-centred business, filled with passionate and self-motivated people, where fresh thinking is valued and innovation is embraced, we want to hear from you. If you relish working in an evolving environment, have a desire to work collaboratively amongst a wealth of talent, partake in rewarding work with a purpose in an exciting industry, SA Water is a great place to be.

For a copy of the position description or for further information, please contact Claire Aldridge, Recruitment Partner at Harrison McMillan via email: claire.aldridge@harrisonmcmillan.com.au or contact our office on 08 7071 7273 .

SA Water believe great outcomes for their customers are best delivered by a diverse and inclusive team that reflects our community. That's why SA Water encourage people seeking flexible working arrangements and from all backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, to apply and join the SA Water team.

title: MS SQL Database Administrator
description:
DXC Technology (NYSE:DXC) - where brilliant people embrace change and seize opportunities to advance their careers and amplify customer success.

Deliver excellence. This role will see you working as part of an experienced and customer driven team, providing project and "business as usual" MS SQL DBA support to customers.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Respond to break/fix incident, problem, change, SRs, maintenance activities
  • Assist with new projects and T&M work
  • Provides 24x7 (on-call) support as per standby roster
  • Manage workload and ensure assignments are completed on time
  • Keeping up to date with new and emerging technologies
  • Takes ownership of highly complex or critical incidents
  • Provides time / resource estimates for assigned tasks

Key Requirements:

  • Proven experience in Database Administration of Microsoft SQL Server 2005 onwards
  • Demonstrated expertise in Database Administration, Performance Tuning and Troubleshooting
  • Experience in performing Backup and Recovery Tasks
  • Strong experience installing and configuring SQL Servers
  • Experience in High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) Technologies
  • Experience in Microsoft SQL Replication and Microsoft Clustering
  • Experience in defining Database Server Security, User Creation, Roles and Permission
  • Exposure to Migrations, upgrades, SQL Database Design and Development
  • University or other relevant qualifications
  • Understanding of ITIL framework
  • Experience in database maintenance activities to ensure databases satisfy 24x7 requirements
  • Knowledge of hardware platform and operating system issues
  • Strong communication and customer facing skills

Applicants must be Australian Citizens . If you would like to be part of a culture that drives innovation, delivers results, rewards performance and encourages ideas, then please press the "Apply Now" button to submit your resume.

As an employer of choice, our “people first” philosophy means we offer competitive remuneration, benefits, training and career opportunities that reflect our commitment to improving the lives of our employees, and the communities in which we live and work. Some of these include;

  • Extensive resources to support your onboarding and continual development including DXC University
  • DXC Recognition, our global virtual platform that fosters a culture of appreciation and celebration with real-time reward and recognition
  • We know that great people refer great people. We will reward you when you bring your friends and family to work at DXC
  • More time to do the things you love with flexible leave options, including purchased leave
  • Take time to give back with charitable and emergency services volunteer days
  • Well-being matters to us and our Employee Assistance Program is there to support you and your family
  • And of course, all the basics; novated leasing, discounted health insurance, paid parental leave and many other discounts

title: Business Change Analyst
description:
SNIPPET

Business Change Analyst for a 24 month contract with South Australia Police.

ORGANISATION

It’s never been a more exciting time to join the South Australia Police, Information, Systems and Technology Service. SAPOL provides a diverse range of services to the community aimed at providing a safe and peaceful environment. The Information, Systems and Technology Service are transforming and are seeking new skills and attributes to enhance the ICT approach for the organisation in order to deliver tech enabled policing. This is a rare opportunity to use your skills and experience to drive real change.

ROLE

Are you a seasoned change professional who is able to envision how technology enables the business to transform the way they work and then support them to deliver on that vision? Are you looking to work within an organisation with community purpose and wanting to make a difference?

In this newly created 24 month contract role in the Business Change branch, you will be working closely with individuals and teams across SAPOL to prepare and support them with changes associated with the implementation of new or improved systems and technology, to new digital and operational policing projects.

Working within a dedicated Business Change team, you will work with experienced Change Managers on major transformational projects like Mobile Workforce Transformation and Shield and work with the wider PMO and Business Engagement teams to ensure smooth project adoption.

Your experience undertaking and coordinating a complex range of change management functions on technology and business projects will be crucial to the success of this role. You will be strong in change communication, stakeholder engagement and managing competing demands.

You will be undertaking and coordinating a range of activities related to business change management that are required to support the successful delivery of IS&T projects and initiatives. This includes working closely with individuals and teams across SAPOL to ensure the business impact of changes associated with implementation of new or improved systems and technology are properly understood and plans are developed to ensure the business change is effectively managed during project delivery. The role will work collaboratively with IS&T staff to ensure successful project implementation.

SUCCESS

  • Demonstrated experience in coordinating and delivering change management planning, initiatives / projects in a complex environment with a focus on adoption, efficiency gains and cultural and behavioural change.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of and significant competence in applying contemporary change management frameworks, change management principles, methodologies, and tools.
  • Demonstrated high level of analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to think laterally and conceptually.
  • Proven ability to communicate and negotiate effectively with people at all levels, verbally, in writing and presentations, including preparing high quality reports and documents that clearly explain complex technical information.
  • Demonstrated ability to organise workloads effectively in a climate of competing priorities to achieve agreed outcomes and work in a team environment on complex tasks.
  • Able to assess and lead stakeholder engagement, current/future state impacts, change readiness assessments and measure change sustainability across a large program of work.
  • Experience developing and implementing communication and training materials.
  • Acute business acumen and understanding of organisational issues and challenges.
  • Demonstrated ability to support and engage senior leaders, coaching project resources and stakeholders.

SALARY

ASO6 $94,176 - $99,615 per annum

Special Conditions please refer to the Position Information Document.

BENEFITS

This is a great opportunity to join a large SA Government department that is going through a transformational change period and investing in ICT as a driver of business excellence.

CALL TO ACTION

If you have the necessary experience as a Change Analyst and want to work with a change ready organisation with lots of projects in-flight, dealing with stakeholders at all levels then please apply via the link below with your CV, cover letter and response to the success factors above or contact David Lilley for more information or the Position Information Document at David.Lilley@hays.com.au

Applications Close: 31/5/2022 5:00pm

title: Fuel Pricing Analyst
description:
The Opportunity

The role of the fuel pricing analyst is to maximize fuel volume across the OTR retail network.  The purpose of the role is to conduct robust and insightful reporting and analysis to allow us to react quickly to changes in the market.  We use industry specific software and the successful applicant will be fully trained.

Who are we?

Peregrine Operate a substantial fuels business trading under the Reliable Petroleum and Mogas Regional brands.  Geographically we span across all of South Australia, Western Victoria the Northern Territory and Western Australia.  We have a diverse and well balanced business that supplies both B2B and B2C segments across Retail, Agri-Business, Fishing, Transport and Mining.

We manage our in-house company-owned delivery fleet which is complemented by a contractor fleet working across the country.  To complement our fuels business we also supply a full range of packaged lubricants and refuelling products including tanks and dispensing equipment.

For more information about Peregrine please visit our website www.peregrine.com.au

Key responsibilities include:

  • Driving and developing strategies for improved performance
  • Reviewing market conditions and ensuring data is gathered regularly and accurately
  • Becoming the go to person in the use and configuration of our software
  • Analysing fuel reconciliation data from sites and actioning accordingly
  • Logging issues and instigating corrective measures, closing the loop on any issues raised
  • Submitting reports to the GM of Fuels and ensuring procedures are accurate, current and comprehensive
  • Providing environmental governance of wet stock across the retail network

The successful candidate will possess:

  • A tertiary qualification in Finance, Mathematics, Economics or related discipline
  • Advanced MS office skills particularly Excel
  • Exceptional analytical skills with a keen eye for detail
  • Proven ability to meet deadlines and prioritise multiple tasks
  • Recent University graduates are encouraged to apply

What’s in it for you?

Where do we start? What’s important to you? What about this for starters…

  • A culture of care, reputation, equality and determination
  • Work with some of the brightest and best minds in Australia
  • Work with a modern ERP (Microsoft Navision)
  • Work in our (soon to be finished) renovated offices on the Parade, close to boutique shops and excellent cafés and restaurants
  • Be part of the growth story of an exceptional business
  • Build a career and drive your own future
  • A competitive salary package

If you want to talk to us about becoming part of the team, click “apply now” and upload your current CV and Cover letter…. What are you waiting for?

Please note only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

title: Demand Planning Analyst
description:
What’s the role?

In your role as a Demand Planning Analyst, you will play a vital role in ensuring our printed products are available at more than 15,000 retail outlets nationally.

  • Utilise historical sales data and insights to calculate the demand for News Corp Australia newspapers.
  • Support the demand planning function for BAU, holidays, promotions, and magazine allocations.
  • Liaise with the press sites to provide direction on weekly print volumes.
  • Manage relationships and effectively communicate with Field Sales, Logistics and Marketing.
  • Actively contribute to providing improvement to the demand planning process.
  • Role can be based in Adelaide, Brisbane, Melbourne or Sydney!

Who you are

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Comfortable working with large data sets.
  • Excellent proficiency using Microsoft Excel (knowledge of VBA is desired but not essential).
  • Positive, can-do attitude.
  • Results orientated with a proven track record of delivering above expectations.
  • Ability to work effectively with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Quantitative background, with a degree in Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline (desired).
  • Graduates may apply.

What’s in it for you?

  • A truly collaborative environment
  • Variety of work where no two days are the same
  • Work with some of Australia's most recognised and prestigious brands
  • Flexible / hybrid working arrangements
  • Employee discounts with multiple brands including JB Hi-Fi, Qantas, Apple, Samsung, Medibank Health Insurance and Commonwealth Bank, plus many more.
  • Corporate wellbeing program
  • Access to on-site gym facilities

Who are we?

We are Australia’s number one and most influential media organisation with more than 150 prestige brands across news, sport and lifestyle. Each month more than 17 million Australians choose to consume news and information from our digital and print products – more than any other media group in Australia.

What’s next?

Apply now or for more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers

Diversity strengthens our national teams and newsroom as we seek to tell stories that represent the communities of Australia. Our people make us unique, and so we are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, religion, sexual orientation, age, disability or gender identity. Applicants of diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply!

title: Senior Data and Analytics Architectural Lead
description:
• New and exciting role working within Microsoft ecosystem
  • An innovative and supportive environment use cutting edge technology
  • Full-time initial 3-year ongoing contract, offering flexibility and autonomy

About Flinders University

Flinders University have a bold vision, captured in their Strategic Plan: making a Difference: The 2025 Agenda, is to be internationally recognised as a world leader in research, an innovator in contemporary education, and the source of Australia’s most enterprising graduates.

Flinders recognises the key to their success is exceptional people and they are seeking an outstanding individual to join the team of this exceptional establishment.

Role Overview

Working within the Information and Digital Services (IDS) unit, this role will provide strategic and operational leadership to the relevant stakeholders and teams within IDS.

You will be responsible for the planning, developing and continuous improvement of the data and analytics architecture and strategy.

The role is also responsible for building, maintaining and maturing a capability hub for IDS where all relevant IDS planning, data and analytics resources have either a full or dotted reporting line into.

About the Person

You will be a strong communicator and collaborator with an innovative mindset. You will drive innovation amongst your team with a customer centric focus. You will be resilient, curious by nature, love learning but also actively sharing your knowledge with others to get the best outcomes.

Key Responsibilities, Skills and Experience

  • Provide advanced strategic thinking, planning and analytical skills to achieve outcomes and meet the University’s strategic goals.
  • Lead a team to its full potential, including advanced interpersonal and relationship management.
  • Ability to build and manage customer relationships in strategic and long-term context.
  • Demonstrated experience in contemporary enterprise architecture frameworks and their application to complex business environments.
  • Extensive experience in agile ways of working including exposure to scaled agile methodologies and/or collaborating and delivering through a matrix structure.
  • Advanced experience in data warehousing or business intelligence design or with processes of implementation.
  • Advanced experience in enterprise data modelling and database design within a large organisation.
  • Tertiary qualifications in ICT or relevant business disciplines is required.
  • Higher education experience advantageous.

Flinders University are seeking to increase the diversity to improve equal opportunity outcomes for employees, and therefore encourage female applicants, people with a disability and/or from Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islanders descent to apply.

A National Police Certificate which is satisfactory to the University will be required by Flinders University before the successful applicant can commence in this position.

COVID-19 vaccination in accordance with the Flinders University COVID-19 Vaccination Policy (2022) is a condition of employment with the University. Any offer of employment will be subject to the successful candidate presenting their COVID-19 Digital Certificate as evidence of vaccination or showing evidence of a valid medical exemption where relevant.

For more information, please contact Claire Pennington at Harrison McMillan on 08 7071 7273 .

title: Senior Regulatory Analyst
description:
• Do you have an analytical mind with a sound understanding of financial accounts/performance?
  • Do you want to work in a genuinely flexible and friendly CBD environment?
  • Do you want to work in an employee focused, high performance, statutory organisation?

Salary range: $94,176 - $99,615 – More than one position available

The Essential Services Commission is currently seeking applications, from experienced financial/economic analysts and those looking to consolidate and grow their current practical workplace experience, to join our team. The Commission is an independent statutory authority that regulates the provision of essential services in the water and sewerage, electricity, gas, ports and rail industries.  Our primary objective is to protect the long-term interests of South Australian consumers with respect to the price, quality and reliability of essential services.

What are we looking for from you to succeed in these roles?

  • The ability to maintain a “big picture” focus when working on detailed technical issues.
  • Be collaborative and enjoy working as part of a small team.
  • Being able to think analytically and creatively with a ‘solutions’ approach to situations.
  • Ability to draft briefing papers, correspondence and documents that are technically correct and easy to read for the non-technical audience.
  • Be able to talk to your ideas and communicate effectively.
  • Most importantly, be a positive leader and ambassador for our organisation.

Does this sound like you? Read on because, in addition, the key requirements for this role are also…

  • To undertake quantitative and qualitative analysis of information and data sets across multiple industries and then analyse, assess, and explain trends in the operational and financial performance of regulated entities.
  • To assist in the implementation of reporting guidelines and to undertake ongoing monitoring of performance against service standards and performance metrics.

Experience working in a regulatory environment will be advantageous in your application but is not essential.

Yes! We will consider some relocation expenses for the right candidate. Adelaide is an amazing and vibrant city, with rents being on average 45% lower than Sydney and many more great reasons to make it your new home – experience Adelaide.

This is the important bit, to apply please email a one-page pitch telling us about you, highlighting your experience and what would make you successful in the role. Also attach your current CV and email both to Rachel Wilkinson, Manager, People and Corporate, at escosahr@escosa.sa.gov.au . Applications should be submitted in PDF format. For further information about us please visit escosa.sa.gov.au

For a confidential discussion, please call Rachel Wilkinson on 8463 4448 .

Applications close: 5pm on Sunday, 5 June 2022.

Want to work with us but don’t quite fit the roles at this level or the key requirements? Then please reach out to have a chat or send your CV through (please include ‘future consideration’ in your email subject line) or keep an eye on our vacancies page.

The Commission and the South Australian public sector promote diversity and flexible ways of working, including part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss flexible working arrangements for this role.

The Commission adopts a zero-tolerance approach to towards domestic violence and disrespectful behaviours of any kind in the workplace and in the broader community.

title: Snr Systems Analyst - financials
company: Talent – SEEK Recruitment Agency of the Year | 7 Time Winner
description:
• Adelaide based opportunity
  • 6+ month contract
  • Strong Finance/Billing Systems experience with SQL Skills

Our client is currently looking to fill a requirement for a Senior Systems Analyst with experience in support of large finance/billing systems with good understanding of underlying database structures and strong SQL skills.

The focus of the skills and experience required of the successful contractor will be as follows:

  • Working on large finance systems.
  • Expert SQL Query skills and Data analysis.
  • Understanding of system lifecycle of system changes.
  • Awareness of Medicare Billing will be preferred.
  • Awareness of .Net Skills will be preferred.

If you are coming to the end of a contract and looking for something new, or looking to move to a contract role please click Apply Now for your chance to be considered.

title: Service Delivery Analyst
description:
Service Delivery Analyst to develop an end-to-end support model for the new OT systems that are being implemented within a defense robotics project.

Our client within the defense sector is a tier 1 organization looking for a Services Delivery Analyst with experience as a Business analyst and/or technical writer to be part of an exciting 6 month robotics project that will require a great mind to bring all the systems requirements and technical components together to come up with great solutions and operational efficiencies.

The objective of this role is to develop the end-to-end support model for the new OT systems that are being implemented. To achieve this, the Service Delivery Analyst will work closely with key stakeholders on the project to draw up the accountability and responsibility matrix for the new OT systems that are being implemented.

Daily responsibilities

  • Engaging with the business, capturing support requirements, and building relationships with key stakeholders
  • Establishing a cross functional Accountability Support Matrix
  • Establishment of a Concept of operations document for Operational Technology utilised on the Programme
  • Developing a Document Management Plan that ties all the above together

Candidate skills/experience

  • Core
    • IT Service Delivery/management
    • Requirements Management as a Business Analyst
      • Analysis of service requirements
    • IT Support background is required
  • Secondary
    • Technical writing
    • Broad or cross functional stakeholder engagement skills
    • Adaptable to a changing/evolving environment
    • Operational technology Management - Capital Engineering Equipment

If you want to be part of a complex and exciting piece of work, apply now and become part of the Hudson Family!

For a confidential discussion and further information, please call Kevin Gonzalez, our Business Analysis Talent Specialist based in the Adelaide office, on 08 7081 1080 . You can also send your CV to kevin.gonzalez@hudson.com or apply with your MS Word copy of your resumes via the link provided.

title: GIS Analyst
description:
WGA (Wallbridge Gilbert Aztec) is a national multi-disciplinary, award-winning engineering team with an ethos based on developing long-term collaborative client relationships, and delivering innovative, buildable and economical solutions.

Based in our Adelaide office, we are seeking a GIS Analyst with a minimum 5 years’ experience to join our team.

The Opportunity

Working under the direction of the Spatial Business Manager, this is an opportunity for a GIS Specialist to work with a small GIS team to deliver support within the organisation and project-based GIS solutions for our clients. This is an opportunity for growth in a dynamic environment with a strong support base, WGA provide spatial services within multiple industries, including but not limited to water, transport, energy, civil and infrastructure.

The success of this position greatly depends on your ability to build strong relationships within the Engineering and Drafting teams across the WGA organisation. Our expectation is for you to strive to deliver the highest of design and consulting standards. You will have strong communication skills, a ‘can do’ attitude and self-motivation.

In this role you will develop and maintain GIS capabilities and undertake data capture, data maintenance, governance and analysis whilst supporting system and data enhancement projects.

We are looking for a confident, professional and experienced individual who is committed to delivering projects to a high standard and who is passionate about developing their skills in spatial data.

It is expected that you will have an excellent understanding and working knowledge of the ESRI suite of products, including: Esri ArcGIS Desktop, ARCGIS Pro and ArcGIS Online and will have excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a client focused attitude and excellent time management and problem-solving skills.

Your use of initiative and a desire to continuously improve business performance will be utilised in this dynamic team environment.

In return WGA offer you a fantastic working environment, which allows for autonomy, creativity and where your continued growth and development is encouraged.

We enjoy company sponsored social activities throughout the year and we value work/life balance, offering flexible working conditions to meet personal commitments.

Candidates for the role will ideally have:

• A tertiary qualification in GIS or a related field

• A minimum of 5 years’ experience working in GIS data analysis and mapping

• An excellent understanding and working knowledge of the ESRI suite of products, including: Esri ArcGIS Desktop, ARCGIS Pro and ArcGIS Online.

• Development of innovative spatial solutions to deliver superior project outcomes for our clients

• Support the ongoing development and implementation of standards for day-to-day GIS processes and data management.

• Leadership skills with the ability to motivate and inspire the development of an engaged and positive team

• Strong written and verbal communication skills

• An understanding of data management with methodical attention to file naming, storage and metadata recording.

• A desire to promote and grow the spatial technologies within the business

• The ability to provide innovative solutions client expectations and translate these solutions in clear communication to the GIS team.

Thank you for your interest in this opportunity at WGA. You can find out more about us here https://wga.com.au/

Business Change Analyst for a 24 month contract with South Australia Police.

title: Business Analyst
description:
A tier one plumbing organisation that’s considered a leader in the market!

Hindmarsh Plumbing has been a leader in the South Australian plumbing industry for over 45 years. We are experts in commercial and industrial construction, maintenance plumbing and water treatment. We strive to provide a value-add service to our clients, to the highest level of quality whilst not compromising on the safety of our people.

What your day-to-day could look like

Reporting to the PMO Manager, this newly created Business Analyst role has been designed to partner with key stakeholders in the delivery of transformational projects at Hindmarsh Plumbing. As an important member of the Project Management Office (PMO) and with the strong support of a PMO framework, this role will be the direct link to Hindmarsh Plumbing and will have the ability to lead business improvement initiatives and initiatives aligned to the Business & Technology Roadmap.

Critical to the role will be your ability to work with key stakeholders to analyse and capture business requirements, identify opportunities for continuous improvement, document workflow and processes and support stakeholders through change. You will be a post change champion for the ongoing support of newly implemented initiatives to ensure long-term success.

Key responsibilities of the position include:

  • Lead Hindmarsh Plumbing business improvement initiatives and initiatives aligned to the Business & Technology Roadmap.
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify and document functional and non-functional business requirements and continuous improvement opportunities.
  • Lead and contribute to the full project lifecycle from initiation and design through to testing, implementation, training and user adoption.
  • Follow change management principles to ensure high levels of stakeholder confidence and user adoption.
  • Support the PMO Senior Business Analyst in the delivery of Tier 1 Strategic Projects.
  • Follow PMO framework & champion the PMO function within Hindmarsh Plumbing.

Why choose us?

The successful candidate will become part of a friendly people-focussed team environment which values training, development and supporting our team members. If you want to work for a company which is honest, ethical and focuses on their people so they can be best for our clients, then you need to apply now!

What we are looking for?

If you are a 'can-do' person, who thrives on new challenges; likes working in a team within a diverse environment; and consistently delivers to the highest quality, then you'll fit right in and we'd like to have you on our team.

You will possess the following experience, skills and qualifications:

  • 3 years’ experience in a BA or continuous improvement role.
  • Understanding of business analysis and project management frameworks and methodologies.
  • Demonstrated experience in effective stakeholder engagement.
  • Excellent customer service, communication skills and demonstrated ability to work as part of a team.
  • Experience in analysis and definition of product requirements.
  • Understanding of change management principles and their application.
  • Ability to communicate across all levels of user knowledge.
  • Experience in the use of Microsoft 365 applications and SharePoint.

Sounds exciting? Now is the time to join our team!

Submit your application by hitting ‘Apply’ and we’ll get back to you shortly to let you know if you’re a fit. All applications are managed through our employment website; just follow the ‘Apply for this job’ link below to submit or access more information.

Applications will remain open until the position is filled.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

Hindmarsh 5007 SA

title: Airpower Teaming System (ATS) - Finance Cost Analyst (P3)
salary: Permanent role. Benefits. Role based in Brisbane.
description:
About Us

Boeing Defence Australia (BDA) is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force.

Joining us is a chance to make your mark, working with a diverse team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.

We currently employ more than 2,500 people across 14 sites in Australia and three international locations and have a range of opportunities available as we plan for future growth.

The Opportunity

We are expanding our Commercial team that is supporting the cutting-edge Loyal Wingman Airpower Teaming System (ATS) and are seeking a Senior Finance Cost Analyst. We're looking for "can-do" self-starters, who enjoy working in a diverse team exploring new technology.

Boeing is taking another bold step in aerospace and advanced manufacturing.  The Loyal Wingman ATS is the first military aircraft to be designed, engineered and manufactured in Australia in more than 50 years.  This unmanned teaming aircraft is Boeing's first military aircraft to be designed and developed outside the U.S and uses artificial intelligence to extend the capabilities of manned and unmanned platforms.  This cutting-edge project is aiming to unlock global Defence and aerospace opportunities for Boeing and Queensland.  In March 2022, in the latest exciting landmark, the aircraft received the official designation, 'MQ-28A ' at the RAAF's naming ceremony.

The role would ideally be based in Brisbane, however offers the opportunity for flexible working arrangements including ability to perform some days remotely from home and flexible working hours.  This role offers the opportunity to challenge yourself in a fast-paced environment with plenty of changes that keeps the work interesting and provides the opportunity for exposure to the broader Boeing enterprise.

Responsibilities

Work with our existing Finance team to assist with:

  • Development of cost forecasts, monthly financial reporting and quarterly Estimate at Completion
  • Analysis of Cost performance and recommendations on impacts & actions
  • Implementation of Baseline changes into the financial system
  • Variance reporting on Cost and Schedule performance
  • Pricing of minor contract change proposals
  • Review of financial data with program and leadership stakeholders
  • Stakeholder management including liaising with Control Account managers, finance team and Program Leadership
  • Mentoring of junior cost analysts in the team

Experience/Qualifications

  • Bachelor Degree in finance, business or commerce; or equivalent experience in the workforce
  • Strong excel skills
  • Experience with Deltek Cobra cost management program or equivalent advantageous
  • Familiarity with earned value management while not essential would be highly regarded
  • Experience with cost forecasting, variance reporting and estimates at completion
  • Experience managing financial baseline changes
  • Experience with Open Plan Professional or equivalent scheduling program advantageous
  • Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements

As a BDA employee, you will join other innovative, ethical people who have the critical skills required to develop and deliver world class capabilities and systems to protect Australia and its national interests.

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are core values. We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

Benefits

  • Flexible working options
  • Study assistance
  • Salary packaging
  • Employee Incentive Program
  • Global opportunities

Boeing has implemented a new COVID-19 Vaccination Policy in Australia that requires all new Boeing Australia hires to show proof of being fully vaccinated from COVID-19, or have an approved medical exemption. This role is categorised as Group 2 under the Boeing Australia COVID-19 Vaccination and Safety Controls Policy.

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. Female applicants, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and ex-defence personnel are encouraged to apply.

If you are ready to join an innovative industry leader and would like to register your interest in working for Boeing, please click Apply Now.

title: Machine Learning
description:
About the Role:

As a Consunet Applied Scientist you will perform a vital role with the use of your Machine Learning knowledge to support our Cyber and Electronic Warfare technology company. The role will consist of project research, development, and demonstration of near real-time autonomous electromagnetic spectrum management to deliver orders of magnitude increase in agility and efficiency cost savings for Australian Defence and commerce. You will be working within an agile environment with a team of professionals to achieve the organisations research goals. The applied research of the project you will be undertaking is in the application of advanced computational methods (Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Data Science) to a problem domain requiring pattern recognition, forecasting and planning.

To be considered for this role, you must be an Australian citizen.

Essential Knowledge and Skills:

  • Understanding software engineering and problem solving.
  • In-depth knowledge of Python programming skills including experience with Pytorch, TensorFlow, NumPy, Panda and Matplotlib.
  • A comprehension understanding of Mathematics, especially statistics, vectors and matrices, optimisation, and complex algorithm development and the ability to link these to modelling and machine learning.
  • Experience with training and testing of machine learning models, including data preparation, data leakage and performance assessment.
  • You will have demonstrable experience with Neural Network based technologies and understand Model based and Model free based approaches, with the familiarity of building models within an R&D environment.
  • You are an adaptable individual who can communicate fluently, both orally and in writing, and are comfortable with presenting complex information to both technical and non-technical audiences such as internal and external stakeholders.

Desirable Knowledge and Skills:

  • Background in Radar, EW or Comms
  • Understanding of distributed systems
  • Government/Defence Industry experience
  • Recommending and designing technical solutions
  • Writing and maintaining technical documentation
  • Implementing and testing software using edge technologies and frameworks
  • Experience working in teams applying Agile software engineering best practices
  • Post graduate degree within Machine Learning, Pattern Matching, Data Science are preferred, however established equivalent expertise will be considered

To be considered, candidates will have:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Successful candidates must be eligible to hold and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance. Eligibility requirements can be found at http://www.defence.gov.au/agsva.

Benefits working for Consunet:

  • A workplace that believes in innovation, quality, and a work-life balance.
  • Flexible, inclusive and friendly work environment.
  • Competitive remuneration.
  • Salary packaging options.
  • Career and skills progression through training and development to team members.
  • Access to cutting-edge technology, research, and agile project management practices.
  • Mentoring and support from our experienced team members.

About the Company:

Consunet is headquartered in the Adelaide CBD with operations in Adelaide, Edinburgh (SA) and Canberra. A level of flexibility is generally offered with respect to work location. If you have specific requirements, please discuss them during your interview.

Our people create world-leading trusted cyber and spectrum security technology solutions that safeguard our customers' interests. As a 100% Australian-owned and operated corporation, Consunet strives to be the country's leading sovereign cyber and spectrum security solution developer, and trusted industry partner to the Australian Defence and cyber security communities. The company has a strong research and development and collaboration emphasis, implements Agile development and management processes, and has a proven track record of delivering and sustaining in-service operational capabilities for defence and commercial customers. Our vision “to build the Australian cyber and spectrum security future” is firmly rooted in everything we do.

To Apply:

Click “Apply Now”. Please attach a cover letter summarising your experience when applying.

title: Senior Business Analyst

Modis is a national professional services company with global capability. As a member of global professional services group Adecco, we offer world-class employment opportunities.

Talented, committed, can-do individuals have always been the cornerstone of this dynamic business. It is expected that the successful candidate will bring energetic dynamics and a strong Senior Business Analyst skill set to this organisation.

title: Business Consultant
description:
CSSP is the leading supplier of construction management software solutions in Australia and has been providing solutions to the construction industry in Australia and the surrounding area since 1983. As part of the JDM Technology Group (JDM), a global software company that works exclusively in construction, their large customer base is spread across Australia, New Zealand, Asia and the Middle East. CSSP staff have over 250 man-years experience in construction industry software development and systems integration projects, and this is enhanced by the experience of, and collaboration with, the other companies in the JDM Group.

CSSP develops, supports, and owns all their software and is dedicated to contributing to its customers' long-term success. By combining existing technologies with additional products, CSSP has an ongoing commitment to developing world class products in strategic markets, for local and overseas clients.

CSSP are committed to long-term relationships with their customers and endeavour to provide excellence of service combined with a promise to support their products for as long as customers require.

The Business Consultant will assist in the development of strong relationships with CSSP CHEOPS customers through implementation, training, and support of all modules of the CHEOPS software and will also provide value added business consulting services.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop strong, consultative relationships with CSSP CHEOPS customers
  • Implementation, training, and support of all modules of the CHEOPS software
  • Specify CHEOPS enhancements or developments in conjunction with clients
  • Development of marketing, support, installation, implementation, and support to clients
  • Mentor and train staff to ensure technical knowledge is passed on to all appropriate staff
  • Develop and maintain implementations and support training documentation

Key requirements:

  • Advanced experience as an Accountant (ideally with working knowledge of accounting systems within the construction industry)
  • A clear understanding of accounting policies and procedure within the construction industry
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills
  • Highly analytical with strong problem-solving skills
  • An ability to work autonomously
  • Experience in documentation and/or user requirement gathering
  • Strong influencing skills and an ability to facilitate client meetings and workshops

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply please click apply or call Tom Moore on 08 8216 3516 for a confidential discussion.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
We have an abundance of work for skilled Senior IT BAs, who are creative and enthusiastic individuals, and love solving the diverse client problems and variety of work that professional IT Consulting offers.

Applicants must hold Australian Citizenship, Permanent Residency (PR), or other permanent work rights – DWS are unable to sponsor or support visas.

Type : Permanent, full time
Salary: up to $150K package (inc super), depending on experience

What you will bring:
  • Significant IT Business Analyst experience in enterprise scale projects
  • Strong experience in Agile environments
  • A combination of technical AND functional business focus in your work as a BA
  • Exceptional communication skills
  • Desirable, a formal BA qualification such as IIBA CCA, CBAP or AAC
  • Experience working on a broad range of projects with major businesses in different domains ; financial services, government, professional services, retail, industrial, supply chain
  • Commercial experience in applying formal methodologies such as BABOK, Scrum, BPMN
  • You thrive in a constantly changing and dynamic work environments
  • A proactive approach with client and a drive to exceed expectations
  • A flexible and adaptable attitude
What DWS can offer you:

  • Paid learning and certifications (chosen entirely by you), with completion bonuses
  • An active social club that host regular, subsidised events

About Us:

Established in 1991, DWS is a professional Technology Consultancy and part of HCL Technologies. With offices across Australia, we have over 700 employees in Melbourne, Sydney, Adelaide, Brisbane and Canberra; providing services to a broad range of blue-chip corporate clients, as well as Federal, State and Local Government agencies. We provide a wide range of services including; IT consulting, managed application services, project management, customer driven innovation, digital transformation, data and business analytics, strategic advisory and productivity, and robotic process automation.

title: Machine Learning Researcher
description:
About us:

STELaRLab is Lockheed Martin’s first dedicated multi-disciplinary research lab to be setup outside of the US and conducts research in artificial intelligence, signal and image processing, communication systems and multidomain operations (MDO) to deliver exciting outcomes that advance Australian capability.

STELaRLab maintains strong partnerships with academia, government, and wider industry to execute research and development from conceptual prototyping through to simulated and/or live trials. This exciting new position will be located and works closely with the Australian Institute of Machine Learning (AIML), working with world-class researchers with the opportunity to build your career and reputation and work in one of the world’s most liveable cities.

AIML is Australia’s leading research institute in machine learning, artificial intelligence and computer vision. With world-leading researchers, modern facilities and an innovative culture, delivering research that is highly valued to local and global communities. AIML is the largest computer vision and machine learning group in Australia with over 130 members including academics, research staff and students. The institute works on a mixture of fundamental and commercially orientated research projects in computer vision and machine learning, with a strong track record of publication in the top venues. The University’s Computer Vision research is amongst the best in the world. Find out more at https://www.adelaide.edu.au/aiml/home.

About the role:

As a Machine Learning Researcher , you will perform research and/or product development for multiple scientific or engineering disciplines including Machine Learning, Computer Science, Signal or Image Processing, Communication and Analytics with tasks including:

  • Executing application-driven R&D projects within a multi-disciplinary team.
  • Designing and implementing solutions and prototypes that draw from the state-of-the-art in academic literature to deliver transformational capability.
  • Partnering with academia, government and industry to advance technologies with practical relevance, and engaging with the community to showcase your capabilities.
  • Developing your technical and professional expertise to expand the breadth of solutions you may bring to any given problem.

Essential skills and experience:

  • PhD in a related discipline from a recognised institute.
  • Execution of R&D tasks for projects in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Signal or Image Processing, Analytics, or associated disciplines.
  • Participation in multi-disciplinary research teams.
  • Strong communication and influencing skills including the ability to prepare and present concise oral and written reports to stakeholders.

Desirable knowledge and experience:

  • Machine Learning.
  • Signal and /or image processing.
  • Communications and/or radar electronic warfare processing.
  • Communications engineering/modelling, including space-based systems.
  • Sensor systems (imaging, radio frequency, other).
  • Sensor and information fusion, and methods for accounting for data uncertainty.
  • Space systems.

How we reward and support you:

At Lockheed Martin we value our team and the contribution they make every day. We offer rewarding career pathways working on interesting projects that make a difference, continuous professional development and the opportunity to learn from a diverse team of talented individuals.

In return we offer:

  • Competitive Remuneration.
  • Options for genuine work/life flexibility – 9 day fortnight.
  • Membership to Destination Discounts – that saves you money on many every day purchases including supermarkets, petrol, department stores to name a few.
  • Salary packaging for car leasing.

Special Requirements:

Applicants must be eligible for and are required to apply for and maintain a CoA Baseline security clearance.

Employment may be contingent on the satisfactory result of criminal and/or other background screens, which require the collection and transfer of personal information.

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Lockheed Martin supports Equal Employment Opportunity and Diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, harassment free, diverse, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. Diversity and inclusion are the foundation of our culture and reflect our values of doing what’s right, respecting others and performing with excellence. By leveraging our employees’ unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

title: PMO Business Analyst
description:
About Us

Founded in 1961, the Sarah family quickly became a trusted name in the building industry by providing a quality product, delivering outstanding customer service, and following through on our promises. 60 years later, we have cemented ourselves as a multi-awarding winning leader in the industry, most recently as the Master Builders SA 2019 Commercial Builder of the year, and these values remain at the forefront of every project we undertake. We employ over 200 South Australians and pride ourselves on the investment we make in our people.

We currently have an exciting opportunity in our PMO team for a passionate Business Analyst who thrives and succeeds from building strong relationships and partnering with key stakeholders to deliver successful transformational business projects. This role will engage with key stakeholders to analyse and capture business requirements, identify opportunities for continuous improvement, document workflow and processes and support stakeholders through change. Working as part of a high-performing team within an extremely fast-paced environment with a growing organisation, career opportunities are a given!

About the Perks

We believe that our people are a reflection of our service! We offer you not just a job, but an opportunity to partner with other professionals for a lucrative and rewarding career. Not only will you enjoy a great working environment within a purpose-built modern office located just minutes from the CBD, you will also enjoy:

  • Salary Continuance Insurance
  • Work/Life Balance & Volunteer leave in addition to 4 weeks of annual leave
  • Paid parental leave
  • Onsite car parking, gym and shower facilities
  • Access for you and your family to our Employee Assistance Program
  • Annual full health assessments including skin checks
  • Discounted health insurance
  • Annual flu vaccinations

About You!

The successful applicant will have a strong customer service background, will be driven, flexible and passionate. You will possess the following qualifications, skills and experience:

  • A minimum of 3+ years’ experience in a business analysis or continuous improvement role
  • Experience in the analysis and documentation of business requirements including mapping of business processes, information and systems
  • Understanding of business analysis and project management frameworks and methodologies
  • Delivering projects (from conception to implementation and review)
  • Solid experience in stakeholder engagement and change leadership
  • Experience in designing and applying business improvement methods and techniques
  • Qualifications in Business Analysis, Continuous Improvement or Project Management is welcomed, but not mandatory

You will not only be innovative, but you will also be able to provide expert advice and support to key stakeholders on continuous improvement opportunities, information management, reporting and analytics and business systems.

How to Apply

All applications are managed through our employment website, follow the ‘Apply for this job’ link below for more information and to submit your application. Applications will remain open until the position is filled although early applications are encouraged.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

Eastwood 5063 SA

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
• Permanent Position
  • Located in Adelaide but open to Sydney based candidates.

How will I Help?

Situated within the Mortgage Operations Insights and Portfolio Team, the Senior Business Analyst is responsible for executing various IT and Operations Business driven initiatives and process redesign activities, to deliver on Westpac’s vision and strategic priorities. You will work within Group Operations (GO) to define and document what is required for change to the Mortgage Operations business processes, policies, and information systems to create a seamless home loan experience.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Design and implement solutions from initiation stage to delivery, to standardise and align processes across the Mortgage Operations business functions.
  • Analyse, identify and recommend approaches to deliver on the goals and objectives of initiatives.
  • Actively contribute to helping the Mortgage Operations business unit reach their aims as outlined by the FY22 Mortgages program of work.
  • Schedule and facilitate Requirements Workshops and co-ordinate and complete analysis activities.
  • Collaborate with business partners, technology partners, suppliers, and customer groups to analyze, validate, document, inform and communicate business requirements.

What’s in it for me?
You’ll play a significant part of the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our purpose is helping Australians succeed. So, we’ll back you in the development of your career, internal career prospects, and flexible working. You’ll also keep learning to grown, backed by a fantastic team of people with a can-do, supportive structure.

What do I need?

  • 3-5 years’ experience in a Business Analyst role on major end-to-end business transformation projects.
  • Demonstrated understanding of Business Analysis Frameworks and/or methodologies.
  • Exemplify a high level of self-motivation, organisation, and communication.
  • A well founded understanding of technology and business systems strategically and operationally.
  • Mortgage experience is desirable but not essential.

What is it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team of people who love helping others succeed. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs.

How do I Apply?

Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.

As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.

The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We’ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they’re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.

The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.

By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy, and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.

Our people are our highest priority, and we are committed to placing our redeployees in available roles before we review other applicants.

title: Senior Analyst
description:
About us

At Accolade Wines, our purpose is to enrich everyday moments. As one of the world’s leading wine companies, our award-winning portfolio includes beloved brands such as Hardys, Grant Burge, St Hallett, House of Arras, Mud House, Jam Shed and many more. We are one of the largest wine producers in the world – we’ve been around since 1836, and our portfolio has won nearly 9,000 international wine show awards in the last decade.

About the role

The driving force behind our business is our people – we have over 1,500 staff across Australia, the UK, Europe, Asia, South Africa, New Zealand and the Americas, and every one of us is passionate about making the ordinary extraordinary through our amazing wines.


We are now recruiting for a Senior Analyst to join our global Finance team. This position is working within our Supply Chain Finance team, reporting to our Global Inventory & Strategic Sourcing, Senior Finance Manager. In this role you will be focused on supply inventory on a global scale, partnering with key stakeholders to provide analytical support in ensuring wine inventory positions are optimised, balancing risk and supporting future growth.


You will be based in our Adelaide office, with flexibility up to three days working from home.


This role is full-time and permanent.

Key responsibilities include:

•    Partner with key stakeholders on the delivery of the Global Supply Chain CAPEX budget in full and on time; and provide analytical support for ensuring capital allocation decisions are maximised across the global supply chain
•    Support in tracking the value creation pipeline; ideation, quantification and execution across grape and bulk wine sourcing
•    Provide analytical support to ensure AW’s global inventory position is balanced, and risks articulated with regards to future supply and demand positions
•    Delivering timely and accurate monthly management reporting, including future focused insights, global cash flow, inventory forecasting
•    Building accurate forecasts and annual plan financials

What you’ll bring:

•    Strong analytical and numerical skills, with proficiency in Excel
•    Experience working in a similar Senior Analyst position, ideally with experience in the FMCG industry
•    Autonomy and the flexibility to execute on strategy as well as deliver excellent hands-on work
•    Strong interpersonal skills, both verbal and written
•    University Degree in Accounting or related discipline
•    Professional Accounting qualification
•    Proactivity, excellent organisational skills and a passion for wine!

What you can expect:

Accolade Wines will provide the ideal climate and a hand-picked rewards package for you to make a difference in our successful and growing business.

You will also have access to:
•    Wine allowance and access to unique wine specials
•    Flexible working (Up to 2-3 days working from home)
•    Modern office located in our new modern office in the heart of the Adelaide CBD
•    Loyalty Leave
•    Accolade Wines Anniversary day off
•    Go Beyond Day - making a different in your local community
•    Access to an extensive online learning library
•    Private Health Insurance Discounts
•    Annual Flu Vaccination Program
•    Employee Assistance Program
•    Various exclusive employee discounts


Want to find out more? Watch us in action here: https://player.vimeo.com/video/ 296545118

title: Data Migration Analyst - .Net, ETL, SSIS, TFS - based in Darwin
description:
Large enterprise organisation based in Darwin and delivering very complex, high value, and / or high-risk ICT programs and multi-year digital transformation initiatives is seeking Data Analysts to work on data migration and other data related activities within an Enterprise Project Services program and contribute to design and architecture deliverables.

Key Duties & Responsibilities:

The Data Analyst(s) will be required to work on data migration and other data related activities for their allocated EPS program and contribute to design and architecture deliverables. High-level responsibilities are as follows:

• Work with subject matter experts and project team members to define, document and communicate data migration requirements and associated data migration business rules; and conduct walk throughs with stakeholders to obtain validation and approvals.

• Develop and provide input into the design, planning and management of data migration processes to deliver source to target data mapping and data convergence, cleansing validation and synchronisation rules.

• Provide input and support to the migration of data from one system to another including legacy and staging source environments.

• Perform data migration testing, reconciliation and exception reporting. • Identify opportunities for enhancements and refinements to data governance and data management practices, processes and standards for effectively carrying out data migration activities.

• Identify data quality issues and recommend remediation actions.

Essential Skills and Experience:

• Demonstrated experience in data analysis on multi system data convergence and migration projects.

• Demonstrated extensive experience (at least 5 years) in gathering and documenting data requirements, data migration business rules and development of complex data maps.

• Experience as an MSSQL Database Developer in creating Stored Procedures and Views.

• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse and disseminate significant amounts of information across project teams and stakeholders with attention to detail and accuracy.

• High level oral, written and interpersonal communication skills including ability to communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders.

• Experience in project/program management within established structures with the ability to work to tight deadlines and competing priorities.

• Experience in working collaboratively within a team environment with high priority deliverables, and ability to guide and knowledge transfer to project team members.

• Experience in developing extract-transform-load (ETL) processes using tools such as Microsoft SSIS or IBM InfoSphere DataStag

Desirable Skills and Experience:

• Tertiary qualifications in IT, computer science or software engineering.

• Experience using Atlassian tools such as Jira, Bitbucket (Git) and Confluence.

• Experience with Microsoft data platform, including tools such as SSIS and Master Data Services.

• Experience with the Microsoft platform in the development of data migration processes e.g: .NET Framework, Team Foundation Server (TFS), T-SQL.

• Experience with Enterprise Architect Data modelling methodology.

Personal Qualities required of Candidate(s):

• High level social and written skills with ability to effectively support colleagues and stakeholders in the project and other interested stakeholders.

• Ability to work either in a large team environment with members of diverse cultures and backgrounds or remote offices connected to Darwin.

• Self-starter with high personal drive and a positive attitude.

• Disciplined and accountable for supporting and maintaining work products.

• Behaves in a respectful and professional manner, maintaining high integrity and transparency when delivering work.

• Excellent problem solver and critical thinker.

• Promotes teamwork and collaboration by engaging stakeholders and team members.

• Services Personnel are also expected to abide (and confirm they will) by the DCDD Corporate Values of Honesty, Professional, Respectful, Accountable and Innovative.

The successful applicant will be required to be based in Darwin for the duration of the contract.

title: Data Warehouse Administrator
description:
• Northern Adelaide Local Health Network - Lyell McEwin Hospital, Elizabeth Vale & Modbury Hospital , Modbury
  • Total Indicative Remuneration: $81,543 - $85,429 p.a. - ASO4 - Temporary Full Time - 37.5 hours per week Until 30 June 2023.

The Data Warehouse Administrator contributes to the delivery of trusted, timely and actionable data to support the Northern Adelaide Local Health Network’s (NALHN’s) clinical, operational and strategic decisions.

The role assists with facilitating access to data for stakeholder use, including, but not limited to use of the NALHN Data Warehouse. The Data Warehouse Administrator:

  • Maintains expert knowledge of database management and extraction methods and tools, as well as knowledge of the Data Warehouse, its multiple data sources, and the applications that interface with it.
  • Assists with the development and implementation of data extraction, data transformation, and data loading processes.
  • Carries out agreed operational procedures of a routine nature, such as systems modifications, maintenance and problem resolution.
  • Contributes to documentation in relation to data sources, extraction, testing and auditing procedures.
  • Liaises with a range of internal and external stakeholders to assess data requirements and translate these into tangible digital health projects.

COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement under the Emergency Management (Healthcare Setting Workers Vaccination) (COVID-19) Directions 2021 to work in SA Health/health care setting.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working including part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role.

Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory Criminal History Check.
