title: Demand Analyst | Manufacturing | International Operations
description:
You will come from a manufacturing, FMCG, Retail or Pharma background. You will be adept at demand planning for a high number of SKUs across multiple, international DC's.

The key function of this role is to develop and maintain accurate and reliable forecasts to ensure all customer demand is met and we have the policies to support the demand planning process for the business.

You will forge strong stakeholder relationships across the business whilst providing a proactive and supportive demand planning experience to support the Group’s growth agenda.

The Role;
  • Developing accurate and reliable demand forecasts for the business.
  • Maintaining, developing and improving demand and inventory systems, policies and processes.
  • Maintaining Inventory parameters to support continuity of supply (ISP – item site planning)
  • Working collaboratively with sales and operations stakeholders to ensure current and accurate forecasting information is utilised for demand forecasts.
  • Building and maintaining positive relationships with stakeholders for all supply chain activities.
  • Supporting any training, coaching, and education requirements for supply chain team members and key stakeholders in the forecasting process.
  • Staying up to date with market fluctuations to anticipate demand trends and managing any exceptional demand changes or risks with communication and resolution.
  • Clarifying and simplifying what is required to meet and exceed customer expectations.
  • Contributing actively to the Group Supply Chain team and working closely with the Inventory Planners.
  • Preparing and maintaining relevant reports in relation to demand planning.
  • Actively supporting the S&OP process through the integration of systems and processes.
Qualifications;
  • Tertiary qualification in Supply Chain Management highly regarded.
  • Prior experience in a demand analysis role, preferably with experience supporting forecasting with key stakeholders.

Competencies and Relevant Experience;
  • High-level engagement and collaboration skills at all levels of the business, with the ability to influence outcomes
  • Strong attention detail and a flair for improving systems and processes.
  • High levels of professional credibility and personal integrity that builds trust.
  • Results oriented, goal driven and outcome focused.
  • Excellent problem-solving ability including use of sound judgement.
  • High-level numerical reasoning skills.
  • Experience with supply chain systems and advanced MS Excel skills.
  • Plans effectively and takes accountability for delivering on expectations.
  • Experience with systems and processes to support our S&OP strategies will be highly regarded.
If this sounds like a role you think you'd excel in - then we'd love to hear from you!

title: Business Analyst - Finance Systems
description:
• Exciting opportunity to join SA's iconic RAA
  • Permanent full-time position based at Mile End
  • Flexible Work Arrangements including opportunity to WFH

Your new opportunity

This exciting newly created position will see you administer and develop the financial management system (Technology One) and provide support and assistance with associated systems used throughout RAA.

As an integral member of our team, it will be your responsibility to:

  • Ensure all finance systems are available for use by the organisation and licence numbers are appropriate
  • Review existing software in meeting accounting requirements of the Association and reported to Finance Business Partner - Technology
  • Maintain accurate reporting from finance systems
  • Assist in the preparation of business cases, delivery plans, test cases or other related documentation
  • Ensure accuracy and validity of all accounting transactions through appropriate system controls and monitoring

What will set you apart from the rest

At RAA we hire on cultural add first and technical fit second, however, to be successful in this role you will need:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Business/Accounting or IT is desirable
  • Excellent numeracy and accuracy skills with demonstrated high level of analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Experience in all aspects of Technology One including robust knowledge of building ETLs, writing and maintaining Crystal reports and SQL tables
  • Advanced knowledge of the principles of computerised accounting systems
  • Demonstrated knowledge of business analysis principles and practices
  • Experience with a range of accounting packages, including the use of reporting tools to extract financial data

What sets us apart from the rest

To ensure our employees feel valued, empowered and celebrated we provide a range of employee benefits including:

  • Free RAA premium road service & discounts on all RAA Products
  • Flexible Work Arrangements including opportunity to WFH
  • Ongoing Training & Development Opportunities & Study Support Program
  • Wellbeing Facilities and Corporate Health Insurance Plan
  • On-site Cafe with Barista - plus much more!

Who we are -

As one of the state's largest and most iconic organisations, we're proud to make things better for members and better for our community. More than 780,000 members choose us to deliver peace of mind through our trusted range of motor, home and travel products and services. We're also one of the state's largest employers (and growing!), with more than 1200 employees working collectively with the common goal to keep our members moving.

How to apply

Simply hit "Apply for this job" to attach a CV and cover letter addressed to Abby Waites, Talent Acquisition Consultant.

Applications close 4pm Wednesday 18th May, 2022

Please note applications may be short-listed and progressed prior to the closing date.

We're committed to building a workplace that's diverse and inclusive, where employees are embraced for their unique qualities and valued for their contributions. We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in everyone, and helps us to give our members better service.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
At Escient, we are embarking on the next phase of our growth journey. To facilitate our continued growth, we are looking for talented Senior Business Analysts to join our team and drive the delivery of our services to our clients in our Adelaide office.

To be successful as a consultant you will have a passion for wanting to help clients:
  • deal with change
  • become more human
  • deliver on their purpose, and
  • navigate complexity.
You will also have:
  • 5+ years proven experience as a Business Analyst.
  • strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills and attention to detail.
  • hands-on experience with change frameworks and project lifecycles
  • excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • relevant tertiary qualification is desirable.
Working closely with other consultants, you will deliver end-to-end business analysis activities including requirements gathering, process mapping, workshop facilitation and the development of solution scope documents. You will also have the opportunity to lead and contribute to internal initiatives that matter to you through our innovation fund.

As anyone who has worked in consulting will know, no two engagements are the same – one day you could be defining complex business requirements, the next engagement developing a Digital Strategy. This unique opportunity is as challenging as it is rewarding and a big tick for those who thrive on change, growth and development.

You will be a natural communicator, able to organise and participate in meetings with key business stakeholders, and your warm and engaging style will allow you to develop strong relationships with stakeholders at all levels.

Who should apply?
If you are inspired by the idea of helping to shape the future in a values-led organisation, then submit your application by providing an original cover letter or video application outlining why you want to work for Escient and how you demonstrate our core values. Our core values are integral to our culture and our recruitment process, and applications that do not include a cover letter will not be shortlisted.

Fitting in with our culture will be the key to your success in this role. You will be engaging, confident and passionate. Structured in your approach and creative in your solutions. You prefer to work with people and your communication skills, both written and verbal are first class.

Escient is an organisation with a growth mindset, always looking at ways to deliver more to our clients and employees alike. This means that by joining us you will also have a unique opportunity to contribute internally to the growth of our organisation, allowing you to use some of those entrepreneurial skills you have hidden up your sleeve.

With additional benefits such as annual technology and professional membership allowances, purchased annual leave and an EVP that delivers on providing meaningful work, across multiple regions sometimes, and a culture that is envied by our competitors, why would you want to work anywhere else?

About Escient
Founded in August 2016, Escient’s purpose is to help shape the future (for organisations, people and the planet).

We focus on helping organisations deal with the four key challenges that define today’s business agenda and that will determine success in the future:
  • Dealing with Change: Helping leaders build strong, adaptable and resilient organisations that are ready for a future that’s undefined.
  • Becoming more Human: Helping organisations take a more human- centric approach to the way they design their organisations and how deliver for their people and customers.
  • Delivering on their Purpose: Helping organisations become act more purposefully, enabling them to have a more positive impact on people, society and the planet.
  • Navigating Complexity: Helping organisations find clarity in the complexity – to understand and navigate the ever-changing world and make and deliver on the decisions and strategies that make the most of opportunities.
Our values sit at the heart of how we do this. Being selfless, courageous and creative, underpinned by our human superpower of empathy, is how we deliver better experiences for our clients which we believe deliver better results and lasting impact.

Escient has grown rapidly and was recognised in the AFR’s Fast Starter lists in 2020 and 2021, as well as an employer of choice by The Australian Business Awards in 2020 and 2021. Our growth journey has seen as ranked as one of Australia’s top three start-ups by LinkedIn in 2018 and one of the SA Top 100 Businesses from 2018 through 2021.

We are 100% employee owned with 100+ consultants in Adelaide, Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane.

Please note we can only accept applications from candidates with full working rights in Australia.

title: Senior Analyst Programmer
description:
The South Australian Certificate of Education Board (SACE Board) of South Australia’s primary role is the provision of the South Australian Certificate of Education (SACE) to government, non-government and international schools.

Our purpose is to “shape education so that students thrive” which is achieved through working closely with our stakeholders to inspire, innovate and create the best outcomes for students and their communities so that SACE Graduates are capable to construct their own futures to contribute to a sustainable and socially just world.

The IMPACT you will drive at the SACE Board

The Senior Analyst Programmer is accountable to the Applications Development Team Leader for contributing to the availability of relevant and effective information systems for the SACE Board of South Australia by developing, implementing and maintaining SACE applications. The Senior Analyst Programmer will also provide leadership support to the Applications Development Team Leader.

What you will BRING

Essential Knowledge / Skills / Experience

  • Experience in providing leadership and guidance for applications development and maintenance activities within a team of ICT specialists.
  • Ability to communicate and negotiate effectively verbally and in writing with both technical and non-technical staff, including the presentation of comprehensive information and concepts to individuals and groups.
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively and collaboratively within and across teams in order to achieve agreed outcomes.
  • Proven ability to determine priorities, meet tight deadlines and produce high standard work under pressure.
  • Extensive experience in development of web applications using Java/JEE and Java frameworks (such as Spring, Spring MVC and Hibernate) and experience with JavaScript, JSP, AJAX, CSS, XHTML and relational databases such as MS SQL.
  • Experience in all aspects of the software development lifecycle and proven ability to manage the initiation, development and implementation of application specific improvements and produce supporting technical documentation.
  • Proven ability to manage and control the release of software throughout the development lifecycle and into business operation.

Qualifications
An appropriate tertiary qualification in Information Technology or related discipline is desirable.

Special Conditions

  • Intrastate travel to regional and remote locations; international and interstate travel may be required.
  • A current driver’s licence is required.
  • Some out-of-hours work.
  • The incumbent works under the SACE Board of South Australia Act 1983.
  • An intense time of activity within the SACE Board of South Australia occurs between October and December.  For some roles, the incumbent would not normally be able to take planned leave during this period.
  • Appointment is subject to a satisfactory working with children check obtained through the Department of Human Services to be renewed every 5 years before expiry.

What we can OFFER you!

  • A supportive and dynamic team environment that values the work that you do.
  • Professional development opportunities.
  • Salary Sacrifice Benefits.
  • Flexible work and wellbeing provisions.

Remuneration
ASO6 classification level.  Salary range $94,176 - $99,615 per annum.

APPLYING with Us

If you are passionate about young people and their education, we want to hear from you!

For further information including the role description and to apply, please go to iworkfor.sa.gov.au

ENQUIRIES to
Sam Godfrey, Applications Development Team Leader on 08 8115 4789 or sam.godfrey@sa.gov.au

Applications close: 25/5/2022 at 11:45pm

title: Business/Systems Analyst
company: Talent – SEEK Recruitment Agency of the Year | 7 Time Winner

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
About Tic:Toc
Faster. Smarter. Simpler.

Tic:Toc is a world-leading fintech company based in Adelaide. We use technology and Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) to reimagine financial services processes and create superior experiences for our customers. And we’re growing fast.

You will find an environment waiting for you that is creative, friendly and a lot of fun. We are passionate about what we do, and it shows.

Tic:Toc expects and supports you to challenge traditional thinking and take risks. We are straight-talking and our team is full of bold, brave and energised talent.

What you’ll do
As a Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll work collaboratively day to day with the Data Science and Business teams to build, solve and challenge complex business problems and solutions.

Being in a pivotal role, you will also benefit from being in Tic:Toc’s tight knit workplace and often find yourself interacting with other functions.

At Tic:Toc, we work Agile. While you will be supported with our ways of working, we expect you to work autonomously to achieve defined sprint objectives in the desired timeframes.

Here’s a few other things you’ll do:
  • Develop, mature and modularise all elements of AI models from pre-processing, training/testing through to deployment.
  • Measure, monitor, optimise and recommend changes to productionised models.
  • Build your own models to solve real problems, applying rigour from exploration and experimentation through to production.
  • ETL & data warehousing: don’t worry... we already do this well, so you don’t have to fret about wrangling too much untidy data. But we don’t know everything, so please bring your ideas on how we can evolve!
  • Manage infrastructure associated with all things machine learning and advanced analytics.
  • Be empowered to suggest and action change, drawing on your experience and smarts.
  • Facilitate advanced analytics and computationally expensive modelling using warehoused data.
  • Support ongoing embedding of analytical products within the user experience.
  • Utilise and adhere to Tic:Toc software tools, methodologies, and standards.
You will bring to us
Essential
  • Demonstrated capability in a developer role, ideally with analytical experience.
  • Demonstrated experience in working with and productionising advanced analytics solutions.
  • Demonstrated experience in one or more of these programming/scripting languages: Python, C#, SQL, R, Bash, PowerShell.
  • Demonstrated expertise with deep learning architectures (RNN, LSTM, CNN, reinforcement etc.) and applications (time series, NLP, computer vision, recommendation).
  • Experience with data science ecosystem including Python, Jupyter Notebooks, Anaconda and R.
  • Demonstrated experience with exposing your models via API within a cloud-based environment.
  • At ease with common libraries such as Numpy, Pandas, Keras, Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, fastai, Scikit-Learn.
  • Sound knowledge of probability, machine learning (supervised, unsupervised, semi-supervised) and statistics
  • Demonstrated experience in data processing
Desirable
  • Demonstrated ETL muscle.
  • Experience working in Agile development environments.
  • Experience working with cloud-based technologies such as AWS including but not limited to SageMaker, Redshift, Lambda, S3, Athena, Glue, CloudFormation.
  • Familiarity with Apache Ecosystem including Airflow, Spark, Kafka etc.
  • Experience in Financial Services and familiar within home loan processes and language.
  • Cloud technology and/or Big Data certification.
  • Real-time ETL (streaming).
  • Experience with Big Data tools such as Hadoop, Spark, Pig, Hive, Scala.
  • Tertiary Qualifications in Computer Science, Engineering or Advanced Analytics.
What you’ll get in return
  • We offer an attractive remuneration package + generous employee share plans;
  • We offer flexible working hours and work from home arrangements to balance your work and lifestyle;
  • We offer opportunities to expand career development outside of your everyday including providing leadership training and opportunities;
  • We also offer 1:1 Training, Learning Programs and Mentoring to help you succeed;
  • We have a vibrant culture and workspace to help you do great work;
  • You’ll be part of a company that’s growing rapidly, building products customer’s love.
Whilst all of our job opportunities have specific criteria, if the above describes who you are but you don’t tick all of our boxes, we still encourage you to apply. If you have any questions, you can get in touch with Karam Singh our Talent Sourcer at ksingh@tictoc.com.au or 0401799479 .

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
About Us

G’day Group comprises three leading Australian tourism brands in Discovery Parks, G’day Parks and loyalty program G’day Rewards. Employing more than 1100 people Australia-wide, G’day Group has a truly national footprint of over 280 holiday parks, including 65 fully owned and operated parks. The largest park network in the country, we’re about authentic Australian holiday experiences and inviting all Aussies to say g’day to more of Australia.

We’re on a journey of growth and evolution to reshape the industry, offering the best customer experience underpinned by the best technology. With eyes on domestic and regional tourism like never before we are building a passionate, adaptable, high-performance team to deliver holiday memories that put a smile in every g’day.

The Role

G’Day Parks is embracing the new normal and is undertaking an historic transformation to build the Park experience of the future. Accordingly, significant investment is being made into technology and business processes to provide market leading experiences to our customers in both the physical and digital realm. Working with G’Day Parks means working in a dynamic, fun environment featuring contemporary cloud technologies and utilising “best-in-class” applications, infrastructure, and processes.

Reporting to the Lead Business Analyst, the Senior Business Analyst will be highly visible across the business and critical to the success of the future projects roadmap. This is an exceptionally exciting role for someone that wants to be part of an innovative, industry-defining transformation.

The Senior Business Analyst will apply the latest techniques within the context of our customers and business, to improve customer experience and drive returns.

This role will require you to;

-         Facilitate workshops, interviews and generally elicit requirements.

-         Contribute to sprint planning, project planning and road-mapping sessions.

-         Lead solution design and process design workshops.

-         Collaborate with other BAs by sharing relevant information for other projects and providing support when needed.

-         Ensure that appropriate documentation is created at all stages of the project.

-         Write user stories, epics, business requirements and functional specifications.

-         Work with vendors and consultants to ensure Discovery Parks is getting value from external relationships, whilst also acting as an SME for business requirements.

-         Assist in the preparation of business cases and project evaluation activities.

-         Identify opportunities for processes improvements.

-         Work closely with product owners to define requirements.

-         Provide support and guidance to developers and testers regarding business requirements and acceptance criteria.

-         Support the design, development, and delivery of the change management plan.

-         Support the IT Management team in delivering a best-in-class ecosystem through providing the deliverables in a timely and effective manner.

-         Assist in the development of a best practice IT Business Analysis capability.

-         Support ad-hoc reporting efforts to surface data to different business units.

Your Experience

Relevant tertiary qualifications, combined with agile or traditional certifications, along with commercial working knowledge of business analysis principles, methodologies and tools is essential.

To be successful in this role you will have exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal. You will be flexible and adaptable. Your collaborative style is a natural strength, as is your business acumen and understanding of organizational issues and challenges.

You will possess a high level of energy, self-motivation, autonomy, initiative, and attention to detail to be successful in meeting the business demands at G’Day Parks. Your naturally upbeat and open style will fit our cultural values. You will have a highly organised mindset with the ability to assess the urgency of work allocated to you by various stakeholders.

G’Day is a dynamic company with an energetic ‘market disrupter’ reputation. If you are passionate, adventurous, and ready to hit the ground running, we want to hear from you.

Discover more to life - APPLY NOW!

Prior to an offer of employment being made, candidates must provide authority for a Federal Police Clearance to disclose any criminal offences or charges.

Discovery Parks is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our staff, customers and the communities we operate in. Due to the latest highly contagious Covid-19 Delta variant, Discovery Parks has implemented a vaccination policy which requires all employees, wherever possible, to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19. This covid vaccination policy applies to all new Discovery Parks employees.

title: Senior Reporting Analyst - Commercial
description:
• Major Services Group – Adelaide CBD
  • Excellent analytical and Systems reporting
  • Develop complex reporting and visual statements

A leading national Asset Services group has won a significant long-term contract with the SA Government and has a large team supporting the management and operational delivery of facilities assets across the state.


Reporting to a Project Director, you will drive the reporting against critical contract KPIs, program reporting analysis, client report development and interpretation.  Your depth of systems and analysis is needed within a larger enterprise b2b environment, where SAP, Python and similar software is in place, and your capacity to extract, manage and assess critical information, articulate the results and interpretation of data, and engage in a positive and constructive manner with internal stakeholders is critical to success.


Ideally you have gained qualifications within a quantitative discipline, and have a solid IT user capability, and developed reports, presentations, and analytical systems within a large corporate or contract provider workplace.  A strong team culture, positive workplace is provided, with a desire for you to innovate, deliver strong reporting information and systems with minimal management is important in this large and fast paced business.


Visual presentation and working with both client and internal stakeholders in addition to core analytical work is a key balance.  Please send an updated word resume and we will review and commence interviews directly.

title: Team Lead Data Management | Adelaide
description:
Team Lead Data Management | Sydney

Novotech is the Asia-Pacific CRO designed for biotech, accelerating clinical development via cutting-edge technology to improve patient lives.

Working in a fast-paced and adaptable environment, we strive to set the benchmark for both business and clinical trial performance across all clinical trial phases and therapeutic areas.

Our people are critical in meeting organizational, and client objectives and we place a strong emphasis on creating a collaborative, transparent, and inclusive work environment where everyone is supported to achieve.

About the Position

The Team Lead Data Management will have responsibility for Data Management staff as assigned and ensures that line reports conduct clinical trials according to all applicable Good Clinical Practice (GCP), Regulatory Requirements, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and the Project Agreement

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage a team of professional Data Management staff.
  • Define and prioritize resource requirements and manage resource assignments across projects.
  • Actively contribute to recruitment of new staff.
  • Review and prioritise resource allocation on projects, liaising with CDM/PM as required.
  • Ensure on-boarding, training and integration of all new line reports and that process is completed as per company policy. Ensure that they understand the company policies and procedures appropriate to their position
  • Performance management of line reports; set and agree written goals and objectives, competency assessments, coordinate salary reviews and promotions and maintain succession plans.
  • Support the delivery of consistent training and development of line reports in order to develop growth and promotion from within the Data Management group
  • Ensure adhere to Company policies, procedures and guidelines and be quality minded in performance of duties

Skills, Knowledge and Experience

  • A degree in clinical, biological or mathematical sciences or related field, with a minimum of 4-6 years of relevant work experience.
  • Advanced knowledge of Data Management processes and systems.
  • Outstanding written and oral communication skills are required.
  • Solid understanding of clinical drug development process is preferred.
  • Proven leadership skills and the ability to lead by example and to encourage team members to seek solutions.
  • Previous people management experience is preferred.
  • Excellent organisational skills and demonstrated ability to manage projects

Novotech is proud to offer a great workplace. We are committed to being an employer of choice for gender equality and providing an inclusive work environment where everyone is treated fairly and with respect.

Our team members are passionate about what we do, but we understand work is only of the things that is important to them. We support our team members with flexible working options, paid parental leave for both parents, flexible leave entitlements, wellness programs and ongoing development programs.

We are looking for people who are passionate about working clinical research and biotech, including people who identify as LGBTIQ+, have a disability or have caring responsibilities.

We are a Circle Back Initiative Employer and commit to respond to every application. We look forward to contacting you regarding your application.

title: Geology Manager
description:
Geology Manager

About Alligator Energy

Alligator Energy Ltd (AGE or Alligator) is experiencing rapid growth as we develop our Samphire Uranium Project in South Australia, advance our three other exploration projects in uranium, nickel, cobalt, plus evaluate future resource, project and M&A opportunities. We are seeking an experienced Geology Manager to join our team working on the Samphire Uranium Project to advance its resource, geological and geoscience development in addition to AGE’s other exploration projects.

About the Role

Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, your role as Geology Manager will be instrumental in leading the relevant technical aspects of the Samphire project to transition from its current inferred resource through to indicated status and feasibility studies as a pre-curser to decision to mine. You will also apply your expertise into Alligator’s other exploration projects. This is a leadership role with a strong technical and management component. In this role you will:

  • Develop an understanding of the regional and project geology, hydrogeology, geophysics, and historical drilling to expand the existing resource in AGE’s Samphire tenement holdings.
  • Seek to understand the value drivers for the Samphire Project; assess and communicate technical risk, including the geological uncertainties and potential impacts for ISR operations.
  • Management and oversight of all Samphire drilling programs, including planning, performance, cost control, administration, logistics and reporting.
  • Implementation of WHS policies and procedures to ensure field operations exceed statutory requirements in addition to measurement and communication of WHS performance indicators.
  • Mentor, supervise & professionally develop your team as it expands.
  • Responsible for ensuring compliance with all regulatory requirements, ensuring work program approvals and reporting support program execution timelines.
  • Implement value-add software/platforms for continuous improvement of geological data management and analysis.
  • Ensure respectful relationships and an open communication are maintained with all landowners, indigenous groups, and community in the region.
  • Evaluation of additional exploration and resource project opportunities.
  • Reporting to the CEO / Board as required.

We are seeking candidates with the following:

  • Degree qualified (or higher) in Geology/Geoscience.
  • Highly proficient in QA/QC, geological data analysis and attention to detail.
  • Prior experience in exploration and/or delineation of sedimentary-hosted uranium deposits including roll-front mapping.
  • Demonstrated experience in Australian Resource and Reserve reporting standards (JORC) of exploration results and mineral resource estimates for uranium.
  • Familiarity in unconformity-type uranium geological models (prior experience in exploring in these terrains would be highly regarded).
  • Demonstrated proficiency in downhole-well log interpretation software and well-log interpretation.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in 3D geological modelling and GIS software (Vulcan, Leapfrog, Micromine, QGIS, MapInfo or others).
  • Prior experience in supervision and managing drilling programs, contractors, and related stakeholders (landholders, indigenous groups, regulators etc.)
  • Prior experience in exploration field crew management
  • Experience in statutory tenement reporting to SA Government regulators and obtaining approvals for field work programs.
  • Demonstrated experience in tenement management.
  • Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills including both written and verbal.

You can find out more about Alligator Energy here: https://alligatorenergy.com.au. Applications will close Friday 27 May 2022.

title: Management Accountant
description:
ABOUT ADBRI LIMITED
Adbri was formerly known to Australians as Adelaide Brighton, one of Australia's pioneering construction materials and industrial mineral manufacturing companies. As a proud Australian ASX listed leader, supporting local economies and communities, their purpose is to build a better Australia through their respected brands and product range in cement, lime, concrete, aggregates, paving, bricks and industrial minerals. Their footprint spans across Australia with 44 quarries, 95 concrete plants, 16 cement and lime facilities and 10 concrete product facilities which ensures they are ready to take on any challenge.

Adbri's name is synonymous with cement and lime; today, their manufacturing facilities and distribution centres are strategically located in Australia's major mining and construction markets of Western Australia, South Australia, Victoria, New South Wales, Queensland, and Northern Territory.

ABOUT THE MANAGEMENT ACCOUNTANT
Joining the Cement & Lime segment, one of the most iconic segments of Adbri and reporting to the Finance Manager - Cement & Lime, you will be a key element to the team in providing financial support, information and analysis to the finance business partners and the wider Cement & Lime division team. Key aspects to the role will be assisting in the formulation of budgets, forecasts and reporting along with supporting the month end through analysis, journals and accruals. This role will exposure you to a complex ASX listed finance environment, build your true finance business partner capabilities, utilise your aptitude to learn cost to produce and manufacturing methodology.

The key responsibilities of this role include:

  • Assist in month end close for the division, including journals, accrual, cost transfers, reporting and analysis
  • Analysis and reporting of major shut down costs for the sites
  • Ensure appropriate coding structures are maintained within SAP including taking appropriate action where required to correct
  • Assist in the development of the budget and forecasts in conjunction with the finance business partners
  • Ensuring reporting deadlines are met and compliance with financial procedures are adhered to
  • A commitment to providing exceptional customer service, both internally and externally
  • Drive efficient continuous improvement opportunities into the business, using systems and processes

The key requirements for this role include:

  • Relevant Tertiary qualifications, or a related discipline
  • CPA or CA membership or currently working towards
  • Relevant management accounting experience including supporting budgeting, forecasting and reporting activities
  • Experience with accurate and timely preparation of financial information within agreed timelines
  • The ability to foster a positive team environment

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply please click apply or call Jessica Gouscos on +61 8 82163555 for a confidential discussion.

title: Payroll Systems and Data Governance Lead
description:
At BAE Systemswe are all systems go as we continue to drive innovation and seek passionate and talented people to join our business.  We currently have an exciting and unique opportunity for a Payroll Systems and Data Governance Lead. This role will play a pivotal role within our central payroll team and will be responsible for driving system changes and process improvement.

What this opportunity will mean for you:

  • Purposeful work where your efforts are recognized in an environment where you can thrive
  • Joining an organisation that is passionate about developing some of the most impressive careers in the world
  • Industry-leading flexibility options to unlock the talent and diversity of every individual
  • Unique opportunities to contribute to programs of national significance whilst growing your skills
  • A strong safety culture, inclusive teams and work to be proud of, underpinned by a compelling set of values

Your new role will be accountable for:

  • Ensuring that payroll data is sampled and checked in line with agreed processes and that actions resulting from inconsistencies are progressed, managed or delegated as required
  • Ensuring that privacy, data protection and relevant security protocols are built into governance arrangements and followed in practice
  • Identifying system improvements in consultation with ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning), preparation of test scripts for systems testing and implementation, including liaisons with other system/module owners to ensure structured approach to integrated testing and delivery.
  • Managing business ad-hoc reporting requirements to ensure that data integrity is maintained, regular reports are reviewed for accuracy and confirmation of meeting   business needs as well as produced on time and within the required expectations.
  • Regular consultation with key system users to assess user requirements, this includes the provision of expert advice and solutions to module owners to assist with decision making process.  Ensuring HRMS (Human Resources Management System) processes are effective and efficient and are aligned to business processing functionality
  • Working and engaging with the key stakeholders across the business to help improve and further develop the payroll systems functionality and capability.
  • This role also will be looking after multiple time capture systems.
  • Identifying, developing and implementing new and existing payroll processes, procedures and forms used by the business
  • Working with key stakeholders to ensure that robots and dashboards are developed and updated to maximise efficiency
  • Working with multiple internal and external stakeholders
  • Maintaining BMS (Business Management Systems) documentation to ensure it reflects new and/or updated changes.

About you

As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you'll have:

  • Broad knowledge and understanding of people management principles and practices
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal and the sensitivity to understand audience needs and adapt style accordingly
  • Proactive approach to both project management and influencing change
  • Highly developed problem-solving skills
  • Highly developed planning and organisational skills
  • Ability to coach and develop others
  • Preferably exposure to ORACLE ERP - Payroll module
  • Exposure to time-keeping systems e.g. Kronos/Ultramain/Crown
  • Experience of gathering requirements and translating these into specific improvements
  • Experience in the design and improvement of business processes and data flows
  • A high level of attention to detail
  • Experience of managing governance and approvals frameworks
  • Sound organisational skills and ability to meet deadlines
  • Proficiency in various computer packages, including Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, general knowledge of human resources related systems
  • Ability to work independently and cooperatively with business and technical resources
  • Ability to create system testing documentation to ensure accurate delivery of enhancements

About us

BAE Systems' advanced defence technology solutions protect people and national security, keeping critical information and infrastructure secure.  For more than 65 years we have searched for new ways to provide our customers in Australia with a competitive edge across air, land, sea, cyber, space and electronic domains.

In terms of our culture, it's safety focused and inclusive.  For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of our more than 4,100 employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. It also means providing a safe, family friendly, flexible and supportive place to work.  Join us.

Applications should be addressed to: Lidia Morris, Talent Acquisition Specialist

Whilst applications must be made online, confidential enquiries are very welcome via email: lidia.morris@baesystems.com

We welcome and strongly encourage applications from women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders for these opportunities.  An inclusive culture and an exciting, supportive career opportunity awaits.  We are also proud to be a WORK180 Endorsed Employer for Women. If you would like to know more information about how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives here: https://tinyurl.com/Work180BAE-Systems-Australia

We are a 2021 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant

To learn about other employment opportunities at BAE Systems, please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au

BAE Systems Australia will never request money from you during the recruitment process. Please be aware of scam messages asking for money for an administration fee, visa or similar. If you receive such a message please report it to Scam Watch www.scamwatch.gov.au/report-a-scam.

Job applications should only be submitted via the BAE Systems Australia website and not via email.  If you receive an email from BAE Systems that does not utilise "@baesystems.com " as the domain, it is not legitimate.  BAE Systems does not use gmail, aol, Hotmail or similar accounts

title: Data Platform Architect
description:
The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services, is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organisations to realise their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2020 combined revenues of EUR 15.8 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com [link removed].

Let's talk about the team:

Our Insights and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner with Capgemini for a very good reason - our exceptional people.

Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:

  • Define and ensure a comprehensive and coherent view across Business, Information, Systems and Technology, not just to design IT systems but to deliver Business Change which may also be supported and enabled by IT.
  • Define solutions strategies and roadmaps. Builds Capgemini's image and reputation to the client and the marketplace. Leads coordination of architecture solutions to meet senior level expectations at both client and Capgemini and/or partners. Leads strategic planning of technology and business solutions for the enterprise.  Demonstrates thought leadership in topics in the architect community and shows a passion for technology. Demonstrates business acumen by delivering the architecture program.
  • Define and ensure comprehensive and coherent view across Business, Information Systems and Technology
  • Define strategy and architecture for data estate modernisation, legacy to cloud data migration, data pipeline, data analytics, machine learning pipeline, data trust and data engineering solutions
  • Drive business change supported and enabled by Data and AI
  • You will provide technical solutions to project team to perform design to deployment related activities, provide guidance, perform reviews, prevent, and resolve technical issues
  • You will work with stakeholders including the Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues
  • You will assess and propose methods to improve system performance by conducting tests, troubleshooting, and integrating new element

Let's talk about your capability and experience:

  • Have a minimum of 10 years IT experience and minimum 5 years in solution architecture with data background, whilst leading architecture and solutioning strategy
  • Develop portfolio products and service solutions for Capgemini and Clients
  • Demonstrate technical strategy leadership in one or more technology areas and/or one or more customer facing situations
  • Show proven thought leadership in technical implementation and practices
  • Lead and motivate multi-functional teams in dispersed or complex environments
  • Set and manage the client's expectations from the start
  • Be able to drive projects and initiatives from conception through to implementation
  • Demonstrate excellent written, verbal communication and listening skills
  • Harness your excellent teamwork and leadership skills
  • Have experience managing business and technical stakeholders, managing multi-shore resources in a particular technical area (those being configuration, customisation, data estate modernisation, integration)
  • Be Knowledgable and experienced in Functional Architecture Design, Technical Solution Design
  • Have experience with cloud data platforms and technologies (AWS/Azure) and Big Data technologies (Hadoop/Spark)

Let's talk about what's in it for you!

Passionate people are Capgemini's Ace of Spades - join us to discover a career that will challenge, support and inspire you. Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. You will work alongside some very smart and inspiring people on exciting projects and you will also enjoy incredible benefits.  We offer flexible work practices and 40 hours of self-development every year with a huge selection of learning opportunities to choose from. Capgemini constantly aims for excellence in its operations and the employee experience it provides. In line with our Purpose, Flexible Working aims to improve the overall people experience by providing an optimal work-life balance, more autonomy and freedom in when, where and how we work.

As "Architects of Positive Futures", Capgemini actively supports the community in 3 ways:

Diversity and Inclusion - we believe diversity of thought fuels excellence and innovation, which is why we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age.  To support our commitment to diversity and inclusion, we celebrate or recognise special events and days of significance that are important to our employees such as Diwali, Bastille Day, Pride, IDAHOBIT, IWD and International day of people with Disabilities.  Our Employee Resource Groups Women@Capgemini, OutFront, Indigenous, Parents and Carers and Sustainability Community of Practice support the grassroots passion of employees to drive our diversity agenda and effect change.

Digital inclusion - at Capgemini we are using our skills to drive social impact initiatives focusing on helping society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution.  We also provide employees with opportunities to give back to the community through charity projects and volunteer days.

Environmental Sustainability - Capgemini joined the CDP's (Carbon Disclosure Project) prestigious "A list" for its commitment to the Net-Zero economy. As well as focusing on helping our clients transform towards more sustainable business models, Capgemini recently announced its commitment to becoming a netzero busines by 2030 .

Recognised by Ethisphere as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the last 9 years in a row, ethics and values are at the heart of Capgemini's corporate culture and business.  Embedded in our DNA, our seven values - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty - have remained the same since company inception in 1967. To see how we bring these values to life, visit www.capgemini.com/au-en/careers/ [link removed] and listen to some of our employee's stories.

#GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.

Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.

#LI-YT1

title: Risk Analyst
description:
How will I Help?

We currently have multiple opportunities for Risk Analysts to join our Financial Crime and Fraud Operations team based in Adelaide with opportunities also available within our Parramatta team.

In this role within the Transaction Monitoring Investigations team you will be responsible for review and analysis of alerts raised by our branch network and other internal stakeholders within the business. Utilising your strong analytical skills, you will work well to deadlines in a fast paced and developing environment. The Westpac Group is required to comply with the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorism Financing (AML/CTF) legislation.  As part of these obligations, the Westpac Group must be capable of identifying, managing and mitigating its ML/TF risks.

This is a 12 months max term opportunity offering 40 hours per week. Our operational hours is between 7:30am – 6pm Monday to Friday

What’s in it for me?
You’ll play a significant part of the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our purpose is helping Australians succeed. So we’ll back you in the development of your career, internal career prospects, and flexible working. You’ll also keep learning to grown, backed by a fantastic team of people with a can-do, supportive structure.

What do I need?

You will have strong communication skills, both written and verbal and have the ability to embrace contribute to and help drive change.  You will be able to adapt to changing policies and procedures as required.

You will have the ability to investigate complex matters to make sound and timely decisions in a manner that meets the relevant legislation and policy compliance requirement.  You will have strong relationship management skills to effectively build strong working relationships with your stakeholders

You will have strong analytical skills and a keen eye for detail.  Background in Banking and Financial Services, Anti Money Laundering / Counter Terrorism Finance legislation and processes would be advantageous but not essential.

What is it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team of people who love helping others succeed. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs.

How do I Apply?

Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.

As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.

The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We’ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they’re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.

The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.

By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy, and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.
