title: Senior Analyst Programmer
description:
The South Australian Certificate of Education Board (SACE Board) of South Australia’s primary role is the provision of the South Australian Certificate of Education (SACE) to government, non-government and international schools.

Our purpose is to “shape education so that students thrive” which is achieved through working closely with our stakeholders to inspire, innovate and create the best outcomes for students and their communities so that SACE Graduates are capable to construct their own futures to contribute to a sustainable and socially just world.

The IMPACT you will drive at the SACE Board

The Senior Analyst Programmer is accountable to the Applications Development Team Leader for contributing to the availability of relevant and effective information systems for the SACE Board of South Australia by developing, implementing and maintaining SACE applications. The Senior Analyst Programmer will also provide leadership support to the Applications Development Team Leader.

What you will BRING

Essential Knowledge / Skills / Experience

  • Experience in providing leadership and guidance for applications development and maintenance activities within a team of ICT specialists.
  • Ability to communicate and negotiate effectively verbally and in writing with both technical and non-technical staff, including the presentation of comprehensive information and concepts to individuals and groups.
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively and collaboratively within and across teams in order to achieve agreed outcomes.
  • Proven ability to determine priorities, meet tight deadlines and produce high standard work under pressure.
  • Extensive experience in development of web applications using Java/JEE and Java frameworks (such as Spring, Spring MVC and Hibernate) and experience with JavaScript, JSP, AJAX, CSS, XHTML and relational databases such as MS SQL.
  • Experience in all aspects of the software development lifecycle and proven ability to manage the initiation, development and implementation of application specific improvements and produce supporting technical documentation.
  • Proven ability to manage and control the release of software throughout the development lifecycle and into business operation.

Qualifications
An appropriate tertiary qualification in Information Technology or related discipline is desirable.

Special Conditions

  • Intrastate travel to regional and remote locations; international and interstate travel may be required.
  • A current driver’s licence is required.
  • Some out-of-hours work.
  • The incumbent works under the SACE Board of South Australia Act 1983.
  • An intense time of activity within the SACE Board of South Australia occurs between October and December.  For some roles, the incumbent would not normally be able to take planned leave during this period.
  • Appointment is subject to a satisfactory working with children check obtained through the Department of Human Services to be renewed every 5 years before expiry.

What we can OFFER you!

  • A supportive and dynamic team environment that values the work that you do.
  • Professional development opportunities.
  • Salary Sacrifice Benefits.
  • Flexible work and wellbeing provisions.

Remuneration
ASO6 classification level.  Salary range $94,176 - $99,615 per annum.

APPLYING with Us

If you are passionate about young people and their education, we want to hear from you!

For further information including the role description and to apply, please go to iworkfor.sa.gov.au

ENQUIRIES to
Sam Godfrey, Applications Development Team Leader on 08 8115 4789 or sam.godfrey@sa.gov.au

Applications close: 25/5/2022 at 11:45pm

title: Adversarial Machine Learning Researcher/Engineer APS Level 4/5-6
description:
The Role
This role can be filled as either:
• Adversarial Machine Learning Researcher
• Adversarial Machine Learning Engineer

You will be part of an S&T team working in the area of Adversarial Machine Learning (AML) undertaking applied research, or engineering tasks, towards quantifying and enhancing the robustness of Machine Learning (ML) solutions for Defence applications.

AML involves countering data-driven attacks on ML solutions, whereby malicious actors modify training or test data to mislead and/or subvert ML predictions. You will help to devise, or implement and evaluate, new robust learning approaches suitable for adversarial environments and undertake research and development into the design and assessment of robust ML solutions for Defence applications, including reinforcement learning and deep learning.

Both roles provide exposure to S&T challenges in cyber security and operations in a military context. In addition, there exists the opportunity to work closely with Australian and international research partners, Defence clients and cyber security domain experts. You will also be supported with training in aspects of cyber security and ML as required, and encouraged to further develop your expertise.

The AML Researcher will also be encouraged to engage with the scientific community. The AML Researcher, under guidance and as part of a multi-disciplinary team, will:

• Contribute to research developing, adapting, applying and assessing robust ML techniques in the context of Defence applications.
• Prepare scientific publications and reports, present outcomes, demonstrate technologies and interact with both Defence clients and the academic/scientific community.
• Maintain up to date knowledge in specific areas of ML and broaden knowledge across areas relating to AML, including cyber security.
• Enhance S&T capability through targeted collaboration with other DST Group teams, academia, industry and other national/international research agencies.

The AML Engineer , under guidance and as part of a multi-disciplinary team, will:

• Contribute to developing, adapting, applying and assessing robust ML techniques in the context of Defence applications.
• Develop software as required to support the development and evaluation of attacks against and defences of ML algorithms.
• Contribute to scientific publications and reports to present outcomes and demonstrate technologies to both Defence clients and the academic/scientific community.
• Maintain up to date knowledge in specific areas of ML and broaden knowledge across areas relating to AML, including cyber security.

• Provide support to enhancing S&T capability through targeted collaboration with other DST Group teams, academia, industry and other national/international research agencies.

About our Team
Cyber and Electronic Warfare Division undertakes research and development focused on identifying, analysing and countering threats to Australia’s defence and national security through electronic means.

Cyberwarfare Operations branch undertakes research and development to help Australian Defence develop an effective cyber warfare capability that enables fight-through in a contested cyber environment.

The Counter Cyber Threats group undertakes research and development to identify, understand and defeat threats to key cyber terrain. Their work supports ADF cyber operations, with a particular focus on defence of military mission systems and platform systems.

Our Ideal Candidate
We are looking for candidates who can build and sustain positive relationships with team members, actively participate in team work and group activities, work collaboratively and operate as effective team members.

The ideal AML Researcher shall also be able to:

• Conduct research into and assist in the development of tools and techniques.
• Contribute to novel techniques published in the scientific literature.
• Research developments in the field and maintain currency through participating in professional activities.

While the ideal AML Engineer shall also be able to:

• Be accountable for and apply software engineering principles to the development of tools and techniques.
• Be current with and experienced in mainstream machine learning libraries.
• Investigate emerging technologies and maintain currency in the field through participating in professional activities.

Application closing date: Sunday the 29th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference DSTG/01991/22 on

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=848A8DDC-B929-A72D-C814-C88BDFD8D8CD

title: Intelligent Agents Scientist APS 4/5-6 (S&T Level 3-4) and EL 1 (S&T Level 5)
description:
The Role
Cyber and Electronic Warfare Division is seeking an early to mid-career researcher to advance the state of the art with respect to intelligent agents and autonomous systems for information warfare. The researcher will be working with a team of scientists and engineers developing self-aware and self-adaptive agents that will be deployed in multi-agent contested environments.

Duties shall include:

  • Researching and architecting algorithms for multi-agent teaming, goal based reasoning and trust management,
  • Identifying gaps in existing multi-agent technologies,
  • Developing prototypes of intelligent agents,
  • Conducting experiments with intelligent agents in both synthetic and real Defence environments and,
  • Working with collaborators internal to DSTG and within academia and industry.

This position will be filled at either S&T3-4 or S&T5 and will be determined by the level of relevant expertise of the successful candidate.


About our Team
Cyber and Electronic Warfare Division undertakes research and development focused on identifying, analysing and countering threats to Australia's defence and national security through electronic means.

The mission of Contested Communications is to develop survivable tactical communications and electronic warfare solutions for contested and degraded cyber electromagnetic environments.
Information Warfare Command and Control (IWC2) STC conducts research and development of command and control (C2) technologies for fighting in and through the contested information environment. Information warfare (IW) occurs within the machine, and necessitates an approach that relies heavily on autonomous operation of cyber, EW and influence operations capabilities, under the oversight of a human command element.

IWC2 research themes include:

  • Information warfare C2 paradigms,
  • Antifragile multi-agent architectures,
  • Autonomous control methodologies,
  • Machine-human integration,
  • Causal modelling and,
  • Scalable and elastic coordination technologies.

We seek to collaborate with others working in similar areas so as to increase critical mass and achieve maximal impact for Defence.

Our Ideal Candidate
Our ideal candidate shall demonstrate initiative and integrity, and have a passion for developing machine intelligence.

Desirable skills and experience include:

  • Ability to think conceptually, to structure, analyse and solve complex problems through sound research and engineering practices,
  • Knowledge of machine learning, computational intelligence, multi-agent coordination and cooperation, and/or system self-organisation paradigms,
  • Skills in software development,
  • The ability to work both as a member of a team and individually and,
  • The ability to inspire, collaborate, and communicate with influence.

Competency in cyber warfare, electronic warfare or command and control would be well regarded.

Application Closing Date: Wednesday 1 June 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, reference DSTG/02110/22

on https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=2DE92CAC-53DD-4F4A-AA95-C88D8314FEDE .

title: Senior Consultant, Workforce Analytics and Data Quality
description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to work flexibly to balance work and family needs?  Do you want the flexibility to negotiate the hours that would suit your busy lifestyle? Then DCP is interested to hear from you.

About the Department
The Department for Child Protection (DCP) plays a key role in the protection of children, young people and their families within South Australia. The department provides support to vulnerable children and young people to be safe, strong and connected.

The Opportunity
The Human Resources Directorate currently have an exciting opportunity to join the team as a Senior Consultant, Workforce Analytics and Data Quality on a full-time or part-time term basis until 16 December 2022.

As the Senior Consultant, Workforce Analytics and Data Quality you will be responsible for managing and improving data quality relating to DCP HR systems, including aligning data and creating consistency between various data systems.  As the expert in workforce analytics and data quality, you will provide sound advice to relevant stakeholders in matters pertaining to data and will work with Shared Services SA, DCP Finance and HR administration, OCPSE and key stakeholders to undertake data quality checks and develop systems and procedures to ensure that all data reporting is consistent and accurate.

In this role you will establish and maintain excellent relationships with field staff and managers around data quality, reporting and processes and procedures that aim to improve data quality across DCP.  You will also oversee key HR Systems including CHRIS21 and HR21 to identify opportunities for improvement and to communicate all relevant changes and system upgrades where applicable. You will provide data to support workforce planning and reporting to inform future strategies, including the development of directorate workforce profiles and Diversity and Inclusion data.

About You
To be successful in this role, you will have strong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to liaise and negotiate with a diverse range of people on sensitive and complex human resource data issues. You will have experience with data integrity and workforce analytics and apply this experience with a high degree of autonomy.

To be successful you must also demonstrate your ability to interpret and understand a broad range of often complex information and systems and a high level of expertise in CHRIS21, coupled with exceptional analytical skills, showing attention to detail and commitment to delivering data analysis with integrity.

To find out more about this role, including the key selection criteria and special conditions , please click on the attached role description.

Successful candidates will be assessed and considered for either classification based on their skills, abilities, knowledge and experience.

People of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander descent and/or those who have a disability are strongly encouraged to apply.

To submit your application and to find the enquiries contact , please click on the 'apply' button to be redirected to the DCPSA Job Board .

Applications close: 13/05/2022 11:00 PM

title: ACCC/AER 2023 Graduate Program (EA2022/1)
description:
• Join a Federal Government agency that has a great reputation
• Varied work
• Be part of projects that make a positive difference

Is the ACCC/AER Graduate Program on your wish list?

Congratulations! It’s time for you to start thinking about your career options for 2023 - you’re probably spending some time looking at all the major employers in the graduate market. Have you thought about working at the ACCC/AER?

The ACCC is an independent statutory authority that administers the Competition and Consumer Act 2010 and other Acts.

The ACCC works to promote effective competition and fair trading in the marketplace to benefit consumers, business and the community, and efficiency in the delivery of certain infrastructure services.

The ACCC shares staff, resources and facilities with the Australian Energy Regulator (AER). The AER is staffed by ACCC employees, but operates as a separate legal entity and has its own board. As well as other duties, the AER is responsible for the economic regulation of the wholesale electricity market and gas transmission networks.

Why the ACCC and AER?

The ACCC/AER is a great place to work because:

  • we have a great reputation and we are highly regarded for the work we do;
  • we have the opportunity to work on lots of different, exciting matters;
  • we can see the difference we are making in the Australian community, particularly through high-profile matters such as the NBN, electricity pricing, product safety financial services, digital platforms, the dairy industry, criminal cartels, consumer data and more;
  • we have a culture that encourages continuous development and diversity and employees who are highly engaged and passionate about what we do.

If you have tertiary qualifications, we believe you could be a good fit within the ACCC/AER and we’d encourage you to apply. This could be from any discipline, for example:

  • Arts and design
  • Business and government
  • Communications, public-relations and media
  • Data analysis and statistics
  • Economics
  • Education and social work
  • Finance and accounting
  • IT, computer science and technology
  • Law
  • Mathematics and engineering
  • Medicine, health and psychology
  • Science and humanities

Joining the ACCC/AER as a graduate, you can expect:

  • $64,616 per annum from 6 February 2023, advancing to $68,096 per annum from mid-May 2023, $73,978 in November 2023 and $82,511 upon successful completion of the program in June 2024.
  • challenging rotations across various Divisions
  • ongoing learning and development opportunities
  • flexible working conditions, including the ability to work part-time (minimum 30 hours per week) regular opportunities to network, socialise, share experiences and develop relationships;
  • an entry level program coordinator and assigned buddy;
  • a workplace that promotes diversity, inclusion and equal opportunity.

Want even more benefits?

In addition to the benefits of the graduate program, as an ongoing employee of the ACCC/AER you will also be eligible for:

  • an attractive remuneration package, including a base salary + 15.4% superannuation and annual salary reviews;
  • excellent leave benefits, including four weeks of annual leave and sick leave per year (pro-rated for part time employees), the opportunity to purchase additional annual leave and paid parental leave (after a qualifying period);
  • flexible working conditions, including options to work part-time and access to our flex scheme; and
  • ongoing career development, including chances to work in different ACCC/AER offices, opportunities for advancement and mobility within the organisation, formal and on-the job training programs and possibilities to participate in secondments with other APS agencies.

Need to know more?

Check out our Graduate Opportunities page for more information, including testimonies from some of our recent graduates.

How can you get involved?

We thought you’d never ask! Applications for our 2023 graduate program are now open. To find out more information about the ACCC/AER Graduate Program, our eligibility criteria and what we expect from our graduates, please download our candidate kit. The candidate kit will also provide you with information about the recruitment and selection process for the 2023 program.

Applications close 10 pm (AEST) Sunday 29 May 2022 . Assessment centres will take place in June, with offers made to successful applicants from August 2022.

Know someone who might be interested in a spot in our 2023 Graduate Program? Share this page with them – you never know, you might make their career!

title: Senior Bioinformatician/Bioinformatician
description:
Senior Bioinformatician/Bioinformatician/Computational Biologist

POSITION SUMMARY

Seonix Bio is a start-up company developing world leading technology to identify those at genetic risk of glaucoma so they can be diagnosed and treated earlier. Glaucoma is the world’s leading cause of irreversible blindness with 80 million sufferers worldwide, and is treatable if discovered early. Yet, 50% of glaucoma is currently undiagnosed. Seonix believes there is a major opportunity to transform clinical glaucoma care and reduce preventable blindness. Seonix’s technology is based on seminal research into a polygenic risk score for glaucoma, published in Nature Genetics.

Seonix is seeking a senior bioinformatician, bioinformatician, or computational biologist - depending on experience - primarily to:

  • Research and develop a range of key next generation applications, including predictive algorithms combining genetic data with other data sources, custom genetic assay design and algorithm development, and polygenic risk scores for new applications.
  • Contribute to research and development of Seonix’s polygenic risk score for glaucoma and associated pipelines and supporting infrastructure.

The successful candidate will report to the CEO and will work with Seonix’s Scientific Advisory team, bioinformaticians and software engineers. The company’s leadership team has a track record of building genetics businesses that change clinical care globally.

The role is ideally full-time, but could also be part-time, with the range of responsibilities to be adjusted to fit available time. A minimum commitment of 3 days per week is required. The role will be tailored to the experience of the candidate, and may suit either a senior bioinformatician with substantial experience or, for example, a highly capable post doc who is early in their career.

The successful candidate must be self-starting and self-driven, strong technically, have good communication and organizational skills, and be able to perform a wide variety of tasks in a start-up environment.

Seonix will offer a competitive package, depending on experience.

This is a rare opportunity for a talented individual to join an exciting company at an early stage and make a real impact.

PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Research, develop and maintain statistical models/algorithms and bioinformatics tools/pipelines for a range of new technology projects, including:
    • Development and implementation of statistical algorithms that exploit genetic and non-genetic data to predict disease outcomes.
    • Custom genetic assay design and optimization, analysis of related experiments, and design of algorithms for routine analysis.
    • Polygenic risk scores for new applications.
  • Research, develop, implement, and maintain production quality bioinformatics tools/pipelines to extend and improve Seonix’s glaucoma polygenic risk score.
  • Contribute to development of internal/external informatics systems for clinical service delivery.
  • Design and analyse experiments to validate Seonix’s current and future technologies.
  • Work with the software team to integrate bioinformatics pipelines / algorithms into software, including development of high quality code where required.
  • Document R&D activities, including working to appropriate quality standards where required.
  • Communicate and collaborate effectively internally and externally to assist in meeting the overall objectives of the company.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Ph.D. in a relevant discipline (or M.Sc. + significant experience)
  • Strong bioinformatics skills, with experience of pipeline development and data analysis for genetic applications (NGS/Illumina SNP arrays).
  • Strong programming skills, ideally with experience of Python / R.
  • Strong statistical skills, with the ability to research, extend and apply statistical algorithms for real-world application (e.g. development of a new polygenic risk scores).
  • Ability to design, implement and analyse experiments.
  • Ideally, experience of genetic assay design/development (e.g. custom panels, microarray designs).
  • Ideally, experience in a clinical application.
  • Ideally, experience of containerization and cloud deployment.
  • Ideally, experience of machine learning/AI algorithms.

CLOSING DATE: 12/06/22

Contact Nick Haan ( careers@seonixbio.com )

title: Adversarial Machine Learning Researcher/Engineer APS Level 4/5-6
description:
The Role
This role can be filled as either:
• Adversarial Machine Learning Researcher
• Adversarial Machine Learning Engineer

You will be part of an S&T team working in the area of Adversarial Machine Learning (AML) undertaking applied research, or engineering tasks, towards quantifying and enhancing the robustness of Machine Learning (ML) solutions for Defence applications.

AML involves countering data-driven attacks on ML solutions, whereby malicious actors modify training or test data to mislead and/or subvert ML predictions. You will help to devise, or implement and evaluate, new robust learning approaches suitable for adversarial environments and undertake research and development into the design and assessment of robust ML solutions for Defence applications, including reinforcement learning and deep learning.

Both roles provide exposure to S&T challenges in cyber security and operations in a military context. In addition, there exists the opportunity to work closely with Australian and international research partners, Defence clients and cyber security domain experts. You will also be supported with training in aspects of cyber security and ML as required, and encouraged to further develop your expertise.

The AML Researcher will also be encouraged to engage with the scientific community. The AML Researcher, under guidance and as part of a multi-disciplinary team, will:

• Contribute to research developing, adapting, applying and assessing robust ML techniques in the context of Defence applications.
• Prepare scientific publications and reports, present outcomes, demonstrate technologies and interact with both Defence clients and the academic/scientific community.
• Maintain up to date knowledge in specific areas of ML and broaden knowledge across areas relating to AML, including cyber security.
• Enhance S&T capability through targeted collaboration with other DST Group teams, academia, industry and other national/international research agencies.

The AML Engineer , under guidance and as part of a multi-disciplinary team, will:

• Contribute to developing, adapting, applying and assessing robust ML techniques in the context of Defence applications.
• Develop software as required to support the development and evaluation of attacks against and defences of ML algorithms.
• Contribute to scientific publications and reports to present outcomes and demonstrate technologies to both Defence clients and the academic/scientific community.
• Maintain up to date knowledge in specific areas of ML and broaden knowledge across areas relating to AML, including cyber security.

• Provide support to enhancing S&T capability through targeted collaboration with other DST Group teams, academia, industry and other national/international research agencies.

About our Team
Cyber and Electronic Warfare Division undertakes research and development focused on identifying, analysing and countering threats to Australia’s defence and national security through electronic means.

Cyberwarfare Operations branch undertakes research and development to help Australian Defence develop an effective cyber warfare capability that enables fight-through in a contested cyber environment.

The Counter Cyber Threats group undertakes research and development to identify, understand and defeat threats to key cyber terrain. Their work supports ADF cyber operations, with a particular focus on defence of military mission systems and platform systems.

Our Ideal Candidate
We are looking for candidates who can build and sustain positive relationships with team members, actively participate in team work and group activities, work collaboratively and operate as effective team members.

The ideal AML Researcher shall also be able to:

• Conduct research into and assist in the development of tools and techniques.
• Contribute to novel techniques published in the scientific literature.
• Research developments in the field and maintain currency through participating in professional activities.

While the ideal AML Engineer shall also be able to:

• Be accountable for and apply software engineering principles to the development of tools and techniques.
• Be current with and experienced in mainstream machine learning libraries.
• Investigate emerging technologies and maintain currency in the field through participating in professional activities.

Application closing date: Sunday the 29th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference DSTG/01991/22 on

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=848A8DDC-B929-A72D-C814-C88BDFD8D8CD

title: Applied Scientist (Intelligent Agent-Based Modeller)
description:
About the Role:

As a Consunet Applied Scientist you will perform a vital role with the use of your intelligent agent-based modelling knowledge to support our research and development into information warfare command and control applications. The role will consist of researching innovative ideas and algorithms, supporting the development, and demonstration of tools and applications to support command and control in the information warfare domain. You will be working within an agile environment with a team of professionals including scientists, mathematicians and software developers to achieve the organisations research goals. The applied research of the project you will be undertaking is in the application of advanced computational methods (Artificial Intelligence and Intelligent Agent-Based Modelling) to a problem domain requiring decision and planning support.

To be considered for this role, you must be an Australian citizen.

Essential Knowledge and Skills:

  • Experience in Artificial Intelligence – intelligent agent-based modelling.
  • Understanding of algorithm development and modelling using Python or Java or similar languages with good exposure to principles of object-oriented programming.
  • Experience in mathematics, especially techniques for multi-criteria solutions and maximal resilience, understand real time solvability, complex algorithm development and the ability to apply resulting concepts to solving problems emerging in information warfare command and control.
  • Provide support to our in-house software development team in the form of implementation guidance.
  • You are an adaptable individual who can communicate fluently, both orally and in writing, and are comfortable with presenting complex information to both technical and non-technical audiences such as internal and external stakeholders.
  • Postgraduate within Artificial Intelligence are preferred, however established equivalent expertise will be considered

Desirable Knowledge and Skills:

  • Background in Artificial Intelligence, in particular intelligent agent-based modelling
  • Understanding of distributed and complex systems
  • Government/Defence Industry experience
  • Recommending and designing technical solutions
  • Writing and maintaining technical documentation
  • Experience working in teams applying Agile software engineering best practices

To be considered, candidates will have:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Successful candidates must be eligible to hold and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance. Eligibility requirements can be found at http://www.defence.gov.au/agsva.

Benefits working for Consunet:

  • A workplace that believes in innovation, quality, and a work-life balance.
  • Flexible, inclusive and friendly work environment.
  • Competitive remuneration.
  • Salary packaging options.
  • Career and skills progression through training and development to team members.
  • Access to cutting-edge technology, research, and agile project management practices.
  • Mentoring and support from our experienced team members.

About the Company:

Consunet is headquartered in the Adelaide CBD with operations in Adelaide, Edinburgh (SA) and Canberra. A level of flexibility is generally offered with respect to work location. If you have specific requirements, please discuss them during your interview.

Our people create world-leading trusted cyber and spectrum security technology solutions that safeguard our customers' interests. As a 100% Australian-owned and operated corporation, Consunet strives to be the country's leading sovereign cyber and spectrum security solution developer, and trusted industry partner to the Australian Defence and cyber security communities. The company has a strong research and development and collaboration emphasis, implements Agile development and management processes, and has a proven track record of delivering and sustaining in-service operational capabilities for defence and commercial customers. Our vision “to build the Australian cyber and spectrum security future” is firmly rooted in everything we do.

To Apply:

Click “Apply Now”. Please attach a cover letter summarising your experience when applying.

title: Technical Claims Analyst
description:
About McLarens:

McLarens is a leading global claims services provider that helps clients achieve timely and equitable claims resolution.

The McLarens group of brands is trusted by clients worldwide to deliver the best in claims management, loss adjusting and auditing services to pre-risk and damage surveying. With direct operations in 200 countries with over 1800 team members, McLarens is a global leader with a customer-centric culture, with quality at the heart of everything we do.

The Opportunity

Due to continuing growth in our Adelaide office, we have an exciting opportunity for a full time Technical Claims Analyst.

Reporting to the Executive Loss Adjuster, your overall responsibility will be to provide support to Loss Adjusters and the central billing team, aiding the office’s efficiency and productivity in the handling of claims.

This role is part of our Loss Adjusting pathway, providing an excellent opportunity to commence or progress your career in the Adjusting industry.

The Role

Responsibilities include:

  • Provide technical claims handling support
  • Undertake non-complex fee earning case work, where appropriate
  • Liaise with Loss Adjusters to proactively support the management of claims from initial set-up to conclusion
  • Acknowledge and notify associated parties of new claims
  • Liaise with the insured, insurers, brokers and any other stakeholders, to ensure optimum service levels and to become a point of contact, where needed
  • Undertake general office administrative duties in accordance with company standards as required, such as diary management, booking appointments, allocating post to files, scanning documents, photocopying and filing, stationery orders
  • Format and issue technical reports in compliance with professional standards and internal guidelines and in accordance with agreed timescales
  • Deal with internal and external queries in a professional manner and accurately record conversations/messages
  • Ensure compliance with financial procedures, such as the invoicing process
  • Ensure data is accurately input in order to achieve high standards of data integrity and information management
  • Run, check, analyse and distribute reports as required
  • Assist with the preparation of client and business presentations
  • Participate and contribute to projects as required
  • Other ad hoc duties as required

Knowledge and Experience

Essential:

  • Strong administration skills
  • Highly organised, with the ability to multi-task and self-manage a varied workload with changing priorities
  • A strong team player, with excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Ability to deal professionally at all times with clients, policyholders and third parties
  • Strong working knowledge of MS Office applications, particularly Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint
  • Experience of coordinating complex activities for a team of individuals
  • Experience working in a time pressured and busy environment and managing competing priorities

Desirable:

  • Specific industry (insurance/financial/legal services) experience would be advantageous but is not necessarily required.

Employment with McLarens is subject to reference and background checks including a National Police Check.

title: Research Officer
company: Aboriginal Health Council of South Australia
description:
The Aboriginal Health Council of South Australia Ltd. (AHCSA) is the peak body representing Aboriginal community controlled health and substance misuse services in South Australia at State and National levels. Our primary role is to be the ‘health voice’ for all Aboriginal people in South Australia. We achieve this by advocating for the community and supporting workers with appropriate Aboriginal health programs based on a holistic perspective of health.

The Research Officer position is funded by The Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies (AIATSIS) Indigenous Research Exchange (the Exchange) Grant, to deliver the study titled “ Taking the next steps: Informing the transformation of the research sector to respond to Aboriginal research priorities and ways of conducting research”

The Research Officer will provide coordination and research support for the Project. The main aim of the Project is to inform sector development to achieve equitable outcomes through Aboriginal-identified research priorities and principles that inform the conduct of research.

The Research Officer will play a key role in the planning and implementation of the research, bearing responsibility for project management and administration, collection and analysis of qualitative interview and quantitative project data, liaising with participating services and communities, drafting reports and disseminating information.

The role will also be responsible for developing and maintaining effective communication and working relationships with existing networks across the research sector and will operate under the principles of Aboriginal community control.

What we offer:

  • The opportunity to join the peak body representing Aboriginal community controlled health and substance misuse services in South Australia
  • Aboriginal community controlled organisation that encourages work/life balance
  • An inclusive and diverse workplace
  • Great salary package and benefits

Key Outcomes and Activities of the Role:

  • Contribute to AHCSA’s vision “All Aboriginal people enjoy a high quality of health and well-being”.
  • Ensure the research is implemented according to the ethics approvals and compliance frameworks.
  • Project management, administration, collection and analysis of qualitative interview and quantitative data
  • Ensure accurate and appropriate data and record management is maintained.
  • Coordinate the Research Sector workshops with key stakeholders.
  • Coordinate the Aboriginal Advisory Group of the study.
  • Draft a Road Map as the key knowledge translation strategy of the project.
  • Assist with reporting and dissemination requirements as per the Activity plan.
  • Develop working relationships and maintain the engagement of co-investigators.
  • Undertake any other duties as reasonably required for research.
  • Comply with and abide by applicable laws including the National Principles for Child Safe Organisations and  AHCSA’s policies and procedures at all times.
  • Contribute to study publications.

Desired Qualification:

Qualification in research or project management or equivalent experience in these fields or other field relevant to the position.

Sought After Experience:

  • Demonstrated research and knowledge translation experience.
  • Demonstrated experience working with Aboriginal people, organisations and communities and other stakeholders including government agencies and non-government organisations.
  • Demonstrated experience in project management, implementing programs, writing reports, facilitating meetings and presenting information to a diverse audience.
  • Experience in the use of research information technology systems to manage online surveys and      qualitative analyses e.g. Qualtrics, RedCap, NVivo, Excel spreadsheets. Transferrable skills with experience gained through other software will be considered.

For additional information on the role please contact Dr Gokhan Ayturk, Manager, Research and Ethics from Gokhan.Ayturk@ahcsa.org.au if you have any queries.

Prior to applying for this position, please contact Julian Snook at julian.snook@ahcsa.org.au to request a copy of the Job and Person Specification or visit our webpage where it can be found under the Careers Tab - https://ahcsa.org.au/careers/careers. Applications must include a cover letter and resume, addressing the Person Specification – Selection Criteria, as outlined in the Job and Person Specification.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are strongly encouraged to apply.

title: Intelligent Agents Scientist APS 4/5-6 (S&T Level 3-4) and EL 1 (S&T Level 5)
description:
The Role
Cyber and Electronic Warfare Division is seeking an early to mid-career researcher to advance the state of the art with respect to intelligent agents and autonomous systems for information warfare. The researcher will be working with a team of scientists and engineers developing self-aware and self-adaptive agents that will be deployed in multi-agent contested environments.

Duties shall include:

  • Researching and architecting algorithms for multi-agent teaming, goal based reasoning and trust management,
  • Identifying gaps in existing multi-agent technologies,
  • Developing prototypes of intelligent agents,
  • Conducting experiments with intelligent agents in both synthetic and real Defence environments and,
  • Working with collaborators internal to DSTG and within academia and industry.

This position will be filled at either S&T3-4 or S&T5 and will be determined by the level of relevant expertise of the successful candidate.


About our Team
Cyber and Electronic Warfare Division undertakes research and development focused on identifying, analysing and countering threats to Australia's defence and national security through electronic means.

The mission of Contested Communications is to develop survivable tactical communications and electronic warfare solutions for contested and degraded cyber electromagnetic environments.
Information Warfare Command and Control (IWC2) STC conducts research and development of command and control (C2) technologies for fighting in and through the contested information environment. Information warfare (IW) occurs within the machine, and necessitates an approach that relies heavily on autonomous operation of cyber, EW and influence operations capabilities, under the oversight of a human command element.

IWC2 research themes include:

  • Information warfare C2 paradigms,
  • Antifragile multi-agent architectures,
  • Autonomous control methodologies,
  • Machine-human integration,
  • Causal modelling and,
  • Scalable and elastic coordination technologies.

We seek to collaborate with others working in similar areas so as to increase critical mass and achieve maximal impact for Defence.

Our Ideal Candidate
Our ideal candidate shall demonstrate initiative and integrity, and have a passion for developing machine intelligence.

Desirable skills and experience include:

  • Ability to think conceptually, to structure, analyse and solve complex problems through sound research and engineering practices,
  • Knowledge of machine learning, computational intelligence, multi-agent coordination and cooperation, and/or system self-organisation paradigms,
  • Skills in software development,
  • The ability to work both as a member of a team and individually and,
  • The ability to inspire, collaborate, and communicate with influence.

Competency in cyber warfare, electronic warfare or command and control would be well regarded.

Application Closing Date: Wednesday 1 June 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, reference DSTG/02110/22

on https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=2DE92CAC-53DD-4F4A-AA95-C88D8314FEDE .

title: Qualitative Researcher
description:
About NCVER

The National Centre for Vocational Education Research Ltd (NCVER) helps promote better understanding and discussion within the vocational education and training (VET) sector, and assists policymakers, practitioners, industry, training providers, and students to make informed decisions.

NCVER is a professional and independent body responsible for collecting, managing, analysing, evaluating, and communicating research and statistics about VET and the links between education and the labour market more generally. More detail of NCVER’s activities can be found on our Portal at www.ncver.edu.au

Position details

We are seeking an experienced qualitative research professional to join our Research & Data Analytics branch which is responsible for facilitating and delivering timely, forward thinking and relevant research findings based upon rigorous analysis that informs decision making for diverse VET sector stakeholders.

As an important part of our Research, Analytics and Reporting Group, you will work with NCVER’s research team to deliver world class research that is timely, relevant and trusted by our stakeholders.

You will be part of a dynamic team made up of technical and VET sector experts working on projects that inform and influence policy and practice in VET to support a skilled and capable Australian workforce and a strong economy.

You will have experience in delivering end to end research projects, from taking a brief, to designing a research approach, through to execution, analysis and reporting.  You will apply a range of innovative research methodologies such as conducting literature reviews, designing, running and analysing surveys, conducting case studies, and undertaking consultations via interview or focus groups among others.  While we have data analysts to apply analytics to research projects it is useful but not essential for you to have some experience with data or statistical analysis.

You will support the delivery of research outputs through the preparation of high-quality written reports and data visualisations that are suitable for a range of audiences, including researchers, policy makers, practitioners and the general public.

Selection criteria:

  • Qualification in a social research, statistics, public policy or other relevant subject area
  • Previous relevant experience in a market, social or government research environment
  • The ability to work independently and collaboratively in a multi-skilled team contributing to the expertise of the Research and Data Analytics branch
  • Demonstrated understanding of a range of qualitative and/or mixed method research approaches, the ability to select the most appropriate methods and apply these to complex research questions, sometimes integrated with quantitative analysis
  • Demonstrated ability to identify and utilise a range of research methods, to ensure informed and relevant research
  • Proven ability to think critically and creatively, and to advise others in the use of innovative approaches to address complex research problems
  • Excellent organisational, project management and time management skills with demonstrated ability to self-manage with minimal supervision
  • Ability to consult widely with stakeholders and collaborate with subject matter experts, both within and external to the organisation
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills and a demonstrated ability to interpret and translate findings for non-technical audiences, in a range of formats (i.e. presentations, reports, data visualisations)

Appointment details

  • Full-time ongoing role based in Adelaide (part-time hours (0.8 minimum) may be negotiated for the right applicant)
  • Generous, flexible working conditions
  • Gifted leave over Christmas shut down
  • Hybrid working from the office/home arrangement
  • Salary in the range of $78,000 to $95,000 commensurate with skills and experience
  • 12% superannuation payable in addition to salary

Application details

To be considered for this position, please forward an application letter (maximum two pages in length), addressing the above criteria, plus your CV by clicking the ‘Apply’ button.

Applications close at 5pm on Monday 23 May.  Previous applicants need not re-apply.

title: Data Management & digital Security officer
description:
Provide Data Management & digital Security to secure Dept of Defences research into prototyping guided weapons. 12 Months minimum contract

  • Requires past experience as a Data Manager and Australian Citizenship essential (For security Clearances)
  • $ Based on Experience
  • 12 month full time contract, with potential to go longer

Your Next Employer...

You'll be working with the R&D department for the Department of Defence (Defence Science Technology Group, DTSG) in Edinburgh.

DSTG is currently supporting research into guided weapons prototyping.

The Role...

1. Develop and implement efficient and secure procedures for data handling and compliant with all DSTG policies;

2. Ensure digital databases and archives are protected from security breaches and data losses;

3. Support staff with the use of data systems

You Will Need...

1. Proven experience as Data manager

2. Proficient in MS Office

3. To be an Australian Citizen

For more information, call Soyuz on 03 9573 1500

title: Business Consultant
description:
CSSP is the leading supplier of construction management software solutions in Australia and has been providing solutions to the construction industry in Australia and the surrounding area since 1983. As part of the JDM Technology Group (JDM), a global software company that works exclusively in construction, their large customer base is spread across Australia, New Zealand, Asia and the Middle East. CSSP staff have over 250 man-years experience in construction industry software development and systems integration projects, and this is enhanced by the experience of, and collaboration with, the other companies in the JDM Group.

CSSP develops, supports, and owns all their software and is dedicated to contributing to its customers' long-term success. By combining existing technologies with additional products, CSSP has an ongoing commitment to developing world class products in strategic markets, for local and overseas clients.

CSSP are committed to long-term relationships with their customers and endeavour to provide excellence of service combined with a promise to support their products for as long as customers require.

The Business Consultant will assist in the development of strong relationships with CSSP CHEOPS customers through implementation, training, and support of all modules of the CHEOPS software and will also provide value added business consulting services.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop strong, consultative relationships with CSSP CHEOPS customers
  • Implementation, training, and support of all modules of the CHEOPS software
  • Specify CHEOPS enhancements or developments in conjunction with clients
  • Development of marketing, support, installation, implementation, and support to clients
  • Mentor and train staff to ensure technical knowledge is passed on to all appropriate staff
  • Develop and maintain implementations and support training documentation

Key requirements:

  • Advanced experience as an Accountant (ideally with working knowledge of accounting systems within the construction industry)
  • A clear understanding of accounting policies and procedure within the construction industry
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills
  • Highly analytical with strong problem-solving skills
  • An ability to work autonomously
  • Experience in documentation and/or user requirement gathering
  • Strong influencing skills and an ability to facilitate client meetings and workshops

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply please click apply or call Tom Moore on 08 8216 3516 for a confidential discussion.

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
About Us

Bridgestone is a global leader in sustainable mobility and advanced solutions, providing products, services and solutions for a world in motion. We have a long-held tradition of excellence supported by a commitment to offer the highest quality products and services to all customers. Through our mission of "Serving Society with Superior Quality" Bridgestone strives to be a company trusted by the community and valued by its employees.

About the role

Reporting directly to the SAP Business Applications Manager, you will work closely with the Business Systems team to provide high levels of customer service to the company’s end users. Your key responsibilities will include interpreting, analysing and documenting business reporting requirements, identifying solutions to fulfil business needs and developing solutions to contribute to the continuous improvement of business processes and procedures primarily focused on SAP ERP and SAP BW systems. You will also be responsible for designing specification documents, writing test cases, processing and implementing change requests and assisting management with the implementation of various systems projects as required.

About you

This is an excellent opportunity to build on your prior business analyst experience with a multi-national organisation. This role offers broad scope and will require exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities, coupled with high-level written and oral communication skills. Your flexibility, initiative and outstanding ability to develop and maintain relationships at all levels will add further to your success.

  • Tertiary qualifications in IT, Computer Science or a Business related discipline are highly desirable.
  • Experience in Data Modelling with SAP BW and business reporting within SAP Business Objects will be very well regarded.

This is an excellent opportunity for an enthusiastic, dynamic and proactive individual to join a National icon that provides exceptional working conditions and a positive and engaged organisational culture.

What we offer

The successful candidate will be rewarded with a competitive salary and staff discounts. You will also join a globally recognised company that values its employees. Working in a City Fringe location with your own undercover carpark.

To apply, please provide a Cover Letter and Resume quoting reference number: S21215

title: Payroll Analyst (Chris 21)
description:
• Flexible working arrangements | Ability to work from home entirely
  • Newly created role | Very attractive salary package
  • Multiple positions on offer
The Organisation
Our client is a well established and successful company that is going from strength-to-strength. They have a high performing culture and offer generous salary packages coupled with low staff turnover. Due to recent project work, they require the assistance of a number of experienced senior payroll candidates with an analytical skill set to join them for a minimum of a 7-8 month period. Working among a supportive environment, with the ability to take the reigns and lead change, this is a new role, and a great opportunity for a payroll professional who is looking for their next challenge.

Position Description
This role is responsible for working in partnership with the Senior Payroll Manager to develop and implement significant improvements to payroll processes.

Reporting into the Payroll Manager and working closely alongside HR, your main tasks will include:
  • Providing advanced expertise and specialist advice for payroll awards, industrial agreements and statutory requirements
  • Providing a consultative approach to rectifying and advising on appropriate courses of action
  • Provide value-add analysis and commentary to stakeholders across the business
  • Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide recommendations
  • Provide payroll support for key projects related to the implementation of new and existing systems
  • Assisting with Payroll management within the division for major
    business and/ or system changes
  • Working in partnership with project stakeholders and BAU
    colleagues

The Successful Candidate
To be a success in this role you will possess:
  • Previous experience in a similar Payroll Analyst position using Chris 21
  • Confidence in leading analytical projects and recommending change
  • Understanding of and experience interpreting Awards/EBAs
  • High level attention to detail and accuracy
  • A demonstrated ability to communicate complex matters in a simplified manner
  • Forward thinking mindset with a keen desire to lead change
  • Strong stakeholder management skills with clear communication techniques

Additional Benefits
  • Extremely flexible working arrangements - ability to work from home entirely
  • Newly created role you can make your own
  • Work for a company that places well-being first
  • Attractive salary in a long term role
How To Apply
To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Daniel Close on 0431 284 815 or dclose@sharpandcarter.com.au

title: Senior Program Financial Analyst
description:
About Us:

Lockheed Martin is a dynamic, growing, and energetic organisation offering stimulating, challenging work at the forefront of technology. Lockheed Martin is a leader in Australia’s National Security, and our collaboration with Australian industry spans the Aeronautics, Maritime, Surveillance and Defence domains. We employ approximately 100,000 staff worldwide, and over 1000 staff in Australia across multiple locations.

About the opportunity:

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Program Financial Analyst to join our team based at Mawson Lakes. This position is available on a permanent full time basis. As the Senior Program Financial Analyst, you will be responsible for providing financial management and oversight to a number of assigned programs.

Your day to day duties will include:

  • Provide end to end financial support and advice to allocated programs & projects
  • Preparation and review of monthly project reporting, including:
    • Customer reporting
    • Internal forecasting
    • Other ad-hoc internal reporting
  • Provide significant inputs and analysis to annual operation plans, and 5 year forecasts, covering OSEC & R&O’s
  • Provide detailed variance analysis on monthly forecasts for OSEC
  • Oversee and provide inputs to any Contract Change Proposal, and minor pricing proposals/Survey and Quotes
  • Prepare and analyse quarterly Estimates at Completion
  • Maintain and track financial R&O’s for allocated programs
  • Track and manage any foreign currency exposures
  • Complete monthly project reconciliations
  • Review, tracking and approval of monthly customer invoicing
  • Be involved in project finance process improvement activities
  • Other ad-hoc activities to assist Financial Management

About you:

  • Significant experience and ability in accounting and/or finance
  • Strong experience using accounting principles, concepts, practices and standards
  • Ability to provide accurate analysis, and advice to management
  • Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline (Finance, Accounting etc.)

As well as the above you will be an expert in building and maintaining strong business relationships with stakeholders both internally and externally.

Special Requirements:

Applicants are required to be Australian Citizens and be eligible to gain a NV1 Defence Security Clearance.

What we offer you:

At Lockheed Martin we value our team and the contribution they make every day. We offer rewarding career pathways working on interesting projects that make a difference, continuous professional development and the opportunity to learn from a diverse team of talented individuals.

In return we offer:

  • Competitive Remuneration
  • Genuine work/life flexibility including a 9-day, compacted fortnight (every other Friday off)
  • Membership to Destination Discounts – that saves you money on many every day purchases including supermarkets, petrol, department stores to name a few
  • Salary packaging for car leasing

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Lockheed Martin supports Equal Employment Opportunity and Diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, harassment free, diverse, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. Diversity and inclusion are the foundation of our culture and reflect our values of doing what’s right, respecting others and performing with excellence. By leveraging our employees’ unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

title: Biostatistician / Senior Biostatistician / Principal Biostatistician
description:
Avance Clinical - our most important asset is our people. We offer a fun, friendly work environment and a culture that values honesty and respects its people.

Avance Clinical is a Contract Research Organisation which offers specialised services supporting clinical drug development for the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industry.

Responsibilities

  • Preparation and review of statistical analysis plans and randomization schedules.
  • Preparation and review of listings, tables and figures for interim analyses and clinical study reports.
  • Perform statistical analyses.
  • Review CDISC SDTM and ADaM specification documents.
  • Assist with preparation and review of clinical study reports.
  • Liaise with Clinical Project Managers, the Data Management team, and external vendors (e.g. bioanalytical laboratories).
  • Communicate with clients including discussion of processes, timelines and study results.
  • Review of Case Report Forms for data capture.
  • Monitor and report on study budgets and identify changes from contracted scope of work.

What you’ll need to succeed

  • Ordinary degree in the appropriate discipline or appropriate industry experience.
  • Higher degree in relevant discipline to Biostatistics / Scientific research data analysis
  • Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in statistical analysis in pharmaceutical / health research.
  • Working knowledge of ICH GCP Guidelines, medical terminology and clinical trials processes.
  • SAS programming experience (highly desirable).
  • Working knowledge of CDISC SDTM and ADaM implementation and requirements ( highly desirable)
  • Understanding of pharmacokinetics (desirable).
  • Ability to communicate at a high level with clients, senior management and other stakeholders.
  • Ability to work under pressure in a multi-disciplinary team environment.

Benefits

  • Reputable growing CRO with stability
  • Challenging and stimulating environment where what you do matters
  • A diverse and inclusive culture with a strong emphasis on team collaboration
  • Training and career development opportunities
  • Attractive remuneration

To apply

  • To apply for this role please click on the 'APPLY' link and submit your CV along with a cover letter outlining your skills and experience - please submit as one PDF document.
  • You must also have full Australian working rights to be considered.
  • No agencies please

www.avancecro.com

title: Senior International Licensing Analyst (EXIM) - various Programs
description:
About us

Lockheed Martin is a dynamic, growing, and energetic organisation offering stimulating, challenging work at the forefront of technology. Lockheed Martin is a leader in Australia’s National Security, and our collaboration with Australian industry spans the Aeronautics, Maritime, Surveillance and Defence domains. We employ approximately 100,000 staff worldwide, and over 1000 staff in Australia across multiple locations.

We’re pleased to invite applications for the position of Senior International Licensing Analyst to join our growing team. This role can be based at Mawson Lakes, SA, Melbourne VIC or Canberra, ACT.


About the role

Primary responsibility of the Senior International Licensing Analyst is to plan and coordinate Export/Import (EXIM) activities, including the flow of traffic to/from international destinations, related customer service, brokerage and customs transactions. You will maintain compliance with Australian and international regulations governing the shipment, receipt and documentation of EXIM products and research and resolve customer or supplier issues. The role will see you as the Interface with internal and external worldwide EXIM operations and organisations. You will be required to negotiate with international customers to develop handling agreements, act as liaison with customs representatives to resolve problems and establish requirements for license generation, guidance of the license generation and tracking process.

Responsibilities will include but not be limited to:

  • Provide a high level of advice and guidance to a range of stakeholders across the Company with respect to EXIM Compliance matters.
  • Maintain compliance with regulations governing the shipment, transfer, receipt and documentation of EXIM products and technical data.
  • Provide guidance as part of the EXIM Compliance Team in accordance with Lockheed Martin (LM) policy and pursuant to Lockheed Martin Australia’s (LMA’s) EXIM Compliance Management Plan.
  • Provide guidance on the use of International Commercial Terms (Incoterms), Free Trade Agreements and other preferential duty programs.
  • Review and provide advice to Lockheed Martin Corporation (LMC) on Australian Export/Supply applications prior to submittal to Defence Export Control (DEC) Office.
  • Review non-Australian Export authorisations. Example U.S. Technical Assistance Agreements
  • Draft and submit Australian Export/Supply applications for Lockheed Martin Australia

About you:

  • Significant experience working with EXIM Compliance
  • Significant working knowledge and application of as many of the following as possible:
    • United States International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and Export Administration Regulations (EAR).
    • Defence Strategic Goods List (DSGL)
    • Incoterms
    • Customs Act 1901
    • Customs (Prohibited Export) Regulations 1958
    • Customs (Prohibted Import) Regulations 1956
    • International Air Transport Association (IATA) regulations
  • Substantial experience in Supply Chain, Logistics and Customs Procedures

Along with the above you will have outstanding communication and attention to detail with the ability to develop strong relationships with your stakeholders.

Special Requirements:

Applicants are required to be Australian citizens and be eligible to obtain and maintain Australian Defence Security Clearance to NV1 level.

What we offer you:

At Lockheed Martin we value our team and the contribution they make every day. We offer rewarding career pathways working on interesting projects that make a difference, continuous professional development, and the opportunity to learn from a diverse team of talented individuals.

In return we offer:

  • Competitive remuneration
  • Options for genuine work/life flexibility including a 9-day, compacted fortnight
  • Membership to Destination Discounts – that saves you money on many every day purchases including supermarkets, petrol, department stores to name a few
  • Annual flu vaccinations
  • Salary packaging for car leasing

Equal Opportunity Statement

Lockheed Martin supports Equal Employment Opportunity and Diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, harassment free, diverse, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. Diversity and inclusion are the foundation of our culture and reflect our values of doing what’s right, respecting others and performing with excellence. By leveraging our employees’ unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

title: Microsoft Application Support Analyst
description:
• Work for a Microsoft Gold Partner
  • Use the latest & greatest technology to help clients with their productivity solutions
  • Support a broad & diverse range of clients
  • Become a member of a national team with a global footprint

Role Overview:

Working in a close-knit, national Client Care team, you will contribute in a collaborative environment, working with many different organisations and liaising across our Client Delivery and Product Development teams, to find the best outcomes for clients. You will be a first contact point for our clients who have exhausted their own internal teams problem-solving abilities, giving them advice and support and helping them through technical application faults. While you will be a natural communicator and have strong written and oral communication abilities, we think you will probably end each day having learned something new. This role offers significant Microsoft application variety where you will participate in the support, administration, configuration, and enhancement of Project Online, Project for the Web, the Power Platform, and Office 365 environments. You will have a broad knowledge in various areas of Microsoft applications, particularly focused on Microsoft cloud technologies, and ideally have experience partnering with external clients, to provide support and uphold their application support expectations. Using your strong communication skills, you will provide the highest level of client service, keep promises and uphold our values, such as “we are easy to work with”.

You understand that being part of the team we refer to as “Client Care“ is not about meeting the minimum SLA and hiding behind an email account; you won’t be afraid to tackle a problem head on with a client, pick up the phone, or suggest creative work-around solutions to solve their business problems. You are accountable and see things through to the end, rather than looking for the first opportunity to “handball”. Finally, this role may provide career growth into other areas of the Sensei business, including front-line Consulting, Product Development or other teams as the company continues to grow and add capabilities.

What your day might look like (beware, in this job, there is no typical day):

  • Help clients with technical challenges they have in using a range of Sensei’s systems, software and solutions.
  • Give suggestions, advice and guidance on how to best use their solution.
  • Act as the first point of support for premium clients who have exhausted their own internal support teams problem solving abilities.
  • Troubleshoot and problem solve technical Microsoft application faults to identify and diagnose issues logically. This can be either by telephone, email or remote login.
  • Educate our clients as they need it, often remotely over the phone or via Microsoft Teams.
  • Monitor the health of our client’s solutions, by performing preventative maintenance and “health check” reports.
  • Stay ahead of the Microsoft technology curve and provide insights into upcoming technologies or solutions which benefit them.
  • Provide an exemplary level of client service and focus, with appropriate support responses and friendly communication.

Sound interesting? Here’s the key skills set you’ll need to qualify:

  • Previous experience working supporting Microsoft applications.
  • Outstanding communication skills – you will be someone who’s easy to talk to, a naturally charming individual and can translate technical issues to non-technical people.
  • Outstanding listening skills – a key part of the role is listening to the client to *really* understand what the problem is (perhaps not the symptoms they are describing).
  • Strong ability to work with clients to calmly, quickly and logically identify and diagnose issues.  This often needs to be done in a short time frame, so strong problem solving and technical troubleshooting skills are vital.
  • Superior interpersonal skills especially when it comes to managing client relationships.  You have to take ownership of client issues.
  • Ability to be resourceful and develop general knowledge base or how-to articles.
  • Desire to be a key part of a team, have some fun, and take pride in your work and helping others.

We are also interested in secondary skills or experience you may have in these areas which you will want to boast about in the interview to stand out amongst the rest:

  • Previous experience with the Microsoft Power Platform suite of products. (Power BI, Power Apps and Power Automate).
  • Intermediate experience in writing and understanding SQL queries.
  • Previous experience in Project Online/Server, Microsoft Project.
  • Previous experience in Office 365, Dynamics 365.
  • Previous experience in Microsoft SharePoint Administration and Configuration.
  • Experience in writing SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and Power BI Reports.
  • Experience in PowerShell as it relates to SharePoint or ability to make minor user interface changes in scripting languages such as JavaScript or JQuery.
  • Both Microsoft and tertiary certifications are highly desirable for this position.

Interested in applying? Here’s what we value:

  • You’re an honest person and keep your promises.
  • You have outstanding written and oral communication skills.
  • You deal with change well and are comfortable with working to service level agreement (SLA) deadlines.
  • You are not afraid of seeing something new for the first time and picking up the phone with a client to work through it methodically.
  • You naturally possess geeky tendencies and are super passionate with Microsoft technology.
  • During your interview, you’ll be able to tell us the capital city of Bolivia :)
  • You’re a team player and thrive on helping others grow and succeed with you.

… and here’s how we roll at Sensei:

  • Influence the way you work with flexible work arrangements.
  • We recognise that life is easier when cash flow is easy. That’s why we’ll pay you weekly – not fortnightly or monthly like other companies.
  • We’ll help you support your family – get up to 4 months Paid Parental Leave at full salary for primary carer (not including government-funded parental leave).
  • Be mentored and keep learning – grow your career – we want you to be with us for a long time.
  • Transparency – we’re open about what’s happening in the company, where it’s going, how it’s performing.
  • Stay Connected – BYOD policy, mobile allowances reimbursement program.
  • Get lot’s of extra goodies like food, drink, discounts and more.

Now it’s time to do something about it!  Go on, reach out and have an initial chat with us to learn more about the role and tackle any questions you may have to confirm Sensei is the right place for you and your talents.

About Sensei:

At Sensei Project Solutions we partner with clients to help them improve the way they work.  We want our clients to be able to focus on the work that matters so they can achieve their individual and organisational goals.  To do this, we focus on creating market leading digital solutions for work and project management that bridge the gap between industry standards and technology. We are known for our expertise, our approachable working style, and our leadership within the Microsoft productivity landscape. We are a profitable, growing, awesome place to work that everyone at Sensei is proud of. Things you should know about us before applying to join:

  • We're growing. You won't be the "new person" for long :)
  • We're a friendly and fun bunch. We work hard.
  • We have high expectations, but we'll make sure we help you meet them.
  • We are Microsoft Gold Partners and deeply connected to the Microsoft Product Community.

You can find out more about us on our website - https://www.senseiprojectsolutions.com.au/careers/

title: Employment Tax Analyst - Adelaide
description:
Company description:

Deloitte Services Pty Ltd



Job description:

What will your typical day look like?

As an Analyst within our Business Tax Services (BTS) team in Adelaide, you will gain exposure to a diverse client portfolio across a wide range of industries and sectors, including multinationals, government departments and ASX listed companies.

The work itself will involve advising on matters relating to:

  • Employment taxes (including PAYG withholding, superannuation guarantee, payroll tax and fringe benefits tax);
  • Personal income tax;
  • Global mobility tax compliance and advisory services to employers of internationally mobile employees;
  • Mitigating compliance risks and providing innovative solutions.

Each set of client circumstances presents its own challenges, so you will be able to continuously expand upon your expertise in this dynamic and ever-changing area of tax. The BTS team at Deloitte are at the forefront of developments with technology tools, data automation and analytical solutions. You will have the opportunity to work with a forward-thinking team in a supportive and inclusive environment.

About the team
With complexity and change in tax legislation and interpretation comes a need for data-driven insights and fit-for-future solutions - that's where we come in.

As an employment tax and global mobility tax specialist you will work collaboratively with other market-leading teams at Deloitte, combining tax research, automation techniques and data analytics, to advise and assist employers to maximise performance and achieve sustainable compliance with respect to employment tax and reporting obligations.

Enough about us, let's talk about you.
You are someone who has:

  • 1-2 years of experience in relation to employment taxes and personal income tax
  • Ability to work with data and apply analytical thinking including analysis and interpretation of legislation and supporting technical materials
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills
  • Enthusiasm and a passion to succeed
  • Bachelor degree in either Commerce or Commerce and Law (preferable)

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia's borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles.

Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We're committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we're leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress - check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

Next Steps

Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

title: EOI - Occupancy Planner, Space Data Manager & Moves and Changes Coordinator
description:
What’s your ambition? Is it a big goal or small steps? Professional or personal? We’d like to know, because we make your ambitions our business.
