If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. We're focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours.

Our renowned Work Dynamics Group is currently receiving Expressions of Interest from candidates for the below key roles:

Occupancy Planner

Space Data Manager

Moves and Changes Coordinator

As a JLL Occupancy Planner , your goal is to manage the seating and accommodation of a client across their state or national property portfolio: the role is equal parts project manager, data analyst, and relationship builder.  You will manage occupancy (seating) and property allocations, maintain the occupancy dashboard, perform building capacity analysis, and be involved in portfolio-wide occupancy projects.

Ideally suited for a people person that has a knack for puzzles/problem solving and understands the power of data driven insights.

As a JLL Space Data Manager , you will focus on keeping an accurate BAU data source and ensuring the correct information is available at any given time within the system. Regularly updating of the core data in our Space Data platform (Serraview) includes making changes to Buildings & Floors, Floorplans, People Data and Org Unit Structure as allocation and occupancy changes across our Government Portfolio footprint.

Ideally suited for people interested in the latest systems & technology, good spatial awareness and likes to produce meaningful insights out of data .

As a JLL Moves, Adds and Changes Coordinator , you will effectively assist and implement our client’s relocation strategy through utilising specialised space management tools and resources. You will work part of the OP team to develop scope and schedules for relocation/project work, whilst ensuring client satisfaction throughout the move management process.

Ideally suited for a person that likes to get things done, possibly new to the corporate world but has an interest in logistics and planning.

You will be provided with training and knowledge to get you up to speed with JLL’s systems and processes!

You must be an Australian Citizen and be able to obtain and hold Federal Government level security clearances in order to comply with our client’s requirement.

What you can expect from us:
At JLL, we value your health and wellbeing which is why we are excited to announce a whole raft of new benefits through our WHEREFIT partnership! WHEREFIT provides you with access to exclusive corporate discounts of up to 40% off at leading fitness and wellbeing brands across Australia. With over 2,000 unique offers across gyms, activewear, studios, healthy meals, supplements, accessories, self-care and more, there is something for everyone so you can perform at your best!


You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things. Keep those ambitions in sight and imagine where JLL can take you...

JLL is committed to developing and maintaining a diverse workforce. As an organisation, we don’t just accept that we are a place of many different people, but we embrace it, we celebrate it, and we proactively support the needs that difference brings. JLL is committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, gender, age, sexual orientation or disability, and that is why, for more than a decade, we continue to rank among the World’s Most Ethical Companies. We are dedicated to offering veterans from all ranks and services a successful civilian career as they transition out of the military. We recognise and appreciate the skills acquired in their service careers as vital and transferable to our workforce.

Apply today, quoting job reference number JDREQ207111

Please note, although developing relationships with agencies forms a component of the JLL talent acquisition strategy, on this occasion agency submissions will not be accepted.

title: Product Owner / Senior Business Analyst
description:
Just imagine your future with us…

Aurecon is committed to creating an inclusive culture that embraces diversity, equity and inclusion - and we provide our people with flexible working opportunities.

We believe diverse teams enable us to solve our clients' and society's most complex problems in unconventional and distinctive ways. We offer flexible working as it enables all our employees to balance work and life in way that works for them.

Aurecon is an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality, as awarded by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (Australia), and are a founding member of The Diversity Agenda in New Zealand. We also have a Reconciliation Action Plan and hold Silver Employer status in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTI+ inclusion. Across our company, inclusive leadership is role modelled from the top and is an expectation of all.

Our flexible way of working includes our flexible start and finish times, working from home, part time and job share options. Aurecon also offers 14 weeks paid parental leave, three weeks paid partner leave, and other health services and benefits.

If this is how you would like to work, you'd be a good fit, we'd love to hear from you. We welcome people of all identities from all background and with diverse accessibility needs. We're curious about your career path and how we can support you to be your best.

The Role

In this role you will work closely with Product and Technology teams to ensure that product features, functional and technical requirements are accurately defined, documented, prioritised and communicated to all relevant parties (onshore and offshore) to be successfully delivered as a software solution to the stakeholders involved. You will be communicating with internal teams and clients and have a good understanding of business drivers, values and the end vision.

Here are the key things you will do to 'bring ideas to life':

  • Be able to set the benchmark for the delivery team for modern software delivery practices and have a comprehensive understanding of how to achieve success through Agile SCRUM methodologies
  • Elicit requirements for digital products using various techniques which include but not limited to interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, process flow charts, use cases, scenario planning, business, task, and workflow analysis
  • Translation of business requirements as an end-to-end vision of the software solution into a prioritised set of feature deliverables represented as a product roadmap
  • Collaborate with solutions architect, technical team and subject matter experts to establish and analyse trade-offs between usability, performance and time etc.
  • Maintain functional relationships with all stakeholders to gather information, understand stakeholder interest, maintain an up to date understanding of the various operations, and manage expectations with these stakeholders
  • Work closely with the SCRUM team to refine and write user stories and support the agile delivery of digital products
  • Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.

What we are looking for

  • Industry certification as a Business Analyst, Tertiary qualifications in Computing or the equivalent in work experience
  • Demonstrated experience working in Technology building and delivering software products as a Senior Business Analyst including relevant experience as a Product Owner
  • Exposure working in an Agile SCRUM environment
  • Excited to learn new technologies and analytical methodologies relating to business intelligence and analysis
  • Exceptional stakeholder management experience and superior analytical skills
  • Ideally you will also be proficient with JIRA and have an understanding of software products in Cloud, SaaS and Mobile applications

We value the difference each team member brings, and we look for people who have had a broad range of experiences and a growth and learning mindset.

About us

We've re-imagined engineering.

Aurecon is an international engineering, design, and advisory company, but not as you know it!

Drawing on our deep pool of expertise, we co-create innovative solutions with our clients to some of the world's most complex challenges.

We listen deeply and intently, which helps us see opportunities, possibilities and potential others can't. Think engineering. Think again.

Want to know more?

You can learn more about what it's like to work at Aurecon by visiting the careers section of our website.

If you are intrigued or excited by what you have read, then we want to hear from you. Apply now!

title: Enterprise Software Support Analyst
description:
At Esri Australia we share a passion: for solving problems with GIS (Geographical Information Systems) and Enterprise technologies; for contributing to an ongoing geospatial conversation; and collaborating with our clients for a better future.  As part of Esri Australia’s expanding Care Team, you will play a pivotal role in making this vision a reality.

About the team

Join our passionate ArcGIS application enthusiasts and technology specialists to contribute to our well-earned and highly respected team of troubleshooting and solution experts relied upon by a diverse client base. We are proud to support and contribute to ArcGIS solutions supporting both local, national, and even global projects.  Our team members are passionate about the intersection of technology and geographic information systems. We are highly self-driven to grow our skillsets and enthusiastic in our approach to sharing our knowledge with colleagues. Various overlapping backgrounds and skillsets in the team foster plenty of opportunities to share your own expertise and learn from your peers.

We strongly encourage you to apply if you have an enthusiasm for learning new technologies, GIS, problem solving, and knowledge sharing.

About the Role

As an Enterprise Software Support Consultant, you will deliver on our vision and service delivery principles of Ease, Expertise, Collaboration and Consistency, by providing technical software support and training to our clients, ensuring that our contact with clients delivers a user experience consistent with our client experience vision.

Key responsibilities of the role include:

  • Provide high-quality technical software support, training, and customer service to our Esri Australia end users through effective communication and efficient troubleshooting
  • Identify, understand, and articulate solutions for customer issues to resolve ArcGIS Enterprise and related technologies
  • Perform incident management, problem management and change management processes in line with the ITIL best practices
  • Work well in high energy, fast-paced, enthusiastic, positive, and collaborative culture
  • Assist in the development and maintenance of our knowledge base.

Being successful in this role involves being keen to learn more about geospatial technologies, the ArcGIS Enterprise suite, and developing core ArcGIS server-based product knowledge.

It is a fantastic role for an enthusiastic professional willing to apply and grow their Information Technology knowledge and skills across the full stack of ArcGIS Enterprise deployments.

About You

  • Relevant experience and/or qualification (BA preferred) in associated business disciplines (Computer Science, Information Technology)
  • Experience working in software support or technical customer service with the direct end-user contact.
  • Experience with administering Microsoft Windows Server and Linux operating systems highly regarded.
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills. You communicate well in both written and verbal medium. You can communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • The ability to effectively perform fault diagnosis and problem-solving skills; communicate clearly and concisely relevant findings, workarounds, and steps to resolve.
  • Dedicated to continuous learning; a passion for embracing new and emerging technologies.
  • Keen interest and ability to work collaboratively as part of a team.
  • Great attention to detail and time management skills.
  • You must hold current permanent and full-time working rights in Australia.
  • Personality/ Behaviour aligns with Esri Australia’s core values.

The following skills and experience will make a difference:

  • ArcGIS Enterprise (ArcGIS Server, Portal for ArcGIS, and ArcGIS Data Store).
  • Networking Fundamentals (Web server administration, firewalls, load balancing, IIS, DNS, DHCP, TCP/UDP, networking ports).
  • Web Service Fundamentals (SOAP / REST API’s, browser development tools, JavaScript, Python).
  • Web Security and Identity Store integration (Firewalls, SSL Certificates, SSL/TLS, SAML, Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS)).
  • Database Technologies (SQL, MS SQL Server administration, Oracle, PostgreSQL, CouchDB, Elastic).
  • Exposure to environments hosted in Amazon Web Services (AWS) and/or Microsoft Azure Cloud.

For further details or if you have any questions, please contact Tibo Torche, National Talent Acquisition Lead on 07 3218 0448 or mail to ttorche@esriaustralia.com.au .

We are a 2022 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

Please note that Esri Australia does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.

title: Strategy Specialist
description:
• Join an organisation with a strong corporate social responsibility
  • Bring your strategic thinking to an innovative environment
  • Pivotal role in a collaborative team

Seeking a capable professional with relevant commercial experience that supports strategic decision making through analysis and undertaking market research.

About the Company

At HomeStart we believe that affordable home ownership is essential to the health, well-being and ongoing sustainability of our communities. HomeStart’s role, within the framework of government policy, is to provide leadership and innovation in the housing finance sector by enabling more South Australians to fulfil their home ownership dreams. We do this through the provision of innovative housing finance solutions.

Role Overview

The Strategy Specialist is responsible for supporting the Executive to establish and maintain a successful strategy for the organisation through the provision of a planning and monitoring framework. This role will help identify and develop pathways to market opportunities to further build HomeStart’s role in the South Australian home ownership market. Further responsibilities of the role include (among others):

  • Supporting strategic decision making through the provision of information and analysis
  • Assisting in developing HomeStart's external influence through sharing home ownership information
  • Designing organisational positions on housing and home ownership issues for a variety of stakeholders
  • Developing and maintaining a framework for assessing ideas for new opportunities

About the Person

You will be an experienced thought provoking critical strategic thinker with solid commercial experience encompassing market analysis, strategic planning and stakeholder management across a variety of audiences. You will have an analytical approach with a demonstrated track record of data backed decision-making. The ideal candidate will also possess:

  • At least 5 years relevant commercial experience coupled with relevant tertiary qualifications
  • Experience in strategic thinking, evidenced by development and preparation of strategy
  • Demonstrated initiative, with the capacity and discipline to self-generate ideas or opportunities
  • Proven experience in relationship development and ongoing management
  • Commercial acumen and market knowledge
  • Capacity to influence and build strong relationships
  • Strong writing, communication and facilitation skills

For more information please contact Nick on 08 7071 7273

Please note – all applicant resumes must be submitted in Word format only.

title: Analytics Integration Engineer
description:
This company is a rapidly growing team (100+) of mathematicians, engineers, designers, computer scientists, strategists and client success experts based in Australia, USA, Canada and New Zealand building a machine learning-based, advanced analytics workforce and human capital management platform.

The role:

  • Understand client's business processes and technology environment.
  • Understand system and data integration requirements in collaboration with client's technology and operations teams focusing on analytical data and enabling algorithm execution.
  • Configure the platform and integrate with client's systems as per the defined integration approach based on analytical data and algorithm needs.
  • Understand the platform data model and data integration frameworks.
  • Develop c and other integration modules for movement of data to / from client environments.
  • Collaborate with colleagues on Client Support Ticket processes through closure.
  • Maintain ongoing communications with clients to ensure required changes do not impact ongoing internal processes. Collaborate with client's internal technology teams and external partners to ensure timely completion of implementation projects.
  • Work with the colleagues on the Data Science team to solve data requirements and strategy for future analytical capabilities.
  • Work with colleagues on the Data Science team to prepare data structures in support of ongoing reporting requirement.
  • Monitor and maintain data pipelines proactively to ensure high service availability.
  • Works with Data Scientists and ML Engineers to understand mathematical models and optimize data solutions accordingly.



What you bring:

  • Prior experience in system integration and enterprise software implementation, preferably in cloud-based environments for large organizations at scale.
  • Strong interpersonal and client communication skills.
  • Resilience to handle challenges and solve complex client problems.
  • Experience with source code versioning using git and Source Code Repository Hosting Services like Github, Gitlab and/or BitBucket
  • Experience with remote server access & remote service troubleshooting
  • Experience with one or more of the following: Ruby, Python, Linux Shell
  • Experience working with a Linux based environment.

Even better if you have:

  • 3+ years of experience in system and data integration roles as part of an enterprise software implementation in a cloud-based environment.
  • Prior experience in workforce management solutions or analytical solutions.
  • Prior experience working with Quick Service Restaurant and/or Retail industries.



For more information or a confidential discussion, please contact Jessica Gadsby on (08) 8112 7417 quoting reference 244216.



To apply please click the 'Apply Now' button.

title: Senior Test Analyst
description:
About the Department for Correctional Services
The Department employs approximately 1,900 staff and has responsibility for nine prisons and sixteen Community Correctional offices across the state. Our vision is for a safer community by protecting the public and reducing re-offending. We work towards this through the contribution of staff who are employed in a wide variety of fields, from correctional officers and teachers to social workers, psychologists and supervisors of court orders. Their commitment ensures we deliver quality services to prisoners, offenders and victims of crime. We strongly promote diversity and equity in our workforce, which directly contributes to greater effectiveness and better outcomes. In a supportive and collaborative environment, you will encounter interesting professional challenges and you will work alongside dedicated and passionate people who help to turn around the lives of offenders and rebuild lives affected by crime.

Duties
The iSAFE Senior Test Analyst will assist the iSAFE IT and Data Program Manager and iSAFE Program Leadership Group in the effective delivery of the iSAFE Program monitored by the iSAFE PMO by providing senior expert test analyst functions to support successful implementation of the new iSAFE solution. Reporting to the iSAFE IT and Data Program Manager, the iSAFE Senior Test Analyst works within the iSAFE IT and Data workstream and is accountable for all required testing outcomes associated with the iSAFE solution.

Special Conditions

  • Section 47 of the Public Sector Act 2009 applies in conjunction with other provisions of the Act and other applicable industrial entitlements.
  • The incumbent is required to satisfactorily complete a National Criminal History Check;
  • A current South Australian Driver's Licence is essential;
  • A flexible approach to working hours is required;
  • Some interstate and intrastate travel will be required which may necessitate overnight absences.
  • Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa.

Requirements

  • Essential: Nil
  • Desirable: International Software Testing Qualification Board (ISTQB) Certification, Information Technology related degree, PM related certification, ITIL certification

Remuneration
ASO7 ($103,387 - $111,759pa)

Enquiries
Mr John Trembath
iSAFE ICT Senior Project Manager
8218 2042
john.trembath2@sa.gov.au

Additional Information
This is a temporary vacancy for up to 12 months.
It is a requirement for any non-ongoing DCS employees to be fully vaccinated with a Therapeutic Goods Administration approved COVID-19 vaccination.

Application Instructions For more information on how to apply please visit the www.iworkfor.sa.gov.au website and job reference 484111

Applications close: 22/05/2022 11:00 PM

title: Data Processing Officer
description:
• $30-32 Per hour + Super
  • Based in the Western Suburbs
  • Commencing Immediately

About the company

Join a supportive team in a reputable organisation within the financial industry. This is an excellent opportunity for Finance graduates or experienced Data Entry officers seeking an analytical role to work in a fast paced and high volume environment. There are multiple temporary positions on offer for an initial 6-month assignment, working Monday - Friday.

About the role

This role is responsible for the high volume data processing and maintenance of client records and information to support the finance team. Main responsibilities include:

  • High volume data entry, both numeric and alphanumeric
  • Preparation and compiling documentation
  • Internal and external stakeholder liaison is required
  • Ensuring all documents are verified and compliant

Skills & experience

  • Tertiary qualifications in Finance or Finance-related discipline will be advantageous
  • Relevant experience working in a data entry function
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while maintaining high levels of accuracy
  • Strong knowledge of the Microsoft Suite, especially Excel and Word
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to learn new systems and processes in a timely manner will ensure success in a busy role


Benefits

  • Modern offices
  • Inclusive team culture and collaborative team environment
  • Potential for further development opportunities

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply. To apply please click apply or call Renee Caprioli on 08 8216 3511 for a confidential discussion.

title: Grad/PostGrad GIS Support Analyst - Adelaide/Canberra/Brisbane/Perth/Melbourne
description:
• Choose your location! Brisbane, Perth, Melbourne, Adelaide, or Canberra!
  • Get trained and upskilled to support our clients on the complete system for all their geospatial needs.
  • Multiple positions available - open to graduates & post-graduates, through to candidates with 2+ years of experience.

At Esri Australia we share a passion: for solving problems with Geographical Information Systems (GIS) and Enterprise technologies; for contributing to an ongoing geospatial conversation; and collaborating with our clients for a better future. As part of Esri Australia's expanding Client Care Team, you will play a pivotal role in making this vision a reality.

About the Team

Join our passionate application enthusiasts and technology specialists to contribute to our well-earned and highly respected team of troubleshooting and solution experts relied upon by a diverse client base. We are proud to support and contribute to ArcGIS solutions supporting both local, national, and even global projects. Our team members are passionate about the intersection of technology and geographic information systems. We are highly self-driven to grow our skillsets and enthusiastic in our approach to sharing our knowledge with colleagues. Various overlapping backgrounds and skillsets in the team foster plenty of opportunities to share your own expertise and learn from your peers. We strongly encourage you to apply if you have an enthusiasm for learning new technologies, GIS, problem solving, and knowledge sharing.

About the Role

As a GIS Support Consultant, you will deliver on our vision and service delivery principles of Ease, Expertise, Collaboration and Consistency, by providing technical software support and training to our clients, ensuring that our contact with clients delivers a user experience consistent with our client experience vision.

Key responsibilities of the role include:

  • Provide high-quality technical software support, training, and customer service to our Esri Australia end users.
  • Resolve technical issues by means of ArcGIS knowledge, specifically using ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Desktop and ArcGIS Online.
  • Work well in a high-energy, fast-paced, enthusiastic, positive, and collaborative culture.
  • Identify, understand, and articulate solutions for customer issues related to ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Desktop and ArcGIS Online using Esri tools and other related technologies.
  • Interfacing and providing high level assistance to key and strategic clients.
  • Assist in the development and maintenance of our service desk documentation ensuring that the documentation is accurate and of a high quality.
  • Being successful in this role involves being keen to learn more about geospatial technologies, desktop ArcGIS applications, and developing product knowledge across a suite of ArcGIS Products.

About You

  • You have recently graduated (BA preferred) in associated business disciplines (Geography, Geospatial Science, Remote Sensing and/or Surveying) or have relevant industry experience.
  • Experience working with ArcGIS Pro and/or ArcGIS Desktop and/or ArcGIS Online and other related technologies.
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills. You communicate well in both written and verbal medium. You can communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • The ability to effectively demonstrate fault diagnosis and problem-solving skills; and communicate relevant issues and findings.
  • Dedicated to continuous learning; eager to learn and embrace new and emerging technologies.
  • Keen interest and ability to work collaboratively as part of a team.
  • Great attention to detail and time management skills.
  • Working rights - You must hold current permanent and full-time working rights in Australia.
  • Personality/ behaviour aligns with Esri Australia's core values.

About the Process

As part of the recruitment process we will require all applicants to provide a short video cover letter (approx. 3 minutes).

We ask you to post your video on an open source platform (e.g. Youtube, Upload through WeTransfer or else.)

You will need to update the URL through the application process through our Career Portal.

You should include the following information:

  • Your name and where you're from
  • Personal statement that describes your overall skills and abilites
  • What makes you qualified for the position
  • What you would bring to the team and the position

For further details or if you have any questions, please contact Chris Downie, Talent Acquisition Coordinator on 07 3218 0442 or mail to cdownie@esriaustralia.com.au .

We are a 2022 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.

Please note that Esri Australia does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.

title: SENIOR FINANCIAL PLANNING AND REPORTING ANALYST
description:
SAHMRI

South Australian Health and Medical Research Institute (SAHMRI) is committed to achieving innovative, ground-breaking health and medical research that fundamentally improves the quality of life for all people.  It’s home to more than 700 medical researchers, working together to improve the prevention, treatment and diagnosis of some of the biggest health challenges in society today.

Reporting to the Financial Planning and Analysis Manager (FP&A Manager), this newly created role provides an opportunity to contribute to the continued enhancement of financial reporting, forecasting and budgeting systems and processes to support SAHMRI’s growth and innovation. The role also provides an opportunity for leadership development through coaching, mentoring and supporting the development of team members. This pivotal role will:

  • prepare high quality and timely management reports, analysis of performance against budget and the identification of trends and insights to inform business decisions;
  • prepare monthly financial information for allocated projects, providing meaningful insights to support stakeholders with effective financial management of their areas;
  • support the FP&A Manager to deliver the annual budget and forecast processes;
  • support the FP&A Manager and in-house Oracle ERP team to provide insights on the development of the Oracle financial reporting system to better suit SAHMRI finance’s growing needs;
  • provide coaching and development support to team members, encouraging a culture of continuous development and service delivery.

Applications are encouraged from CPA/CA candidates with proven experience providing sound advice, guidance and support to a wide range of stakeholders in a comparable finance partnering role. Strong analytical skills, service orientation, attention to detail and excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to form strategic value adding relationships with stakeholders will be critical to your success.

It’s an exciting time join SAHMRI as it responds to significant growth, with high profile projects such as the new Australian Bragg Comprehensive Cancer Centre, that continue to deliver world class research translating to life changing health outcomes for our society.

Please visit henderconsulting.com.au for a job and person specification. For further information on our client, please visit sahmri.org

Applications should be addressed to Bernie Dyer.

For a confidential discussion, please call (08) 8100 8849 .

title: Senior SAS Programmer / Statistical Programmer
description:
Avance Clinical - our most important asset is our people. We offer a fun, friendly work environment and a culture that values honesty and respects its people.

Avance Clinical is a Contract Research Organisation which offers specialised services supporting clinical drug development for the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industry.

The Opportunity

If you are highly skilled in SAS programming, are passionate about clinical research and want to work in a challenging and stimulating environment where what you do matters, then we want to hear from you now.

Responsibilities

  • Preparation of listings, tables and figures for clinical study reports.
  • Assist Data Management team in the development and implementation of programmed data checks.
  • Assist Data Management team in reconciliation of external data with data collected in the study database.
  • Preparation of SDTM datasets from various types of source databases.
  • Preparation of analysis datasets based on the CDISC ADaM standard.
  • Preparation of support documentation for CDISC compliant submission packages.

What you’ll need to succeed

  • Ordinary degree in the appropriate discipline or appropriate industry experience.
  • Minimum 4 years’ experience in pharmaceutical / health research.
  • SAS programming experience.
  • Knowledge of ICH GCP Guidelines, medical terminology and clinical trials processes.
  • Formal training in SAS programming (desirable).
  • Experience working with CDISC standards, especially SDTM and ADaM (Highly desirable) .
  • Knowledge of database management (desirable) .
  • Excellent MS Word and Excel skills.
  • Demonstrated initiative, trust and reliability and the ability to work unsupervised.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills.

Benefits

  • Reputable growing CRO with stability
  • Challenging and stimulating environment where what you do matters
  • A diverse and inclusive culture with a strong emphasis on team collaboration
  • Training and career development opportunities
  • Attractive remuneration

To apply

  • Join our team and submit your CV along with a cover letter outlining your skills and experience - please submit as one PDF document.
  • No agencies please

www.avancecro.com

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
About Us

Bridgestone is a global leader in sustainable mobility and advanced solutions, providing products, services and solutions for a world in motion. We have a long-held tradition of excellence supported by a commitment to offer the highest quality products and services to all customers. Through our mission of "Serving Society with Superior Quality" Bridgestone strives to be a company trusted by the community and valued by its employees.

About the role

Reporting directly to the SAP Business Applications Manager, you will work closely with the Business Systems team to provide high levels of customer service to the company’s end users. Your key responsibilities will include interpreting, analysing and documenting business reporting requirements, identifying solutions to fulfil business needs and developing solutions to contribute to the continuous improvement of business processes and procedures primarily focused on SAP ERP and SAP BW systems. You will also be responsible for designing specification documents, writing test cases, processing and implementing change requests and assisting management with the implementation of various systems projects as required.

About you

This is an excellent opportunity to build on your prior business analyst experience with a multi-national organisation. This role offers broad scope and will require exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities, coupled with high-level written and oral communication skills. Your flexibility, initiative and outstanding ability to develop and maintain relationships at all levels will add further to your success.

  • Tertiary qualifications in IT, Computer Science or a Business related discipline are highly desirable.
  • Experience in Data Modelling with SAP BW and business reporting within SAP Business Objects will be very well regarded.

This is an excellent opportunity for an enthusiastic, dynamic and proactive individual to join a National icon that provides exceptional working conditions and a positive and engaged organisational culture.

What we offer

The successful candidate will be rewarded with a competitive salary and staff discounts. You will also join a globally recognised company that values its employees. Working in a City Fringe location with your own undercover carpark.

To apply, please provide a Cover Letter and Resume quoting reference number: S21215

title: eCommerce Specialist
description:
Milford is offering a rare opportunity within the Australian automotive marketplace for an eCommerce Specialist focussed on creating a highly compelling user experience across the digital space.

Working within our sales and marketing department, your key function will be to manage and drive all aspects of our eCommerce activity. In doing this you will plan, execute & manage a broad range of digital marketing activities, social media channels and business / application metadata.

To be successful in this role, you will be highly familiar in the use of CMS driven eCommerce platforms and demonstrate a sound proficiency in using all Microsoft 365 applications.  With a focus on product application and management, you will also quickly develop advanced ERP skills in order to best maximise our eCommerce impact.

Newly graduated or final year students within a marketing, business or sales based discipline looking to develop their career and long term prospects should all apply for this position.

Please click the 'Apply For This Job' button to submit your resume and mandatory covering letter

Applications Close May 31

title: National Public Policy and Economics - Associate/Senior Associate
description:
About the Opportunity

You’ll help build evidence to transform Australian businesses and governments to create value and improve the way they work. As a National Public Policy and Economics - Associate/Senior Associate, you’ll add value to our high profile policy development and reform projects that extend from market development and reform to program evaluation.

As part of the opportunity, you’ll have access to professional development and technical upskilling that is all about helping you thrive. You’ll work with inspiring people, join a culture driven to make a difference and develop your skills as you help us to solve important problems. With paid study leave, flexible working and other benefits, you’ll have the freedom to create a career that grows as you do.

What will you create?

This role provides an opportunity to work in our Skilled Service Hub in Adelaide with the National PPE team across the health, infrastructure and government sectors at both a federal and state level. You will play a key role in creating the evidence base for governments to use in making important informed policy decisions that impact all Australians. Much of our material is used in the evidence base and new policy decision making documents for governments and their Ministers.

In joining, you’ll lead and integrate into PwC engagements across sectors, working with agility and excellence to deliver value to our clients. You'll use your insight and expertise to augment the capacity and capability of the public sector to deliver its work.

About you

We are looking for people with strong skills in the research and analysis of public policy data and information. This includes people who can:

  • apply Australian Bureau of Statistics data to analytical work in various public policy areas
  • undertake desktop research on policy developments and innovations in national and international jurisdictions (e.g. national and international approaches to energy reform, school reform, fiscal policy approaches, and infrastructure policy development)
  • perform general research and synthesis tasks, including rapid reviews and market analysis of published, peer-reviewed, grey literature materials and market data, synthesising key findings and themes
  • read and interrogate Commonwealth and state/territory budget papers and Portfolio Budget Statements from both a qualitative and quantitative perspective
  • understand key concepts in relation to health economic analysis, including cost benefit analysis, quality of life years, health technology assessments, return on investment and social return on investment to support with research and analysis
  • research legislation and regulations, including history of amendments (explanatory memoranda to bills, Hansard debates, etc.)
  • understand key concepts in relation to program evaluation and review.

Eligibility

You’re a graduate in Economics, Research, Law, Public Policy, or Commerce.

Due to the security requirements to access the data involved in delivering our projects, you must be an Australian Citizen who has, OR is willing to obtain a minimum government NV1 Security Clearance.

Life at PwC

Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.

We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.

We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.

PwC is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, as well as visitors to our offices and events.

PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff, contractors, clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices, attend client sites, undertake work-related travel, or attend work-related events, subject to limited exemptions. For more information: https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html

title: Corporate Finance Analyst
description:
ElectraNet builds, owns, operates, and maintains the South Australian high voltage transmission network that delivers electricity from generators to distributors and major load connected customers, enabling power to be supplied to homes, businesses, and communities.

The Opportunity

As part of our Treasury and Corporate Finance team, you will undertake financial modelling and analysis to assess, research and investigate optimal capital financial plans, project investments and valuations that consider the commercial and regulated environments in which we operate. The role will also undertake portfolio reporting and provide market intelligence and commercial insight to a broad range of stakeholders, from the Board of Directors, Shareholders and Executives through to business leaders.

This position has become available due to an internal promotion and is an excellent opportunity for someone looking to expand their commercial experience in a complex technical environment, operating with the support and guidance of an established team.

Working in the Treasury & Corporate Finance function provides an opportunity to gain exposure to all aspects of the company’s operations.  The work undertaken and outcomes delivered by the function is highly visible across multiple divisions, the Board, Executive and Senior Leaders across the business along with external service providers and investors.  This environment provides the team and individuals with a high level of challenging and career development opportunities.

About You

You will have experience in a similar environment, with proven high-level financial modelling and analysis, forecasting, scenario analysis, capital optimisation and valuations experience.

Your commercial acumen will be underpinned by influential stakeholder engagement skills demonstrated by the ability to effectively communicate and translate complex financial concepts and frameworks in a meaningful way, providing rich market insights and commentary for material and business critical financial planning and decision making.

Your approach will be positive and flexible with an adaptable attitude, a willingness to take on a wide range of diverse tasks and adjust to competing and shifting priorities in a changing environment, to achieve a best for business outcome.

Formal qualifications in Accounting/Finance or a relevant discipline and an approved accountancy or post graduate qualification (e.g., CA / CPA / CFA) is essential.

About Us

Safety is at the heart of all that we do, and our most valuable assets are our people.

Our people are what make ElectraNet a great place to work. We also work flexibly to achieve our outcomes, collaborating in the office, onsite or virtually to ensure we provide energy and infrastructure solutions for a better world.

This is an excellent opportunity to grow your career within a diverse, complex and highly regulated environment.

Click 'Apply' to view the Position Description on our careers page. Applications close Sunday 15 May 2022. Please apply online.

​For further information on all our employee benefits visit our website.

Please follow us on LinkedIn.

title: Senior Information Officer
description:
Your new company
South Australia Police (SAPOL) provides a diverse range of services to the community. These services are aimed at producing a safe and peaceful environment by the minimisation of crime and disorder. It is a large complex organisation which, because of the nature of its operations, is constantly subject to public scrutiny and accountability. It provides services to a range of different locations (over 100) spread across the State on a 24 hour a day basis. SAPOL’s vision is to provide a visible, responsive police service for all South Australians. All SAPOL employees are guided by Our Values of Service, Integrity, Courage, Leadership, Collaboration and Respect. SAPOL is an organisation with a proud history and an exciting vision for the future.

Your new role
The Senior Information Officer is accountable to the Manager, Data Management Unit within the Information Services Branch, for the development, implementation and coordination of approved programs and projects as required within SAPOL that promote and maintain the accuracy, reliability, integrity and consistency of SAPOL data assets at both the local and national level. Your role will include the development and maintenance of tools to support the management of data incorporating best practice guidelines and standards for data capture, integration and conversion mapping. You will be involved in the analysis of data to resolve issues, create and undertake impact assessments and user acceptance testing to support Australian Criminal Intelligence Commission (ACIC) and SAPOL initiatives. The position also involves liaison with internal and external stakeholders at a Managerial level.

What you will need to succeed

  • Excellent communication both written and verbal to convey information across all levels of staff both internally and externally.
  • Demonstrated ability to critically examine and analyse complex and diverse work practices, information capture flow systems.
  • Proven experience developing practical and innovative solutions.
  • Experience in the development, implementation and management of agency wide policies, procedures and standards.
  • Knowledge of data management tools and best practice standards within the information management environment related to legislation and government policies.

Special Conditions

  • Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory Criminal History Check and compliant Immunisation screening.
  • Incumbent may be assigned to other duties at this remuneration level or equivalent.
  • Some out of hours work and intra/interstate travel may be required.

Salary
ASO6 - $94,176 - $99,615 per annum.

What you need to do now
If you have the necessary experience as a Senior Information Officer then please apply via the link below with your CV, cover letter and response to the selection criteria or contact Sarah Ormandy at SAPOLapplications@hays.com.au .

Application Instructions:
Please click on ‘Apply’ which will direct you to iworkforSA and further information will be provided on how to apply.

Applications Close: 2/6/2022 5:00 PM

title: Quality Control Analytical Specialist
description:
Quality Control Analytical Specialist

Are you experienced in Quality Control, analytics and thrive in achieving excellence in a dynamic environment? Do you deliver standout results first time, every time?

If so, you’ll fit right in at Mayne Pharma.

Our team is rapidly growing, and we’re searching for professionals looking to make their mark.

What’s in it for you? You’ll help us achieve our mission of delivering better, safer and more accessible pharmaceutical products.

At Mayne Pharma, the results speak for themselves

Mayne Pharma has a 40-year track record and has set about delivering the highest quality products and strictest quality control protocols for the pharmaceuticals industry. This extends to a robust portfolio of branded and generic drugs spanning dermatology, women’s health, urology and more.

We’re always searching for ways to improve.

That’s why we develop new technologies, delivery systems and products to better serve our customers. To make this possible, Mayne Pharma employs over 900 staff globally – including more than 200 scientists.

Culture comes first

We put people first at Mayne Pharma.

And the reason is simple: we know that cultivating a strong culture means we can deliver on our promise ­– to offer better, safer and more accessible medicines.

To make hard work rewarding, you will enjoy a competitive salary, development opportunities and a plethora of health, wealth and lifestyle benefits – including:

  • Salary packaging
  • Financial bonuses
  • Travel discounts
  • Pandemic leave
  • EAP and wellness programs
  • Discounted gym memberships

Did we mention our values?

Accountability, agility, creativity, empowerment, integrity and passion. That’s what we stand for. So if these resonate with you, you’ve found the perfect match.

Here’s where you come in

As an experienced Quality Control Analytical Specialist, you’ll join a fast-paced environment that pushes you to achieve your best as you partner the business to deliver its products and improve its processes.

But you won’t do it alone. You’ll be supported – every step of the way as part of a high achieving Quality Control Team.

Your responsibilities, at a glance:

  • Directly support the QC Co-ordinator for authorising QC laboratory data as it relates to raw materials and liquids and creams products.
  • Manage changes (for example through change control) to QC specifications in approved documentation management processes and laboratory data management systems.
  • Provide in depth technical knowledge and specialist skills with respect to use, maintenance, troubleshooting and revision of cGMP analytical laboratory methods and equipment (i.e. HPLC, GC, UV spectroscopy etc).
  • Lead and administer the compendial review program for the QC department, inclusive of driving compendial method verifications as required.
  • Support continuous improvement in the QC laboratory through aligning raw material test requirements (Assay/Related compounds for example) with finish product testing.

Support the QC laboratory by ensuring responsibility for the provision of Specialist analytical knowledge, analytical method, validation verification, GMP compliance and training.

You need to tick these boxes.

We pick applicants based on capability and aptitude. But we also emphasise cultural fit.

Therefore, you’ll need to have a positive mindset and be prepared to take ownership of your performance.

You’ll also need to hold a Degree in Science (Chemistry or related field)

Experience in Pharmaceutical (GMP) or related industry (preferably a QC environment)

Extensive experience with analytical equipment and techniques (HPLC and GC)

Ability to clearly and logically present complex technical information in written and oral formats

Formal Supervisory or management training and/ or experience (desirable)

Ready to become part of the Mayne Pharma story?

Join the Mayne Pharma team today and help us deliver better, safer and more accessible pharmaceutical products.

To apply, please forward your application, including a cover letter and resume.

APPLY NOW

*We are offering a permanent position.

From 1st December 2021, all new employees at Mayne Pharma must be fully vaccinated with a TGA-recognised COVID-19 vaccine and provide evidence of vaccine status

At Mayne Pharma we value work-life balance and support our people in maintaining a strong sense of personal wellbeing and purpose. That’s why we are committed to providing opportunities for our people to grow and develop both personally and professionally and have a strong culture of promoting and developing talent from within.

title: Database Administrator
description:
About Optic Security Group

Optic Security Group is the leading provider of business-critical, converged security solutions across Australia and New Zealand helping organisations safeguard their people, assets, information and technology.

In response to the ever-evolving and increasingly complex security landscape, we provide corporate, enterprise and government customers in-depth technical and industry expertise to tackle all emerging security challenges.

Our team consists of just under 200 brilliant people across 18 different locations serving and meeting the needs of 1,000’s of customers that place risk mitigation high on their agenda.

The Role

An opportunity to provide database and client relationship support to the Group Marketing Manager in a temporary capacity.  The role will be a national role requiring professionalism and trust as a frontline contact to our clients, located across a variety of industries. A pleasant phone manner is a must as is the ability to self-manage workload with a positive attitude.   Although initially a temporary position there may be potential for a longer-term administrative role at the completion of this project.

  • Management and contact with an Australia wide client base that is both timely and proactive.
  • Maintain client database and spreadsheets as required.
  • Maintenance of the client base to ensure correct contact information.
  • Administrative support as required.
  • 3-month project timeline (possibility to extend).
  • 4 or 5 day a week opportunity – office-based role.

Why work with us?

  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Work alongside a great positive, growing team
  • Workplace flexibility

If this sounds like you and you’re keen to be considered, then we’d love to hear from you.

Please submit your cover letter and CV.  All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence.

NB You must have Australian citizenship/residency, with a clean criminal record to apply for this job.

title: Lead Configuration Analyst
description:
• Tailored career and development opportunities
  • Position will be based at Mawson Lakes, SA
  • Flexibility to focus on career, family, and lifestyle

As a proud industry leader in Defence mission support, Raytheon Australia is responsible for providing mission critical systems operations, engineering, maintenance and base support services for the Harold E. Holt Defence Precinct, located near Exmouth, Western Australia.

To support this mission, Raytheon Australia is currently seeking a motivated principal systems engineer (space systems), who is ready to join a diverse, talented, and enthusiastic team of engineering professionals in Adelaide, South Australia.

If you are looking for a change or ready for the next step in your career, then this role is for you. To support our mission, Raytheon Australia is currently seeking a motivated Configuration Management (CM) Lead who is ready to join a diverse, talented, and enthusiastic team of engineering professionals in our newly constructed facilities in Mawson Lakes, South Australia.

The CM Lead is responsible for ensuring that product configuration identification, configuration control, configuration status accounting, configuration audits and data management for the program’s Mission Systems is accomplished in accordance with the Raytheon Australia Configuration Status Accounting System (CSAS) and the program’s Configuration Management Plan (CMP). You will be responsible for the ongoing development and maintenance of the NCSHEH CM Processes and Procedures. As the Senior CM representative for HEH you are responsible for mentoring the CM Officer to assist them meet the HEH CM-related contract performance measures.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain the program’s CMP and subordinate processes and procedures;
  • Configure program related CM tools and produce reports to support the contract needs;
  • Facilitate Configuration Control Board (CCB) meetings;
  • Manage and report the status of CCB actions and changes - eg. Engineering Change Proposals (ECP), CSAS Change Activities (CA);
  • Lead Functional and Physical Configuration Audits (FCA/PCA) and associated reviews;
  • Capture Configuration Status Account Information (CSA) within the CSAS; and
  • Ensure integrity of the data set/configuration environment via regular audits.

Skills, Experience and Qualifications

  • An engineering or technical qualification (minimum Certificate III) in a relevant discipline;
  • 6 years of practical configuration management experience;
  • Experience in a defence environment is desirable;
  • Solid communication and interpersonal skills, including experience working with remote teams;
  • Experience with CSAS and Enterprise Asset Management software such as Windchill and Maximo is desirable;
  • Experience in configuring CM software applications to produce customised reports; and
  • Willing and able to travel interstate for short term assignments.

Candidate must be eligible to obtain an Australian Defence Security Clearance. Eligibility can be found at http://www.defence.gov.au/ag with ability to satisfy ITAR material access compliance.

If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding career access your next mission now by clicking the "Apply" button below or contact us at careers@raytheon.com.au

title: Postdoctoral Bioinformatician in Single Cell and Spatial Omics Data Analysis
description:
Full-Time, 2 year Contract

  • Exciting opportunity for an experienced (Level B) post-doctoral bioinformatician/computational biologist
  • World-class health and medical research facility in Adelaide, South Australia
  • Excellent remuneration package, including salary packaging

Salary range $95,000 - $110,000

At the South Australian Health and Medical Research Institute (SAHMRI), we are committed to achieving innovative, ground-breaking health and medical research that fundamentally improves the quality of life for all people.

The South Australian Genomics Centre (SAGC) is a multi-institutional, national genomics and bioinformatics facility that is supported by Bioplatforms Australia (BPA) through the Australian Government’s National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy (NCRIS). The SAGC has consolidated genomics and bioinformatics expertise in the state, with a group of ~10 genomics and bioinformatics staff working side-by-side to deliver innovative genomics and bioinformatics solutions across all areas of genomics research, including agriculture, healthcare and ecology. In 2021, the SAGC was designated as a 10x Genomics Reference Site in spatial transcriptomics and is making significant new investments to develop and apply these technologies.

An exciting opportunity now exists for an experienced (Level B) post-doctoral bioinformatician/computational biologist to join the SAGC bioinformatics platform. To flourish in this role, you will already have a deep understanding of single-cell transcriptomics data analysis and have at least a keen interest, if not existing experience, in the application of spatial transcriptomics and/or other spatial omics approaches to biomedical research questions.

As an experienced bioinformatician you will work with a relatively high degree of independence in the area of single cell and spatial omics data analysis. Single cell and spatial omics technologies available to us include the Chromium X, Visium, STomics, and NanoString technologies and we are actively collaborating with other researchers and facilities who are developing other spatial omics methods (e.g. spatial lipidomics and metabolomics).

You will have a sound understanding of software and workflow development best practices such as source control, test driven programming and continuous integration/deployment. Staff are expected to enable research by leading the development of reproducible, standardised pipelines for single cell and spatial data analysis as well as the development of new methods, pipelines and data visualisation tools. Your career development will be supported and you will be encouraged to publish your research and to collaborate/lead major funding applications to NHMRC, ARC or MRFF.

This role requires the successful candidate to be a team player with excellent communication skills. You will also contribute to the SAGC’s education and outreach activities by leading hands-on training workshops.

About the Role

Key responsibilities include:

  • Provide end-to-end bioinformatics analysis support to our collaborators working in the single cell or spatial omics fields.
  • Develop and publish new bioinformatics pipelines, software and resources that advance capabilities in single cell and spatial omics data analysis.
  • Lead the writing of reports and publications relating to your work.
  • Contribute or lead the development of competitive funding applications to NHMRC, ARC, MRFF or other funding agencies.
  • Contribute to the development and organisation of hands-on training workshops.
  • Ensure successful transfer of knowledge to other members of the SAGC bioinformatics team.

About You

The successful candidate will possess the following key attributes:

  • PhD or equivalent experience, in either bioinformatics, computer science, physics, statistics or other relevant discipline
  • Post-doctoral experience in a research, industry or bioinformatics role
  • Have a deep understanding of single-cell transcriptomics data analysis
  • Prior experience with, or a keen interest in, spatial transcriptomics data analysis - particularly the Visium, STomics and NanoString technologies
  • Have a broad understanding of several of the following areas
    • Transcriptomics : bulk RNAseq, scRNAseq, spatial transcriptomics
    • Genomics : variant, haplotype and diversity analysis, genome assembly, metagenomics, epigenetics
    • DevOps : version control, test driven development and continuous integration, containerisation using Docker/Singularity
    • Systems biology : multi-omics data integration, statistics
    • Statistics : linear models, ANOVA, hypothesis testing
    • Visualisation : data visualisation and User Interface/Experience design
    • Workflow systems : Snakemake and/or Nextflow
    • Other omic's technology : metabolomics, proteomics
  • Prior experience with at least two of the following scripting languages: bash, R, Python and Perl

Special Requirements

  • Some out of hours work may be required

The SAGC are also recruiting for two additional roles:

  • SAHMRI | Bioinformatics Officer
  • SAHMRI | Bioinformatician/Computational Biologist

Everything we do is underpinned by our core values and our institute is dedicated to grow a culture that pursues, enables and demands research excellence. We are proud of the work we do and work hard as a team to make a positive difference to the community.  Our values of Excellence, innovation, courage, integrity and teamwork are what help us achieve our goals. If these are also your values and goals, apply today.

For the safety and wellbeing of our employees and our community you will need to comply with SAHMRI’s Immunisation Policy which includes, wherever possible, that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please contact us if you have any queries specific to your circumstances.

For a copy of the position description, please click here .

For more information, please contact Sen Wang at sen.wang@sahmri.com

Applications close: 11:29pm ACST 31 May 2022

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are strongly encouraged to apply

SAHMRI is a member of the Athena SWAN Science in Australia Gender Equity program. We have been awarded Bronze status for our commitment to advancing the careers of women, trans and gender diverse individuals in STEMM.

title: ICT Corporate Business Partner
description:
The Department for Education is committed to developing an education system where all children and young people reach their potential, enabled by world-class digital technology and systems. In support of this the department has proudly launched a new Digital Strategy 2022 - 2025, which sets the vision, goals and reform activities for improving the use of digital technologies in South Australian government schools.

The department has committed to a focus on five key areas that enable accelerated learning and growth for every child, in every class, in every school and preschool across the state:

  • Strengthen digital foundations
  • Build digital capability
  • Maximise the benefits of digital technologies for teaching and learning
  • Streamline and modernise operations
  • Mobilise ICT support where it is needed

Through this focus the department will embrace the opportunities provided by today's technology, and shape the future of South Australia's education system for generations to come. The Digital Strategy includes seventeen key reform initiatives, each designed to complement one other and support a holistic approach to digital education.

One of these initiatives reflects the establishment of an ICT Corporate Business Partnering team. The department is now seeking multiple ICT Corporate Business Partners to work closely with central leaders to drive the planning, implementation and evaluation of high quality, customer centric business partnering services that ensure strategic engagement and deliver impactful outcomes. The Business Partners will liaise with executive and senior management to identify, evaluate and deliver ICT modernisation programs that are tailored to individual corporate business unit current, and future needs.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Plan and deliver high quality, customer centric business partnering services that identify key areas for modernisation and follow these through to execution
  • Lead the strategic planning and delivery of critical projects to uplift corporate ICT platforms and solutions
  • Conceptualise and implement client specific strategies with particular regard to budget implications of technology modernisation, adapting current and future technology to resolve issues
  • Provide expert advice and briefings for the consideration of the Manager, ICT Corporate Business Partnering, Director, Business Improvement, Chief Information Officer, and a diverse range of corporate and site stakeholders across the State
  • Establish highly effective, collaborative relationships of trust with leaders and their teams

Key Requirements:

  • Extensive experience in the strategic planning, implementation and evaluation of critical business improvement programs that include the delivery of fit for purpose digital technologies
  • Experience in leading and managing multidisciplinary projects and utilising a business partnering approach to engage with executive and senior management
  • Extensive knowledge of the use of tools and data to develop and deliver evidence-based analysis, strategies, engagement plans and executive reporting
  • Highly effective in articulating and presenting complex concepts clearly and concisely, to a diverse range of stakeholders, and negotiate successful outcomes in a professional manner
  • Extensive knowledge of ICT digital technologies and their application in corporate environments

This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is passionate about making a real difference in the lives of South Australian children and young people. The ICT Corporate Business Partner will play a key role in delivering the ICT Services' divisional and overarching departmental strategic agenda, and will directly contribute toward the successful realisation of our Digital Strategy.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply please click apply or call Ash Nair or Dione Chrisakis 08 8216 3517 for a confidential discussion.

title: Senior Test Analyst
description:
About the Department for Correctional Services
The Department employs approximately 1,900 staff and has responsibility for nine prisons and sixteen Community Correctional offices across the state. Our vision is for a safer community by protecting the public and reducing re-offending. We work towards this through the contribution of staff who are employed in a wide variety of fields, from correctional officers and teachers to social workers, psychologists and supervisors of court orders. Their commitment ensures we deliver quality services to prisoners, offenders and victims of crime. We strongly promote diversity and equity in our workforce, which directly contributes to greater effectiveness and better outcomes. In a supportive and collaborative environment, you will encounter interesting professional challenges and you will work alongside dedicated and passionate people who help to turn around the lives of offenders and rebuild lives affected by crime.

Duties
The iSAFE Senior Test Analyst will assist the iSAFE IT and Data Program Manager and iSAFE Program Leadership Group in the effective delivery of the iSAFE Program monitored by the iSAFE PMO by providing senior expert test analyst functions to support successful implementation of the new iSAFE solution. Reporting to the iSAFE IT and Data Program Manager, the iSAFE Senior Test Analyst works within the iSAFE IT and Data workstream and is accountable for all required testing outcomes associated with the iSAFE solution.

Special Conditions

  • Section 47 of the Public Sector Act 2009 applies in conjunction with other provisions of the Act and other applicable industrial entitlements.
  • The incumbent is required to satisfactorily complete a National Criminal History Check;
  • A current South Australian Driver's Licence is essential;
  • A flexible approach to working hours is required;
  • Some interstate and intrastate travel will be required which may necessitate overnight absences.
  • Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa.

Requirements

  • Essential: Nil
  • Desirable: International Software Testing Qualification Board (ISTQB) Certification, Information Technology related degree, PM related certification, ITIL certification

Remuneration
ASO7 ($103,387 - $111,759pa)

Enquiries
Mr John Trembath
iSAFE ICT Senior Project Manager
8218 2042
john.trembath2@sa.gov.au

Additional Information
This is a temporary vacancy for up to 12 months.
It is a requirement for any non-ongoing DCS employees to be fully vaccinated with a Therapeutic Goods Administration approved COVID-19 vaccination.

Application Instructions For more information on how to apply please visit the www.iworkfor.sa.gov.au website and job reference 484111

Applications close: 22/05/2022 11:00 PM

title: Validation Specialist
description:
Validation Specialist

Are you a recent graduate or experienced in Validation and thrive in achieving excellence in a dynamic environment? Do you deliver standout results first time, every time?

If so, you’ll fit right in at Mayne Pharma.

Our team is rapidly growing, and we’re searching for professionals looking to make their mark.

What’s in it for you? You’ll help us achieve our mission of delivering better, safer and more accessible pharmaceutical products.

At Mayne Pharma, the results speak for themselves

Mayne Pharma has a 40-year track record and has set about delivering the highest quality products and strictest quality control protocols for the pharmaceuticals industry. This extends to a robust portfolio of branded and generic drugs spanning dermatology, women’s health, urology and more.

We’re always searching for ways to improve.

That’s why we develop new technologies, delivery systems and products to better serve our customers. To make this possible, Mayne Pharma employs over 900 staff globally – including more than 200 scientists.

Culture comes first

We put people first at Mayne Pharma.

And the reason is simple: we know that cultivating a strong culture means we can deliver on our promise ­– to offer better, safer and more accessible medicines.

To make hard work rewarding, you will enjoy a competitive salary, development opportunities and a plethora of health, wealth and lifestyle benefits – including:

  • Salary packaging
  • Financial bonuses
  • Travel discounts
  • Pandemic leave
  • EAP and wellness programs
  • Discounted gym memberships

Did we mention our values?

Accountability, agility, creativity, empowerment, integrity and passion. That’s what we stand for. So if these resonate with you, you’ve found the perfect match.

Here’s where you come in

As a Validation Specialist, you’ll join a fast-paced environment that pushes you to achieve your best as you partner the business to deliver its products and improve its processes.

But you won’t do it alone. You’ll be supported – every step of the way as part of a high achieving Validation Team.

Your responsibilities, at a glance:

  • Assist in the qualification and validation of pharmaceutical facilities, utilities and equipment.
  • Responsible for protocol writing and execution.
  • Establishing test procedures and documenting results, analyse failures and observations.
  • Prepare resolution plans for testing shortfalls, present verification test results and recommend improvements to design.

An opportunity currently exists for a team of Validation Specialists to be part of a multi-disciplined validation team working with various and numerous stakeholders for projects across Mayne Pharma. Reporting to the Validation Team Leader, you will be responsible for the execution of validation and qualification activities for the infrastructure and equipment associated with our multi-faceted pharmaceutical manufacturing facility.

You need to tick these boxes

We pick applicants based on capability and aptitude. But we also emphasise cultural fit.

Therefore, you’ll need to possess the following:

  • Have a positive mindset and be prepared to take ownership of your performance.

  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate in a dynamic team environment with minimal supervision
