Ready to become part of the Mayne Pharma story?

Join the Mayne Pharma team today and help us deliver better, safer and more accessible pharmaceutical products.

To apply, please forward your application, including a cover letter and resume.

APPLY NOW

*We are offering a permanent position.

From 1st December 2021, all new employees at Mayne Pharma must be fully vaccinated with a TGA-recognised COVID-19 vaccine and provide evidence of vaccine status

At Mayne Pharma we value work-life balance and support our people in maintaining a strong sense of personal wellbeing and purpose. That’s why we are committed to providing opportunities for our people to grow and develop both personally and professionally and have a strong culture of promoting and developing talent from within.

title: Python Developer
description:
Python Developer

$120k - $130k plus super - ESOP available
Remote distributed team throughout Australia - WFH - offices available in Sydney



If you're a Python Developer who's all about solving interesting problems with robust, well-tested back end logic, then this is the role you've been looking for.

You'd be joining a world-class team of engineers on a truly one-of-a-kind payment & financial management application. The platform has already been extremely well received by the Australian market. Following a $20 million funding round, the plan now is to (quite literally) take on the world.

You'll be joining the team to as they look to internationalise the platform. That means integrating with a new card issuing partner who can support global payments, as well as a rift of new feature/product builds to service and overseas userbase.


Key skills/experience

There's a strong, quality focused engineering culture here, that champions TDD and well designed, well tested solutions. As well as implementing code, you'll also be involved with solution design/architecture and advocating for best practices like TDD.

Key tools/tech you'll work with day-to-day include:

  • Python
  • AWS
  • Relational databases like Postgres/MySQL


Other things that make this role interesting:

  • You'll be joining a business with massive investment that's growing. Fast. That means real opportunity to climb into more senior, challenging positions as the company develops
  • A role that *actually* supports home working. You'll be working as part of a fully distributed team. There's an office in Sydney if you want to use it. It's not mandatory though.
  • Whilst you'll be working on a product that's market tested, there's still a ton of new things to build, and challenges to be worked through. If you enjoy the process of solving technical problems, there's heaps to keep you engaged.


Want to find out more? Just hit "apply" to register your interest.

Alternatively contact Jay at Aurec for more details on this and other Python Developer positions that are remote or remote-first.

title: Cyber Governance, Risk & Compliance Analyst
description:
ABOUT THE CLIENT

Elders has been a leading agribusiness in rural Australia since 1839 with a focus on helping people find success with their agricultural business. With over 180 years of knowledge, experience and advice for its clients, Elders continues to focus on its future as a pure agribusiness both within Australia and internationally.

ABOUT THE ROLE

Reporting directly to the Head of Cyber Security and Enterprise Technology, the Cyber Governance Risk & Compliance Analyst will be responsible for managing cyber security governance, risk and compliance processes across IT suppliers, outsourced providers and Elders internal IT environments.

Furthermore from a technical perspective, the successful candidate will be responsible for:

  • Maintaining and operating the Cyber Security Assurance framework, including standards, supporting guidelines, processes, registers, reporting and dashboards
  • Assisting and coordinating with internal and external audit functions as required
  • Reviewing and cyber incident response planning, providing input against current industry trends and standards
  • Improving and executing processes, tools and systems to identify, assess, measure, manage, and monitor risks across Elders
  • Identifying vulnerabilities and weaknesses across internal controls or standards and opportunities for enhancements

ABOUT YOU

The Cyber Governance Risk & Compliance Analyst will be expected to contribute to the Elders culture and display the Elders values. To compliment this:

  • Tertiary degree in IT, business, relevant discipline, or industry experience with similar certifications. i.e. CISSP, CISM, CISA
  • Knowledge and understanding of associated business process and legislative requirements
  • Experience in managing Cyber Security risk, governance and compliance functions across cyber security operations and 3rd party suppliers
  • Experience developing Cyber Security Assurance framework, including standards, supporting guidelines, processes, registers, reporting

If you'd like to know more about this opportunity, please reach out to Liam McBean on 0420 865 288 .

title: Voice and Data Communications Capability Leader
description:
The Opportunity

This is a key senior leadership role for an Engineering Capability Leader within the Mission Systems & Ground Systems Capability. The successful applicant will possess the following attributes:

  • Dynamic, innovative and likes to think outside the square;
  • Team orientated, influential and likes a challenge;
  • An advocate for diversity and inclusion and will be actively involved in leading change;
  • An excellent communicator who can engage and motivate diverse and geographically dispersed teams;
  • Outcome focused and demonstrates strong values-based leadership.

This role is based in Brisbane.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities will include:

  • Lead, develop and engage employees and management team;
  • Strategic workforce planning including the provision of resources to meet multiple project demands and secure future opportunities;
  • Develop and lead the capability growth strategy, including Product, Technology and People, in the area of Voice and Data Communications to align with the BDA business plans and roadmaps;
  • Support executing projects and campaigns within BDA through provision of people, processes and tools to ensure they are successful in meeting our customer expectations;
  • Enable collaboration across the business to identify and leverage commonalities, innovation and efficiencies.

Experience/Qualifications

The successful applicant will have:

  • 10+ years leadership experience in a technical environment;
  • Tertiary qualifications and experience in a field of relevance to Voice and Data Communications;
  • Leadership experience within a matrix organisation (desirable);
  • Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements.

About Us

Boeing Defence Australia is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force. As a BDA employee, you will join other innovative, ethical people who have the critical skills required to develop and deliver world class capabilities and systems to protect Australia and its national interests. Joining us is a chance to make your mark, working with a diverse team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.

We encourage movement within the organisation; our aim is to nurture our existing employees and help them reach their full potential.

title: Voice and Data Communications Capability Leader
description:
The Opportunity

This is a key senior leadership role for an Engineering Capability Leader within the Mission Systems & Ground Systems Capability. The successful applicant will possess the following attributes:

  • Dynamic, innovative and likes to think outside the square;
  • Team orientated, influential and likes a challenge;
  • An advocate for diversity and inclusion and will be actively involved in leading change;
  • An excellent communicator who can engage and motivate diverse and geographically dispersed teams;
  • Outcome focused and demonstrates strong values-based leadership.

This role is based in Brisbane.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities will include:

  • Lead, develop and engage employees and management team;
  • Strategic workforce planning including the provision of resources to meet multiple project demands and secure future opportunities;
  • Develop and lead the capability growth strategy, including Product, Technology and People, in the area of Voice and Data Communications to align with the BDA business plans and roadmaps;
  • Support executing projects and campaigns within BDA through provision of people, processes and tools to ensure they are successful in meeting our customer expectations;
  • Enable collaboration across the business to identify and leverage commonalities, innovation and efficiencies.

Experience/Qualifications

The successful applicant will have:

  • 10+ years leadership experience in a technical environment;
  • Tertiary qualifications and experience in a field of relevance to Voice and Data Communications;
  • Leadership experience within a matrix organisation (desirable);
  • Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements.

About Us

Boeing Defence Australia is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force. As a BDA employee, you will join other innovative, ethical people who have the critical skills required to develop and deliver world class capabilities and systems to protect Australia and its national interests. Joining us is a chance to make your mark, working with a diverse team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.

We encourage movement within the organisation; our aim is to nurture our existing employees and help them reach their full potential.

title: Bioinformatics Officer
description:
Full-Time, 2 year contract

Salary Range $80,000 - $95,000

At the South Australian Health and Medical Research Institute (SAHMRI), we are committed to achieving innovative, ground-breaking health and medical research that fundamentally improves the quality of life for all people.

The South Australian Genomics Centre (SAGC) is a multi-institutional, national genomics and bioinformatics facility that is supported by Bioplatforms Australia (BPA) through the Australian Government’s National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy (NCRIS). The SAGC has consolidated genomics and bioinformatics expertise in the state, with a group of ~10 genomics and bioinformatics staff working side-by-side to deliver innovative genomics and bioinformatics solutions across all areas of genomics research, including agriculture, healthcare and ecology.

An exciting opportunity now exists for an entry level post-doctoral researcher or experienced MSc-level bioinformatician to join the SAGC bioinformatics team. To flourish in this role, you will need to be able to work across multiple different projects and to possess excellent organisational and time-management skills.

This role is primarily responsible for conducting bioinformatics analyses on a wide variety of client projects with varying levels of complexity. You will have a varied and interesting workload across projects in different biological disciplines.

There are significant opportunities for professional growth and development through exposure to data sets from different genomics technologies. Staff are expected to enable research by leading the development of reproducible, standardised pipelines for genomics data analysis and, where necessary, new methods and pipelines. Your career development will be supported and you will be encouraged to publish your research and to collaborate on major funding applications to NHMRC, ARC or MRFF.

You will also be supported to develop your bioinformatics capabilities; ensuring that the SAGC can remain at the forefront of genomics. It is expected that you will have interest in and develop your capabilities in at least one specialist area of bioinformatics.

About the Role

Key responsibilities include:

  • Provide end-to-end bioinformatics analysis support to SAGC clients
  • Develop reproducible analytical workflows with a view to improve internal efficiencies as well as client experiences
  • Contribute to/or lead the drafting of reports and publications

About You

The successful candidate will possess the following key attributes:

  • MSc, PhD, or equivalent experience, in either bioinformatics, computer science, physics, statistics or other relevant discipline
  • Have a broad understanding of at least two of the following areas and a significant interest in developing a deep understanding in at least one:
    • Transcriptomics : bulk RNAseq, scRNAseq, spatial transcriptomics,
    • Genomics : variant, haplotype and diversity analysis, genome assembly, metagenomics, epigenetics
    • DevOps : version control: test driven development and continuous integration, containerisation using Docker/Singularity
    • Systems biology : multi-omics data integration, network analysis
    • Statistics : linear models, ANOVA, hypothesis testing
    • Visualisation : data visualisation and User Interface/Experience design
    • Workflow systems : Snakemake and/or Nextflow
    • Other Omic's technology : metabolomics, proteomics
  • Prior experience with at least one of the following scripting languages: bash, R, Python and Perl

Special Requirements

  • Some out of hours work may be required

The SAGC are also recruiting for two additional roles:

  • SAHMRI | Bioinformatician/Computational Biologist
  • SAHMRI | Postdoctoral Bioinformatician in Single Cell and Spatial Omics Data Analysis

Everything we do is underpinned by our core values and our institute is dedicated to grow a culture that pursues, enables and demands research excellence. We are proud of the work we do and work hard as a team to make a positive difference to the community.  Our values of Excellence, innovation, courage, integrity and teamwork are what help us achieve our goals. If these are also your values and goals, apply today.

For the safety and wellbeing of our employees and our community you will need to comply with SAHMRI’s Immunisation Policy which includes, wherever possible, that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please contact us if you have any queries specific to your circumstances.

For a copy of the position description, please click here .

For more information, please contact Sen Wang at sen.wang@sahmri.com

Applications close: 11:29pm ACST 31 May 2022

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are strongly encouraged to apply

SAHMRI is a member of the Athena SWAN Science in Australia Gender Equity program. We have been awarded Bronze status for our commitment to advancing the careers of women, trans and gender diverse individuals in STEMM.

title: Principal Reporting Ethics & Investigations
description:
About BHP

At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success. Come and be a part of this success.

About the Role

The purpose of the Principal Reporting Ethics & Investigations is to design and deliver reports to provide insights to the BHP Board, the Executive, Functions and Line Management in relation to Ethics & Investigations matters. This role will coordinate and respond to planned and unplanned Ethics & Investigations business information requests

Additional accountabilities of the role include:

  • Leads the development and delivery of internal and external reports with a high degree of quality
  • Maintains regular reporting routines and processes to meet Senior Management business information needs. Implements processes to ensure continuous understanding in business need with Key Stakeholders
  • Provides report writing Subject Matter Expertise to identify underlying themes and focus areas of governance over Ethics & Investigations. In preparing Board Papers and Executive Leadership Team Papers, collaborate with process partners (HSE, Inclusion & Diversity and others) to confirm alignment.
  • Provides timely, objective, complete, factually accurate and professionally written reports that add value and provide stakeholders with the necessary transparency of information to make appropriate decisions.
  • Uses data analytics to develop robust themes and focus areas to share insights with the business. Review the integrity of the data used in preparing reports
About You

As the successful candidate you will have demonstrated experience establishing and maintaining strategic stakeholder relationships, including collaboration between key discussion makers. You enjoy supporting team performance and capability development through peer support, collaboration, sharing of lessons learned and providing on-time feedback.

In addition, we are seeking specific attributes such as:

  • Expertise in reporting design, implementation and utilisation
  • Experience in engaging with stakeholders to determine suitable solutions for information requests
  • Demonstrated experience in implementation of processes to manage and prioritise information requests
  • Experience in developing targeted technical reports (e.g. memo, business case, project report) to inform or influence parties to make value adding decisions based on data
  • Experience preparing Board Papers and Executive Leadership Team Papers
  • Experience utilising data analytics to develop themes and focus areas, including the ability to review data integrity for inputs into reporting
  • Knowledge and proven experience in the resources mining or manufacturing industry
  • Tertiary qualifications - ideally in Law/Commerce/Management/Finance
About Our Process

At BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks.

BHP also requires employees in Australia to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 to ensure the safety and wellbeing of our people (from the 31st of January 2022 or earlier depending on relevant state health directives). If you are applying for a role at BHP please consider this new requirement when submitting your application. BHP will also adhere to any relevant health directives that may be made that affects our workforce. For further information please see our website

Supporting a Diverse Workforce

The size and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance based bonuses and unique BHP employee share program.

At BHP, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourage applications from all qualified applicants regardless of race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, people with disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.

We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.

BHP is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disability.

title: EOI - FINANCIAL ANALYSTS - ADELAIDE
description:
About Santos
Santos is a global low-cost producer of oil and gas committed to ever-cleaner energy and fuels production with operations across Australia, Papua New Guinea, Timor-Leste and North America.
Santos has been supplying reliable and affordable energy to Australia and the Asia-Pacific for over 65 years. At Santos, our commitment is to be a global leader in the transition to cleaner energy and clean fuels, by helping the world decarbonise to reach net-zero emissions in an affordable and sustainable way.

Santos is already Australia’s biggest domestic gas supplier, a leading Asia-Pacific LNG supplier and is committed to supplying the critical fuels such as oil and gas in a more sustainable way through decarbonising projects such as the Moomba CCS project.

Underpinned by a diverse portfolio of high-quality, long-life, low-cost oil and gas assets, Santos seeks to deliver long-term value to shareholders. For more than 65 years, Santos has been working in partnership with local communities, providing local jobs and business opportunities, safely and sustainably developing its natural gas resources, and powering industries and households.

As customer demand evolves, Santos plans to grow its cleaner energy and clean fuels through carbon capture and storage, nature-based offsets, energy efficiency and use of renewables in its operations. With a strong, low-cost base business supplying oil and gas and plans to develop cleaner energy and clean fuels, Santos remains resilient, value accretive and at the leading edge of the energy transition.

About the role
An exciting time in the company’s journey having now formed a merged entity between Santos and Oil Search, we are now advertising for multiple Financial Analyst positions within our Finance division teams including Corporate teams and business division teams. Reporting to the Financial Controller, you will be responsible for assisting the Santos Finance team in meeting the Group's obligations relating to financial planning and analysis, internal management reporting, ASX financial reporting, in addition to, assisting with month end corporate group analysis; whilst assisting with the Finance Manager in responsibilities of providing finance support, oversight and analysis to the divisional Executive Vice President.

Accountabilities are delivered in line with the Santos company values. Key responsibilities of the role include:

  • Assisting financial accounting, budgeting, forecasting and providing financial analysis
  • Supporting key Group year end and half year processes including impairment and restoration assessment and other ad hoc work
  • Working with key stakeholders to produce and review monthly Asset Performance Reports to provide key stakeholders with analysis, insight and commentary in relation to business performance, including performance against targets and trends, key business drivers and performance metrics
  • Providing asset ASX reporting information to Investor Relations
  • Assisting with preparation of annual and half year subsidiary Financial Statements
  • Assisting with preparation of forecasts and budgets
  • Providing assistance to the Asset Teams and Financial Services with accounting and reporting matters
  • Overseeing application of new accounting policies and implementation including calculations and required adjustments at an asset level
About you
The successful candidate will hold relevant tertiary/degree qualifications in Accounting, Commence or a similar tertiary degree including CA, CPA or equivalent. You will bring experience in Accounting with exposure to a large organisation either through direct employment in a large corporate environment or through a large chartered accounting firm. Imperative to your success will be a sound knowledge of Accounting Standards, proven experience in report writing and sounds working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suit. Experience using SAP will be highly advantageous.

This position will suit a proactive, results driven professional who demonstrates strong interpersonal skills with an ability to engage with stakeholders. Proven experience in a senior finance role will be highly regarded.

How to apply
Please apply online. Applications close COB Friday, 20th May 2022

title: *** ERP System Administrator ***
description:
Renowned High Street Establishment located in Mile End is looking to hire an ERP System Administrator to join the team.

There is an internal IT team who look after all things IT, this role reports into the CFO and basically you will become an ERP Subject Matter Expert.

Responsibilities
  • Managing end-to-end Pronto implementation ( modules /upgrades)  and business Customisations.
  • Providing 2nd & 3rd level support to all Pronto software.( across the business – Stores and Support office)
  • Investigating and resolving system issues & data integrity errors on daily basis – Crawl through of the Transactions on a daily basis
  • Contacting Pronto Software for all support calls raised, co-ordinate with user for testing, Department head Sign-off and requesting Pronto fix to push live data set.
  • Carry out system IT audits to bring in visibility to process compliance & track the reported non-compliances to closure on-time, for the projects and supporting groups
  • Liaise with Finance team on business Cognos Reporting systems and support ad-hoc duties.
  • Supporting Store assistance on daily bases on all POS/Retail issues and fixing them on timely manner.
  • Participating in  accounting Period Closures ( Monthly , Quarterly , Half Yearly & Yearly) and support other finance team members in completing their month-end and year end closing activities
  • UAT testing, documenting and process training to users on new development custom function.
  • Analyzing user processes and manifest SOPs for all Pronto Users.

Skills & Experience
  • Retail experience as an ERP system administrator
  • Hands on knowledge & experience working as SA in ERP – Pronto preferred
  • Had implemented roll out of ERP in business
  • Hands on operator (ability to think from user perspective) with great communication skills

title: Bioinformatician/Computational Biologist
description:
Full-Time, 2 year contract

  • An exciting opportunity for an experienced (Level B) post-doctoral bioinformatician/computational biologist
  • World-class health and medical research facility in Adelaide, South Australia
  • Excellent remuneration package, including salary packaging

Salary Range $95,000 - $110,000

At the South Australian Health and Medical Research Institute (SAHMRI), we are committed to achieving innovative, ground-breaking health and medical research that fundamentally improves the quality of life for all people.

The South Australian Genomics Centre (SAGC) is a multi-institutional, national genomics and bioinformatics facility that is supported by Bioplatforms Australia (BPA) through the Australian Government’s National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy (NCRIS). The SAGC has consolidated genomics and bioinformatics expertise in the state, with a group of ~10 genomics and bioinformatics staff working side-by-side to deliver innovative genomics and bioinformatics solutions across all areas of genomics research, including agriculture, healthcare and ecology.

An exciting opportunity now exists for an experienced (Level B) post-doctoral bioinformatician/computational biologist to join the SAGC bioinformatics team. To flourish in this role, you will need to be able to thrive in a fast-paced environment, work across multiple different projects and to possess excellent organisational and time-management skills.

As an experienced bioinformatician you will have a deep understanding of at least one area of bioinformatics and have the ability to work independently and support junior members of the team to reach their full potential. You will have a sound understanding of software and workflow development best practices such as source control, test driven programming and continuous integration/deployment. Staff are expected to enable research by leading the development of reproducible, standardised pipelines for genomics data analysis and, where necessary, new methods and pipelines. Your career development will be supported and you will be encouraged to publish your research and to collaborate on major funding applications to NHMRC, ARC or MRFF.

The role requires a significant amount of face-to-face time with clients to scope out projects, communicate findings over the course of a project, and present a final report. In addition, you will lead hands-on training workshops, in your area of expertise, to teach attendees how to extract maximum value from their data.

About the Role

Key responsibilities include:

  • Provide end-to-end bioinformatics analysis support to SAGC clients
  • Develop and publish new bioinformatics software and resources that supports SAGC researchers
  • Develop reproducible analytical workflows with a view to improve internal efficiencies as well as client experiences and to add new SAGC service offerings
  • Contribute or lead the drafting of reports and publications relating to your work
  • Contribute or lead the development of competitive funding applications to NHMRC, ARC, MRFF or other funding agencies
  • Contribute to the development and organisation of hands-on training workshops

About You

The successful candidate will possess the following key attributes:

  • PhD or equivalent experience, in either bioinformatics, computer science, physics, statistics or other relevant discipline
  • Post-doctoral experience in research, industry or bioinformatics support role
  • Have a broad understanding of several of the following areas and a deep understanding in at least one:
    • Transcriptomics : bulk RNAseq, scRNAseq, spatial transcriptomics
    • Genomics : variant, haplotype and diversity analysis, genome assembly, metagenomics, epigenetics
    • DevOps : version control, test driven development and continuous integration, containerisation using Docker/Singularity
    • Systems biology : multi-omics data integration, statistics
    • Statistics : linear models, ANOVA, hypothesis testing
    • Visualisation : data visualisation and User Interface/Experience design
    • Workflow systems : Snakemake and/or Nextflow
    • Other omic's technology : metabolomics, proteomics
  • Prior experience working in biomedical, agricultural or environmental research
  • Prior experience with at least two of the following scripting languages: bash, R, Python and Perl

Special Requirements

  • Some out of hours work may be required

The SAGC are also recruiting for two additional roles:

  • SAHMRI | Bioinformatics Officer
  • SAHMRI | Postdoctoral Bioinformatician in Single Cell and Spatial Omics Data Analysis

Everything we do is underpinned by our core values and our institute is dedicated to grow a culture that pursues, enables and demands research excellence. We are proud of the work we do and work hard as a team to make a positive difference to the community.  Our values of Excellence, innovation, courage, integrity and teamwork are what help us achieve our goals. If these are also your values and goals, apply today.

For the safety and wellbeing of our employees and our community you will need to comply with SAHMRI’s Immunisation Policy which includes, wherever possible, that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please contact us if you have any queries specific to your circumstances.

For a copy of the position description, please click here .

For more information, please contact Sen Wang at sen.wang@sahmri.com

Applications close: 11:29pm ACST 31 May 2022

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are strongly encouraged to apply

SAHMRI is a member of the Athena SWAN Science in Australia Gender Equity program. We have been awarded Bronze status for our commitment to advancing the careers of women, trans and gender diverse individuals in STEMM.

title: Senior Integration Developer
description:
The Department for Education is committed to developing an education system where all children and young people reach their potential, enabled by world-class digital technology and systems.

The department's intent is to deliver high performing, world class information and communication services. The edAnalytics Hub Program is a key project being delivered to consolidate and replace disparate and end of life data and reporting systems across HR, Finance and Student areas, with a modern enterprise data and analytics solution.

To support this vision, the Department for Education is now seeking a Senior Integration Developer to join the edAnalytics Hub Program to provide advice to the Integration Architect, development team, and internal stakeholders to deliver project requirements and lead the design and development of integration.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead the design and implementation of technically complex programs
  • Model a test-driven and quality-led culture including evaluating automation throughout the software development lifecycle
  • Provide advice in relation to integration architecture to solution and enterprise architects and developers
  • Coordinate and evaluate technical activities including the development of applications and the creation of APIS, point to point integrations and integration platforms
  • Manage, monitor and provide analysis of the integration environment
  • Monitor critical issues, risks and changes, which impact on the Department's data infrastructure and architecture

Key Requirements:

  • Experience planning complex programs which deliver highly integrated and stable applications, interfaces and software platforms
  • Significant experience implementing contemporary data management platforms and utilising Microsoft Azure and Mulesoft technology suites.
  • Knowledge of software development concepts and tools for the development for API, Microservices and the integration of PaaS and SaaS solutions
  • Knowledge of government policies and their application in relation to the department's data-related policies

This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is passionate about making a real difference in the lives of South Australian children and young people.

The Senior Integration Developer will provide technical expertise to all aspects of delivery from requirements analysis, design, testing through to full production deployment. Working collaboratively and with flexibility across divisional teams based on peak workloads and priorities, the role will contribute to achieving the department's objective in providing world class education.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply please click apply or call Ash Nair on 08 8216 3517 for a confidential discussion.

title: Payroll Specialist
description:
• Part Time or Full Time
  • Flexible Environment
  • Supportive Team

Cole School Experts specialise in the provision of virtual and on-site accounting, consulting, and software services to the non-Government Education Sector. Our head office is based in Adelaide with satellite officers on the East Coast, supporting Schools throughout Australia and New Zealand.

We are a rapidly growing business, and it is an exciting time to join our dynamic team.  We provide a modern work environment, we actively promote professional learning and recognise success.

We only work for Schools, typically transactional and virtually and we are looking for a successful, high level Payroll Specialist. You may need to work across multiple clients and multiple software. Schools are complex but we will teach.

Generally, we provide:

  • End to end payroll processing and record maintenance
  • Onboarding & terminations of staff
  • Pay rises, adjustments, payment of leave loading
  • Award/enterprise agreement interpretation
  • Year end reconciliations and requirement

It is imperative we work as a team so personality matters, we need to like, respect, and support each other, so to be successful in this role, the skills you should possess are:

  • the ability to interpret and understand multiple Awards/Enterprise Agreements and current statutory legislations
  • a team player will the ability to converse on all levels
  • strong attention to detail and accuracy
  • be tech-savvy
  • adaptability and a multitasker
  • honesty and strong values
  • resilience to meet daily deadlines
  • the ability to maintain a high degree of confidentiality
  • high achiever with commitment to your clients
  • outstanding Excel skills

School experience would be awesome but is not essential.

We may at times need to attend a school, we will manage the checks but if you are aware of a reason why you would not pass, please do not apply:

  • National Police Check & Working with Children’s Check

If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you!

To apply for this position please submit your resume with a covering letter.

Applications close - 23rd May 2022

title: Financial Analyst / Management Accountant
description:
The Company

One of the world’s largest logistics and materials handling equipment providers is looking for an experienced Business Controller (Financial Analyst/Management Accountant) to join their team. With over 18,000 employees across Europe, Asia, Africa, Australia and South America, this global company is strongly leading the way within the intralogistics industry. Located in Adelaide’s Northern Suburbs, just 20 minutes from the CBD. This is a permanent full-time position, offering Monday-Friday office hours.

The role

The Business Controller (Financial Analyst/Mangement Accountant) will be responsible for managing performance, business cost and account trends whilst focusing on the improvement of profitability. You will be working closely with the Finance and Management team to analyse all aspects of the business whilst directly reporting to the Finance Director.

The main responsibilities and duties involved are, but are not limited to:
  • Preparing reports including evaluation, analysis, and financial control.
  • Conduct annual planning and monthly forecasts as well as monthly and year-end closings
  • Working collaboratively with Business Partners to overcome challenges of monthly and quarterly performance
  • Conduct projects and evaluate processes, systems, and controls.
  • Prepare key documents including business cases
  • Collaborate and work closely with management, marketing sales and logistics teams.

About you

We are looking for an experienced, and highly motivated Business Controller (Financial Analyst/Management Accoutant) to join the close-knit team.

For you to be successful in this role, you must have:

  • Relevant qualifications
  • Sound knowledge of sales and financial controlling
  • Strong communication skills and ability to liaise with key business partners, colleagues, and clients
  • Experience with SAP FICO or SAP Business Warehouse would be ideal but not essential
  • Experience with Baseplan or alternative ERM systems
What’s in it for you?
  • Salary of up to $95k super
  • Onsite car parking
  • Modern offices
  • Family Fun Days & BBQ’s

If this role is of interest to you, APPLY NOW or contact Kathleen on 08 8317 4805 for a confidential discussion.



At people2people and Frog Recruitment, everyone is welcome and as an inclusive workforce, we encourage our employees, clients, and candidates to showcase their authentic selves.

title: Technical Manager, EMR Reporting Services
description:
• Department for Health and Wellbeing, Digital Health SA – Electronic Medical Record (EMR) Project
  • Salary: $115,817 to $120,189 – ASO8 – Full Time / Term Contract (temporary up to 17 December 2022)

SA Health are seeking a highly skilled manager to manage the team providing reporting to all hospitals and health services currently using the SA Health enterprise electronic medical record (Sunrise EMR). The Electronic Medical Project is an exciting opportunity to contribute to ongoing improvements in the health of all South Australians by providing a single unified record for all individuals receiving health care in the state. The EMR Reporting Services team deliver reports critical to the day to day clinical and administrative functions of the health system, optimising the mechanisms to retrieve data from a large complex database in a timely manner to clinicians, administrative staff and executives working in SA Health facilities.

The Technical Manager, EMR Reporting Services is accountable for managing the program of work associated with the provision of EMR Reporting Services to satisfy SA Health strategic and operational reporting requirements from data contained within the EMR database; at the enterprise, health unit, corporate or where appropriate, at the individual levels.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role. Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory Criminal History Check and appropriate immunisation requirements. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants are encouraged to apply. Job ref: 792763

Vaccination Requirements

COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement under the Emergency Management (Healthcare Setting Workers Vaccination) (COVID-19) Directions 2021 to work in a SA Health/health care setting.

Enquiries

Kimberley Brett

Senior Manager Build and Support

Phone: 7425 3279

E-mail: kimberley.brett@sa.gov.au

Friday, 03 June 2022 - 11.55PM

title: EOI - SENIOR FINANCIAL ANALYSTS - ADELAIDE
description:
About Santos
Santos is a global low-cost producer of oil and gas committed to ever-cleaner energy and fuels production with operations across Australia, Papua New Guinea, Timor-Leste and North America.

Santos has been supplying reliable and affordable energy to Australia and the Asia-Pacific for over 65 years. At Santos, our commitment is to be a global leader in the transition to cleaner energy and clean fuels, by helping the world decarbonise to reach net-zero emissions in an affordable and sustainable way.

Santos is already Australia’s biggest domestic gas supplier, a leading Asia-Pacific LNG supplier and is committed to supplying the critical fuels such as oil and gas in a more sustainable way through decarbonising projects such as the Moomba CCS project.

Underpinned by a diverse portfolio of high-quality, long-life, low-cost oil and gas assets, Santos seeks to deliver long-term value to shareholders. For more than 65 years, Santos has been working in partnership with local communities, providing local jobs and business opportunities, safely and sustainably developing its natural gas resources, and powering industries and households.

As customer demand evolves, Santos plans to grow its cleaner energy and clean fuels through carbon capture and storage, nature-based offsets, energy efficiency and use of renewables in its operations. With a strong, low-cost base business supplying oil and gas and plans to develop cleaner energy and clean fuels, Santos remains resilient, value accretive and at the leading edge of the energy transition.

About the role
An exciting time in the company’s journey having now formed a merged entity between Santos and Oil Search, we are now advertising for multiple Senior Financial Analyst positions within our Finance division teams including Corporate financial planning and analysis team and functional reporting team.

Reporting to the Finance Manager, you will be responsible for assisting the Santos Finance team in meeting the Group's obligations relating to internal management reporting, business finance support, ASX financial reporting, in addition to, assisting with month end corporate group analysis; whilst assisting with the Finance Manager in responsibilities of providing finance support, oversight and analysis to the divisional EVP.

The Senior Financial Analysts will have a strong financial accounting background and a high level of commercial acumen to support the coordination and delivery of key business processes between Finance and the operating division to ensure all deliverables are met in a timely manner. The roles will suit candidates with experience in large corporate environments and from large chartered accounting firms looking to move to a large corporate.

Accountabilities are delivered in line with the Santos company values. Key responsibilities of the role include:

  • Assisting financial accounting, budgeting, forecasting and providing financial analysis
  • Supporting key Group year end and half year processes including impairment and restoration assessment and other ad hoc work
  • Working with key stakeholders to produce and review monthly Asset Performance Reports to provide key stakeholders with analysis, insight and commentary in relation to business performance, including performance against targets and trends, key business drivers and performance metrics
  • Providing asset ASX reporting information to Investor Relations
  • Assisting with preparation of annual and half year subsidiary Financial Statements
  • Assisting with preparation of forecasts and budgets
  • Providing assistance to the Asset Teams and Financial Services with accounting and reporting matters
  • Overseeing application of new accounting policies and implementation including calculations and required adjustments at an asset level
About you
The successful candidate will hold relevant tertiary/degree qualifications in Accounting, Commence or a similar tertiary degree including CA, CPA or equivalent. You will bring significant years’ experience (i.e. 7 years +) in finance with exposure to a large organisation either through direct employment or through a large chartered accounting firm. Imperative to your success will be a sound knowledge of Accounting Standards, proven experience in report writing and sounds working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suit. Experience using SAP will be highly advantageous.

This position will suit a proactive, results driven professional who demonstrates strong interpersonal skills with an ability to engage with stakeholders. Proven experience in a senior finance role will be highly regarded.

How to apply
Please apply online. Applications close COB Friday, 20th May 2022

title: Implementation Consultant
description:
• Hiring Mid and Senior level Consultants for WFM and Payroll Implementation teams
  • Remote role, based anywhere in ANZ
  • Must have Payroll and / or Workforce Management experience in the capacity of a Consultant
  • $100-140k base + Super + 10% bonus with accelerators

About the role

You will be working for a global leader in the HCM space, with a presence in every major geography working with customers from 1000 headcount to enterprise 20k+. They are a SaaS business, and value culture and their staff. The projects will see you work as part of a broader team, offering support and guidance along the way.

The implementation consultant participates in all stages of the implementation lifecycle (discovery, configuration, testing, deployment, post-go-live support), under the direction of the Project Manager, and may lead one or more activities.   Project responsibilities include gathering customer requirements, configuring the solution to meet documented customer requirements, setting and managing customer expectations, providing guidance, identifying risks, and communicating issues to the Project Manager.

Essential Functions
  • Provide Implementation Services to Customers
  • Document and validate customer’s business requirements
  • Conduct consulting sessions (on the phone and in-person) and document meeting minutes
  • Attend internal project meetings and provide status on progress of activities and deliverables
  • Provide customers with follow-up consulting and general assistance in areas of expertise
  • Be a “go-to” resource for specific functional areas for both internal and external users
  • Configure the application to meet the customer’s documented business requirements
  • Contribute to internal Implementation initiatives
  • Document solutions and contribute to a solutions repository
  • Contribute to internal knowledge share; review posted feedback on a continuous basis and respond to questions
  • Complete new release training on a timely basis; be fully versed on new and/or enhanced functionality in each product release

Education/Skill/Experience Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
  • 2-5+ years’ experience in a Software Implementation

Desirable
  • Experience with software in a SaaS / Cloud computing environment.
  • Basic understanding of relational databases and SQL an asset
  • Understanding of common human capital management (HCM) business practices
  • Workforce Management Consultant ideally has experience with EBA and Award interpretation

title: IT Graduate Program 2023
description:
Are you ready to kickstart your innovation and technology career with one of Australia’s most innovative companies?

SA Power Networks delivers energy solutions to empower South Australia today and in the future. We are always seeking to build a more sustainable, efficient and innovative business that creates real value for our customers.

As one of the State’s largest employers, we have a commitment to integrity and take pride in doing the right thing for our people, customers and community.

Progress your career and help us in empowering South Australia.

We offer award-winning training, an outstanding culture of safety and a supportive environment that encourages you to contribute and recognise your achievements.

Empowering opportunities for Innovation and Technology graduates

We are seeking Innovation and Technology (IT) graduates to join our Graduate Development Program, commencing in February 2023.

Our Graduate Development Program is a two-year fixed term contract where you will have the opportunity to join one of the State’s largest, industry-leading IT teams, offering unmatched opportunities for professional and personal development across our business.

The program includes structured rotations within Innovation and Technology, technical training and experience, mentoring, ongoing support and real career opportunities.

About you:

  • You love to learn and apply new skills in innovative ways
  • You enjoy problem solving with data
  • You have a passion for emerging technologies
  • You are a great communicator and can translate complex solutions to stakeholders
  • You are excited to learn a variety of disciplines, including: project management, automation, Microsoft, SAP, IT operations, cyber security, user experience design and more

To be eligible, you will need to:

  • Have completed your degree or be graduating at the end 2022
  • Be an Australian citizen or permanent resident
  • Be prepared to undertake a pre-employment medical

We are particularly interested in receiving applications from graduates who have specialised in Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Analytics, Information Technology, Cyber Security or similar.

What we offer:

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. The benefits we offer our employees will allow you to be your best every day. They include:

  • Mentoring opportunities to increase your knowledge and business networks
  • Technical training and experience, including your participation in our graduate rotation
  • Unlimited potential to grow your career
  • Exposure to world-leading projects in digital transformation and future energy
  • Very completive salary package with access to flexible working conditions

Candidates will need to be prepared to undertake a pre-employment medical. Applicants must be Australian citizens or Permanent Residents to apply.

For further information on our graduate program go to https://www.sapowernetworks.com.au/about-us/careers/our-programs/

Or email recruitment@sapowernetworks.com.au

title: Modelling and Simulation Engineer
description:
MODELLING & SIMULATION ENGINEER

  • All Systems GO! Be part of the next generation of defence technology
  • Utilise your skills in modelling and simulation systems
  • Enjoy flexibility , engaging work and a culture that embraces diversity and open-mindedness

At BAE Systemswe are all systems go as we continue to drive innovation and seek passionate and talented people to join our business. We currently have an opportunity as a Modelling & Simulation Engineer within our Battlespace Integrated Solutions based in Edinburgh, South Australia .

What this opportunity will mean for you:

  • Purposeful work where your efforts are recognized in an environment where you can thrive
  • Joining an organisation that is passionate about developing some of the most impressive careers in the world
  • Industry-leading flexibility options to unlock the talent and diversity of every individual
  • Unique opportunities to contribute to programs of national significance whilst growing your skills
  • A strong safety culture, inclusive teams and work to be proud of, underpinned by a compelling set of values

Your new role:

As a result of the growth within our business, we are seeking an experienced and talented Modelling & Simulation Engineer to join our expanding M&S team.

The Joint Survivability Tactics Validation Program (JSTVP) has been initiated to provide defence against threats that use the Electro Magnetic Spectrum (EMS) to target Australian Defence Force (ADF) units. Examples of these threats are missiles which are guided by radar frequency or electro-optic seekers, and laser guided weapons.

The program aims through synthetic trials to simulate various engagements to support assessments of susceptibility of ADF platforms (both maritime and land) against these threats.

This opportunity will see you:

  • Contribute to the development of the JSTVP project modelling & simulation environment through:
    • Understanding of the M&S requirements
    • Development of system models
    • Verification and Validation of System Models
    • Execution of virtual trials
    • Contribute to the generation of technical documents
    • Develop knowledge and understanding in the M&S as pertains to EW evaluation
    • Provide mentoring of more junior members of the team

As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you'll have:

  • Strong understanding in software engineering principles and software development
  • Understanding of and solving problems abilities in the complex mathematical domain
  • Ability to actively engage and contribute to tasks within the JSTVP programs team
  • Ability to work independently while maintaining focus and motivation
  • High level of communication, interpersonal and time management skills
  • Ability to document and generate technical reports
  • Significant experience in C and C++ programming (essential)
  • Experience working within an Agile framework, using tools such as Cmake, etc.
  • Experience in MATLAB programming
  • Experience in the use of GIT repository tools or similar
  • Currently holds a Negative Vetting 1 clearance or ability to obtain (essential)

Research shows that some candidates hesitate to apply for roles if they feel they don't meet 100% of the criteria. So, if this opportunity excites you and you have the right foundational experience and qualifications, we encourage you to apply. Whether it be for this role or another, your skills and competencies are of interest to us.

Clearances

As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance.

International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.

Further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html

Applications should be addressed to: Ben Woodrow - Talent Acquisition Specialist-Engineering and made online here. Confidential enquiries are welcome via email: Ben.Woodrow@baesystems.com

We are a 2021 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.

Our culture

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment where our people can thrive. For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of our employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation.

If you would like to know more information about how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives here: https://au.work180.co/employer/bae-systems/benefits

title: Corporate Tax Senior Analyst - Adelaide
description:
Company description:

Deloitte Services Pty Ltd



Job description:

What will your typical day look like?

As a Senior Analyst within our corporate tax team in Adelaide, you will provide tax advisory and compliance services to a broad range of clients. Expect every day to be different - assist with a client's compliance on one day, and work on complex domestic and cross-border tax matters, or a significant transaction engagement, on another. Be part of a high-performing and fast-growing team that really love what they do and be mentored by some of the best in this field.

About the team

No two days are the same in the Business Tax Services Team (BTS) team as you work with a range of respected ASX 200 clients, large corporate groups, multinational organisations and complex private groups, gaining deep knowledge of tax requirements along the way. We don't just provide pragmatic tax advice, we help clients simplify their tax management and oversight, giving them confidence and clarity in making strategic decisions.

Enough about us, let's talk about you.

You are someone with:

  • Experience providing tax advice and/or tax compliance services to Australian based corporate clients either in-house, or at an accounting or legal firm.
  • Strong interpersonal skills to maintain relationships with our clients and cultivate new ones.
  • A self-starter attitude with an ability to drive results and take initiative to identify areas of opportunity.
  • Enthusiasm and a passion to succeed.
  • Commerce or legal qualifications preferred
  • Chartered Accountant or Master of Tax qualifications (or working towards) would be beneficial

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia's borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We're committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we're leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress - check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.


Next Steps

Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

title: IT Liaison
description:
Higher education position requiring a person who has an interest and experience in Business Relationship Management in senior executive and IT environments. Our client is also ideally looking for someone with a BRM Certificate, an enterprise Business Analyst background and/or a strong Project Management background.

Our client is one South Australia's most notorious and highly regarded higher education providers, and they are looking for an IT Liaison to join their team. They have been known as a team of progressive people with the mentality to drive new initiatives and the calibre to give you a career boost in higher education IT executive environments. This higher education provider has great perks including an unrivalled superannuation package from the beginning and other extra advantages once you have proven yourself internally for 1 year as a permanent employee.

This is a people skills role that will require a person who has an interest and experience in Business Relationship Management in senior executive and IT environments. Our client is also ideally looking for someone with a BRM Certificate, an enterprise Business Analyst background and/or a strong Project Management background.

Key Responsibilities

  • Stakeholder engagement
    • Act as the primary point of contact for an allocated faculty portfolio and develop professional relationships.
    • Develop a stakeholder engagement plan for your portfolio.
    • Manage stakeholder relationships and create awareness around IT priorities and projects underway to improve operations.
  • IT Awareness and communications
    • Lead, maintain and monitor great engagement strategies between IT and Business executives.
    • Delivery key communications in a timely, non-technical IT manner and positive manner to business stakeholders.
    • Work within portfolio to increase existing and planned IT capabilities.
  • Technology convergence
    • Identify and anticipate emerging trends, needs, risks and goals within portfolio and connect these to the different disciplines for improvement and new initiative creation.
    • Support IT strategy and planning teams to align with portfolio plans, business priorities and IT strategic directions.
    • Ensure IT risk management is in place and raise awareness of risks involved in the use of IT assets, services, and products.
  • Demand management
    • Be the first point of interaction for IT demand management requests and appraise the benefit, value, consequences, and risk profile.
    • Identify and anticipate future portfolio IT demands and work with IT for approval of non-standard requests.
    • Resolve non-standard requests considering business and the IT team's needs.
  • IT Service Delivery Enablement
    • Manage stakeholder satisfaction, understanding and perception of IT services to improve continuously their services.
    • Liaise and collaborate with team to ensure project solutions are aligned to customer expectations and ensure IT incident management processes are looked after.
    • Build strong knowledge of IT activities, operational BAU and project to communicate priorities to all stakeholders in these groups.

Selection Criteria / Knowledge and Experience:

  1. Knowledge and demonstrated experience in an IT Liaison Management role, including fostering managing and consulting on a range of Information Technology related topics.
  2. Experience of working with stakeholders at senior management level in a large and complex organisational environment, including experience in working with governance committees, Executive Directors and Senior Managers to effect strategic change.
  3. A well-regarded technology professional, who has broad experience and previous hands-on experience in consulting, analysis, project management and customer engagement.
  4. Consulting/advisory experience that has fostered the ability to establish strong working relationships with stakeholders to influence required outcomes.
  5. Proven extensive ability to apply a range of facilitation methods to drive and guide discussion and elicit business capability requirements that are consistent and aligned with corporate strategy.
  6. Exceptional written, verbal and presentation skills, capable of inspiring others, proficiency in providing high level and honest advice to senior management in a respectful, consultative, and collaborative manner.
  7. Exceptional communication skills with the ability to handle complex technical and sometimes difficult conversations.
  8. Demonstrated ability to exercise a high degree of autonomous, self-motivated operation, strategic problem solving, escalation management and creative thinking, and a proven capacity to plan, prioritise and implement strategies for a large and complex organisation.
  9. Capacity for understanding the development needs of a leading higher education provider, and ideally awareness of local and international trends in the higher education sector.
  10. Excellent time management with the ability to respond quickly to the changing needs of customers whilst maintaining a high level of service and satisfaction.

Do not miss out on an opportunity to take your career to the next level! :)

For a confidential discussion, please call Kevin Gonzalez , our Business Analysis Talent Specialist based in the Adelaide office, on 08 7081 1080 / 0425 723 396 or Jarrod MacDonald , Project Management Talent specialist on 0404 805 070 . You can also send your CV to kevin.gonzalez@hudson.com or Jarrod.Macdonald@hudson.com and apply with your MS Word copy of your resumes via the link provided.

title: Coding and Documentation Auditor
description:
• Central Adelaide Local Health Network
  • The Royal Adelaide Hospital and The Queen Elizabeth Hospital
  • Salary  ASO-5  $82,042/$91,245 p.a.
  • Full-time ongoing

You will be responsible for providing audit of clinical documentation, ICD-10-AM/ACHI assignment, and application of National and State Standards. The role includes the co-ordination and control of auditing activities maintaining a high standard work ethic. The Coding & Documentation Auditor will undertake continual audits in accordance with the CALHN Audit Plan and deliver up-to-date education to coding staff on audit findings to ensure consistent quality and integrity of data, including raising issues relating to Casemix/Activity Based Funding (ABF) and contribute to timely APC data submission.  This role contributes significantly toward the achievement of legitimate revenue optimisation, and improved data quality to accurately reflect the comprehensive casemix profile of Central Adelaide Local Health Network. Maintaining quality statistics, you will work closely with the Audit Co-Ordinator, Documentation Improvement Manager, Clinical Coding Manager, Manager Health Information Services and Executive as required.

You will have successfully completed Advanced ICD-10-AM, ACHI ACS Clinical Coding (HIMAA) or equivalent and have excellent knowledge of medical terminology. Demonstrating clinical coding experience in a large tertiary or quaternary healthcare facility, you will be highly skilled in comprehensive data analysis and interpretation. You must also be proficient in the use of patient administration software and standards and bring the ability to convey that knowledge to others. Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal, will be essential. This will be evident in your ability to foster professional working relationships and operate effectively within a team environment.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role.

In addition to the annual salary package we also offer salary sacrifice benefits, employer superannuation contributions and leave loading.

Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory Criminal History Check and appropriate immunisation requirements.

COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement under the Emergency Management (Healthcare Setting Workers Vaccination) (COVID-19) Directions 2021 to work in SA Health/health care setting.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants are encouraged to apply. Job ref: 792680

Enquires to:

Naomi Johnson   Telephone: 8222 7458

Email: Naomi.johnson@sa.gov.au

11.55 pm Friday 27 May 2022

title: Product Owner
description:
We are a Supply Nation Certified recruiting and advisory business that specialises in professional talent acquisition and employment solutions across Australia.


Our vision is "Ethical Recruiting. Empowered People"


Currently, we have a role for a Product Owner (EL1 Level) to start in mid/late June 2022. The person we are looking for will work with agile product teams to identify, design, prototype, configure, and implement new product features and capabilities for the Australian Space Agency.


Role & Responsibilities:
  • Act as the primary contact between the product development teams and stakeholders, describing the vision and goal for the project team
  • Develop user stories & provide input to recommendations for the request and/or problem resolution
  • Take ownership of product decisions, including which features are to be released and having the final say on the product, and manage feedback to guide future development
  • Identify internal resources to ensure successful feature implementation
  • Actively participate in all development team agile ceremonies throughout the life of the project, to keep the project team up to date with Agency priorities and to understand the perspective of the project team
  • Monitor and evaluate product progress at each stage of the development, report progress and lead any remediation activities required to keep the project on track
  • Ensure the product is developed in alignment with the product vision and user needs, and accepting or rejecting work based on the delivery of expected outcomes
Skills & Experience:
  • Minimum 5 years experience as a Product Owner / Product Manager
  • Proven, hands-on experience managing all stages of the product life cycle
  • Demonstrated experience working within a multi-disciplinary team within Scrum or Agile Software Development Methodology
  • Ability to prioritise effectively
  • Excellent problem solving skills with the proven ability to effectively communicate (and influence) at various levels
  • Proven ability to lead others in defining requirements & identifying solutions
  • Sharp focus on achieving results and navigate through ambiguity despite challenges
  • Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment
  • Working knowledge of product development architecture, understanding of design quality standards and proficiency in the use of analytic tools will be highly regarded

This is a 12 month full-time temp position with 2 x 12 month extensions. A competitive rate in line with EL1 Level is on offer, along with the opportunity to work in a supportive and friendly working environment.


Do you want to be considered for this position? Click 'apply now' to send a current copy of your CV. Not sure if this is the right job for you and you are looking to explore your options, then give John Camm a call on 0488 808 905 and start a conversation about what might be right for you.


Rainy Day Recruitment has a clear vision: "Ethical Recruiting. Empowered People" and is dedicated to promoting diversity and inclusion in acquiring talent for our clients. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration of their application without regard to culture, race, nationality, ethnicity, age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or religion. That said, this role requires NV2 Security Clearance, which means applications will ONLY be considered from Australian Citizens. Eligibility can be found at: http://www.defence.gov.au/agsva. Rainy Day Recruitment is eager to receive applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and invite them to apply.


In line with our COVID Policy, all applicants represented by Rainy Day Recruitment must be fully vaccinated - including any additional booster shots when eligible. Proof of vaccination status

title: Product Manager
description:
SINTELIX – Text and Data Analytics Software

Sintelix is a global leader in advanced Text & Data Analytics software. Partnering with Law Enforcement, Intelligence and Defence organisations, we provide one of the fastest, most accurate & highly configurable solutions on the market.

We are a company of diverse & talented individuals with a passion for advanced technology, who love seeing our software benefit humanity.

We work closely with customer organisations, equipping them to process and analyse large volumes of unstructured data to provide safe & secure workplaces & communities.

THE ROLE

The Sintelix Online (SxO) Product Manager is an integral role for Sintelix, representing a new opportunity. Set against a background of continued rapid growth, your role will be pivotal in the development of the SxO Product in collaboration with our Marketing team to directly impact generation of revenue at Sintelix.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE

Strategy and Management:

Product Strategy
Develop, evolve and own the product strategy for Sintelix Online (SxO), including:

  • Lead the creation of, and maintain, the SxO strategic plan, including release schedules
  • Generation of Voice-of-Customer feedback and Product feature prioritisation
  • Drive and provide considered input into the overall SxO marketing strategy

Product Management
Optimise the SxO Customer Journey and Product experience to produce a rapid rise in revenue, including:

  • Direct the evolution of SxO's customer journey analytic system and dashboard, including automated metrics on marketing pipeline, conversions, user behaviours (web and product) and financial metrics
  • Operating SxO's instrumentation and improvement
  • Progressing fixes and issues affecting revenue
  • Understanding customer needs and the implications of products SxO integrates with (e.g. i2 ANB)
  • Collection and assessment of client feedback and incorporation into SxO design
  • Managing the SxO Affiliate program

Digital Marketing:

Customer Journey
Use the customer journey to identify, diagnose and prioritise issues effecting growth.

Accelerated Marketing
Design and implementation of innovative accelerated marketing initiatives.

Quality Documentation
Create quality process maps, requirements and briefs to elicit materials and web site changes from the marketing team.

Marketing Materials/Content:

Manage the creation and maintenance of content related to SxO in alignment with strategy and analytics.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU

  • Attractive remuneration - including a range of bonuses
  • Hybrid model - we understand the new era of work-life across the office and work from home
  • Flexible hours - working hours and arrangements to balance your work & lifestyle
  • Career development - mentoring & development opportunities are a vital part of what we do
  • Great team - we all want each other to succeed, and pride ourselves on our collaboration, team-work and support of one another

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Mandatory Requirements:

  • Experience either in software product management or successfully inspiring and managing a digital marketing operation
  • Ability to build relationships and positively influence stakeholders (internal and external) at all levels
  • Excellent communication skills (oral and written)
  • Proven high level of professionalism
  • Resilient with a continuous improvement mindset
  • Strong experience in collaboration on projects/campaigns
  • Strong technology business acumen
  • Good judgement: ability to solve problems taking context into account
  • Ability to mentor others to produce high quality outputs
  • Ability to create effective standards/guidelines to inspire the creation of consistent high-quality outputs

Desirable Attributes

  • Experience in software product management in either a SaaS or subscription-based environment
  • Experience in digital marketing of either SaaS or subscription-based software solutions with a proven track record of revenue generation and revenue growth

NEXT STEPS

Research shows that whilst men apply for jobs when they only meet 60% of the requirements, women and other marginalised people only apply if they generally meet 100% of the requirements. If you’re enthusiastic about this opportunity & it sounds like you (even if you don’t tick all the boxes!), please still get in touch.

If you have any questions, please contact our Recruitment Manager Cam Agnew at cam.agnew@sintelix.com

Otherwise, please submit your application online at your earliest convenience!

* Applicants must have legal work rights within Australia

title: Geographic Information Systems Officer
description:
• Are you a Geographic Information Systems expert looking for your next career move?
  • A competitive salary starting from $75,195.12 (inclusive of super) + relocation assistance with one of Australia's most reputable Councils!
  • Enjoy work/life balance with access to a Rostered Days Off every 3 weeks, career progression opportunities, and more.

Moree Plains Shire is experiencing significant growth and are expanding our Information Services team.

About the Opportunity

As our Geographic Information Systems Officer, you will contribute to the Corporate Services - Information Services department. You will undertake short, medium, and long-term project management, data management, and relay communications in an accurate and legible manner to the broader Moree Plains Shire Council network.

To learn more about this exciting opportunity, click “Apply Now”!

About You

You'll bring a good comprehension of scalable goal-setting, familiarity with managing multiple simultaneous projects and producing output in a timely and accurate manner. You will demonstrate the ability to develop clear and actionable steps for the delivery of GIS Information, as well as navigate technical talk proficiently with your team.

Additionally, you will need patience, accountability, attention to detail and a problem-solving mindset to thrive in this team.

Essentials:

  • A relevant tertiary qualification in a spatial information related discipline &/OR relevant extensive experience in the implementation of a corporate GIS service +
  • General Construction and Induction Card (can be obtained after securing the position) +
  • National Criminal History Check +
  • Complete vaccination against COVID-19 or a valid medical exemption +
  • Current NSW Class C Drivers Licence.

Moree Plains Shire Council’s mission is to lead the way in fostering a healthy, positive, and well-resourced community. Council is recognised as an Employer Of Choice and is committed to providing employees with a happy and healthy working life experience in order to foster a productive workforce.
