title: Research Associate
description:
What’s the role?

Our business is only as strong as the service we provide to our customers. That’s where you come in. Your work lays the foundation for all of the customer promises we have made when they selected to do business with CoreLogic, ensuring we deliver world-class data for our market leading products.

This role is critical to the success of CoreLogic. You’ll be responsible for sourcing updated information across our market leading products, by ensuring our customers get the data fast and accurately.  Working closely with our Operations team, you’ll also have a hand in boosting advocacy and increasing customer satisfaction across all our channels.

Your purpose?

To ensure as soon as it happens, you capture it and share it with our customers, maintaining a memorable impression for CoreLogic’s customers, knowing that we are enthusiastic about providing them the very best service experience possible every time they use our products.

The role includes:

  • Researching and Updating property & records information, through phone, chat and email with professionalism and probing questions.
  • Identifying new sources and partnerships for supply of information, rewarding regular information partners
  • Perform workflow system and administrative user testing, identifying and reporting any roadblocks or ideas to make the tasks faster and smarter.
  • Responding to requests for more information from customer enquiries
  • Conduct physical inspections of commercial sites and business areas to capture information

Job Qualifications

Are you the right fit?

You need to have proven experience in:

  • Creating great phone relationships and building rapport – we don’t focus on handle time here, just accurate & fast updates.
  • Great adaptability in learning new systems with speed and the ability to multi task
  • A demonstrated ability to:
    • be curious as you deal with complexity and the many unknowns in a decision-making process
    • champion customer outcomes within our organisation, don’t settle for the status quo if it impacts a customer’s impression of our products
    • display strong decision making skills to problem solve.
    • quickly build valuable relationships within a business in a highly collaborative environment
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Confidence in querying sometimes complex processes and projects in simple ways
  • Collaborate and want to immerse yourself in a highly engaged culture

What credentials do you need?

  • A solid understanding of, and expertise in delivering fantastic customer outcomes
  • 1+ years of service experience, in a call centre, retail or hospitality

What does success look like?

Your Key Performance Indicators are based on:

  • Timely and accurate updates of data
  • Ensuring our customers have a consistent and quality outcome
  • Servicing our enquiry channels promptly in line with SLAs

CoreLogic's Diversity Commitment: ​

CoreLogic is fully committed to employing a diverse workforce and creating an inclusive work environment that embraces everyone’s unique contributions, experiences and values. We offer an empowered work environment that encourages creativity, initiative and professional growth and provides a competitive salary and benefits package. ​ We are better together when we support and recognize our differences.

title: Geospatial Engineer - Adelaide
description:
Nova Systems Geospatial is a multidisciplinary team of Software Developers, Designers, DevOps Specialists and Geospatial Consultants with a proven track record of building and supplying innovative, high value enterprise spatially enabled software and data solutions. The Geospatial team leads the development of software and geospatial solutions and the provision of geospatial products at Nova Systems. Our services are a significant part of Nova's broad range of professional services across Defence, Essential Services, Land Management, Government, Utilities, Energy and Resources.

We are flexible in the way we work, and receptive to improving process and ways of bringing new ideas to life through innovation. We challenge convention when it is in the interest of our customers and actively seek employees that think the same way. Our success is built on collaboration, so you can expect to work closely with your colleagues and customers in our mission to build and deliver high value solutions.

We pride ourselves on transparency, compassion for our people and building a safe, fun and inclusive environment where everyone has the freedom to be their full self. Just to seal the deal, you'll get heaps of flexibility on how you work and be part of a culture where you can contribute and succeed.

About the Role:

We have opportunities for Geospatial Engineers with a strong background in IT working with our team of specialists. In this role, you will be able to engage closely with our clients to provide cutting edge geospatial technological solutions. Our projects span across enterprise geospatial applications, spatial data processing, visualisation, analytics, and platform maintenance. A consultative approach to working with clients is a key enabler for this role.

What you will be involved in:

  • A variety of technical work focused on geospatial platform configuration, customization, and deployment
  • Using geospatial (GIS) software and processes to perform spatial data analysis, visualization, and translation
  • Helping develop project requirements and solution design
  • Supporting the optimization, maintenance, and upgrade of geospatial platforms
  • Being part of a talented and motivated multidisciplinary team, with a focus on building high quality geospatial solutions and products
  • Working in a collaborative, lean and agile environment
  • Delivering successful customer outcomes

What we would expect from you:

  • Demonstrated experience with commercial or Open-Source geospatial platforms such as ESRI, FME, Mapbox, Geoserver, Leaflet, or Google
  • Skills and experience in the automation of geospatial software and data processes using modern scripting languages, such as Python
  • Working knowledge of the software development life cycle, software deployment processes and cloud infrastructure
  • The ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment and customer facing role
  • A Bachelor's degree in associated business disciplines (Geomatics, Land Information, Geography, Computer Science, Information Technology, Remote Sensing)
  • Australian Citizenship and the ability to obtain and maintain a Defence security clearance

Nova's Value Proposition; Beyond the pay cheque:

In addition to salary, you are supported with:

  • Flexible working conditions to suit individual needs and dress for your day
  • Commitment to Professional and Personal Development (up to $5000 per year)
  • Reward & Recognition Program offering exclusive discounts from hundreds of major retailers, helping you to save on groceries, petrol, holidays and more!
  • Additional Leave entitlements include Reserve Leave, Loyalty Leave, Parental Leave and Purchased Leave
  • Wellbeing Hub with access to health and fitness content
  • Employee Assistance Program for employees and family members
  • Access to Defence Health and Travel Insurance
  • Novated Leasing and Salary Sacrifice
  • Nova Employee Share Offer
  • An inclusive and supportive culture
  • A range of other great benefits, just ask us!

To apply, please click on the "apply now" button and submit your resume using the "upload resume" function in PDF Format (only).

Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please call Serena in Nova Talent Acquisition Team on: (08) 8252 7100

Nova Systems does not accept any recruitment agency solicitations.

title: ICT Corporate Business Partner
description:
The Department for Education is committed to developing an education system where all children and young people reach their potential, enabled by world-class digital technology and systems. In support of this the department has proudly launched a new Digital Strategy 2022 - 2025, which sets the vision, goals and reform activities for improving the use of digital technologies in South Australian government schools.

The department has committed to a focus on five key areas that enable accelerated learning and growth for every child, in every class, in every school and preschool across the state:

  • Strengthen digital foundations
  • Build digital capability
  • Maximise the benefits of digital technologies for teaching and learning
  • Streamline and modernise operations
  • Mobilise ICT support where it is needed

Through this focus the department will embrace the opportunities provided by today's technology, and shape the future of South Australia's education system for generations to come. The Digital Strategy includes seventeen key reform initiatives, each designed to complement one other and support a holistic approach to digital education.

One of these initiatives reflects the establishment of an ICT Corporate Business Partnering team. The department is now seeking multiple ICT Corporate Business Partners to work closely with central leaders to drive the planning, implementation and evaluation of high quality, customer centric business partnering services that ensure strategic engagement and deliver impactful outcomes. The Business Partners will liaise with executive and senior management to identify, evaluate and deliver ICT modernisation programs that are tailored to individual corporate business unit current, and future needs.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Plan and deliver high quality, customer centric business partnering services that identify key areas for modernisation and follow these through to execution
  • Lead the strategic planning and delivery of critical projects to uplift corporate ICT platforms and solutions
  • Conceptualise and implement client specific strategies with particular regard to budget implications of technology modernisation, adapting current and future technology to resolve issues
  • Provide expert advice and briefings for the consideration of the Manager, ICT Corporate Business Partnering, Director, Business Improvement, Chief Information Officer, and a diverse range of corporate and site stakeholders across the State
  • Establish highly effective, collaborative relationships of trust with leaders and their teams

Key Requirements:

  • Extensive experience in the strategic planning, implementation and evaluation of critical business improvement programs that include the delivery of fit for purpose digital technologies
  • Experience in leading and managing multidisciplinary projects and utilising a business partnering approach to engage with executive and senior management
  • Extensive knowledge of the use of tools and data to develop and deliver evidence-based analysis, strategies, engagement plans and executive reporting
  • Highly effective in articulating and presenting complex concepts clearly and concisely, to a diverse range of stakeholders, and negotiate successful outcomes in a professional manner
  • Extensive knowledge of ICT digital technologies and their application in corporate environments

This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is passionate about making a real difference in the lives of South Australian children and young people. The ICT Corporate Business Partner will play a key role in delivering the ICT Services' divisional and overarching departmental strategic agenda, and will directly contribute toward the successful realisation of our Digital Strategy.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply please click apply or call Ash Nair or Dione Chrisakis on 08 8216 3500 for a confidential discussion.

title: Technical Specialist - Server
description:
The Technical Specialist position resides within the Parliamentary Network Support Group (PNSG) within the Information & Technology section of DTF. The role delivers a range of complex and critical technical activities.

This role provides the application of technical skills in the planning, development, maintenance, problem resolution and support of the server, systems management, application, security and storage technology platforms and systems servicing Parliament and Electorate Offices.

The incumbent will need to take a collaborative and team-first approach and develop and maintain effective consultative and collaborative relationships with a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders and service providers.

Responsibilities may also include support of LAN / WAN networks, firewalls / gateways (proxies), IPS / IDS environments and interoperability relationships in conjunction with other peer team members.

This is a trusted role and could be required to undertake duties such as the eDiscovery function requiring an elevated security clearance to Australian Government Protective Security Policy Framework (PSPF) Negative Vetting Level 1.

For more information about the role, how to apply and to download a copy of the Job and Person Specification please visit I Work for SA: https://iworkfor.sa.gov.au/ and search for reference number 485702.

Diversity Statement
The Department of Treasury and Finance actively promote flexible working arrangements, and is committed to having at least 50% of interviewees for each role being women. At DTF we value and encourage diversity within our workforce, to help us reflect the community we serve.

Special Conditions

This role has been classified as a position of trust. The incumbent is subject to a satisfactory criminal history / record check in line with departmental and Parliamentary policies and procedures.

  • The incumbent is required to:
    • participate in a roster system for on-call and after-hours support
    • hold a current driver’s license
    • refrain from any kind of political activity or involvement in electoral affairs.
    • maintain confidentiality regarding sensitive client information.
  • Some intra/interstate travel involving overnight absences may be required.
  • The incumbent will be required to participate in the Departmental Performance Development Program and achieve performance targets as negotiated and mutually agreed with the Team Leader, Technology Services.
  • The incumbent may be required to be assigned to other positions at the same remuneration level across the department.

Enquiries
Name: Peter Evans|
Title: Team Leader Technology Services, PNSG
Contact number: 8403 2345

All applications must be submitted online via the www.iworkfor.sa.gov.au website by clicking on 'Apply' and following the instructions.

title: Research Officer
description:
(HE05) $72832.00-$80983.00 per annum plus an employer contribution of up to 17% superannuation may apply

2 year fixed term position available immediately

An exciting opportunity for a Research Officer to join the Department of Chemistry in the School of Physical Sciences as part of the newly established Faculty of Sciences, Engineering and Technology.  Join a vibrant research team led by Prof Greg Metha to develop an exciting renewable energy technology to drive decarbonisation of industry.

We are seeking an enthusiastic and motivated researcher, whose research in the laboratory will be focussed on the development of photocatalysis technologies for water splitting to produce hydrogen.

The successful candidate will work under routine supervision whilst undertaking research characterisation and performance measurements for an industry funded project progressing photocatalytic water-splitting technology to produce hydrogen.   The successful candidate will also develop testing procedures, prepare reports, maintain records and provide administrative support to the project.

To be successful you will need:

  • Proficiency in using instrumentation for chemical analysis and testing, as well as general software (e.g. Microsoft Office) and bespoke software for data analysis (e.g. Origin, MATLAB).
  • Ability to work productively and harmoniously in a team environment, and willingness to help others achieve project/experimental objectives.
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret and analyse data.
  • Ability to work well under pressure to meet deadlines and an ability to prioritise tasks.
  • Ability to communicate effectively, seek understanding and ask questions to clarify meaning.

The ability to develop software-to-hardware interfaces (e.g LabView coding) will be highly desirable.

Enjoy an outstanding career environment

The University of Adelaide is a uniquely rewarding workplace. The size, breadth and quality of our education and research programs - including significant industry, government and community collaborations - offers you vast scope and opportunity for a long, fulfilling career.

It also enables us to attract high-calibre people in all facets of our operations, ensuring you will be surrounded by talented colleagues, many world-leading. Our work's cutting-edge nature - not just in your own area, but across virtually the full spectrum of human endeavour - provides a constant source of inspiration.

Our culture is one that welcomes all and embraces diversity consistent with our Staff Values and Behaviour Framework and our Values of integrity, respect, collegiality, excellence and discovery. We firmly believe that our people are our most valuable asset, so we work to grow and diversify the skills, knowledge and capability of all our staff.

We embrace flexibility as a key principle to allow our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal and family life.

In addition, we offer a wide range of attractive staff benefits. These include: salary packaging; flexible work arrangements; high-quality professional development programs and activities; and an on-campus health clinic, gym and other fitness facilities.

Learn more at: adelaide.edu.au/jobs

Your faculty's broader role

The Faculty of Sciences, Engineering and Technology is a multidisciplinary hub of cutting-edge teaching and research. Many of its academic staff are world leaders in their fields and graduates are highly regarded by employers. The Faculty actively partners with innovative industries to solve problems of global significance.

Learn more at: set.adelaide.edu.au

If you have the talent, we'll give you the opportunity. Together, let's make history.

Click on the link below to view the position description and to apply for this opportunity.

https://careers.adelaide.edu.au/cw/en/job/509160/research-officer

Please ensure you submit a cover letter, resume, and upload a document that includes your responses to all of the selection criteria for the position as contained in the position description or selection criteria document.

Applications close 11:55pm, 24 May 2022.

For further information

For a confidential discussion regarding this position, contact:

Greg Metha
Professor of Chemistry, Sciences, Engineering & Technology
P: +61 (8) 313 5943
E: gregory.metha@adelaide.edu.au

The University of Adelaide is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people who meet the requirements of this position are strongly encouraged to apply.

#LI-UOA

title: PhD Scholarship: ePortfolios and self-regulated learning in higher education
description:
The University of South Australia (UniSA) is Australia’s University of Enterprise. We are South Australia’s largest university and one of the very best young universities in the world. At UniSA, we are authentic, resilient, and influential - and we deliver results. We pride ourselves on our dynamic and agile culture, which embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Plus, we are committed to the principles of excellence and equity.

Our people are critical to our success. They are creative, enterprising and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm.

We educate global professionals ready to create and inspire change, through more than 200 world-class degrees. We deliver outcomes-focused research that is inspired by global challenges and opportunities, to deliver economic and social prosperity.

Our strategic plan, Enterprise25, focusses on our people, programs and precincts, and sets out our path to ensure that we continue to deliver quality teaching, research and student outcomes.

  • 100% of our assessed research rated at or above world-class - 2018 Excellence in Research for Australia (ERA), 4-digit Fields of Research.
  • No. 1 in Australia for industry research income - 2019 THE World University Rankings.
  • No. 1 in Australia for research impact & engagement - 2018 ARC Engagement and Impact Assessment (EI), Combined Impact – Approach to Impact and Engagement on Assessed Fields.
  • Athena Swan Bronze Award.

About the research degree project

PhD Project: ePortfolios and self-regulated learning in higher education

Positively impact higher education policy and practice on an international scale.

Are you seeking to advance your career in higher education through defining education policy and practice nationally and internationally? The University of South Australia – Australia’s University of Enterprise – is offering a unique opportunity to apply for an innovative, project-based PhD aimed at accomplishing this.

In response to current and future priorities, higher education institutions are increasingly positioning ePortfolios to develop and evidence competencies and skills that are highly correspondent to self-regulated learning (SRL). Research into ePortfolios and their relationships to SRL, however demonstrate limitations in methodology and potential impact. Therefore, there is a timely need to advance research into relationships between ePortfolios and SRL.

In this collaborative research project involving four universities – one American and three Australian – you will  be expected to use qualitative and quantitative approaches to investigate the relationship between ePortfolios and SRL in the higher education context. Our intention is to impact research, policy and practice within both Australia and the United States.

You will join the Centre for Change and Complexity in Learning (C3L), which provides a vibrant research culture and opportunities for skills and knowledge development. In addition to the skills gained through the larger research project, you will also have opportunities to develop an international network with key stakeholders involved in ePortfolios, SRL and, more broadly, learning engagement in higher education.

Completion of this project will provide you with highly desirable skills in a growing area, advancing your employability within and beyond the higher education sector.

What you’ll do

In this project-based research degree, you will undertake activities standard to a large-scale project of this nature. These include reviews of research, development of methodology, data collection, data cleaning and data set development, analysis and write up of results.

There may also be opportunities for travel and placement, such as travel to data collection sites (e.g. other universities) as well as travel to international conferences.

Intended results will include a completed thesis by the successful candidate, publication opportunities, and development of an international collaboration network of both universities and strategic partners.

Where you’ll be based

You will be based at UniSA’s Centre for Change and Complexity in Learning (C3L). The Centre focuses on the complex relationship between human and artificial cognition, how it changes society, knowledge processes, and teaching and learning.

C3L uses complexity science methodologies, promotes the uptake of applied research, and engages with the community, government agencies (healthcare, education, defence, cultural) and industry to research the lifespan of learning and the role of UniSA in serving all stages of knowledge and learning processes.

Situated within UniSA Education Futures, who conducts powerful research in partnership with academia and industry. We contribute to a global knowledge base and find solutions to common challenges faced by rapidly evolving societies worldwide. We embed digital opportunities into the everyday. The Samsung SMARTSchool combines teaching and learning with the latest IT technology, facilitating innovation, problem-solving and team-based learning.

Supervisory Team

  • Associate Professor Chris Deneen - Principal Supervisor
  • Dr Rebecca Marrone - Co Supervisor


Financial Support

This project is funded for reasonable research expenses.  Additionally, a living allowance scholarship of $28,854 per annum is available to eligible applicants. A fee-offset or waiver for the standard term of the program is also included. For full terms and benefits of the scholarship please refer to our scholarship information for domestic students or international students.

Eligibility and Selection

This project is open to application from both domestic and international applicants.

Applicants must meet the eligibility criteria for entrance into a PhD.

All applications that meet the eligibility and selection criteria will be considered for this project. A merit selection process will be used to determine the successful candidate.

The successful applicant is expected to study full-time, and to be based at our City West campus in the heart of Adelaide.

Essential Dates

Applicants are expected to start in a timely f ashion upon receipt of an offer.  Extended deferral periods are not available. Applications close on Friday, 3 June, 2022

title: Dynamic Application Leader
description:
With branches across the nation and employing more than 650 staff, Beyond Bank Australia is one of Australia's largest customer-owned banks and the first BCorp accredited bank.

Why work for Beyond Bank?

  • A flexible, inclusive and diverse environment
  • Opportunities for professional growth
  • Benefits and discounts from our Employee Banking package on a range of Beyond Bank products and services
  • 3 paid Work Life Balance days per annum
  • 2 paid Community Volunteer days per annum
  • Staff BeWell program which includes health initiatives, employee assistance (for immediate family also) and an employee care program.
  • The chance to be part of an organisation that works for and with customers and their communities to make a difference and change lives.


  • Your key responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

  • Collaboration with internal stakeholders and external partners to ensure applications are customer centric, efficient, fit for purpose and help deliver the operational and strategic requirements of the business
  • Leading and championing Dynamics 365 CRM by providing unique and deep product knowledge and roadmap to leverage and deliver excellent outcomes for the business and our customers and ensure our development is aligned with product direction, and new functionality/technology is leveraged to meet strategic and operational requirements
  • Working closely with the business to understand, prioritise and fix pain points and barriers within systems/ applications/ processes to ensure we provide our customer with exceptional customer experience
  • Taking ownership of the implementation, configuration and delivery of Dynamics projects (including leading support analysts & team members, analysing, defining and documenting business requirements; undertaking solution configuration; lead testing activities, solutions demos and presentations; stakeholder support and relationship management as required)
  • Managing and controlling stable and secure development lifecycle and release management while maintaining a clear focus on improving processes and systems for customers and customer facing staff

You will possess the following skills and experience:

  • Experience in Customer/User Experience and Process Improvement
  • Comprehensive understanding of the Microsoft technology stack and be competent in or keen to develop skills in the configuration and development of the current (Dynamics 365) and future Dynamics CRM releases
  • Broad understanding of Technology, Applications, Banking Systems and systems integration via various methods (e.g. API, data updates)
  • Exposure/Experience in delivering projects using Agile Delivery & Change Management principles
  • Outstanding communication, negotiation and influencing skills
  • Experience in supplier and vendor management

As a values-driven and preferred employer, we work for and with our people to grow your career.

If you are passionate about people and want to make a difference, we want to hear from you!

Applications close COB 26 May 2022

Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccinations Apply (Excluding medical exemptions)

For more information, please visit beyondbank.com.au

Beyond Bank is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity at all levels. To be eligible to apply you must be an Australian/New Zealand citizen or hold permanent residency status in Australia. Please note that all applicants are required to complete a National Criminal History Check prior to commencing employment. Beyond Bank Australia Ltd ABN 15 087 651 143 AFSL/Australian Credit Licence 237 856.

title: Senior HL7 Integration Specialist
description:
Senior HL7 Integration Specialist

About Our Client:

Chamonix IT Solutions is an end-to-end technical services business focused on helping customers to achieve and maintain digital currency to stay competitive in an ever-evolving market.  From digital transformation through to complete technical delivery and ongoing managed support, Chamonix has been working with customers across a range of industries for over 11 years to understand where they are on their digital journey, where they need to be and then help them get there.

The Role:

The Senior HL7 Integration Specialist is responsible for delivering expert consulting services and technical assistance in aiding Chamonix’s healthcare clients with their information management systems data exchange implementations, using HL7 electronic reporting industry standard messaging protocol. The scope of this role includes acting as the lead technical consultant in the analysis, troubleshooting, testing, and software support to set up data exchanges.

Key responsibilities :

  • Provide functional and integration solutions using HL7 FHIR

  • Participate in design discussions with healthcare clinicians/integrators.

  • Create solutions including other standards such as HL7 CDA and OpenEHR

  • Work on integrations where FHIR data is converted and stored in multiple formats

  • Create training material and conduct training in HL7 FHIR for developers, QA engineers and consultants.

What we are looking for:

You will have proven software engineering experience across the full software development lifecycle within the healthcare domain and be certified in HL7 FHIR in order to deliver customised integration services.

You will be a skilled communicator with a consultative approach and the ability to develop relationships among many stakeholders at all levels.

Demonstrated experience in leading a team of integration specialists within a healthcare setting will be highly regarded.

This is a permanent opportunity based in Adelaide with a salary range of $140k to $160k plus super depending on experience.

For further information please contact Brett Hughes at EGM Recruitment on 0422 970 313 .

title: Behavioural Scientist / Psychologist
description:
The Australian Wine Research Institute is looking for someone to bring insights and practices from behavioural science and organisational psychology to our extension and adoption programs. These programs are designed to disseminate knowledge and promote practice change in the grape and wine sector.

The ideal candidate will hold a degree in psychology, behavioural science or a related discipline. Ability to design and manage projects, superior communication skills and teamwork experience are also prerequisites.

The Australian Wine Research Institute (AWRI) is the Australian grape and wine industry’s own research organisation. It supports a sustainable and successful grape and wine industry through world-class research, practical solutions and knowledge transfer. The AWRI has strong links with the wine industry and other research organisations and provides a stimulating and challenging work environment.

The position will be based at the Waite Research Precinct, Adelaide, SA and will work closely with several teams at the AWRI.

A position description is available from Behavioural Scientist/Psychologist Position Description. For further information, please contact the Group Manager – Industry Development and Support, Con Simos, on 0448889432 or con.simos@awri.com.au .

Applications should be completed via the online form at https://www.awri.com.au/about_the_awri/people/careers/ Only applications that are completed via the online application form will be considered. Applications will be assessed as they are received.

title: Test Analyst
description:
About Land Services SA

Land Services SA are leading property experts in South Australia, offering a range of property transaction and valuation services, property information products, custom data sets, reliable market insights, technology consulting and managed service offerings.

Land Services SA’s datasets are unique, extensive, timely and relate to every property, land transaction and statutory property valuation within the State. We continue to unlock our datasets, leveraging this for performance reporting, investment proposals, mining projects, cost-benefit analysis, research and the preparation of legal documents, to name a few.

As a trusted partner of the State, Land Services SA deliver highly valued, trusted services to the community, being recognised for creating innovative solutions.

About the Position

The Test Analyst will, as part of a team, perform quality assurance activities on cloud-based (AWS) enterprise solutions, utilising Agile methodologies and mature DevOps Processes.

The Test Analyst will contribute to the design, documentation and execution of quality assurance activities, ensuring that technical solutions meet user requirements. The Test Analyst will contribute to the design, definition and execution of both manual and automated test suites.

Reporting to the Test Lead, the Test Analyst will work as a member of Land Services SA support or project teams which are developing new software solutions, or enhancing and maintaining existing capabilities. All quality assurance activities well be performed following internal quality processes and industry best practices for ensuring web application security.

Key Outcomes of the Role

Reporting to the Test Lead, the Test Analyst will be responsible for the following:

  • Prepare test cases from user stories and conversations
  • Plan and manage testing activities
  • Prepare and perform manual and automated tests
  • Manage defect register
  • Collaborate with colleagues and clients in regular face-to-face meetings
  • Communicate with clients regarding testing requirements
  • Adhere to the ISO 9001 and ISO 27001 Quality and Information Security Management System requirements.

Key Competencies

  • Experience in preparing automated tests using tools such as JUnit and Selenium WebDriver
  • SQL skills, preferably Postgres
  • Experience in SOAP UI, Postman or any other API testing tools
  • Experience with requirements and issue tracking tools such as JIRA
  • Experience verifying reported defects and issues against requirements
  • Experience in preparing test strategies, test cases and test automation in an agile development context
  • Very good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work in a team environment under limited supervision
  • Experience in source code management tools, e.g. Git or SVN
  • Experience in using Jenkins or similar automation tools
  • Experience in working and testing in cloud environments e.g. AWS or Azure.

Special Conditions

  • Satisfactory National Police Clearance Check

For further information, please contact Christie O’Brien via email at careers@landservices.com.au or simply apply now by submitting a covering letter, that demonstrates you have the required skill set and experience we're seeking, together with a copy of your resume.

As part of this recruitment process applicants that are offered a role will be required to consent to a National Crime History check prior to commencement. All enquiries will be handled in confidence.

Our privacy collection statement can be found by visiting our website  https://www.landservices.com.au

title: Contract Establishment Officer
description:
About the Role

The Contract Establishment Officer supports the Manager Contracts Establishment to expedite and streamline the review, administration, management and processing of agreements for research at UniSA. The position is responsible for efficiently and effectively preparing, reviewing, negotiating, and arranging execution of research agreements.

The position is responsible for advising UniSA to enable satisfaction of its contractual responsibilities, particularly in relation to requirements of research funders, and that its exposure to risk is minimised by ensuring research contract provisions are consistent with UniSA's policies, standards, applicable legislative framework, and approach to risk management.

About UniSA

The University of South Australia is Australia’s University of Enterprise. Our culture of innovation is anchored around global and national links to academic, research and industry partners. Our graduates are the new urban professionals, global citizens at ease with the world and ready to create and respond to change. Our research is inventive and adventurous and we create new knowledge that is central to global economic and social prosperity.

Research and Innovation Services (RIS) provides support for the management of research, and administers sponsored research projects, along with contract research and consultancy agreements. It is also responsible for ensuring the responsible and ethical conduct of research, and for developing and implementing strategic initiatives to improve the quality of the experience and outcomes for postgraduate research students.

The Contracts Establishment Team provides strategic, legal and operational support to the Director, RIS and RIS senior management to support the core functions of RIS in support of responsible, compliant and ethical conduct of research. The team works closely with researchers and stakeholders in the preparation, review, negotiation, and execution (in accordance with the University’s delegation framework) of various types of research contracts, including both standard form contracts and bespoke research agreements.

Core Responsibilities

  • Provide expedient strategic review, interpretation, advice and guidance on research agreements and research funding agreements, legislation and regulations relating to research projects and contract activity including reviewing terms and conditions aligned to the University’s framework
  • Manage standard and non-standard research agreements from initial negotiation with external partners to execution and notification, including drafting clauses or agreements to suit the particular needs of a research project where this may be required or to ensure compliance with obligations to a funding body or partner
  • Ensure appropriate and full approvals are in place before proceeding to finalisation, including confirming with researchers and other relevant stakeholders that research project level information is complete and correct (e.g., in schedules to agreements), and researchers have a full understanding of the contractual milestones, deliverables, and other obligations
  • Proactively liaise with other professional service areas of the University to ensure the efficient, compliant, and effective negotiation and administration of research contracts and briefings to the signatory, and to obtain complex specialist or legal advice where it may be required
  • Liaise and negotiate with granting agencies, partner research organisations, industry partners and researchers

Essential Skills and Experience

  • A tertiary law degree or recognised legal, paralegal, or business qualifications and demonstrated relevant experience, training, education, and expertise in legal review and advice, drafting, negotiating, administering, and advising on contracts within the tertiary education or research sector, or in a commercial or government environment
  • A good working knowledge of contract law and commercial contracting with demonstrated ability to critique legal documents and provide feedback to key stakeholders such as professional, administrative, legal, and academic staff across the research ecosystem
  • Knowledge of research governance, research grant funding opportunities and requirements, application processes and post-award/post-contract management processes
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret funding rules and guidelines when managing research grant or research funding related agreements, with an ability understand and identify key risk issues or considerations in the research context
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with experience in drafting or negotiating bespoke research agreements or contractual terms for some of the University’s research funders/partners

Benefits

Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as:

  • Access to great personal development opportunities
  • Generous superannuation contributions of 17%
  • Employee assistance and development programs
  • Corporate health insurance
  • Staff study support

Culture

As a University of Enterprise, we offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our staff are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm. We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results.

How to Apply

For a copy of the position description and to apply, please visit Working at UniSA . The online application form will list the specific selection criteria that you need to address.

Please address your cover letter to Emma Kelvin, Recruitment Consultant . For further information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact UniSA Recruitment Central on +61 8 8302 0482 or via email at recruitment@unisa.edu.au using job reference number 4097 .

Applications close: 11.30pm Sunday 22 May 2022

Applications welcomed from Australian or NZ citizens, Australian permanent residents and those who have the legal right to work in Australia for the term of appointment.

#LI-DNI

title: Senior Ecologist
description:
About us:
Succession Ecology is a multi-faceted environmental business, providing a broad range of services in ecological consulting and research, landscape scale restoration and native seed supply. We specialise in large-scale management and restoration of arid systems and the production and sale of native seed. Our focus is on finding unique solutions in nature and applying new and innovative techniques to ecosystem management, which sets us apart in the environment industry.


We are seeking a Senior Ecologist to join our Ecological consulting team. This team works across a broad range of projects including ecosystem recovery, design, management and monitoring, development projects and tailored research programs to support project outcomes. The position will involve field work in locations throughout Australia (typically in SA) and office work based at Edwardstown.


Succession Ecology is a culture and values driven organisation. We are passionate about what we do and look forward to finding a new team member that can contribute to building our positive impact on the environment in Australia. The ideal candidate will be hardworking and adaptable person with an enthusiasm for learning, innovation and being actively involved in making a difference in our unique environment.
Position:


You will need:
• PhD qualification in Ecology or Environmental Science.
• 15 years + experience in the environment industry.
• Extensive research program experience (i.e. ecological surveys, flora and fauna identification, data collection, managing field teams, etc.).
• Highly developed written and verbal communication skills, with experience in data analysis, report writing and preparing management plans.
• Project Management experience
• Botany skills
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team of professionals.
• Ability to travel and stay away for multiple nights.
• Driver’s licence and Four-Wheel Drive Experience.


Beneficial attributes include:
• Experience in GIS, field mapping and developing and managing spatial datasets.
• Knowledge of State/Commonwealth regulatory frameworks and policy.
• Knowledge of South Australian ecosystems.
• NVC accreditation.
• First Aid and White card accreditation.

Applications:
Any queries please call Briony (0410 526 210 ) during business hours.
Otherwise, applications should be sent to jobs@successionecology.com.au


www.successionecology.com.au
Closing Date: Friday 10th June 2022

title: Data Entry Officer
description:
An exciting opportunity exists to join a large insurance firm on a key project due to begin in late May.

Our client is urgently seeking switched on candidates with strong data entry experience and excellent attention to detail to join a key Project for a 3-6 month assignment with a possibility of extension or a permanent placement.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work for an a renowned organisation in an interesting and highly regarded project where your input counts.


Duties:
  • Undertaking a range of administration & data processing tasks
  • Manual transfer of data from the current software into the new system
  • Managing data on excel
  • Uploading of documentation
  • File preparation

Who are you?
  • Corporate experience ideal, but not required
  • Able to work independently
  • High volume processing/data entry experience
  • Excellent communication skills
  • CRM/File Management systems experience
  • Intermediate to Advanced Excel skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office & Teams
Apply now!
If you are available immediately or planning to be so soon, please attach a copy of your updated resume through Seek and we will be in contact to chat further around the opportunities we have upcoming.

title: Applications Specialist
description:
City of Prospect is an inner urban community of approximately 21,000 residents, located immediately north of the City of Adelaide and ten minutes from the CBD. City of Prospect includes all or parts of the suburbs of Collinswood, Medindie Gardens, Fitzroy, Prospect, Ovingham, Thorngate, Broadview, Nailsworth, and Sefton Park.

City of Prospect provides a wide range of services which enhance the quality of life for residents and builds a strong sense of community. With a new CEO and new strategic plan, this is an exciting time to join Council as it continues to meet evolving community expectations.

Reporting to the Team Leader Information and Communications Technology, you will assist with the administration, maintenance, and enhancement of Council's Microsoft 365 environment, SharePoint Online, and Microsoft Teams applications.

Duties will include but are not limited to:

  • Working with end-users, ICT personnel and software vendors on a regular basis to ensure information systems meet operational requirements
  • Proactively identify opportunities and apply industry best practice to leverage technologies in areas which improve and enhance operational practices and user experiences
  • Supporting Council's existing SharePoint implementation and assist with the development of forms using Microsoft Forms and Power Apps and workflows using Microsoft Power Automate
  • Assisting with the installation, configuration, and operational support of enterprise level and

Off-the-Shelf software, including the resolution of technical and functional software issues

  • Managing the installation and upgrade of technical and/or business applications projects
  • Providing support and advice to customers on Council's business application related enquiries
  • Developing end-user training material and programs, ensuring all documentation is complete and up to date, and delivering training when required

To be successful in this role, you will have a tertiary qualification in Information Technology and/or significant proven experience with MS 365 apps, SQL scripts, SQL Server, LAN/WAN environments and concepts, and system integration using APIs, XML and .NET Frameworks and Web Services.

To obtain a copy of the Candidate Information Pack and to apply, please visit mcarthur.com.au and quote reference number 144998. Applications close 9am Monday 6th June 2022.

Confidential enquiries can be directed to Paul Coyle on 08 8100 7000 .

title: Technical Specialist - Server
description:
The Technical Specialist position resides within the Parliamentary Network Support Group (PNSG) within the Information & Technology section of DTF. The role delivers a range of complex and critical technical activities.

This role provides the application of technical skills in the planning, development, maintenance, problem resolution and support of the server, systems management, application, security and storage technology platforms and systems servicing Parliament and Electorate Offices.

The incumbent will need to take a collaborative and team-first approach and develop and maintain effective consultative and collaborative relationships with a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders and service providers.

Responsibilities may also include support of LAN / WAN networks, firewalls / gateways (proxies), IPS / IDS environments and interoperability relationships in conjunction with other peer team members.

This is a trusted role and could be required to undertake duties such as the eDiscovery function requiring an elevated security clearance to Australian Government Protective Security Policy Framework (PSPF) Negative Vetting Level 1.

For more information about the role, how to apply and to download a copy of the Job and Person Specification please visit I Work for SA: https://iworkfor.sa.gov.au/ and search for reference number 485702.

Diversity Statement
The Department of Treasury and Finance actively promote flexible working arrangements, and is committed to having at least 50% of interviewees for each role being women. At DTF we value and encourage diversity within our workforce, to help us reflect the community we serve.

Special Conditions

This role has been classified as a position of trust. The incumbent is subject to a satisfactory criminal history / record check in line with departmental and Parliamentary policies and procedures.

  • The incumbent is required to:
    • participate in a roster system for on-call and after-hours support
    • hold a current driver’s license
    • refrain from any kind of political activity or involvement in electoral affairs.
    • maintain confidentiality regarding sensitive client information.
  • Some intra/interstate travel involving overnight absences may be required.
  • The incumbent will be required to participate in the Departmental Performance Development Program and achieve performance targets as negotiated and mutually agreed with the Team Leader, Technology Services.
  • The incumbent may be required to be assigned to other positions at the same remuneration level across the department.

Enquiries
Name: Peter Evans|
Title: Team Leader Technology Services, PNSG
Contact number: 8403 2345

All applications must be submitted online via the www.iworkfor.sa.gov.au website by clicking on 'Apply' and following the instructions.

title: Remuneration and Benefits Officer
description:
About the role

We have two newly created roles for Remuneration & Benefits Officers to join our HR team based out of Adelaide.
The Remuneration & Benefits Officer contributes to our successes by partnering with the business to deliver innovative and pragmatic remuneration and benefits solutions.
As a key member of the team, the role is responsible for the end to end management of GFG Alliance's remuneration and benefit offerings which includes but not limited to the development of staff and wages Letters of Offer, employee relocations, maintenance of the HRIS, remuneration policy advice as well the delivery of key remuneration & benefit projects. The position is also accountable for driving various remuneration initiatives such as salary reviews and sourcing targeted internal and external market data.

About your experience

Our ideal candidate is an individual who is keen to broaden their current remuneration skills, or even a HR generalist looking to broaden their current HR toolkit or seeking a career change. This role will provide unique exposure to a number of broad and diverse remuneration and benefit challenges across a large and diverse business portfolio.

  • Bachelor's degree in area of specialty and/ or proven experience as a Remuneration and Benefits Officer
  • Highly numerate and analytical, together with a high level of accuracy and strong attention to detail
  • Advanced level skills in data analytics and modelling using Microsoft Excel
  • Deep technical knowledge and understanding of all aspects of Remuneration and Benefits
  • Strong relationship management and communication skills, including the ability to influence key stakeholders
  • Experience in managing benefit programs is desirable but not essential
  • Well-versed in external market benchmarking practices and accredited in Hay Job Evaluation methodology
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships at all levels of the organisation
  • Knowledge of tax, superannuation and employment law requirements in Australia
  • Capacity to be sensitive to matters of a confidential nature is also essential
About our team

GFG Alliance is a collection of global businesses and investments owned by Sanjeev Gupta and his family. The Alliance has 3 core industry groups; Liberty Steel, Alvance Aluminium and Simec Energy, different businesses working together as one towards the delivery of a common industrial strategy. We are on a mission to invigorate metals manufacturing and engineering around the world by using sustainable solutions, new technology, local resources, and big thinking.

As members of the GFG Alliance group in Australia, SIMEC Mining and SIMEC Energy as well as Liberty Primary Steel and Liberty Bell Bay, work together as champions of sustainable industry. We are on a mission to invigorate industry and engineering using sustainable solutions, new technology, local resources and big thinking.

Next steps

We believe that there is strength in diversity, and what sets us apart as individuals makes us stronger as a team. It's about making sure we have different and differing voices across all parts of the business to make us the best we can be. We are focused on diversity within three specific areas: diversity of thought, of gender and of culture. Fostering diversity means GFG Alliance is a workplace where all employees can flourish and grow. We encourage you to join us on our journey.

Apply today.

title: PhD Scholarship: Developing a ‘missing links’ public policy
description:
The University of South Australia (UniSA) is Australia’s University of Enterprise. We are South Australia’s largest university and one of the very best young universities in the world. At UniSA, we are authentic, resilient, and influential - and we deliver results. We pride ourselves on our dynamic and agile culture, which embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Plus, we are committed to the principles of excellence and equity.

Our people are critical to our success. They are creative, enterprising and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm.

We educate global professionals ready to create and inspire change, through more than 200 world-class degrees. We deliver outcomes-focused research that is inspired by global challenges and opportunities, to deliver economic and social prosperity.

Our strategic plan, Enterprise25, focusses on our people, programs and precincts, and sets out our path to ensure that we continue to deliver quality teaching, research and student outcomes.

  • 100% of our assessed research rated at or above world-class - 2018 Excellence in Research for Australia (ERA), 4-digit Fields of Research.
  • No. 1 in Australia for industry research income - 2019 THE World University Rankings.
  • No. 1 in Australia for research impact & engagement - 2018 ARC Engagement and Impact Assessment (EI), Combined Impact – Approach to Impact and Engagement on Assessed Fields.
  • Athena Swan Bronze Award.

About the research degree project:

PhD Project: What do South Australian firms need to enable and support high growth? Developing a ‘missing links’ public policy

Inform public policy on business growth

If you are seeking to advance your career in business and innovation and are interested in public policy, the University of South Australia – Australia’s University of Enterprise – is offering a project- based PhD through our Centre for Enterprise Dynamics in Global Economies (C-EDGE) in partnership with the South Australian Department of Premier and Cabinet and the Australian Centre for Business Growth .

Government policy often takes a top-down approach to deliver initiatives and interventions that respond to a broad ‘market failure’. Alternatively, they will ‘pick winners’ and target a priority sector for growth. The aim of this project is to equip policymakers with the tools to consider a bottom-up ‘missing links’ approach to policy formation.

The objective of this project-based research degree is to determine the influential effects that various policy and support programs have on established companies choosing opportunities and strategies for high growth. The project will consider a range of options that support high growth across education, financial grants, locational factors, human resource choices, digitisation, and supply chain/market diversification. The results will provide evidence-based guides for both policymakers and industry practitioners.

This project is a dynamic partnership between the Department of Premier and Cabinet, UniSA’s Australian Centre for Business Growth, and C-EDGE. You will be part of a research program that aligns with and supports the South Australian Government’s prosperity and growth objectives, preparing you for a career in business growth.

You will join a vibrant and engaging research culture within UniSA and be given ample opportunity to build your social and professional networks. You will also gain exposure to and experience with leading scholars and research methods to build your innovation expertise, and be co-located with an active cohort of success-driven higher degree research students.

What you’ll do

This is a valuable opportunity to be part of a collaborative group of researchers, producing articles for research and practitioner publications, and engaging with industry partners.

In this project-based research degree, you will have the opportunity to develop a research design and the necessary skills to respond to a critical policy question. Your customised research will contribute to modernising approaches for governments to facilitate enterprise growth and dynamics.

Upon successful completion you will demonstrate significant theoretical and analytical skills, advanced knowledge in a relevant and impactful area, and have the ability to effectively communicate research results.

You will also gain access to career enhancing internship opportunities during your studies. This will provide you with critical industry research insights, and additional project management and data visualisation skills.

You will be funded for one conference to conduct research and for professional development and networking.

Where you’ll be based

You will be based in the Centre of Enterprise Dynamics in Global Economies (C-EDGE). We engage in research and innovation that fosters enterprising solutions for the problems that challenge local, regional and global prosperity.

We are in a world of uncertainty, where businesses and government are continually confronted by rapid changes in technology whilst dealing with external shocks. In this environment of dynamism and constant flux, how do organisations, industries, and entrepreneurial individuals, initiate and sustain, innovation and enterprise?

Our unique research addresses that question. We produce high quality, theory-driven research that informs and develops improved practices in dynamic contexts among enterprising individuals, organisations, professions, industries and policymakers. We provide the tools, methods, and frameworks to influence policy and practice, related to innovation and enterprise.

Supervisory Team

  • Associate Professor Allan O'Connor - Principal Supervisor
  • Professor Marie Wilson - Co-Supervisor
  • Associate Professor Akshay Vij - Co-Supervisor
  • Dr Mirjam Wiedemann - Co-Supervisor
  • Professor Jana Matthews - Industry Advisor


Financial Support

This project is funded for reasonable research expenses. Additionally, a living allowance scholarship of $28,854 per annum is available to Australian and New Zealand citizens, and permanent residents of Australia, including permanent humanitarian visa holders. A fee-offset or waiver for the standard term of the program is also included. For full terms and benefits of the scholarship please refer to our scholarship information . International applicants are not invited to apply at this time.

Eligibility and Selection

This project is open to applications from Australian or New Zealand citizens, and Australian permanent residents or permanent humanitarian visa holders. International applicants are not invited to apply at this time.

Applicants must meet the eligibility criteria for entrance into a PhD.

Additionally applicants must meet the projects selection criteria:

  • Eligibility for Government data clearance (the candidate(s) will be working with confidential and secure data. The candidates will be required to satisfy any Australian and/or South Australian Government data access clearances)


Applicants who can also demonstrate/provide the following will be highly regarded:

  • A research proposal (approximately 2500 words that has been developed in consultation with the proposed lead supervisor. A template to help guide this application is available here )
  • A sample of either critical writing, report writing, and/or research writing skills (approximately 5000 words)
  • Self-management capabilities (e.g. evidence of completion of previous self-managed projects)
  • Strong communication skills to work with senior executives and policymakers (e.g. prior experience working in similar situations)


All applications that meet the eligibility and selection criteria will be considered for this project. A merit selection process will be used to determine the successful candidate.

The successful applicant is expected to study full-time and be based at our City West campus in the heart of Adelaide.

Essential Dates

Applicants are expected to start in a timely fashion upon receipt of an offer. Extended deferral periods are not available. Applications close on Sunday 5 June 2022.

title: Brand New Opportunities at Datacom Adelaide - Customer Service - Casual
description:
Be the first to join this new and exciting opportunity to help out your fellow Australians!

We are hiring Customer Service Roles in Adelaide CBD with hybrid working from home options available. Be recognised and rewarded for your contributions while making a real difference to the lives of Australians.

As a Customer Service Representative, you will be providing essential services to people across Australia on behalf of our Australian Federal Government client. In this role you'll be operating in a dynamic team environment with a focus on meeting quality outcomes for customers.


Benefits

  • Datacom oﬀers its people the ability to make a real diﬀerence, and develop their careers within a supportive and rewarding environment.
  • We offer options for you to interview virtually
  • Best in class rewards and recognition program, including awards and corporate retail discounts on tap.
  • Talent development programs designed to engage and empower you: we want to build on your strengths and experiences and provide you with career growth within our organisation. Opportunities for development include: Leadership, Business Analytics, Administration, HR & Recruitment and IT.
  • Paid Parental Leave


Operating Hours

Our operating hours are Monday to Friday between 8:00am and 8:00pm on a rotating roster with flexibility to support all of your out of work commitments.

We understand that life can be busy, therefore, Datacom's commitment is to provide a flexible work life balance to suit any personal or family commitments whilst still maintaining full time hours.


About You

  • High attention to detail
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Clear communication skills to customers and stakeholders
  • Punctual and reliable
  • Experience adhering to KPI's
  • Able to manage customer expectations
  • Patience and empathy towards people in difficult situations
  • A team player focus, working collaboratively to exceed expectations
  • Intermediate computer skills, ability to navigate multiple screens and a typing speed of 30WPM
  • Due to Federal Government clearance requirements Australian Citizenship is required


About Datacom

Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.

We have over 6,500 people across our global offices and generate an annual revenue of over AU $1.1 billion annually. This makes us one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. We are committed to hiring, developing and promoting diverse talent.

Datacom has extensive expertise in the operation of contact centres, data centres, engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations.

Founded in 1965, we have a successful trading history of consistent growth, profitability and a track record of delivering innovative, cost effective technology solutions.

We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

If you're looking for meaningful work with genuine career progression opportunities, training and development, we'd love to hear from you.

Datacom is committed to the health and safety of its people and the wider community. Based on site access requirements for this role, the successful applicant will need to be able produce evidence of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19, or a valid exemption. Datacom will consider whether any accommodations can be made for candidates who are partially vaccinated (with remaining vaccine doses booked), or who are unable to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and hold a valid exemption.

APPLY WITH US TODAY!

title: Procurement/Purchasing Manager
description:
Quarry & Mining Manufacture (QMM) operates in Adelaide, Whyalla, and Brisbane, providing high-quality services across Australia. We have built strong professional relationships with a broad range of clients in the quarry, mining, concrete, cement, asphalt, salt, gypsum, and recycling industries, offering:

  • New plant design, fabrication, installation, and commissioning
  • Existing plant upgrades and new equipment retrofits
  • Designing solutions for material handling problems and bottlenecks
  • On-site breakdown, maintenance, and shutdown services
  • Repairs and maintenance (on-site and in our workshop)
  • Equipment and spare parts fabrication
  • General engineering and fabrication
  • Structural repairs
  • Supply of crushing and screening equipment
  • Equipment and parts sales

This position of Procurement/Purchasing Manager requires an enthusiastic, team orientated individual with a strong customer focus who can work independently, as well as collaboratively to maximise workflow and achieve company goals. The business has strategic plans to continue growth opportunities and a new business structure that offers the freedom needed to make a difference and setup a long term career.

In this busy and hands on role your responsibilities will include:

  • source and negotiate new supply contracts and manage Inventory control and with cost analysis.
  • BOM analysis ensuring data accuracy.
  • Managing delivery issues/requirements/processes.
  • Management of current and redundant stocks.
  • Negotiating better prices with current or new suppliers
  • Working closely with the Workshop and site services teams to develop effective purchasing strategies
  • Manage local and interstate suppliers, building optimal relationships whilst monitoring performance
  • Ensuring data is processed with the highest degree of accuracy
  • Commitment to best practice and continuous improvement
  • Review processes and procedures to improve and streamline
  • Participate in projects as required

To be considered for this role it is essential that the successful candidate has the following skills and experience:

  • Experience within a dedicated purchasing role
  • Exposure to inventory control, demand planning and production planning would be great
  • Advanced Microsoft skills - Word and Excel
  • Exceptional communication skills - written and verbal
  • Strong attention to detail combined with advanced analytical skills
  • Exposure to Pronto System preferred but not essential
  • Ability to work with and positively contribute to a busy team
  • Demonstrated experience in delivering process improvements would be a bonus

This is an ideal role for someone who likes to be busy and who understands that accurate data entry is as important as many of the more "senior" purchasing tasks that this role requires. The successful candidate will have an opportunity to grow with the business and set out a career.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Do you love a good lamb roast? We’re developing the world’s best technology to measure meat quality. We need a Senior Software Engineer to help us bring it to market.

Miniprobes is a high-tech spin-out from the University of Adelaide. We use precision fibre-optics and near-infrared lasers to build imaging devices less than a millimetre in diameter. Based on 10 years of R&D, our team has developed a new type of imaging technology which we are using to measure meat quality for the livestock industry.

It’s an exciting time to join Miniprobes . We are developing our first product for commercial release. You can be pivotal in creating this new product. We have the expertise, funding and industry partnerships to deliver it to the livestock industry within the next 2 years. You will be part of the team that develops this product. You will also be a foundational employee in this young company as we start on a trajectory of rapid growth.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will help us to develop the software that is at the heart of this system. This includes acquisition, processing and analysis of data from our imaging hardware as well as creating tools to remotely manage installed systems. You will be involved in a range of areas including real-time systems, image processing and machine learning, targeted at a Windows platform.

To be considered for this role you will need:

  • Bachelor of Engineering, Computer Science or related area;
  • At least 5 years software development experience;
  • Experience with C++ and OO concepts.

To apply, submit your resume/CV and a cover letter highlighting any skills and experiences that would make you a vital part of our team.

For further information regarding this position, please contact the Director (Software) at rodney.kirk@miniprobes.com .

title: Contract Establishment Officer
description:
About the Role

The Contract Establishment Officer supports the Manager Contracts Establishment to expedite and streamline the review, administration, management and processing of agreements for research at UniSA. The position is responsible for efficiently and effectively preparing, reviewing, negotiating, and arranging execution of research agreements.

The position is responsible for advising UniSA to enable satisfaction of its contractual responsibilities, particularly in relation to requirements of research funders, and that its exposure to risk is minimised by ensuring research contract provisions are consistent with UniSA's policies, standards, applicable legislative framework, and approach to risk management.

About UniSA

The University of South Australia is Australia’s University of Enterprise. Our culture of innovation is anchored around global and national links to academic, research and industry partners. Our graduates are the new urban professionals, global citizens at ease with the world and ready to create and respond to change. Our research is inventive and adventurous and we create new knowledge that is central to global economic and social prosperity.

Research and Innovation Services (RIS) provides support for the management of research, and administers sponsored research projects, along with contract research and consultancy agreements. It is also responsible for ensuring the responsible and ethical conduct of research, and for developing and implementing strategic initiatives to improve the quality of the experience and outcomes for postgraduate research students.

The Contracts Establishment Team provides strategic, legal and operational support to the Director, RIS and RIS senior management to support the core functions of RIS in support of responsible, compliant and ethical conduct of research. The team works closely with researchers and stakeholders in the preparation, review, negotiation, and execution (in accordance with the University’s delegation framework) of various types of research contracts, including both standard form contracts and bespoke research agreements.

Core Responsibilities

  • Provide expedient strategic review, interpretation, advice and guidance on research agreements and research funding agreements, legislation and regulations relating to research projects and contract activity including reviewing terms and conditions aligned to the University’s framework
  • Manage standard and non-standard research agreements from initial negotiation with external partners to execution and notification, including drafting clauses or agreements to suit the particular needs of a research project where this may be required or to ensure compliance with obligations to a funding body or partner
  • Ensure appropriate and full approvals are in place before proceeding to finalisation, including confirming with researchers and other relevant stakeholders that research project level information is complete and correct (e.g., in schedules to agreements), and researchers have a full understanding of the contractual milestones, deliverables, and other obligations
  • Proactively liaise with other professional service areas of the University to ensure the efficient, compliant, and effective negotiation and administration of research contracts and briefings to the signatory, and to obtain complex specialist or legal advice where it may be required
  • Liaise and negotiate with granting agencies, partner research organisations, industry partners and researchers

Essential Skills and Experience

  • A tertiary law degree or recognised legal, paralegal, or business qualifications and demonstrated relevant experience, training, education, and expertise in legal review and advice, drafting, negotiating, administering, and advising on contracts within the tertiary education or research sector, or in a commercial or government environment
  • A good working knowledge of contract law and commercial contracting with demonstrated ability to critique legal documents and provide feedback to key stakeholders such as professional, administrative, legal, and academic staff across the research ecosystem
  • Knowledge of research governance, research grant funding opportunities and requirements, application processes and post-award/post-contract management processes
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret funding rules and guidelines when managing research grant or research funding related agreements, with an ability understand and identify key risk issues or considerations in the research context
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with experience in drafting or negotiating bespoke research agreements or contractual terms for some of the University’s research funders/partners

Benefits

Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as:

  • Access to great personal development opportunities
  • Generous superannuation contributions of 17%
  • Employee assistance and development programs
  • Corporate health insurance
  • Staff study support

Culture

As a University of Enterprise, we offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our staff are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm. We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results.

How to Apply

For a copy of the position description and to apply, please visit Working at UniSA . The online application form will list the specific selection criteria that you need to address.

Please address your cover letter to Emma Kelvin, Recruitment Consultant . For further information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact UniSA Recruitment Central on +61 8 8302 0482 or via email at recruitment@unisa.edu.au using job reference number 4097 .

Applications close: 11.30pm Sunday 22 May 2022

Applications welcomed from Australian or NZ citizens, Australian permanent residents and those who have the legal right to work in Australia for the term of appointment.
