It is also responsible for ensuring the responsible and ethical conduct of research, and for developing and implementing strategic initiatives to improve the quality of the experience and outcomes for postgraduate research students.

The Contracts Establishment Team provides strategic, legal and operational support to the Director, RIS and RIS senior management to support the core functions of RIS in support of responsible, compliant and ethical conduct of research. The team works closely with researchers and stakeholders in the preparation, review, negotiation, and execution (in accordance with the University’s delegation framework) of various types of research contracts, including both standard form contracts and bespoke research agreements.

Core Responsibilities

  • Provide expedient strategic review, interpretation, advice and guidance on research agreements and research funding agreements, legislation and regulations relating to research projects and contract activity including reviewing terms and conditions aligned to the University’s framework
  • Manage standard and non-standard research agreements from initial negotiation with external partners to execution and notification, including drafting clauses or agreements to suit the particular needs of a research project where this may be required or to ensure compliance with obligations to a funding body or partner
  • Ensure appropriate and full approvals are in place before proceeding to finalisation, including confirming with researchers and other relevant stakeholders that research project level information is complete and correct (e.g., in schedules to agreements), and researchers have a full understanding of the contractual milestones, deliverables, and other obligations
  • Proactively liaise with other professional service areas of the University to ensure the efficient, compliant, and effective negotiation and administration of research contracts and briefings to the signatory, and to obtain complex specialist or legal advice where it may be required
  • Liaise and negotiate with granting agencies, partner research organisations, industry partners and researchers

Essential Skills and Experience

  • A tertiary law degree or recognised legal, paralegal, or business qualifications and demonstrated relevant experience, training, education, and expertise in legal review and advice, drafting, negotiating, administering, and advising on contracts within the tertiary education or research sector, or in a commercial or government environment
  • A good working knowledge of contract law and commercial contracting with demonstrated ability to critique legal documents and provide feedback to key stakeholders such as professional, administrative, legal, and academic staff across the research ecosystem
  • Knowledge of research governance, research grant funding opportunities and requirements, application processes and post-award/post-contract management processes
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret funding rules and guidelines when managing research grant or research funding related agreements, with an ability understand and identify key risk issues or considerations in the research context
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with experience in drafting or negotiating bespoke research agreements or contractual terms for some of the University’s research funders/partners

Benefits

Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as:

  • Access to great personal development opportunities
  • Generous superannuation contributions of 17%
  • Employee assistance and development programs
  • Corporate health insurance
  • Staff study support

Culture

As a University of Enterprise, we offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our staff are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm. We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results.

How to Apply

For a copy of the position description and to apply, please visit Working at UniSA . The online application form will list the specific selection criteria that you need to address.

Please address your cover letter to Emma Kelvin, Recruitment Consultant . For further information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact UniSA Recruitment Central on +61 8 8302 0482 or via email at recruitment@unisa.edu.au using job reference number 4097 .

Applications close: 11.30pm Sunday 22 May 2022

Applications welcomed from Australian or NZ citizens, Australian permanent residents and those who have the legal right to work in Australia for the term of appointment.

#LI-DNI

title: Manager, Research
description:
Here at the SATC, we love our state and we love what we do. We want to bring visitors to South Australia to build a prosperous economy and share the love with the rest of Australia and the world. We search for undiscovered experiences, remarkable people and immersive products, and we tenaciously seek the best.

Together we are making a difference so South Australia thrives.

The Manager, Research is responsible for providing strategic research leadership to the agency. This includes managing ongoing research requirements across the various teams in the agency, as well as identifying research gaps and potential strategic projects. The role has a key focus on facilitating communication of relevant research insights across the SATC and working within the SATC to embed the research findings into plans and strategies. The role manages strategic research projects ensuring high quality and relevant, actionable outcomes.  The role has a leadership responsibility within the Strategy and Insights team providing support to the Senior Manager, Strategy and Insights and representing the team as needed at an Executive and Board level.

Responsibilities will include but will not be limited to:

  • Work with teams within the SATC to identify research needs, define research issues and provide expert advice on research design and methodology to address gaps.
  • Maintain a strong focus on servicing the strategy needs of the Events and Marketing teams within the SATC
  • Provide project management services to SATC teams that are purchasing research, ensuring that the highest quality outcomes are achieved at a competitive cost.
  • Maintain a strong knowledge of research providers and products on offer. Provide advice on where emerging products might benefit the SATC.
  • Maintain strong and current expertise in emerging research techniques to enable high quality internal advice and management of research contractors.
  • Manage the SATC’s relationship with Tourism Research Australia (TRA) with respect to the agreed deliverables under the Service Level Agreement including the National Visitor Survey (NVS) and International Visitor Survey (IVS).
  • Act as the SATC’s representative on the national Tourism Research Committee ensuring that strategic priorities are raised and actioned.
  • Assist the Senior Manager, Strategy & Insights in the project management of the strategic and operational planning cycle for the SATC.
  • Lead workshops with SATC Business Units to facilitate the development of strategic and operational planning.

The role will be offered as a three (3) year contract and subject to six (6) months’ probation and participation in regular performance reviews.

Please note that shortlisted candidates will be required to show evidence of COVID-19 vaccinations or certified medical exemption prior to attending an interview.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working, including part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role, and candidates with an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander background are encouraged to apply.

Enquiries can be directed to People and Culture on 8463 4513 .

Position descriptions can be accessed via https://tourism.sa.gov.au/about/careers

Applications consisting of a resume and a cover letter are to be directed to Adam Stanford at the South Australian Tourism Commission via employment@sa.gov.au

Applications close: 9am 1 June 2022

title: Critical Minerals Researcher
company: Department of the Premier and Cabinet
description:
The role of Critical Minerals Researcher undertakes research programs in Mineralogy / Economic Geology and develops, interprets and studies the South Australian Museum’s earth sciences collections, as part of a professional research collective that also includes the Australian Critical Minerals Research Centre at the University of Adelaide. The incumbent provides expert, authoritative advice on professional matters, promotes the Museum in both scientific and community forums, and supervises students and visiting researchers working on the Earth Sciences collections.

Special Conditions:

title: Digital Advertising Specialist
description:
Who are we?

We are a growing ICT Managed Services Provider based in Adelaide.

We provide a range of technology solutions, cloud offerings, helpdesk support, consulting, cyber awareness training and fully managed services. Personal development is highly supported within the company, with a very inclusive team culture and open communication. Social and relationship skills are considered just as important as technical skills.

Why do we need you?

We recognise that, in order to achieve our goals, we need to hire great people who are confident in their ability to make a unique contribution to the future success of our company. Interstate expansion is on the horizon and we need confident, results-driven staff to add value to our constantly growing team.

The Role?

Reporting directly to the company Director, you will be working with two brands and have the opportunity to take ownership and management of our LinkedIn campaigns, Google advertising stack, SEO strategy, and any other digital marketing platforms available to push forward company growth and digital presence.

Essential Skills:

  • Pay per click management
  • SEO implementation
  • Lead generation
  • Conducting keyword research/optimisations, testing framework and audience management across all accounts.
  • Managing campaign expenses, staying on budget, forecasting monthly costs/performance and reconciling any discrepancies that may arise
  • Compiling weekly/monthly/ad-hoc reports for the Director
  • Proven track record
  • Experience in managing campaigns/projects
  • Passionate and strong work ethic
  • Ability to work independently

If you have the above skills/experience and are looking for your next role, please apply online.

title: Research Associate Medical Biotechnology
description:
JR0000004514

Availability:
Fixed-Term until May 2023 | Full-Time

Compensation:
Research Academic Level A

Salary Range:
$88,592 - $94,938 p.a.

Reporting to:
Associate Professor, Medical Biotechnology
College of Medicine and Public Health

Position Information:
The salary range is reflective of the incumbent having completed a PhD.
This position may attract further funding for extension beyond the availability end date.

About the College of Medicine and Public Health
At the College of Medicine and Public Health, we deliver clinical, population and lab-based research, integrated teaching programs and high-quality clinical services. Our footprint reaches out from our world class teaching hospital at the Flinders Medical Centre in South Australia to multiple rural clinical locations all the way to Darwin in the Northern Territory. Our research and teaching equip the next generation of leaders and innovators with the skill, commitment, and vision to protect vulnerable communities and truly advance health outcomes. It's at the heart of everything we do.

About the Role

An exciting research opportunity is available for a postdoctoral researcher in the team of Associate Professor Munish Puri, based at Flinders' Medical Biotechnology research facilities. We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated postdoctoral researcher, who will conduct research in an Industry supported research project aimed at producing single cell microbial oil.

The project focuses on screening microbial strains (fungal/microalgae) for single cell oil production. The novel microbial oils would be produced through fermentation and evaluated for their transformed structures. This opportunity provides an effective and innovative means to rapidly identify and solve industry-relevant problems at a commercially relevant pace, while maintaining the academic rigour.

In working with the chief investigators, you will also contribute to the design and execution of the experiments in the university laboratory and sites of the industry partner, implementation of downstream processing methods and data analysis, and preparation of publication and reports within the scope of the project.

You will actively perform hands-on research and support reporting of new research findings through generation of high-quality publications and conference presentations. You will contribute towards attracting externally funded grants and assist in the supervision and training of research higher degree students. In addition, you will also assist the investigators in maintaining a close relationship with industry to ensure research in the bioprocessing area is relevant and industry focused.

About You

You will be able to demonstrate your well-developed interpersonal skills, critical in your work to collaborate with colleagues and engage with key stakeholders, including your assistance in developing and fostering industrial research partnerships. Further, you'll have ability to assist with co-supervision of HDR students, develop strong teamwork skills in a multicultural environment, and lead and manage research programs and those teams. Critical to the role, you will demonstrate:

  • research experience in carrying heterotrophic fermentation with regards to single cell oil producing microorganism, and relevant publications in high quality scientific journals;
  • experience in performing mutagenesis using oleaginous microbes (experience with fungus strains); and
  • experience in instrumentation GC-MS/HPLC for carrying fatty acid analysis, lipids analysis (fractionation of lipid classes, TLC-GC) and sugar analysis.

You must also show evidence of completion of a PhD in one of the following areas: biotechnology, industrial biotechnology, bioprocess engineering, biochemical engineering, chemical engineering, chemistry and biochemistry, or equivalent qualification in an appropriate and relevant field.

Life at Flinders

We're transforming, and investing in people and facilities, to create contemporary, stimulating and satisfying learning and work environments that reflect our core values of excellence, innovation, courage, and integrity. Flinders is refocusing its strategic priorities with the aim of elevating its performance to be a top ten Australian university, and amongst the top 1% in the world.

Reaching beyond the limits of buildings, borders, and backgrounds, ours is an inclusive culture that believes absolutely in equality and opportunity for all. We don't just accommodate differences; we embrace and celebrate them. So, why work at Flinders?

  • 17% Superannuation + salary packaging options
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Wide range of professional development activities and services
  • We embrace diversity and promote equity and inclusion for students and staff with disabilities and health conditions , we are committed to Indigenous education and engagement and support initiatives such as The Pride Network
  • Vibrant campus life and amenities including on campus health care services , gym and childcare centre

Prescribed Conditions for Employment
A valid National Police Certificate which is satisfactory to the University will also be required before the successful applicant can commence in this position.

Flinders University has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that requires all new staff members to be up to date with their COVID-19 vaccinations, subject to medical exemptions and limited exemptions.

Candidates with current rights to work in Australia (citizens, PRs, and temporary visa holders) will be considered in the first instance, however, we are happy to review international applications.

How to Apply and Information

Candidates are encouraged to have discussion with the hiring manager, Associate Professor Munish Puri , prior to submitting an application. Please do not forward applications to the contact.

To view the full position description and apply online , please visit the Jobs@Flinders website via the job portal: JR0000004514 Research Associate Medical Biotechnology .

Applications to be submitted before 11:59pm Wednesday, 1 June 2022

Please note, late applications and applications sent via agencies will not be accepted .

title: Senior Software Engineer - Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning
salary: Genuine Work Life Balance - competitive salary
description:
About us

Lockheed Martin is a dynamic, growing, and energetic organisation offering stimulating, challenging work at the forefront of technology. Lockheed Martin is a leader in Australia’s National Security, and our collaboration with Australian industry spans the Aeronautics, Maritime, Surveillance and Defence domains. We employ approximately 100,000 staff worldwide, and over 1000 staff in Australia across multiple locations.

Lockheed Martin Australia has a strong pedigree in the engineering support of the Jindalee Over the Horizon Radar Network (JORN). Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AIML) practices have been found to have an increasing utility in the processing of JORN signals with an initial study of the application of AIML to peak detection demonstrating improved performance.

Lockheed Martin Australia is investing in AIML approaches that have broad applicability to signal processing and have the potential to significantly improve the clarity, quality and accuracy of data presented to system operators. In this project, Lockheed Martin Australia is increasing confidence in AIML techniques for JORN application through development and deployment of a product demonstrator to demonstrate and quantify a prototype AIML application performance with respect to the current JORN classic algorithm.

About the Opportunity

Working as an integral member of this team, the primary responsibility of the role is to technically lead the development of project software related deliverables to ensure all technical and quality requirements are met.

In particular, you will:

  • Lead the development, integration and deployment of an AIML signal processing model for assessment of practical use
  • Lead activities to identify, analyse, select and apply concepts, technologies and techniques that are applicable to the technical development of monitoring and control domain software products
  • Lead the agile development of complex technical solutions proposed by yourself and team Subject Matter Experts, including the development of software requirement, design and test rationale and the implementation of code and unit test whilst together overcoming project technical issues
  • You will also be responsible for resolution of problems identified during the conduct of software development, integration and test of your products

About you:

  • Extensive knowledge of engineering processes and the overall engineering product lifecycle
  • Advanced experience in software engineering methodologies and techniques
  • Advanced experience leading and/or managing small teams to successful system outcomes
  • Excellent ability to apply experiential judgement and lateral approaches to complex problem solving

Any of the following skills & experience is highly desirable:

  • AIML functionality available in Python
  • Python-based async I/O microservice architectures
  • Agile software development rituals and methodologies
  • Deployment of products to Linux servers (real and/or virtualised)

Special Requirements:

Applicants are required to be Australian Citizens to be eligible for Defence clearance

Employment may be contingent on the satisfactory result of criminal and/or other background screens, which require the collection and transfer of personal information.

What we offer you:

At Lockheed Martin we value our team and the contribution they make every day. We offer rewarding career pathways working on interesting projects that make a difference, continuous professional development, and the opportunity to learn from a diverse team of talented individuals.

In return we offer:

  • Competitive remuneration
  • Options for genuine work/life flexibility including a 9-day, compacted fortnight
  • Membership to Destination Discounts – that saves you money on many every day purchases including supermarkets, petrol, department stores to name a few
  • Annual flu vaccinations
  • Salary packaging for car leasing

Equal Opportunity Statement

Lockheed Martin supports Equal Employment Opportunity and Diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, harassment free, diverse, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. Diversity and inclusion are the foundation of our culture and reflect our values of doing what’s right, respecting others and performing with excellence. By leveraging our employees’ unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

title: Solution Architect
description:
Data Action (DA) has over 30 years' experience as a specialist software and services provider to the alternate banking and financial services industry. Operating nationally and servicing a broad client base including customer owned banks, credit unions, neobanks and financial services membership organisations, DA's focus of supporting the financial wellbeing of Australians is echoed through our values:

  • No goldfish - Go beyond your bowl, share knowledge, stay curious and keep learning.
  • Fail forward - Learn from mistakes and keep moving forward.
  • Cheer loudly - Be proud of the team's results and celebrate successes.
  • Own it - Throw yourself in and own your work, taking responsibility until the end.
  • Think Client - Put yourself in our Client's shoes - consider the impact for their customers and deliver.

DA has evolved to become a provider of core banking and digital platforms and services to some of Australia's leading customer-owned, challenger banks, aggregators, and the financial services industry, aligned with our purpose - powering innovation in banking.

DA operates nationally with close to 300 staff based in Adelaide, Sydney, Melbourne, and Brisbane - enhancing the banking experience of more than 1.43 million Australians via its core banking and digital platforms, powering customer transactions across 3.2 million accounts every day.

About the Role:

The Solution Architect will have a comprehensive understanding of translating problem statements, functional and non-functional requirements into solutions, enabled by technology and specifically the suite of DA products and services.

You will be responsible for assisting in the establishment of an IT Architecture practice, whilst managing and governing activities that take place during solution ideation, design and implementation phases.

The Solution Architect also be a key technical liaison for project managers and internal stakeholders across the organisation for DA client mergers, acquisitions, offboarding and supporting projects.

The Solution Architect will be instrumental in assisting the development of project portfolios taking into account internal and external considerations (including vendors), ensuring solutions are not only fit for purpose, but also closely aligned with the enterprise roadmap, business requirements, key principles and supporting architecture guidelines.

You will be responsible for:

  • Analysing current technologies and processes used within DA and proposing ways to improve
  • Document the scope of the solution, and how it meets the requirements
  • Work closely with infrastructure teams to maximise the use of On-Prem and Cloud capabilities
  • Propose and establish frameworks for necessary contributions from various departments/divisions
  • Account for possible project challenges and constraints, including: risks, time, resources, and scope
  • Document the full solution covering all architectural views
  • Work closely with project managers to resolve technical issues
  • Define clear milestones for all aspects of a project.

To be successful in this role, you must be able to demonstrate:

  • Relevant Bachelor's degree in IT/Business, or similar
  • Demonstrated experience within a similar role - ideally no less than 5 years
  • Extensive and demonstrated experience with solutions architecture, business and systems requirements, and technical design and analysis in a complex technical environment
  • Proven experience in engaging internal functional teams along with external clients and/or vendors to ensure solutions align with enterprise strategy and technology roadmaps
  • Exposure to enterprise architecture and strategic thinking
  • Well-developed analytical, problem solving, decision-making and design enhancement abilities
  • Superior communication and interpersonal skills.

DA offers exciting opportunities for professional development and we have a strong focus on career progression for our employees. Flexible and supportive working arrangements are encouraged.

If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you! Please be sure to combine a covering letter addressing the key criteria set out above as the first page of your resume.

To be considered for this role you will need to be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident, or have a current visa that permits you to work in Australia.

title: Scientist (Lincoln, New Zealand)
description:
The Role and Opportunity

Please note this role is based in Lincoln, New Zealand.

AgResearch is looking for an enthusiastic and dedicated Scientist to join the Computational Agricultural Systems Team in Lincoln, New Zealand, on a full-time, permanent basis.

Agricultural systems modelling capabilities are strategically important for AgResearch. This position is to further expand these capabilities, especially expertise in APSIM, a comprehensive model for simulating biophysical processes in agricultural systems.

What You will be Doing

The successful candidate will primarily contribute to the delivery of projects in the areas of agricultural systems modelling. Specific project allocation will be done based on the candidate’s expertise. They will be expected to provide scientific thought leadership and deliver research outcomes within these projects. The agreed research outcomes will contribute to the intellectual environment of the research group and science in general.

This role involves operating as part of multi-disciplinary project teams to deliver high-quality science outcomes relevant to agricultural industry priorities.

Your Ideal Background

  • PhD in a biophysical aspect of agricultural science or a related discipline
  • Experience of applying quantitative system models to understand, and diagnose problems, and/or develop potential solutions relevant to pastoral agricultural systems
  • Experience in writing or adapting code in a programming or scripting language
  • Experience in developing tools (e.g., scripts) for automating tasks relevant to model application and handling large amounts of data
  • A track record of high-quality peer-reviewed publications
  • The ability to prioritise competing demands and manage your time effectively
  • Excellent communication, organisational and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work autonomously while being part of a collaborative team
  • Demonstrates safe workplace behaviour by taking all practicable steps to ensure own and other’s safety in the workplace

Our Benefits

When your work environment fits your values and your lifestyle, it is a better place to be. Our campuses are green, open, and developing, allowing you to enjoy your work and be productive at the same time – we offer flexibility (work from home, flexible hours) and generous benefits to make sure our people feel supported and enjoy being part of the AgResearch team.

You can view the complete list here: http://www.agresearchcareers.co.nz/working-here/our-benefits/

How to Apply

This role will suit a passionate, talented and collaborative person who is motivated to drive their career forward within this vital New Zealand organisation. If this sounds like you, apply today using the link below, including a cover letter detailing why you feel you would be suitable for this position.

For further information, please contact Munir Shah, Computational Agri Systems Team on Munir.Shah@agresearch.co.nz .

Applications close: Wednesday 25 May 2022

title: Outreach and STEM Outreach Officer and Manager STEM Engagement  APS and APS 6
description:
The Role
In its 2017 Naval Shipbuilding Plan, the Australian Government made clear that a skilled workforce is critical to the success of the National Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise. As the largest capital investment ever undertaken in Australia, the National Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise represents an entirely new direction in the way Australia underpins its national security interests. We are seeking applications from individuals interest in undertaking challenging, interesting and important work that is front and center for the Australian Government within the Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise.

Are you looking for your next challenge?

Are you interested in building the next generation of S&T to support Naval Shipbuilding in the future?

Can you build strong sustainable partnerships to deliver integrated strategies and solutions?

Join DSTG and help us connect with the next generation to deliver More, together!

We are offering two exciting roles within Defence Science and Technology Group in STEM Outreach and Engagement. In these roles, you will help us build the Defence Science & Technology (S&T) workforce through nurturing the next generation to seek careers in science and technology and supporting the Chief Defence Scientist in the responsibility of building Defence S&T shipbuilding workforce capability .

It is recommended you contact Broderick Matthews at Broderick.Matthews@defence.gov.au for specific information on these roles.


About our Team
The Science Engagement and Impact Division (SEID) is responsible for strategically positioning DSTG to deliver maximum impact for Defence. The division co-ordinates and develops DSTGs external engagements and leads the development of science policy, the formulation of strategic research programs, and the investment of resources into DSTGs science and technology capabilities. The division also develops our highly skilled and collaborative workforce, recognising diversity in partnerships and building a shared culture.

Workforce Capability and Talent (WCT) Branch within SEID is responsible for building Defence capability through the strategic management of the Defence S&T workforce. WCT ensures there is a strong, diverse pipeline to meet the future workforce demand for Defence science and technology through planning workforce capability, partnering to raise the profile of STEM, engaging with talent pools and developing sustainable talent management strategies.

We also lead the implementation of the Brilliant People, Collaborative Culture pillar of the More, Together: Defence Science and Technology Strategy 2030 which focusses on developing a highly skilled and collaborative workforce that recognises diversity in partnerships and builds a shared culture.

Our Ideal Candidate
Our ideal candidates will be great communicators, who act with purpose to help shape innovation, science and technology within Defence and across the eco-system. You will be adept at using and presenting information to inform data driven decisions and enjoy a fast paced, agile environment. You will be a team player who is open to consulting with a range of stakeholders and teams to seek diversity of thought and new ideas. You will be inclusive to deliver progressive, pragmatic solutions for the Defence S&T eco-system.

The ideal candidates for these roles will have a well-developed understanding of the STEM ecosystem across Australia, with a focus on education including the tertiary sector and a proven ability to liaise and collaborate with schools and other relevant institutions and industry bodies.

An ability to collaborate, influence and build a strong rapport with a range of stakeholders to effectively facilitate delivery of cross-organisational programs is key to this role. Strong communication skills, with the ability to strategically communicate to a wide range of audiences using multiple mediums will be required.

You will have strong capabilities in program management, with demonstrated experience in working with a small team to achieve results within defined timeframes. The ability to perform analysis, identifying requirements and determining appropriate courses of action to meet organisational needs.

The ideal candidates will have a qualification, or equivalent experience, in science, technology and/or engineering, science communication, STEM education or equivalent experience with STEM outreach and engagement.

We will be creating a merit pool to fill any similar ongoing and non-ongoing vacancies over the next 12 months.

Application Closing Date: Friday 27 May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, reference DSTG/02757/22

on https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=D7CC8B47-B625-C5A6-E41E-C88D4923DACD .

title: Associate Professor / Professor in Tourism
description:
About the Role

UniSA Business is ranked in the top 1% worldwide by EFMD Global and is one of just 12 institutions in Australia to be EQUIS accredited. Our business program is rated 5 stars for excellence (2022 QS Rankings), and we offer the #4 ranked MBA program in Australia.

As a leading expert in the Tourism discipline, you will design, deliver and coordinate courses for our undergraduate, post graduate and MBA programs, and develop a program of collaborative research that supports the research agenda of the UniSA Business School.

You will make an outstanding contribution to all activities of the Business School and will play a strategic leadership role through the fostering of national and international links with universities, accrediting bodies, and industry. As an eminent authority in the discipline, you will also mentor other academic team members and participate in academic committees, groups and strategy planning forums as appropriate.

About UniSA

The University of South Australia is Australia’s University of Enterprise. Our culture of innovation is anchored around global and national links to academic, research and industry partners. Our graduates are the new urban professionals, global citizens at ease with the world and ready to create and respond to change. Our research is inventive and adventurous and we create new knowledge that is central to global economic and social prosperity.

UniSA Business prepare students for global careers, creating leaders for change whose skills and knowledge shape business, industry and policy. Our research programs are inspired by the contemporary challenges facing Australia and its region, and we share our expertise in modern business practice with partners locally and worldwide.

Core Responsibilities

  • Lead the development of courses and employ innovative and contemporary teaching methods
  • Undertake nationally and internationally recognised research and attract external funding from competitive grant schemes
  • Provide high quality supervision to higher degree by research (HDR) students
  • Initiate, foster and enhance national and international links with other universities, industries and accrediting bodies
  • Mentor other academic team members and contribute to the overall leadership of UniSA Business


Essential Skills and Experience

The level of appointment will depend on qualifications and experience relating to Level D or Level E requirements.

In addition to a doctoral degree, you will demonstrate sustained, high-quality teaching and research experience with discipline expertise in Tourism. You will have experience working collaboratively with industry and/or government organisations to support research and teaching outcomes.

Benefits

Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as:

  • Access to great personal development opportunities
  • Competitive salary negotiated under the Enterprise bargaining agreement
  • Employee assistance and development programs
  • A range of salary packaging options, including vehicle leasing, laptops and car parking fees
  • Various on-site services available at our campuses which may include on-site gym membership


Culture

As a University of Enterprise, we offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our staff are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm. We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results.

How to Apply

For a copy of the position description and to apply, please visit Working at UniSA . The online application form will list the specific selection criteria that you need to address.

Please address your cover letter to Jade Windsor, Senior Consultant: Recruitment Central. For further information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact UniSA Recruitment Central on +61 8 8302 1700 or via email at recruitment@unisa.edu.au using job reference number 4075 .

Applications close: 11.30pm Monday 27 June 2022

title: PhD Scholarship - Parametric VR: Applying and Exploring Virtual Reality Systems
description:
The University of South Australia (UniSA) is Australia’s University of Enterprise. We are South Australia’s largest university and one of the very best young universities in the world. At UniSA, we are authentic, resilient, and influential - and we deliver results. We pride ourselves on our dynamic and agile culture, which embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Plus, we are committed to the principles of excellence and equity.

Our people are critical to our success. They are creative, enterprising and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm.

We educate global professionals ready to create and inspire change, through more than 200 world-class degrees. We deliver outcomes-focused research that is inspired by global challenges and opportunities, to deliver economic and social prosperity.

Our strategic plan, Enterprise25, focusses on our people, programs and precincts, and sets out our path to ensure that we continue to deliver quality teaching, research and student outcomes.

  • 100% of our assessed research rated at or above world-class - 2018 Excellence in Research for Australia (ERA), 4-digit Fields of Research.
  • No. 1 in Australia for industry research income - 2019 THE World University Rankings.
  • No. 1 in Australia for research impact & engagement - 2018 ARC Engagement and Impact Assessment (EI), Combined Impact – Approach to Impact and Engagement on Assessed Fields.
  • Athena Swan Bronze Award.

About the research degree project:

PhD Project - Parametric VR: Applying and Exploring Virtual Reality Systems to Better Support Parametric Design

Inform the impact on architects and industry perceptions regarding adopting VR in Parametric Design

An Australian Research Council (ARC) Discovery Project has been established at the University of South Australia (UniSA) to investigate a new and intuitive set of user interactions for Virtual Reality (VR) to support parametric design in architecture. 'Parametric VR' is a new and exciting research topic that can advance the architecture and construction sector by supporting highly innovative design processes, improved design performances, optimised design interactions, and simplified workflows. These improvements are realised through VR-enabled capabilities: design immersion, virtual prototyping, and cognitive enhancement. As more daily activities are conducted remotely, VR immersive technologies can also effectively support design collaborations. VR can improve interactions in parametric design, which have been critically underdeveloped. Parametric VR will further the developments of both technologies and deepen their impact on the global design industry.

Supported by the Discovery Project team, UniSA Creative is seeking a qualified candidate to conduct a PhD research project to develop and test prototype(s) of Parametric VR, a novel system of VR tools to support parametric design, allowing architects to directly edit parametric design in VR across the project lifecycle. This PhD will specifically focus on design application and adoption of the technological developments including:

  1. Determining appropriate application(s) of VR to the parametric design pipeline and at the true scale of architectural design projects.
  2. Developing/adopting and mapping software tools and VR interactions against the selected parametric processes and tasks.
  3. Testing the effectiveness of Parametric VR prototype(s) and design scenario(s) through user studies with architects.


The project will be hosted at UniSA Creative and the Australian Research Centre for Interactive and Virtual Environments (IVE), in collaboration with UniSA STEM. The successful PhD candidate will be supported by the extended research networks including end-user organisations and international collaborators as enabled by the ARC Discovery Project. The successful candidate will be working amongst a strong cohort of PhD students in IVE, who share similar passion and research interests to create high-impact outputs with strong peer support. During the project, the PhD candidate will be guided to develop research publications in journals and conference for knowledge dissemination and exchange. The successful candidate will also have the opportunity to undertake a placement at the end user organisation to gain end-user/industry experiences and to further validate and disseminate the research.

Supervisory Team

  • Professor Ning Gu - Principal Supervisor
  • Professor Bruce Thomas - Co-Supervisor
  • Dr Andrew Cunningham - Co-Supervisor


Financial Support

This project is funded for reasonable research expenses. Additionally, a living allowance scholarship of $28,854 per annum is available to eligible applicants. A fee-offset or waiver for the standard term of the program is also included. For full terms and benefits of the scholarship please refer to our scholarship information for domestic students or international students.

Eligibility and Selection

This project is open to applications from both domestic and international applicants. Applicants must meet the eligibility criteria for entrance into a PhD. Additionally, applicants must meet the projects selection criteria:

  • Hold a Master of Architecture or an equivalent degree from a related design discipline.
  • Skills and experiences in applying computational design tools in the Architecture, Engineering and Construction (AEC) sectors, especially related to parametric design.
  • Applicants should submit a full research proposal (approximately 2500 words) that has been developed in consultation with the proposed lead supervisor. A template to help guide this application is available here .


Applicants who can also demonstrate the following will be highly regarded:

  • Skills and experiences in developing immersive virtual environments such as VR, Augmented Reality (AR) and other related technologies.
  • Skills and experiences in applying VR, AR and other related technologies in the AEC and other design disciplines.
  • Skills and experiences in computer programming or scripting.


The successful applicant is expected to study full-time and to be based at our City West campus in the heart of Adelaide.

Essential Dates

Applicants are expected to start in a timely fashion upon receipt of an offer. Extended deferral periods are not available. Applications close on Sunday 5 June 2022.

title: Technical Manager, EMR Reporting Services

title: Digital Test Analyst
description:
Data Action (DA) has over 30 years' experience as a specialist software and services provider to the alternate banking and financial services industry. Operating nationally and servicing a broad client base including customer owned banks, credit unions, neobanks and financial services membership organisations, DA's focus of supporting the financial wellbeing of Australians is echoed through our values:

  • No goldfish - Go beyond your bowl, share knowledge, stay curious and keep learning.
  • Fail forward - Learn from mistakes and keep moving forward.
  • Cheer loudly - Be proud of the team's results and celebrate successes.
  • Own it - Throw yourself in and own your work, taking responsibility until the end.
  • Think Client - Put yourself in our Client's shoes - consider the impact for their customers and deliver.

DA has evolved to become a provider of core banking and digital platforms and services to some of Australia's leading customer-owned, challenger banks, aggregators, and the financial services industry, aligned with our purpose - powering innovation in banking.

DA operates nationally with close to 300 staff based in Adelaide, Sydney, and Melbourne - enhancing the banking experience of more than 1.43 million Australians via its core banking and digital platforms, powering customer transactions across 3.2 million accounts every day.

About the Role:

The Testing team provides services including test analysis, test design, test execution and test automation to ensure the delivery of a robust production environment to support the values and objectives of DA and its clients.

In-bedded within our Digital Team, the Digital Test Analyst performs specialised and general testing of DA applications, systems and solutions including timely and accurate reporting on testing status and through positive contributions to the Testing team.

Responsibility extends from system integration testing of components delivered from Development and Infrastructure teams, through to performance testing and other non-functional testing required to assure the quality of DA solutions.

The Digital Test Analyst is responsible for testing allocated change requests and defects and is involved in the software development life cycle from the inception of a change request.

You will be responsible for:

  • Providing feedback on customer requirements and software design specifications
  • Attending estimate and design review meetings with customers, business analysts and developers
  • Developing test documentation in accordance with formal testing methodologies as a result of interpretation of approved requirements and/or design documentation
  • Executing test cases and revising and maintaining regression test case suites - manual and automated
  • Writing Release Notes for internal and external use
  • Writing and executing test cases for defect fixes.

What You'll Need to Succeed:

  • Tertiary qualifications in a related IT field, and/or experience deemed equivalent
  • Minimum of 3 years relevant test experience
  • Knowledge of software testing procedures and methodologies
  • Strong understanding of the process to develop test plans, test cases and other data in line with testing methodologies
  • Knowledge of the banking & finance sector would be highly advantageous, but not essential.

DA offers exciting opportunities for professional development and we have a strong focus on career progression for our employees. Flexible and supportive working arrangements are encouraged.

If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you! Please be sure to combine a covering letter addressing the key criteria set out above as the first page of your resume.

To be considered for this role you will need to be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident, or have a current visa that permits you to work in Australia.

We will never ask you to pay for any services or training as part of applying for a position at DA.

title: DIGITAL SYSTEMS SPECIALIST - NATIONAL SUPPORT OFFICE (MARLESTON)
description:
Looking to join a dynamic team?

As the Digital Systems Specialist at Beaumont Tiles, you will support and administer Digital systems and new technologies across the business.  Reporting to the Head of IT, you will identify emerging digital needs, gather requirements and provide technical advice and solutions expertise in line with the Business Digital Strategy.

Who are you?  You’re a high performing, professional individual who has the ability to work both independently and as part of a supportive team environment. Having professional industry experience, you’re a confident communicator with the ability to remain calm under pressure. You follow plans, focus on outcomes, and are meticulous with deadlines while maintaining a keen eye for detail.

Key responsibilities of the role include:

  • Define and document Digital functional specifications
  • Co-ordinate User Acceptance Testing (UAT), training and development

THE BEAUMONT TILES STORY

Beaumont Tiles is Australia’s biggest retailer of tiles and bathroom ware with over 100 outlets across most states. An innovative market leader, Beaumont Tiles buyers travel the globe to bring back the best in tiles, stone and bathroom ware. Apart from offering the opportunity to work with a recognised national company you'll have the benefit of working alongside other like-minded passionate individuals that work hard to see the company grow! For the right candidate an attractive package can be negotiated.

Enjoy your work with Beaumont Tiles!

No Recruitment Agencies please

title: Cyber Technology Analyst
description:
ABOUT THE CLIENT

Elders has been a leading agribusiness in rural Australia since 1839 with a focus on helping people find success with their agricultural business. With over 180 years of knowledge, experience and advice for its clients, Elders continues to focus on its future as a pure agribusiness both within Australia and internationally.

ABOUT THE ROLE

Reporting directly to the Head of Cyber Security and Enterprise Technology, the Cyber Technology Analyst will be providing their technical expertise and guidance to key internal stakeholders.

Furthermore from a technical perspective, the successful candidate will be responsible for:

  • Providing cyber security operational risk, threat, vulnerability and incident response advice and action plans to optimise the technical response and recovery processes whilst minimising any business impacts
  • Monitoring and assessing project initiatives and BAU operations for areas of cyber risk relating to technology, its implementation, design or operational state
  • Reviewing and cyber incident response planning, providing technical input against current industry trends and standards
  • Governing and reporting on cyber risk relating to IT product lifecycle management, vulnerability risk posture, Vendor operations and cyber capabilities
  • Managing 3rd party vendor cyber risk assessments, assurance and compliance programs

ABOUT YOU

The Cyber Technology Analyst will be expected to contribute to the Elders culture and display the Elders values. To compliment this:

  • Proven expertise and experience in a Security Operations role within a SOC, SIEM & CERT environment including maintenance of cyber security operational services, standards and operational documentation for complex business systems and environments
  • Proven expertise in applying security operations principles, practices, processes and procedures within enterprise operational environments and standards
  • Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline - I.T. (Security), Engineering, Audit or business major
  • Relevant specialist qualification in Cyber or Information Security desirable (CISSP, CISA. CompTIA Security+, CCNA Security, GIAC, or similar MSCE IRAP, SABSA Certified)

If you'd like to know more about this opportunity, please reach out to Liam McBean on 0420 865 288 .

title: Data Entry Administrator

title: Applied Scientist (Planning and Scheduling)
description:
About the Role:

As a Consunet Applied Scientist you will perform a vital role using your understanding of wireless communications to support the design and implementation of our next-generation disruptive radio access management system. The role will consist of researching innovative ideas and algorithms, supporting the development, and demonstration of near real-time autonomous electromagnetic spectrum management solutions. You will be working within an agile environment with a team of professionals including scientists, mathematicians and software developers to support the research goals of our Cyber and Electronic Warfare technology company. The applied research part of the project is in the applications of advanced computational techniques (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning) as well as Distributed Systems to develop novel protocols or adapt existing academic research in Complex Systems towards wireless transmission scheduling and path planning.

To be considered for this role, you must be an Australian citizen.

Essential Knowledge and Skills:

  • Experience in algorithm development and modelling using Python or Java or similar languages with good exposure to principles of object-oriented programming.
  • Understanding of wireless systems design and optimisation for diverse applications.
  • Experience in Artificial Intelligence – Planning and Scheduling techniques.
  • Experience in mathematics, especially optimisation, and complex algorithm development and the ability to apply resulting concepts to solving problems in radio access networks.
  • Provide vital systems engineering support to our in-house software development team in the form of implementation guidance.
  • You are an adaptable individual who can communicate fluently, both orally and in writing, and are comfortable with presenting complex information to both technical and non-technical audiences such as internal and external stakeholders.
  • Post graduate qualifications within Computer Science/EEE are preferred, however established equivalent expertise will be considered

Desirable Knowledge and Skills:

  • Background Communications systems theory and wireless systems
  • Understanding of distributed and complex systems
  • Government/Defence Industry experience
  • Recommending and designing technical solutions
  • Writing and maintaining technical documentation
  • Good understanding of current cellular or wi-fi communications standards
  • Experience working in teams applying Agile software engineering best practices
  • Background in Artificial Intelligence, in particular intelligent agent-based modelling

To be considered, candidates will have:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Successful candidates must be eligible to hold and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance. Eligibility requirements can be found at http://www.defence.gov.au/agsva.

Benefits working for Consunet:

  • A workplace that believes in innovation, quality, and a work-life balance.
  • Flexible, inclusive and friendly work environment.
  • Competitive remuneration.
  • Salary packaging options.
  • Career and skills progression through training and development to team members.
  • Access to cutting-edge technology, research, and agile project management practices.
  • Mentoring and support from our experienced team members.

About the Company:

Consunet is headquartered in the Adelaide CBD with operations in Adelaide, Edinburgh (SA) and Canberra. A level of flexibility is generally offered with respect to work location. If you have specific requirements, please discuss them during your interview.

Our people create world-leading trusted cyber and spectrum security technology solutions that safeguard our customers' interests. As a 100% Australian-owned and operated corporation, Consunet strives to be the country's leading sovereign cyber and spectrum security solution developer, and trusted industry partner to the Australian Defence and cyber security communities. The company has a strong research and development and collaboration emphasis, implements Agile development and management processes, and has a proven track record of delivering and sustaining in-service operational capabilities for Defence and commercial customers. Our vision “to build the Australian cyber and spectrum security future” is firmly rooted in everything we do.

To Apply:

Click “Apply Now”. Please attach a cover letter summarising your experience when applying.

title: Spatial Consultant
description:
Just imagine your future with us…

Aurecon is committed to creating an inclusive culture that embraces diversity, equity and inclusion - and we provide our people with flexible working opportunities.

We believe diverse teams enable us to solve our clients' and society's most complex problems in unconventional and distinctive ways. We offer flexible working as it enables all of our employees to balance work and life in way that works for them.

Aurecon is an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality, as awarded by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (Australia), and are a founding member of The Diversity Agenda in New Zealand. We also have a Reconciliation Action Plan and hold Silver Employer status in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTI+ inclusion. Across our company, inclusive leadership is role modelled from the top and is an expectation of all.

Our flexible way of working includes our flexible start and finish times, working from home, part time and job share options. Aurecon also offers 14 weeks paid parental leave, three weeks paid partner leave, and other health services and benefits.

If this is how you would like to work you'd be a good fit, we'd love to hear from you. We welcome people of all identities from all background and with diverse accessibility needs. We're curious about your career path and how we can support you to be your best.

The Role

We have a fantastic role for a capable and motivated Geospatial Consultant that is keen to develop themselves and grow in our business. This position would support our projects primarily in Victoria and South Australia and play a critical role in delivering initiatives across our markets nationally. Utilising your valuable skills and experience you will have the opportunity to be part of a passionate team of professionals as you join a large-scale organisation that has some exciting plans ahead.

What we are looking for

Firstly, you will share our genuine passion for re-imaging engineering and be someone that actively pursues continuous learning to help shape the future. You will ideally be a forward-thinking Geospatial consultant, with strong foundational skills, including:

  • Proven years of Experience in GIS or a related field
  • Excellent understanding and working knowledge of the ESRI suite of core products, including: Esri ArcGIS Desktop/ArcPro and the analytic extensions
  • Excellent python and scripting skills especially in relation to automation is highly desirable
  • ArcGIS Enterprise, ArcGIS Online, Collector and Survey123 experience would be highly advantageous
  • A bachelor's degree in associated business disciplines (Spatial Science, GIS or related field).
  • FME experience preferred but not essential

We value the difference each team member brings and we look for people who have had a broad range of experiences and a growth and learning mindset.

About us

We've re-imagined engineering.

Aurecon is an international engineering, design and advisory company, but not as you know it!

Drawing on our deep pool of expertise, we co-create innovative solutions with our clients to some of the world's most complex challenges.

We listen deeply and intently, which helps us see opportunities, possibilities and potential others can't. Think engineering. Think again.

Want to know more?

You can learn more about what it's like to work at Aurecon by visiting the careers section of our website.

If you are intrigued or excited by what you have read, then we want to hear from you. Apply now!

title: Sales Estimator, flex location SA
description:
Job Description

BlueScope is an Australian-born, global success story, spanning 18 countries, with a team of over 14,000 people. We’re driven by innovation and are proud that the technologies in our products and brands, like COLORBOND® steel, inspire and protect everything from hospitals and bridges to stadiums and homes.

The Opportunity

Come and discover the opportunity to join our Customer Service team in our BlueScope Building Components business as an Sales Estimator . BlueScope Building Components, a division of BlueScope in Australia, manufactures and markets steel building products, solutions and services through its four leading brands: Lysaght, Fielders, Ranbuild and Kiteleys.

In this role you will be working closely with our internal sales and customer service teams to provide estimating expertise so that our customers can build and create great structures to maximize their homes potential. Focusing on estimating for a range of our products that include patios, pergolas and verandahs.

We have a office locations at Gillman, Mile End, Gawler, Marion and Noarlunga - you'll be offered the flexibility to work across these sites, to best fit in with your lifestyle.

What Will You Do?

Working with our friendly and diverse team, you will:

  • maintain and enhance relationships with internal and external customers
  • share your technical knowledge and skills, complete design structures in our software by interpreting and clarifying the customer’s concept
  • interact with customers through phone and email
  • provide guidance on the design concept and complete take-off’s
  • develop estimates and quotes in line with business pricing policy
  • monitor customer trends and seek ways to improve the customer’s experience
  • adopt a continuous improvement approach to processes and systems and actively suggest improved ways or working

More About You

With your experience in estimating and drafting or perhaps you have a building or trades background, you will be a quick learner who’s comfortable with numbers and technical drawings and computer based applications.  You will bring:

  • a commitment to a strong positive team culture - proactive approach to your work and ability to work autonomously
  • excellent customer service skills, working with supervisors, suppliers, trades people and contractors, maintaining and improving at all times
  • experience in estimating with high level of attention to detail
  • good process management and organizational skills
  • excellent skills in Microsoft Office

Why BlueScope

As BlueScope continues to go from strength to strength, a career with us provides you with the opportunity to grow and be rewarded. At BlueScope, you will:

  • create and deliver innovative solutions that drive transformation in our business
  • make an impact that really does shape the world we live in
  • keep growing through continuous learning and development opportunities
  • enjoy the sense of belonging that comes from working with people who genuinely look out for one another

At BlueScope, our people are our strength, and we don’t say that lightly. We want our people to be successful, and to be safe. We offer work-life flexibility through our B-flex program and make sure our inclusive work environment welcomes people of all backgrounds. We’re passionate about driving sustainability outcomes that matter to our communities, including action on climate and our 2050 net zero goal. And we’ll do this through Our Purpose: We create and inspire smart solutions in steel, strengthening our communities for the future.

Come and discover us at bluescope.com/life-at-bluescope/careers.

Together we can make a world of difference.

Applications close Friday 27th of May 2022.

title: Outreach and STEM Outreach Officer and Manager STEM Engagement  APS and APS 6
description:
The Role
In its 2017 Naval Shipbuilding Plan, the Australian Government made clear that a skilled workforce is critical to the success of the National Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise. As the largest capital investment ever undertaken in Australia, the National Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise represents an entirely new direction in the way Australia underpins its national security interests. We are seeking applications from individuals interest in undertaking challenging, interesting and important work that is front and center for the Australian Government within the Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise.

Are you looking for your next challenge?

Are you interested in building the next generation of S&T to support Naval Shipbuilding in the future?

Can you build strong sustainable partnerships to deliver integrated strategies and solutions?

Join DSTG and help us connect with the next generation to deliver More, together!

We are offering two exciting roles within Defence Science and Technology Group in STEM Outreach and Engagement. In these roles, you will help us build the Defence Science & Technology (S&T) workforce through nurturing the next generation to seek careers in science and technology and supporting the Chief Defence Scientist in the responsibility of building Defence S&T shipbuilding workforce capability .

It is recommended you contact Broderick Matthews at Broderick.Matthews@defence.gov.au for specific information on these roles.


About our Team
The Science Engagement and Impact Division (SEID) is responsible for strategically positioning DSTG to deliver maximum impact for Defence. The division co-ordinates and develops DSTGs external engagements and leads the development of science policy, the formulation of strategic research programs, and the investment of resources into DSTGs science and technology capabilities. The division also develops our highly skilled and collaborative workforce, recognising diversity in partnerships and building a shared culture.

Workforce Capability and Talent (WCT) Branch within SEID is responsible for building Defence capability through the strategic management of the Defence S&T workforce. WCT ensures there is a strong, diverse pipeline to meet the future workforce demand for Defence science and technology through planning workforce capability, partnering to raise the profile of STEM, engaging with talent pools and developing sustainable talent management strategies.

We also lead the implementation of the Brilliant People, Collaborative Culture pillar of the More, Together: Defence Science and Technology Strategy 2030 which focusses on developing a highly skilled and collaborative workforce that recognises diversity in partnerships and builds a shared culture.

Our Ideal Candidate
Our ideal candidates will be great communicators, who act with purpose to help shape innovation, science and technology within Defence and across the eco-system. You will be adept at using and presenting information to inform data driven decisions and enjoy a fast paced, agile environment. You will be a team player who is open to consulting with a range of stakeholders and teams to seek diversity of thought and new ideas. You will be inclusive to deliver progressive, pragmatic solutions for the Defence S&T eco-system.

The ideal candidates for these roles will have a well-developed understanding of the STEM ecosystem across Australia, with a focus on education including the tertiary sector and a proven ability to liaise and collaborate with schools and other relevant institutions and industry bodies.

An ability to collaborate, influence and build a strong rapport with a range of stakeholders to effectively facilitate delivery of cross-organisational programs is key to this role. Strong communication skills, with the ability to strategically communicate to a wide range of audiences using multiple mediums will be required.

You will have strong capabilities in program management, with demonstrated experience in working with a small team to achieve results within defined timeframes. The ability to perform analysis, identifying requirements and determining appropriate courses of action to meet organisational needs.

The ideal candidates will have a qualification, or equivalent experience, in science, technology and/or engineering, science communication, STEM education or equivalent experience with STEM outreach and engagement.

We will be creating a merit pool to fill any similar ongoing and non-ongoing vacancies over the next 12 months.

Application Closing Date: Friday 27 May 2022

on https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=D7CC8B47-B625-C5A6-E41E-C88D4923DACD .

title: IT Resilience Specialist x 2
company: Talent – SEEK Recruitment Agency of the Year | 7 Time Winner
description:
Our client is seeking for a couple of IT Resilience Specialists able to join the team in a permanent capacity.


Essential criteria required for these roles:

Candidates with full working rights based, based in Adelaide or ready to relocate will be considered

  • Knowledge and understanding of current IT Service Continuity/DR planning techniques and technologies, as well as the methods used to perform risk and business impact analysis.
  • Sound working knowledge and understanding of high availability and recovery technologies and architecture
  • Understanding of and experience in applying ISO/IEC 27031:2011, ISO 22301:2019 and/or other BCP/DR standards and practices.
  • Accreditation in either IT Service Continuity/BCP or Risk Management - desirable/an advantage
  • Working knowledge of Cloud, IT infrastructure, network, compute, storage and security technologies to guide the preparation of related recovery procedures.

title: Director - Pricing Implementation Section
description:
Director - Pricing Implementation Section

This position leads a team responsible for the delivery of all components of the national pricing models used for hospital and aged care funding. This includes but is not limited to:

  • Leading and managing the Pricing Implementation section;
  • Managing the annual cycle of work to determine the draft and final National Efficient Price (NEP) and National Efficient Cost (NEC) for public hospitals, including pricing and shadow pricing for all applicable hospital streams of care and pricing for safety and quality.
  • Managing the cycle of work to deliver advice on the pricing of aged care services and protheses.
  • Providing project management and oversight of the national costing models for activity based funding and block funding;
  • Coordinating preparation of position and briefing papers around the calculation and results of national pricing models, including coordinating and providing expert advice to stakeholders in relation to funding models for hospitals, aged care services and prostheses;
  • Representing IHPA on a range of national committees, working groups and conferences and liaising with all nine Australian governments and a range of national stakeholders regarding pricing determinations and pricing advice; and
  • Supporting the Executive in explaining the models underpinning the NEP and NEC to external bodies.

For further information and to submit an application please refer to Department of Health

Please note, this position is based in Sydney, NSW.

Applications close Monday, 30 May 2022 11:30pm AEST.
