title: Manager, Information and Digital
description:
• Leadership opportunity at an organisation that truly makes a difference
  • Drive capital investment projects to achieve strategic organisational goals
  • Full-time role with salary sacrificing benefits based in Adelaide CBD

About the Company

Relationships Australia SA (RASA) has over 60 years’ experience in providing services that respond to the needs of South Australians. RASA are a not-for-profit, charitable organisation, with a purpose to provide services which assist people who are vulnerable and disadvantaged.

Role Overview

Reporting to the Executive General Manager, Information and Data Management, the Manager Information and Digital will work on the implementation, optimisation, and support of RASA’s business information systems. As the Manger, Information and Digital, you will lead small, dedicated teams in ensuring that RASA is maximising the efficiencies and capitalising on the full features and benefits of its core applications and service support. You will also lead in capital investment projects and assisting in provision of solutions that help achieve RASA’s goals.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead and manage end to end upgrades, including planning, testing, implementation, debugging, and resolution of issues.
  • Maintain the organisations core applications ensuring quality and complete functionality.
  • Act as the subject matter expert in the organisations core applications and systems to executive leadership.
  • Act as the bridge between non-technical and technical stakeholders, including the gathering of project requirements.
  • Completing regulatory and governance requirements.
  • Identify, recommend, and procure software to achieve strategic business goals.
  • Work closely with the service desk and applications teams to ensure alignment of operational readiness.

Skills, Knowledge and Experience

In order to successfully perform the role of Manager, Information and Digital the following skills and experience is required:

  • Relevant tertiary qualification in Information Technology, IIBA or equivalent experience in the field.
  • Proven leadership experience, including that of teams
  • Highly skilled in Information Technology implementation projects
  • Demonstrated project management experience, including panning, requirement gathering, implementation and maintenance
  • Pragmatic experience in documentation including Data mapping, process modeling and user-stories
  • Significant business analysis experience will be highly regarded
  • Experience with Finance, HR & Payroll or CRM systems is highly desirable
  • Ability to respond to request for proposals

You will be required to undertake satisfactory DCSI check for working with children and National Criminal History Check for this role.

If you are a skilled leader who wants to make a difference through working for a reputable not-for-profit, then this is the role for you. Apply today!

For more information, please contact Laura Maio Harrison McMillan on (08) 7071 7273 .

title: Statistical Programming Team Manager
description:
Lead an expanding, highly technical, and experienced team. We have fantastic office locations in Adelaide, Melbourne, and Sydney, or be home based anywhere in Australia!

Core Responsibilities

  • Ensure a high level of client service is delivered and maintained in terms of product and timelines, whilst also delivering projects within budget.
  • Provide a strong, cohesive link between the Statistical Programming (i.e. SAS programming and CDISC programming) Team and Biometrics (i.e. Statistics and Pharmacokinetics) and Data Teams and the Head Biostatistics ensuring clear and defined communication pathways are established.
  • Report regularly to the Head Biostatistics in respect to Statistical Programming (i.e. SAS programming and CDISC programming) group operations, resourcing, system issues, project performance, and potential project slippages.
  • Provide considered justification statements to the Head Biostatistics relative to resource expenditure.
  • Monitor projects against milestones and budget.
  • Provide leadership in issue resolution with external parties, i.e. clients and external auditors.
  • Identification and remediation of issues arising that may affect the planned completion of client projects including provision of support, guidance, and assistance (when necessary) to Statistical Programming staff to meet project milestones.
  • Facilitate communication between all project stakeholders and ensure that regular updates are provided in accordance with each study plan.
  • Participate in client meetings and Audits as required.


Departmental Responsibilities

  • In consultation with stakeholders, initiate the development of systems (project management, work flow and resource tracking) to track project progress and process improvement.
  • Ensure there is ongoing quality review within the departments as required, including internal reviews of documents and forms to ensure they are appropriate for use.
  • Schedule and conduct regular Statistical Programming Team meetings and ensure appropriate distribution of minutes.
  • Ensure appropriate allocation of team resources to client programs to ensure timely delivery of activities, monitor individual workloads and ensure staff keep task lists current.
  • Manage recruitment, training, human resource and performance management for the Statistical Programming Team.
  • Quarterly review of staff training files to ensure compliance with Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and to maintain staff development.
  • Monitor adherence to guidelines and policies.

Qualifications, Skills and Experience

  • Ordinary degree in the appropriate discipline or appropriate industry experience.
  • Minimum 5 – 7 years’ experience in the pharmaceutical industry / Clinical Research Organisation (CRO) working in a GCP environment.
  • Minimum of 7 years statistical programming experience.
  • Demonstrated leadership and mentoring skills.
  • Ability to communicate at a high level with clients, senior management and other stakeholders.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to prepare reports and SOPs.
  • Intermediate to advanced MS Office Suite.
  • Excellent time management and organisational skills with the drive to be outcome focussed.
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritise work and handle deadline pressure in a multi-disciplinary team environment.
  • Knowledge of ICH GCP Guidelines, medical terminology and clinical trials processes (highly desirable) .
  • Commercial links with pharmaceutical and biotechnology industry (highly desirable).

title: Senior SEO Specialist
description:
We are an iconic South Australian brand, operating for over 25 years, an industry leader in residential plumbing, electrical, air con and roofing across all of Australia.

Our marketing team aim to be the leaders of digital marketing within the utilities industry and drive company growth. We collaborate and share ideas to ensure we are growing as a company and providing solutions to business objectives.

We strive to have the best talent in the industry, as we are an expanding company in South Australia. We are looking for an enthusiastic, dedicated Senior SEO Specialist to join our beautifully refurbished national head office, located on North Terrace in the heart of Adelaide.

Renowned for exceptional customer service and creating a memorable experiences for our customers.

The applicant will have a professional presence, being able to uphold and contribute to the ethos of Metropolitan Gas & Plumbing, able to exercise initiative, discretion and confidentiality. You will be able to prioritise tasks and time manage effectively in a fast paced office environment.

Reporting directly to the SEO/Website Manager, you will have the opportunity to take ownership of our SEO strategy across multiple brands while working directly with content writers, digital advertising managers, web/graphic designers and developers.

Plumbing is one of Australia’s most competitive SEO markets. The right candidate will possess the skills to help drive growth both locally and nationally.

As a marketing team, we collaborate and share ideas ensuring we grow together and provide solutions to business objectives.

We own multiple brands. These brands are within our vertical, but we also have brands within horizontal markets. This means that you will be working on many different websites and projects simultaneously within different industries.

You will be required to undertake a variety of tasks including and not limited to:

Tasks & Responsibilities:

  • Growing our digital presence and increasing leads through SEO strategies
  • Backlink acquisition
  • Strategic problem solving - you’ll need to identify bottlenecks, troubleshoot and execute solutions that drive organic search ability and conversions
  • Performing keyword research, on-page SEO and internal link building
  • Writing content briefs for our in-house content team
  • Monitoring Google Analytics, Search Console and Ahrefs Site Explorer reports and communicating any issues to the SEO/Website Manager
  • Providing a weekly breakdown of all brands’ SEO performance
  • Using web analytics (Universal Analytics, GA4 and Matomo)

Qualifications & Experience:

  • A minimum of 3-5 years’ experience in a similar role
  • Demonstrated experience across Google products: Google Analytics, Google Keyword Planner, Search Console, Google Trends, and other key Google Tools
  • Proven performance in link acquisition strategies
  • Excellent working knowledge of WordPress
  • Excellent knowledge of SEO tools such as Semrush, Ahrefs, Majestic, Screaming Frog, Surfer SEO, etc.
  • Proven performance in SEO and Local SEO with knowledge of the key differences
  • Understanding the importance of SEO, the role it plays and how it impacts other departments in a high performing digital marketing team
  • Keen attention to detail and pride in work
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
  • Be contactable and able to work outside of business hours when necessary

Not essential, but highly desirable:

  • Plumbing, air conditioning, electrical and roofing knowledge
  • Google Analytics/Google Ads certifications
  • Google Analytics/Google Ads certifications
  • Intermediate Excel/Google Sheets knowledge
  • Experience with Google Business Profile Manager
  • Experience with digital advertising like Google Ads and Facebook Ads

An equal opportunity employer whom encourage and support their teams to grow and develop. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you’re capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

If you would enjoy working with a collaborative marketing team, please apply today.

title: Senior Information Officer
description:
Your new company
South Australia Police (SAPOL) provides a diverse range of services to the community. These services are aimed at producing a safe and peaceful environment by the minimisation of crime and disorder. It is a large complex organisation which, because of the nature of its operations, is constantly subject to public scrutiny and accountability. It provides services to a range of different locations (over 100) spread across the State on a 24 hour a day basis. SAPOL’s vision is to provide a visible, responsive police service for all South Australians. All SAPOL employees are guided by Our Values of Service, Integrity, Courage, Leadership, Collaboration and Respect. SAPOL is an organisation with a proud history and an exciting vision for the future.

Your new role
The Senior Information Officer is accountable to the Manager, Data Management Unit within the Information Services Branch, for the development, implementation and coordination of approved programs and projects as required within SAPOL that promote and maintain the accuracy, reliability, integrity and consistency of SAPOL data assets at both the local and national level. Your role will include the development and maintenance of tools to support the management of data incorporating best practice guidelines and standards for data capture, integration and conversion mapping. You will be involved in the analysis of data to resolve issues, create and undertake impact assessments and user acceptance testing to support Australian Criminal Intelligence Commission (ACIC) and SAPOL initiatives. The position also involves liaison with internal and external stakeholders at a Managerial level.

What you will need to succeed

  • Excellent communication both written and verbal to convey information across all levels of staff both internally and externally.
  • Demonstrated ability to critically examine and analyse complex and diverse work practices, information capture flow systems.
  • Proven experience developing practical and innovative solutions.
  • Experience in the development, implementation and management of agency wide policies, procedures and standards.
  • Knowledge of data management tools and best practice standards within the information management environment related to legislation and government policies.

Special Conditions

  • Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory Criminal History Check and compliant Immunisation screening.
  • Incumbent may be assigned to other duties at this remuneration level or equivalent.
  • Some out of hours work and intra/interstate travel may be required.

Salary
ASO6 - $94,176 - $99,615 per annum.

What you need to do now
If you have the necessary experience as a Senior Information Officer then please apply via the link below with your CV, cover letter and response to the selection criteria or contact Sarah Ormandy at SAPOLapplications@hays.com.au .

Application Instructions:
Please click on ‘Apply’ which will direct you to iworkforSA and further information will be provided on how to apply.

Applications Close: 2/6/2022 5:00 PM

title: APS Level 6, Executive Level 1, Executive Level 2 - ICT Enterprise Architect
description:
Your Role

Defence Chief Information Officer Group ICT Architecture Branch is looking to hire multiple positions with in the bands APS 6, EL1, and EL2 across multiple areas within the branch:

  • Cyber and ICT Security;
  • SAP;
  • Cloud and Infrastructure; and
  • Standards and Architecture Practice.

Defence is seeking strongly motivated individuals with drive, integrity and a passion to support Defence, including the ADF, in delivering its national security objectives. As an architect in the Chief Information Officer group (CIOG) you will have the opportunity to work with major Defence capability projects.  The projects range across capability streams such as Land Combat and Amphibious Warfare, Maritime and Anti-Submarine Warfare, Strike and Air Combat or even Intelligence, Surveillance, Reconnaissance, Electronic Warfare, Space and Cyber.  ICT Architecture responsibilities include:

  • Establishing and maintaining effective Defence Enterprise Architecture;
  • Establishing and maintaining architectures and roadmaps in line with Defence ICT and Information Management Strategies;
  • Translating Whole-of-Government, Defence and ICT Strategic guidance into unambiguous architectural direction and guidance;
  • Establishing, reviewing and maintaining architectural principles, guidelines, standards and patterns;
  • Ensuring enterprise-wide compliance with architecture standards and fit-for-purpose ICT solutions in fixed, mobile and deployed environments Business modelling, business process analysis / design and management of whole-of-Defence activities; and
  • Manage preferred tools, set standards, and defined architecture practice services in Defence;

To be effective in these roles you will think strategically and work interdependently with other Defence functions, and be a strong team player to achieve effective outcomes. This will require highly developed communication and relationship management skills.

Our Ideal Candidate

As an ICT Enterprise Architect you will work under broad direction to undertake complex research, analysis and design activities associated with the Defence enterprise.  As the ideal candidate, you will:

  • Work within a framework of legislation, established principles, work practices and procedures in accordance with Defence’s mission and business objectives.
  • Have experience and comprehensive knowledge of research, analysis and design and are responsible for the development, implementation, compliance and review of products and policies within the enterprise architecture field.
  • Build holistic views of Defences strategy, processes, information, and assets and apply this knowledge and ensure that Defence and ICT are aligned.
  • Strategically assess Defences current capabilities, translate business strategy and objectives into an operating model and work towards identifying required changes in capabilities and emerging technologies relevant to Defence's business outcomes.
  • Build Relationships and engage with stakeholders, manage expectations and concerns to develop a shared understanding of the business benefits and risks to achieve outcomes.
  • Be accountable to contribute towards ongoing self-improvement and professional development.
  • Take the initiative for achieving outcomes, progressing work, reviewing performance and focusing on identifying opportunities for continuous improvement
  • Work with independence, under broad direction, and set work tasks that align with the strategic objectives and communicate expected outcomes. You may be required to plan, lead and manage a team and exercise the associated people and financial responsibilities to achieve business outcomes.

Our Organisation

Defence’s primary mission is to protect Australia and its national interests, promote security and stability in the world, and support the Australian community as directed by the Government.

Defence Australian Public Service (APS) employees are engaged in an array of occupations, across Australia and around the world, enabling our three services: Navy, Army and Air Force, to fulfil key defensive roles as well as providing a range of peacetime services.

In Defence, you will enjoy experiences and opportunities that, as an APS employee, you simply would not get in any other organisation. You are able to undertake interesting, challenging and unique work. This ranges from intelligence and strategic policy right through to human resources, communications, infrastructure and engineering, and information technology.

Defence is committed to recruiting the right people, in the right jobs, at the right time - whether it is creating, acquiring or delivering Defence capability. Our greatest asset is our people.

A more diverse workforce supported by an inclusive culture enhances Defence’s capability and effectiveness, as it draws on different ideas to innovate and adapt to a rapidly evolving strategic environment and the changing nature of warfare. Building ‘Capability through Inclusion’ is one Defence’s six cultural reform priorities under Pathway to Change: Evolving Defence Culture 2017 – 2022 .

Our Values and Behaviours reflect the traditions and identities of the Australian Defence Force (ADF) and the APS. The values underpin Defence’s corporate culture and contribute to achieving organisational goals.

Defence accommodates requests for reasonable adjustment for people with disability to assist in the application process and if successful, the inherent requirements of the position. Please inform the contact person listed on the front of this Information Pack should you require adjustments to be put in place. The RecruitAbility process applies to this role.

Defence's commitment to Indigenous Reconciliation, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities, and the whole-of-Government Closing the Gap strategy is outlined in Defence’s Reconciliation Action Plan 2019-2022 .

Defence provides relocation assistance to eligible APS employees required to relocate. The level of assistance will vary depending on the reason for relocating and your personal circumstances. For more information, please download the APS Relocation Assistance Handbook .

Our Group

Working in the Chief Information Officer Group (CIOG), you will be contributing your expertise to some of the most technically demanding and complex ICT transformation projects being undertaken in Australia. CIOG is transforming Defence’s ICT capabilities. We build and maintain critical infrastructure and systems, such as classified and secure military systems. We manage one of the largest ICT networks in Australia and provide a modern, secure, sustainable and scalable information environment to enable current and future military and business operations.

Our vision is a CIOG where everyone understands how we can use technology to enable war fighting as well as our day-to-day business. We apply new ways of thinking and working that allow us to take advantage of faster, better and more efficient ways of delivering ICT Services. Supporting Defence in this technology dominated era requires a different, more responsive and agile approach to everything, from our strategy, through to our processes, policies and people.

We are diverse, agile and strive for a positive workforce culture where people feel valued and where we take pride in our work. We foster a work environment where individual differences are valued and utilised. We leverage the unique knowledge and experience of our people to enhance our capability. Everyone has something to contribute.

CIOG offers the opportunity to work in the largest and most complex ICT environment in Australia with a competitive salary, flexible work hours and work-life balance, generous leave (with the ability to purchase more), and 15.4% superannuation, paid paternity/maternity leave, retirement planning, and wellness programs. We invest in your career development through funding your professionalisation and training programs and offer a variety of opportunities nationally.

Our Team

ICT Architecture Branch is responsible for ensuring that Defence has a modern, secure and scalable enterprise Information and Communications Technology (ICT) architecture to support Defence business and military operations. It is transforming Defence's ICT architecture for the future ICTAB is comprised of five directorates;

  • Directorate of Defence Capability Architecture;
  • Directorate of Information, Integration, Applications and Engagement;
  • Directorate of Platform Architecture;
  • Directorate of Infrastructure and Cloud Architecture;
  • Directorate of SAP Architecture;
  • Directorate of Security Architecture; and
  • Directorate of Standards and Architecture Practice.

Each will be a slightly different focus and stakeholder group but all with the same mission in mind – to enable Defence to meet its outcomes using modern, secure and scalable enterprise Information and Communications Technology (ICT) . There are multiple positions available within the various directorates of ICTAB.

Desirable Qualifications, Experience or Training

The following prior knowledge, relevant experience or training will be considered highly desirable:

  • A relevant qualification from an Australian University or TAFE institution (or overseas qualification) would be highly regarded.
  • Technical background/experience preferred in Cloud and Infrastructure, Cyber, Security, SAP, and Architecture Standards.
  • Knowledge of architectural frameworks and methodologies such as TOGAF and DODAF2.
  • Excellent communication skills and stakeholder relationships.

How To Apply

Apply for this role by submitting your application through our online recruitment system (eRecruit) located at Defence APS Careers. If you have any questions regarding this role, email the contact officer.

For more information please refer to the Applicant User Guide . Further advice on addressing selection criteria can be found in ‘Cracking the Code’ publication located on the Australian Public Service Commission website.

Vacancies will be extended in exceptional circumstances only. Applicants requesting an extension must contact the Contact Officer 24 hours prior to the vacancy closing date.

In your application you should provide a copy of your current Resume/CV and address the following:

Assessment Criteria

An explanation of how your skills, knowledge and experience will be relevant to this role (limit your total response to 1000 words).

PLEASE NOTE: Defence APS Careers is for job seekers only. We do not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies and/or search firms and will not pay fees to any such organisations unless arranged with the provider prior to advertising the vacancy.

Eligibility

Employment with the Department of Defence is subject to conditions prescribed within the Public Service Act 1999.

Citizenship – To be eligible for employment with Defence, applicants must be an Australian citizen. Only in exceptional circumstances can this requirement be waived.

Health Assessment - As a condition of engagement, a mandatory pre-employment health assessment may be required where there are physical or medical requirements for the role. Your contact officer can provide further guidance on whether this is required for your role.

Security Clearance – The Australian community requires the highest level of integrity from Defence employees. The preferred applicant will be required to successfully undergo the security clearance vetting process at a specified clearance level.

Further information can be provided in the Australian Government Security Clearance Applicant Guide Book. Please ensure that you read this information thoroughly and confirm that you meet the minimum requirements to be eligible to hold a security clearance at the required level.

Please ensure that you are able to provide the necessary documents if you apply for the position. The security clearance level required for this position can be found on the front page of this Information Pack.

More information on the security clearance vetting process is available on the AGSVA website .

Thank you for your interest

Department of Defence

title: .NET Analyst / Programmers
description:
• Experience support enterprise level .Net solutions
  • Developing and supporting critical .Net business systems
  • Permanent role, Darwin based

Darwin – Northern Territory

Dialog, with over 1,200 people , is the largest Australian subsidiary of 10,000 strong Singapore based NCS, the IT Services arm of Singtel, a worldwide technology and telecommunications business.

Conducting its IT Services business Australia wide, Dialog ’s key focus is on delivering outstanding results to its many corporate and government clients using leading tools, technologies and methodologies.

As an integral team member of this highly dynamic organisation you will benefit from accelerated career development through diverse projects, training and mentoring in a collaborative atmosphere.

Dialog enjoys long-term relationships with Australia’s Peak Government and Corporate organisations. As a Dialog consultant engaging with these clients, you will:

  • Work with key stakeholders to achieve world’s best practice processes in major projects
  • Work on a wide variety of interesting and challenging assignments
  • Work with colleagues in partnership with clients who are committed to achieving their business objectives
  • Enjoy salary above industry standard in a working environment in which effort, creativity and a positive attitude are highly valued
  • Have extensive training opportunities through the Dialog Academy, which offers a wide range of ICT and Business skills courses
  • Work with likeminded colleagues who share information and focus on the goal, driving the project and their careers further and faster

Dialog requires Darwin based .Net Analyst / Programmers to support and develop critical business systems for clients in the Northern Territory. You will be interacting directly with Clients and Systems Owners and will be given a high level of responsibility for the delivery of this service. Dialog seeks people who have these capabilities:

  • Several years’ experience supporting and developing .Net C# 4.0+ systems in an enterprise environment.
  • Experience liaising directly with Clients and System Owners to understand requirements and manage delivery expectations.
  • Sound MS SQL Server administration skills
  • Excellent problem solving skills and the ability to work cooperatively in a team environment to investigate and solve complex technical problems.

Established in 1979, Dialog employs over 1,200 people throughout Australia, and provides a wide range of information technology solutions to government and corporate clients.

At Dialog , our whole approach is based on four key values: Involved, Committed, Can Do, Always .

It's these values, applied to every project, which stand behind our success and ensure we are always client focused. These same four values underpin the relationship we enjoy with our people.

Join our team of professional, enthusiastic and experienced consultants, where communication, learning and knowledge sharing are prized. We offer an excellent benefits package and industry standard market rate salaries.

Dialog is an equal opportunity employer.

Applicants should be Australian or NZ citizens or Australian permanent residents . If you are not an Australian or New Zealand citizen you will need to provide your passport and visa for our review.

Visit our website www.dialog.com.au for more information.

title: Senior Ocean Specialist
description:
Australia is regularly affected by severe weather events. These events are growing in frequency and severity, leading to increased impacts on the economy, infrastructure, property, and wellbeing.


To address this, the Bureau of Meteorology is undertaking significant steps to deliver a more customer focussed, integrated and resilient national operation. This is an exciting direction for the Bureau which will change the way we deliver services to Australian communities.


The future operating model for the Bureau will create new career pathways to enhance our culture, to empower our people to learn and grow. As part of this transformation, we are introducing new roles that will assist the Bureau in delivering world class weather products and services within the newly formed Community Services Group (CSG).


This group is comprised of Environmental Prediction Services (EPS), Decision Support Services (DSS) and National Production Services (NPS) which have been configured to enable scalable, national and resilient services. The EPS Program will establish a world class centre of scientific expertise. To achieve this, EPS has been configured into four predictive service units: Severe Weather, Marine and Antarctic, Water, and Climate, each of which play a key role in the value chain of the Bureau's capability to deliver a suite of valuable products and services to the Australian community.


The objective of the Marine and Antarctic team is to deliver unsurpassed environmental prediction services for marine, coastal and oceans hazards offshore, in coastal waters and on the Australian and the Antarctic continents, including surrounding ice areas and international waters. To deliver these objectives the team is divided into two sub teams, Ocean and Antarctic Services and Tsunami, Marine and Coastal Hazards.  Both these teams operate within a footprint across Hobart, Adelaide and Melbourne and together support and deliver a number of different services.


The Ocean and Antarctic Services team specialises in ocean dynamics, sea level, tides, ice and high latitude weather. The team is comprised of specialists who design, develop and manage the capabilities required to deliver the oceans, tides, Antarctic and ice products and services. The team monitors ocean and ice conditions and delivers ocean and tidal analysis and predictions. The team stands up operationally as required to deliver Antarctic weather and ice services, including in a customer decision support role. Our customers come from a range of BSG priority sectors, community and emergency services.


The Senior Ocean Specialist will have an excellent understanding of the science, systems and technology and processes behind our sea level and tides services. As part of the team, you will contribute to the operations and continuous improvement of these services.


You will display a dedicated curiosity about sea level, tides and oceanography and the impacts of the evolving ocean and climate landscape. Employing personal drive and integrity, and communicating with influence, you will empower a high-performing team through promoting a positive culture of teamwork and continuous improvement. This will include a demonstrated ability to coach, develop and mentor individuals and develop their sea level and oceanography expertise and build internal and external relationships across the value chain.


This role will report to the Ocean and Antarctic Services Team Lead. The successful candidate will be committed to supporting the Bureau and our partners outside the scope of standard working hours during significant events and peak periods. The successful candidate may be required to carry out their duties remotely for either a period or until otherwise advised.


How to Apply: For more information please visit the Bureau of Meteorology's careers website (http://www.bom.gov.au/careers).

title: Senior Research Grants Officer (NHMRC)
description:
JR0000004403


Employment Type

Continuing, full-time


Compensation Grade

Higher Education Officer Level 7


Salary Range

$88,384 - $97,837 per annum 17% superannuation


Reporting to:

Manager, Research Grants and Tenders

Research Development and Support (RDS)


About Research Development and Support

Research Development and Support (RDS) works with Flinders researchers, Colleges, Centres and Institutes, other portfolios, and external stakeholders to proactively support our research. Our teams underpin Flinders’ research evolving from ideas through to impact. RDS is part of the Portfolio of the Deputy Vice-Chancellor (Research) and provides excellence in all facets of research management and promoting Flinders’ research.


About the role

Under broad direction, the Senior Research Grants Officer coordinates grant applications for funding opportunities on behalf of the University, and acts as the key contact in the support of academic researchers applying for research funding. As part of the RDS team the Senior Research Grants Officer will be required to work closely with a number of stakeholders including legal support staff, researchers, College based support staff, grants finance and external funding bodies. In particular, the position leads the coordination of the major grant application development and submission processes within the University.


About you

You will have a high level of competence in project management and administrative duties including the administration of major grant funding submission rounds and demonstrated capacity to develop training materials, and programs of relevance to researchers as part of a range of grant support services.

You will show team leadership and the ability to build a high performing and customer focused team in a complex environment with demonstrated high level liaison and negotiation skills, excellent oral and written communication skills, including demonstrated capacity to provide high quality advice to clients as well as research granting agencies.

To be successful in this role you will also require:

  • A relevant degree and experience or equivalent combination of experience and/or education and/or training.
  • Practical experience in the application of intellectual property, insurance and risk principles.
  • Demonstrated expertise in working with databases and information management systems.
  • An in-depth understanding of the University research environment, including the funding of research and policy context in which research administration operates.
  • Knowledge of and an ability to learn how to process category 1 NHMRC and MRFF grant applications.

Life at Flinders

We're transforming, and investing in people and facilities, to create contemporary, stimulating and satisfying learning and work environments that reflect our core values of excellence, innovation, courage, and integrity. Flinders is refocusing its strategic priorities with the aim of elevating its performance to be a top ten Australian university, and amongst the top 1% in the world.

Reaching beyond the limits of buildings, borders, and backgrounds, ours is an inclusive culture that believes absolutely in equality and opportunity for all. We don't just accommodate differences; we embrace and celebrate them. So, why work at Flinders?

  • 17% Superannuation + salary packaging options
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Wide range of professional development activities and services
  • We embrace diversity and promote equity and inclusion for students and staff with disabilities and health conditions , we are committed to Indigenous education and engagement and support initiatives such as The Pride Network
  • Vibrant campus life and amenities including on campus health care services , gym and childcare centre

Prescribed Conditions for Employment

A valid National Police Certificate which is satisfactory to the University will also be required before the successful applicant can commence in this position.

Flinders University has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that requires all new staff members to be up to date with their COVID-19 vaccinations, subject to medical exemptions.

How to Apply and Information

To view the full position description and apply online, please visit the Jobs@Flinders website via the job portal: JR0000004403

For more information regarding the position, or to have a confidential discussion, please contact: Dr Mary Rieger

We are seeking to increase the diversity to improve equal opportunity outcomes for employees, and therefore we encourage female applicants, people with a disability and/or from Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islanders descent to apply.

Applications to be submitted before:

11:59pm, Sunday 22 May 2022

Please note, late applications and applications sent via agencies will not be accepted .

title: Test Analysts, Senior Test Analysts, Test Leads and Test Managers
description:
​ AccessHQ, a Dialog Group company , is looking for a Test Analyst, Senior Test Analyst, Test Leads or Test Managers in Adelaide who are;

  • Are Passionate about quality
  • Great communicators and collaborators
  • Expertise in the delivery of quality assurance services
  • Experience across a range of enterprise technologies and domains

We love to support people who are transitioning their careers or who have made the leap already and have complementary skills from other industries to back up their IT experience.

Human Quality

In the age of software & digital the quality of software and the customer experience it allows is critical to our customers success.  AccessHQ is helping our clients to re-imagine quality.   Our founding beliefs:

  • We believe technology only exists to serve people and that humans are the most important element in any successful technology solution
  • We believe the customer’s experience is the ultimate measure of quality for any organisation. Quality is less about process and technique and more about people & behaviour
  • We believe the approach most organisations take to quality is anchored in the industrial era and it does not work for the digital age

We need passionate and enthusiastic professionals to join our team to work with our clients.

If that resonates, you could be just who we are looking for…

What We Offer You?

  • Competitive Pay
  • Training and Certification
  • Dedicated career Coach & Mentor
  • Fun, Flexible & Collaborative Culture
  • Opportunity to Work Across Multiple Industries & Technologies

Who is Dialog Group and AccessHQ?
AccessHQ is a wholly owned subsidiary of the Dialog Group which has been recently acquired by NCS, the IT Services arm of Singtel, a worldwide technology and telecommunications business.

AccessHQ has over 20 years’ experience in the assurance and testing space and is passionate about making technology live up to its promise. We believe that technology is an enabler for people to work, connect and learn. It's all about people, and too often we are forgotten in the excitement of technology development. is the voice of the people who use technology; whether we are customers, students, employees or citizens we're all human and all technology should have Human Quality.

Want To Apply?

Click the button below to apply or go to the website for more opportunities like this.

Applicants must have the right to work in Australia. All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence. Dialog Group is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Electronics Engineer
description:
The Company:

SolFlow is product development company that focuses on renewable energy technology and specialises in the area of DC energy.

It has multiple international patents and develops technology within the scope of the registered IP.

About The Role:

The role is ideally suited to an experienced Electronics Engineer with previous DC electronics experience. DC to DC converters and switch mode circuitry desired.

Working with Arm processors, WIFI, Bluetooth, Modbus experience also desired.

Who You Are:

  • Passionate about changing the way people consume energy and delivering game changing technology
  • Holding a degree in Electronics Engineering
  • Possessing at least 5 years of experience
  • Strong experience in embedded software development using C/C++ and Python
  • Preparation of documents required for design data packs, such as: specifications, compliance matrices, design calculations, analysis reports, drawings, test plans, test reports
  • Possessing PCB layout skills
  • Possessing component selection skills
  • Self-motivated and stick to milestones.
  • Ability to self-manage
  • Enjoys the challenge of problem solving

What You Will Typically Be Doing:

  • 50% of your time will be spent doing electronics design from concept to handover to production
  • 50% of your time will be project managing some key projects

Culture and Rewards:

The company is a small high achieving team, working with large and well-established multinational companies and will be able to support your career growth in a permanent role.

This is an exciting opportunity for you to innovate and work with ground-breaking technology within the renewable energy industry called PV Direct. One that will continue to grow on a global scale.

The office is based on the northern suburbs of Adelaide with additional testing facilities in Darwin.

Please be aware you must be an Australian citizen or have permanent residency status to apply for this role.

title: Communications & Marketing Officer
description:
About the Company:

Established in 1921, LLL Australia is a charitable financial institution that provides loans to the Lutheran Church of Australia (LCA) churches, schools, aged care facilities and other associated organisations, thereby promoting the missional work of the LCA. In addition, LLL provides savings accounts: personal and joint accounts; guardian accounts for children; and business accounts, including self-managed super funds and not-for-profit organisations.

As an Authorised Deposit-taking Institution (ADI), the LLL is regulated under the Banking Act and by APRA. Its mission is to provide business and financial support to the Lutheran Church of Australia (LCA) while providing excellent service to all customers and safeguarding the interests of depositors. As LLL embark on their planned strategic expansion of their lending activity outside of the Lutheran community, there will be a strong focus on telling the LLL story to support the strategy.

About the Role:

The Communications and Marketing Officer is a member of LLL Australia's Client Relationship function and is accountable for the effective engagement of the LLL brand through content creation and implementation of effective digital marketing strategies.

The Communications and Marketing Officer role is critical in telling the story of the LLL brand across their acquisition and retention channels; to new and returning supporters, stakeholders, the Lutheran Church of Australia (LCA) and the broader Christian community. This will be achieved by working closely with the Marketing Manager to develop and implement a range of communications and marketing activities. This role reports directly to the Marketing Manager.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Source, curate, and publish the LLL brand narrative through extensive content creation and storytelling in the form of; articles, presentations, photo and video content, blog posts, newsletters, social media content, advertisements, and eDM's (internal and external)
  • Generation of content that celebrates LLL's ethos with new and existing audiences through a multi-channel, multi-level engagement strategy
  • Proofreading of content ensuring accuracy and quality
  • Develop, implement and monitor a dynamic and progressive strategic marketing, social media, and digital communication plan, including analysis and measurement of online advertisements using tools such as Google Analytics and other digital communication programs
  • Design, shoot and create digital and physical content for the LLL brand
  • Assistance with managing LLL promotional events such as sponsorship events, award presentations, dinners, functions, and customer forums

Skills and Experience required:

  • Degree qualified in Marketing or Journalism with a minimum of 3 years experience in a similar marketing role
  • Proven copywriting skills and story-generating experience are essential
  • Proven experience with Digital Marketing, including Social Media management, Google Analytics and SEO Keywords
  • Proficient in MS Office Suite, Content Management Systems, and imaging programs
  • Good design skills, including graphics, video production and web design (Adobe products preferred)
  • Working knowledge of a not-for-profit and/or finance sector is highly regarded but not essential

Benefits:

  • Excellent team culture
  • Attractive Salary Package
  • Career growth and development opportunities
  • North Adelaide location

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply please click apply or call Emily Martens on 08 8216 3531 for a confidential discussion.

title: Prepress/Graphics Technology Specialist (hybrid location)
description:
Multi-Color Corporation is the world's largest label solutions manufacturer. We support many of the world’s most prominent brands, including leading producers of wine & spirits, home & personal care, food & beverage & specialty consumer products. We are recruiting a collaborative Prepress/Graphics Technology Specialist to join our team. MCC is a large organisation offering the ability for future opportunities including training & development for further advancement.

About

  • Full-time permanent ongoing position
  • Hybrid model - flexible with candidate location (within Australia)
  • Occasional travel within Australia & New Zealand will be required
  • Reporting to the Regional Prepress Technology Manager, the successful candidate will implement & support all graphics information technologies.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop & implement graphics technology plans supporting the current & future business needs of the organisation
  • Workflow automation: understand hybrid label printing process requirements to develop automated Esko WebCenter & Esko Automation Engine workflow solutions which will minimise operator input, reduce errors & improve throughput
  • Operations: ensure graphics systems uptime. Support system configuration & capacity planning, patches, upgrades & new release management
  • Provide periodic onsite support across Australia & New Zealand to audit current processes, implement established projects & support local initiatives related to graphics technology
  • Work with business unit & management to ensure applications support the organisation's needs & follow best practice. Provide programming & application integration to specifications that support business requirements
  • Application support: provide user support in graphic application related issues including login, functionality, reporting & data integrity
  • Vendors: maintain appropriate vendor support relationships
  • Compliance: create & review documentation in accordance with prepress standard operating procedures.

Candidate Criteria

  • Certificate IV Graphics Technology or equivalent work experience
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in graphics
  • Expert skills in Esko Automation Engine, Esko WebCenter, Esko graphic editors & Adobe graphic editors
  • Rational, logical & fact-driven decision-making capabilities (ability to read & analyse complex documents)
  • Relate to people at all levels of the organisation
  • Use clear, persuasive & articulated language in both spoken & written word
  • Demonstrate a professional image
  • Travel & operate within our offices & plants across Australia & New Zealand
  • Collaborative leadership skills & the ability to operate remotely
  • Ability to communicate, negotiate & consult with a wide range of stakeholders including executive, senior management & employees

Candidate must embrace the following behaviours & attitudes:

  • Values: actively endorse, practice & promote our Core Values of ‘Integrity, Passion, Creativity, Perseverance & Achievement’
  • Teamwork: supporting, encouraging & challenging colleagues within & across business units with the intent of achieving improved performance & professional productive relationships
  • Culture of Continuous Improvement: through the generation & execution of new ideas
  • Delivering on the Promise: ensuring that commitments made to internal & external customers are executed as specified.

Apply

Please provide resume and a covering letter addressing the criteria and why you would be suited to this role.

title: Datacom at Modbury is HIRING - Full Time - Customer Service Roles
description:
Datacom is growing! As a result, we are hiring for Customer Support roles in Modbury, Adelaide. Learn practical skills, build long-lasting friendships all while working flexible hours! Be recognised and rewarded for your contributions while making a real difference to the lives of Australians.

As a Customer Service Representative, you will be providing essential services to people across Australia on behalf of our Australian Federal Government clients! In this role you'll be operating in a dynamic team environment with a focus on meeting quality outcomes for customers.

What your day will look like?

- Working to a rotating roster that ties into your lifestyle

- Receiving inbound calls and resolving enquires related to a variety of government services

- Learning new skills while on the job

- Recording customer interactions and process account information

- Managing customer expectations

- Collaborating within the Datacom Connect team

What you'll bring

To be successful in this role, you'll bring:

- An interest in customer service

- Patience and empathy towards people in difficult situations

- The ability to identify customer needs and provide support.

- A team player focus, working collaboratively to exceed expectations

- Flexibility and adaptability

- A love for learning new things

- Intermediate computer skills

- Proficient verbal and written communication skills

- Australian Citizenship

Benefits

Working at Datacom you are part of a team that connects people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in. With over 7,200 people across our global offices and an annual revenue of over AU $1.1 billion annually Datacom is one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. We offer:

- Fast paced, friendly and supportive team environment

- Paid training

- Rewards & Recognition programs, performance incentives, end of year parties - and more!

- Paid parental leave

- Monthly cake day, fresh fruit and regular monthly engagement events

- Retail discounts from leading retailers like Woolworths, Amazon and Apple

- Comprehensive training resources, with ongoing coaching and development

- Rapid career progression through our Datacom Academy, where you can work your way up and across the business

- A best-in-class employee assistance program run by Assure

- Employee referral programs - once you are in and you are loving it - you can refer a friend and get $500!

If you're looking for meaningful work with genuine career progression opportunities, training and development, we'd love to hear from you.

APPLY WITH US TODAY!

title: Junior Salesforce Developer
description:
Junior Salesforce Developer

  • Exciting opportunity for an enthusiastic developer keen to evolve their skills
  • CBD fringe location with salary packaging
  • Work with Australia's leading cancer charity

About the company

Cancer Council SA’s vision is a cancer free future . Every minute, every hour, every day, we’re getting closer through impactful research, the delivery of cancer prevention activities, education and advocacy programs and providing support to people affected by cancer right here in South Australia.

Cancer Council is the only charity to help people from the point of diagnosis through to treatment and survivorship. We are proud to have served the community for over 90 years and have an enviable reputation as one of South Australia’s most trusted charities.

Role overview

Reporting directly to the Manager, Information Systems & Security and working closely with the CRM Administrator you will primarily be responsible for the delivery, with support from a 3rd party Salesforce vendor, of sound, sustainable and documented Salesforce CRM enhancements and defect triage for our staff, clients, donors and volunteers to improve our use cases and support our mission.

There will be a formal training program for this role which will include appropriate Salesforce administration and development courses and self-paced learning. Time will be provided to attend courses and to undertake course preparation.

This role will work closely with the CRM Administrator to ensure that any development of enhancements by this role or by 3rd party vendors are designed, documented and understood before acceptance by business users.

Key accountabilities

  • Provide support and troubleshoot and resolve bugs and defects with salesforce platform and systems connected to it
  • Follow best practice methodologies to implement technical solutions; develop and innovate on the Salesforce platform
  • Take a holistic view of developments and consider current and potential future interdependencies to avoid technical debt
  • Provide technical advice to the wider business and generally help to lift Salesforce capability
  • Lead and/or assist in the testing of 3rd party development of the Salesforce platform or applications adding data to Salesforce.
  • Develop dashboards, lists and reporting solutions to ensure stakeholders have the information required to make decisions or create actionable items.
  • Work closely with stakeholders across Cancer Council SA to understand processes and implement solutions that enable enhanced user experiences.

Skills, knowledge and experience

Essential
• A degree in Computer Science or related IT field or relevant Salesforce/Software development experience
• Proficient in at least 1 object oriented programming language (e.g. Java, C#) and a query language (e.g. SQL)
• Technical understanding of algorithms, systems architecture and end-user experience.
• Independent, self-motivated and a fast learner
• Results driven and willingness to work in fast-paced environments
• Great communication skills, approachable and a team player

Desirable
• Experience and/or certifications in Salesforce (CRM)
• Understanding or experience HTML/CSS/JavaScript or Integration/WebServices
• Experience with Power BI – new generation analyst reporting tool.
• Experience in SQL including experience in SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) & SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)

Special conditions

  • The successful applicant must be a non-smoker.
  • Intra/inter-state travel, out of hours and weekend work may be required
  • At times planned or emergency work may need to be carried out outside of normal work times.
  • The position requires on call support outside of business hours including weekends and public holidays when providing back up support to the Manager Information Systems & Security. (4 weeks per year)
  • Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory police check and may require a further Department of Human Services clearance.
  • All staff are required to be fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine approved by the Therapeutic Goods Administration or have an exemption that has been endorsed by the Chief Public Health Officer or their delegate.

For more information, please contact Michael Hutchesson on 08 8291 4136 or view the position description.

Applications close at 5pm, Thursday 2 June 2022.

With respect, no recruitment agencies please.

Cancer Council SA promotes and values diversity, applicants from diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

As an organisation, Cancer Council SA are committed to creating a safe workforce for all.

Cancer Council SA employees have been trained by Rosemary Wanganeen in Bi-Cultural Awareness, Safety and Inclusion and we welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

title: APS Level 6, Executive Level 1, Executive Level 2 - ICT Enterprise Architect
description:
Your Role

Defence Chief Information Officer Group ICT Architecture Branch is looking to hire multiple positions with in the bands APS 6, EL1, and EL2 across multiple areas within the branch:

  • Cyber and ICT Security;
  • SAP;
  • Cloud and Infrastructure; and
  • Standards and Architecture Practice.

Defence is seeking strongly motivated individuals with drive, integrity and a passion to support Defence, including the ADF, in delivering its national security objectives. As an architect in the Chief Information Officer group (CIOG) you will have the opportunity to work with major Defence capability projects.  The projects range across capability streams such as Land Combat and Amphibious Warfare, Maritime and Anti-Submarine Warfare, Strike and Air Combat or even Intelligence, Surveillance, Reconnaissance, Electronic Warfare, Space and Cyber.  ICT Architecture responsibilities include:

  • Establishing and maintaining effective Defence Enterprise Architecture;
  • Establishing and maintaining architectures and roadmaps in line with Defence ICT and Information Management Strategies;
  • Translating Whole-of-Government, Defence and ICT Strategic guidance into unambiguous architectural direction and guidance;
  • Establishing, reviewing and maintaining architectural principles, guidelines, standards and patterns;
  • Ensuring enterprise-wide compliance with architecture standards and fit-for-purpose ICT solutions in fixed, mobile and deployed environments Business modelling, business process analysis / design and management of whole-of-Defence activities; and
  • Manage preferred tools, set standards, and defined architecture practice services in Defence;

To be effective in these roles you will think strategically and work interdependently with other Defence functions, and be a strong team player to achieve effective outcomes. This will require highly developed communication and relationship management skills.

Our Ideal Candidate

As an ICT Enterprise Architect you will work under broad direction to undertake complex research, analysis and design activities associated with the Defence enterprise.  As the ideal candidate, you will:

  • Work within a framework of legislation, established principles, work practices and procedures in accordance with Defence’s mission and business objectives.
  • Have experience and comprehensive knowledge of research, analysis and design and are responsible for the development, implementation, compliance and review of products and policies within the enterprise architecture field.
  • Build holistic views of Defences strategy, processes, information, and assets and apply this knowledge and ensure that Defence and ICT are aligned.
  • Strategically assess Defences current capabilities, translate business strategy and objectives into an operating model and work towards identifying required changes in capabilities and emerging technologies relevant to Defence's business outcomes.
  • Build Relationships and engage with stakeholders, manage expectations and concerns to develop a shared understanding of the business benefits and risks to achieve outcomes.
  • Be accountable to contribute towards ongoing self-improvement and professional development.
  • Take the initiative for achieving outcomes, progressing work, reviewing performance and focusing on identifying opportunities for continuous improvement
  • Work with independence, under broad direction, and set work tasks that align with the strategic objectives and communicate expected outcomes. You may be required to plan, lead and manage a team and exercise the associated people and financial responsibilities to achieve business outcomes.

Our Organisation

Defence’s primary mission is to protect Australia and its national interests, promote security and stability in the world, and support the Australian community as directed by the Government.

Defence Australian Public Service (APS) employees are engaged in an array of occupations, across Australia and around the world, enabling our three services: Navy, Army and Air Force, to fulfil key defensive roles as well as providing a range of peacetime services.

In Defence, you will enjoy experiences and opportunities that, as an APS employee, you simply would not get in any other organisation. You are able to undertake interesting, challenging and unique work. This ranges from intelligence and strategic policy right through to human resources, communications, infrastructure and engineering, and information technology.

Defence is committed to recruiting the right people, in the right jobs, at the right time - whether it is creating, acquiring or delivering Defence capability. Our greatest asset is our people.

A more diverse workforce supported by an inclusive culture enhances Defence’s capability and effectiveness, as it draws on different ideas to innovate and adapt to a rapidly evolving strategic environment and the changing nature of warfare. Building ‘Capability through Inclusion’ is one Defence’s six cultural reform priorities under Pathway to Change: Evolving Defence Culture 2017 – 2022 .

Our Values and Behaviours reflect the traditions and identities of the Australian Defence Force (ADF) and the APS. The values underpin Defence’s corporate culture and contribute to achieving organisational goals.

Defence accommodates requests for reasonable adjustment for people with disability to assist in the application process and if successful, the inherent requirements of the position. Please inform the contact person listed on the front of this Information Pack should you require adjustments to be put in place. The RecruitAbility process applies to this role.

Defence's commitment to Indigenous Reconciliation, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities, and the whole-of-Government Closing the Gap strategy is outlined in Defence’s Reconciliation Action Plan 2019-2022 .

Defence provides relocation assistance to eligible APS employees required to relocate. The level of assistance will vary depending on the reason for relocating and your personal circumstances. For more information, please download the APS Relocation Assistance Handbook .

Our Group

Working in the Chief Information Officer Group (CIOG), you will be contributing your expertise to some of the most technically demanding and complex ICT transformation projects being undertaken in Australia. CIOG is transforming Defence’s ICT capabilities. We build and maintain critical infrastructure and systems, such as classified and secure military systems. We manage one of the largest ICT networks in Australia and provide a modern, secure, sustainable and scalable information environment to enable current and future military and business operations.

Our vision is a CIOG where everyone understands how we can use technology to enable war fighting as well as our day-to-day business. We apply new ways of thinking and working that allow us to take advantage of faster, better and more efficient ways of delivering ICT Services. Supporting Defence in this technology dominated era requires a different, more responsive and agile approach to everything, from our strategy, through to our processes, policies and people.

We are diverse, agile and strive for a positive workforce culture where people feel valued and where we take pride in our work. We foster a work environment where individual differences are valued and utilised. We leverage the unique knowledge and experience of our people to enhance our capability. Everyone has something to contribute.

CIOG offers the opportunity to work in the largest and most complex ICT environment in Australia with a competitive salary, flexible work hours and work-life balance, generous leave (with the ability to purchase more), and 15.4% superannuation, paid paternity/maternity leave, retirement planning, and wellness programs. We invest in your career development through funding your professionalisation and training programs and offer a variety of opportunities nationally.

Our Team

ICT Architecture Branch is responsible for ensuring that Defence has a modern, secure and scalable enterprise Information and Communications Technology (ICT) architecture to support Defence business and military operations. It is transforming Defence's ICT architecture for the future ICTAB is comprised of five directorates;

  • Directorate of Defence Capability Architecture;
  • Directorate of Information, Integration, Applications and Engagement;
  • Directorate of Platform Architecture;
  • Directorate of Infrastructure and Cloud Architecture;
  • Directorate of SAP Architecture;
  • Directorate of Security Architecture; and
  • Directorate of Standards and Architecture Practice.

Each will be a slightly different focus and stakeholder group but all with the same mission in mind – to enable Defence to meet its outcomes using modern, secure and scalable enterprise Information and Communications Technology (ICT) . There are multiple positions available within the various directorates of ICTAB.

Desirable Qualifications, Experience or Training

The following prior knowledge, relevant experience or training will be considered highly desirable:

  • A relevant qualification from an Australian University or TAFE institution (or overseas qualification) would be highly regarded.
  • Technical background/experience preferred in Cloud and Infrastructure, Cyber, Security, SAP, and Architecture Standards.
  • Knowledge of architectural frameworks and methodologies such as TOGAF and DODAF2.
  • Excellent communication skills and stakeholder relationships.

How To Apply

Apply for this role by submitting your application through our online recruitment system (eRecruit) located at Defence APS Careers. If you have any questions regarding this role, email the contact officer.

For more information please refer to the Applicant User Guide . Further advice on addressing selection criteria can be found in ‘Cracking the Code’ publication located on the Australian Public Service Commission website.

Vacancies will be extended in exceptional circumstances only. Applicants requesting an extension must contact the Contact Officer 24 hours prior to the vacancy closing date.

In your application you should provide a copy of your current Resume/CV and address the following:

Assessment Criteria

An explanation of how your skills, knowledge and experience will be relevant to this role (limit your total response to 1000 words).

PLEASE NOTE: Defence APS Careers is for job seekers only. We do not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies and/or search firms and will not pay fees to any such organisations unless arranged with the provider prior to advertising the vacancy.

Eligibility

Employment with the Department of Defence is subject to conditions prescribed within the Public Service Act 1999.

Citizenship – To be eligible for employment with Defence, applicants must be an Australian citizen. Only in exceptional circumstances can this requirement be waived.

Health Assessment - As a condition of engagement, a mandatory pre-employment health assessment may be required where there are physical or medical requirements for the role. Your contact officer can provide further guidance on whether this is required for your role.

Security Clearance – The Australian community requires the highest level of integrity from Defence employees. The preferred applicant will be required to successfully undergo the security clearance vetting process at a specified clearance level.

Further information can be provided in the Australian Government Security Clearance Applicant Guide Book. Please ensure that you read this information thoroughly and confirm that you meet the minimum requirements to be eligible to hold a security clearance at the required level.

Please ensure that you are able to provide the necessary documents if you apply for the position. The security clearance level required for this position can be found on the front page of this Information Pack.

More information on the security clearance vetting process is available on the AGSVA website .

Thank you for your interest

Department of Defence

title: Critical Minerals Researcher
company: Department of the Premier and Cabinet
description:
The role of Critical Minerals Researcher undertakes research programs in Mineralogy / Economic Geology and develops, interprets and studies the South Australian Museum’s earth sciences collections, as part of a professional research collective that also includes the Australian Critical Minerals Research Centre at the University of Adelaide. The incumbent provides expert, authoritative advice on professional matters, promotes the Museum in both scientific and community forums, and supervises students and visiting researchers working on the Earth Sciences collections.

Special Conditions:

  • The Incumbent will be required to participate in the department's Performance Management Program.
  • The Incumbent may be assigned to another position at this remuneration level or equivalent.
  • Some work outside of normal hours will be required.
  • Some interstate travel involving overnight absences will be required.
  • This role requires a National Criminal History Check.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working including part-time.  Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role.

For a Role Description, further information and how to apply please visit https://iworkfor.sa.gov.au and search vacancy number 483446.

Dr Steve Donnellan
