title: Presales Consultant
description:
About Resolve Software

Here at Resolve Software, we have helped over 150 businesses around the world. We work with our customers to understand their requirements and implement a solution to manage complaints, requests, investigations, misconduct and general case management.

The role

The Presales Consultant is responsible for designing solutions and estimation of the effort required for implementation. This role is accountable for ensuring the right solutions are determined that will meet customer needs.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Undertake pre-sales assessment qualifications resulting in recommendation(s)
  • Develop a thorough understanding of customer requirements
  • Identify business drivers and value propositions
  • Propose technical and business solution visions
  • Provide technical and solution responses to tenders
  • Review artefacts/products produced by team members
  • Undertake presentations of solution demonstrations and solution architecture
  • Configure solutions for demonstration purposes
  • Estimate configuration efforts required to deliver a solution
  • Identify and document assumptions that have been made during the sales process
  • Assist customers with initial product evaluations and share relevant customer success stories / best practices
  • Provide a thorough handover to assist with the implementation of projects that you have been involved in designing solutions for
  • Provide support throughout the implementation process on key design and architecture guidance

We are open to this role being based anywhere within Australia and remote work from home options are available.

Experience and skills

  • Previous experience in presales and/or solution architecture/design and/or technical/senior business analysis is beneficial
  • Advanced Business Analysis skills beneficial
  • Excellent understanding of technology and how it is applied in business
  • Understanding of system integration and IT security required
  • A thorough understanding of current technical trends
  • Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills
  • Strong ability to build and foster business relationships

Our culture and perks

What really sets us apart in the tech landscape is our passion and drive as family-like team. At Resolve Software we offer a range of benefits including:

  • Employee Share Purchase Plan from our parent company Constellation Software Inc.
  • Flexible leave offerings, including opportunities to purchase additional leave (up to 10 additional annual leave days)
  • EAP Support, offering mental/physical wellbeing counselling

How to apply

If this sounds like you, and you would like to work for an innovative company where you can make a difference, then we want to hear from you. To apply for this position, please send your CV coupled with a cover letter outlining your interest and suitability to the role via the Apply now link.

For further information on us and our products, visit www.resolvesoftwaregroup.com. Resolve Software Group is an entity of Jonas Software www.jonassoftware.com, the leading provider of enterprise management software for more than 40,000 customers across 15 countries. Jonas Software is a 100% owned subsidiary of Constellation Software Inc., headquartered in Toronto and traded on the TSX (CSU.TO).

title: Application Developer
description:
Java Developer
Multiple locations

We are Fujitsu. A Japanese company with a strong set of values and a history of respecting fairness and equality, whilst promoting diversity and inclusion. We constantly push ourselves to do better and strive to bring together a diverse mix of perspectives and talents in an inclusive environment, where we encourage our people to bring their full selves to work. We call this Be Completely You.
We are inclusive. As a responsible business, it is important to us that we reflect the diversity of our society and customers. Globally, Fujitsu is not only a Disability Confident company, a Times Top 50 employer for Women, and a signatory for the Race at Work Charter. We are also committed to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and in Australia we have been recognised as an AWEI Bronze employer for our LGBTI inclusion. We also have specific inclusion efforts with First Nations Peoples in New Zealand through our Maori and Pacific Peoples Inclusion Plan and in Australia with our Reconciliation Action Plan.
We are people centric . This means we care about our people (and their families and communities) and appreciate that everyone has a life outside of work. By supporting our people to Work Your Way, we empower them to achieve a flexible and respectful approach to work which suits them and our customers best - this could be working hours, location, or a flexible approach to their working day.
We want you to thrive. If working for a progressive organization, with a continuing commitment to diversity and inclusion is important, you should apply.

Shape your world and achieve together
  • 5 years of demonstrable industry experience in application support, maintenance and development of Java/JEE applications.
  • 3 years of proven experience in leading a team of software development, maintenance and support services
  • Fully understands and uses the concepts, methodologies, techniques and tools of systems delivery or application management, including configuration, release, management processes.
  • Knowledgeable of a wider field of information systems and how own role relates to other information system roles, the business of the employer or client
  • Successfully implemented modifications and enhancements to complex applications with moderate supervision
  • Preparation of accurate design and programming estimates to deliver to schedule
  • Methodical and structured approach and can prioritise and multitask successfully
Key Accountabilities:
Technical competencies:
  • Significant demonstrable industry experience in software analysis, design and development in Java/JEE , Struts and EJB
  • Demonstrable industry experience with SQL, PL/SQL and Oracle database
  • Experience with shell and pearl Scripting, Unix/ Linux OS
  • Experience in Application Servers such as IBM WebSphere/JBoss
  • Demonstrable industry experience in version controlling and automation of build, integration and build
  • Qualifications -> Tertiary qualifications in the field of computer science or equivalent
Building your own path to success:
  • Proven experience in Software development and application maintenance Support
  • Proven experience with Java/JEE.
  • Experience working with Struts, EJB
  • Experience with SQL and Oracle database
  • Experience with shell Scripting
PLEASE NOTE:
Fujitsu complies with government legislation in various jurisdictions which in certain circumstances may impose a requirement that certain workers be vaccinated against COVID-19 (or otherwise have a valid exemption).  Also, for client facing roles, many of our customers require our staff to be vaccinated to attend their workplaces. Based on Fujitsu’s assessment of workplace risk and the safety and wellbeing of our people and consultation with our staff, Fujitsu has introduced a Vaccination Requirements policy which requires all persons entering a Fujitsu workplace, attending a Fujitsu work-related event, or entering other premises to undertake work on Fujitsu’s behalf to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or the subject of an appropriate exemption (and to provide evidence of the same).  Consequently as a result of Fujitsu’s policy, and, where applicable , customer and legislated vaccination requirements, Fujitsu requires all new employees to be fully vaccinated or have an authorised exemption approved by Fujitsu’s Crisis management Team (CMT). Recruits will be required to provide evidence of their vaccination status as part of the recruitment process.

title: Senior Programs Evaluation Officer / Evaluation Officer
description:
About the Department for Correctional Services
The Department employs approximately 1,900 staff and has responsibility for nine prisons and sixteen Community Correctional offices across the state. Our vision is for a safer community by protecting the public and reducing re-offending. We work towards this through the contribution of staff who are employed in a wide variety of fields, from correctional officers and teachers, to social workers, psychologists and supervisors of court orders. Their commitment ensures we deliver quality services to prisoners, offenders and victims of crime. We strongly promote diversity and equity in our workforce, which directly contributes to greater effectiveness and better outcomes. In a supportive and collaborative environment, you will encounter interesting professional challenges and you will work alongside dedicated and passionate people who help to turn around the lives of offenders and rebuild lives affected by crime.

Duties
Senior Programs Evaluation Officer - ASO6
The Senior Programs Evaluation Officer is responsible for the coordination and implementation of evaluation and research projects for rehabilitation programs, including providing high level conceptual, evaluative and research skills to the Offender Development Directorate. The evaluation projects will support the achievement of overall Correctional Services strategy in delivering effective rehabilitation programs for all offenders.

Evaluation Officer - ASO5
The Evaluation Officer is responsible for the planning and implementation of evaluation and research projects for the Department. The evaluation projects will support the overall Correctional Services strategy in delivering effective rehabilitation program for all offenders.

Special Conditions

  • Section 47 of the Public Sector Act 2009 applies in conjunction with other provisions of the act and other applicable industrial entitlements.
  • The incumbent is required to satisfactorily complete a National Criminal History Check;
  • A current South Australian Driver's Licence is essential;
  • A flexible approach to working hours is required;
  • Some interstate and intrastate travel will be required which may necessitate overnight absences.

Requirements
Essential: Nil
Desirable: Degree in Psychology, Social Sciences, Criminology, Statistics or other related discipline.

Remuneration
ASO5: $82,042 - $91,245
ASO6: $94,176 - $104,165

Enquiries
Ms Sophie Ransom
A/Team Leader, Program Services Unit
8226 9139
sophie.ransom@sa.gov.au

Additional Information
This is a temporary vacancy for up to 12 months.
Successful applicant will be appointed at either classification depending on the qualification and experience held.
It is a requirement for any non-ongoing DCS employees to be fully vaccinated with a Therapeutic Goods Administration approved COVID-19 vaccination

Application Instructions For more information on how to apply please visit the www.iworkfor.sa.gov.au website and job reference 485457

Applications close: 31/05/2022 11:00 PM

title: Oracle DBA
description:
• Enterprise experience providing Oracle DBA for critical databases
  • Client facing to major government clients
  • Permanent role, Darwin based

    Oracle DBA Required in Darwin

Dialog, with over 1,200 people , is the largest Australian subsidiary of 10,000 strong Singapore based NCS, the IT Services arm of Singtel, a worldwide technology and telecommunications business.

Conducting its IT Services business Australia wide, Dialog ’s key focus is on delivering outstanding results to its many corporate and government clients using leading tools, technologies and methodologies.

As an integral team member of this highly dynamic organisation you will benefit from accelerated career development through diverse projects, training and mentoring in a collaborative atmosphere.

Dialog enjoys long-term relationships with Australia’s Peak Government and Corporate organisations. As a Dialog consultant engaging with these clients, you will:

  • Work with key stakeholders to achieve world’s best practice processes in major projects
  • Work on a wide variety of interesting and challenging assignments
  • Work with colleagues in partnership with clients who are committed to achieving their business objectives
  • Enjoy salary above industry standard in a working environment in which effort, creativity and a positive attitude are highly valued
  • Have extensive training opportunities through the Dialog Academy, which offers a wide range of ICT and Business skills courses
  • Work with likeminded colleagues who share information and focus on the goal, driving the project and their careers further and faster

Dialog requires an Oracle Database Administrator to join a small team providing Oracle database administration. Dialog seeks people who have these capabilities:

  • At least 5 years’ experience administering Oracle 12c (or later) databases to a high availability in accordance with strict SLAs in large organisations
  • Demonstrated responsibility for major upgrades of recent versions
  • Experience liaising directly with clients, preferably in a government environment

Established in 1979, Dialog employs over 1,200 people throughout Australia, and provides a wide range of information technology solutions to government and corporate clients.

At Dialog , our whole approach is based on four key values: Involved, Committed, Can Do, Always .

It's these values, applied to every project, which stand behind our success and ensure we are always client focused. These same four values underpin the relationship we enjoy with our people.

Join our team of professional, enthusiastic and experienced consultants, where communication, learning and knowledge sharing are prized. We offer an excellent benefits package and industry standard market rate salaries.

Dialog is an equal opportunity employer.

Applicants should be Australian or NZ citizens or Australian permanent residents . If you are not an Australian or New Zealand citizen you will need to provide your passport and visa for our review.

Visit our website www.dialog.com.au for more information.

title: Communications Intelligence Security Officer/COMSO  APS Level 6
description:
The Role
The Communications Intelligence Security Officer/COMSO is responsible for the security of all Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) within SRSPO. They are accountable to ensure they have knowledge of and drive compliance with the relevant legislative and policy frameworks. The COMSO has a vital role in all elements of Protective Security – Information, Personnel, Physical and Administrative. They will provide detailed security technical, professional and policy advice in relation to complex unit work and contribute to strategic planning, program and project management, and policy development.

The COMSO’s proactive involvement in all SCI related protective security matters is essential for the establishment and maintenance of effective security practises both in SRSPO and within external stakeholders. As such, they will be required to identify, anticipate, and respond to stakeholders’ needs and expectations to achieve SRSPO and wider Defence outcomes. You will also collaborate with our Industry partners to ensure they meet their security obligations.

About our Team
Surveillance and Response Systems Program Office (SRSPO) ensures the availability and performance of highly complex surveillance and response airborne and related systems for the Royal Australian Air Force (RAAF). This includes the P-8A Poseidon and the P-3C (Electronic Warfare) aircraft systems. SRSPO also acquires and supports common Aeronautical Life Support Equipment (ALSE) that is used on all air vehicles operated by the RAAF, Navy and Army. In the near future we will support a new remotely piloted high altitude long endurance aircraft system, the MQ4 Triton.

At SRSPO we are passionate about working with our stakeholders and industry partners to ensure that necessary acquisition, sustainment and regulatory requirements are fulfilled in order to support the warfighter and achieve the Department of Defence’s strategic and operational objectives. We offer an interesting and supportive work environment, a range of wellbeing activities and flexible work arrangements including the ability to work from home.

Our Ideal Candidate
A high performing, self-motivated, organised individual adept at building productive and collaborative relationships at both a technical and leadership level to achieve protective security objectives. You will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically, prioritise effectively, and apply a continuous improvement mindset. You will have a methodical approach to problem solving and developing business-processes, procedures and plans.

Along with SRSPO’s Executive, the COMSO is a promoter of a positive security culture therefore you must be able to engage and proactively communicate with influence to stakeholders of all levels. The Defence environment has unique Security challenges therefore you will need to be proficient at researching and analysing complex information, the environment, and situations/incidents, to identify process inadequacies and conduct risk management accordingly. Key to this is understanding and applying the requirements of the Defence Security Principles Framework (DSPF) and related policies so that SRSPO’s local systems, procedures and controls comply.

Application Closing date: Sunday the 22th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference CASG/01523/22 on Link: https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=5A0739A3-E257-B298-E204-C879F7489311

title: Systems Architect
description:
Welcome to Prism Defence…


Prism Defence is specialised in Ship/Air integration and innovative solutions that support the development and management of Ship/Helicopter operating Limits.

At Prism Defence we work with defence forces across the world to conduct flight tests in the harshest maritime environments to prove and enable aircraft capability to land on ships.

We are seeking a system architect to enhance our software development outcomes with multiple deployments planned over the next few years.

You will be supporting Prism Defence’s software, instrumentation and engineering team to develop the next generation of software and hardware solutions for Prism Defence and our clients in many parts of the world.

title: Research Grants Officer (ARC)
description:
JR0000004400

Availability:
Continuing | Part-Time at 0.6 FTE

Compensation:
Higher Education Officer Level 6

Salary Range:
$81,377 - $86,765 FTE

Reporting to:
Senior Research Grants Officer (ARC & IGII)
Research Development and Support

About the Role
The Research Grants Officer (ARC) is responsible for the efficient management of existing research grants and established competitive research grant rounds. Working as a member of the Grants and Tenders team, you will work closely with stakeholders to provide project-based research administration support to assist with data capture and sustain collaborative partnerships (internally and externally) to support Flinders research. More specifically, you will be expected to:

  • Identify opportunities for external funding and grant programs
  • Coordinate and facilitate communications and advice to researchers and advising in relation to external grant and tender guidelines and funding rules
  • Assist with grant application lodgement processes
  • Review and coordinate the preparation of academic status documentation for partnering external researchers

About You

To be successful in this role, you will consistently and actively engage with relevant teams and stakeholders and demonstrate a focus on high quality customer service. You will be curious, resilient, and apply your problem-solving and analytical skills to a complex environment. You will be adaptable and thrive in a changing and fast paced environment. The successful candidate will also demonstrate:

  • The ability to anticipate potential risks and take proactive steps to overcome them, whilst acknowledging the complexity of the Australian research environment.
  • Experience in research administration, including an- understanding of the Australian Research Council and international, government and industry grants opportunities and processes.
  • A passion for supporting research, continuous improvement and innovation.
  • Completion of a degree with subsequent relevant experience, or extensive experience in an administrative roles.

Life at Flinders

We're transforming, and investing in people and facilities, to create contemporary, stimulating and satisfying learning and work environments that reflect our core values of excellence, innovation, courage, and integrity. Flinders is refocusing its strategic priorities with the aim of elevating its performance to be a top ten Australian university, and amongst the top 1% in the world.

Reaching beyond the limits of buildings, borders, and backgrounds, ours is an inclusive culture that believes absolutely in equality and opportunity for all. We don't just accommodate differences; we embrace and celebrate them. So, why work at Flinders?

  • 17% Superannuation + salary packaging options
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Wide range of professional development activities and services
  • We embrace diversity and promote equity and inclusion for students and staff with disabilities and health conditions , we are committed to Indigenous education and engagement and support initiatives such as The Pride Network
  • Vibrant campus life and amenities including on campus health care services , gym and childcare centre

Prescribed Conditions for Employment

A valid National Police Certificate which is satisfactory to the University will also be required before the successful applicant can commence in this position.

Flinders University has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that requires all new staff members to be up to date with their COVID-19 vaccinations, subject to medical exemptions and limited exemptions.

How to Apply and Information
To view the full position description and apply online , please visit the Jobs@Flinders website via the job portal: JR0000004400 - Research Grants Officer (ARC)

Applications to be submitted before 11:59pm Sunday 22 May 2022

Please note, late applications and applications sent via agencies will not be accepted .

title: Process Improvement Consultant - Remote or Hybrid!
description:
About the role

DVE Business Solutions are the leading consultants in Higher Education process improvement! We are passionate about helping our clients improve their ways of working and systematising their processes and operating models. As the Senior Process Improvement Consultant, you will be responsible for working with our clients to improve their processes through efficiency gains, communications, training and system implementations. Typical processes we are involved in include Curriculum Management, Timetabling and Scheduling, Student Management Systems, Credit Management, Research and Admissions.

You will work with a small team of professionals to understand and improve the client’s processes, develop requirements for automation and system improvements, and assist with rolling out changes through stakeholder engagement. The successful candidate will have a strong education background, process improvement experience, and preferably knowledge of system and technology implementations within an educational setting.

This is a flexible role, based out of any state with reasonable travel to clients. We would also consider part-time options for the right person.

About you

You will be an enthusiastic, interested person who enjoys talking to a broad range of stakeholders. You will enjoy using your interpersonal skills to develop stakeholder relationships and your critical thinking and problem-solving skills to understand and identify solutions to problems.

You will have the ability to listen to a discussion, draw out key pieces of information and synthesise ideas. The successful candidate will be confident in presenting work to stakeholders to articulate solutions and demonstrate and understanding of their needs. You will be interested in developing solutions that involve both technological change and people change.

Key skills & proven experience

Higher Education knowledge:

  • Knowledge of the University and/or private Higher Education Provider (HEP) environment, structure and processes.
  • Experience with Higher Education institutional politics, particularly in relation to academic and scholarly challenges.

Stakeholder engagement:

  • Ability to talk to and engage with client teams, ranging from senior leaders to operational staff.
  • Experience in facilitating client workshops of between 10 and 20 stakeholders, with the ability to keep the audience engaged whilst eliciting requirements.
  • Advanced analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex business needs and develop appropriate product supported solutions.
  • Know-how to document client requirements with the ability to interpret and discuss these with technical vendor teams.

Process knowledge:

  • Understanding of at least two of the following common processes in Higher Education: Student Information Systems, Timetabling, Credit, Placement, Research Management, Admissions & Enrolment.

Personal attributes:

  • Good problem solver
  • Excellent stakeholder manager
  • Team player
  • Keen to learn and take on new challenges
  • Quick learner
  • Happy to work in a planned team environment, but comfortable with autonomy and ambiguity.

To be successful in this role, you will need:

  • Previous experience working in a university or Higher Education Provider.
  • High level skills in workshop facilitation and requirement elicitation techniques.
  • Experience managing multiple projects and/or stakeholders with conflicting deadlines.
  • A positive approach to problem solving and teamwork and a desire to embrace challenges as growth opportunities.
  • Excellent skills in stakeholder engagement and communication management across all organisational levels.
  • Have been involved in system implementation projects.
  • Ability to predict client needs and identify opportunities to further support them.
  • Undergraduate qualification as a minimum.

If this role sounds like it could be your next career move and you're as passionate about change and improvement in the Higher Education sector as we are then apply below and a team member will get in touch!

title: Research Assistant in Neuroscience and Dementia Research
description:
JR0000004277

Employment Type

Fixed-term until March 2024, part-time at 0.6 FTE


Compensation Grade

Higher Education Officer Level 5


Salary Range

$72,885 - $80,438 (pro rata) + 17% superannuation


Reporting to:

Senior Research Fellow in Neuroscience, Flinders Health and Medical Research Institute


About the College of Medicine and Public Health

At the College of Medicine and Public Health, we deliver clinical, population and lab-based research, integrated teaching programs and high-quality clinical services.

Our footprint reaches out from our world class teaching hospital at the Flinders Medical Centre in South Australia to multiple rural clinical locations all the way to Darwin in the Northern Territory.

We promote research in health services, systems improvements, public and population health, improved clinical care and laboratory and precision medicine.


About the role

This is a great opportunity to support exciting new Neuroscience and Dementia research in a dynamic laboratory and academic environment. Undertake research support to the team of Dr Arne Ittner, head of the Laboratory for Molecular Memory and Dementia Research (aiLab), at FHMRI Neuroscience with a variety of research support activities.

Provide experimental and procedural support on research activities using cells, tissue, plasmids and protein that contribute to the understanding of mechanisms of learning and memory and the molecular processes that occur during memory loss in dementia. Our research is supported by National health and Medical Research Council, the Australian research Council, and Flinders Foundation among others.


About you

You will have a biomedical, biological science or bio-technological background with technical skills in molecular biology, and experience in a biomedical research lab.

Teamwork and team culture is important for the role, and you will require the ability to work effectively both autonomously and in a team environment, including the ability to provide routine direction to junior staff/students.

As well as this you will have experience in lab administration/management tasks, and the ability to effectively prioritise and complete multiple tasks whilst applying sound judgment and initiative.

To be successful in this role you will require:

  • Demonstrated ability to perform research experiments and handling of laboratory mice
  • Sound communication (written and oral), interpersonal skills and cultural sensitivity
  • Computer skills including MS Office and statistical analysis packages
  • Bachelors degree, equivalent or higher in Molecular Biology, Genetics and/or Neuroscience (or any relevant field).


Life at Flinders

We're transforming, and investing in people and facilities, to create contemporary, stimulating and satisfying learning and work environments that reflect our core values of excellence, innovation, courage, and integrity. Flinders is refocusing its strategic priorities with the aim of elevating its performance to be a top ten Australian university, and amongst the top 1% in the world.

Reaching beyond the limits of buildings, borders, and backgrounds, ours is an inclusive culture that believes absolutely in equality and opportunity for all. We don't just accommodate differences; we embrace and celebrate them. So, why work at Flinders?

  • 17% Superannuation + salary packaging options
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Wide range of professional development activities and services
  • We embrace diversity and promote equity and inclusion for students and staff with disabilities and health conditions , we are committed to Indigenous education and engagement and support initiatives such as The Pride Network
  • Vibrant campus life and amenities including on campus health care services , gym and childcare centre


Prescribed Conditions for Employment

A valid National Police Certificate which is satisfactory to the University will also be required before the successful applicant can commence in this position.

Flinders University has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that requires all new staff members to be up to date with their COVID-19 vaccinations, subject to medical exemptions.


How to Apply and Information

We are seeking to increase the diversity to improve equal opportunity outcomes for employees, and therefore we encourage female applicants, people with a disability and/or from Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islanders descent to apply.

11:59pm, Wednesday 11 May 2022
