title: Directors, Mergers Exemptions & Digital EA2022/180
description:
• Genuine opportunity for WFH and in the office.
• Our people's great work can be seen every day in the positive impact we make for Australian consumer
• Assist with litigation in the Federal Court or the Australian Competition Tribunal.

Competition Exemptions Branch

The Competition Exemptions Branch assesses applications for authorisation and notification which, if granted, allow businesses to obtain immunity from the Act where the proposed conduct is considered to be of public benefit.

The work of the Branch involves a high degree of interaction with participants in a wide range of industries on matters that directly impact on market structure and consumers.

The Branch’s functions involve investigative and regulatory activities, economic and legal analysis and preparation for litigation where necessary.

The Branch sits within the Mergers, Exemptions and Digital Division.


Role and Duties

Working under broad direction, the main duties are:

  • Provide leadership and development to a team of skilled professional staff and contribute to the leadership of the Branch and Division.
  • Plan and lead the investigation and analysis of authorisation applications, notifications and certification trademark applications.
  • Oversee a team to prepare written and oral recommendations for ACCC commissioners.
  • Discuss the impact of conduct with customers, competitors, and industry groups, and professionally represent the ACCC in these discussions.
  • Prepare correspondence to companies seeking authorisation reviews, industry stakeholders and other market participants.
  • Assist with litigation in the Federal Court or the Australian Competition Tribunal.

Interstate travel for this position may be required.

For more information about the role including the selection criteria, please see the attached Candidate Kit.

How to apply

When applying you will be asked to upload your resume and submit a statement of claims that is no more than 800 words, addressing the above selection criteria, taking into consideration the role and duties.

In your statement of claims please detail instances from your past that demonstrate how you meet the selection criteria. Please include an example of when you have been involved with a complex or challenging matter, what was your role and how you overcame those challenges.

When preparing your statement of claims, please take into consideration the role and duties, and detail instances from your past that demonstrate how you meet the selection criteria.

Salary: $128,977 to $151,149 per annum (plus 15.4% superannuation)

Contact Officer: Lyn Camilleri, (03) 9290 1973

This role is available on a full time, part time or job share basis.

title: Digital Marketing Star
description:
Digital Marketing Star

THE OPPORTUNITY

This is a newly created full-time role which is key in helping our team achieve the vision, “GDT strives to provide the best Health and Safety Technology tools to better assist with the physical and mental security of lone workers and vulnerable people”.  Ideally you will be an energetic, positive, genuine person who thrives in a supportive, collaborative, inclusive and client outcome focused culture. Looking after 2 brands, Worksafeguardian.com.au and loneworker.com.au, the requirement is to illustrate and communicate our solution which helps clients improve the safety, wellbeing, and sense of protection for their employees, whilst reducing their risk. Experience is preferred however passion is key and training will be provided.

VALUES

Integrity – GDT, acting with integrity in everything we do is an essential part of how we operate as it demonstrates the strong ethical behaviours all employees are expected to uphold and demonstrate within every aspect of the business.

Support – creating a supportive and warm environment for all employees is crucial in building a positive culture and increasing mental and physical well-being. All employees should feel comfortable coming into the workplace knowing that there is always someone around to guide them through any questions or concerns they may have.

Respect – GDT respects all people and welcomes diversity at all levels. Being part of a team means being able to respect one another’s rights, beliefs, and opinions on all topics and matters. GDT promotes a culture in which employees are valued for both their skills and as people, allowing all employees the chance to succeed.

Accountability – practicing accountability allows all employees the chance to take ownership of their actions and show initiative throughout all aspects of the business. Accountability allows for a proactive and reliable environment, in which all employees are given the ability to thrive and succeed.

Adaptability – is an expectation that promotes an adaptable approach throughout all aspects of our business relations. Allowing for an agile and flexible system which opens us up to necessary growth and change while maintaining mutual respect for one another.

YOUR ROLE WITH US

As this is a newly created role we are seeking someone who is creative and has a grasp of marketing processes and principles and ready to take charge of our digital presence. Working across all components of digital including Google Ads and Analytics, Bing Ads, Meta, LinkedIn, SEO and web to drive leads to the sales team as well as creating wider spread awareness of our brands and solution. Working with the team you will be managing all areas of digital from campaigns, socials, EDM’s and Search Ad’s, if it’s digital it will fall under this roles domain

COMPANY PROFILE

Global Distress Technologies (GDT) is an exciting, fast growing SA business with an expanding national presence. GDT is a solutions-based technology creator that focuses on improving the security and safety of people working or living by themselves across Australia and New Zealand. GDT’s flagship product “WorkSafe Guardian” is Australia’s 1st Professionally Monitored Safety Alert App that is used in all industries for Lone Workers.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Google Ad, Analytics and Tag platform
  • Meta and LinkedIn platforms
  • SEO tools and Website
  • Content Management
  • Marketing asset creation (videos, images, graphics & PDF’s)
  • Microsoft Office and Teams
  • Excellent communication skills and a friendly attitude
  • An eye for precision and detail
  • Conscientious, Confident, Sincere & Honest
  • CRM Experience

BENEFITS

  • Salary based remuneration
  • Great city fringe location in Norwood
  • Opportunity to be part of a growth organisation
  • Relaxed/Casual work environment
  • Modern workspace
  • Some social activities

DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?

Reliable candidates with excellent communication and interpersonal skills are encouraged to submit their resume, and salary requirements. To be considered, please submit a cover letter with a few key points that make you right for this role. We encourage anyone at any level to apply from university leavers to people with great experience.

**Candidates must have authority to work in Australia.

***Your vaccination decision is your choice

title: Security Coordinator
description:
Security Coordinator

About the Company

SA Water is proud to deliver an essential service to 1.8 million customers every day for more than 160 years. Core services protect public health, enable modern lifestyles, and contribute to economic development. SA Water delivers reliable supply of safe, sustainable, clean water services across the state, both regionally and locally.

Our strategy is comprised of five key focus-areas, which are set to achieve our vision for a future of sustainability and health for all South Australians. These values encompass customer engagement, affordable access, the wellbeing of our communities, climate adaptation, diversity and inclusion, and productivity. In support of our strategies, collaboratively, our people will be guided by specific corporate methodologies, business plans and outcome-based measures.


About the role

An exciting opportunity exists for an experienced physical Security Coordinator.  It’s an exciting time to join the team as they are currently developing a new security framework. You will bring your knowledge and experience and have direct input into the framework.

On a day-to-day basis, the Security Coordinator acts as a point of contact for the business, and liaises with other functions such as Asset Design, Capital works, Health & Safety, Supply Chain, and Operations. You will conduct security risk assessments and implement solutions to mitigate risks, and you’ll also respond to, investigate and report security incidents.

About the Person

The successful candidate will be a great communicator as you will liaise internally across different levels of the organisation. You also may liaise with the Protective Security Services Branch and SA Police as necessary. You’ll have excellent writing skills to help develop policies and procedures

You’ll also bring with you a collaborative and proactive mindset, working well with others in the team and be a critical thinker with analytical skills.

The Security Coordinator will have:

  • 5+ years of experience in a physical security role (essential)
  • The ability to attain a Baseline security level vetting (essential)
  • Experience with project coordination in a complex environment with a diverse set of stakeholders (essential)
  • Experience with Microsoft office, such as Word and Excel, teams and SharePoint (desirable)
  • Knowledge of the SAPSF and other relevant standards (desirable)

Participating in an on-call roster is required as a part of this role**


Key responsibilities:

The Security Coordinator undertakes daily security operations, conduct security risk assessments, and implement solutions to mitigate the identified risks. You will respond to, investigate, and report security incidents and you will:

  • Model SA Water Values and associated behaviours, and demonstrate genuine care for the protection and security of people, assets, and information
  • Lead by example and promote security which is people-centred, risk focused, and systems driven.
  • Provide Security leadership, direction, and expertise, and ensure Security is highly visible across the organisation.
  • Create security awareness and delivery of security training to build security capabilities of the organisation
  • Identify, develop, and coordinate security projects


If you have a passion to work within a diverse, customer-centred business, filled with passionate and self-motivated people, where fresh thinking is valued and innovation is embraced, we want to hear from you. If you relish working in an evolving environment, have a desire to work collaboratively amongst a wealth of talent, partake in rewarding work with a purpose in an exciting industry, SA Water as an organisation is a great place to be.


SA Water believe great outcomes for their customers are best delivered by a diverse and inclusive team that reflects our community. That's why SA Water encourage people seeking flexible working arrangements and from all backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, to apply and join the SA Water team.


For a copy of the position description or for further information, please contact:

Kylie Ralston
Recruitment Partner - Harrison McMillan Kylie.Ralston@harrisonmcmillan.com.au
08 7071 7214

title: Senior SEO Specialist
company: Gas and Plumbing Australia Pty Ltd
description:
We are an iconic South Australian brand, operating for over 25 years, Metropolitan Gas & Plumbing is an industry leader in residential plumbing, electrical, air con and roofing across all of Australia.

Our marketing team aim to be the leaders of digital marketing within the utilities industry and drive company growth. We collaborate and share ideas to ensure we are growing as a company and providing solutions to business objectives.

We strive to have the best talent in the industry, as we are an expanding company in South Australia. We are looking for an enthusiastic, dedicated Senior SEO Specialist to join our beautifully refurbished national head office, located on North Terrace in the heart of Adelaide.

Metropolitan are renowned for exceptional customer service and creating a memorable experiences for our customers.

The applicant will have a professional presence, being able to uphold and contribute to the ethos of Metropolitan Gas & Plumbing, able to exercise initiative, discretion and confidentiality. You will be able to prioritise tasks and time manage effectively in a fast paced office environment.

Reporting directly to the SEO/Website Manager, you will have the opportunity to take ownership of our SEO strategy across multiple brands while working directly with content writers, digital advertising managers, web/graphic designers and developers.

Plumbing is one of Australia’s most competitive SEO markets. The right candidate will possess the skills to help drive growth both locally and nationally.

As a marketing team, we collaborate and share ideas ensuring we grow together and provide solutions to business objectives.

We own multiple brands beyond Metropolitan. These brands are within our vertical, but we also have brands within horizontal markets. This means that you will be working on many different websites and projects simultaneously within different industries.

You will be required to undertake a variety of tasks including and not limited to:

Tasks & Responsibilities:

  • Growing our digital presence and increasing leads through SEO strategies
  • Backlink acquisition
  • Strategic problem solving - you’ll need to identify bottlenecks, troubleshoot and execute solutions that drive organic search ability and conversions
  • Performing keyword research, on-page SEO and internal link building
  • Writing content briefs for our in-house content team
  • Monitoring Google Analytics, Search Console and Ahrefs Site Explorer reports and communicating any issues to the SEO/Website Manager
  • Providing a weekly breakdown of all brands’ SEO performance
  • Using web analytics (Universal Analytics, GA4 and Matomo)

Qualifications & Experience:

  • A minimum of 3-5 years’ experience in a similar role
  • Demonstrated experience across Google products: Google Analytics, Google Keyword Planner, Search Console, Google Trends, and other key Google Tools
  • Proven performance in link acquisition strategies
  • Excellent working knowledge of WordPress
  • Excellent knowledge of SEO tools such as Semrush, Ahrefs, Majestic, Screaming Frog, Surfer SEO, etc.
  • Proven performance in SEO and Local SEO with knowledge of the key differences
  • Understanding the importance of SEO, the role it plays and how it impacts other departments in a high performing digital marketing team
  • Keen attention to detail and pride in work
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
  • Be contactable and able to work outside of business hours when necessary

Not essential, but highly desirable:

  • Plumbing, air conditioning, electrical and roofing knowledge
  • Google Analytics/Google Ads certifications
  • Intermediate Excel/Google Sheets knowledge
  • Experience with Google Business Profile Manager
  • Experience with digital advertising like Google Ads and Facebook Ads

Metropolitan are an equal opportunity employer whom encourage and support their teams to grow and develop. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you’re capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

If you would enjoy working with a collaborative marketing team, please apply today.

title: Manager, Research
description:
Here at the SATC, we love our state and we love what we do. We want to bring visitors to South Australia to build a prosperous economy and share the love with the rest of Australia and the world. We search for undiscovered experiences, remarkable people and immersive products, and we tenaciously seek the best.

Together we are making a difference so South Australia thrives.

The Manager, Research is responsible for providing strategic research leadership to the agency. This includes managing ongoing research requirements across the various teams in the agency, as well as identifying research gaps and potential strategic projects. The role has a key focus on facilitating communication of relevant research insights across the SATC and working within the SATC to embed the research findings into plans and strategies. The role manages strategic research projects ensuring high quality and relevant, actionable outcomes.  The role has a leadership responsibility within the Strategy and Insights team providing support to the Senior Manager, Strategy and Insights and representing the team as needed at an Executive and Board level.

Responsibilities will include but will not be limited to:

  • Work with teams within the SATC to identify research needs, define research issues and provide expert advice on research design and methodology to address gaps.
  • Maintain a strong focus on servicing the strategy needs of the Events and Marketing teams within the SATC
  • Provide project management services to SATC teams that are purchasing research, ensuring that the highest quality outcomes are achieved at a competitive cost.
  • Maintain a strong knowledge of research providers and products on offer. Provide advice on where emerging products might benefit the SATC.
  • Maintain strong and current expertise in emerging research techniques to enable high quality internal advice and management of research contractors.
  • Manage the SATC’s relationship with Tourism Research Australia (TRA) with respect to the agreed deliverables under the Service Level Agreement including the National Visitor Survey (NVS) and International Visitor Survey (IVS).
  • Act as the SATC’s representative on the national Tourism Research Committee ensuring that strategic priorities are raised and actioned.
  • Assist the Senior Manager, Strategy & Insights in the project management of the strategic and operational planning cycle for the SATC.
  • Lead workshops with SATC Business Units to facilitate the development of strategic and operational planning.

The role will be offered as a three (3) year contract and subject to six (6) months’ probation and participation in regular performance reviews.

Please note that shortlisted candidates will be required to show evidence of COVID-19 vaccinations or certified medical exemption prior to attending an interview.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working, including part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role, and candidates with an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander background are encouraged to apply.

Enquiries can be directed to People and Culture on 8463 4513 .

Position descriptions can be accessed via https://tourism.sa.gov.au/about/careers

Applications consisting of a resume and a cover letter are to be directed to Adam Stanford at the South Australian Tourism Commission via employment@sa.gov.au

Applications close: 9am 1 June 2022

title: Brand New Opportunities at Datacom Adelaide - Customer Service - Full Time
description:
Be the first to join this new and exciting opportunity to help out your fellow Australians!

We are hiring Customer Service Roles in Adelaide CBD with hybrid working from home options available. Be recognised and rewarded for your contributions while making a real difference to the lives of Australians.

As a Customer Service Representative, you will be providing essential services to people across Australia on behalf of our Australian Federal Government client. In this role you'll be operating in a dynamic team environment with a focus on meeting quality outcomes for customers.

Benefits

  • Datacom oﬀers its people the ability to make a real diﬀerence, and develop their careers within a supportive and rewarding environment.
  • We offer options for you to interview virtually
  • Best in class rewards and recognition program, including awards and corporate retail discounts on tap.
  • Talent development programs designed to engage and empower you: we want to build on your strengths and experiences and provide you with career growth within our organisation. Opportunities for development include: Leadership, Business Analytics, Administration, HR & Recruitment and IT.
  • Paid Parental Leave

Operating Hours
Our operating hours are Monday to Friday between 8:00am and 8:00pm on a rotating roster with flexibility to support all of your out of work commitments.

We understand that life can be busy, therefore, Datacom's commitment is to provide a flexible work life balance to suit any personal or family commitments whilst still maintaining full time hours.

About You

  • High attention to detail
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Clear communication skills to customers and stakeholders
  • Punctual and reliable
  • Experience adhering to KPI's
  • Able to manage customer expectations
  • Patience and empathy towards people in difficult situations
  • A team player focus, working collaboratively to exceed expectations
  • Intermediate computer skills, ability to navigate multiple screens and a typing speed of 30WPM
  • Due to Federal Government clearance requirements Australian Citizenship is required

About Datacom

Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.

We have over 6,500 people across our global offices and generate an annual revenue of over AU $1.1 billion annually. This makes us one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. We are committed to hiring, developing and promoting diverse talent.

Datacom has extensive expertise in the operation of contact centres, data centres, engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations.

Founded in 1965, we have a successful trading history of consistent growth, profitability and a track record of delivering innovative, cost effective technology solutions.

We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

If you're looking for meaningful work with genuine career progression opportunities, training and development, we'd love to hear from you.

Datacom is committed to the health and safety of its people and the wider community. Based on site access requirements for this role, the successful applicant will need to be able produce evidence of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19, or a valid exemption. Datacom will consider whether any accommodations can be made for candidates who are partially vaccinated (with remaining vaccine doses booked), or who are unable to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and hold a valid exemption.

APPLY WITH US TODAY!

title: Graduate Sales Executive
description:
About us:

San Remo is a market leader in pasta and global food manufacturer providing high quality food products to domestic and overseas customers. With some of Australia's most well-loved brands, including San Remo Pasta, Fantastic Cup Noodles, Fantastic Rice Crackers, Balfours and Monjava Coffee, San Remo continues to enhance its market position with a broad range of diverse and innovative products.

About the role:

The San Remo Graduate Program allows you to work in a variety of roles to gain all-round exposure to our Sales function and broader business. Working alongside industry experts over two years, you will gain invaluable skills and experience to help launch your sales career.

During and after the program you will the opportunity to advance your career in a wide variety of sales areas including:

  • National and State Account Management
  • Field Sales Management
  • Category Development and Analytics
  • Customer and Trade Marketing

By joining us, you’ll receive mentoring, development and support from experienced FMCG leaders and colleagues, which will help you build strong networks across the business. In addition to on-the-job experience with real accountability, you will also be involved in cross functional project teams across the business.

About you:

Passionate about making a difference in the career you choose, you will have recently graduated or are in the process of completing your studies in a business related field (eg: marketing, commerce, logistics, psychology, project management, innovation).

Driven to succeed, you are great at multi-tasking, problem-solving and have a natural empathy for others and sense of teamwork.

You may not know exactly where you want to go, but you know you’re going to get there.  Let us be part of your journey.

If you’re interested in taking up the challenge apply today!

title: Operations Management Advisor
description:
How will I Help?

We have a fantastic opportunity for Operations Management Advisor  within Westpac Group Operations (GO). You will support the end to end Workforce Planning services, capacity, and work-flow management that support and enable the business to deliver on their strategic goals.

This role will be responsible for leading and managing initiatives to optimise planning performance. Key to this is understanding and effectively integrating capability changes within the team thus ensuring alignment across the end-to-end planning process with other business units.

Preference in location is in Adelaide but is also open to other states.

Key Responsibilities:

Assist group training to ensure overall business understanding of Operational Management

Conduct regular formal AOM Capability Assessments (ACA) of Leaders

Provide ongoing coaching and consulting on inconsistencies across all GO Business Units

Meet monthly with Partner Operations Managers to discuss WFM related issues and indicate improvement opportunities

Provide ongoing coaching and consulting on inconsistencies across all Business Units.

What’s in it for me?

You’ll be working with the division as a whole to drive implementation of the strategic plan and have the opportunity to influence real change in delivering our Vision, Goals and Service Promise.

You’ll be working for an organisation that supports development, internal career moves and flexible working. Along with competitive salary, you’ll receive Westpac’s generous benefits and a whole array of customer discounts!

Westpac Group has been around for over 200 years and offers employees a multitude of opportunities.  We aim to attract the best people inside and outside of the business – building an organisation where the best talent thrives.

What do I need?

You will bring with you your strong experience in Strategic Workforce Planning. You will be experienced in working with complexity and ambiguity and managing through complex organisation. You will hold stakeholder management skills and be highly proficient with both your verbal and written communication. You will be asked to challenge and hold your own amongst some key people across the organisation and provide your thought leadership on several matters.

As well as:

Lead and facilitate workforce planning initiatives including, but not limited to, critical role/capability identification, environmental scanning, gap analysis, risk analysis, and action planning

Manage workforce analytics tool for the enterprise

Capacity Planning and Workforce Management

Drive performance improvement campaigns supported by data analytics and insights

Manage performance and resources efficiently and effectively.

What is it like to work there?

You’ll join one big, supportive team to reach our purpose of Helping Australians Succeed.

Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. Think inspiring locations, flexible work spaces and unexpected careers.

As an equal opportunity employer, we celebrate difference and love having a diverse and inclusive workplace.

How do I Apply?

Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.

As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.

The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We’ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they’re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.

title: Integration Developer
description:
• Full-time permanent role based at Mile End
  • Fantastic opportunity to join a rapidly growing IT department
  • For questions contact: 0477 560 714

Your new opportunity

As we scale, we need more specialised IT experts to evolve our technology and business across a broad range of areas. Our IT experts play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our business. This exciting opportunity will have you develop, document and test application integration based on supplied specifications. In addition, you will:

  • Establish and maintain relationships with business stakeholders to develop and deliver tailored solutions
  • Develop & test integration artefacts
  • Migrate changes and content between environments
  • Install and maintain appropriate integration development tools and environments
  • Provide 2nd level fault analysis on integrations and associated services
  • Maintain documentation of changes to integrations and associated services

What will set you apart from the rest

At RAA we hire on cultural add first and technical fit second, however, to be successful in this role you will need:

  • The ability to read and comprehend technical material, distil appropriate concepts and apply them
  • Experience programming in C# and JavaScript
  • Experience developing integration components
  • Knowledge of Azure DevOps CI/CD and Integration Services
  • Effective communication skills and strong attention to detail

What sets us apart from the rest

To ensure our employees feel valued, empowered and celebrated we provide a range of employee benefits including:

  • Free RAA premium road service & discounts on all RAA Products
  • Flexible Work Arrangements
  • Ongoing Training & Development Opportunities & Study Support Program
  • Wellbeing Facilities and Corporate Health Insurance Plan
  • On-site Cafe with Barista - plus much more!



How to apply

Simply hit "Apply for this job" to access further information found in the position description or follow the prompts to apply.


We're committed to building a workplace that's diverse and inclusive, where employees are embraced for their unique qualities and valued for their contributions. We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in everyone, and helps us to give our members better service.

Who we are -

As one of the state's largest and most iconic organisations, we're proud to make things better for members and better for our community. More than 780,000 members choose us to deliver peace of mind through our trusted range of motor, home and travel products and services. We're also one of the state's largest employers (and growing!), with more than 1200 employees working collectively with the common goal to keep our members moving.

title: Software Engineer Python (Edinburgh, SA)
description:
About the Role:

As a talented Python developer, you will join a small team working closely with our customer to develop automated network analysis and threat detection software to provide a state-of-the-art cyber security solution.

Essential Knowledge and Skills:

  • Tertiary qualification or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Software Engineering or relevant discipline
  • Full stack development experience (backend, database, web UI)
  • Demonstrated Python development experience
  • History of developing web-based user interfaces, particularly with JavaScript
  • Experience using Software Configuration Management tools (e.g. Git) and Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment tools (e.g. Bamboo or Travis)
  • Experience with Linux and Linux development
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Experience in working with small client-facing teams
  • Australian citizen (note: permanent residents or VISA holders are not eligible for this role due to Federal Government security requirements).

Desirable Knowledge and Skills:

  • Experience with backend database design and implementation across a variety of platforms (preferably ElasticSearch and SQL)
  • Familiarity with containerized web application development and deployment tools, such as Docker
  • Experience developing software to process data pipelines and message queues
  • Familiarity with virtual infrastructure such as VMWare vSphere
  • Knowledge of cyber security tools or concepts
  • An interest in Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning/Deep Learning concepts.

To be considered, candidates will have:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Successful candidates must be eligible to hold and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance. Eligibility requirements can be found at http://www.defence.gov.au/agsva.

Benefits working for Consunet:

  • A workplace that believes in innovation, quality, and a work-life balance.
  • Flexible, inclusive and friendly work environment.
  • Competitive remuneration.
  • Salary packaging options.
  • Career and skills progression through training and development to team members.
  • Access to cutting-edge technology, research, and agile project management practices.
  • Mentoring and support from our experienced team members.

About the Company:

Consunet is headquartered in the Adelaide CBD with operations in Adelaide, Edinburgh (SA) and Canberra. A level of flexibility is generally offered with respect to work location. If you have specific requirements, please discuss them during your interview.

Our people create world-leading trusted cyber and spectrum security technology solutions that safeguard our customers' interests. As a 100% Australian-owned and operated corporation, Consunet strives to be the country's leading sovereign cyber and spectrum security solution developer, and trusted industry partner to the Australian Defence and cyber security communities. The company has a strong research and development and collaboration emphasis, implements Agile development and management processes, and has a proven track record of delivering and sustaining in-service operational capabilities for Defence and commercial customers. Our vision “to build the Australian cyber and spectrum security future” is firmly rooted in everything we do.

To Apply:

Click “Apply Now”. Please attach a cover letter summarising your experience when applying.

title: Finance Business Systems Specialist
description:
FINANCE BUSINESS SYSTEMS SPECIALIST

The Opportunity

Peregrine’s growth journey is just beginning…

The Finance Business Specialist will be instrumental in improving the functional integrations and relationships between the finance core of the ERP and other related systems.

Reporting to our Finance Business Systems Manager, you will support internal users and champion best practices use of our ERP system.

Who are we?

Peregrine is one of the largest private organisations in Australia with over 5000 staff.  One of our most recognisable brands is OTR and we are changing the way our guests think about convenience retailing.

At OTR, we believe in making our customer's lives easier. We are on an amazing growth trajectory as we take our highly successful business model nationwide growing from our current base 160+ locations.

Today we serve over 1 million guests a month making their lives easier by meeting a broad range of their fuel, drinks, food and beverage needs through a portfolio of brands including EAT, C Coffee, Subway, Oporto, GYG and HappyWash.

Read more about us here:

https://www.peregrine.com.au/ [link removed]

https://www.ontherun.com.au/ [link removed]

What will you be responsible for?

  • Assist with the implementation of a financial control framework in line with internal policy that utilises system functionality as much as possible
  • Monitor existing controls and integrations to ensure they are up to date and effective
  • Maintain system controls or raise requests with IT for required changes as required
  • Assist with the review of system controls and workflows periodically to ensure the integrity of accuracy and control
  • Assist with understanding and improving internal finance workflows
  • Capture functional requirements and contribute to new enhancement, development or integration projects relating to our core finance systems
  • Undertake testing activities to support proposed changes or projects and provide recommendations for sign-off
  • Collaborate with IT to the extent that activities require IT clearance or support

What skills and experience will our ideal candidate have?

  • Strong analysis/problem solving skills, able to listen and articulate back for feedback and solutions
  • Sound Accounting knowledge coupled with previous experience in a large, fast paced organization
  • Highly developed written communication and documentation skills.
  • Able to build relationships and effectively promote urgency when resolving problems
  • Strong presentation skills to present progress updates to Senior Management
  • Experience in business/technical function or in a project management role
  • Credible change agent with demonstrated ERP Skills
  • Excellent decision-making abilities
  • Solid understanding of business operations

What’s in it for you?

Where do we start? What’s important to you? What about this for starters…

  • A culture of care, reputation, equality and determination
  • Work with some of the brightest and best minds in Australia
  • Work in our (soon to be finished) renovated offices on the Parade, close to boutique shops and excellent cafés and restaurants
  • Be part of the growth story of an exceptional business
  • Build a career and drive your own future
  • A competitive salary package

If you want to talk to us about becoming part of the team, click “apply now” and upload your current CV and Cover letter…. What are you waiting for?

Please note only shortlisted applicants will be contacted

title: Associate Professor / Professor in Tourism
description:
About the Role

UniSA Business is ranked in the top 1% worldwide by EFMD Global and is one of just 12 institutions in Australia to be EQUIS accredited. Our business program is rated 5 stars for excellence (2022 QS Rankings), and we offer the #4 ranked MBA program in Australia.

As a leading expert in the Tourism discipline, you will design, deliver and coordinate courses for our undergraduate, post graduate and MBA programs, and develop a program of collaborative research that supports the research agenda of the UniSA Business School.

You will make an outstanding contribution to all activities of the Business School and will play a strategic leadership role through the fostering of national and international links with universities, accrediting bodies, and industry. As an eminent authority in the discipline, you will also mentor other academic team members and participate in academic committees, groups and strategy planning forums as appropriate.

About UniSA

The University of South Australia is Australia’s University of Enterprise. Our culture of innovation is anchored around global and national links to academic, research and industry partners. Our graduates are the new urban professionals, global citizens at ease with the world and ready to create and respond to change. Our research is inventive and adventurous and we create new knowledge that is central to global economic and social prosperity.

UniSA Business prepare students for global careers, creating leaders for change whose skills and knowledge shape business, industry and policy. Our research programs are inspired by the contemporary challenges facing Australia and its region, and we share our expertise in modern business practice with partners locally and worldwide.

Core Responsibilities

  • Lead the development of courses and employ innovative and contemporary teaching methods
  • Undertake nationally and internationally recognised research and attract external funding from competitive grant schemes
  • Provide high quality supervision to higher degree by research (HDR) students
  • Initiate, foster and enhance national and international links with other universities, industries and accrediting bodies
  • Mentor other academic team members and contribute to the overall leadership of UniSA Business


Essential Skills and Experience

The level of appointment will depend on qualifications and experience relating to Level D or Level E requirements.

In addition to a doctoral degree, you will demonstrate sustained, high-quality teaching and research experience with discipline expertise in Tourism. You will have experience working collaboratively with industry and/or government organisations to support research and teaching outcomes.

Benefits

Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as:

  • Access to great personal development opportunities
  • Competitive salary negotiated under the Enterprise bargaining agreement
  • Employee assistance and development programs
  • A range of salary packaging options, including vehicle leasing, laptops and car parking fees
  • Various on-site services available at our campuses which may include on-site gym membership


Culture

As a University of Enterprise, we offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our staff are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm. We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results.

How to Apply

For a copy of the position description and to apply, please visit Working at UniSA . The online application form will list the specific selection criteria that you need to address.

Please address your cover letter to Jade Windsor, Senior Consultant: Recruitment Central. For further information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact UniSA Recruitment Central on +61 8 8302 1700 or via email at recruitment@unisa.edu.au using job reference number 4075 .

Applications close: 11.30pm Monday 27 June 2022

title: Digital Marketer. Make your mark!
description:
Digital Marketer

THE OPPORTUNITY

This is a newly created full-time role which is key in helping our team achieve our vision, “GDT strives to provide the best Health and Safety Technology tools to better assist with the physical and mental security of lone workers and vulnerable people”.  Ideally you will be an energetic, positive, genuine person who thrives in a supportive, collaborative, inclusive and client outcome focused culture. Looking after 2 brands, Worksafeguardian.com.au and loneworker.com.au over all mediums, the requirement is to illustrate and communicate our solution which helps clients improve the safety, wellbeing, and sense of protection for their employees, whilst reducing their risk. Experience is preferred however passion is key and training will be provided in key areas if required.

VALUES

Integrity – GDT, acting with integrity in everything we do is an essential part of how we operate as it demonstrates the strong ethical behaviours all employees are expected to uphold and demonstrate within every aspect of the business.

Support – creating a supportive and warm environment for all employees is crucial in building a positive culture and increasing mental and physical well-being. All employees should feel comfortable coming into the workplace knowing that there is always someone around to guide them through any questions or concerns they may have.

Respect – GDT respects all people and welcomes diversity at all levels. Being part of a team means being able to respect one another’s rights, beliefs, and opinions on all topics and matters. GDT promotes a culture in which employees are valued for both their skills and as people, allowing all employees the chance to succeed.

Accountability – practicing accountability allows all employees the chance to take ownership of their actions and show initiative throughout all aspects of the business. Accountability allows for a proactive and reliable environment, in which all employees are given the ability to thrive and succeed.

Adaptability – is an expectation that promotes an adaptable approach throughout all aspects of our business relations. Allowing for an agile and flexible system which opens us up to necessary growth and change while maintaining mutual respect for one another.

YOUR ROLE WITH US

As this is a newly created role we are seeking someone who is creative and has a grasp of marketing processes and principles and ready to take charge of our digital presence. Working across all components of digital including Google Ads and Analytics, Bing Ads, Meta, LinkedIn, SEO and web to drive leads to the sales team as well as creating wider spread awareness of our brands and solution. Working with the team you will be managing all areas of digital from campaigns, socials, EDM’s and Search Ad’s, if it’s digital it will fall under this roles domain.

COMPANY PROFILE

Global Distress Technologies (GDT) is an exciting, fast growing SA business with an expanding national presence. GDT is a solutions-based technology creator that focuses on improving the security and safety of people working or living by themselves across Australia and New Zealand. GDT’s flagship product “WorkSafe Guardian” is Australia’s 1st Professionally Monitored Safety Alert App that is used in all industries for Lone Workers.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Google Ad, Analytics and Tag platform
  • Meta and LinkedIn platforms
  • SEO tools and Website
  • Content Management
  • Marketing asset creation (videos, images, graphics & PDF’s)
  • Microsoft Office and Teams
  • Excellent communication skills and a friendly attitude
  • An eye for precision and detail
  • Conscientious, Confident, Sincere & Honest
  • CRM Experience

BENEFITS

  • Salary based remuneration
  • Great city fringe location in Norwood
  • Opportunity to be part of a growth organisation
  • Relaxed/Casual work environment
  • Modern workspace
  • Some social activities

DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?

Reliable candidates with excellent communication and interpersonal skills are encouraged to submit their resume, and salary requirements. To be considered, please submit a cover letter with a few key points that make you right for this role. We encourage anyone at any level to apply from university leavers to people with great experience.

**Candidates must have authority to work in Australia.

***Your vaccination decision is your choice

title: Senior Test Analyst
description:
Peoplebank are recruiting for a Senior Test Analyst (with specific experience in integration Testing) to work on a long-term project (happy to consider hourly rate contractors or a permanent engagement) based in Adelaide CBD.


There is some flexibility to WFH, but onsite presence is needed in Adelaide on a regular basis (so it's NOT 100% WFH)


Responsibilities will include:

  • Identifying, designing and developing test cases according to specifications.
  • Participating in review of requirement specification documents to make sure requirements are complete, not ambiguous and not in conflict to other requirements.
  • Performing functional, non-functional, integration and system testing in line with test cases for the project.
  • Creating and maintaining test data according to the organisational privacy requirements to be used in test execution.
  • Recording test results, raising defects and re-testing fixes.
  • Creating test reports and communicating status of assigned testing tasks to testing lead and management
  • Providing realistic estimates to Test Lead for assigned testing tasks.
  • Maintaining the test management system e.g. HP ALM and JIRA according to organisational and program standards and processes for testing
  • Adhering to all organisational policies, procedures, standards and practices.


Skills and experience required:

  • 5+ years prior experience working as a Test Analyst on complex projects.
  • Proven experience in planning and executing various forms of testing of enterprise computer applications, particularly system, acceptance and regression testing.
  • Proven experience with use of test repositories and testing tools
  • Proven experience in verifying COTS applications.

So don't delay and APPLY NOW and will contact all suitable applicants within 24 hours to discuss this exciting role!
