title: Supervisor EO Technical Team (Edinburgh Parks)
description:
We’re inventing the future, right here, right now, at Thales. We design the critical security solutions of tomorrow by combining the curiosity to explore, the intelligence to question and the vision to create. Together we solve complicated problems by combining our experience in the market with our leading research and development capabilities.

About Your Role:

Thales Australia provides logistics services expertise to our customer, the Australian Defence Force. Thales will train and qualify you to work in each area of our logistics business including, storage, maintenance and distribution. This will be comprised of ‘on the job’ training as well as courses through our in-house registered training organisation.

The Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG) provides a critical role in safeguarding Australia through a world-class, compliant and safe Defence and national security explosives research capability.

The EO Supervisor applies specialist EO (Explosive Ordnance) knowledge and experience to conduct and supervise EO facilities and specialist S&T support operations. This includes the supervision of EO technical staff in support of DST EO activities to ensure safety, compliance and customer service.

This is an initial 12 months fixed term contract with multiple extension

  • EO Facilities operations, management, maintenance and inspection
  • EO Equipment management, maintenance and accounting
  • EO Technical and Logistics support
  • Storage, Handling, Accounting and Transport of EO and Non Explosives Dangerous Goods (NEDG)
  • Support to EO Inventory assurance and stocktaking
  • Support to EO Disposal
  • Plan, supervise, conduct and support EO enabling tasks, tests and trials in support of the AOT Team
  • Coordinate and escort maintenance/repair personnel working in DST EO facilities
  • Identify reactive maintenance requirements through the conduct of day to day activities and monthly EO Facility Inspections
  • Implementation of appropriate occupational health and safety policies and procedures in the workplace
  • Supervise, conduct and/or support the transport by road of Research and Service EO and NEDG within DST Port Wakefield, Edinburgh and Woomera
  • Supervise and conduct the preparation of documentation for the transport of EO by road/air
  • Supervise and conduct the safe storage, unpacking, handling, inspection, repacking, marking and sealing of EO

How About You:

  • Completed training/demonstrated competence Certificate IV in EO or the ability to obtain
  • Knowledge of storage, distribution and/or warehousing as well as MS office suite
  • Ability to lead a small team with proven stakeholder engagement skills
  • Apply technical knowledge and experience to assist with the unpacking, repackaging and sealing of EO
  • Knowledge and experience of EO facilities inspection and stock checks.
  • Experience in EO stock control tasks (including but not limited to issuing and receiving of EO)

Good to Know

You’ll get an email acknowledgement after you’ve applied, Thales strives to provide a personalised experience for all suitable applicants.

As a Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain an appropriate clearance.  To learn more about clearances please visit – http://www.defence.gov.au/AGSVA/

Prior to offer you’ll complete a pre-employment police and medical.

For more information on Thales visit us @ThalesCareers on Instagram

Thales is committed to promoting and maintaining a workplace culture of shared respect that enables all of us to feel valued, do our best, and remain truly passionate about the place that we work. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive, barrier-free recruitment process and supportive workplace. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and individuals from diverse backgrounds.

We are also proud to be a WORK180 Endorsed Employer for Women. If you would like to know more on how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives here: https://work180.com/en-AU/for-women/employer/thales [link removed].

Wellbeing matters at Thales, and where possible we encourage flexible working.

title: SuccessFactors Talent Specialist Functional Consultant
description:
Must-Have:

  • Minimum 8 - 10 End-End-To Implementations in RCM, ONB, PMGM & SPCDP
  • Certified in SuccessFactors Recruiting Management (RCM)
  • Certified in SuccessFactors Onboarding (ONB)
  • Certified in SuccessFactors Performance and Goals Management (PMGM)
  • Certified in SuccessFactors Succession Planning and Development (SPCDP)

  • Handled, configurations/changes in the areas of RCM Data Models, Requisitions, Candidate Profile, Application and Offer templates setup for RCM

  • Good Knowledge in Goal setting and Performance Processes
  • Experience in Goal cascading, Group and Team Goals functionalities
  • Experience with Continuous Performance Management and knowledge in 360 Degree multi rater templates
  • Knowledge in identifying the talent gaps with career paths that link to development plans and learning activities (through SAP SuccessFactors Learning)

  • Continuously upgrade self and customers with the bi-annual upgrades in SuccessFactors

title: Business Liaison: AUCBG (HEO 5)
description:
About the Role

In this client-focused and diverse role, you will identify suitable Business candidates and convert their interest into enrolment in the Centre for Business Growth’s world-class programs. You will represent the Centre at networking events and conferences to meet with and engage potential participants and will provide them with expert information and tailored advice.

You will have the opportunity to assist in the preparation and development of proposals for programs and provide support for marketing initiatives such as social media and events. You will also develop a range of processes to support the business activities of the Centre and have a proficiency with a range of information systems, including Salesforce.

About UniSA

The University of South Australia is Australia’s University of Enterprise. Our culture of innovation is anchored around global and national links to academic, research and industry partners. Our graduates are the new urban professionals, global citizens at ease with the world and ready to create and respond to change. Our research is inventive and adventurous and we create new knowledge that is central to global economic and social prosperity.

Core Responsibilities

  • Identify potential candidates of the Centre’s programs and work to convert interest to enrolments
  • Provide information and support, assess candidate suitability, and facilitate the enrolment and induction processes
  • Represent the Centre at networking events and conferences and engage with potential participants
  • Develop, implement, and monitor systems, processes, and templates to support business liaison activities
  • Maintain the client relationship management (CRM) database of existing and potential candidates


Essential Skills and Experience

  • Tertiary qualifications in Business or an appropriate discipline or equivalent demonstrated knowledge and skills
  • Experience in a sales related environment with a focus on achieving targets and client service management
  • Demonstrated experience in project management with ability to work to timeframes
  • High level analytical ability to interpret information and provide detailed reports and recommendations
  • Experience with various administrative information systems and web-based programs, including Salesforce


Benefits

Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as:

  • Access to great personal development opportunities
  • Generous superannuation contributions of 17%
  • Flexible working conditions
  • Employee assistance and development programs
  • A range of salary packaging options, including vehicle leasing, laptops and car parking fees


Culture

As a University of Enterprise, we offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our staff are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm. We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results.

How to Apply

For a copy of the position description and to apply, please visit Working at UniSA. The online application form will list the specific selection criteria that you need to address.

Please address your cover letter to Jade Windsor, Senior Consultant: Recruitment Central. For further information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact UniSA Recruitment Central on +61 8 8302 1700 or via email at recruitment@unisa.edu.au using job reference number 4080 .

Applications close: 11.30pm Monday 6 June 2022

Applications welcomed from Australian or NZ citizens, Australian permanent residents and those who have the legal right to work in Australia for the term of appointment.

title: Senior IT Consultant
description:
Our Story…

Enhanced Lifestyles is a not-for-profit, customer driven organisation, offering personalised choices in service options to South Australians with disabilities. Our service was developed by people with disabilities, to give them real choices about the type of services they need to retain independence in their homes and in the community. It ensures our customers have control over their lives and manage all elements of their services.

The success of our organisation is because of our people. Diversity is our strength; through their potential we unlock together. We encourage innovative ideas and help each other be better by providing ongoing career opportunities to grow and evolve.

The Role…

We are on the hunt for a Senior IT Consultant . This exciting and newly created position has come about as result of our continued growth and the need for us to embed a diverse suite of new IT applications, frameworks, and policies. This will be an awesome opportunity for a suitably credentialled senior technician to play a key role in the development and implementation of our ICT roadmap.

As our Senior IT Consultant, you will have a deep understanding of the IT landscape and ideally in and around the Disability and or Not for Profit sector. You will be that type of person who has the natural ability to break down any barriers, develop amazing relationships with our employees and customers, and deliver end to end IT services, from conceptual design through to transformed IT technology environments.

The role will be responsible for envisaging, developing, executing, and optimising highly relevant IT strategies, programs and software to enable our services and people to build our presence and competence in the Disability and Community Sector. You will effortlessly liaise with internal stakeholders in order to understand their operational requirements and find appropriate IT technological solutions to exceed these needs. This is a non-managerial role requiring a high level of technical knowledge and expertise.

What skills, qualifications and experience will our ideal candidate have…

  • Demonstrated experience in a similar role, ideally within an SME that is going through substantial growth and change.
  • Accomplished and technically competent in IT infrastructure, applications and networking, ideally with current experience and oversight of Azure, Sharepoint, Exchange and related desktop and application virtualisation technologies.
  • Advanced current awareness of cybersecurity threats, trends and protective strategies.
  • Strong internal customer service ethos and continual improvement focus.
  • Demonstrated success in infrastructure architecture, project delivery, procurement, system administration, solutions architecture and supplier management.
  • Possession of appropriate tertiary qualifications in related IT discipline / cybersecurity, together with 5+ years' experience in a senior technical role.
  • As project implementation will play a key foundation to this role, qualifications and experience in Project Management would be ideal.

Key Competencies…

  • Collaboration
    • Effective liaison, including information and advice to employees at all levels and across all business units and support functions.
    • Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships across all levels of the organisation.
  • Innovative / Solutions orientated Approach
    • Delivery of high quality, results-oriented customer-focused (internal and external) solutions.
    • Analysis and advice to a diverse audience to assist and influence decision-making.
  • Leadership
    • Ability to provide constructive feedback and guidance to management and employees with positive results.
    • Identification of staff training and developmental activities with resultant enhancement of job effectiveness and career development.
  • Strategic and commercial agility
    • Demonstrates resilience, creativity and problem-solving.
    • Personal accountability demonstrated through monitoring, evaluation and improvement.
    • Strong time management and prioritisation experience.

Checks…

  • A current Working with Children Check & NDIS Worker Screening or ability to obtain one.
  • Please note, where there is a public health directive that the position requires a Covid or any other vaccination the incumbent will be required to adhere to the public health directive.

What's in it for you…

  • An attractive remuneration package, plus superannuation and salary sacrifice tax benefit.
  • Flexible work from home opportunities.
  • Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping employees realise their potential. If you need a certificate or qualification in order to grow and protect our business - we can support you to achieve these skillsets.
  • An exciting career - As our business grows, so do the opportunities for our you and our people.

We’d love to hear from you…

We care about creating a workplace where our employees feel valued, respected, and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, or life stage. As our organisation continues to grow, we encourage our employees to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to develop and make a real difference.

Forward to us your CV and cover letter today and be a part of our amazing organisation!

title: Assistant Director - Sustainable Finance
company: Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment
description:
Apply your finance and banking expertise to increase the resilience of Australia’s natural environment and the agricultural sector to climate change

Opportunities and Challenges

The Financing Solutions for Nature team has an exciting opportunity for a finance professional with experience in the commercial finance and banking sectors to combine a passion for positively impacting climate change challenges with a federal government role.

The team is developing frontier policy initiatives to increase private investment in Australia’s natural capital by helping the finance sector to recognise, value and invest in natural capital.

You will be joining a high-performing and dedicated team that aims to progress the recognition of natural capital as a financial asset class and demonstrate that improvements to natural capital will provide productivity, profitability and resilience benefits.

This exciting work also involves engaging with a range of industry, government, finance and scientific stakeholders.

The Role

As a key advisor and leader in the Financing Solutions for Nature team, you will draw on your understanding of the finance and banking sectors, and your ability to identify opportunities to catalyse increased private sector investment in Australia’s natural capital. Your specialist policy advice will help establish innovative initiatives and drive policy development.

Responsibilities include:

  • Leading a team to deliver high quality analysis and policy advice with a particular focus on advising on how natural capital considerations can be integrated into financial sector decision making, including to the minister and senior executives
  • Developing and managing effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders, to achieve area and agency goals
  • Managing the day to day operations of a small team, including coaching and monitoring staff workload and performance, and quality assuring team outputs

To learn more about the opportunity, please review the position description.

Erecruit job reference:  2022/2498

Your Background & Experience


We welcome individuals with a diverse range of skills, knowledge and experiences – both from in and outside government.

You will need to demonstrate:

  • Familiarity with the banking and finance sectors OR sustainable finance, ESG reporting and disclosure
  • A strong track record of exercising sound judgement; drawing on strategic thinking and problem-solving skills to deliver results
  • The ability to provide advice on complex areas of policy to a minister and/or senior executive
  • Experience informing the development of data driven decision-making support tools for the finance sector

The following areas of formal study will be highly regarded:

  • Economics/ banking/ finance
  • Law
  • Natural resource management/ economics
  • Data analytics/ integration

Work With Us

The work we do today, matters for tomorrow. Join the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment (DAWE) and enjoy:

  • Access to training and development
  • Health and wellbeing focused culture
  • Permanent full-time or part-time hours
  • Salary: $112,294 - $120,780 + Super

We are Canberra based however we are open to discussing flexible working arrangements, including working remotely from other locations in Australia.

To be eligible for employment with the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment you must be an Australian citizen.

How to apply

For more details on how to apply, please click the appropriate link below.

Alternatively for a discussion regarding this role please contact:

Name: Nicole Yazbek-Martin

Phone number: 02 5156 5721

Email address: nicole-yazbek-martin1@environment.gov.au

Flexible employment arrangements are available with the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment

title: Clinical Coder/Privacy Officer
description:
Clinical Coder/Privacy Officer

Permanent Full Time Opportunity!

Join an organisation with a genuine commitment to family friendly practices, work-life balance and a wide array of learning and development programs. We offer strong, flexible career paths and provide unique opportunities to work across Ramsay’s network of facilities.

The Opportunity

Ramsay Clinic Adelaide is looking for an experienced Clinical Coder to join our coding team. Due to a commitment to high quality coded data, expanding services, an increasingly diverse case mix, auditing and training opportunities. We offer a flexible work environment and extensive support network of Health Information Managers, Clinical coders, Clinical Documentation Specialists and educators.

We are committed to developing your coding skills and professional development is supported and encouraged.

Essential criteria:

  • Recognised degree or qualification in ICD-10-AM coding

Desirable:

  • Minimum 2 to 5 years hospital medical record coding experience covering a variety of specialities
  • Experience in the use of 3M Codefinder software;
  • Knowledge of health fund contracts and Australian Revised Diagnostic Related Groups (ARDRG);
  • Sound IT skills
  • Excellent organisational & communication skills;
  • Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritise;
  • Commitment to high standards of service through a continuous improvement focus;

Why Ramsay?

  • Flexible work practices to best match your work/life balance
  • Professional Development – Grow your career across our national network!
  • Employee assistance program
  • Industry discounts across private health insurance, retail services, financial services and more. [link removed]

Why Ramsay Clinic Adelaide?

Ramsay Clinic Adelaide is a part of the Ramsay Health Care South Australian Mental Health Services Group of hospitals and is a leading provider of psychiatric services in this State. A teaching facility of the University of Adelaide, the Clinic provides a full range of general, acute and specialised psychiatric services and community outreach services.

Ramsay Health Care also offers:

  • Flexible work practices to best match your work/life balance
  • Professional Development – Grow your career across our national network!
  • Employee assistance program
  • Industry discounts across private health insurance, retail services, financial services and more. [link removed]

How to apply

All applications must be lodged online. Please click the Apply button within this ad to lodge an application.

Requirements

Everyone who joins Ramsay:

  • Must be vaccinated against Covid-19, including a third dose if required under State health orders
  • Must provide a National Police check conducted within the previous 12 months
  • According to the role, Ramsay may require a Working-With-Children check and proof of immunisation against infectious diseases.

If you have any questions about this opportunity, please contact Carolyn Turnbull, Chief Executive Officer on TurnbullC@ramsayhealth.com.au

Applications close: 4th June 2022 at 11.55pm

title: Senior Technical Officer
description:
(HE06) $81,254 to $87,770 plus an employer contribution of up to 17% superannuation may apply.

Continuing full time position available immediately.

The Technical Services team provide operational support across the Faculty relating to laboratory management, Health, Safety and Wellbeing (HSW), Infrastructure support, teaching and shared laboratory support and laboratory materials receipt and distribution. The position will be primarily located at the Adelaide Health and Medical Sciences building adjacent SAHMRI, but on occasion will be required to assist the team located on the eastern side down at Helen Mayo North and Helen Mayo South.

The Senior Technical Officer works under general direction, to deliver high quality services in the management and coordination of precinct research operations, liaising with researchers and Faculty support services, to enhance Faculty of Health & Medical Sciences research activities.

The Senior Technical Officer provides support for research operations, facilities, infrastructure and events, as required. The position facilitates researcher accommodation, facilities, procurement, finance and data needs and works closely with researchers, affiliates and Faculty service providers to ensure seamless and cohesive support services.

To be successful you will need:

  • Knowledge of the University sector, funding of research and of related structures and processes in a research-oriented field.
  • Demonstrated experience in coordinating and undertaking a range of operational research support services including administrative, financial, facilities management, asset management and data management functions at the faculty level.
  • Demonstrated experience communicating, both verbally and in writing, in a succinct, professional and responsive manner to deliver client centric results.
  • Demonstrated experience delivering high quality administrative support and services to senior professional and academic staff.
  • Demonstrated ability to promote the organisational values of integrity, respect, collegiality, excellence and discovery, and a commitment to positively comply with the associated behaviour expectations.

Enjoy an outstanding career environment

The University of Adelaide is a uniquely rewarding workplace. The size, breadth and quality of our education and research programs - including significant industry, government and community collaborations - offers you a vast scope and opportunity for a long, fulfilling career.

It also enables us to attract high-calibre people in all facets of our operations, ensuring you will be surrounded by talented colleagues, many world-leading. Our work's cutting-edge nature - not just in your own area, but across virtually the full spectrum of human endeavour - provides a constant source of inspiration.

Our culture is one that welcomes all and embraces diversity consistent with our Staff Values and Behaviour Framework and our Values of integrity, respect, collegiality, excellence and discovery. We firmly believe that our people are our most valuable asset, so we work to grow and diversify the skills, knowledge and capability of all our staff.

We embrace flexibility as a key principle to allow our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal and family life. Flexible working arrangements are on offer for all roles at the University.

In addition, we offer a wide range of attractive staff benefits. These include: salary packaging; flexible work arrangements; high-quality professional development programs and activities; and an on-campus health clinic, gym and other fitness facilities.

Learn more at: adelaide.edu.au/jobs

Your faculty's broader role

The Faculty of Health and Medical Sciences contains one of Australia's largest concentrations of leading health researchers, teachers and clinical titleholders. title: DA Planner
description:

title: Payroll System Business Consultant
description:
About the opportunity

Ascender is a leading Payroll and HCM SaaS and managed services provider across AsiaPac; Ascender has recently been acquired by Ceridian, a global leader in human capital management (HCM) technology.   We have new opportunities for Business Consultants across all of Australia - Perth, Melbourne, Brisbane, Sydney & Adelaide


Use your expertise in Payroll, Human Resources systems and the Ascender Pay platform to deliver projects.


What you’ll get to do

  • Deliver professional services engagements ranging from small to large projects for the implementation of Ascender Pay
  • Lead small to medium projects such as Ascender Pay version upgrades or discrete medium to large and complex Ascender Pay application implementations
  • Lead requirements gathering workshops/exercises and prepare detailed client requirements documentation
  • Undertake analysis of client business requirements and prepare functional design specifications detailing proposed solutions
  • Complete configuration of the Ascender Pay payroll platform to meet client requirements
  • Prepare test plans and conduct testing of the Ascender Pay payroll platform solution
  • Train clients in the use of the Ascender Pay payroll platform

What’s in it for you

  • Encouragement to be the best version of yourself at and away from work:
    • YOUnity diversity and inclusion programs
    • Amazing time away from work programs
  • Support for your total well-being through our Live Well, Work Well programs targeting all aspects of your life
  • Recognition for your contributions through excellent pay, perks, and rewards
  • Giving where you’re living: volunteer days, Ceridian sponsored events, and our very own charity, Ceridian Cares
  • Opportunities to fuel your career growth through numerous internal and external programs and events
  • Flexible work options
  • Vibrant team-based culture that supports improvement and change
  • Opportunity to work on integration activities and accounting policy alignment within a global environment; growth agenda across AsiaPac.
  • Opportunity to add value and shape best practice

Skills and experience we value

You'll bring a track record of successful delivery of timely and accurate client-facing consulting services.
You have technical knowledge of HR/Personnel, Payroll and Leave practices, procedures, operations, and local legislation. Hands-on experience using or configuring payroll and/or HRIS systems. If you have a strong understanding of system integrations and transformation of business rules, it's an advantage. Ascender Pay experiences would be great, but don't worry, we'll train you if you don't.

When restrictions lift you may need flexibility to travel and work at client sites as you'd deliver project implementations. You're motivated to get the work done, micromanagement isn't for you and you have a high level of initiative. You can break down technical language into easy speak for non-technical people.

title: Multiple Cyber Security Opportunities
description:
The Opportunity

Boeing Defence Australia (BDA) is rapidly growing its cyber security capabilities to meet the needs of an ever changing world.

Due to sustained growth we are now recruiting for a number of positions across multiple programs at both senior and junior levels:

1. Senior Cyber Security Specialists.
2. Cyber Security Leads.
3. Cyber Security Architects.
4. Security Governance and Compliance specialists.
5. Network Security Specialists.
6. Cyber Operations/Security Analysts.
7. Cyber Risk and Threat Analysts.

Roles exist in Brisbane, Adelaide and Williamtown.

Responsibilities

Working in the BDA Information & Cyber Security Capability you will have the opportunity to contribute to a number of exciting and innovative programs, working across air, land, sea and space, while bringing your information security expertise to bear on world class Defence capabilities.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Interfacing with our customer on all matters relating to information security and Cyberworthiness.
  • Evaluating and responding to emerging security issues. Identify cyber security risks/gaps and coordinating actions to meet objectives.
  • Participating in evaluation of process effectiveness and identifying areas for improvement.
  • Delivering sound and timely information security design advice. Recommending technological or procedural solutions to meet security control intent in support of engineering projects.
  • Analysing and documenting information security events. Identifying root causes, prioritising threats and recommending and/or implementing corrective actions. Testing and deploying risk mitigation processes and tools.
  • Close collaboration with the BDA Capabilities in particular the Mission Systems and Ground Segment Capability.
  • Contributing to and supporting information security operations, incident response and mitigation activities.

Experience/Qualifications

To be successful you will have expertise in some of the below:

  • Knowledge of (or ability to learn about) Australian Defence Security Policy Framework and associated standards such as Australian Cyber Security Centre Information Security Manual.
  • Understanding of developing and implementing information security practices in an engineering environment.
  • Expertise with Defence or Australian Intelligence Community (AIC) Information Security System design and architectures.
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills and the ability to clearly articulate complex security concepts to a broad and diverse audience.
  • Sound information security knowledge across some/all of the following environments is desirable:
    • Network Security.
    • Host based security.
    • Defence Accreditation and Certification process.
    • Threat risk analysis.
    • Container security.
    • Pentesting.

Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements.

About Us

Boeing Defence Australia is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force. As a BDA employee, you will join other innovative, ethical people who have the critical skills required to develop and deliver world class capabilities and systems to protect Australia and its national interests. Joining us is a chance to make your mark, working with a diverse team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are core values. We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

Benefits

  • Flexible working options
  • Study assistance
  • Salary packaging
  • Employee Incentive Program
  • Global opportunities

Boeing has implemented a new COVID-19 Vaccination Policy in Australia that requires all new Boeing Australia hires to show proof of being fully vaccinated from COVID-19, or have an approved medical exemption. This role is categorised as Group 1 under the Boeing Australia COVID-19 Vaccination and Safety Controls Policy.

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. Female applicants, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and ex-defence personnel are encouraged to apply.

If you are ready to join an innovative industry leader and would like to register your interest in working for Boeing, please click Apply Now.

title: National Naval Shipbuilding – Multi-discipline Researchers, Scientists/Engineers
description:
In its 2017 Naval Shipbuilding Plan, the Australian Government made clear that a skilled workforce is critical to the success of the National Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise.  As the largest capital investment ever undertaken in Australia, the National Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise represents an entirely new direction in the way Australia underpins its national security interests. We are seeking applications from individuals interested in undertaking challenging, interesting and important work that is front and centre for the Australian Government within the Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise.

Maritime Division uses science and technology to deliver a capability edge to the Australian Defence Force in the maritime domain. We have expertise in a diverse range of technologies including sensors, statistics, materials, propulsion, automation, systems integration, signatures, and ship building. These are combined in a multidisciplinary research program to improve the operational capability, availability, reliability and safety of existing maritime and air platforms, and to reduce their vulnerabilities. We are at the forefront of future systems, including autonomous vehicles, and the Defence Force’s future submarine and surface ship programs. Maritime Division has an emphasis on delivering impact to the Australian Defence Force.

Our ideal candidates will have a passion for and demonstrated ability to solve highly complex problems and demonstrating solutions through prototyping using a high degree of rigor (using proven engineering and or scientific methods). You will be able to apply your knowledge to solve complex real world problems, and work with a diverse range of stakeholders to understand their needs and adjust and communicate their approach accordingly to meet any imposed timelines/milestones, working effectively in a team environment. You will demonstrate good communication skills and be willing to work as part of a team to achieve the required defence outcomes in the information sciences domain.

We have multiple positions available in the following disciplines:

  • Non-Acoustic Signature Management (NASM)

The Non-Acoustic Signature Management group provides research and engineering support to the Maritime Domain, in particular the group supports the following areas:

  • Electromagnetic Signature Control provides a sovereign capability to enhance the operational effectiveness and survivability of current and future platforms through the control of Radar, Infrared and Visible signatures using specialised treatments, computer modelling and measurement techniques.
  • Specialised Coatings and Corrosion Science area enhances the operational effectiveness, safety and availability, and reduces the cost of ownership, of ADF platforms through application of corrosion prevention technologies to minimise platform signatures and structural degradation.

  • Undersea Command and Control (UCC)

The Undersea Command and Control Branch is seeking multiple S&T 3-4 (Above) Researchers to undertake research in the undersea warfare domain. This includes research activities associated with torpedoes, torpedo defence, submarine combat control systems, submarine sonar systems, optronics, and human sciences for enhancing crewing systems and control room design/innovation.

  • Acoustic Signature Management (ASM)

The Acoustic Signature Management branch of Maritime Division provides Australia’s primary capability for the management and control of acoustic signatures, hydrodynamics, and manoeuvring performance of defence maritime platforms.  The branch consist of the Acoustic Signature Control, Hydroacoustics, and Acoustic Materials Systems groups. The work involves analytical and numerical prediction capability and has access to a number of world class experimental facilities.

  • Maritime Platform Performance (MPP)

The Maritime Platform Performance Group provides research and engineering support to the Maritime Domain, in particular the group supports the following areas:

  • The Power and Energy Systems Group provides research and engineering support to the Maritime Domain, in particular the group supports the following areas:
    • Mechanical Systems – research, modelling and engineering support for diesel performance and reliability, energy reduction and waste energy recovery technologies
    • Electrical Systems – development and exploitation of electrical power and energy system models (main propulsion motors, power electronics and hardware power in the loop) and Pb-acid battery performance, integration and optimisation
    • Electro-Chemical – materials development, performance modelling and prognosis and safety assessment of alternative battery chemistries
    • Naval Platform Survivability (NPS) leads the research and development of advanced modelling and technologies to support ADF surface ships and submarines in the areas of material analysis and design; fire-fighting and atmosphere; platform vulnerability and recoverability to underwater and air water weapon effects.
    • Naval Architecture and Platform System Analysis (NAPSA) guides research and development of advanced tools and methods to assess the whole-of-vessel performance for the Australian Defence Force. Whole-of-vessel performance includes: seakeeping; multi-vessel interactions; operational loads; whole-of-vessel performance; structural response; integrated model based systems exploration and design trade-off studies.
  • Littoral Autonomy Sensors and Systems

The Littoral Autonomy Sensors and Systems (LASS) Major Science Technology Capability (MSTC) has a major focus on the development of robotic and autonomous systems (RAS) to support future Navy capabilities, including in littoral and undersea warfare. The MSTC is comprised of three Science and Technology Capabilities (STC) centred around:

  • Robotics, vehicle architectures and autonomy, underwater communications, integration and performance;
  • Sensing and perception, including underwater object detection and classification; and
  • Mine countermeasure systems.

As a member of the MSTC you will collaborate with a team of motivated engineers, scientists and mathematicians whose mission is to increase capability through improved employment of robotic and autonomous systems, and / or the exploitation of sensor data for undersea perception and cueing of autonomous systems.

Application Closing Date: 30 May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, reference the following links:

DSTG/02466/22 (NASM)

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=8259F4E9-54F1-5733-D149-C88D853B5DE3

DSTG/2439/22 (UCC)

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=63E3DB0A-024E-8A01-3986-C88D84A16E95

DSTG/02431/22 (ASM)

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=66A738A7-D3D8-254F-2E41-C88D84141129

DSTG/02455/22 (MPP)

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=C89293FC-633E-F7D1-1FFD-C88D84CB0265

DSTG/02397/22 (LSS)

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=C09992B9-BB74-845A-5CA2-C88D8554766F

title: Graduate Valuer
description:
Opteon is an international provider of valuations, advisory and specialist property services in the Australian and New Zealand market. Recognised as the largest valuation professional services firm in these regions, we deliver meaningful solutions for our clients across all property types and market sectors. We are experiencing an exciting period of growth and change, positioning the company as one of the most prominent property services providers. Our future growth strategy is for organic growth, diversification and international expansion.


About the Role

An exciting and rare opportunity has become available for motivated individuals who have either recently completed a Degree in Business (Property) or are near completion. If you're looking to begin your career in the property valuation sector, this is the position for you!

Working through a structured program, you will initially gain the knowledge and insights of the organisation and profession by working in our scheduling team. You will rotate to assist qualified Valuers with a variety of tasks including assistance with quality valuation reports, providing excellent back-end support, client services, and general office administration.

This role offers career development opportunities for candidates with the right attitude and skills and will prepare you to become a Registered and/or Certified Property Valuer.

About you

We are seeking bright, motivated and articulate candidates who are looking to establish a career with our business. The successful candidate will demonstrate:

  • Near completion or recently completed a Bachelor of Business (Property) or equivalent

  • Genuine interest in customer service and property valuations

  • Confident verbal and written communication and report writing skills

  • Experience in multitasking and prioritising workloads in high volume environments

  • Proficiency and comfort with using Microsoft Office, web-based systems and learning new technology

  • A positive and professional manner

  • Current Driver's license

  • The ability to work full time

What we offer

We offer rewarding careers for outstanding individuals, a positive and inclusive culture and the distinct opportunity for high performers to develop professionally. This is your opportunity to be a part of Opteon and its ongoing success.

How to apply

Please apply for this position by submitting your confidential application online including resume.

title: Consultant | Human Capital | Organisation Transformation
description:
Company description:

Deloitte Services Pty Ltd



Job description:

  • Work life - work in a way that suits you best
  • Health & Well-being - Gym discounts, Fitness First, Xtend Barre, HealthPass… the list goes on!
  • Family - 18 weeks paid parental leave

About the team - Organisation Transformation

Deloitte Human Capital Consulting combines business strategy with people strategy to achieve success for our clients. We don't just understand our clients, we become one with them. We empower and upskill talent to radically transform many different business types and areas - it's not just about HR.

What will your typical day look like?

  • A Change Consultant is one of those roles that has the power to influence the ongoing and sustained transformation undertaken by a business and its people.
  • A critical role in a team where your focus on the human aspects of change takes people and organisations on a journey to realise strategic transformations that deliver true blue business value and lasting results.
  • Some of our large-scale business transformation projects include:
  • Organisational Change Management/ Business Readiness
  • Behaviour change
  • Communications
  • Organisational Design

Enough about us, let's talk about you.
We are looking for emerging change practitioners with 2+ years' experience seeking to apply your skills and learn more from the Organisational Transformation community and the latest global ‘change by design' methodology:

  • You will have change management experience. This can be in the shape of professional services, industry or as an advisor alongside a Tier 1 consulting company.
  • You are solution focussed. You apply functional knowledge to inform solution development and contribute to recommendations that enable the client's business agenda.
  • You are responsive. You have experience in using business context and objectives to inform business cases that deliver value to the client when forming a future state vision.
  • Your team game is exceptional. You value your colleagues; you show empathy and bring people together in a shared vision. This extends to your client approach, which is characterised by energy, engagement and wholly client centric.
  • Have or be eligible for AGSVA security clearance

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia's borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We're committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we're leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress - check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

Next Steps

Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now. We'd love to hear from you



We offer:

  • Work life - work in a way that suits you best
  • Health & Well-being - Gym discounts, Fitness First, Xtend Barre, HealthPass… the list goes on!
  • Family - 18 weeks paid parental leave

title: Research Officer (Digital Automation Solutions)
description:
The Opportunity

We have an opportunity for a Research Officer (Digital Automation Solutions) to be part of our South Australian Research and Development Institute (SARDI) Division within the Department of Primary Industries and Regions.

The primary purpose of the role is to investigate and deliver new protocols to improve data management and laboratory automation in molecular diagnostics.

The role contributes to delivering the agency’s priorities including growing primary industries and drive regional development.

The role contributes to improving the efficiency of delivering diagnostics to reduce the impact of soil borne diseases to increase productivity of the primary industries.

About Us

The Department of Primary Industries and Regions, as a key economic development agency of the South Australian Government, works across a diverse range of industry sectors including agriculture, livestock, forestry, fishing and aquaculture and regional development. We involve and engage with others to ensure we make good decisions, have clear policies, plan and implement effective programs, drive relevant projects, promote efficient resource use and broker shared responsibility. In this way we enable the State’s primary industry sectors and regions to remain competitive, productive and sustainable.

Benefits

At the Department of Primary Industries and Regions, we offer our employees challenging and rewarding work with opportunities for career progression, learning and development and flexibility.

Our Commitment to Diversity

The Department of Primary Industries and Regions is committed to building a flexible, diverse and inclusive culture, planning for and promoting diversity. We welcome and encourage applications from diverse community groups and ages including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, LGBTIQ, people with disabilities, women and other diversity groups. The Department of Primary Industries and Regions recognises the benefits that such an approach brings for our staff and customers in delivering the future of SA.

Special Conditions

  • Successful applicant will be required to satisfactorily complete a National Police Check (NPC) prior to being made an offer of employment

Requirements

  • Essential: Degree in Engineering or Science
  • Contract up until 1/7/25 with a possibility of extension
  • Possession of a current driver’s licence and willingness to drive
  • Out of hours work and inter / intrastate travel may be required
  • You acknowledge your work, health and safety obligations and our expectations

Remuneration

PO1 $65,487 - $79,942 per annum

Enquiries

Daniele Giblot-Ducray
Phone: 08 8429 2229
Email: daniele.giblot-ducray@sa.gov.au
Website: www.pir.sa.gov.au

Application Instructions

All applications must be submitted online.

If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit a Covering Letter (no more than 3 pages) outlining your skills and experience in relation to the Professional and Technical Knowledge, Systems and processes orientation and Innovation capabilities of the role description and a current CV (no more than 5 pages). Applicants must include the contact information of at least 2 referees with 1 being your immediate supervisor/manager and a completed “Pre-Employment Declaration in the SA Public Sector” form.

Application Instructions

All applications must be submitted online via http://iworkfor.sa.gov.au/, citing Reference Number: 484226

title: Marketing Manager
description:
About Land Services SA

Land Services SA are leading property experts in South Australia, offering a range of property transaction and valuation services, property information products, custom data sets, reliable market insights, technology consulting and managed service offerings.

Land Services SA’s datasets are unique, extensive, timely and relate to every property, land transaction and statutory property valuation within the State. We continue to unlock our datasets, leveraging this for performance reporting, investment proposals, mining projects, cost-benefit analysis, research and the preparation of legal documents, to name a few.

As a trusted partner of the State, Land Services SA deliver highly valued, trusted services to the community, being recognised for creating innovative solutions.

About the Position

Reporting to the Chief Product Officer, you will craft an appropriate B2B Marketing strategy for SA and WA to support the Commercial objectives. You will work closely with the Product and Sales teams to understand business needs and develop, deploy and refine various B2B marketing activities to target customer groups. These activities should drive awareness / purchase / customer retention and drive revenue growth to meet budget targets and deliver value to our clients.

Key Responsibilities

You will be responsible for:

  • Develop a comprehensive B2B Marketing strategy for both WA and SA.
  • Develop and implement relevant brand and product frameworks.
  • Support Brand Managers to develop comprehensive product Go To Market strategies.
  • Collate and maintain the multi-channel communication calendar and ensure relevant inputs from various departments.
  • Ensuring marketing activities are successfully implemented, integrated, and delivered
  • Develop and implement marketing programs that deliver website traffic, sales enquiry and brand health metrics.
  • Develop Email campaign content, customer journeys, audience maintenance and deploy to target customers.
  • Ensure product related LSSA website content is developed, deployed and refined as required.
  • Ensure appropriate measurement of marketing activities and recommend refinements based on data led insights and customer feedback.
  • Ensure the ongoing management of the Marketing budget.
  • Understand the Product and Sales team requirements and integrate into the Marketing plans as appropriate.
  • Producing and implementing an efficient marketing plan, seeking to make optimal use of allotted budget
  • Providing reports and responding to information requests from management
  • Monitoring the strategic marketing plan to achieve the required sales and marketing KPI’s

Key Capabilities

To succeed in this challenging role, you will have

  • Tertiary qualification in relevant business, marketing or communications.
  • Previous experience developing a B2B Marketing strategy and delivering finely tuned go to market strategies
  • Minimum 5+ years of experience in a Marketing Manager role
  • Clear and concise written, verbal, and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work autonomously and collaboratively as part of a team.
  • Demonstrated creative flair and development of innovative solutions.
  • Excellent time management and prioritisation skills.
  • A proven ability to achieve objectives and demonstrate actual results.
  • Ability to communicate professionally, pragmatically, and with influence.
  • A positive, 'can-do’ attitude.
  • A communicative and collaborative approach to working with stakeholders both externally and internally.
  • Highly developed presentation skills with excellent communication skills.
  • Knowledge / experience working within CRM platforms
  • Direct marketing experience (customer journeys, content development, execution, understanding of analytics/reporting)
  • Understanding of Pardot and Salesforce Sales tool preferred.

For further information, please contact Christie O’Brien via email at careers@landservices.com.au or simply apply now by submitting a covering letter, that demonstrates you have the required skill set and experience we're seeking, together with a copy of your resume.
As part of this recruitment process applicants that are offered a role will be required to consent to a National Crime History check prior to commencement. All enquiries will be handled in confidence.
Our privacy collection statement can be found by visiting our website  https://www.landservices.com.au

title: Customer Service roles for Australian Passport Office, Full Time - Hybrid WFH!
description:

We are hiring Customer Service Roles to support our new client, the Australian Passport Office, in Adelaide CBD with hybrid working from home options available. Be recognised and rewarded for your contributions while making a real difference to the lives of Australians.

As a Customer Service Representative, you will be providing essential services to people across Australia on behalf of our Australian Federal Government client. In this role you'll be operating in a dynamic team environment with a focus on meeting quality outcomes for customers.

About The Role

With access to knowledge content, extensive training and leadership support you will be helping Australians with Passport enquires looking to travel.

A hybrid working model will give flexibility, less time spent travelling while still having face to face contact and support with your team.

Benefits

Operating Hours
Our operating hours are Monday to Friday between 8:00am and 8:00pm on a rotating roster with flexibility to support all of your out of work commitments.

We understand that life can be busy, therefore, Datacom's commitment is to provide a flexible work life balance to suit any personal or family commitments whilst still maintaining full time hours.

About You

  • Clear communication skills to customers and stakeholders
  • Punctual and reliable
  • Experience adhering to KPI's

  • Patience and empathy towards people in difficult situations

  • Due to clearance requirements Australian Citizenship is required


About Datacom

Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.

We have over 6,500 people across our global offices and generate an annual revenue of over AU $1.1 billion annually. This makes us one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. We are committed to hiring, developing and promoting diverse talent.

Datacom has extensive expertise in the operation of contact centres, data centres, engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations.

Founded in 1965, we have a successful trading history of consistent growth, profitability and a track record of delivering innovative, cost effective technology solutions.

We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

If you're looking for meaningful work with genuine career progression opportunities, training and development, we'd love to hear from you.
