title: Communications Intelligence Security Officer/COMSO  APS Level 6
description:
The Role
The Communications Intelligence Security Officer/COMSO is responsible for the security of all Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) within SRSPO. They are accountable to ensure they have knowledge of and drive compliance with the relevant legislative and policy frameworks. The COMSO has a vital role in all elements of Protective Security – Information, Personnel, Physical and Administrative. They will provide detailed security technical, professional and policy advice in relation to complex unit work and contribute to strategic planning, program and project management, and policy development.

The COMSO’s proactive involvement in all SCI related protective security matters is essential for the establishment and maintenance of effective security practises both in SRSPO and within external stakeholders. As such, they will be required to identify, anticipate, and respond to stakeholders’ needs and expectations to achieve SRSPO and wider Defence outcomes. You will also collaborate with our Industry partners to ensure they meet their security obligations.

About our Team
Surveillance and Response Systems Program Office (SRSPO) ensures the availability and performance of highly complex surveillance and response airborne and related systems for the Royal Australian Air Force (RAAF). This includes the P-8A Poseidon and the P-3C (Electronic Warfare) aircraft systems. SRSPO also acquires and supports common Aeronautical Life Support Equipment (ALSE) that is used on all air vehicles operated by the RAAF, Navy and Army. In the near future we will support a new remotely piloted high altitude long endurance aircraft system, the MQ4 Triton.

At SRSPO we are passionate about working with our stakeholders and industry partners to ensure that necessary acquisition, sustainment and regulatory requirements are fulfilled in order to support the warfighter and achieve the Department of Defence’s strategic and operational objectives. We offer an interesting and supportive work environment, a range of wellbeing activities and flexible work arrangements including the ability to work from home.

Our Ideal Candidate
A high performing, self-motivated, organised individual adept at building productive and collaborative relationships at both a technical and leadership level to achieve protective security objectives. You will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically, prioritise effectively, and apply a continuous improvement mindset. You will have a methodical approach to problem solving and developing business-processes, procedures and plans.

Along with SRSPO’s Executive, the COMSO is a promoter of a positive security culture therefore you must be able to engage and proactively communicate with influence to stakeholders of all levels. The Defence environment has unique Security challenges therefore you will need to be proficient at researching and analysing complex information, the environment, and situations/incidents, to identify process inadequacies and conduct risk management accordingly. Key to this is understanding and applying the requirements of the Defence Security Principles Framework (DSPF) and related policies so that SRSPO’s local systems, procedures and controls comply.

Application Closing date: Sunday the 22th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference CASG/01523/22 on Link: https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=5A0739A3-E257-B298-E204-C879F7489311

title: Border Force Supervisor
description:
Looking for a challenging and rewarding career working for a Department that is inclusive and provides flexibility?

Want to contribute to building a secure Australia that is prosperous, open and united?

We invite you to apply for the role of Border Force Supervisor within the Australian Border Force.

We are looking for people who have a diverse range of skill sets covering one or more of the following:

  • Knowledge of operational governance, including planning discipline, reporting and related processes (desirable but not essential)
  • Basic intelligence tradecraft (desirable but not essential)
  • Strong leadership and stakeholder engagement skills
  • Display high standards of integrity, a demonstrated ability to problem solve and make informed decisions
  • Display initiative, flexibility and adaptability to change and in implementing emerging border restrictions and policy changes
  • Excellent written communication skills, high degree of accuracy including appropriate grammar and the ability to communicate complex ideas and outcomes in a clear, concise and logical manner
  • Manage staff performance including foster staff morale and effective teamwork and cooperation
  • Undertake work activities within an awareness of the possible impact on strategic, political or operational outcomes for the ABF Highly developed (or the ability to quickly acquire) knowledge of Command, coordination and control (C3), Incident Command (ICCS+) and planning framework.
  • Knowledge of legislation, policy and guidelines applicable to Border Force Operational activities and ability to make complex and sensitive decisions that may have reputational risk.

Mandatory

  • Ability to obtain and maintain an Australian Government Negative Vetting Level 1 clearance
  • Employment Suitability Clearance (ESC).
  • Some positions within the ABF require the occupant to meet Border Force Officer essential qualifications.  If successful for one of these positions, candidates are required to:
  • Attain and maintain relevant medical, fitness and psychometric standards
  • Swear an oath or make an affirmation
  • Actively participate in career management (postings and deployments), and
  • Be uniformed if the position requires.

Is this you?

For further information relating to this position and to apply, please visit Careers and recruitment (homeaffairs.gov.au)

title: Research Scientist
description:
The Opportunity
The primary purpose of the role is to manage and deliver scientific outcomes relating to the South Australian Marine Scalefish Fishery, South Australian Lakes and Coorong Fishery (Finfish) and provide scientific support to other projects in the Community-Based Fisheries Sub-Program within the Fisheries Program at SARDI Aquatic Sciences. The Community-Based Fisheries Sub-Program undertakes stock assessments and carries out biological and ecological research to meet the information needs of managers charged with responsibility for managing sustainable exploitation and equitable allocation of finfish fisheries resources in South Australia.

The role contributes to delivering high-quality scientific information and advice to facilitate the sustainable management of community-based fishery resources in South Australian waters, through successful and timely delivery of research, publishing stock assessment reports and articles in peer-reviewed scientific journals. The role contributes to the research assessments and projects overseen by the Community-Based Fisheries Sub-Program. The primary focus of the group is on the population dynamics and fisheries biology of key finfish species and application of the daily egg production method to estimate spawning biomass. Fishery dependent and biological data are integrated in stock assessments that determine the status of harvested populations. The primary outputs are stock assessment reports that provide the scientific basis for sustainable fisheries management. Scientific findings are published in peer-reviewed reports, and national and international journals. Research findings are also communicated directly to PIRSA fisheries managers, fishery licence holders and national and international scientists through relevant steering committees, meetings and conferences. The role is also responsible for exploring opportunities for external funding to conduct new research projects.

The role contributes delivering the agency’s priorities including securing production through biosecurity and efficient and sustainable use of resources.

About Us
The Department of Primary Industries and Regions, as a key economic development agency of the South Australian Government, works across a diverse range of industry sectors including agriculture, livestock, forestry, fishing and aquaculture and regional development. We involve and engage with others to ensure we make good decisions, have clear policies, plan and implement effective programs, drive relevant projects, promote efficient resource use and broker shared responsibility. In this way we enable the State’s primary industry sectors and regions to remain competitive, productive and sustainable.

Benefits
At the Department of Primary Industries and Regions, we offer our employees challenging and rewarding work with opportunities for career progression, learning and development and flexibility.

Our Commitment to Diversity
The Department of Primary Industries and Regions is committed to building a flexible, diverse and inclusive culture, planning for and promoting diversity. We welcome and encourage applications from diverse community groups and ages including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, LGBTIQ, people with disabilities, women and other diversity groups. The Department of Primary Industries and Regions recognises the benefits that such an approach brings for our staff and customers in delivering the future of SA.

Special Conditions

  • Successful applicant will be required to satisfactorily complete a National Police Check (NPC) prior to being made an offer of employment

Requirements

  • To be eligible for this position applicants must be an Australian Citizen or hold a visa that permits you to work in Australia
  • A post-graduate degree in Science with a major in fisheries, zoology or related discipline (or equivalent research experience) is required.
  • Regular intra-state and occasional inter-state travel
  • Full time ongoing role based at West Beach
  • Regular work outside normal working hours
  • Possession of a current C class driver’s licence and willingness to drive
  • May require field trips on research and commercial vessels
  • Willingness to complete additional training as required (e.g. coxswains)
  • You acknowledge your work, health and safety obligations and our expectations

Remuneration
PO3 $96,860 - $102,400 per annum

Enquiries
Jonathan Smart
Phone: 0403555682
Email: jonathan.smart@sa.gov.au
Website: www.pir.sa.gov.au

Application Instructions

All applications must be submitted online.

If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit a Covering Letter (no more than 3 pages) outlining your skills and experience in relation to the Professional and Technical Knowledge, Achievement orientation and Communication capabilities of the role description and a current CV (no more than 5 pages). Applicants must include the contact information of at least 2 referees with 1 being your immediate supervisor/manager and a completed “Pre-Employment Declaration in the SA Public Sector” form.

Application Instructions
All applications must be submitted online via http://iworkfor.sa.gov.au/, citing Reference Number: 485525

title: Solution Architect
description:
Nova Systems is a global engineering services and technology solutions company with strategically located offices in Australia, New Zealand, the United Kingdom, Norway, and Singapore. From national defence and essential services to border control and cyber security, these are the challenges we partner with our clients to anticipate, understand, and solve.

At Nova Systems, we provide highly specialised advice and solutions at scale, we are agile and ready to predict, react and respond. We refer to it as being "Optimised for Performance". Small enough to care, big enough to matter, we leverage the benefits of scale for our clients.

But what makes Nova Systems truly unique, is our people. Nova Systems is where the best and brightest minds come together to challenge, collaborate, and innovate.

At Nova Systems we see things differently. We bring (and take) a different perspective. We are the smarts behind the solution.

About the Role:
We are seeking a Solution Architect to join our ICT team in Adelaide.

You will design, develop and implement systems architecture that will meet business needs. Gathering requirements and functional and non-functional specifications, assessing the current software systems in place in order to identify areas in need of improvement, and overseeing development teams.

What will you be involved in:

  • Leads the design and development of architectures for complex solutions ensuring consistency with agreed requirements.
  • Establishes policies, principles and practices for the selection of solution architecture components.
  • Manages trade-offs and balances functional, service quality and systems management requirements within a significant area of the organisation.
  • Coordinates and manages the target architecture across multiple projects or initiatives.
  • Maintains a stable, viable architecture and ensures consistency of design and adherence to appropriate standards across multiple projects or initiatives.
  • Providing advice and recommendations, based on expertise and experience, to address client needs.

What we would expect from you:

  • Proven experience in engineering and software architecture design.
  • Ability to effectively translate business requirements to a technical solution design which aligns with the architectural requirements.
  • Experience applying design patterns or other guidance including roadmaps and principles, to develop solutions to business requirements.
  • Experience in consultative and creative solution selling; experience in developing solutions that meet customer's requirements.
  • Must have extensive Cloud experience (AWS or Azure)
  • Experience working in both Agile and Structured delivery
  • Detailed understanding of Digital, Mobile and Web Architectures
  • Australian Citizenship

Nova's Value Proposition; Beyond the pay cheque:
In addition to salary, you are supported with:

  • Flexible working conditions to suit individual needs and dress for your day
  • Commitment to Professional and Personal Development (up to $5000 per year)
  • Reward & Recognition Program offering exclusive discounts from hundreds of major retailers, helping you to save on groceries, petrol, holidays and more!
  • Additional Leave entitlements include Reserve Leave, Loyalty Leave, Parental Leave and Purchased Leave
  • Wellbeing Hub with access to health and fitness content
  • Employee Assistance Program for employees and family members
  • Access to Defence Health and Travel Insurance
  • Novated Leasing and Salary Sacrifice
  • Nova Employee Share Offer
  • An inclusive and supportive culture
  • A range of other great benefits, just ask us!

To Apply
Please click on the "apply now" button and submit your resume using the "upload resume" function in PDF Format (only).

Nova Systems does not accept any recruitment agency solicitations.

title: eCommerce Specialist - Digital Sales
description:
• High Volume fast paced environment
  • International leader in Industrial manufacturing and reselling industry
  • Diversified and fast-growing business to keep you interested
This role is for a customer-oriented champion looking to kickstart their career in a stable and growing organisation with opportunities for development and progression. You will be a vital member of the Digital team, ensuring all customers are satisfied by providing appropriate resolutions to their enquires and assisting with sales conversion.

The right candidate will have a track record of customer service/ sales success, and will bring a positive ‘can-do’ attitude. You will be reporting to the Marketing Manager of Digital Business Programs & eCommerce.

This is an exciting time to join the business. We are at the early stages of an important transformation that will improve our performance, competitiveness, and growth. This is a place where ALL our people are supported, successful, can thrive and grow their career.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Communicate and respond to customers in a timely manner via phone, email, and live chat
  • Resolve customer complaints in an empathetic and professional manner
  • Provide product knowledge in response to customer queries
  • Process orders, applications, forms, and requests
  • Maintain records of customers interactions including transactions, comments, and complaints
  • Collect data from various points within the organisation and upload onto website
  • Ensure overall customer satisfaction
  • Report monthly on KPIs
What you need:
  • Successful completion of tertiary studies beneficial
  • Customer service and basic sales experience
  • Willingness to learn our business and products
  • Effective communication skills at all levels
  • Computer literate at an Intermediate level with Microsoft 365. Zendesk or related CRM a bonus!
  • Determination to problem solve and seek improvements
  • Ability to work efficiently in a hybrid capacity as required
  • Self-driven with a hunger for success and personal growth
Why us?

Motion Asia Pacific is Australia’s leader in the distribution of Bearings and Power Transmission. We operate across Australia, New Zealand, Indonesia, and Singapore.

We are a Company who values relationships, therefore we need this role to always work to foster and maintain trusted relationships across all levels of our business and seek to support and add value to our store network, managers, and leaders.

With 1700 staff members in Australia, we focus on continuous improvement and sustainable growth as our two main objectives. This is driven by our long-term investment in people, systems, process, and new growth opportunities for our people.

So, if you are interested in joining our group don’t wait, apply now and let us help you empower your career with us!

MOTION is an equal opportunity employer


You must be either an Australian Citizen or a holder of an Australian Permanent Residency Visa to be eligible to apply for this position.

title: Architecture Lead - Strategy & Governance
description:
• All Systems GO! Drive the next generation of defence capability delivery
  • Opportunity to lead the Enterprise Architecture activities establishing strategy and governance to support enterprise outcomes
  • Enjoy flexibility , engaging work and a culture that embraces diversity and open-mindedness

At BAE Systemswe are all systems go as we continue to drive innovation and seek passionate and talented people to join our business. We currently have a unique opportunity as an Architecture Lead - Strategy & Governance within our Central Business function. This role will ideally be based out of Adelaide, Melbourne or Newcastle however we can be flexible to accommodate other locations within Australia.

What this opportunity will mean for you:

  • Purposeful work where your efforts are recognized in an environment where you can thrive
  • Joining an organisation that is passionate about developing some of the most impressive careers in the world
  • Industry-leading flexibility options to unlock the talent and diversity of every individual
  • Unique opportunities to contribute to programs of national significance whilst growing your skills
  • A strong safety culture, inclusive teams and work to be proud of, underpinned by a compelling set of values

Your new role:

You will engage with key stakeholders within the business and IT function to lead the creation of effective roadmaps, options analysis and solution designs to ensure that solutions meet business needs and are supported by architectural governance, policies and standards. Strong leadership, engagement and relationship skills that support effective, reliable and secure outcomes for our customers is key.

As Architecture Lead - Strategy & Governance you will be accountable for these core focus areas:

  • Proactively and holistically lead and support Enterprise Architecture activities that guide the development and management of a portfolio of solutions within the defined enterprise capabilities/projects/programs
  • Leadership, relationship management and execution of EA services with specific focus on enabling enterprise strategy through the four architecture layers of Business, Information, Application and Technology
  • Establishing, managing and maturing appropriate governance, standards and guardrails, guiding and influencing strategy, technology roadmaps and providing direction to drive efficiencies in overall IM&T service delivery, quality and integrity
  • Providing leadership, support and advice ensuring high quality consultation, guidance, deliverables and architectural design
  • Building, facilitating and maintaining positive, effective and lasting relationships through transparent and high integrity services ensuring feedback mechanisms are established
  • Managing team services with a focus on consistency and delivering value and positive customer experience and outcomes
  • Ensuring team services comply with and leverage IM&T policies, governance, standards, principles, functional framework and that the required Technical Authority delegations are in place and adhered to
  • Providing leadership and guidance to ensure transparency across the portfolio of programs and projects to ensure the holistic IM&T teams have the required visibility and consultation leading into execution phases and sustainable support
  • Establishing, maturing and managing associated roadmaps to aid in proactive planning and delivery and ultimately achieve strategic outcomes
  • Ensuring team translates business strategy into solutions architecture, leading solutions design and analysis, orchestrating solutions delivery, and facilitating and collaborating to deliver business outcomes
  • Managing the delivery of EA services with a focus on integrity, efficiency and effectiveness driving a continuous improvement culture
  • Establishing appropriate metrics and provision of management reports as required.
  • Identifying and managing risks and opportunities associated with solution design and liaising with stakeholders across the enterprise

About you

As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you'll have:

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, information-technology, engineering, system analysis or a related study, or equivalent experience
  • Demonstrated experience in at least two IT disciplines such as (solution development, technical or infrastructure architecture, network management, application development, middleware or cloud
  • Demonstrated experience in managing and maturing governance frameworks, standards and guardrails, guiding and influencing strategy, technology roadmaps and providing direction to drive efficiencies in overall IM&T service delivery.
  • Experience as a trusted and respected thought leader who can influence and persuade business and IT leaders and IT development teams
  • Exposure to multiple, diverse technologies, platforms and processing environments
  • Good understanding of strategic and new and emerging technology trends, and the practical application of existing, new and emerging technologies to new and evolving business and operating models
  • Good understanding of product management, agile principles and development methodologies and capability of supporting agile teams by providing advice and guidance on opportunities, impact and risks, taking account of technical and architectural debt
  • Experience working in a relevant industry is helpful, but not required
  • Experience developing architecture blueprints, strategies and roadmaps
  • Strong Engagement and Relationship experience, confident in delivering presentations to senior-level executives and technical audiences

Research shows that some candidates hesitate to apply for roles if they feel they don't meet 100% of the criteria. So, if this opportunity excites you and you have the right foundational experience and qualifications, we encourage you to apply. Whether it be for this role or another, your skills and competencies are of interest to us.

Clearances

As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance.

International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.

Further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html

Applications should be addressed to: Calvin Ebenezer - Talent Acquisition Specialist - IM&T and made online here. Confidential enquiries are welcome via email: calvin.ebenezer@baesystems.com

We are a 2021 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.

Our culture

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment where our people can thrive. For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of our employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation.

If you would like to know more information about how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives via this link .

To learn about other employment opportunities at BAE Systems, please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au

title: Automation Test Analyst
description:
Do you envision working for a cool and fast-growing technology company committed to strong engineering practices that will help them deliver some key products to their clients nationally and worldwide ? They are currently on the lookout for future technical leaders who love to code and collaborate. As a Quality Assurance expert, you will be working alongside tech professionals to test custom, high-quality product solutions.

With Quality Assurance at the forefront the QA / Test Analyst will have a strong understanding of QA best practices, the software development lifecycle (SDLC) and stay up to date with current emerging technologies and trends.

Responsibilities:

  • Champion the quality process by following up on issues, tracking and reporting bugs and overall quality to the teams as necessary
  • Document, develop and execute test plans, strategies, and test cases based on requirements and discussions with the project team
  • Create and execute automated and manual tests using established standards and procedures
  • Contribute to designing an efficient software development process to ensure working software is deployed
  • Be an advocate for the quality of the software and quality as part of the software development process

Experience:

  • Understanding of SDLC and test automation best practices
  • Capacity to investigate and debug complex issues
  • Experience with SaaS application testing
  • Understanding and exposure to a wide array of QA practices, processes, and tools
  • Excellent overall communication abilities including strong presentation skills
  • Understanding of Linux / Debian operating systems (desirable)

What's in it for you?

  • Great team culture with an opportunity to make an impact in your role and the team immediately
  • Excellent on-the-job learning opportunities to grow your skills
  • Flexibility to work from home and the office

.

.

.

To be considered for the role click the 'apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Sonia Robertson on 08 74220613 or email: srobertson@paxus.com.au and quote the above job reference number.

Paxus values diversity and welcomes applications from Indigenous Australians, people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people living with a disability. If you require an adjustment to the recruitment process please contact me on the above contact details.

title: Procure to Pay Trainer
salary: Base Rate + Super + Salary Sacrifice + Travel
description:
We are seeking an enthusiastic and dynamic resource who is able to coordinate and deliver  a training program, materials and general training duties in accordance with the Procure to Pay (P2P) project training program and in collaboration with the P2P project team and Resthaven ICT team.

This is a Full Time, 12 Month Fixed Term position. Must have the ability to travel throughout metropolitan and regional locations within South Australia.

About the Role:

Deliver Procure to Pay Training for in line with the project timeline and approved training program.

  • Contribute to the development of training materials and procedural documentation in line with the project timeline and requirements identified by the project team.
  • Set up training environments in readiness for end-user training including location/venue, equipment, and user access to the relevant application.
  • Deliver Procure to Pay end-user training.
  • Provide support to end-users throughout transition activities.
  • Administer training feedback surveys and prepare training attendance reports.
  • Identify user specific related issues and collaborate with the project team and relevant Resthaven stakeholders to resolve and manage.
  • Participate in UAT, including writing test scenarios, and undertaking testing in collaboration with the project team.

About You:

  • Experience with systems process training or keen to progress a career in training
  • An understanding of accounts payable and supplier concepts and associated business processes would be of benefit.
  • A keen desire to work in a training role with a sound grasp of training methods and delivery.
  • Ability to analyse issues and identify possible solutions based on a sound analysis of available information.
  • Sound literacy and computer skills, including report writing and presentation skills.
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products including O365.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and sound experience of end-user contact in training situations.
  • The ability to prioritise efficiently in challenging and complex environments.
  • Certificate IV in Workplace training or equivalent (desirable)
  • Evidence of 2021 Flu Vaccination & Covid-19 full vaccination required

The benefits to you:

  • Join a richly diverse and inclusive organisation that makes a difference in people's lives
  • Career progression opportunities
  • Access to salary packaging to increase your take home pay
  • Four free Physiotherapy Treatments per financial year
  • Access to a professional development fund to continue your learning

For enquiries please contact Madeline Giles-Lindsay, Recruitment Business Partner - Madeline.Giles-Lindsay@resthaven.asn.au

Applications close: 9am, Tuesday 31 May 2022

title: Merchandiser
description:
ITW is a Fortune 200 company operating in nearly every corner of the globe. ITW has a powerful and unique business model and culture which is the key to over 100 years of success. ITW Construction Asia Pacific employs around 1100 employees in the region to service our key end markets and customers in residential and commercial construction. Our team has achieved some great things this year – such as being rated number 4 top Graduate Employer in Australia amongst 300 eligible companies!
We are proud of our portfolio of brands such as Paslode, Zenith, Lane and Buildex just to name a few. ITW’s products and solutions are at work all over the world, in deep-sea oil rigs, aerospace technology, bridges and wind turbines, healthcare, the spaces in which we live and work, the cars we drive, and the mobile devices we rely on. We are never, whether we know it or not, more than a few steps from an innovative ITW solution.

Job Description

As our Merchandiser your primary focus is being responsible for the VIS Agreement and maintenance of ITW ranges to a high standard for retail sale within your designated region.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Drive customer satisfaction, meeting agreed customer service levels through superior business practices, focused customer service and strong relationship building
  • Maintain high levels of stock display and cleanliness
  • Complete stock adjustments and report if stock from previous order is not put away.
  • Change min max levels for stock, labels and trays when required.
  • Maintain accurate call cycle compliance: Efficient and streamlined customer call cycle delivery, maximising the allocated in-store hours

To be successful in this position you will have:

  • Demonstrated high standards of oral and written communication skills including ability to liaise with varying levels of organisation & customer base.
  • Proven ability to develop & maintain customer/business relationships
  • Demonstrated ability to work autonomously
  • Strong time management and organisational skills
  • Numerical literacy

At ITW, our values are essential, a non-negotiable part of our culture and guide how we work together. The ideal candidate will live and breathe integrity, respect, trust, shared risk, and simplicity.

ITW is dedicated to providing a flexible and inclusive working environment where you will witness our enviable track record of internal career growth and progression.

Additional Information

Illinois Tool Works Inc. (“ITW” or “the Company”) is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or on the basis of disability.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability and are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the online application system process due to your disability, please call 0448 580 741 to request assistance.

title: ARC Centre Manager
description:
(HE07) $89,399-$99,987 per annum plus an employer contribution of up to 17% superannuation may apply

Fixed term position until 31 Dec 2022 available immediately with the possibility of extension.

The Australian Research Council (ARC) Training Centre for Innovative Wine Production , based in the Faculty of Science, Engineering and Technology, is a well-established research centre seeking to inspire the next generation of scientists, engineers and research leaders by providing direct experience with industry partners.

Now in its final phase, the Centre seeks your strengths in research and operational coordination, stakeholder engagement, and project management to join the team in the role of Centre Manager.

In this position, you will work closely with the Centre Director to lead activities aimed at increasing the scientific outcomes of the Centre as well as supporting PhD students in the completion of their studies and the research programs.

As a part of the leadership team, in this multi-faceted role you will coordinate and head the operational management of the Centre, including coordinating its research and administrative functions, assisting with strategic planning and delivery, engaging with stakeholders and strengthening relationships.

To be successful you will need:

  • Experience in all aspects of project management, with a proven record of successfully managing research or technical projects through to completion
  • Demonstrated experience working in a research/technical environment, including supporting research activities, and preparation and submission of project reports
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively as a member of an interdisciplinary team and to develop collaborative teams working in both academic and commercial environments
  • Excellent technical writing skills with experience in writing for various audiences across a range of media, and managing web-sites and social media.
  • Experience in working with industry, including managing industry relevant research & development projects, and engaging and negotiating with partners

The successful candidate will have highly developed planning and organizational skills, able to prioritise and meet deadlines.

Enjoy an outstanding career environment

The University of Adelaide is a uniquely rewarding workplace. The size, breadth and quality of our education and research programs - including significant industry, government and community collaborations - offers you vast scope and opportunity for a long, fulfilling career.

It also enables us to attract high-calibre people in all facets of our operations, ensuring you will be surrounded by talented colleagues, many world-leading. Our work's cutting-edge nature - not just in your own area, but across virtually the full spectrum of human endeavour - provides a constant source of inspiration.

Our culture is one that welcomes all and embraces diversity consistent with our Staff Values and Behaviour Framework and our Values of integrity, respect, collegiality, excellence and discovery. We firmly believe that our people are our most valuable asset, so we work to grow and diversify the skills, knowledge and capability of all our staff.

We embrace flexibility as a key principle to allow our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal and family life.

In addition, we offer a wide range of attractive staff benefits. These include: salary packaging; flexible work arrangements; high-quality professional development programs and activities; and an on-campus health clinic, gym and other fitness facilities.

Learn more at: adelaide.edu.au/jobs

Your faculty's broader role

The Faculty of Sciences, Engineering and Technology is a multidisciplinary hub of cutting-edge teaching and research. Many of its academic staff are world leaders in their fields and graduates are highly regarded by employers. The Faculty actively partners with innovative industries to solve problems of global significance.

Learn more at: set.adelaide.edu.au

If you have the talent, we'll give you the opportunity. Together, let's make history.

Click on the link below to view the position description and to apply for this opportunity.

https://careers.adelaide.edu.au/cw/en/job/509911/arc-centre-manager

Please ensure you submit a cover letter, resume, and upload a document that includes your responses to all of the selection criteria for the position as contained in the position description or selection criteria document.

Applications close 11:55pm, 30 May 2022.

For further information

For a confidential discussion regarding this position, contact:

Professor Vladimir Jiranek
Centre Manager, The Australian Research Council Training Centre
E: vladimir.jiranek@adelaide.edu.au

The University of Adelaide is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people who meet the requirements of this position are strongly encouraged to apply.

#LI-UOA

title: Manager, Enterprise Architecture
company: The Business Agility Group (Australia) Pty Ltd
description:
Our Client in the Banking and Finance domain, is looking to fill a newly created permanent position for an experienced Enterprise Architect looking to step into an EA Management position or an existing EA Manager, looking for a change. Either way our Client is looking for an experienced, enthusiastic, driven and communicative individual to build and drive their new EA Practise and architectural roadmap for the future.

They are located in Adelaide, SA, so ideally they are looking for a local candidate, someone prepared to relocate or for the right person, our Client will entertain someone working remotely with occasional travel to HQ and other national sites.

To be considered for this role, the candidate must have:

  • the requisite skills and experience detailed here,
  • have at least Permanent Residency working rights for Australia, and
  • at least 3 year's relevant local working experience.

The Role:

This is a great opportunity to be responsible for designing and building an EA Practise with a holistic view of the Client’s architecture both now and in the future. This includes areas such as business processes, information gathered, technology and strategy. You will use this extensive knowledge to help organise logic across their IT infrastructure to help reflect the integration and standardisation requirements around their operating model.

The successful candidate will look at the documented strategic direction of the organisation and link this to the IT strategy, using a variety of models and tools. By documenting all requirements, it will enable the Client to perform business in the most efficient and timely manner, whilst also working with various stakeholders from across the business to ensure all remain synchronised and aligned with each other's respective strategic directions.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Define, manage and coordinate the execution of the overall EA practice and processes for the Client (e.g., documentation standards, architecture review and governance coordination).
  • Assist with bringing together architecture with strategy and execution.
  • Work with the development and operations / delivery teams to assist their production of enterprise / solution artefacts and roadmaps.
  • Manage significant architectural decisions across the business and help communicate them to stakeholders.
  • Ensure effective architectural processes flow through to design correctly.
  • Build strong internal and external relationships.
  • Provide recommendation on tools for architecture and strategy that will improve / enhance their ability to compete in the market.

Skills and Experience:

  • Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Software Engineering.
  • IT architecture qualifications, such as TOGAF, SABSA, or similar.
  • A knowledge of Agile and Business-driven methodologies.
  • Experience formulating and maturing Enterprise Architecture practices and frameworks.
  • At least 5 years as a Senior Enterprise Architect and managing a team of Architects would be highly regarded.
  • Experience within the Banking and Finance/IT industries and an exposure to Banking System software is highly desirable.
  • Excellent and effective verbal, written communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Very good administrative, organisational and time management skills.
  • Ability to multitask in a fast paced, professional environment.
  • Strong attention to detail.

Note.

  1. An attractive salary is on offer, but it will also depend on skills, experience and fit within the organisation.
  2. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Senior Service Designer | Government Department | Mental Health | Adelaide SA
description:
• Role can be located Perth, Darwin, Newcastle, Nowra, Wodonga, Townsville.
  • Full time Hours, 37.5 hour a week role
  • Contract position + Potential extension

ACM Healthcare is working on behalf of a commonwealth government agency to source a Senior Service Designer in either Sydney, Adelaide, Melbourne or Brisbane.

Our client has established a S ervice Review and Transformation Program to review and improve the existing organisational structure and models of client service delivery across the Division. The Program will undertake a holistic analysis of the current state and future opportunities for the Division. This will inform the co-design of a connected service ecosystem that optimally and efficiently creates reciprocal value to meet the needs of all stakeholders.

The Program consists of five sequential Projects:

  • Current State Review
  • Future Trends Review
  • Solution Design
  • Change Implementation
  • Evaluation and Improvement

We are recruiting for an experienced Senior Service Designer to contribute to the Current State Review and Future Trends Review projects; and assist with the identification of themes, insights and opportunities which will inform the Solution Design Project. The successful candidate will employ a Human Centred Design approach to conduct and interpret stakeholder research; apply the findings to a design process; and contribute to collaborative inquiry, analysis and co-design activities for all three projects.

Duties:

  • Lead and deliver the Current State Stakeholder Research component of the Current State Review project; adopting contemporary human centred design methodologies to deliver high quality analysis and synthesis of findings into themes, insights and areas of opportunity.
  • Conduct a desktop review of existing data and previous research findings to define the challenge, identify knowledge gaps, and form an initial hypothesis base to investigate in the stakeholder interviews.
  • Collaborate with the team Senior Organisational Analyst to identify and map current initiatives and services available.
  • Perform customer and stakeholder workshops using quantitative and qualitative online and offline methods, to understand the needs and motivations driving behaviours, and to fill the gaps identified in the desktop review.
  • Synthesise research data to identify themes and patterns leading to stakeholder insights, from which to develop solution design opportunities.
  • Based on research, identify ideas and initial concepts to improve interactions, both digital and in person, communicating findings and proposals in partnership with other project leads.
  • Produce service design deliverables such as customer interaction flows, journey maps, designs and physical/digital prototypes.
  • Work in collaboration with relevant teams to reach best practice design solutions.
  • Build and manage relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.
  • Communicate project progress, achievements, updated timelines and next steps with internal stakeholders and sponsors.

Mandatory Criteria:

  • Deep theoretical and practical experience in human-centred design in complex organisational and stakeholder environments.
  • Demonstrated experience initiating and leading complex innovation projects (from a subject matter and stakeholder perspective) while applying agile methodology.
  • Well-developed research and analytical skills - the ability to practice divergent and convergent thinking; ability to draw on literature, evidence and information from diverse disciplines and fields into practical action; and ability to analyse qualitative and quantitative data to draw insights.
  • Excellent organisational skills with demonstrated experience delivering high quality outcomes on time limited projects, with proven capacity to prioritise, and achieve results while remaining customer focussed.
  • Well-developed interpersonal and influencing skills with previous experience engaging and collaborating with key stakeholders to achieve optimal business outcomes.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to produce high quality written documentation and presentation of findings in a timely manner.

Desirable:

  • Tertiary qualifications in an appropriate discipline and extensive work experience.
  • The ideal candidate will also have an understanding of mental health services; as well as relevant experience with the Australian Public Service, and/or the Defence community.

Contact:

Catherine on 0449 535 457 to discuss this role further or inquire about our other positions available. Alternatively, email Catherine directly at catherine@acmhealthcare.com.au

OR

Jess on 0404 576 374 to discuss this role further or inquire about our other positions available. Alternatively, email Jess directly at jess@acmhealthcare.com.au

Why to work with ACM (Conditions Apply*)

  • Free EAP Program
  • Potential to pay your gym membership
  • Potential to pay your work travel
  • Leave and Unpaid leave options
www.acmhealthcare.com.au
Tel: 1800 GO 2 ACM (46-2-226)
Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Linkedin

Email: recruitment@acmhealthcare.com.au OR
click on the 'Apply for this job' button below.

title: Senior Test Analyst
description:
Long term opportunity for a Senior Test Analyst with a strong technical background and skills in Integration Testing. Apply now!

  • Senior Integration Test Analyst | Government Org | Contract Opportunity
  • Adelaide CBD Based | Some WFH Flexibility | Great Team Culture
  • $85-100/hour | Long Term - 12+ Month Contract

As the Senior Test Analyst you will be working on an ongoing Government program which is continually evolving and replacing outdated legacy systems and process. This is a long term contract with the scope of work running well into 2023. You will be performing Functional and Non-functional testing with a heavy focus on Integration Testing.

Key Responsibilities...

  • Identifying, designing and developing test cases according to specifications.
  • Participating in review of requirement specification documents to make sure requirements are complete, not ambiguous and not in conflict to other requirements.
  • Performing functional, non-functional, integration and system testing in line with test cases for the project.
  • Creating and maintaining test data according to the organisational privacy requirements to be used in test execution.
  • Recording test results, raising defects and re-testing fixes.
  • Creating test reports and communicating status of assigned testing tasks to testing lead and management
  • Providing realistic estimates to Test Lead for assigned testing tasks.
  • Maintaining the test management system e.g. HP ALM and JIRA according to organisational and program standards and processes for testing
  • Adhering to all organisational policies, procedures, standards and practices.

Key Skills and Experience

  • Experience in similar role
  • Proven experience in planning and executing various forms of testing of enterprise computer applications, particularly system, acceptance and regression testing.
  • Proven experience with use of test repositories and testing tools
  • Proven experience in verifying COTS applications.

Sound like you?

HOW TO APPLY:

Please submit your resume for consideration via the appropriate link. A cover letter demonstrating your relevant experience may also be reviewed. Should you wish to discuss, please contact Brett Elliott on 0448 041 718 quoting reference number: 215543. Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

title: Procurement Officers
description:
• 6 month contract
  • Federal Government Agency
  • Adelaide Location

About the company
Karlka Recruiting Group has partnered with a Federal Government Agency to engage an APS4 - APS6 Procurement Officers. This position is located in their busy Adelaide office for an initial 6 month contract.

About the Position
The officers will be required to manage multiple panel procurements, complete relevant forms of engagement via panels for example Work Order, Official Order, etc which will require strong administrative skills.
Officers will need to work autonomously and within a team environment. Officers will need to be flexible in how they approach work noting the need to operate in an often high-pressure environment, dealing with high volumes of work requiring Officers to be able to prioritise their workload to deal with changes in priorities.

Duties
  • Accessing external panel arrangements.
  • Providing advice to staff in relation to procurement activities to ensure compliance with internal procedures and the Commonwealth Procurement Framework.
  • Ensuring deadlines can be met.
  • Working collaboratively and communicating effectively with various stakeholders and suppliers, when undertaking procurement activities.
  • Ensure risks and issues are escalated to the appropriate delegate in a timely manner
Requirements/Skills

  • Display good judgement and be flexible and resilient under pressure.
  • Strong skills in coordination, planning, time management and achieving results.
  • Demonstrated ability at problem solving, proposing solutions and effective action in meeting ARWA objectives.
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritise tasks and achieve known deliverables and outcomes.
  • Ability to communicate effectively (both written and orally) and have good interpersonal skills.

title: CUSTOMER SERVICE-TRAINEE
description:
Bring your passion for exceptional customer service to this role!

Statewide Appliance Spares is looking for a bright enthusiastic person interested in developing their customer service skills. This person will enjoy problem-solving and finding solutions, with a willingness to learn & become a vital member of our team.

For over 35 years, Statewide Appliance Spares has been a leading national distributor and retailer of appliance spare parts and equipment for the most popular domestic and commercial appliance manufacturers. Brands supported by Statewide Appliance Spares include LG, Panasonic, Electrolux, Fisher & Paykel, Samsung, Fujitsu, Bosch and many more.

We are seeking a reliable person to join our dedicated customer service and spare parts team to fill a permanent fulltime position in our busy office and warehouse.

The purpose of the role is primarily for the efficient interpretation of customer telephone and email enquiries for price and availability of appliance spare parts, accurate processing of orders and effectively addressing any customer queries or issues. Also the successful person will need to be willing to be trained in related activities such as counter sales, warehouse work, stock ordering, stock control and administration.


The main duties and responsibilities for this role will be to:

  • Efficiently & attentively respond to customer enquiries by phone or email
  • Efficiently conduct spare parts identification and interpretation
  • Effectively communicate with customers and process sales orders
  • Assist in front counter sales when necessary
  • Order stock, follow-up and goods receiving when necessary
  • Provide backup support for other customer service activities

The successful person MUST have the following skills and attributes:

  • A bright and enthusiastic personality
  • Competent in using computers and data entry is essential
  • Be flexible in performing a variety of tasks as required
  • Proven to be self-motivated, reliable and responsible
  • Display professional and confident communication skills
  • Ability to learn quickly & possess a willingness to continually develop

In addition you should have:

  • Some retail or other customer service experience
  • Effective telephone communication skills
  • An efficient and well organised nature
  • The ability to follow processes and procedures in a team environment
  • A track record of being reliable, flexible and eager to learn new skills
  • An interest in electronics, computers or how appliances work is desirable but not essential

Statewide Appliance Spares is an organisation that understands the importance of having good people within its business. Your commitment and contribution will be recognised with competitive pay and conditions.

If you are ready to develop your skills and join a successful company that sells and distributes spare parts for some of the most recognised appliance brands throughout Australia, with a passion for exceptional customer service and problem-solving, then we would like to hear from you. Apply to the Chief Executive Officer today. (Previous applicants need not apply)

title: Solution Architect
description:
Attractive remuneration package on offer to the successful candidate. Total salary package offered will depend on qualifications and experience.

Continuing position available

P lay an integral role in planning and implementing key IT projects assuming end-to-end responsibility for the overall architectural solution.

The IT Strategy, Planning and Governance unit is responsible for IT Security, IT Governance, oversight of the CIO Office, and the disciplines of architecture, business analysis, change management, communications and training. These functions within ITDS support and enable the strategic objectives of the University. The solution architect forms part of this unit.

Receiving broad direction and working with a considerable degree of autonomy, the solution architect plays an integral role in implementation of key IT projects including conducting feasibility assessments for potential projects and assuming end-to-end responsibility for the overall architectural solution.

To be successful you will need

  • Extensive experience in architecting and implementing enterprise solutions.
  • Experience in performing the Solution Architect role across an IT portfolio involving a wide variety of technologies in the application and infrastructure domains, delivering into an operational environment.
  • Current knowledge of IT trends and preferably those relevant to the University’s IT environment.
  • Extensive experience in one or more of the following areas is desired but not essential; Adobe Experience Platform, CRM and RedHat Fuse, enterprise/corporate application solution design, integration architecture in an enterprise environment, data architecture, cloud architecture.

Enjoy an outstanding career environment

The University of Adelaide is a uniquely rewarding workplace. The size, breadth and quality of our education and research programs - including significant industry, government and community collaboration - offers you vast scope and opportunity for a long, fulfilling career.

It also enables us to attract high-calibre people in all facets of our operations, ensuring you will be surrounded by talented colleagues, many world-leading. Our work's cutting-edge nature - not just in your own area, but across virtually the full spectrum of human endeavour - provides a constant source of inspiration.

Our culture is one that welcomes all and embraces diversity consistent with our Staff Values and Behaviour Framework and our Values of integrity, respect, collegiality, excellence and discovery. We firmly believe that our people are our most valuable asset, so we work to grow and diversify the skills, knowledge and capability of all our staff.

We embrace flexibility as a key principle to allow our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal and family life. Flexible working arrangements are on offer for all roles at the University.

In addition, we offer a wide range of attractive staff benefits. These include: salary packaging; flexible work arrangements; high-quality professional development programs and activities; and an on-campus health clinic, gym and other fitness facilities.

Learn more at: adelaide.edu.au/jobs

Your division's broader role

The Division of University Operations enables the University's delivery of high-quality and distinct learning, teaching and research experiences. Its responsibilities link to Adelaide's strategic plan and focus on people, community, assets and infrastructure, and processes.

Learn more at: adelaide.edu.au/operations

If you have the talent, we'll give you the opportunity. Together, let's make history.

title: Credit Assessor
description:
THE BASICS

We are seeking an ambitious and enthusiastic Credit Assessor to join one of Australia’s leading credit risk teams. This role represents an opportunity to support an incredibly exciting, fast-growing financial technology company (‘FinTech’), that offers substantial personal and professional development opportunities.


THE COMPANY

OurMoneyMarket and its brand ‘Handypay’ (together ‘OMM’) is one of Australia’s fastest growing FinTech companies, recently featuring in the AFR Fast Starter List and Deloitte Fast Tech 50 . Based on the Deloitte Fast Tech 50 list, OMM is the fastest growing FinTech in Australia and the fast-growing business in Adelaide.

Our mission is to ‘Make Money Simple’. We offer personal finance management tools and a range of consumer finance solutions (personal loans, interest-free payment plans, car loans, and more), so you can turn maybe someday, into today!


ABOUT THE ROLE

You will be responsible for preparing credit application files for decisioning by a credit manager. As a Credit Assessor, your role will entail:

  • Assessing credit risk and providing pricing and outcome recommendations for personal loan applications;
  • Accurately assessing a customer’s loan application and validating data in line with policy and regulations;
  • Following up customers daily for the information required to complete an assessment;
  • Being responsible for the quality of files to ensure correct and complete information is available to enable settlement to proceed.
  • Developing strong credit assessment and structuring skills by working with a diverse customer set;
  • Responding to enquiries and qualifying customers for finance by completing the application process with customers over the phone and via email.
  • Providing outstanding customer service to OMM’s customers and vendor partners. This includes assisting with group inbox management, resolving loan and account enquiries, appeals or complaints in a timely manner.


ABOUT YOU

  • Good quantitative and analytical skills
  • Great interpersonal skills and ability to build rapport
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills


WHAT WE OFFER

We will offer you:

  • A competitive salary to reward the very best
  • An environment where you will be able to personally and professionally take yourself to a new level
  • Opportunities to be part of our leadership development programmes, where you can gain experience in Treasury, Finance, Marketing, Sales, Software Engineering, Product Management and more!
  • A collaborative, respectful, team culture, where you will work closely with executive management
  • Discounts on consumer finance products
  • A place where you can make a huge impact, and everyone will love you for it!


HOW TO APPLY

Simple follow the links to apply!

title: IT Project Managers
description:
At GHD, our business is undertaking a digital transformation in its use of tools, processes, and technologies. We are embracing cloud technologies and have significant new and existing projects underway across all regions in which GHD operates. As a result, we are now looking for experienced IT Project Managers to join our Market Engagement Technology team to scope and document projects in the Market Engagement Technology program related to the implementation of transformation projects across GHD. Initially this will be a 12 month fixed term opportunity with possibility of extending / ongoing work. Working within IS, this position will see you involved in:

  • Hold primary responsibility for the successful delivery of projects from the Market Engagement Technology roadmap
  • Liaise with Enterprise stakeholders, IS technical contributors, External Program Partners and Business Analysts to establish the scope of projects
  • Document the project scope in a way that allows consultation and approval
  • Establish the internal governance pathway for the project based on its scope and impact, and then manage the project in accordance with the agreed pathway
  • Work directly with the Business Analysts, Development Team, Platform Team, external partners and other IS teams to deliver the projects
  • Develop strong relationships with a range of key Stakeholders, and maintain a high level of communication to sustain those relationships

What you will bring to the team

  • Previous experience in successful delivery of transformation projects
  • An ability to confidently initiate and sustain communications with a range of parties within the Enterprise
  • Advanced written skills, including the ability to concisely translate a large amount of information into reports and correspondence, targeted at both technical and non-technical audiences as needed
  • Project Management skills including progress, tracking, financial management, vendor management, reporting, risk management
  • Strong analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting skills

We currently have vacancies specific to:

  • Salesforce
  • MarTech
  • Enterprise Applications
  • Cloud Migration
  • IT Operations

Interested?
Contact Andy Maddison – Talent Acquisition Business Partner
T + 07 3316 4013 GHD is an equal opportunity employer and we want everyone to be able to fully participate in our recruitment process. We value a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and people of all identities. #LI-AM1

title: Test Lead
salary: ASO7 $103,387 to $111,759 per annum plus super
description:
Snippet
A rare opportunity for an ongoing Test Lead role with South Australia Police.

Your new company
South Australia Police (SAPOL) provides a diverse range of services to the community.  These services are aimed at producing a safe and peaceful environment by the minimisation of crime and disorder.  It is a large complex organisation which, because of the nature of its operations, is constantly subject to public scrutiny and accountability.  It provides services to a range of different locations (over 100) spread across the State on a 24 hour a day basis.

SAPOL’s vision is to provide a visible, responsive police service for all South Australians. All SAPOL employees are guided by Our Values of Service, Integrity, Courage, Leadership, Collaboration and Respect. SAPOL is an organisation with a proud history and an exciting vision for the future.

Your new role
As the Test Lead, your role will involve implementing a consistent, risk-based approach to testing across the whole of the SAPOL IS&T department. This is a key role, providing testing services and advice across a broad project portfolio as well as BAU solutions. You will work with business contacts across the organisation and closely with the PMO and other stakeholders to ensure that accurate estimates of testing efforts are provided at the project initiation phase and work with them to ensure that testing resources are available.

You will manage the whole of the SAPOL IS&T software testing team to ensure consistency, the sharing of technical knowledge, as well as recommendations for personal development amongst the team. You will need to apply a matrix management approach to ensure flexibility and the sharing of resources in a dynamic environment. As a part of this role you will also have the opportunity to evolve the testing framework, including the establishment of a best practice test automation offering.

You will report to the SAPOL IS&T Manager, Quality and Assurance and will work with a range of internal and external stakeholders, including other operational managers, to ensure the integrity, availability and quality of IS&T services to SAPOL.

This is a great opportunity for you to join a large and complex environment during an exciting IT transformation. You will be a proven leader with excellent interpersonal and communication skills ready to take on your next challenge

What you’ll need to succeed

  • Experience leading a team of technical experts in various forms of testing including systems, acceptance, load and regression testing.
  • Knowledge of, and practical experience in, managing functional and non-functional testing, administering test management tools in an SDLC and ITIL environment.
  • Ideally you will have experience implementing or improving testing services.
  • The ability to effectively liaise with internal and external stakeholders to ensure accurate estimates of testing is provided at the project initiation phase, and work with project teams to ensure availability of resources.
  • Ideally, you will have experience leading a team from manual to automated testing and evaluating where this would be most effective implementation.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage and lead a team with the ability to work with autonomy in determining methodologies.
  • High level of analytical skills and a methodical approach to detail.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills including the ability to communicate technology solutions into business terms as well as business requirements to technical staff.

Salary
ASO7 $103,387 to $111,759 per annum plus super.

Benefits
This is a great opportunity to join a large, complex and high profile SA Government department that is going through an exciting transformational change period and making a genuine investment in ICT as a driver of business excellence.

Application Instructions:
Please click on ‘Apply’ which will direct you to iworkforSA and further information will be provided on how to apply.

Applications Close: 25/05/2022 5:00pm

title: HYBRID WFH! Full Time, Customer Service Roles for the Australian Passport Office
description:
Are you passionate about helping people? Be the first to join this new and exciting opportunity to help out your fellow Australians!

We are hiring Customer Service Roles to support our new client, the Australian Passport Office, in Adelaide CBD with hybrid working from home options available. Be recognised and rewarded for your contributions while making a real difference to the lives of Australians.

As a Customer Service Representative, you will be providing essential services to people across Australia on behalf of our Australian Federal Government client. In this role you'll be operating in a dynamic team environment with a focus on meeting quality outcomes for customers.

About The Role

With access to knowledge content, extensive training and leadership support you will be helping Australians with Passport enquires looking to travel.

A hybrid working model will give flexibility, less time spent travelling while still having face to face contact and support with your team.

Benefits

  • Datacom oﬀers its people the ability to make a real diﬀerence, and develop their careers within a supportive and rewarding environment.
  • We offer options for you to interview virtually.
  • Best in class rewards and recognition program, including awards and corporate retail discounts on tap.
  • Talent development programs designed to engage and empower you: we want to build on your strengths and experiences and provide you with career growth within our organisation. Opportunities for development include: Leadership, Business Analytics, Administration, HR & Recruitment and IT.
  • Paid Parental Leave


Operating Hours
Our operating hours are Monday to Friday between 8:00am and 8:00pm on a rotating roster with flexibility to support all of your out of work commitments.

We understand that life can be busy, therefore, Datacom's commitment is to provide a flexible work life balance to suit any personal or family commitments whilst still maintaining full time hours.

About You

  • High attention to detail
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Clear communication skills to customers and stakeholders
  • Punctual and reliable
  • Experience adhering to KPI's
  • Able to manage customer expectations
  • Patience and empathy towards people in difficult situations
  • A team player focus, working collaboratively to exceed expectations
  • Intermediate computer skills, ability to navigate multiple screens and a typing speed of 30WPM
  • Due to clearance requirements Australian Citizenship is required


About Datacom

Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.

We have over 6,500 people across our global offices and generate an annual revenue of over AU $1.1 billion annually. This makes us one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. We are committed to hiring, developing and promoting diverse talent.

Datacom has extensive expertise in the operation of contact centres, data centres, engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations.

Founded in 1965, we have a successful trading history of consistent growth, profitability and a track record of delivering innovative, cost effective technology solutions.

We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

If you're looking for meaningful work with genuine career progression opportunities, training and development, we'd love to hear from you.

APPLY WITH US TODAY!
