title: Senior Integration Developer
description:
The Department for Education is committed to developing an education system where all children and young people reach their potential, enabled by world-class digital technology and systems.

The department's intent is to deliver high performing, world class information and communication services. The edAnalytics Hub Program is a key project being delivered to consolidate and replace disparate and end of life data and reporting systems across HR, Finance and Student areas, with a modern enterprise data and analytics solution.

To support this vision, the Department for Education is now seeking a Senior Integration Developer to join the edAnalytics Hub Program to provide advice to the Integration Architect, development team, and internal stakeholders to deliver project requirements and lead the design and development of integration.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead the design and implementation of technically complex programs
  • Model a test-driven and quality-led culture including evaluating automation throughout the software development lifecycle
  • Provide advice in relation to integration architecture to solution and enterprise architects and developers
  • Coordinate and evaluate technical activities including the development of applications and the creation of APIS, point to point integrations and integration platforms
  • Manage, monitor and provide analysis of the integration environment
  • Monitor critical issues, risks and changes, which impact on the Department's data infrastructure and architecture

Key Requirements:

  • Experience planning complex programs which deliver highly integrated and stable applications, interfaces and software platforms
  • Significant experience implementing contemporary data management platforms and utilising Microsoft Azure and Mulesoft technology suites.
  • Knowledge of software development concepts and tools for the development for API, Microservices and the integration of PaaS and SaaS solutions
  • Knowledge of government policies and their application in relation to the department's data-related policies

This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is passionate about making a real difference in the lives of South Australian children and young people.

The Senior Integration Developer will provide technical expertise to all aspects of delivery from requirements analysis, design, testing through to full production deployment. Working collaboratively and with flexibility across divisional teams based on peak workloads and priorities, the role will contribute to achieving the department's objective in providing world class education.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply please click apply or call Ash Nair on 08 8216 3517 for a confidential discussion.

title: Senior Group Portfolio Advisor
description:
About Santos
Santos is a global low-cost producer of oil and gas committed to ever-cleaner energy and fuels production with operations across Australia, Papua New Guinea, Timor-Leste and North America.

Santos has been supplying reliable and affordable energy to Australia and the Asia-Pacific for over 65 years.
At Santos, our commitment is to be a global leader in the transition to cleaner energy and clean fuels, by helping the world decarbonise to reach net-zero emissions in an affordable and sustainable way.

Santos is already Australia’s biggest domestic gas supplier, a leading Asia-Pacific LNG supplier and is committed to supplying the critical fuels such as oil and gas in a more sustainable way through decarbonising projects such as the Moomba CCS project.

Underpinned by a diverse portfolio of high-quality, long-life, low-cost oil and gas assets, Santos seeks to deliver long-term value to shareholders.

For more than 65 years, Santos has been working in partnership with local communities, providing local jobs and business opportunities, safely and sustainably developing its natural gas resources, and powering industries and households.

As customer demand evolves, Santos plans to grow its cleaner energy and clean fuels through carbon capture and storage, nature-based offsets, energy efficiency and use of renewables in its operations.
With a strong, low-cost base business supplying oil and gas and plans to develop cleaner energy and clean fuels, Santos remains resilient, value accretive and at the leading edge of the energy transition.

About the role
A great opportunity has become available within the Group Planning & Portfolio team for a Senior Group Portfolio Advisor accountable for providing the Executive Leadership Team with the insights and perspectives to inform vision, set direction and support action.

Reporting to the Manager, Group Planning & Portfolio, this position will be responsible for the facilitation of group pro-forma financial statement analysis and the maintenance and management of planning and portfolio related processes in line with Santos Management Standards.

The candidate will need to bring strong technical accounting and analytical skills along with a strategic mindset to the role to address complex “what-if” scenarios, combining big picture thinking with attention to detail. The ability to distil detailed data into clear messages whilst preparing the highest quality presentation material for Executive Leadership Team and/or Board consumption will ensure success in the role.

Key responsibilities of the role include:
  • Managing Santos Group pro-formal financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cashflow Statements) via the corporate funding model
  • Facilitating bi-annual assurance/audit programs (inclusive of asset long term plans and economics) to ensure integrity of Group Portfolio data
  • Running the corporate funding model to support portfolio scenario analysis and key stakeholder requirements (Strategy, Investor Relations, Corporate Development, Group Treasury, Group Taxation, Group Finance, Commercial and Midstream)
  • Coordinating half-year and full-year Impairment processes, assurance of impairment cases, analysis, and audit Interface on behalf of the Corporate Planning Division
  • Supporting the preparation of Company Valuation materials
  • Developing and maintaining internal networks to understand and articulate emerging risks and opportunities
  • Addressing complex “what-if” portfolio scenarios, combining big picture thinking with attention to detail
  • Distilling detailed portfolio data into clear messages whilst preparing high quality presentation material for Board and/or Excom consumption
  • Mentoring and developing team members with specific regards to Santos Group pro-forma financial statements analysis
About you
The successful candidate will be tertiary/degree qualified in either Commerce, Finance, Economics, or similar disciplines with demonstrated work experience within the Oil & Gas industry.  Chartered Accounting or CPA qualification coupled with audit firm experience will be highly regarded.

To be successful in this role you will need to display strong analytical skills, be able to link strategic and financial analysis coupled with cashflow and financial modelling. Further you will need to be resilient and flexible to meet the dynamic demands of a fast-paced environment.

You will bring your capabilities to problem solve and be confident at presenting information in a clear concise manner to a wide range of stakeholders throughout the business.
Being able to manage your time effectively and thinking outside the box, pulling big picture ideas together, are critical to your success in this role.

How to apply
Applications must be submitted via the online recruitment system before COB Wednesday, 18th May 2022

title: Digital Marketing Coordinator
description:
HVG Decorative Building Products, a subsidiary of HVG, distribute and manufacture innovative, design driven interior surfaces throughout Australia that enhance and transform. Our industry leading brands are used widely in the architectural, design and trade based sectors with a strong focus on our diverse portfolio in supporting commercial and residential markets.
We currently have a new and exciting opportunity for an experienced Digital Marketing Coordinator to join our team. We are looking for someone who is passionate about digital marketing, has a customer focused mindset and wants to own, manage, report and drive their vision within the digital marketing support space.

The Role

Reporting to the Marketing Manager, the successful candidate would have a minimum one to two years’ experience and will be responsible for coordinating all our digital channels.

  • Coordinate and manage website content on required platforms (Wordpress, Shopify or other) in line with marketing strategy
  • Management of all web related, SEO, landing pages, user experience, look and feel
  • Manage customer email, including updating databases and optimising customer experience
  • Distribute eDMs through CRM tools (Mailchimp) on time and to brief. Collect and distribute result
  • Create social media content and calendar in line with business objectives. Design, post and manage all platforms
  • Evaluate end-to-end customer experience, identify critical conversion, and drop off points and optimise user funnels
  • Collaborate, plan and assist with total business marketing strategy and execution
  • Analyse and interpret data, including google analytics
  • Collaborate with agencies, key partners and other external relationships
  • Sample and sales tool management for national team
  • Undertake varied tasks in support of our marketing activities and sales team needs
About you

This is a great opportunity to join an industry leader and build their digital marketing assets across all platforms.
  • Great knowledge of all social media platforms (Linked In, Instagram, Pinterest and Facebook)
  • Design experience using Adobe Suite desirable
  • Experience using WordPress, Mailchimp desirable
  • B2B experience
  • Proven ability in coordinating digital projects and initiatives to completion
  • Keen interest in presenting new and fresh ideas
  • Experienced in copy writing, presenting and communicating with multiple stakeholders
  • Creative flair and an attention to detail
  • Excellent time management and an understanding of the importance of deadline
  • Bachelor of Business, Marketing or Communications
  • Previous experience in industry is desirable, but not essential.
Attractive salary package and a great team await, don't delay apply now with your cover letter and resume in Word format please.

title: Solution Architect
description:
Our Client is among the worlds top 1% of universities, with a rich history of excellence and emphasis on innovation and research. They value talent and recognise the importance of investing resources in fostering the ongoing learning and development those who work and study in their community.

They are looking for an experienced Solution Architect who is confident to work with a degree of autonomy and be able to provide key guidance for implementation of projects across a variety of IT functions within the IT/business unit.

ABOUT YOU:

- Experience conducting feasibility assessments

- Extensive end to end project solution architecture experience

- Experience in delivering solutions in one (preferably more) of the following: cyber security, data migration/warehousing, application support, enterprise service management, legecy OR modern applications projects.

- Delivering solution architecture within projects in application and infrastructure domains to an operational environment

- Ability to communicate, effect change and adapt to diverse and changing environments

If this sounds like you, please APPLY NOW!

REF: 256370

To be considered for the role click the 'apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Victoria Jones on 08 7422 0617 or email: vjones@paxus.com.au and quote the above job reference number.

Paxus values diversity and welcomes applications from Indigenous Australians, people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people living with a disability. If you require an adjustment to the recruitment process please contact me on the above contact details.

title: .Net Developer - Adelaide
description:
This is a Software Developer / Support Analyst role for one of South Australia's Government systems for state-wide operations. The resource will work with the Public Safety Practice support and development team to provide development and ongoing support of the applications and interfaces to support all end-clients.

Roles and Responsibilities:
  • Software developer to develop and support applications and interfaces for projects.
  • The role will start as a development and support analyst during the project phase. It will also evolve into development and ongoing level 2 and 3 support.
  • Note: the project started December 2021, with go-live currently projected for November 2022.
During Project and BAU:
  • Understanding of customer processes and requirements
  • Understanding of the application being implemented, including out-of-the-box configuration and API
  • Interface development
  • Design and documentation
  • Testing
  • Work as part of the wider Courts practice to understand various implementations of the product set
  • System administration
  • Provide Level 2 and 3 support for the main system, interfaces and other associated applications.
  • Timely and efficient resolution of incidents and tasks assigned by customer.
  • Fault resolution and change management to agreed change control procedures and managing the technical aspects of the release and testing processes.
  • On call responsibilities as part of a roster in BAU phase
Skills Required:
  • Software development experience in a development team
  • Experience with agile methodologies.
  • Experience with Java, MS SQL, Apache TomCat, PostGreSQL
Desirable Skills:
  • Experience working directly with a customer.
  • Ability to learn frameworks and languages quickly.
  • Strong application support and delivery background.

title: HREC Officer
description:
Bellberry Limited is an independent, national not for profit company that supports the Australian health research community through the provision of human research ethics committees (HRECs). Our mission is to promote and improve the welfare of human research participants and the quality, efficiency and effectiveness of research in Australia. Our expert committees provide streamlined scientific and ethical reviews of human research projects across the country. We return our profits to the medical research sector.

Fortunately, due to our continued growth, we are recruiting for HREC Officers to join our team. Reporting to the Team Leader, you will be part of a collaborative and supportive team that is responsible for providing:

  • Administration support of studies through our electronic submission and management database
  • Correspondence with committee members, and researchers across Australia
  • Preparation for, and attendance at, HREC meetings
  • Interpretation of meeting deliberations

To be successful in this role you must possess excellent administration, analysis and communication skills with a strong focus on customer service. You will be a team player, who thrives in delivering quality outcomes to clients. A background/interest in medical/health administration, combined with experience in database management will be highly regarded.

In return, you will have the opportunity to work as part of a passionate and progressive company, that offers an attractive salary package, hybrid working, and great employee benefits.

Flexibility of work hours will be required as meetings are held on Wednesday evenings – the role will generally support one meeting per month.

The Job Description can be viewed on the "Join the Bellberry Team" tab on the website at www.bellberry.com.au.

To submit your application, please click “APPLY” and attach your cover letter and resume of no more than two (2) pages.  For a confidential discussion, please contact Athena Seltsikas, HR Business Partner (08) 8361 3222 .

Please submit applications by COB 20 May 2022.

title: Advertising Specialist
description:
Title:

Advertising Specialist


Salary:

75k-85k + super


The Kingdom is a HubSpot Diamond Certified Partner and software developer. We are digital sales experts, uniting marketing technology with sales teams for maximum ROI.

We work from Adelaide, South Australia and specialise in setting up and deploying complicated HubSpot Enterprise portals.

The Kingdom help busy businesses build powerful digital sales tools with continuous improvement, so they get value and growth from their technology investment.

This role is fast-paced, and requires outstanding problem-solving skills, plus a thirst for knowledge.

We work in a quickly changing landscape and need vibrant people keen to change the world.

Determination to bust impediments is critical.

Work in a dynamic digital ecosystem with a large array of different tasks to keep you stimulated.

The role

The Kingdom seeks an Advertising Specialist to acquire new leads and customers through online advertising campaigns. You will create content and deploy all external, online acquisition marketing, projecting the strategy, execution, and optimization across channels for The Kingdom, Campaign Warrior and our comprehensive portfolio of HubSpot consulting clients with digital ad budgets.

Your responsibilities:


  • Proficient with HubSpot
  • Develop content topics to reach the company and our client’s target customers
  • Curate and manage all published content and communications
  • Create and manage promotions and paid social media ad campaigns
  • Formulate and adhere to the marketing budget
  • Segmentation, targeting and positioning of The Kingdom, Campaign Warrior and our client’s brands
  • Uphold the company brand and values
  • Provide reporting to management

Relevant tertiary qualification – Marketing, Advertising

  • 3 years+ marketing/advertising experience, especially on social media and online platforms
  • Experience in managing budgets

title: Manager- Markets, Clients, Strategy
description:
• Position: Manager – Markets, Clients and Strategy (MCS)
  • Location: Adelaide, South Australia
  • Duration: Full-time, permanent employment

Why Tetra Tech International Development?

As a leading global development consulting firm, our purpose is to contribute to a world where people, communities and the planet thrive.

Tetra Tech International Development works with governments, businesses and NGOs to solve complex development challenges. Our dedicated team helps partners including DFAT, USAID and the Asian Development Bank to deliver effective and sustainable projects in more than 80 countries around the world.

The Position

As the Markets, Clients and Strategy (MCS) Manager you will play a critical role in contributing to specific research, technical delivery, business development and project management tasks.

In the position you will also:

  • Collaborate with the leadership team, senior leaders and staff across Tetra Tech International Development as a member of the markets, clients and strategy team to drive business growth and delivery.
  • Work with our teams across the full project lifecycle in both pursuing and delivering work in the international development, private sector, and domestic Australian market for the company.
  • Play a leading role in the pursuit, management, and production of challenging tenders. This may include preparing project summaries, collating project outcomes and proofs, undertaking literature reviews, providing administrative and logistic project support, maintaining pipeline management tools, market research, and other duties as required.
  • Continually review business development and project management performance functions to identify opportunities to improve the performance and delivery of the functions and ensure best practice principles are applied.

Market_Client_Strategy_Manager_PD.pdf

The Person

The successful candidate will demonstrate the following qualifications, key skills, and attributes:

  • Relevant qualifications and training, with an undergraduate qualification in relevant area (i.e. business, management, social sciences or in a technical/ professional field of relevance.)
  • Desirable: Postgraduate degree in relevant area (i.e. Evaluation, Social Sciences Research, Design, Impact Measurement, International Relations, Gender, Public Policy and/or relevant field)
  • Demonstrated strong business awareness, project management capabilities and an in-depth understanding of the international development sector
  • A good understanding in applying technical methodologies and practice in one or more of the following thematic areas: climate and environmental justice; education; defence and human security; health; human capital development; infrastructure; social services; agriculture; inclusive growth; economic development; governance; and justice.
  • Advanced in the use of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Visio.

How to Apply

To view a detailed position description, please visit  Tetra Tech International Development Careers [link removed]and search for job number 499655 . Please note that applications will only be accepted via the online application process on the Tetra Tech International Development Website.

For further enquiries, please contact us at IDEV.HRServices@tetratech.com and quote the job reference number 499655.

Applications close:  Wednesday the 1st of June 2022 at 8:30am (ACST).

Tetra Tech International Development has a 40-year history in successfully delivering international development projects on behalf of donors right around the world, including Australia's Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade, USAID and the UK's Department for International Development (now known as the Foreign and Commonwealth Development Office). Our people work side by side with local partners to support stability, economic growth and good governance, positively changing people's lives.

Tetra Tech International Development has robust policies and guidelines which exemplify our commitment to safeguarding and technical excellence in gender equality. Our team of dedicated GEDSI advisers work closely with our staff and partners to ensure a context-specific and consistent approach is applied to all our programmes to improve the livelihoods of the world’s most marginalised groups.

Tetra Tech International Development is also committed to respectful workplaces and does not tolerate sexual exploitation, abuse or harassment of any kind.

Tetra Tech International Development is an equal opportunity employer of choice and is committed to child protection.

title: Software Engineering Manager
description:
Telstra Health

At Telstra Health, we’re building solutions that improve the quality, safety and efficiency of healthcare delivered across Australia. Working with clinical and administrative systems, health data analytics, population health solutions and information exchange platforms, we’re enabling clinicians to deliver care in new ways.

We are currently searching for a Software Engineering Manager to lead a brand new software engineering team. This role will be working on some new and very exciting projects.

Help us shape a connected future for healthcare by:

  • Managing and supporting the development teams to ensure successful delivery of approved projects in alignment with the project governance framework
  • Managing complex customer implementations and integrations
  • Collaborating with Product Management Leads for the delivery of requested functionality as presented in the roadmap
  • Maintaining and improving the development teams delivery processes and procedures
  • Leading project status reviews to objectively assess and monitor project health & performance and to ensure compliance to methodology

The role will see you acting as a thought-leader, an advocate and champion for Agile across Telstra Health, contributing to the continuous improvement and adoption of Telstra’s agile journey. Therefore, we are looking for somebody who has a clear understanding and experience of working in Agile Software development framework specially particularly TDD / BDD.

You will need to draw on your strong experience leading a technology team/function, and experience within service management or support in a large-scale and diverse environment of incident management, escalation procedures and related disciplines.

You’ll build connections for life through:

  • Joining “an exciting innovative organisation”….listen to our MD Mary Foley share more of her thoughts in this short video [link removed]
  • Being part of Healthcare’s digital future. Watch our video [link removed] which explains how Telstra Health is shaping it now
  • Leading and creating motivated teams through your strategic expertise

To be part of something meaningful and impact lives across Australia, apply for a role with us today.

We are a Circle Back Initiative Employer. We commit to respond to every applicant, and you will hear back from us soon.

To ensure the safety and well-being of our people and customers, this role requires the successful candidate to be vaccinated against Covid-19. However, please speak to us if you have any questions about this based on your individual circumstances.

title: Applications Support Specialist
description:
About us

Saab Australia is a defence, security and cyber solutions provider, specialising in the development and integration of major defence and security systems. For over 30 years in Australia, we have built a reputation for delivering complex systems integration projects that provide proven and advanced capabilities to keep us ahead of today's challenges.

From combat, communications, security and underwater systems, to mixed reality, cyber security and deployable health solutions, our extensive portfolio of products and services provide high-technology solutions for defence forces and civil industries across the globe.

Apply today to join our crew and deliver solutions with purpose.

The role

As part of our Corporate group, the Applications Support Specialist will provides support for Saab's business applications, tools and information systems used across Saab's classified and unclassified computing environments. Drawing on their knowledge and experience, the Applications Support Specialist will help to develop creative and innovative solutions as Saab's business needs dictate.

Further, the successful candidate will:

  • Maintain the integrity and smooth operation of Saab's business applications and information systems;
  • Troubleshoot and resolve assigned incidents or service requests whilst ensuring prompt professional service;
  • Installation, configuration and support of corporate and enterprise wide support tools, systems, applications and technologies;
  • Where appropriate, work with business stakeholders in the tailoring of commercial software products to meet specific business requirements;
  • Work, communicate and cross-skill with other members of the Applications team, and where appropriate within the greater ICT group;
  • Development, customisation and implementation of internal applications and/or systems to meet user needs
  • Afterhours work may be required to support critical issues and maintenance activities

Flexible work arrangements such as hybrid work from home / office, 9 day fortnight and part time (0.8 FTE minimum) will be considered for this role.

About you

Your skills and experience will include:

  • Hands on experience working within applications support team, or similar, supporting corporate business systems;
  • Broad knowledge of business tools, applications and technologies;
  • Demonstrated experience supporting and configuring commercial software products, such as ERP's, Financial Systems, HR Systems, and Engineering toolsets;
  • Demonstrated experience with Database technologies, such as Microsoft SQL Server and/or Oracle;
  • Demonstrated experience in one or more scripting/programming languages (e.g. .Net, PowerShell);
  • Demonstrated experience with application deployment and release management;
  • Fundamental understanding and awareness of information security and how this is applied in operational environments


As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain an NV1 clearance.

Culture and benefits

We employ over 600 Australians and are committed to fostering a culture of excellence and enriching the employee experience.

By joining Saab, you'll be a part of a collaborative and supportive organisation, where your professional growth and work-life balance are emphasised. You'll work within an innovative and vibrant workplace, while having the opportunity to develop a long-term, fulfilling career.

For further information about at career at Saab, visit the page adjacent: https://www.saab.com/markets/australia/careers/saab-life [link removed]

Applications

Click 'Apply' to submit your CV and cover letter in support of your application. You may contact our careers team at careers.mailbox@au.saabgroup.com for a copy of the full position description.

Saab Australia is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders to apply. We also welcome applications from individuals with culturally diverse backgrounds.

Saab Australia is a proud supporter of the Veterans' Employment Program and welcomes the interest of ex-service members, veterans and their families.

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist - Remote
description:
Are you a talented Recruiter looking for an opportunity to showcase your skills in a globally recognised and highly successful organisation?

At Hudson RPO we embrace curiosity, think differently and shape the future of Talent .

We are currently seeking Experienced Project Talent Acquisition Specialists to work on a variety of RPO solutions working remotely for the Hudson RPO Rapid Response team.

We are ideally seeking candidates with experience within a project environment, with experience in volume recruitment campaigns, with retail, FMCG or hospitality experience highly desirable.

What you will be doing

  • Partner closely with hiring managers and key stakeholders to deliver a best-in-class recruitment process
  • Own the entire end to end recruitment lifecycle
  • Add value through the delivery of strategic talent acquisition projects and initiatives
  • Provide guidance and counsel beyond the recruitment process, advising on market insights, trends, and competitor movements.


Who you are

  • An experienced Talent Acquisition Specialist with experience across a a range of white collar industries, including corporate, government, banking and finance, consultancy, IT, engineering, health, retail and hospitality.
  • Ability to effectively engage and manage relationships at all levels
  • Prior experience working in a complex and fast-paced environment
  • Efficient, process oriented and excellent organisational skills

Why you’ll love working for Hudson RPO:

  • Work with some of the world’s leading and most recognised brands
  • Receive four ‘Thrive’ days of leave per year to support your health and wellbeing (on top of your annual leave!)
  • Flexibility is at the core of who we are, and flexible work arrangements are encouraged
  • Quarterly and annual recognition programs to celebrate our employee’s success
  • We’re a passionate team of people who are shaping the future of talent!


A little bit about us

At Hudson RPO, we’re shaping the future of talent.
From recruitment process outsourcing (RPO) to employer branding and across the complete talent life-cycle, we thrive in delivering world-class customer and candidate experiences. People are at the centre of everything we do.

We deliver innovative, customised recruitment services and talent solutions to organisations worldwide. We’re an innovative and diverse team who work hard and think smart. Lead by accomplished and inclusive leaders, our people are always open to trying new things to continuously bring excellence into our client solutions.

At Hudson RPO we don’t just accept difference – we celebrate it, support it, and thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our clients, and our community. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and commit to fairness and equality for all during the hiring process. We value, respect, and listen regardless of your gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability status, religion, or family circumstances.

Please apply or contact Chantel Jones in our Hudson RPO Careers team

title: Software Engineer
description:
• Develop new capability within a long-standing, large Cyber and Big Data strategic partnership with the Commonwealth of Australia
  • Unique opportunity offering long-term career working on diverse leading-edge technologies
  • Family-friendly collaborative team environment offering flexible hours and convenient Adelaide (Mawson Lakes) location

About you

You love using software and technology to solve challenging customer problems with modern and leading-edge technologies. You enjoy variety as your 'norm', in a job that allows you to change what you’re working on.

You are looking to work in a collaborative, highly communicative team, and family-friendly environment where people celebrate team success as much as individual success.

You want a job that doesn't feel like 'work' with flexible hours that fit in with other things that are happening in your life, and a job where you get paid to learn as technologies change.  You’re seeking a workplace that provides career progression you want, at the pace you want it.

The skills you will bring

You are a qualified software engineer by trade with experience across one or more of the technologies listed below:

  • Python, C, C++, Java
  • Linux (ideally), Windows
  • Docker and Kubernetes
  • Cyber Security, Big Data
  • SQL and NoSQL databases
  • Interest and exposure to automated integration and testing would be beneficial
  • Some exposure to agile delivery methodologies

Clearance

To be eligible for this position you must:

  • Be an Australian citizen
  • Be willing to go through a TSPV level clearance

About the program

DXC Technology is part of a 20-year strategic partnership with the Commonwealth to develop new capability in the Cyber and Big Data domains. Now 5 years in, the strategic partnership is going from strength to strength with a great and growing software engineering team delivering capability under 5 separate capability development areas to date.  With a solid foundation and an exciting future, the program is perfectly positioned to add software developers with varied levels of experience over the next year.

Why join DXC Technology?

DXC Technology (NYSE:DXC) – where brilliant people embrace change and seize opportunities to advance their careers and amplify customer success.

People are the heart of our business. We support each other and work as a team, globally and locally to deliver excellence for our customers and colleagues. We live in more than 70 countries, speak multiple languages and work with over 6,000 customers on almost every continent. We use the power of technology to deliver mission critical IT services that move the world. DXC.com

Your working environment

This is a family-friendly collaborative team environment offering flexible hours.

DXC’s ‘people first’ mindset comes to life by offering the ultimate in working flexibility. We take a virtual-first approach, and our teams are spread across multiple geographies delivering a broad range of customer projects, which means we can tailor working arrangements that work for our people.

No matter where you are located, you’ll never feel alone and will always be supported with our diverse range of employee interest and social support groups. Whatever your passion, you will be amongst friends – from #PetsofDXC to photography, cycling or cooking groups – or we welcome you to make your mark and start your own group.

Our culture and benefits

A career with DXC allows you to work on supporting our frontline defence force, enabling missions for success while enjoying work-life balance. You can bring your technology expertise to contribute to national defence firsthand and make a real difference by working on world-class projects that protect our front-line personnel and help families spend more time together.

DXC Australia is a Platinum pledge partner of Soldier On. We are committed to working side-by-side with veterans and their families to help secure their future, and we welcome their interest in applying for this role.

As an employer of choice, our “people first” philosophy means we offer competitive remuneration, benefits, training and career opportunities that reflect our commitment to improving the lives of our employees, and the communities in which we live and work. Some of these include:

  • Extensive resources to support your onboarding and continual development, including DXC University
  • DXC Recognition, a global virtual platform that fosters a culture of appreciation and celebration with real-time rewards and recognition
  • We know that great people refer great people. We will reward you when you bring your friends and family to work at DXC
  • More time to do the things you love with flexible leave options, including purchased leave
  • Take time to give back with charitable and emergency services volunteer days
  • Wellbeing matters to us, and our Employee Assistance Program is there to support you and your family
  • And of course, all the basics; novated leasing, discounted health insurance, paid parental leave and many other benefits

﻿How to apply & our commitment to you in return

If you would like to be part of a culture that drives innovation, delivers results, rewards performance and encourages ideas, then please press the "Apply Now" button to submit your resume. Please contact Kusha Sharma at kusha.sharma@dxc.com for a confidential discussion or in case of any queries before formally applying for this role.

In return, we agree to ensure a hiring process that is enjoyable, thorough, and fair. We strive to provide an environment that lets you thrive and show off the very best version of yourself, while learning about us at the same time.

Interviews and onboarding are conducted online, as part of us being a virtual-first company.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

DXC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we welcome submissions from people from all walks of life. We celebrate our diversity and recognise it is the unique contributions of our people that give us our edge. We stand by the ‘bring your whole-self to work’ philosophy. It is our inclusive culture that powers our results, and our company grows only if our people grow.

Accommodation of special needs for qualified candidates may be considered within the framework of the DXC Accommodation Policy. In addition, DXC Technology is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to support qualified individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

title: Microsoft Surface Sales Specialist
description:
• Join Data#3 a Microsoft Gold Partner
  • Ongoing Training & Development
  • Based in Melbourne, Adelaide or Perth

Who is Data#3?

An Employer of Choice since 2016, our vision is to harness the power of people and technology for a better future. Our award-winning culture is built on five core values; Honesty, Excellence, Agility, Respect, and Teamwork (HEART).

Founded in 1977, Data#3 is an award-winning, publicly listed IT company that partners with world-leading technology vendors to deliver innovative technology services and solutions. Data#3 reported revenues of $1.9 billion in the 2021 financial year and has more than 1,200 employees across 12 locations in Australia and Fiji.

The Role

This is a sales focused role working across our business, responsible for providing solutions and generating sales with our national sales team on Microsoft Surface devices. Collaborate closely with our vendor Microsoft, you will be the subject matter expert for Microsoft Surface technology.

The impact you will make:

  • Evangelise and drive Microsoft Surface sales with the sales teams
  • Actively support partner account managers in driving sales of Microsoft complete solutions
  • Achieve personal, and team product and services targets
  • Leverage support teams to provide timely and competitive pricing and proposals
  • Master the understanding of all the relevant vendor program benefits and leverage all possible internal/external advantages in deals through a systematic approach
  • Work with the management team to optimise the Surface customer support experience across the delivery teams to minimise your post-sale engagement.
  • Attend customer functions, vendor trade shows and internal and external briefings
  • Assist if needed with developing Microsoft solutions within Data#3 to take to market in conjunction with Data#3 marketing
  • Deliver presentations to their customers with the sales teams
  • Assist with Microsoft end-user presentations, demonstrations, and sales calls

The experience you will bring:

  • You are passionate about IT and interested in developing a sales career
  • You have experience either working in a IT retail sales or IT customer focused support role
  • You get excited about new technology being released to the market and what it could deliver to customers
  • You are able to demonstrate from your previous roles the ability to build relationships and collaborate across teams
  • You can create presentations and confidently presenting to groups is a strength
  • You are a professional person with a sense of urgency and effective communication skills
  • You are skilled multi tasker who has a high level of attention to detail

Why apply:

  • The chance to learn and be mentored by industry leaders
  • Access to ongoing training and support
  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Flexible working options, including working from home
  • Convenient office location close to public transport
  • The opportunity to contribute to the greater team and company goals; to make a difference.

Our other benefits include:

  • Income Protection
  • Work-Life Balance
  • Wellbeing & Volunteer paid leave
  • Career Development

For our extensive list of benefits , head to our Careers page : https://www.data3.com/careers/

Please note that Data#3 will request as part of the recruitment process, reference checks and verification of your right to work in Australia. You may also be required to undertake background checks and police checks for security clearance pertaining to specific job requirements.

Data#3 may require you to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, in order to perform this role.

Ref No LISH108188

title: Senior Implementation Consultant
description:
Location : For this role, we are open to remote work and can hire anywhere in Australia.


About the opportunity

The Senior Consultant, Implementation leads the execution of all or many of the activities in all stages of the implementation lifecycle (planning, discovery, design, configuration, testing, deployment, post go-live support). The Senior Consultant works closely with the Project Manager to plan the project and identify critical dependencies.

Project responsibilities include; gathering customer requirements, configuring the Ceridian solution to meet documented customer requirements, setting and managing customer expectations, providing guidance to other project resources,identifying risks and communicating issues to the Project Manager. The Senior Consultant may also deliver Organizational Readiness consulting in support of Ceridian’s Organizational Readiness toolkit.


What you will get to do

Provide Implementation Services to Customers:

  • Document and validate customer’s business requirements and map to Ceridian functionality
  • Configure the Ceridian application to meet customer’s business requirements
  • Conduct consulting sessions (on the phone and in person) and document with meeting minutes
  • Attend internal project meetings and provide status on progress of activities and deliverables
  • Provide customers with follow-up consulting and general assistance in areas of expertise
  • Develop SQL database scripts and XML transformers for integrations and interfaces
  • Be a “go-to” resource for specific functional areas for both internal and external users
  • Work with customers to implement Ceridian Organizational Readiness best practices in preparation for rollout of the Ceridian solution

Contribute to Internal Implementation Initiatives:

  • Document solutions and contribute to a solutions repository
  • Document best practices and share with the Practice
  • Participate in a subject matter expert (SME) program in at least one Ceridian HCM module (Payroll, Benefits, WFM)

Focus on Continuing Education:

  • Contribute to internal knowledge share; review questions and provide feedback on a continuous basis
  • Participate in Continuing Education sessions; lead Implementation best practice sessions
  • Complete new release training on a timely basis; be fully versed on new and/or enhanced functionality in each product release

Provide Sales Support:

  • Support the sales cycle through solution review and feedback and assistance with scoping and estimation
  • Participate in prospect discussions regarding solution overview and implementation considerations

What’s in it for you

  • Encouragement to be the best version of yourself at and away from work:
    • YOUnity diversity and inclusion programs
    • Amazing time away from work programs
  • Support for your total well-being through our Live Well, Work Well programs targeting all aspects of your life
  • Recognition for your contributions through excellent pay, perks, and rewards
  • Giving where you’re living: volunteer days, Ceridian sponsored events, and our very own charity, Ceridian Cares
  • Opportunities to fuel your career growth through numerous internal and external programs and events

Skills and experience we value

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
  • 8+ years of experience in human capital management applications consulting, WFM, or Payroll
  • 3+ years in Consultant role with Ceridian HCM
  • Solid experience in business process mapping
  • Experience in change management an asset

Technical Skills Requirements:

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office products
  • Very experienced with software in a SaaS / Cloud computing environment including experience with HRIS
  • Solid understanding of relational databases, application development and SQL an asset
  • Experience with one or more of the following applications: SalesForce.com, SAP, PeopleSoft, JD Edwards,
  • Kronos, Workbrain/Infor, RedPrairie/JDA, Ultimate, Oracle HR/Payroll, PeopleSoft, Ceridian (preferred)
  • Ability to effectively implement at least two Ceridian HCM modules
  • Expert knowledge of common human capital management (HCM) business practices
  • Deep understanding of different industries and how Ceridian implementation best practices apply to the customer’s business practices
  • Product certification in at least two Ceridian HCM modules (Payroll, Benefits, WFM)
  • Deep Ceridian product knowledge in at least one Ceridian HCM module (Payroll, Benefits, WFM), as demonstrated through multiple implementations

Functional Skills Requirements:

  • Excellent customer relationship acumen
  • Demonstrates full competence in business function
  • Ability to engage with multiple projects & customers at the same time and manage competing priorities
  • Excellent organization, communication and collaboration skills
  • Ability to lead and facilitate customer and internal workshops and sessions
  • Ability to mentor junior consultants and provide day-to-day guidance on project activities
  • Acts as role model for Consulting@Ceridian guidelines
  • Ability to provide implementation scoping and solution guidance in the sales cycle

WORKING ENVIRONMENT & PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

  • Ability and willingness to travel to customer sites as needed

title: Implementation Consulting Manager
description:
Location : For this role, we are open to remote work and can hire anywhere in Australia


About the opportunity

The Services Consulting Manager leads a team of consulting professionals, provides domain (product, module, business process, technology) and thought leadership and acts as an interface with delivery. The focus of this position is managing, employee hiring, development and performance of professionals to achieve high levels of customer satisfaction and targeted Go Lives, productivity, and utilization while minimizing consultant attrition. Collaborates on practice focus and development. Works closely with Project Managers, Resource Management, and Services Sales to strategize on staffing plans for customer projects and position appropriate consultants for customer engagements.


What you will get to do

  • Exhibits strong leadership skills including: coaching, developing a diverse work force, managing a remote team, instilling commitment to quality and excellence, encouraging collaboration, promoting the flow of information among all participants, and providing clear direction on how to meet project goals
  • Seeks and shares information with coworkers and responds to concerns with timely, meaningful, fact-based, and constructive feedback
  • Foresees potential problems and takes corrective action to ensure achievement of goals
  • Clear and concise in communicating information. Actively listens to what others are saying, seeking and sharing information
  • Determines the right resources to effectively execute human resources or development initiatives, provides clear direction, and determines if change in approach is needed to accomplish goals
  • Manages multiple assignments in an effective manner
  • High levels of employee engagement and retention
  • Has overall control of planning, staffing, budgeting, managing expense priorities and recommending and implementing changes
  • Own domain thought leadership area to broaden and deepen skills and skills of the team. Lead initiatives focused on honing our practice excellence including product, but also extending to 2 recruiting process, resource management, implementation acceleration, onboarding acceleration, etc.
  • Provides a positive impression of Ceridian Consulting by leading team to exceed customer expectations and incorporates customer service into messages with team and actions with other parts of the organization
  • In-depth knowledge and understanding of business, technological and competitive trends
  • Has a strong understanding of technical, cost, risk and business implications of potential decisions on other projects and client needs and incorporates these into recommendations

What’s in it for you

  • Encouragement to be the best version of yourself at and away from work:
    • YOUnity diversity and inclusion programs
    • Amazing time away from work programs
  • Support for your total well-being through our Live Well, Work Well programs targeting all aspects of your life
  • Recognition for your contributions through excellent pay, perks, and rewards
  • Giving where you’re living: volunteer days, Ceridian sponsored events, and our very own charity, Ceridian Cares
  • Opportunities to fuel your career growth through numerous internal and external programs and events

Skills and experience we value

  • B.A./B.S. in Human Resources, communications, business, computer science or related fields, or equivalent experience
  • Typically 2+ years of experience in supervisory levels in business or Human Resources staffing functions
  • Experience managing teams of professionals in the consulting environment, with 6+ years of consulting experience desirable
  • Demonstrated experience with deployments of enterprise software systems using industry standard environments including XML and HTTP/HTTPS.
  • Experience with sFTP, Web Services, SOAP or REST API, XML and XSLT.

title: Associate Professor in Social Work
description:
JR0000004376


Employment Type

Continuing, full-time


Compensation Grade

Academic Teaching & Research (Balanced) Level D


Salary Range

$146,208 - $160,854 per annum + 17% superannuation


Reporting to:

Dean People and Resources (or Delegate)


About Flinders University Social Work

Flinders University's heritage of quality, independence, and excellence will continue to be a source of strength and competitive advantage. We recognise the key to our success is exceptional people, and we're seeking an outstanding individual to join the Flinders Social Work team within the College of Education, Psychology and Social Work to contribute to Flinders' bold vision.

We are a team that is:

  • passionate about fostering a fairer, more inclusive and socially just society;
  • committed to high-quality education, including career-ready skills and knowledge, that will prepare students for the complexities of contemporary practice;
  • engaged in exploring nuanced, evidence-based responses to complex problems, such as child abuse, domestic and family violence, disability, homelessness and mental health through research and partnerships to decolonise social work, health, and the human services.

Flinders Social Work is thriving because we:

  • attract quality students from 22 countries and across Australia into our degree programs;
  • revamp courses to include the latest innovations in online education and skills labs;
  • connect to industry partners and communities; and
  • publish high quality research outcomes for the profession.

In 2022 our engagement with students, use of innovative skills and simulation laboratories, curriculum and teaching designs were acknowledged by the Good Universities Guide, which ranked Flinders Social Work as SA’s #1 for postgraduate full-time employment, median salary and overall educational experience, and undergraduate median salary and learner engagement*

As the proud home to Australia’s premier Social Work research centre - Social Work Innovation Research Living Space (SWIRLS) – Flinders Social Work is developing a formidable reputation for our rigorous, theoretically driven research examining social issues and social work practice in our ever-evolving world.

*public SA-founded universities only


About the role

The Associate Professor will be a senior member of the academic staff in the College. They will be responsible for leading quality research endeavours including leading, mentoring, and working in teams to attract competitive research grants and other sources of funding, publishing manuscripts in high impact journals and supervision of research higher degree students. They will provide leadership in the planning and delivery of topics within the suite of programs in Social Work. This includes the development of teaching materials, delivery of lectures/tutorials or other innovative teaching and learning strategies, examinations and may be involved in placement education.

The Associate Professor will also be required to work collectively to strengthen existing partnerships and explore new partnerships with external stakeholders that have potential for providing improved teaching, learning and/or research outcomes for Social Work.

They will also prioritise, coordinate, monitor workflow and provide supervision to staff and casual academics according to the University's policies, practices and standards.

We welcome expertise across the social work fields of child abuse, domestic and family violence, disability, homelessness, mental health, decolonisation, and ageing.

About you

To be successful in this role you will have a PhD in Social Work or a related discipline and can undertake high quality teaching in a tertiary environment, including involvement in topic coordination, curriculum design, and a range of teaching modalities including e-learning platforms.

You will have evidence of educational leadership relevant to teaching and learning and demonstrated experience leading innovation and inspiring excellence amongst colleagues, and experience supervising honours and higher degree students.

You will contribute to leadership in curriculum reviews and internal and external accreditation activities, and a have strong research track record in an area aligned with research strengths in the College, or potential in SWIRLS.

You will display excellent oral and written communication skills and interpersonal skills, including the demonstrated ability to establish effective relationships with staff, students and industry.

Further to this you will require to have extensive experience in establishing effective research collaborations with external local, national and international partners.

Life at Flinders

We're transforming, and investing in people and facilities, to create contemporary, stimulating and satisfying learning and work environments that reflect our core values of excellence, innovation, courage, and integrity. Flinders is refocusing its strategic priorities with the aim of elevating its performance to be a top ten Australian university, and amongst the top 1% in the world.

Reaching beyond the limits of buildings, borders, and backgrounds, ours is an inclusive culture that believes absolutely in equality and opportunity for all. We don't just accommodate differences; we embrace and celebrate them. So, why work at Flinders?

  • 17% Superannuation + salary packaging options
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Wide range of professional development activities and services
  • We embrace diversity and promote equity and inclusion for students and staff with disabilities and health conditions , we are committed to Indigenous education and engagement and support initiatives such as The Pride Network
  • Vibrant campus life and amenities including on campus health care services , gym and childcare centre

Prescribed Conditions for Employment

A valid National Police Certificate which is satisfactory to the University will also be required before the successful applicant can commence in this position.

In addition, it is a requirement of this position that the incumbent maintain a current Child Related Employment Screening which is satisfactory to the University in accordance with the Children’s Protection Act 1993 (SA).

Flinders University has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that requires all new staff members to be up to date with their COVID-19 vaccinations, subject to medical exemptions.

How to Apply and Information

To view the full position description and apply online, please visit the Jobs@Flinders website via the job portal: JR0000004376

Flinders University’s collective vision is to foster an environment that recognises and embraces Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, knowledges and cultures. We would therefore, encourage and welcome applicants from Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander descent as well as people with a disability to apply for this position.

Applications to be submitted before:

11:59pm, Wednesday 1 June 2022

Please note, late applications and applications sent via agencies will not be accepted .

title: Chef
company: Sector 17 Indian Restro and pizza bar
description:

Manages all activities associated with food services.

- Cooks & presents the dishes attractively and creatively according to the procedures which are necessary to keep nutrition related to vegetables and meats.

title: Customer Service Roles - Australian Passport Office
description:
Are you passionate about helping people? Be the first to join this new and exciting opportunity to help out your fellow Australians!

We are hiring Customer Service Roles to support our new client, the Australian Passport Office, in Adelaide CBD with hybrid working from home options available. Be recognised and rewarded for your contributions while making a real difference to the lives of Australians.

As a Customer Service Representative, you will be providing essential services to people across Australia on behalf of our Australian Federal Government client. In this role you'll be operating in a dynamic team environment with a focus on meeting quality outcomes for customers.

About The Role

With access to knowledge content, extensive training and leadership support you will be helping Australians with Passport enquires looking to travel.

A hybrid working model will give flexibility, less time spent travelling while still having face to face contact and support with your team.

Benefits

  • Datacom oﬀers its people the ability to make a real diﬀerence, and develop their careers within a supportive and rewarding environment.
  • We offer options for you to interview virtually.
  • Best in class rewards and recognition program, including awards and corporate retail discounts on tap.
  • Talent development programs designed to engage and empower you: we want to build on your strengths and experiences and provide you with career growth within our organisation. Opportunities for development include: Leadership, Business Analytics, Administration, HR & Recruitment and IT.
  • Paid Parental Leave


Operating Hours
Our operating hours are Monday to Friday between 8:00am and 8:00pm on a rotating roster with flexibility to support all of your out of work commitments.

We understand that life can be busy, therefore, Datacom's commitment is to provide a flexible work life balance to suit any personal or family commitments whilst still maintaining full time hours.

About You

  • High attention to detail
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Clear communication skills to customers and stakeholders
  • Punctual and reliable
  • Experience adhering to KPI's
  • Able to manage customer expectations
  • Patience and empathy towards people in difficult situations
  • A team player focus, working collaboratively to exceed expectations
  • Intermediate computer skills, ability to navigate multiple screens and a typing speed of 30WPM
  • Due to clearance requirements Australian Citizenship is required


About Datacom

Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.

We have over 6,500 people across our global offices and generate an annual revenue of over AU $1.1 billion annually. This makes us one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. We are committed to hiring, developing and promoting diverse talent.

Datacom has extensive expertise in the operation of contact centres, data centres, engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations.

Founded in 1965, we have a successful trading history of consistent growth, profitability and a track record of delivering innovative, cost effective technology solutions.

We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

If you're looking for meaningful work with genuine career progression opportunities, training and development, we'd love to hear from you.

APPLY WITH US TODAY!

title: Senior Java Developer
salary: up to $165K pkg (inc super) dep. on exp.
description:
Who We Are:
Established in 1991, DWS is a professional Technology Consultancy and part of HCL Technologies. With offices across Australia, we have over 800 employees in Melbourne, Sydney, Adelaide, Brisbane and Canberra; providing services to a broad range of blue-chip corporate clients, as well as Federal, State and Local Government agencies. We provide a wide range of services including; IT consulting, managed application services, project management, customer driven innovation, digital transformation, data and business analytics, strategic advisory and productivity, and robotic process automation

Who We Are Looking For:
At DWS we have immediate requirements for Full Stack Java Developers to join several project areas across our tier 1 clients. We want people who are creative, innovative and want to make suggestions and improvements!

Essential skills:
  • Commercial experience as a Java Developer
  • Cloud experience is crucial AWS or Azure
  • Microservices experience is crucial
  • Spring Boot experience
  • Experience with any UI technologies: React , Angular or Vue
  • Experience with RESTful APIs
  • Experience with relational databases such as SQL
  • Agile development experience is crucial
  • CI/CD is a plus, also Unit Testing frameworks like JUint, Mockito and Jasmine
  • The ability to act as a consultant – offering technical insights, sharing your knowledge, and collaborating with clients
  • Please note: This is a Hybrid role (it will consist of home and office based work)
Working at DWS offers you:
  • Ongoing professional and career development
  • Paid learning and certifications (chosen entirely by you), with completion bonuses
  • An active social club that host regular, subsidised events
  • Corporate discounts on a range of services and products, including health insurance, gym memberships, JB HiFi, Apple products and much more
All applicants must hold Australian Citizenship, Permanent Residency (PR) , or other permanent work rights – DWS are unable to sponsor or support visas.

Ready for a new challenge? Click APPLY now!
www.dws.com.au

title: Technologies Teacher
description:
Gleeson College is excited to invite applications from suitably qualified professionals for the permanent position of Technologies Teacher, commencing in Term 3, July 2022.

The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate:

  • Experience in teaching Woodwork, Metalwork and CAD/ CAM (other learning areas are an advantage)
  • Their ability to work collaboratively with colleagues, parents and families and the wider educational community
  • Their commitment to supporting and representing the ethos of our Catholic College as outlined in the Gleeson 10 and the Gleeson Staff 5.

Teachers at Gleeson College are committed to the belief that all students can be thriving people, capable learners and leaders for God's world, and work to ensure that students develop the knowledge, skills and attributes they need to thrive in a rapidly changing and complex world.

It is a mandatory condition of employment for employees to be and remain vaccinated against COVID-19 or provide medical exemption to COVID-19 vaccination endorsed by the Chief Public Health Officer.

Applications will be accepted via email only to:
Att: The Principal
careers@gleeson.catholic.edu.au
by 9.00am on Monday, 30 May 2022

Applications must be submitted as one combined PDF and include :

  • A covering letter (no more than one page);
  • A Curriculum Vitae (two to three pages);
  • A response to the role details outlined in this advertisement using the Broad Purpose and Key Responsibilities in the Position Information Document as a guide (available from the vacancies section of the Catholic Education South Australia (CESA) website);

  • Teachers Registration;
  • Responding to Risks of Harm Abuse and Neglect – Education and Care (RRHAN-EC) certificate;

  • Clearance to work in Catholic Education and Current DCSI/Working with Children Check/Catholic Police Check;
