title: Senior Integration Architect
description:
JR0000001565

Availability:
Continuing | Full-Time

Compensation Grade:
Higher Education Officer Level 9

Salary Range:
$113,286 - $121,223 p.a.

Reporting to:
Senior IDS Architectural Lead
Information & Digital Services (IDS)

About Information and Digital Services

Information and Digital Services (IDS) are a pivotal resource of the University, providing information and digital technology services and support to the Flinders University staff and student community. The IDS team apply technical expertise to support university projects and provide core services such as the IDS Service Desk, Audio visual, simulation and event services, Information security and identity access management services and more.

About the Role

The Senior IDS Integration Architect leads the integration capability at Flinders University, ensuring that reliable and timely data is made available to business processes across the university. You will work with other teams within IDS and across the University to develop the integration strategy and build the capability to deliver better data integration services. The role requires a high degree of communication and collaboration as well as significant technical expertise, along with a commitment to continuous learning and improvement.

About You

You will have strong conceptual thinking and communication skills and a deep knowledge of the design, development and implementation of integration solutions that apply best practice patterns and methods. You will be a team player who is humble, keen and smart with a self-improvement and growth mindset approach to the technologies and practices for integration, personal communication, and effectiveness within the wider team. To excel in this role you will also demonstrate:

  • Extensive knowledge and experience in the use of one or more integration platform technologies (e.g., Boomi, Microsoft Azure, Mulesoft, Workato, WSO2).
  • High level experience in integration architecture design and strategy in a large and complex organisation.
  • Extensive knowledge and experience in the analysis, development and documentation of complex integration solutions in line with best practice use of integration platform technologies.
  • High level skills in leading a team to its full potential, including the ability to manage staff performance.

The successful candidate must also have an appropriate tertiary qualification in Information Technology or relevant technical area, and/or equivalent relevant experience in an IT environment. Previous experience within the Higher Education sector will be highly regarded

Life at Flinders

We're transforming, and investing in people and facilities, to create contemporary, stimulating and satisfying learning and work environments that reflect our core values of excellence, innovation, courage, and integrity. Flinders is refocusing its strategic priorities with the aim of elevating its performance to be a top ten Australian university, and amongst the top 1% in the world.

Reaching beyond the limits of buildings, borders, and backgrounds, ours is an inclusive culture that believes absolutely in equality and opportunity for all. We don't just accommodate differences; we embrace and celebrate them. So, why work at Flinders?

  • 17% Superannuation + salary packaging options
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Wide range of professional development activities and services
  • We embrace diversity and promote equity and inclusion for students and staff with disabilities and health conditions , we are committed to Indigenous education and engagement and support initiatives such as The Pride Network
  • Vibrant campus life and amenities including on campus health care services , gym and childcare centre

Prescribed Conditions for Employment
A valid National Police Certificate which is satisfactory to the University will also be required before the successful applicant can commence in this position.

Flinders University has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that requires all new staff members to be up to date with their COVID-19 vaccinations, subject to medical exemptions and limited exemptions.

How to Apply and Information
To view the full position description and apply online , please visit the Jobs@Flinders website via the job portal: JR0000001565 - Senior IDS Integration Architect

Applications to be submitted before 11:59pm Sunday 22nd May 2022

Please note, late applications and applications sent via agencies will not be accepted .

title: Solution Architect
description:
• Exciting opportunity to join SA's iconic RAA
  • Full-time permanent role based at Mile End
  • For questions contact: 0477 560 714

Who we are -

As one of the state's largest and most iconic organisations, we're proud to make things better for members and better for our community. More than 780,000 members choose us to deliver peace of mind through our trusted range of motor, home and travel products and services. We're also one of the state's largest employers (and growing!), with more than 1200 employees working collectively with the common goal to keep our members moving.

Your new opportunity

As Solution Architect, you'll provide architectural direction and solution design for information technology change, from a broad RAA perspective and at an individual solution level. In addition, you will:

  • Research, design, communicate and specify solutions for approved change requests/projects. This includes analysis and design re data, applications, interfaces and infrastructure requirements.
  • Work collaboratively with key business and technical stakeholders across the program and the wider business
  • Provide scoping, cost/time estimation required to deliver all aspects of a solution (particularly effort, software, communications and infrastructure)
  • Maintain active oversight of technical solution delivery through provision of appropriate guidance and applicable standards
  • Support the continuous improvement of the RAA Architecture practice through the enhancement of standards, principles, modelling techniques, templates and methods

What will set you apart from the rest

At RAA we hire on cultural add first and technical fit second, however, to be successful in this role you will need:

  • Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to foster good stakeholder relationships through consultation and partnership
  • Demonstrated ability to think strategically across complex business issues
  • Demonstrated experience in definition of solutions (knowledge of applications and infrastructure layers) and knowledge across a broad range of technologies
  • Demonstrated experience in architecture planning
  • Good written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills mixed with proven ability to effectively influence people at all levels

What sets us apart from the rest

  • To ensure our employees feel valued, empowered and celebrated we provide a range of employee benefits including:
  • Free RAA premium road service & discounts on all RAA Products
  • Flexible Work Arrangements
  • Ongoing Training & Development Opportunities & Study Support Program
  • Wellbeing Facilities and Corporate Health Insurance Plan
  • On-site Cafe with Barista - plus much more!

How to apply

Simply hit "Apply for this job" to access further information found in the position description or follow the prompts to apply.

To find out further information on this role please call Jessica Meyer on 0477 560 714 .

We're committed to building a workplace that's diverse and inclusive, where employees are embraced for their unique qualities and valued for their contributions. We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in everyone, and helps us to give our members better service.

title: Audit Senior
description:
We are a member firm of PKF International with offices in over 440 cities and 150 countries worldwide. We are a leading provider of business services, audit, superannuation, tax and specialist services to clients locally and internationally. Because of this, PKF is growing. More and more companies want to work with us because of our values, culture and commitment to innovation.

The Role

Our Adelaide Assurance and Audit division is seeking a dynamic, energetic and experienced Audit Senior to join the CBD based team. Reporting to the Audit and Assurance Director you will ideally you have 3-5 years of experience, the ability to produce high quality written advice and reports and the capability to think laterally. This role would suit a qualified professional with experience in external audit, looking for an opportunity to progress their career in a global chartered accounting firm.

As an Audit Senior, you will be working with a diverse range of clients and stakeholders particularly in the Not-for-Profit and government sectors.  Your main duties will include managing a portfolio of clients through planning, delivering and reporting on their audit requirements.

To see us in the interview room, you’ll need:

  • CA qualified or equivalent
  • 3+ years' experience in Professional Services with a sound grasp of CaseWare
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills
  • Be able to work collaboratively with others and autonomously
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines
  • Be highly motivated with a strong desire to succeed.
  • Well-developed organisational and time management skills

Benefits

  • Exceptional opportunity for career development and progression
  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Opportunity for secondment in PKF offices overseas
  • CBD location – close to public transport, cafes & shops
  • Friendly culture and team events (Christmas parties, social events, birthdays etc.)
  • Excellent resources – training & ongoing support
  • Study support and training

How To Apply

For further information about this role please contact Director of Audit and Assurance Jasmine Tan on 08 8273 2252 . To apply, please click on the Apply Now button and upload your CV and cover letter.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
About Us

APA is a leading Australian energy infrastructure business. We own and/or manage and operate a diverse, $21 billion portfolio of gas, electricity, solar and wind assets. Consistent with our purpose to strengthen communities through responsible energy, we deliver approximately half of the nation’s gas usage and connect Victoria with South Australia and New South Wales with Queensland through our investments in electricity transmission assets. We are also one of the largest owners and operators of renewable power generation assets in Australia, with wind and solar projects across the country. Our operations span every mainland state and territory in the country and we employ more than 1900 people.

Our vision is to be world class in energy solutions.

The Role

We now have an exciting opportunity available for a Solutions Architect to join our IT team in Brisbane / Sydney / Melbourne / Adelaide office on a Permanent Full Time basis.

Reporting to the Enterprise Architect, you will play a key role in leading and supporting Enterprise Architecture activities that guide the development and management of a portfolio of solutions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Working with the Business Relationship Manager to translate business requirements into architectural approaches, roadmaps & customer-centric solutions
  • Collaborating on technical requirements, and relating them to specific business-focused outcomes
  • Influencing decisions and project direction at the stakeholder level and acting as a consultant on a broad range of technologies, platforms, and solution options
  • Ensuring solutions align with the overall enterprise architecture
  • Developing and communicating vision and purpose of solution architecture, presenting to groups of key decision-makers and gaining approvals
  • Developing and maintaining current and future state architecture patterns aligned to the overall enterprise architecture and evolving business model
  • Delivering solution architectures for transition to design, overseeing design governance and ensure solutions align with expected standards and requirements

About You

To be successful in this role you will demonstrate:

  • Proven knowledge of architecture principles, frameworks, processes, and governance, preferably few years in a similar role and industry (utilities/energy)
  • Ability to lead, develop and implement solution architectures and frameworks in a complex business and technical environment, via programmes, large projects, and agile methodologies
  • Experience in fostering solid relationships with business stakeholders, technical teams, and external stakeholders
  • Solid understanding and experience in delivering business-focused technology solutions in line with requirements, architecture, and project frameworks
  • Working knowledge of project and software development lifecycles
  • Excellent communication, time management, planning, conceptual thinking, and research skills

Sound like your kind of career? We’d love to hear from you.

APA is an equal opportunity employer. The safety and sustainability of our people, community and environment is our focus. We embrace diversity in our people to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we operate in.

When you join us on this journey to success, you will have access to targeted career development programs, competitive remuneration, employee benefits, work–life balance and wellbeing programs.

Role closes on Wednesday 18 May 2022. Role Reference number: 2073.

Applicants must be eligible to work in Australia to be considered.

APA Group is not accepting submissions from recruitment agencies for this role.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

Visit us on apa.com.au/careers

title: Product Owners x 2 Positions
description:
About People’s Choice

People's Choice is Australia's largest credit union. We are proudly 100% member owned. We work with our members, not just to meet their financial service needs, but to enable dreams, aspirations and fulfilling lives.

Quite simply, we’re people people. We empower our members to create the life they want through modern banking and personal service, with a vision to be recognised as the most trusted financial services provider in Australia.

About the role

You'll report to the Senior Leader, Lean Agile Centre of Excellence and be responsible for prioritising and streamlining programs of work, whilst inspiring and motivating the team to deliver to our future strategy. We’re ideally looking for individuals with strong stakeholder management, who are true advocates for maintaining significant relationships and responsibilities outside the team and enjoy working closely with fellow Product Owners, Business Owners and other key stakeholders.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Ensuring product roadmaps are maintained, visible and transparent to all stakeholders
  • Prioritising the team backlog, including reviewing and contributing to the value stream vision, roadmap and content presentations
  • Supporting and collaborating with the team in preparation for delivering stream activities, including PI Planning, System Demos and Inspect & Adapt Workshops
  • Collaborating with Architects, Product Owners, and Scrum Masters on prioritising the delivery stream backlog
  • Measuring the success and gaining constant feedback of Agile Ways of working and identifying opportunities for improvement

About you

You’ll be a people person who isn’t afraid of a challenge and is comfortable meeting key stakeholder objectives. You will have a broad knowledge of the Product Lifecycle Development coupled with a strong understanding of agile mindsets and behaviours. You will possess a thorough knowledge of the production flows of the values system and have experience coaching Product Owners, Scrum Masters and agile delivery teams.

Why choose People’s Choice

Be part of an inclusive, friendly, professional and motivated team, where people work better together to achieve and grow. We value and celebrate diversity of thought through our inclusive culture and with our people at the heart of our success, we'll support your career goals, whilst also guaranteeing supportive and dynamic working conditions.

The perks:

  • Flexible ways of working – Work from anywhere philosophy
  • Competitive salary
  • Fun, supportive and energetic team
  • Discounted financial products
  • Salary sacrificing options
  • Paid volunteering days

Apply now!

So go ahead and make the important choice to be part of an organisation working together for a better future.

Please click ‘Apply’ and submit your application, including a cover letter and current resume by Friday 6th May, 2022.

To find out more about careers at People’s Choice head to peopleschoice.com/careers

title: Senior Technical Officer
description:
(HE06) $81,254 to $87,770 plus an employer contribution of up to 17% superannuation may apply.

Continuing full time position available immediately.

The Technical Services team provide operational support across the Faculty relating to laboratory management, Health, Safety and Wellbeing (HSW), Infrastructure support, teaching and shared laboratory support and laboratory materials receipt and distribution. The position will be primarily located at the Adelaide Health and Medical Sciences building adjacent SAHMRI, but on occasion will be required to assist the team located on the eastern side down at Helen Mayo North and Helen Mayo South.

The Senior Technical Officer works under general direction, to deliver high quality services in the management and coordination of precinct research operations, liaising with researchers and Faculty support services, to enhance Faculty of Health & Medical Sciences research activities.

The Senior Technical Officer provides support for research operations, facilities, infrastructure and events, as required. The position facilitates researcher accommodation, facilities, procurement, finance and data needs and works closely with researchers, affiliates and Faculty service providers to ensure seamless and cohesive support services.

To be successful you will need:

  • Knowledge of the University sector, funding of research and of related structures and processes in a research-oriented field.
  • Demonstrated experience in coordinating and undertaking a range of operational research support services including administrative, financial, facilities management, asset management and data management functions at the faculty level.
  • Demonstrated experience communicating, both verbally and in writing, in a succinct, professional and responsive manner to deliver client centric results.
  • Demonstrated experience delivering high quality administrative support and services to senior professional and academic staff.
  • Demonstrated ability to promote the organisational values of integrity, respect, collegiality, excellence and discovery, and a commitment to positively comply with the associated behaviour expectations.

Enjoy an outstanding career environment

The University of Adelaide is a uniquely rewarding workplace. The size, breadth and quality of our education and research programs - including significant industry, government and community collaborations - offers you a vast scope and opportunity for a long, fulfilling career.

It also enables us to attract high-calibre people in all facets of our operations, ensuring you will be surrounded by talented colleagues, many world-leading. Our work's cutting-edge nature - not just in your own area, but across virtually the full spectrum of human endeavour - provides a constant source of inspiration.

Our culture is one that welcomes all and embraces diversity consistent with our Staff Values and Behaviour Framework and our Values of integrity, respect, collegiality, excellence and discovery. We firmly believe that our people are our most valuable asset, so we work to grow and diversify the skills, knowledge and capability of all our staff.

We embrace flexibility as a key principle to allow our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal and family life. Flexible working arrangements are on offer for all roles at the University.

In addition, we offer a wide range of attractive staff benefits. These include: salary packaging; flexible work arrangements; high-quality professional development programs and activities; and an on-campus health clinic, gym and other fitness facilities.

Learn more at: adelaide.edu.au/jobs

Your faculty's broader role

The Faculty of Health and Medical Sciences contains one of Australia's largest concentrations of leading health researchers, teachers and clinical titleholders. It's comprised of eight schools and a number of specialist disciplines, institutes and centres, variously focused on world-class research, and training the next generation of: medical doctors; surgeons; dentists; nurses; psychiatrists; psychologists; and other health professionals.

Learn more at: health.adelaide.edu.au

If you have the talent, we'll give you the opportunity. Together, let's make history.

title: Mine Geologist
description:
Iluka Resources is a leading global producer of the critical minerals zircon and high grade titanium dioxide feedstocks (rutile and synthetic rutile). Iluka has also established a significant position in rare earth elements (rare earths). As an international supplier of critical minerals, Iluka’s products are used in an array of applications including technology, construction, medical, lifestyle and industrial uses. As the world moves towards a smarter, safer and sustainable future, Iluka’s high quality products are increasing in demand.

Our people are the foundation of our business and are vital to our success now and into the future. Iluka offers an empowering and inclusive work environment that is as diverse as the communities in which we operate.

About Jacinth-Ambrosia

Jacinth-Ambrosia is located 270 kilometres north of the Port of Thevenard, near Ceduna. It is the world’s largest source of zircon and has a mine life that extends well beyond 2026. It is the first mining development in a mixed use regional reserve – the Yellabina Regional Reserve – in South Australia, with the operation demonstrating a commitment to high environmental standards, including progressive land rehabilitation, as well as a commitment to indigenous employment, which currently comprises 20 per cent of the work force.

About The Role

An exciting opportunity exists for a self-motivated and team focused Mine Geologist to join Iluka’s Technical Services Team, based at Jacinth Ambrosia Site.

Reporting directly to the Mining Manager the main responsibilities of this role include:

  • Geological sampling and mapping
  • Consistent collaboration with metallurgy and processing teams to optimize ore feed into the processing plant
  • Daily grade control and blend planning of the dozer mining push
  • Forecasting of ore block characteristics and mining durations based on previous performance and block model information
  • Contractor management and compliance tracking
  • Monthly and yearly reconciliations of actual performance against block model

About You

To be successful for this role, you will have:

  • Degree in Geology or equivalent
  • High standard of behaviours that align with Iluka’s values of Integrity, Respect, Courage, Accountability & Collaboration
  • Pro-active approach to safety and environment
  • Excellent communication, organisation and interpersonal skills
  • Enthusiasm to join a cohesive team that learn from and teach each other
  • Willingness to be hands on conducting regular field work

It would also be beneficial if you have:

  • Experience in mine geology
  • Experience in mineral sands operations
  • Experience with Surpac and Datamine

What We Offer

If successful, you will be rewarded with a competitive remuneration package and the opportunity to be part of a values-driven company, committed to your professional development.

This position is based on site at the JA mine site with full modern camp facilities provided fly in fly out of Adelaide or Ceduna on an 8:6 roster.

If you share our values, you have the skills and experience to help us to succeed and deliver sustainable value, apply now.

Applications close: 26th May 2022

“We respect and encourage diversity in a workforce that reflects our communities.”

Please note that it is a requirement of this role to comply with Iluka’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy and any government requirement to be vaccinated against COVID-19, unless an exemption applies. You will need to provide evidence to us in an approved form that you are vaccinated with an approved vaccination in accordance with these requirements.

title: Product and Customer Success Coordinator
description:
• Join an innovative, flexible & family-friendly team in this permanent full-time role
  • Generous salary + incentives with excellent benefits
  • Ongoing professional development & training opportunities

An exciting opportunity to join a hi-tech, fast-growing agritech company and enjoy a regional lifestyle in the beautiful Barossa Valley!

About the Opportunity

For this rare industry opportunity, using industry data & customer-specific insights, you will oversee the development of unique, world-leading precision viticulture tools on the online platform that utilises the latest developments in machine learning and satellite technology. Building on your industry experience, you will perform market research, analyse market data, and identify consumer behaviour and trends to inform long-term product strategy.

As Deep Planet’s Product & Customer Success Coordinator you will monitor product performance and create policies and procedures that optimize the customer experience, ultimately building customer relationships that promote retention and loyalty. As a pivotal part of the team, you will provide product demonstrations and deep technical support, enabling customers to optimise their vineyard management process through effective utilisation of Deep Planet’s precision viticulture tools, generating increased profits for the Australian wine industry and reducing its environmental footprint.

Using your strong relationship building skills, you will gather feedback and insights that inform Deep Planet’s product roadmap, helping to build a world-leading precision viticulture platform!

In addition to the above, as the Product and Customer Success Coordinator, your responsibilities include:

  • Writing user stories and other feature descriptions for the engineering team and maintaining a prioritised product backlog based on business and customer impact
  • Documenting value proposition information and supporting marketing and sales efforts with written content
  • Taking on a pro-active role in potential client evaluation based on their needs and Deep Planet’s unique tech capabilities
  • Working directly with the client and their technical team to determine objectives, milestones, and deliverables with regards to initial integration and rollout plans
  • Delivering client insights and drawing on internal resources to deliver best possible results to clients (sales, marketing, product, engineering and research)
  • Deep-dive technical assistance for customers; including conducting screen share sessions with customers to guide them through installations, tech evaluations as well as resolving technical issues with high customer satisfaction
  • Analysing quantitative information from products to gather information on product usage

The full Job Description has been made available for you to view/download once you select 'Apply Now'.

About You

With environmental benefit front of mind, you have a desire to make a positive impact on the industry and the planet. You could be a recent viticulture or plant science graduate, someone with a strong agricultural background, a data or business analyst, or someone who is eager to be a part of the agtech community and help contribute to the building of the agriculture technology of tomorrow!

We are looking for passionate candidates that may bring:

  • Organized, personable, and tech-savvy with background knowledge of the agritech industry, satellite technology and artificial intelligence
  • Data-centric mindset and strong analytical skills
  • Creative thinker with the ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills to convey highly technical concepts to a variety of audiences

About Our Client

Deep Planet is a global Agri Tech startup that was born out of the vision of world-class scientists and engineers from Oxford University.

Deep Planet are focused and creative thinkers with a goal to use Machine Learning for the benefit of the Planet. In 2018, Deep Planet was founded from an idea to address environmental risk. The founding team has more than 15 years of experience starting and scaling deep technology companies worldwide.

Their product, VineSignal, assists winemakers and growers to manage and predict vine health, yield, maturity and irrigation. It allows for improved management practices in the vineyard that reduce cost of production, improve quality and enhances efficiency to maximise commercial returns.

We've shared the client's name to help you assess your suitability for the role.  Please DO NOT contact them directly.

Apply Now!

If you have any queries please email humans(at)humanologyrecruit.com.au in the first instance, or call 1300 2 HUMAN.

To apply, please ensure you click the Apply button , upload a CV and cover letter contained in one document.  Please do not email your CV .  All applications MUST be made online. The position description is also available to download when you click 'apply'.

Please Note:  Our recruitment process will keep you regularly informed of the progress of your application.  Please ensure that you check your email for updates (including your junk mail folder).  Applications will remain open until a suitable candidate is appointed.

title: Solution Architect
description:

Continuing position available

P lay an integral role in planning and implementing key IT projects assuming end-to-end responsibility for the overall architectural solution.

title: Staff Reservoir Engineer - Multiple Roles
description:
• Opportunities for experienced Reservoir Engineers
  • Adelaide Head Office and/or Perth Office
  • Attractive remuneration package

Beach has identified new opportunities for experienced Reservoir Engineers who will make an immediate impact. These roles will be within multi-disciplinary teams responsible for exploration, appraisal, and development assets across the business.

About the Roles

These roles require experienced subsurface professionals with the proven ability to integrate data and interpretations to inform investment and drilling decisions. You will be working on active projects in a range of basins and maturity levels. You will have extensive experience and skills in subsurface technical interpretation and workflows and the ability to document and present to management.

These roles will be based in multi-disciplinary team environments working alongside geologists, geophysicists, engineers, and specialists. Teamwork and communication across disciplines are an important part of the roles.

Preference will be given to those who are in Adelaide, or are willing to relocate, in the first instance.

Key responsibilities will include:

  • Providing effective analysis of pressure, rate and reservoir information to assist Beach in making appropriate business decisions, including:
  • Reserves estimation, production forecasting and development planning
  • Analytical, numerical and network modelling
  • Interpretation of test and production data including geoscience integration
  • Developing and recommending cost-effective reservoir monitoring and surveillance programs
  • Applying knowledge and experience to optimise development plans and maximise asset returns.
  • Recommending value enhancing work programs, including drilling, testing, stimulation, workovers and studies.
  • Evaluating and recommending actions for field development plans and projects submitted by the operator for fields where Beach is a non-operating joint venture partner.
  • Mentoring junior members of the team, ensuring that they broaden and develop.  Leading by example and providing guidance on technical rigour.
  • Identifying, or assisting in the evaluation of, new ventures, mergers or acquisition opportunities.
  • Tertiary qualifications in engineering or mathematics

About you

In addition to technical expertise, the ideal candidates will have highly evolved influencing and communication skills to critically evaluate assumptions and recommendations within multidisciplinary technical teams.

You will also need:

  • Extensive experience in the petroleum industry gained across multiple basins both in Australia and internationally
  • Knowledge and understanding of a range hydrocarbon systems and different drive mechanisms including water drive, solution gas drive and depletion drive, and practical application of secondary and tertiary recovery processes
  • Well-developed understanding of the rock and fluid properties that impact recovery and the ability to integrate reservoir engineering analysis with geoscience evaluations
  • Proficiency with the application of SPE-PRMS
  • Experience with both analytical analysis and numerical modelling, using industry standard software tools, to estimate production performance and reserves
  • Sound knowledge of data acquisition practices with the ability to identify operational challenges and opportunities to ensure fit for purpose reservoir surveillance strategies including design and implementation of waterflood reservoir management
  • Broader engineering experience across other disciplines such as production, drilling and completions
  • Conversant with cashflow modelling and economic evaluation of projects

About us

Beach Energy is a proud South Australian, Energy exploration and production company headquartered in Adelaide. For more than 60 years, Beach has operated onshore and offshore, oil and natural gas production across South Australia, Western Australia, Victoria, and New Zealand.

We seek to deliver long-term value to our shareholders, and focus on the safety of our people, their work environment, and the sustainability of our practices and environment we work in.

Working with Beach, you will make a difference in the delivery of key oil and gas projects within a growth organisation.

At Beach our values govern our decisions and interactions. Our values are Safety, Creativity, Respect, Integrity, Performance and Teamwork . If your experience and interests match the criteria and your values are aligned with ours, we encourage you to apply.

How to apply

Beach is committed to improving gender diversity and Indigenous participation; we encourage all applications. Please submit your cover letter and updated CV by 12 May 2022.

To keep our community safe, candidates are required to comply with COVID related state specific public health orders.

title: Test Lead
salary: ASO7 $103,387 to $111,759 per annum plus super
description:
Snippet
A rare opportunity for an ongoing Test Lead role with South Australia Police.

Your new company
South Australia Police (SAPOL) provides a diverse range of services to the community.  These services are aimed at producing a safe and peaceful environment by the minimisation of crime and disorder.  It is a large complex organisation which, because of the nature of its operations, is constantly subject to public scrutiny and accountability.  It provides services to a range of different locations (over 100) spread across the State on a 24 hour a day basis.

SAPOL’s vision is to provide a visible, responsive police service for all South Australians. All SAPOL employees are guided by Our Values of Service, Integrity, Courage, Leadership, Collaboration and Respect. SAPOL is an organisation with a proud history and an exciting vision for the future.

Your new role
As the Test Lead, your role will involve implementing a consistent, risk-based approach to testing across the whole of the SAPOL IS&T department. This is a key role, providing testing services and advice across a broad project portfolio as well as BAU solutions. You will work with business contacts across the organisation and closely with the PMO and other stakeholders to ensure that accurate estimates of testing efforts are provided at the project initiation phase and work with them to ensure that testing resources are available.

You will manage the whole of the SAPOL IS&T software testing team to ensure consistency, the sharing of technical knowledge, as well as recommendations for personal development amongst the team. You will need to apply a matrix management approach to ensure flexibility and the sharing of resources in a dynamic environment. As a part of this role you will also have the opportunity to evolve the testing framework, including the establishment of a best practice test automation offering.

You will report to the SAPOL IS&T Manager, Quality and Assurance and will work with a range of internal and external stakeholders, including other operational managers, to ensure the integrity, availability and quality of IS&T services to SAPOL.

This is a great opportunity for you to join a large and complex environment during an exciting IT transformation. You will be a proven leader with excellent interpersonal and communication skills ready to take on your next challenge

What you’ll need to succeed

  • Experience leading a team of technical experts in various forms of testing including systems, acceptance, load and regression testing.
  • Knowledge of, and practical experience in, managing functional and non-functional testing, administering test management tools in an SDLC and ITIL environment.
  • Ideally you will have experience implementing or improving testing services.
  • The ability to effectively liaise with internal and external stakeholders to ensure accurate estimates of testing is provided at the project initiation phase, and work with project teams to ensure availability of resources.
  • Ideally, you will have experience leading a team from manual to automated testing and evaluating where this would be most effective implementation.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage and lead a team with the ability to work with autonomy in determining methodologies.
  • High level of analytical skills and a methodical approach to detail.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills including the ability to communicate technology solutions into business terms as well as business requirements to technical staff.

Salary
ASO7 $103,387 to $111,759 per annum plus super.

Benefits
This is a great opportunity to join a large, complex and high profile SA Government department that is going through an exciting transformational change period and making a genuine investment in ICT as a driver of business excellence.

Application Instructions:
Please click on ‘Apply’ which will direct you to iworkforSA and further information will be provided on how to apply.

Applications Close: 25/05/2022 5:00pm

title: Infrastructure Support Analyst
description:
About Tic:Toc
Faster. Smarter. Simpler.

Tic:Toc is a world-leading fintech company based in Adelaide. We use technology and Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) to reimagine financial services processes and create superior experiences for our customers. And we’re growing fast.

You will find an environment waiting for you that is creative, friendly and a lot of fun. We are passionate about what we do, and it shows.

Tic:Toc expects and supports you to challenge traditional thinking and take risks. We are straight-talking and our team is full of bold, brave and energised talent.

The position
This Infrastructure Support Analyst role reports directly to our Reliability Coach in a small but fast-growing team. If the below describes you then you could be exactly who we’re looking for:
  • You love helping people and get a kick out of fixing problems.
  • You’ll enjoy working in a software company utilising new technology processes and tools.
  • You want more than just a service desk role with project work in a rapidly growing Fintech.
  • You’re a self-starter, having strong technical knowledge you keep yourself up to date with the latest technology advancements and trends.
  • You can translate geek speak into understandable terms for our customers, partners, and stakeholders.
  • You are the type of person who takes pride in going the extra mile to provide first class customer service.
  • You’ve got a firm grounding in your career experience so far and are looking stretch yourself further in the next stage of your development.
Infrastructure Support Analyst works closely with members of the Reliability Squad working with the systems and software engineers to support our platform. This role will maintain the support function within the IT infrastructure team and assist with continuous improvement as we scale. This role could be a real stepping-stone into further opportunities across the IT Team.
Key responsibilities of this role:
  • Providing Level 1 and 2 technical support and resolution of IT related requests and incidents and escalating to system engineers and / or software engineers when required;
  • Providing support to both internal and external clients and stakeholders;
  • Providing and maintaining desktop hardware and software;
  • Working in the Tic:Toc preventative maintenance programs;
  • Maintaining and creating required documentation and knowledgebase articles to assist our people and stakeholders to self-serve and improve internal process;
  • Work with our vendors and stakeholders to maintain our platform;
  • Support and monitor our environment to ensure it’s available and reliable;
  • Participate in the On-Call Roster and shift based cover for the Service Desk
The successful candidate
Essential requirements:
  • Experience performing in a service desk environment, maintaining users and desktop equipment for medium size businesses with both external and internal customers.
  • Highly developed communication, consultative and customer service skills i.e. translate Geek speak, understand customer impact, strong collaboration with our people.
  • Can-do attitude and ability to think outside the square and contribute to our systems and processes to help us work smarter and quicker
A strong understanding of:
  • Computer IP network and Infrastructure concepts including LAN, Group Policy, AD, DNS, DHCP.
  • Microsoft and Apple desktop SEO.
  • User and computer management via Active Directory.
  • Office 365 suite of Applications.
  • Group Policy Management.
  • Use of ticket management systems.
  • System support frameworks (ITIL) within the IT function of the business.
  • Support of SaaS and PaaS products and knowledge of public cloud infrastructure.
Our landscape is broad and includes many technologies, so further knowledge of the following would be advantageous but not essential:
  • System scripting to accelerate and automate the delivery of IT services to the business.
  • Knowledge of software development process, for example Agile processes.
  • Awareness and knowledge of Server Infrastructure both physical/virtual and Public/Private Cloud Infrastructure.
What's in it for you?
  • We offer competitive remuneration that aligns with market rate.
  • We also have two generous employee share plans. The first where every employee can become a shareholder and the second plan links success of employee contribution to the achievement of Tic:Toc’s strategic goals.
  • We offer flexible working hours and arrangements to balance your work and lifestyle
  • We also offer 1:1 Training, Learning Programs and Mentoring to help you succeed
Whilst all of our job opportunities have a specific criteria, if the above describes who you are but you don’t tick all of our boxes, we still encourage you to apply. If you have any questions, you can get in touch with Karam Singh our Talent Sourcer at ksingh@tictoc.com.au or 0401799479 .

Please note: The successful candidate will be required to undergo employment screening checks in accordance with best practice in financial services.

title: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Specialist
description:
• Microsoft D365 CE Specialist
  • Permanent Position
  • Attractive Package with Flexible Working Arrangements
  • Work for an Award-winning Employer of Choice

About Data#3

Our vision is to harness the power of people and technology for a better future .

Founded in 1977, Data#3 is an award-winning, publicly listed IT company that partners with world-leading technology vendors to deliver innovative technology services and solutions. Data#3 reported revenues of $1.6 billion in the 2020 financial year and has more than 1,200 employees across 12 locations in Australia and Fiji.

Data#3’s partnership status with world-leading technology vendors includes:

  • Microsoft Gold Certified Partner (inc. Azure Expert MSP)
  • Cisco Gold Certified Partner
  • Titanium Solutions Provider Partner
  • HPE Platinum Partner
  • Aruba Platinum Partner

For more details on why Data#3, head over to our Careers site at https://www.data3.com/careers/.

What Employment Benefits will I receive?

Underpinned by our core business values, Data#3 permanent staff have access to a wide range of activities and benefits, including but not limited to:

  • Income Protection;
  • Work-Life Balance;
  • Wellbeing & Volunteer paid leave; and
  • Career Development.

For our extensive list of benefits, refer to: https://www.data3.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/D3_Staff_Benefits_Final.pdf

The Role

An exciting opportunity has opened up within our growing Professional Services practice for a passionate and motivated Microsoft D365 Specialist.

In this role you will primarily be responsible for delivering D365 solutions, including reviewing, documenting and re-engineering client business processes.

What will I be doing?

The Microsoft D365 Specialist will:

  • Produce conceptual design documentation that adheres to Microsoft's best practices for implementations of Microsoft Dynamics 365, Power Platform and .NET;
  • Consult with clients on data migrations, systems integrations, and other technical issues in Microsoft Dynamics 365;
  • Provide guidance on business decisions from a technical perspective to business or technical stakeholders;
  • Take ownership of and responsibility for the technical delivery of Microsoft Dynamics D365 deployments and upgrades;
  • Identify and suggest opportunities to improve or make modifications to increase software efficiency or functionality;
  • Write and/or re-write code and software programs to meet client requirements and technical specifications using development cycle principles;
  • Develop and implement testing models and plans including documenting test results;
  • Investigate and suggest solutions to defects and problems detected during testing;
  • Develop and provide enhancements, maintenance and support for existing systems within client organisations;
  • Provide presales assistance as required to support the growth of the national Dynamics practice; and
  • Work within a highly collaborative team of passionate likeminded professionals.

What experience will I need?

The Microsoft D365 Specialist will have:

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in a customer facing, technical consulting role;
  • Strong experience in object-orientated programming design and development;
  • Familiarity with enterprise architectural design using both Cloud and On-Premise infrastructure/services;
  • Understanding of relational database design principles and implementation using Microsoft SQL Server.
  • Familiarity with web based integration/communication technologies/frameworks e.g. RESTful Web API’s, oData, SSIS;
  • Experience in dealing with web-based client side development technology e.g. JavaScript, CSS, AJAX, and jQuery;
  • Comfort in dealing with dealing with Application Lifecycle Management/Source Control technologies such as. Azure DevOps or the Atlassian suite;
  • Working knowledge of software coding and development protocols in a business environment;
  • Manages workflow, prioritise and meet project deadlines;
  • A good attitude, with a sense of urgency, strong teamwork, flexible and positive ‘can do’ approach;
  • The ability to work autonomously or in small teams to define and complete client outcomes;
  • Excellent documentation skills; and
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.

What Key Qualifications, Certifications & Training will I need?

The Microsoft D365 Specialist will have:

  • Bachelor degree or equivalent qualification in an IT related discipline is desirable; and
  • Hold a Current Australian Department of Defence security clearance or the ability to obtain a clearance.

Please note that Data#3 will request as part of the recruitment process, reference checks and verification of your right to work in Australia. You may also be required to undertake background checks and police checks for security clearance pertaining to specific job requirements.

Data#3 may require you to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, in order to perform this role.

Ref No. KAWI108199

title: Performance Marketing Manager
description:
TO APPLY, PLEASE COPY AND PASTE THE BELOW LINK INTO YOUR BROWSER.

https://www.refuelcreative.com.au/careers/open-positions/join-our-team-as-our-new-performance-marketing-manager

***Only applications received through the above link will be considered***

We’ve created a new leadership position for a driven and experienced digital marketer to join our team. If this sounds like you, and you want to step into a new challenge, we want you to join us as our Performance Marketing Manager.

This new role is all about taking the lead in our growing digital advertising business. You’ll be managing our SEM Strategist, Web Developer, and Videographers to deliver quality client deliverables.

It’s an exciting time for this role, and for Refuel Creative. Not only will you be working on a range of clients across the globe, but you’ll be joining an established team of professionals.

The main purpose of this role is to provide senior digital marketing expertise to Refuel Creative and its clients, in addition to leading and managing a small team.

Reporting to our CEO, Ryan Jones, this role will plan and implement multi-channel marketing strategies for internal and external clients, that incorporate marketing automation, digital, social and offline channels for clients.

Managing a small team, the Performance Marketing Manager will be responsible for mentoring and training their team, along with HR duties like enforcing company policies and procedures, approving timesheets, and regular one-on-one meetings.


What are the responsibilities of a Performance Marketing Manager?

This is an all round digital marketing position where you’ll get your hands dirty on a range of tools and channels, including:

  • Plan and execute all digital marketing strategies including SEO/SEM, email, social media and display advertising campaigns.
  • Measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns, and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs). This includes developing conversion measurement strategies and remarketing strategies, and implementation of these strategies.
  • Work with the team to research, build and manage paid campaigns across a range of channels including Google Ads, Microsoft Ads, Facebook, Instagram, etc.
  • Analyse and optimise existing paid campaigns including campaign structure, keyword research, negative keyword mining, bid adjustments, creating new campaigns, laser-focused audience targeting, and any other optimisation required to drive revenue and profitable growth.
  • Work closely with the marketing team and external stakeholders to ensure strategic alignment in campaign planning.
  • Work with the team to deliver website projects.
  • Implement quality control processes to ensure a high standard of output.
  • Develop processes for technical tasks, eg installing Meta Pixels, managing Google Tag Manager, etc.
  • Setup conversion tracking using Google Ads, Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics and HubSpot as required.
  • Plan and organise production schedules to ensure client work is completed on time.
  • Utilise industry best practices, techniques, and standards throughout entire project execution.
  • Monitor progress and adjust plans as needed.
  • Collaborate with partners, agencies and other vendor stakeholders.

This is a flexible position. You can work full-time or part-time, 4-5 days per week depending on the successful candidate. This is an in-person role at our office in Port Adelaide, South Australia with flexible work arrangements available for the right candidate.


Why Refuel Creative?

Refuel Creative is an award-winning marketing and technology agency based in Port Adelaide.

We specialise in all things digital. Digital marketing, paid search advertising (SEM/SEO/PPC), social media (Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, etc), web development, analytics, and more. We build a holistic and advanced digital strategy for our clients so that each channel can complement one another effectively.

We are striving to create the best environment for the most driven and personable people to work. By 2030, Refuel will be the Adelaide agency that marketers want to work at, and clients want to work with. It is an ambitious target, but we are focused on achieving it.

You are not just an ‘employee’ here. Instead, you are an ally and a teammate that will play a crucial role in our operation. In our team, your voice always matters. We’re committed to you and nurturing your growth and knowledge.

Our team values have been developed as a group, with everyone having ownership. Whether that is staff, clients, contractors, or collaborators, we go above and beyond to provide a positive experience with our business. We always work as a team to be innovative and creative and stay on top of industry trends and concepts.

title: Application Support Lead
description:
Our client is a highly regarded software company which has created a product to improve the work lives of thousands of people across Australia, New Zealand, and the USA.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a great team in an organisation which has seen tremendous growth and is making the shift to becoming an enterprise level company.

In this role you will be responsible for:

  • Responsible for managing all aspects of support services across Australian and New Zealand clients.
  • Lead and grow a team of support engineers as we expand our client base in the region.

  • Monitor and report on SLA performance.
  • Act as an escalation point for support engineers as needed.
  • Review recurring incidents to identify and log problem tickets for deeper investigation.
  • Contribute to knowledge base content based on experience from resolving support incidents.

To be successful in this role you must have:

  • 7+ years of experience in providing technical support for enterprise applications with stringent SLAs with at least 3+ years in a support lead role.
  • Focus on delivering exceptional customer service.
  • Strong interpersonal and client communication skills.
  • Demonstrated resilience to handle challenges and solve complex client problems.
  • Proven ability to build and lead a high performing customer support team.
  • Hands on experience and technical background with ability to contribute to various areas as needed along with leading the team.

Your application will be highly regarded if you have:

  • Understanding and certification in ITIL framework
  • Prior programming backround in Java, RoR etc
  • Experience in web development
  • Experience in a Linux based environment

For a confidential discussion please call Jessica Gadsby on (08) 8112 7417 , or please send through your updated resume for consideration. Please quote job reference 243166.

title: Digital Marketing Officer
description:
About us

JWPM Industrial Strength Marketing is a specialist B2B marketing agency that was founded in 1993. We pride ourselves on providing consulting and business advice that delivers powerful outcomes to our clients, resulting in tangible (often game changing) improvements. JWPM provides a comprehensive marketing consulting service including developing B2B Marketing Strategy, website development, designing, implementing, and managing B2B digital marketing campaigns, consulting on selling models, and sales force development, customer engagement and customer service strategies, providing brand building, graphic design, and promotional marketing services.

Qualifications & experience

  • Minimum 3 years in a digital marketing role. Website coding experience is highly desirable however, working with CMS (e.g. Wordpress or similar) is essential. Experience with technical products and services in a B2B setting would be highly regarded.

Tasks & responsibilities

  • SEO Research, Targeting, Monitoring, Updating, and Reporting
  • Website development
  • Website updates (updating and editing content)
  • Social media posting and management
  • Paid social advertising (setting-up LinkedIn and Facebook Marketing campaigns)
  • Setting-up paid Search Marketing campaigns
  • Remarketing campaigns
  • Campaign reporting and analytics

Benefits

  • Flexible work arrangements. Can work from home, work in the office, or a combination. Some in office time is expected particularly during the initial stages of employment.

About you

We are looking for an intelligent person with aptitude for Digital Marketing who we can train and mould into becoming a higher performer and valuable resource in this role.

You may not have all the expertise that we require initially, but you will after working with us for 12 months.

Above all we are looking for a keen mind, an exemplary attitude to work, and someone who can work collaboratively in an energetic team.

title: Principal Inspector (Ergonomist)
description:
About the Department of Treasury and Finance
At the Department of Treasury and Finance (DTF) we work together to support the prosperity and wellbeing of all South Australians.

Our objectives are:

  • Trust and empower our skilled, diverse, flexible and committed people.
  • Promote sustainable state finances.
  • Support responsible budget and financial management.
  • Deliver timely high quality services.
  • Collaborate to deliver high quality advice on economic, social and environmental issues.

DTF actively promotes flexible working arrangements and values diversity in the workplace.

About SafeWork SA
SafeWork SA is a business unit within DTF. SafeWork SA is responsible for providing work, health and safety, public safety and state-based industrial relations services across South Australia. As a regulator, our Investigators and Inspectors ensure work, health and safety, and public safety standards are met and appropriate action is taken when breaches of laws are detected. We also help people better understand their work health and safety responsibilities.

Our values are:

  • Professionalism
  • Respect
  • Integrity
  • Service

For more information, please visit: www.safework.sa.gov.au

About the opportunity
SafeWork SA is looking for individuals that are keen to use their skills and aptitudes to positively influence industry stakeholders in a safety context.

The Principal Inspector (Ergonomist) will be responsible for the identification and delivery of coordinated programs, looking at the capabilities and limitations of humans to systems across a variety of industries within South Australia. The role will be responsible for providing specialist advice and assistance to the delivery of state-wide intervention activities and represent SWSA at a State and National level within their area of professional expertise.

You will have proven ability to interact and engage with stakeholders in a respectful manner that leads to successful outcomes. You will uphold and demonstrate SafeWork SA’s values at all times and empower others around you to behave in a similar manner.

Special conditions for employment

  • Engagement in this role is subject to a satisfactory Department of Human Services General Employment Probity Check. A renewal will be required every three years
  • Some out of hours work may be required
  • Possession of a minimum Class C driver’s licence is essential
  • The Inspector will be required to take part in the on-call roster
  • Some intra and interstate travel requiring overnight absences will be required.
  • A Corporate wardrobe is supplied and may be worn in line with SafeWork SA Dress and Personal Protection Policy when interacting with stakeholders

Remuneration
PO3 - $96,860 - $102,400

Further Information
For further information about this opportunity and to obtain a copy of the Job and Person Specification please visit the I Work For SA website:  https://iworkfor.sa.gov.au and search for vacancy reference 482409

Application Instructions
All applications must be submitted online via the I Work For SA website:  https://iworkfor.sa.gov.au and search for vacancy reference 482409.

Only applications received via IWORKFORSA will be acknowledged.

Diversity Statement
The Department of Treasury and Finance is committed to having at least 50% of interviewees for each role being women. We actively promote flexible working arrangements and value diversity in the workplace. Please talk to us about how we can make this role work for you.

Applications close 6pm 05/05/2022

title: Payroll Specialist
description:
• Part Time or Full Time
  • Flexible Environment
  • Supportive Team

Cole School Experts specialise in the provision of virtual and on-site accounting, consulting, and software services to the non-Government Education Sector. Our head office is based in Adelaide with satellite officers on the East Coast, supporting Schools throughout Australia and New Zealand.

We are a rapidly growing business, and it is an exciting time to join our dynamic team.  We provide a modern work environment, we actively promote professional learning and recognise success.

We only work for Schools, typically transactional and virtually and we are looking for a successful, high level Payroll Specialist. You may need to work across multiple clients and multiple software. Schools are complex but we will teach.

Generally, we provide:

  • End to end payroll processing and record maintenance
  • Onboarding & terminations of staff
  • Pay rises, adjustments, payment of leave loading
  • Award/enterprise agreement interpretation
  • Year end reconciliations and requirement

It is imperative we work as a team so personality matters, we need to like, respect, and support each other, so to be successful in this role, the skills you should possess are:

  • the ability to interpret and understand multiple Awards/Enterprise Agreements and current statutory legislations
  • a team player will the ability to converse on all levels
  • strong attention to detail and accuracy
  • be tech-savvy
  • adaptability and a multitasker
  • honesty and strong values
  • resilience to meet daily deadlines
  • the ability to maintain a high degree of confidentiality
  • high achiever with commitment to your clients
  • outstanding Excel skills

School experience would be awesome but is not essential.

We may at times need to attend a school, we will manage the checks but if you are aware of a reason why you would not pass, please do not apply:

  • National Police Check & Working with Children’s Check

If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you!

To apply for this position please submit your resume with a covering letter.

Applications close - 23rd May 2022

title: Geology Manager
description:
Geology Manager

About Alligator Energy

Alligator Energy Ltd (AGE or Alligator) is experiencing rapid growth as we develop our Samphire Uranium Project in South Australia, advance our three other exploration projects in uranium, nickel, cobalt, plus evaluate future resource, project and M&A opportunities. We are seeking an experienced Geology Manager to join our team working on the Samphire Uranium Project to advance its resource, geological and geoscience development in addition to AGE’s other exploration projects.

About the Role

Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, your role as Geology Manager will be instrumental in leading the relevant technical aspects of the Samphire project to transition from its current inferred resource through to indicated status and feasibility studies as a pre-curser to decision to mine. You will also apply your expertise into Alligator’s other exploration projects. This is a leadership role with a strong technical and management component. In this role you will:

  • Develop an understanding of the regional and project geology, hydrogeology, geophysics, and historical drilling to expand the existing resource in AGE’s Samphire tenement holdings.
  • Seek to understand the value drivers for the Samphire Project; assess and communicate technical risk, including the geological uncertainties and potential impacts for ISR operations.
  • Management and oversight of all Samphire drilling programs, including planning, performance, cost control, administration, logistics and reporting.
  • Implementation of WHS policies and procedures to ensure field operations exceed statutory requirements in addition to measurement and communication of WHS performance indicators.
  • Mentor, supervise & professionally develop your team as it expands.
  • Responsible for ensuring compliance with all regulatory requirements, ensuring work program approvals and reporting support program execution timelines.
  • Implement value-add software/platforms for continuous improvement of geological data management and analysis.
  • Ensure respectful relationships and an open communication are maintained with all landowners, indigenous groups, and community in the region.
  • Evaluation of additional exploration and resource project opportunities.
  • Reporting to the CEO / Board as required.

We are seeking candidates with the following:

  • Degree qualified (or higher) in Geology/Geoscience.
  • Highly proficient in QA/QC, geological data analysis and attention to detail.
  • Prior experience in exploration and/or delineation of sedimentary-hosted uranium deposits including roll-front mapping.
  • Demonstrated experience in Australian Resource and Reserve reporting standards (JORC) of exploration results and mineral resource estimates for uranium.
  • Familiarity in unconformity-type uranium geological models (prior experience in exploring in these terrains would be highly regarded).
  • Demonstrated proficiency in downhole-well log interpretation software and well-log interpretation.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in 3D geological modelling and GIS software (Vulcan, Leapfrog, Micromine, QGIS, MapInfo or others).
  • Prior experience in supervision and managing drilling programs, contractors, and related stakeholders (landholders, indigenous groups, regulators etc.)
  • Prior experience in exploration field crew management
  • Experience in statutory tenement reporting to SA Government regulators and obtaining approvals for field work programs.
  • Demonstrated experience in tenement management.
  • Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills including both written and verbal.

You can find out more about Alligator Energy here: https://alligatorenergy.com.au. Applications will close Friday 27 May 2022.

title: Risk Manager
description:
We are a Supply Nation Certified recruiting and advisory business that specialises in professional talent acquisition and employment solutions across Australia.


Our vision is " Ethical Recruiting. Empowered People "


Currently, we have a role for a Risk Manager (EL2 Level) to start in July 2022. The person we are looking for will be responsible for managing risks and providing advice on the National Space Mission for Earth Observation (NSMEO) program, both internally and across the partner agencies.


Supporting the General Manager, Executive Officer, and Director Satellite Acquisition, the successful candidate will be responsible for the design, implementation, and management of the Risk Framework throughout the NSMEO program to oversee, report, and monitor risks and mitigation factors.


Role & Responsibilities:
  • Development of policies, strategies and tools for risk management
  • Support risk assessment within the Agency by maintaining an up-to-date knowledge
  • Integrate operational risk management tools for use in the NSMEO program
  • Interface with legal, supply chain assurance and technical experts to help engage innovative procurement processes
  • Provide advice on future Organisational Risk Management strategies

Skills & Experience:
  • A degree in Risk Management or similar professionally recognised Risk Management qualification
  • 5 years of experience working as a Risk Manager in a similar environment
  • Advanced knowledge of project management systems and specialised risk management software
  • Demonstrated ability to actively mitigate risk and deliver nuanced reports
  • Understanding of risk management in both private and public sectors

This is a 12 month full-time temp position with the possibility of extending. A competitive rate in line with EL2 Level is on offer, along with the opportunity to work in a supportive and friendly working environment.


Do you want to be considered for this position? Click 'apply now' to send a current copy of your CV. Not sure if this is the right job for you and you are looking to explore your options, then give John Camm a call on 0488 808 905 and start a conversation about what might be right for you.


Rainy Day Recruitment has a clear vision: "Ethical Recruiting. Empowered People" and is dedicated to promoting diversity and inclusion in acquiring talent for our clients. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration of their application without regard to culture, race, nationality, ethnicity, age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or religion. That said, this role requires NV2 Security Clearance, which means applications will ONLY be considered from Australian Citizens. Eligibility can be found at: http://www.defence.gov.au/agsva . Rainy Day Recruitment is eager to receive applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and invite them to apply.


In line with our COVID Policy, all applicants represented by Rainy Day Recruitment must be fully vaccinated - including any additional booster shots when eligible. Proof of vaccination status must be provided on request.

title: SAP FICA/FICO Functional Consultant
description:
SAP FICA / FICO CONSULTANT

We are Fujitsu. A Japanese company with a strong set of values and a history of respecting fairness and equality, whilst promoting diversity and inclusion. We constantly push ourselves to do better and strive to bring together a diverse mix of perspectives and talents in an inclusive environment, where we encourage our people to bring their full selves to work. We call this Be Completely You.
We are inclusive. As a responsible business, it is important to us that we reflect the diversity of our society and customers. Globally, Fujitsu is not only a Disability Confident company, a Times Top 50 employer for Women, and a signatory for the Race at Work Charter. We are also committed to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and in Australia we have been recognised as an AWEI Bronze employer for our LGBTI inclusion. We also have specific inclusion efforts with First Nations Peoples in New Zealand through our Maori and Pacific Peoples Inclusion Plan and in Australia with our Reconciliation Action Plan.
We are people centric . This means we care about our people (and their families and communities) and appreciate that everyone has a life outside of work. By supporting our people to Work Your Way, we empower them to achieve a flexible and respectful approach to work which suits them and our customers best - this could be working hours, location, or a flexible approach to their working day.
We want you to thrive. If working for a progressive organisation, with a continuing commitment to diversity and inclusion is important, you should apply.

Shape your world and achieve together
The Senior SAP FICA/FICO Consultant will have extensive SAP FICA (preferably PSCD) experience, with some experience in FICO.
Implementations and Support experience from a Functional perspective and have a good understanding of the key functions in FICA such as Dunning, Billing and Invoicing, Clearing, Payments and Banking along with the associated configuration.
The Senior SAP FICA/FICO Consultant’s prime responsibility is to ensure that Incidents and Defects raised by the customer are responded to and resolved in accordance with established SLAs.
In addition, the Senior SAP FICA/FICO Consultant will need to work with other team members to to design integrated solutions for new policy and legeslative requirements as well as changes to the existing requirements.
The Senior SAP FICA/FICO Consultant must be sensitive to Customer needs, bearing in mind the conflicting requirements that their team would demand, and the delivery capabilities of the consulting team.

Key Accountabilities:
  • Responsible for response and resolution of Incidents and Defects that are assigned to them via the Customer’s Support tool. Tickets that are assigned need to be updated with details of the analysis and resolution in accordance with agreed SLAs. The Senior SAP FICA/FICO Consultant may also be asked to contribute functional support or review unit tests conducted by developers on other tickets.
  • As part of the Incident and Defect resolution, the Senior SAP FICA/FICO Consultant must conduct Functional and System Integration Testing and support User Acceptance Testing.
  • Creation of new Documentation and updates to existing document as required
  • Attend meetings with the Customer and Fujitsu team member as required contributing to the discussions and outcomes

Building your own path to success:
To be successful in this role, you will have:
  • Extensive experience is SAP FICA (preferably PSCD), with some experience in FICO.
  • Understanding of the key functions in FICA such as Dunning, Billing and Invoicing, Clearing, Payments and Banking along with the associated configuration.
  • SAP PSCD Financial Customer Care (FCC) integration in CRM
  • Conceptual understanding of latest SAP Technologies ( S/4 HANA), Cloud concepts and SAP Implementation methodologies (Activate, RUNSAP)
  • Is familiar with IT Industry/SAP strategic directions and is competent to lead the review of related service delivery issues as they apply to specific customers.
  • Confident, energetic and tenacious with excellent analytical and interpersonal skills, providing direction and guidance on FICA/FICO solutioning
  • Excellent oral and written Communication skills.
  • Adaptable to changing customer needs
  • Typically a minimum of 5 years SAP FICA/FICO experience

PLEASE NOTE:
Fujitsu complies with government legislation in various jurisdictions which in certain circumstances may impose a requirement that certain workers be vaccinated against COVID-19 (or otherwise have a valid exemption).  Also, for client facing roles, many of our customers require our staff to be vaccinated to attend their workplaces. Based on Fujitsu’s assessment of workplace risk and the safety and wellbeing of our people and consultation with our staff, Fujitsu has introduced a Vaccination Requirements policy which requires all persons entering a Fujitsu workplace, attending a Fujitsu work-related event, or entering other premises to undertake work on Fujitsu’s behalf to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or the subject of an appropriate exemption (and to provide evidence of the same).  Consequently as a result of Fujitsu’s policy, and, where applicable , customer and legislated vaccination requirements, Fujitsu requires all new employees to be fully vaccinated or have an authorised exemption approved by Fujitsu’s Crisis management Team (CMT). Recruits will be required to provide evidence of their vaccination status as part of the recruitment process.

title: Financial Auditor
description:
Financial Auditor

  • NSW Government
  • Up to $75 per hour
  • Opportunity to work 100% remotely

Considering applicants who are based in other Australian states and/or territories as this is a role offering 100% work remotely arrangements

The Role

  • Ensure all audit work within personal responsibility is completed effectively and efficiently and meets the requirements of the client’s audit methodology, professional standards and legislation.
  • Build personal competency, knowledge and technical proficiency to contribute to more complex audit assignments.
  • Supervise and train staff to achieve quality audit results and to improve their skills and knowledge.
  • Ensure quality and timely audit outcomes are achieved by maintaining strong and professional relationships with clients and proactively communicating with internal and external stakeholders.

Some of these opportunities require regional travel (travel is reimbursed)
