title: Systems Accountant
description:
The Company
Beerenberg is a proud Australian family-owned business with an unwavering passion for sharing a taste of the country life.  For six generations, the pristine family farm in Hahndorf has transformed fresh farm produce into traditional home-style jams, sauces and condiments enjoyed by consumers worldwide.  All of which are naturally delicious.

With recent expansion into hospitality and the continual growth of retail products, Beerenberg seeks to grow the Finance team by appointing to the newly created role of Systems Accountant.

Reporting to the CFO and working closely with other departments to ensure mutual objectives are achieved and to drive continual improvement of systems in support of operational effectiveness.  This role focuses on reviewing, developing, and maintaining financial and supporting operational systems, whilst ensuring the overall financial integrity of the data.

Responsibilities
  • Collaborate with operational and Finance users to meet business requirements
  • Review systems performance, identify and resolve system issues
  • Troubleshooting of operating systems
  • Review, develop and maintain internal controls and procedures
  • Provide training and support in the use of systems
  • Maintenance of pricing and product system integrity
  • Management of system upgrades
  • Undertaking specialist projects and system development
  • Liaise with outsourced IT
Skills and Experience
To be successful in this newly created role, you will have experience in a system accounting role.   Ideally, you will also have project management experience as part of the finance team and possess CA/CPA qualifications.
  • Highly developed Excel and PowerBI skills
  • Strong analytical and numerical abilities
  • Demonstrated problem-solving / critical analysis skills
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to establish effective working relationships
Applying
If you are looking for a role where you can indeed be involved in the growth of a well-known SA family-owned business and where you will work with a range of systems from accounting, manufacturing, warehousing, POS and more, this role is for you.

Please forward your resume by clicking APPLY.
For a confidential discussion, please get in touch with Joanne Blackman on 0435 890 145 .

title: Principal Inspector (Ergonomist)
description:
About the Department of Treasury and Finance
At the Department of Treasury and Finance (DTF) we work together to support the prosperity and wellbeing of all South Australians.

Our objectives are:

  • Trust and empower our skilled, diverse, flexible and committed people.
  • Promote sustainable state finances.
  • Support responsible budget and financial management.
  • Deliver timely high quality services.
  • Collaborate to deliver high quality advice on economic, social and environmental issues.

DTF actively promotes flexible working arrangements and values diversity in the workplace.

About SafeWork SA
SafeWork SA is a business unit within DTF. SafeWork SA is responsible for providing work, health and safety, public safety and state-based industrial relations services across South Australia. As a regulator, our Investigators and Inspectors ensure work, health and safety, and public safety standards are met and appropriate action is taken when breaches of laws are detected. We also help people better understand their work health and safety responsibilities.

Our values are:

  • Professionalism
  • Respect
  • Integrity
  • Service

For more information, please visit: www.safework.sa.gov.au

About the opportunity
SafeWork SA is looking for individuals that are keen to use their skills and aptitudes to positively influence industry stakeholders in a safety context.

The Principal Inspector (Ergonomist) will be responsible for the identification and delivery of coordinated programs, looking at the capabilities and limitations of humans to systems across a variety of industries within South Australia. The role will be responsible for providing specialist advice and assistance to the delivery of state-wide intervention activities and represent SWSA at a State and National level within their area of professional expertise.

You will have proven ability to interact and engage with stakeholders in a respectful manner that leads to successful outcomes. You will uphold and demonstrate SafeWork SA’s values at all times and empower others around you to behave in a similar manner.

Special conditions for employment

  • Engagement in this role is subject to a satisfactory Department of Human Services General Employment Probity Check. A renewal will be required every three years
  • Some out of hours work may be required
  • Possession of a minimum Class C driver’s licence is essential
  • The Inspector will be required to take part in the on-call roster
  • Some intra and interstate travel requiring overnight absences will be required.
  • A Corporate wardrobe is supplied and may be worn in line with SafeWork SA Dress and Personal Protection Policy when interacting with stakeholders

Remuneration
PO3 - $96,860 - $102,400

Further Information
For further information about this opportunity and to obtain a copy of the Job and Person Specification please visit the I Work For SA website:  https://iworkfor.sa.gov.au and search for vacancy reference 482409

Application Instructions
All applications must be submitted online via the I Work For SA website:  https://iworkfor.sa.gov.au and search for vacancy reference 482409.

Only applications received via IWORKFORSA will be acknowledged.

Diversity Statement
The Department of Treasury and Finance is committed to having at least 50% of interviewees for each role being women. We actively promote flexible working arrangements and value diversity in the workplace. Please talk to us about how we can make this role work for you.

Applications close 6pm 05/05/2022

title: ICT Manager - Adelaide
description:
We’re looking for an ICT Manager to provide strategic and operational leadership that enhances teaching and learning within one of RTG's customers, being a dynamic K-12 private school. This is a core leadership role within the school leading a team of RTG onsite staff as well as other remote resources. You will be responsible for planning and strategy, operational and project management, customer satisfaction, and people coaching and development.

With a strong customer mindset, you will be able to partner with the leadership at the College and across RTG to deliver a well-thought-out roadmap that considers all stakeholder requirements. You will assume ownership of the school's tech assets including vendor relationships, infrastructure, and systems. You will have an innovative approach to technology and understand how an organisation can leverage technology to more effectively continue its journey.



Why join us?

Our people are driven by the fact that we can make a difference/ an impact on something meaningful - it's more than just technology for us.

We pride ourselves on implementing physical and cultural technology change at a rate many businesses could not achieve on their own. RTG continues to provide the best customer experience, we regularly measure customer satisfaction that highlights our key strengths, as well as our improvement and development opportunities. So as we grow and develop you do too!


Key Responsibilities:
  • Lead in all aspects of digital development including the formulation and implementation of the digital strategy
  • Work alongside the senior management and chair the Technology Committee, ensuring that the technology environment is capable of supporting the objectives and goals of the business.
  • Lead the technology team and work with others within RTG to develop the strategy into an actionable plan.
  • Ensure that the technology strategy (including system selection and risk planning) is operationalised and delivered and any issues are addressed.
  • Develop an annual technology roadmap and operating budget and monitor the implementation of these to ensure that financial targets are met.
  • Drive and manage projects and service delivery activities to ensure successful delivery including ongoing support and training.
  • Lead your team to deliver consistently superior customer services that are continually improved.
  • Implement and manage operational procedures for the management of all digital systems, equipment, subscriptions, and other technologies.
  • Establish SLAs and XLAs that reflect the needs and outcomes of the client and lead the team in achieving these and building on these to outperform user expectations
About You

We would like to hear from high performers with exceptional stakeholder management skills and the desire to exceed client expectations. You will bring with you:
  • Strong leadership abilities demonstrated by experience in leading a team and developing and implementing technology strategies
  • A strategic and purpose-oriented mindset
  • Change management and project management experience
  • Demonstrated experience analysing problems and providing clarity of direction and leadership to provide solutions
  • Knowledge and experience with information systems ideally in education, in particular, school management and learning management systems but doesn't have to be
  • Demonstrated experience in successful collaboration
  • A strong interest in emerging technologies
  • Tertiary qualifications in Information and Communication Technology or Education

On Offer
  • We believe in our people, so we encourage and support their ongoing personal growth and development.
  • You’ll join a bunch of incredibly smart people, who are passionate about exceeding customer expectations.
  • We recognise employee performance and appreciate our staff efforts through awards and career growth opportunities.
About RTG
We are a long-established Australian ICT company, having built a good reputation through the delivery of quality solutions and service to our clients. We are a team that measures and deliver results to our customers. Our values include integrity, making a difference, and collaboration and we are passionate about all that we do.


Successful candidates will need to undergo a National Criminal History Check, Working with Children Check, and based on the current Rules for Authorised Workers, be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 where there is medical eligibility.

title: Reporter
description:
We're currently recruiting for several reporter roles in Regional SA. You have a strong writing skills set and a natural knack for producing engaging and snappy copy. Your passion for journalism is strong and you are an independent worker that is comfortable to chase down fresh leads and uncover great stories in a community.

Locations include: Mount Gambier, Whyalla and Barossa Valley

What’s the role?

  • Identify and develop stories across a range of topics that are relevant and engaging for the local community
  • Produce engaging, accurate and clean copy
  • Develop stories from the concept stage to their digital publication
  • Drive subscription growth for the digital masthead and increase traffic to the website
  • Lead and inspire digital content through story development of the highest quality
  • Use data analytics to find new trends and track what content is performing online. Use that information to deliver stories that inspire, inform and engage the community
  • Build genuine connects across local businesses, sports teams, political leaders, families and citizens
  • Produce and publish stories, curating content on our home pages
  • come up with your own ideas for engaging digital content
  • Harness the many storytelling tools that digital has to offer (interactives, video, graphics)

Who are you?

  • 1+ years journalism experience
  • Previous writing and newsroom experience would be ideal
  • Ideally you already have a network from the local community
  • Fantastic interviewing skills and a natural curiosity that drives you to discover the stories that will make an impact
  • A stickler for detail and excellent spelling and grammar
  • CMS, SEO and Social media experience
  • Comfortable working in a fast paced, deadline driven work environment
  • Passionate about advocating and being the voice of the local community

What’s in it for you?

  • Collaborative environment
  • Opportunity to innovate, challenge the norm and pioneer the way forward
  • Variety of work where no two days are the same
  • Make a difference as part of Australia’s most influential media organisation

Who are we?

We are news. We are sport. We are lifestyle. We are News Corp Australia.

The nation’s most influential media organisation, News Corp Australia reaches an unduplicated audience of 16 million Australians every month. As well as our famous news and sports brands, we lead the way in fashion, food, health, real estate and parenting. We operate over 150 household name brands across print, digital and multimedia and have the largest online news audience in the country, with a bigger digital footprint than Facebook.

What's next?

Apply now or for more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers

title: Network Engineer
description:
Data Action (DA) has over 30 years' experience as a specialist software and services provider to the alternate banking and financial services industry. Operating nationally and servicing a broad client base including customer owned banks, credit unions, neobanks and financial services membership organisations, DA's focus of supporting the financial wellbeing of Australians is echoed through our values:

  • No goldfish - Go beyond your bowl, share knowledge, stay curious and keep learning.
  • Fail forward - Learn from mistakes and keep moving forward.
  • Cheer loudly - Be proud of the team's results and celebrate successes.
  • Own it - Throw yourself in and own your work, taking responsibility until the end.
  • Think Client - Put yourself in our Client's shoes - consider the impact for their customers and deliver.

DA has evolved to become a provider of core banking and digital platforms and services to some of Australia's leading customer-owned, challenger banks, aggregators, and the financial services industry, aligned with our purpose - powering innovation in banking.

DA operates nationally with close to 300 staff based in Adelaide, Sydney, and Melbourne - enhancing the banking experience of more than 1.43 million Australians via its core banking and digital platforms, powering customer transactions across 3.2 million accounts every day.

About the Role:

The role of the Network Engineer is to effectively design, install, administer, and optimise internal (DA) and customer's managed data and voice networks. Ultimately, to achieve high performance across business applications that utilise DA's infrastructure.

You Will be Responsible for:

  • Ensuring the availability of DA's network infrastructure for client/server applications
  • Planning/coordinating testing and implementation of replacement versions and vendor supplied patches
  • Assessing and developing strategic goals for DA's network infrastructure, in conjunction with department managers
  • Ensuring the security, integrity, and safety of DA's network infrastructure
  • Taking ownership of business-as-usual tasks, incident management and project delivery
  • Developing processes and procedures for the ongoing management and fine-tuning of the Network Environment
  • Providing a continuous development mindset and the ongoing improvement of skills and capabilities, with regards to DA systems. Including: documentation, maintenance, and quality assurance
  • Participating in an on-call roster, rotating across the Team (including weekend and overtime work).

What You'll Need to Succeed:

  • Sound experience with deploying and supporting Cisco Firewalls, f5 Load Balancers, CheckPoint Firewalls, as well as Cisco routing and Switching
  • Certification in AWS or a cloud-related discipline will be highly advantageous
  • Experience supporting or deploying large enterprise networks, or large-scale deployments
  • Strong exposure to Cisco networking architecture, namely: VLAN, HSRP, BGP and relevant switching and routing protocols
  • Excellent Troubleshooting skills
  • High level of technical expertise and the ability to learn quickly
  • Technical certification(s) from networking suppliers such as Cisco, or substantial progress towards obtaining certification will be highly advantageous.
  • Minimum of 2 - 5 years industry experience.

DA offers exciting opportunities for professional development and we have a strong focus on career progression for our employees. Flexible and supportive working arrangements are encouraged.

If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you! Please be sure to combine a covering letter addressing the key criteria set out above as the first page of your resume.

To be considered for this role you will need to be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident, or have a current visa that permits you to work in Australia.

title: Technical Writer, Lead
description:
Are you a passionate Technical Writer with a software development background and a genuine love of writing technical documents? Topcon Precision Agriculture (TPA) is a leading provider of advanced technological solutions to the agriculture industry. Our products provide navigation, automation and implement control for a wide range of agricultural machinery. We are growing and looking for an experienced Technical Writer, Lead to join our team in Adelaide. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced professional who will play a key role in the next phase of TPA's growth.  Ready to join the team?

Responsibilities

  • Create documentation plans, drawings, illustrations and schedules for documents and documentation sets.
  • Work with Engineering, Product Management, Professional Services and other key stakeholders to gather data for creation or revision of documentation.
  • Research and assimilate technical concepts, equipment and products into manuals, install guides, and other technical documentation ensuring usability and concise content.
  • Research, formalize, adhere to, and coach others on industry standard writing styles and formatting protocols.
  • Develop and maintain documentation hierarchy, content standards, formatting standards, and templates.
  • Improve document usability through content structure, formatting and proofreading.
  • Ensure document control integrity with document revision history content and proper approval workflow routing.
  • Ensure documented processes and methodologies meet ISO 9001 requirements.

Skills & Experience:

  • Extensive experience architecting complex documents and documentation sets, information design and structured authoring.
  • Ability to learn complex concepts quickly and explain with clarity and technical accuracy.
  • Ability to establish rapport and working relationships with a variety of personalities.
  • Sound knowledge of technical writing fundamentals, industry standard writing styles and content organization.
  • Experience with Adobe Creative Suite / Creative Cloud (e.g. FrameMaker, Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, Acrobat Pro)
  • Ability to work with translation vendors in managing translation development & procurement process.
  • Experience with Product Lifecycle Management, Document Control and/or Business Process Management methodologies and software.

If you enjoy working in a team environment and are self-motivated with strong organizational and negotiation skills, this could be your next opportunity. For further information, please call Ann on 0439 419 210 .

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

Must have Australian Permanent Residency or Australian Citizenship.

title: Development Team Lead
description:
Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.

At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.

Flexible Working

Xero is continuing to grow and so are the opportunities to join us!

You can choose to perform this role:

  • In one of our #beautiful offices
  • Flexibly, through a hybrid of in office and remote working styles
  • Permanently Remote

About the role

Your role can be summarised by ‘you do what is needed for the team to succeed’. You will be responsible for supporting your reports to become awesome Xeros. You’ll work with the Product Managers, Designers, BAs to make sure your team has a set of clear goals and responsibilities, and that any blockers for delivery are cleared in a timely fashion.

You’ll also work with your Development Manager and fellow Team Leads to drive cross-pod initiatives to enable the success of the group as a whole. Although you won't have any hands on coding responsibilities, you will provide the team coaching and mentoring drawing on your background in Engineering Management.

What you'll do

  • You are a leader at the intersection of product and engineering management
  • You’ll maintain an environment in which your team can do their best work predictably and sustainably
  • You’ll make sure the team has all the information they need and the right feedback loops in place to discover and deliver valuable, usable, and buildable outcomes
  • You’ll help your team learn and improve, making local discoveries global
  • You’ll look after the health of your team and their products, aiming for resilience.

What you'll bring with you

  • You will be an excellent people manager who has worked in a similar Development Team Leader role.
  • You will have an understanding of Agile fundamentals and experience delivering software using one or more Agile delivery processes.
  • You will have a engineering background with the ability to coach and mentor the team on engineering fundamentals.
  • You will have a passion for helping people fulfil their potential, provide mentorship and have the ability and willingness to impart knowledge and guidance to your team members through excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills.

Why Xero?

At Xero we support many types of flexible working arrangements that allow you to balance your work, your life and your passions. We offer a great remuneration package including shares plus a range of leave options to suit your well-being. Our work environment encourages continuous improvement and career development and you’ll get to work with the latest technology.

Our collaborative and inclusive culture is one we’re immensely proud of. We know that a diverse workforce is a strength that enables businesses, including ours, to better understand and serve customers, attract top talent and innovate successfully. We are a member of Pride in Diversity, in recognition of our inclusive workplace. So, from the moment you step through our doors, you’ll feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life.

title: Project Manager
company: Talent – SEEK Recruitment Agency of the Year | 7 Time Winner

title: Management Accountant
description:
ABOUT ADBRI LIMITED
Adbri was formerly known to Australians as Adelaide Brighton, one of Australia's pioneering construction materials and industrial mineral manufacturing companies. As a proud Australian ASX listed leader, supporting local economies and communities, their purpose is to build a better Australia through their respected brands and product range in cement, lime, concrete, aggregates, paving, bricks and industrial minerals. Their footprint spans across Australia with 44 quarries, 95 concrete plants, 16 cement and lime facilities and 10 concrete product facilities which ensures they are ready to take on any challenge.

Adbri's name is synonymous with cement and lime; today, their manufacturing facilities and distribution centres are strategically located in Australia's major mining and construction markets of Western Australia, South Australia, Victoria, New South Wales, Queensland, and Northern Territory.

ABOUT THE MANAGEMENT ACCOUNTANT
Joining the Cement & Lime segment, one of the most iconic segments of Adbri and reporting to the Finance Manager - Cement & Lime, you will be a key element to the team in providing financial support, information and analysis to the finance business partners and the wider Cement & Lime division team. Key aspects to the role will be assisting in the formulation of budgets, forecasts and reporting along with supporting the month end through analysis, journals and accruals. This role will exposure you to a complex ASX listed finance environment, build your true finance business partner capabilities, utilise your aptitude to learn cost to produce and manufacturing methodology.

The key responsibilities of this role include:

  • Assist in month end close for the division, including journals, accrual, cost transfers, reporting and analysis
  • Analysis and reporting of major shut down costs for the sites
  • Ensure appropriate coding structures are maintained within SAP including taking appropriate action where required to correct
  • Assist in the development of the budget and forecasts in conjunction with the finance business partners
  • Ensuring reporting deadlines are met and compliance with financial procedures are adhered to
  • A commitment to providing exceptional customer service, both internally and externally
  • Drive efficient continuous improvement opportunities into the business, using systems and processes

The key requirements for this role include:

  • Relevant Tertiary qualifications, or a related discipline
  • CPA or CA membership or currently working towards
  • Relevant management accounting experience including supporting budgeting, forecasting and reporting activities
  • Experience with accurate and timely preparation of financial information within agreed timelines
  • The ability to foster a positive team environment

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply please click apply or call Jessica Gouscos on +61 8 82163555 for a confidential discussion.

title: Management Cost Accountant - FMCG
salary: Highly competitive salary negotiable to experience
description:
• Established growing business
  • Northern Adelaide suburbs
  • Salary negotiable to experience

The Organisation
This is your opportunity to join a long established and successful national manufacturing business in the FMCG sector.  With farming operations and a national grower network, this business is a leading supplier of packaged food to Australia's largest retailers.  As an accredited supplier with processing facilities across Australia you would be joining a established business with future business growth potential offering you great career opportunities.

Your responsibilities
As a key member of the national finance team, this position has the opportunity to significantly contribute to the future growth of this business.  Your willingness to engage across the business and provide information that enhances decision making across key areas incorporating operations, supply chain and sales will be paramount to your success.  Developing and maintaining effective costing models will directly impact speed to market and  business profitability.  Previously the costing responsibility rested within another finance position, however, due to business expansion, the position has grown to require a dedicated full time focus.  As a newly created position, you will have the ability to take ownership of your role and contribute to the team through innovative solutions.  Responsibilities include:

  • Develop and maintain product costing model
  • Analyse costs and recommend cost savings
  • Analyse changes in goods and services to determine business impact
  • Variance analysis reporting
  • Price and profitability Management reporting
  • Manage inventory and cycle counting process
  • Support Month end process and year end reporting support
  • Assist with annual budgeting and audit process

Your benefits
If you are looking to truly engage in a business that is open to change and seeking your input then this is the position you have been searching for.  The breath of this position will provide you with scope and challenge as you work across all product lines nationally encompassing four processing plants. Working as part of a National finance team you will have the support of experienced management with the opportunity to achieve career growth. Combine this with a great location, high profile brands, and a great team and you will be set!  Some travel may be involved in the position.

Your background
If you describe yourself as proactive with a curious nature and the ability to engage with internal business partners to drive initiatives then this position is for you.   To be progress with your application we are seeking;

  • Tertiary qualifications in Accounting discipline
  • Previous experience in manufacturing including Bill of Materials is essential
  • FMCG industry experience preferably food, highly advantageous
  • ERP experience essential
  • Advanced MS Excel skills
  • Highly structured with strong attention to detail
  • Ability to build relationships across all divisions
  • Ability to drive adherence to governance practices

You do not want to miss the opportunity of working in successful national business from their Adelaide office.  Do not delay in applying, this position will not last long!

title: Project Manager
description:
About us

Jungal is an award winning platform that connects high end freelancers and contract staff to corporate Australia. We have a new contract opportunity for an experienced Agile Project Manager located in Adelaide, South Australia to work with one of our high energy clients and a quick start.

Let us tell you a bit more …

We're looking for a skilled Agile Project Manager to help a mid sized client with a number of client driven projects and act as an intermediary. If you have experience in working with vendors, CRM jobs and juggling multiple stakeholders, then this one might be for you. You will need a background in IT and able to confidently talk and lead people down negotiations and scoping work.

You will have a passion for people, creating strong outcomes and working with all interested groups to deliver successful results.

Qualifications & experience

  • Experience leading medium sized teams
  • Experience in Scrum and Agile methodology
  • Creating and overseeing client communications and relationship building
  • Producing project updates and governance reports as required
  • Extensive experience in the Microsoft Office Products
  • Jira experience well regarded

So if you're a well regarded and experienced project manager with a proven track record in complex projects, please let us know. This person should be a combination of experience, calmness and industry expertise to inspire trust and confidence whilst maintaining the direction of the work packages.

title: Maintenance Data Manager CAMM2 - Expressions of Interest
description:
About the team
The Airbus Aircraft Sustainment Team in Edinburgh provide engineering, maintenance and supply functions to the Australian Defence Force. We are seeking expressions of interest from qualified and experienced Aircraft Maintenance Data Managers with a defence background to expand our capacity for support to both the P8A Poseidon and, P3 Orion during OLM, ILM and DLM at RAAF Base Edinburgh.

This is an expression of interest only at this stage. Our expectation is that opportunities will become available at varying stages commencing from July 2022. About the role.

The primary objective of these roles is to manage the daily running and data integrity of Computer Aided Maintenance Management (CAMM2) and related systems for defence and industry maintenance and engineering teams. You will work within your competency and authorisation to contribute to the achievement of aircraft maintenance targets, and show a strong commitment to safety and maintenance data integrity ensuring continuing airworthiness.

About you

The skills and experience best suited to these roles:

  • Previous experience using Computer Aided Maintenance Management CAMM2
  • Depot or intermediate level Maintenance experience
  • Australian Defence Industry Maintenance experience
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong Computer skills particularly in Microsoft office,

Qualifications/Training:

  • Completion of Aircraft Trade Apprenticeship
  • Certificate IV in Aeroskills
  • CAMM2 DATA Manager. Training will be provided if the applicant has the background skills to complete the course.

What's on offer
Airbus Group is a global platform for excellence, with network expertise providing our people with the opportunity to be a part of rapidly advancing innovations in engineering and technology to accomplish the extraordinary; making the world a more connected, safer and smarter place.
Here at Airbus Australia Pacific we offer dynamic and diverse roles as well as a friendly place to work! Some benefits you can expect:

  • Relocation package for eligible applicants
  • Clear operational and strategic objectives
  • Supportive structures, systems and processes
  • Exciting and significant future commercial opportunities
  • A commitment to your professional development
  • Strong links to the broader Airbus Group global community
  • Values driven leadership focussed on employee and customer experience
  • Competitive salary packaging
  • Employee Share Ownership Plan
  • Employee health plans - Physiotherapist available on site

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment and are continually striving to improve our gender balance. We welcome and encourage females to apply.

Applicants must be eligible for an Australian Government Security Clearance and have the capacity to satisfy pre-employment medical screening which may include drug and alcohol testing.

*** In addition to your covering letter and resume, please supply a copy of your Aeroskills or trade transcript to accompany your application***

Closing Date: 26 May 2022

All enquiries should be forwarded to:
Vaughn Wilds Edinburgh Maintenance Support vaughan.wilds@airbus.com
Keita  MCCORMICK Talent Acquisition Consultant keita.mccormick@airbus.com
