title: Delivery Manager, EL1, Consumer Data Right (CDR) Division
description:
• Genuine opportunity for WFH and in the office.
• Negotiate, engage & manage relationships with internal and external stakeholders to products service
• Responsible for delivering and operationalising the aspects of the Consumer Data Right

Solution Delivery and Operations Branch

The Operational Delivery Branch is responsible for delivering and operationalising the aspects of the Consumer Data Right for which the ACCC is accountable. This includes core technology components such as the Registration and Accreditation Platform (RAAP) and Conformance Test Suite (CTS). As with the CDR overall, the initial focus of the Operational Delivery Branch will be on the banking sector. The ambit of the team’s work will expand to other sectors as the CDR rollout progresses.

Role and Duties

This role sits in the Operational Delivery Branch and will both support and drive the delivery of the Register and Accreditation Application Platform (RAAP). The Product Manager/Business Analyst will work closely with the Director and IT Delivery Team to ensure that the product meets requirements.

The successful applicant will:

  • Negotiate, engage and manage relationships with internal and external stakeholders to deliver products and services, and build service delivery capability
  • Lead and drive strategic planning to ensure CDR delivery milestones are met in line with roadmaps
  • With input from stakeholders, drive and report on the prioritisation of the team’s delivery plans and acceptance criteria for solutions, ensure alignment with roadmap milestones, and provide sign-off that they have been met
  • Identify and manage risks, and implement mitigation strategies where needed
  • Drive teams to develop clear and defined work plans and timeframes for self and team in the context of business priorities
  • Drive and lead agile planning events including PI Planning, and work with team members to ensure sequencing is logical and prioritised to deliver value to the customer / end users
  • Support teams to drive relevant agile events (e.g. user story refinements, daily stand-ups, retrospectives, showcases)
  • Lead the software development life cycle IT responsibilities such as build and release management
  • Work with Product Owners and Scrum Masters to resolve and escalate issues, blockers and provide input into reporting
  • Manage contract negotiations and ensures delivery as per contractual requirements, including providing leadership for contracted staff
  • Drive the continual improvement of ways of working in line with Scaled Agile methodology, working closely with the Agile Coach

For more information about the role including the selection criteria, please see the attached Candidate Kit.

How to apply

When applying you will be asked to upload your resume and submit a statement of claims that is no more than 800 words.

When preparing your statement of claims, please take into consideration the role and duties, and detail instances from your past that demonstrate how you meet the selection criteria

Salary: $111,251to $123,121per annum (plus 15.4% superannuation)

Contact Officer: Steph Homewood, 0413 991 951

This role is available on a full time, part time or job share basis.

title: Senior Client Recovery Officer
description:
Hudson are pleased to be working alongside this well known and reputable employee management services company located within Adelaide SA. This is a fantastic opportunity to join their busy Salary Sacrificing team in their newly created Senior Client Recovery Officer role. Take this position to new heights with a fresh team that you will be able to shape and guide.

Required duties:

Proactively driving and maintaining an efficient and effective Recoveries function, including:

  • Developing, executing and maintaining an efficient and cost-effective collections solution
  • Providing direction and guidance to Client Recovery Coordinators to prioritise collections activities (through a matrix reporting structure)
  • As a subject matter expert, provide recommendations and advice to Client Recovery Coordinators and other internal stakeholders
  • Effective management of complex recoveries matters, acting as a point of escalation
  • Overseeing all recovery activities to ensure compliance with, and consistent application of policies, guidelines and procedures in line with relevant collection codes and legislation

Portfolio collections

  • Role modelling excellent client & customer service whilst maintaining a professional and friendly manner
  • Collecting debts across brands by negotiating, arranging and monitoring arrangements
  • Ownership of issues through to resolution

Continuously improving processes

  • Owning relationships with internal stakeholders including Client Relationship Managers, Data Analysts, IT, Intelligent Automation and Group Finance
  • Identifying upstream opportunities and implementing changes to reduce downstream recovery requirements

Develop, Maintain and issue collections reporting

  • Ownership of the development and delivery of reliable and accurate collections reporting
  • Generating insights from collections data to drive improvements in collections processes

To be successful in the role you will posses:

  • Strong verbal & written communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to explain complex information and calculations in a simple manner for both internal and external customers
  • An understanding of basic accounting principles
  • Excellent time management, organisational and prioritising skills
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy
  • Proven ability to demonstrate initiative and problem solve and generate new ideas
  • Ability to coach, provide direction and guidance to junior members of the recoveries team
  • Minimum of 5+ years experience working in a complex customer facing role (desirably within salary packaging, banking/finance or superannuation industry)
  • Experience in debt recovery/ collections portfolio management essential
  • Experience in the improvement and deployment of processes across broader business units
  • Experience in a supervisory role highly desirable
  • Certificate III or IV in Customer Service or equivalent

For a confidential conversation please contact Maddy Wenham on 7081 1075 or apply via the link provided

title: Zero Harm Advisor
description:
• Located in Underdale
  • Tool of trade vehicle provided
  • Career Development Opportunities

Join our Zero Harm team in this long-term career development opportunity based in Underdale.  This hands-on role will actively lead and ensure on-going compliance with statutory obligations whilst mitigating risk.

The role of Zero Harm Advisor will contribute to the continual improvement to Downer's Integrated Management System (IMS) and associated programs.  The role will also be responsible for performance monitoring and data analysis, audit processes and guiding incident investigations.

ABOUT YOU

Exposure in the Civil Road Maintenance, Construction, Heavy Industrial or Transport space will be highly regarded as will the ability to influence and engage a wide range of stakeholders, maintaining strong relationships with both operational and management personnel to achieve best outcomes.

  • Diploma or higher qualification in Occupational Health and Safety. A QSA auditor certificate and/or training & assessment qualifications would be highly advantageous.
  • OHS Exposure gained within a high-risk industry operating accredited heavy vehicles
  • Demonstrate knowledge and ability to evaluate and implement Zero Harm policies and procedures and ensure compliance.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with ability to influence at various business levels.
  • Strong computer and data analysis skills that extend to report collation and presentation.
  • Ability to think strategically, considering both corporate and local objectives/drivers.
  • Ability to conduct audits; investigations of safety issues and assist in developing improvement plans based on findings.
  • Demonstrated ability to develop Zero Harm improvement plans to drive and promote proactive safety awareness programs.
  • Prior experience with managing return to work programs in consultation with line management; liaison with Injury Management Team.

WHAT WE OFFER

  • Continued investment & industry leading research & development into sustainable practices that contribute to the circular economy, delivering on long term urban infrastructure improvements.
  • Training and Development to support your career with us.
  • The unique opportunity to work in an organisation with the safety of our people and the environment at the forefront of all that we do.
  • The ability to build your professional career in a multi-disciplined business environment.

To apply, please click on "Apply" below and submit your resume. We do not accept applications via email but for more information, please email Samantha.Temple@downergroup.com

Please note, screening and interviews may take place prior to the closing date – applications may also close before this date.

title: Geotechnical Engineer/Senior Geotechnical Engineer
description:
FMG Engineering is a very well-known and highly regarded multi-disciplinary National Engineering Consultancy providing services and solutions to the development, property and urban infrastructure sectors. With offices in Adelaide, Melbourne and Sydney, we employ over 140 staff, comprising engineers, scientists, technicians and support staff.

Ambitious, positive, passionate and energetic – you will have outstanding interpersonal skills and be motivated by working in a team of high performing professionals. Analytical, technically proficient and flexible – you will relish challenges where your rewards and responsibilities will be based on your positive attitude and ability.

Key responsibilities of this role include:

  • Develop and maintain client relationships
  • Undertake geotechnical investigations, assessments and report writing
  • Provide geotechnical advice to internal and external clients
  • Liaise with clients, with regards to preparation of quotes and tenders
  • Supervising, mentoring and peer reviewing the technical work of other team members
  • Interact with and provide guidance within our NATA accredited materials testing laboratory (AN 544) maybe no need for engineers at the level, we are looking for, rather than some lab technician to apply?

Key selection criteria:

  • A minimum 3 years’ experience or 7 years' experience for the senior role in geotechnical engineering/engineering geology
  • Tertiary qualifications in civil/geotechnical engineering or related discipline
  • Familiar with South Australian soil/rock conditions plus proven track record of soil logging and/or rock coring experiences based on Australian Standard
  • Proven skills in building and maintaining client relationships
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, with strong report writing ability
  • Advanced excel data analysis and interpretive reporting skill is highly regarded for senior role
  • Strong project/site management/supervision skills
  • Flexibility to work either in the office, out on site or interstate
  • Experience with geotechnical/pavement software packages is highly regarded – especially Circly, Plaxis and Slope/W

This role represents an outstanding opportunity for the right person to join the FMG family and continue to develop their professional career.

If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your resume and cover letter (outlining which of the above-mentioned criteria makes you suitable for this role) via SEEK or email to recruitment@fmgengineering.com.au. Applications close 10 June2022.

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Continuous Improvement (CI) Operational Lead
description:
Company Description

Connecting people and communities| Driving eCommerce | Moving Australia & New Zealand

With an unrivalled and expansive network, Global Express builds unique, innovative, and tailored transport and logistics solutions.

From a shipload of containers full of fresh produce, urgent medical deliveries on the next available flight, end-to-end retail to every corner by road or rail, or simply delivering gifts to friends and family, we connect people, communities, and businesses across Australia and New Zealand.

Backed by Allegro Funds, Australia’s most awarded and largest transformation and turnaround private equity firm, we’re looking to the future and working towards new and exciting ways to put our customers’ businesses at the heart of ours.

Job Description

An exciting opportunity is available for an experienced Service Quality CI Lead to join our Service Quality team on a permanent basis.

As the Service Quality CI Lead, you will seek to improve the operational processes, revenues & customer experience, through providing functional, operational and problem resolution in support of the Operations teams, poor performing or at-risk customers, strategically important receivers and business partners.

Reporting to the Service Quality Continuous Improvement Manager, the Service Quality CI lead will contribute towards all tactical & strategic matters related to continuous improvement in the business.  Your primary operational responsibilities will be state focused, with attention and consideration given to other operations teams across other divisions or states if required.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities

  • Undertaking deep dive data analysis and value stream mapping of the existing operational processes to identify gaps, bottlenecks to eliminate work duplication, influence operational cost reduction and deploying best practices accurately and reliably
  • Study, measure and evaluate network throughput issues within the major GE depots to support and maintain optimum delivery performance (DIFOT)
  • Use a combination of Project Management (PM) and Continuous Improvement (CI) tools / techniques to lead & implement CI operational projects / workshops, validate issues, identify root causes, develop corrective actions, formulate SOPs and implement change
  • Identify opportunities for more innovative and/or efficient operational and business process designs to improve customer experience & team efficiency
  • Support cultural change that embraces CI through the education and use of Lean Six Sigma (LSS) tools and methodologies
  • Work with the relevant key stakeholders i.e., Operations Management and Teams, Sales, Account Management etc., to identify issues and opportunities and proactively implement change to improve the service delivery and the customer experience.
  • Support and implement key decisions related to developing GE continuous improvement initiatives beneficial to both our Customers and Operations Teams
  • Maintain appropriate technical capability and skills sets to serve business needs, including training requirements for all Service Quality Team Members

Qualifications

An open mindset to continuously develop and strive for a career at Global Express along with a can-do attitude will set you apart.

The role requires someone driven, passionate, organised, and tenacious.  The Continuous Improvement Customer Lead will have strong communication skills with a desire to continuously learn and grow their skillsets and a team player.

  • Six Sigma accreditation (Yellow / Green belt preferred)
  • Proven experience in Performance improvement and/or transformation experience (minimum of 2 years’ experience in similar role)
  • Clear understanding and/or experience of a network and logistics environment
  • Proven experience in managing internal business relationships, internal/external stakeholders over multiple geographic locations
  • Strong stakeholder engagement that fosters an inclusive & collaborative environment
  • Self-driven with a strong sense of urgency, commitment to deadlines and deliverables
  • Passionate about change and improving GE culture and results
  • Innovative & curious
  • Strong customer advocacy and understanding
  • Team Player who can get along with people, have good influencing skills, and can motivate others
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • A good understanding of data fundamentals, data and root cause analysis
  • A deep knowledge of processes, process & value stream mapping
  • A basic understanding of statistical data analysis and the use of statistical software i.e., Minitab

Additional Information

We believe nurturing a diverse and inclusive workplace, which celebrates different points of view and gives everyone the chance to contribute, as we build to a bigger and brighter future.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.

It’s never been a more exciting time to join our team as we take the next step in our journey.

To find out more about us, visit https://www.tgexpress.com.au/careers

To be considered, you must be entitled to work in the specified country and be prepared to undertake pre-employment checks including a criminal history check and medical assessment.

title: Materials Scientist
description:
TekCyte is a medical coating company, based at Mawson Lakes SA, that develops and manufactures polymer coatings for the medical device industry. The facility is situated on the UniSA Mawson Lakes Campus.

We are currently seeking an energetic and enthusiastic scientist, with a background in chemistry and/or materials sciences. Experience in surface analytical techniques is desirable but not essential. The role requires working in a team to develop novel coating technologies for biomedical and industrial applications. The right candidate will need to ﬁt into our dynamic technology development team.

Tasks and Responsibilities

  • Report to the Senior Materials Engineer
  • Carry out experiments and research work according to protocols provided by the Senior Materials Engineer.
  • Record all experimental details according to TekCyte’s quality policies. Perform data analysis and prepare graphs.
  • Create presentation slides to help Senior Materials Engineer present results.
  • Ability to navigate online resources to gather information.
  • Produce technical documents such as technical reports, standard operating procedures and work instructions.
  • Adhere to TekCyte and UniSA OHS guidelines while working within TekCyte’s or UniSA’s laboratories.
  • Maintain laboratory equipment in good working order.

Skills and Experience

Essential

  • A Bachelor degree in relevant disciplines (e.g. materials science, chemistry, physics, chemical engineering or biochemistry)
  • Knowledge of thin ﬁlm coating techniques
  • Excellent analytical and technical skills.
  • Good observational skills
  • Good time-management skills
  • Good writing and communication skills

Desirable

  • Experience in biomedical and/or medical device industry
  • Experience in developing coatings for biomedical devices
  • Experience with analytical techniques such as XPS, SEM, and Sessile drop
  • Experience in research laboratories

title: Branch Manager
description:
TVH - Keeps You Going.

TVH is a market leader in the aftermarket distribution of parts and accessories for materials handling, agricultural and industrial equipment globally and in Australia. Worldwide employing over 6,800 people, TVH provides unparalleled customer value-add in its core markets.

The Australian operation is an important business for the group. In recent years it has experienced strong growth organically and through acquisition, and is poised for significant further growth in existing and new markets.

About the role:

TVH Australia now has an opening for a Branch Manager. Located in Adelaide and reporting to our General Sales Manager, you will lead a team of 11 from our Wingfield branch to:

  • Manage all operational aspects of the branch including sales, customer service, warehouse, human resources and administration
  • Build and leverage effective business relationships with customers
  • Coach and develop knowledge and skills of team members to cultivate a team culture of high performance and best-in-class customer service
  • Implement plans and strategies to ensure consistent monthly and annual achievement of sales budgets and KPI’s
  • Actively promote TVH Workplace Health and Safety policies

About you - Skills, experience and qualifications:

This role will suit a branch/parts manager from within the materials handling or industrial aftermarket or automotive parts component market with the best mix of:

  • At least 5 years’ experience in a parts based distribution business
  • Exceptional customer focus and a flair for sales/business development
  • Genuine passion for delivering a high quality service and instilling in others to do so
  • Strong leadership skills with a proven track record of leading a team
  • Sound conflict resolution, problem solving and interpersonal skills
  • Sound computer systems and data analysis skills, including the use of Microsoft Office
  • Qualifications in Business Management /Administration desirable but not essential

We can offer you:

  • Recognition programs and incentives for your performance
  • The opportunity to join a dynamic global company that is a leader in its field
  • Ongoing training and career development
  • TVH Nudge: our health and wellbeing program that provides you with opportunities to make healthy daily choices.

If this role sounds like the perfect role for you please submit your cover letter and resume by clicking 'APPLY'.

title: Zero Harm Coordinator - Rail Infrastructure Projects
description:
Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. Through trusted relationships and world leading insight we work closely with our customers to design, build and sustain assets, infrastructure and facilities.

Our long history of delivering transport infrastructure projects under a variety of contracting models. Services include the design and construction of light rail, heavy rail, bridge and roads, as well as track and station work, signalling and rail safety technology.

THE ROLE

An exciting opportunity has become available for a Graduate or Entry Level – Safety / Zero- Harm Coordinator to join our Rail Team based in South Australia. You will provide support, coordination and advice of safety practices, systems and procedures across various projects.

Working as part of a dynamic team, you will be trained on and responsible for:

  • Communicating safety requirements to subcontractor’s onsite.
  • Compile data and information for end of month reporting.
  • Track progress against assigned deliverables and report on progress to the leadership team.
  • Enter and extract data from key performance and incident management systems.
  • Prepare and update project work, health and safety documents and registers.
  • Facilitate group discussions about work, health and safety.
  • Conduct field leadership inspections and audits.
  • Provide support to various projects across different states.

ABOUT YOU

  • Relevant Work, Health, Safety and/or Environment qualifications – favourable but not essential.
  • Experience within the rail, transport, construction, mining & resources or engineering industries - favourable but not essential.
  • Good computer and data analysis skills that extend to report collation and presentation.
  • Able to regularly travel interstate for project auditing.
  • Understanding of document compliance procedures and processes and understanding of technology to support safety systems.
  • Knowledge of incident management and reporting involving multiple internal and external parties.

WHAT WE OFFER

  • Highly supportive management and team-orientated organisation.
  • Exposure to a variety of exciting projects
  • Competitive remuneration with on-going development, training and support.
  • A long-term career opportunity for working with an ASX listed company.
  • Numerous financial, lifestyle, health & wellbeing benefits including salary sacrifice options, novated leasing, discounts and support programs

To apply for this great opportunity please click the APPLY button.

As an employer who embraces equal opportunity and promotes diversity and inclusion, we encourage men and women of all ages and backgrounds, including Indigenous Australians to apply.

For more information please contact Ellen Farrell - Recruitment & Sourcing Business Partner: ellen.farrell@downergroup.com

Applications will not be accepted via email. Please submit your application via the advertisement.

title: Reliability Engineer
description:
About the Company

SA Water is proud to deliver an important and essential service to 1.7 million customers every day. For more than 160 years, we have been working together with South Australians to ensure a reliable supply of safe, clean water and a dependable sewage system.

About the role

SA Water’s Tactical, Integrity and Reliability Team manages assets to support the business functions through the creation and optimisation of asset maintenance programs for all metro and regional assets. The team are responsible for delivering effective asset maintenance strategies and engineering solutions to ensure a world class service to our community.

With your tertiary qualification, preferably in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering, ability to engage stakeholders and communicate across all levels of the organisation and strong analytical skill set will see you deliver the requirements of the Reliability Engineer position.

This role reports to the Tactical, Integrity and Reliability Manager and is based in Adelaide, supporting the maintenance team around South Australia.

Along with this you will also be responsible for the following:

  • Provide specialist reliability in design, root cause investigation, defect elimination, reliability-based maintenance, condition-based maintenance, technical auditing, life cycle cost optimisation, reliability data analysis and risk for SA Water infrastructure to meet equipment availability and maintenance budget constraints.
  • Drive an increased awareness in the Design for Reliability (DfR) process through coordination of an effective DfR consultation and delivery plan with resources from Asset Management, Program/Project Management, WHS, Operations, Maintenance, Design and Construction to achieve optimal outcomes.
  • Ensure SA Water “Design for Reliability” process is incorporated into whole asset life cycle processes.
  • Provide the technical lead on Design for reliability matters for all engineering disciplines (i.e., mechanical, electrical, and civil).
  • Seek and initiate value add initiatives to embed reliability engineering throughout asset life cycles across the corporation.
  • Drive an increased awareness of reliability-based techniques and application across the corporation.
  • Ensure overall maintenance strategies shift from the reactive to proactive approach to minimise total cost of maintenance and operational risk.
  • Work effectively within the reliability discipline and engineering teams, with other technical engineering disciplines and across multi-disciplinary teams within the corporation and other partners.
  • Provide the timely, accurate, appropriate, and adequate information and documentation to all stakeholders with a focus on minimising delays and providing cost effective solutions.
  • Provide technical support into reliability and maintenance discipline forums and knowledge base across the corporation.
  • Conducts site audits to ensure compliance to reliability and maintenance standards.
  • Support the corporation to meet maintenance reliability compliance requirements within statutory, regulation, industry code of practice, Australian and International standards.
  • Ensure SA Water maintenance and reliability standards and guidelines are best for business solutions that meet holistic asset life cycle requirements, while providing cost effective, fit for purpose outcomes.
  • Educate asset management, capital delivery, engineering, operation teams, contractors, minor and major framework partners, Adelaide service delivery on SA Water maintenance and reliability requirements and standards.
  • Lead initiatives to improve the maturity of maintenance and reliability within the corporation.
  • Determine suitability of new, smart, and emerging reliability and maintenance techniques and recommend they are adopted by the corporation where benefits are identified.

About the Person

To be considered for this role you will need to have extensive experience in Maintenance Reliability, Mechanical or Electrical engineering qualifications, knowledge of engineering principals in a maintenance environment and strong written and verbal communication skills.

Key requirements of the role include:

  • Qualifications in Mechanical or Electrical engineering.
  • Post-graduate qualifications in Reliability Engineering or relevant experience.
  • Experience in reliability and maintenance engineering and condition monitoring techniques.
  • Good understanding of FMECA, RCM and RCA
  • Excellent computer literacy (including SQL and Access database).
  • Ability to accurately record, manage and analyse data electronically.
  • Understanding of works management systems and associated processes.
  • SA Water requires all workers to be double vaccinated against Covid 19, HEP A&B and Q fever.
  • Valid Driver’s Licence

If you have a passion to work within a diverse, customer-centred business, filled with passionate and self-motivated people, where fresh thinking is valued and innovation is embraced, we want to hear from you. If you relish working in an evolving environment, have a desire to work collaboratively amongst a wealth of talent, partake in rewarding work with a purpose in an exciting industry, SA Water as an organisation is a great place to be.

SA Water believe great outcomes for their customers are best delivered by a diverse and inclusive team that reflects our community. That's why SA Water encourage people seeking flexible working arrangements and from all backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, to apply and join the SA Water team

For a copy of the position description or for further information, please contact Daniel Jones, Recruitment Partner at Harrison McMillan via Daniel.jones@harrisonmcmillan.com.au or contact the office on 08 7071 7273 .

Please submit applications in Word format.

Closing date: 9am on the 6th of June 2022

title: Psychologist, Defence Force Recruiting
description:
What we do at Defence Force Recruiting

Defence Force Recruiting is a unique partnership between ManpowerGroup and the Australian Defence Force, to recruit Defence personnel for our Australian Navy, Army, and Air Force.

ManpowerGroup is extremely proud of the relationship it has with the Australian Defence Force, one that has stretched over almost two decades. This partnership is the largest of its kind, globally, with the Australian Defence Force the only Defence Force to outsource its entire recruitment process: right from the attraction of candidates, assessment of candidates (including medical, physical, and psychological), through to enlistment into any of the three services.

Defence Force Recruiting leverages the unique skills, knowledge, and life experience of Australian Defence Force (ADF) personnel and the outstanding individuals that make up ManpowerGroup’s team to achieve capability for the ADF.

IS THIS ROLE FOR YOU?

  • Are you a psychologist with clinical, organisational or generalist background, seeking experience in psychological and occupational assessments for one of Australia’s largest and most complex organisations?
  • Would you enjoy a role that primarily involves test interpretation, undertaking interviews, writing relevant reports and liaising with ADF personnel to provide your recommendations on a candidate’s suitability?
  • Would you like to support the ADF’s rapid workforce expansion to meet the Australian Government’s strategic goals?
  • Would you like to support the ADF in developing a happy, healthy and high performing workforce?
  • Would you like to undertake training to gain the required accreditation to perform ADF Occupational Suitability Assessments?
  • Would you like to learn how to assess individuals to ensure they have the resilience required to meet the demands they could face in an ADF environment?
  • Would you like to undertake job-person-fit assessments to ensure that individuals enlist/commission into roles that align with their strengths and interests?
  • Would you like to gain an understanding of how to assess individuals for specialist roles such as intelligence, officer/leadership, policing, security, Special Forces and submariner?
  • Would you like an operational role that involves your work being complete by the end of each day, with limited spill over to the next day, no worries to take home with you, and no work to build up while you are on leave?
  • Would you like to work in a close-knit, friendly, and professional team-environment where case consultation is encouraged, and CPD supported?

If the answers are YES, please read on…

To be successful in this role, there are a few things we are looking for:

  • Experience and full registration as a psychologist
  • Proven experience in test interpretation
  • Ability to meet deadlines in a dynamic and face-to-face environment
  • Solid computer literacy
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Strong organisational skills, time management and attention to detail
  • Professional verbal and written communication skills

If you don’t meet all of the above requirements – but believe you have something special you could bring to this role (or any other role across our team) – we still want to hear from you! Please continue with your application and we will be in touch.

What makes working at Defence Force Recruiting rewarding?

People first is our mantra. We are proud of the people that make up our diverse workforce: diverse in background, diverse in thinking, diverse in career ambitions and diverse in what they need from us as their employer. We know that great results for our client, the Australian Defence Force, would not be possible without our incredible team. That is why we focus so much of our efforts on making working at Defence Force Recruiting great.

Here are just a few of the benefits our people have access to:

  • Professional development programs (internal and external), and access to local and global online learning platforms
  • Wide-lensed flexibility offerings: we know one size doesn’t fit all and work with our people to meet their unique needs
  • Holistic approach to health and wellbeing initiatives
  • Opportunities to give back to our community, in a meaningful way
  • Reward and recognition programs focussed on the outstanding efforts of our people
  • Access to family and life friendly benefits program

There are many more things that make working at Defence Force Recruiting great – just reach out to our friendly team to find out more!

There are a few non-negotiables for all roles within our ManpowerGroup Defence Force Recruiting team. You must be an Australian Citizen as well as be able to obtain a security clearance. COVID-19 vaccination (in accordance with relevant State or Territory guidelines) is also a requirement to ensure the health and safety of our people, partner, and candidates.

ManpowerGroup is committed to being a Diversity Confident Recruiter and encourages applications from people from a diverse range of backgrounds, including people with a disability. Please indicate your preferred method of communication in your resume and please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments should you be contacted for an interview by contacting internal_recruitment@dfr.com.au .

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

title: SHE Project Delivery Lead
description:
At BAE Systems we are all systems go as we continue to drive innovation and seek passionate and talented people to join our business. We currently have a unique permanent full time opportunity for a highly experienced SHE Specialist / Project Delivery Lead, to act as an instrumental contributor in developing and maintaining a safety culture by providing advice, mentoring, coaching and best practice solutions to prevent incidents. This exciting opportunity will see you add value by delivering a Safety Differently approach throughout the BAE Systems business in conjunction with ensuring governance processes are also implemented.

What this opportunity will mean for you:

  • Purposeful work where your efforts are recognised in an environment where you can thrive
  • Joining an organisation that is passionate about developing some of the most impressive careers in the world
  • Industry-leading flexibility options to unlock the talent and diversity of every individual
  • Unique opportunities to contribute to programs of national significance whilst growing your skills
  • A strong safety culture, inclusive teams and work to be proud of, underpinned by a compelling set of values

About the Opportunity

This opportunity will predominantly support and influence key business programs and works collaboratively with the SHE Capability and Governance, and Health Wellbeing and Injury Management teams to deliver improvement initiatives aligned to the SHE strategy.

More specifically, you will:

  • Support the implementation, review and continuously develop in consultation with operational management and the SHE BP the Safety Differently program
  • Participate, collaborate and consult with leaders and teams to ensure they are engaged and aligned to SHE strategic priorities, and have the right tools to do their job, confidence, ability to manage SHE obligations and risks and drive the right behaviours
  • Support the implementation, review and continuously develop BAE Systems safety management system including risk assessments, safety work method statements (SWMS), risk registers, facilitate training and drive change programs
  • Establish and facilitate systematic approaches to hazard identification and risk assessments directed towards asset and operational lifecycle
  • Establish and support the development of the line of business Critical Control programs as part of targeted Significant Incident Fatality (SIF) reduction program
  • Manage site safety, health and environmental event response and reporting procedures concerning significant hazards, injuries, incidents to ensure accurate and timely response and data analysis
  • Lead or participate in formal investigations, specialist inspections and audits working with the SHE Capability and Governance Leads to ensure findings and actions address systematic improvement and control effectiveness while managing outcomes with key stakeholders
  • Facilitate the development of key learnings from local incidents and hazards and ensure they are communicated through the SHE Business Partner to enhance the organisations learning culture
  • Participate in compliance assurance activities in line with the SHE Strategy and business improvement plans to verify and validate the integrity of SHE risk controls
  • Liaise with line leaders on the safety aspects of plant and process modification, supply, operation, maintenance and training of PPE
  • Participate in continuous improvement and professional development

About you

As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you'll have:

  • Working experience in SHE in a similar role in a large and complex organisation
  • Project management or detailed involvement in delivery of cultural change programs
  • Comprehensive knowledge and understanding of relevant legislative, regulatory and compliance frameworks and governance requirements
  • Management of safety, health and environment in a high risk work environment (i.e. mining, construction, manufacturing)
  • Able to demonstrate understanding of SHE concepts and technical knowledge
  • Ability to understand and apply contemporary SHE practices including, but not limited to, Safety II, Safety Differently and Human and Organizational Performance
  • Ability to access, analyse and evaluate information to think critically, generate and evaluate complex ideas and inform SHE strategy and practice
  • Ability to apply critical thinking, problem solving, communication skills and judgment to complex SHE problems to generate innovative, practical solutions while taking into account legislation and industry/organisational standards
  • Ability to justify and prioritise proposed solutions while taking into account SHE principles, organisational, legal, industry and other relevant factors
  • Ability to interpret and tailor information to communicate to workplace, professional and regulatory audiences using appropriate communication strategies and formats including  reports for a range of audiences using appropriate data
  • Ability to use communication, engagement skills, including negotiation and conflict management skills, to initiate, promote and support change
  • Uses mentoring skills to develop SHE capability of the line of business management
  • Willingness and ability to travel to remote Radar locations
  • Preferable qualifications and memberships:
    • Minimum WHS Diploma
    • Tertiary Qualification in Safety or related discipline (Desired)
    • Lead ICAM Investigator
    • Certified Safety Professional ( AIHS/ IOSH)

About us

BAE Systems' advanced defence technology solutions protect people and national security, keeping critical information and infrastructure secure.  For more than 65 years we have searched for new ways to provide our customers in Australia with a competitive edge across air, land, sea, cyber, space and electronic domains.

In terms of our culture, it's safety focused and inclusive.  For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of our more than 4,100 employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. It also means providing a safe, family friendly, flexible and supportive place to work.  Join us.

Clearances

As a Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance.

Further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html

Applications should be addressed to: Lidia Morris, Talent Acquisition Specialist

Whilst applications must be submitted online, confidential enquiries are welcome via email: sinead.booth@baesystems.com

We welcome and strongly encourage applications from women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders for these opportunities.  An inclusive culture and an exciting, supportive career opportunity awaits.  We are also proud to be a WORK180 Endorsed Employer for Women. If you would like to know more information about how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives here: https://tinyurl.com/Work180BAE-Systems-Australia

To learn about other employment opportunities at BAE Systems, please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au

BAE Systems Australia will never request money from you during the recruitment process. Please be aware of scam messages asking for money for an administration fee, visa or similar. If you receive such a message please report it to Scam Watch www.scamwatch.gov.au/report-a-scam.

Job applications should only be submitted via the BAE Systems Australia website and not via email.  If you receive an email from BAE Systems that does not utilise "@baesystems.com " as the domain, it is not legitimate.  BAE Systems does not use gmail, aol, Hotmail or similar accounts.

title: Senior Patient Services Officer
description:
Do your life's best work! We are currently seeking expressions of interest for a full-time Senior Patient Services Officer to join our facilities based in Flinders Private Hospital, SA.

This is a hands-on role that provides day to day leadership of the patient services team and patient accounts, keeping the team motivated, engaged and on track to consistently deliver patient centric services within the Radiation Oncology practice

What you'll do:

  • Provide direction, supervision, support and recognition of staff activities and promote collaboration, cooperation and teamwork through effective leadership and management strategies.
  • Provide support, initiate and drive change strategies across the practice through the provision of data and leadership which supports both the vision and ethos for GenesisCare and the development of patient focussed change strategies, programs and initiatives
  • Be a champion for high level of patient services by meeting patient needs, maintaining patient service levels and monitoring and reacting to patient feedback
  • Having a clear understanding of the patient registration and billing systems and the related billing processes. Including, assisting with the patient accounts function, as required and during periods of leave.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with internal and external stakeholders and promote and support initiatives designed to improve clerical staff engagement
  • Display a strong commitment to developing others through implementing effective performance management and development processes and providing staff with ongoing feedback and performance coaching.
Who you are:

  • Demonstrated experience in managing and leading a team of 3 or more staff
  • Demonstrated ability to provide excellent customer service in a healthcare environment
  • Strong experience in medical administration and reception management
  • Strong management and communication skills, with the ability to liaise with and effectively influence staff & patients
  • Demonstrated understanding of and ability to provide excellent leadership in line with the organisation's values.
  • A collaborative and flexible approach to delivering exceptional patient centred services.
  • Willingness and ability to proactively implement continuous improvement and change initiatives.
  • Able to effectively and collaboratively solve problems as they arise.
  • High level Medical accounts processing skills including knowledge of Medicare, DVA and private health funds
  • Ability to use clinical administration systems, as well as Microsoft Office software for data analysis and reporting purposes.
  • Diploma of Medical Administration or equivalent experience - desired
What's in it for you:

  • Competitive salary package
  • Working hours between 7am - 5pm Monday to Friday
  • Access to a national network of Oncology Nurses and professionals
  • Work in an exciting new facility with like-minded professional colleagues
  • Ongoing opportunities for professional development to keep up to date with current clinical practices in a rapidly developing organisation
  • Work in a collaborative and friendly environment delivering outstanding outpatient care
Who we are:

We are 5000 highly trained healthcare professionals and support staff across Australia, the U.K., Spain, China and the United States, designing innovative treatments and care for people with cancer and heart disease.

Global care

Across the world, we have more than 440 centres to help us bring the right care to our patients. For radiation therapy, that includes 14 centres in the UK, 21 in Spain, 36 in Australia and 300 in the U.S. We also offer cardiology and sleep services at more than 80 locations across Australia. Every year our team sees more than 400,000 people globally.

People centricity is at the heart of what we do-whether that person is a patient, a referring doctor, a partner or someone in our team. We aim to build culture of 'care' that is patient focused, and performance driven. Our people promise is "do your life's best work, by always growing, having a profound human impact and making great things happen together." If you'd like to make a difference, join us at GenesisCare.
Covid-19:

In line with the Public Health Order, all GenesisCare employees are required to be vaccinated for COVID-19. To be eligible for consideration to perform work for GenesisCare, all recruits must provide evidence against COVID-19 and comply with the requirements of the Public Health Order prior to appointment.

title: Senior UX Researcher
description:
• Help bring our amazing products to life for both our consumers and customers
  • Open to location
  • Fixed term role for 12 months


The safety and wellbeing of our employees and potential employees are important to us. Our external candidates will interview via Zoom. Not only do we wish to protect the health and safety of our people, we want to assure candidates that there is no expectation from REA to meet face-to-face. A virtual interview will not adversely impact your application. If you have any questions or concerns, this can be discussed through the screening process.


We're REA

An Australian start-up success story we're quietly proud of.

From a garage in Melbourne to the global stage is an achievement we're humbled by. Our idea to put pictures of houses on the internet has blossomed since 1995, and we now have businesses across Australia, Asia, India and North America.

Our purpose is to change the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help on every step - whether that's buying, selling, renting or renovating.

Some of our brands include realestate.com.au, realcommercial.com.au, spacely.com.au, Flatmates.com.au, Proptrack.com, Smartline.com.au and Mortgage Choice.

We're proud to have been named one of Australia's Best Workplaces for 2021. This recognition is a great proof point of our unique and special culture. A culture that is driven by our people, our values, and our commitment to making a difference in the community.


What we're doing

The Senior UX Researcher is a member of the Design team which partners with Product and Engineering teams across the business to create amazing products and experiences for our consumers and customers. The world-class team designs experiences that connect people and property, through immersive, intuitive and personalised experiences, providing Australians with knowledge and confidence to make great property decisions. Their passion for innovation drives them to create products our consumers and customers love.

In this role, you'll be responsible for understanding user needs and uncovering deep insights that help bring amazing products to life that find product/market fit, growing our business and delighting our consumers and customers. To do this you'll be leveraging your extensive experience in research and user-centered design, applying insights to work towards the strategy and vision for a product, feature or experience utilising our design system, design principles and playbooks.

As a Senior UX Researcher, you will be tasked with leading discovering and validating REA user experiences. These research insights will inform our product management and design process and be core to delivering to REA industry-leading property experiences. Day to day you'll be working with cross-functional partners in Product Design, Product Management and Engineering, collaborating to deliver products to market fast, monitoring their performance and iterating on them. You'll constantly raise the bar of our experiences and how you work, bringing together stakeholders to align around our consumer and customer needs, advocating for new ideas of products and features that deliver on our strategy.

This role is about raising the bar using your craft, mentoring others and help creating amazing products and experiences.


A few things you'll be doing day to day:

  • Work collaboratively with Product Managers, Designers, Developers, UX Researchers, Data scientists, Marketing team and various other stakeholders to help shape and ship new products and features.
  • Lead research strategies to plans, formulate and undertake user research to discover problems, define solutions and validate concepts and prototypes with our consumers.
  • Design and facilitate workshops, user research activities, stakeholder interviews and research critique sessions.
  • Extensive experience leading lab-based user research, remote testing, a range of fidelity prototype testing, concept testing, contextual inquiry, survey design, competitive and comparative analysis, and other research methods. Applied research and testing on a variety of devices (desktop, mobile, tablet)
  • Strong understanding of strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during each product phase.
  • A strong grasp of quantitative data analysis and statistics, as part of mixed methods approaches.
  • Good knowledge of inclusive design practices and accessibility.
  • Good understanding of the design process and product management.
  • Present research insights and participate in providing best practice feedback and guidance in regular research critiques to ensure consistency and quality outcomes.


Who we're looking for

  • Someone with runs on the board 5+ years of experience practising design research, predominately qualitative approaches with standard methods and best practice processes.
  • An impressive background leading design research methodology, including facilitating workshops with stakeholders and/or customers and using various ideation techniques
  • Have a growth mindset to take on and give clear and constructive feedback.
  • Thrives in a fast-paced, high-energy environment, with an entrepreneurial ownership mentality.


But we don't just look for someone based on their skills and expertise. It's our connection, acceptance and genuine care for each other that makes REA a great place to work. That means you also need to be:

  • Savvy minded and have curiosity to think a little left of field / outside the box
  • A strong and creative communicator
  • Friendly, approachable and have good relationship management skills
  • An avid contributor to our inclusive culture - we celebrate different perspectives and all play an active role in creating a sense of belonging


The REA experience

The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we'll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We're committed to your development - both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously.


We offer:

  • A flexible working environment, meaning we strike the balance of what you need and what works for the business (and yes, our leaders fully understand the benefits of working flexibly)
  • A hybrid approach to the future of work - https://www.rea-group.com/about-us/news-and-insights/blog/rea-groups-evolution-of-hybrid-working/
  • Generous and flexible parental leave offering for primary and secondary carers
  • Summer Fridays - time back to focus on your wellness every Friday afternoon from December through to March
  • Support for your mental and physical health and wellbeing via our 'You Matter' Program
  • Because We Care program which includes volunteer leave and community grants, to ensure you have the opportunity to give back to your community
  • Hack Days for you to bring so you can bring your big ideas to life in a supportive learning environment
  • An additional day of leave just for your birthday


Oh, and by the way:

At REA we value diversity and inclusion in all forms. Gender, religion, ethnicity, LBTGIQ+, neurodiversity and so much more. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you've got the must-haves, dedication and enthusiasm to learn but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.

If you like the sound of us, then we think you should apply today. We're proud to be Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to respond to every applicant. While we're looking at your application, and preparing to come back to you with an update, why not get to know us a bit more through our various social channels?

title: Project Support Officer
description:
RTC Group is a highly experienced and leading provider of integrated services across Australia. Through trusted relationships we work closely with our customers to build and maintain infrastructure and facilities.

Our SA Facilities Maintenance division provides specialised skills in programmed & responsive maintenance, emergency repairs, disabled modification upgrades and vacant restorations. The team are also a leading provider of Property Assessment Surveys.

As part of this team, you will join a group who work together to deliver market-leading, safe, cost effective and environmentally friendly outcomes that exceed customer expectations.

Due to our exciting growth we are seeking an experienced and reliable Project Support Officer to be based out of our Salisbury North office . The successful candidate will be rewarded with competitive rates and a team environment.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • Contribute/support the continuous improvement of a project management framework and systems
  • Contribute/support to achieve project objectives and goals
  • Data analysis and reporting
  • Preparation of KPI reporting, both internally and externally
  • Project monitoring to ensure processes and procedures are implemented, maintained and reviewed.

The Successful Candidate:

  • Relevant qualification in Project Management or similar
  • Thrives in a fast-paced environment
  • Being part of the solution within the Team dynamics
  • Can work under pressure and unsupervised
  • Ability to learn and use new systems
  • Fantastic people skills
  • Organised and are comfortable working with (and creating) structures and processes
  • Excellent phone manner
  • Attention to detail
  • Outstanding communication both verbal and written

title: Parts Sales Coordinator
description:
The role:

If you are looking to join a high performing Distribution team, where you can build meaningful relationships with customers and drive continuous improvement, we would love to hear from you.

The primary focus of this role is Parts Sales Coordinator; ensuring compliance with parts and other company procedures, interpreting parts catalogues, managing stock inventory, generating monthly reports, organise telephone and counter parts orders and partake in general administration duties, however, within this team, we value continuous improvement so If you have a passion for this then, this could be a great opportunity for you.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Establish, develop and maintain positive customer relationships
  • Analyse existing/potential customer parts needs
  • Ensure the swift resolution of customer problems and complaints
  • Increase and maximize all parts sales opportunities through a high level of Customer Service, including stakeholder engagement with our dealer network and supply chain partners.
  • Assist to provide regular flow of inventory to ensure adequate, accurate and appropriate supply and guidelines are adhered to.
  • Provide Parts Interpreting services & support to Dealer network and internal departments

What you’ll need to succeed:

  • Proven experience in similar role
  • Detailed practical working knowledge of the operation of Agricultural machinery, tools and equipment
  • In-depth knowledge of Parts Departments and Supply Chain Analysis
  • Experience in freight ordering and supply of parts from overseas and local sources
  • Excellent data analysis skills, including but not limited to Microsoft Excel
  • Intermediate computer skills, inc proficient with Microsoft suites
  • Proven communication skills, both written and verbal

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Work / life balance
  • Career progression opportunities
  • Be apart of a Continuous improvement team
  • Rewarding and friendly work environment

Who are we?

McIntosh Distribution is part of the McIntosh Group, which was established in 1955.

A leading Australian machinery importer and wholesaler, McIntosh Distribution has an extensive network of approximately 70 dealers strategically located across Australia.

With a commitment to excellent customer service, McIntosh Distribution aims to provide farmers, growers and businesses with industry-leading equipment, service and after sales support.

What comes next?

Update your resume to demonstrate your current experience and hit “Apply for this job” today.

title: EL1 Assistant Director – Policy – Environmental markets development
company: Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment
description:
Provide specialist policy and program advice and contribute to the delivery of innovative initiatives which increase Australia’s resilience to climate change.

Opportunities and Challenges

Join one of our high-performing and dedicated teams navigating uncharted territories in policy and program design.

Our ultimate goal is to increase the resilience of Australia’s natural environment and the agricultural sector to climate change.

The Climate Adaption & Resilience Division has multiple opportunities for experienced policy professionals in a range of impactful areas including:

  • Agricultural Stewardship - leading the development of the Australian Government’s Agriculture Biodiversity Stewardship package, developing credible market approaches for farmers to gain private investment in farm biodiversity services.
  • Financing Solutions for Nature team - developing frontier policy initiatives to increase private investment in Australia’s natural capital by helping the finance sector to recognise, value and invest in natural capital.
  • Environmental Markets - facilitating a private market through which farmers can sell the benefits of biodiversity projects to corporations and private investors who wish to support environmental outcomes


The Role

As a key advisor and leader in the Climate Adaption and Resilience Division, you will provide specialist policy and program advice to help establish these innovative initiatives and drive policy development.

Responsibilities include:

  • Leading a team to deliver high quality, accurate and consistent analysis and policy advice including to the minister and senior executives
  • Leading aspects of policy and program development, planning and project management
  • Contributing to the strategic direction of the work area through planning and identifying and managing risks

To learn more about the opportunity, please review the position description.

Erecruit job reference: 2022/2365

Your Background & Experience


We welcome individuals with a diverse range of skills, knowledge and experiences – both from in and outside government.

You will need to demonstrate:

  • Experience in policy development, and/or program development and delivery
  • Well-developed interpersonal skills and the ability to develop productive working relationships
  • Familiarity with any of the following will be well regarded: environmental markets, sustainable finance, legislative development and/or data analysis and integration/ management

The following areas of formal study will be highly regarded:

  • Public policy
  • Economics/ banking/ finance
  • Law
  • Natural resource management/ economics
  • Data analytics/ integration
  • Science

Work With Us

The work we do today, matters for tomorrow. Join the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment (DAWE) and enjoy:

  • Access to training and development
  • Health and wellbeing focused culture
  • Permanent full-time or part-time hours
  • Salary: $112,294 - $120,780 + Super

We are Canberra based however we are open to discussing flexible working arrangements, including working remotely from other locations in Australia. For further information please speak with the contact officer prior to submitting your application.

To be eligible for employment with the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment you must be an Australian citizen.

How to apply

For more details on how to apply, please click the appropriate link below.

Alternatively for a discussion regarding this role please contact:

Name:  Jeremy Thomas

Phone number: 02 5156 5721

Email address: Jeremy.thomas@agriculture.gov.au

Flexible employment arrangements are available with the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment

title: C++ Software Engineer
description:
Ever wondered why you think differently? Why you seek to understand ‘how does it work’ and ‘what if’ when others simply accept what is? Do you get excited at the prospect of solving complex problems? Does your curiosity to ‘get in and understand’, to test, to try this and that, to evaluate, to make things easier and decisions better, drive the person you are at work and at home?

Is this who you are?

If it is…you’ve found a team of people just like you…a team of people who believe no problem is too big. A team of people that despite sharing the same passion for finding answers, come from diverse backgrounds and contribute a variety of skills and experiences. We are a team of exceptional thinkers, solving complex problems and delivering unparalleled capability to the Australian defence and aviation sectors.

We use our combined skills and experiences in the Defence sector to help protect the Australian way of life, to help government make better decisions and to save lives through advanced mission management systems and tactical support applications.

Our team, founded in 1992, headquartered in Adelaide and with a presence across Australia and the UK, put all the pieces together to deliver unparalleled capability to the Australian defence and aviation sectors.

How will you contribute?

  • You will utilise C++20, Linux, and your preferred editor/IDE within a supportive team of 20 dedicated Software Engineers
  • Create software solutions for mission critical, complex systems that function in challenging environments
  • Assist with architectural support and subsystem design
  • Create interactive visualisation and data analysis tools
  • Design and implement interfaces for data exchange with established systems

Skills you will bring:

  • A passionate pursuit of a clean, modern well-maintained codebase
  • 3rd party device integration
  • Data persistence and archiving
  • Audio/video data acquisition, storage & streaming
  • Scene-graph based interactive displays, GIS data processing and exploitation
  • Turnkey operations: operating system tailoring and integration
  • Git, peer code review, CI/CD, profilers
  • GUI design and development – QT or GDK

Are you curious?

The successful candidate will be required to have Australian Citizenship and obtain a National Police Check. This role requires eligibility for Australian Defence Security Clearance. Initial enquiries can be directed to Bruce Jacobssen on 0433 087 759 .

title: Engagement and Delivery Officer – Workforce Australia
company: Department of Education, Skills and Employment
description:
Position Summary

As an Engagement and Delivery Officer in the South Australian State Office, you will work as part of a flexible delivery team involved in monitoring and managing contract performance, implementing labour market strategies, contributing to regional place-based projects, and representing and engaging across the Department, with external stakeholders and contracted providers, to collaboratively advance the Department's business activities. You will also contribute to policy development, local intelligence gathering and program design and be required to undertake work that is complex in nature, and work under limited direction with the opportunity for reasonable autonomy and accountability.

Your achievements will contribute substantially to government policy measures that sustain broader government economic performance, employment, skills, education, and social goals. You will demonstrate a high level of productivity, resourcefulness, initiative, and flexibility to deliver results, as well as collaborate effectively with your colleagues and staff.

Duties and Responsibilities

Reporting to a Team Leader, the responsibilities of the Engagement and Delivery Officer APS Level 6 may include:

  • Support the delivery of employment programs in South Australia by performing a range of program assurance, contract management and stakeholder engagement activities.
  • Research and interpret complex program guidelines and policies to provide advice and guidance to internal and external stakeholders.
  • Undertake data analysis to support a range of contract management duties such as performance assessments and compliance activities.
  • Communicate effectively with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders, including employment services providers, local, state and commonwealth public officers, employers, and other relevant parties.
  • Draft a range of documents tailored to the audience.
  • Work under limited supervision to manage competing priorities.
  • Collaborate in a team environment and contribute to the activities of the South Australian State Office.
  • Demonstrate leadership qualities at level.

Qualifications and Education

  • Relevant tertiary qualifications in Political Science and Policy, Human Society and Welfare, Behavioural Science, Economics, Business and Management, and / or Project Management desirable.

Capabilities

We are seeking enthusiastic, curious, and motivated individuals with the following skills and capabilities:

  • An understanding of contemporary labour market challenges, including those that relate to South Australia, and awareness of education, skills and employment policy and programs and/or experience will be favourably regarded.
  • Leadership abilities, including the ability to coach staff to drive quality outputs, accountability of work areas, and contribute to issues management.
  • Demonstrate analytical skills and the ability to interpret data, program guidelines and contractual frameworks correctly to resolve complex issues.
  • The ability to build positive working relationships with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders and to represent the department professionally at meetings and events, both virtually and in person.
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills and the ability to provide clear and accurate advice to stakeholders including providers, colleagues, and managers.
  • Initiative, flexibility, and the capacity to adapt to change to meet current and future business priorities and an ability to assist other team members to adapt to change.

Additional Information: Some travel, including overnight travel, will be required. Candidate must hold a valid Driver’s licence.

For further information please review the job information pack and position description available here .

Job Reference Number: 22/0524 EXT Engagement and Delivery Officer

title: Application Support Specialist
description:
Our client is offering a permanent role for an Application Support Specialist to join their tenured and friendly team. The role will be based in Brisbane but remote working is an option for the candidate.

What a day looks like:

  • General 2nd and 3rd level support and troubleshooting of internal and external sites consisting of Oracle and SQL Server databases, IIS Websites and APIs, service bus, .NET apps, Delphi apps, F5s, SAP B1, SharePoint.
  • Website and Server Auditing
  • Clean up servers in legacy data centres
  • Reporting from Oracle and SQL Server data sources
  • Powershell scripting for administrative and discovery tasks

Requirements (Flexible)

  • Proven skills/experience in web administration - c#, .net, javascript
  • Service Now
  • Good understanding of SSL certificates
  • 5 + years experience in application support
  • Preferable development admin background
  • Experience in either MSSQL or PLSQL
  • Proficient understanding of SharePoint
  • Knowledgeable in Networking, Netscaller and Windows OS
  • PowerShell scripting
  • Proficient with monitoring, availability, diagnostic and data analysis tools such as SEQ, SCOM – APM / Application Diagnostics and Pingdom

Benefits

  • Globally recognised brand
  • Experienced and tenured team
  • Flexible working benefits
  • Diverse and interesting work
  • Opportunity to increase salary with on-call roster
  • Learn and be exposed to a wide array of technologies across infrastructure, security, applications and development
  • Professional development

If this sounds like an interesting role to you, please click Apply and our Senior Consultant (Chris Brydon) will get in touch with you.

·

title: Finance Officer
description:
About the EPA
The Environment Protection Authority (EPA) is South Australia’s independent environment protection regulator. We protect, restore and enhance the environment through the risk-based regulation of pollution, waste, noise and radiation. We work closely with industry, the community and government to protect our unique natural environment while supporting economic growth and improving wellbeing.

Role Detail
We are seeking an enthusiastic person with a commitment to service excellence to join our small team that provides accounting services to the EPA. The primary purpose of the role is to contribute to effective budget management and financial reporting.

What We Are Looking For
To be successful in the role you will have:

  • Excellent communication and engagement skills, with strong attention to detail
  • Experience, enthusiasm and self-motivation in providing financial services, data analysis and interpretation
  • Be able to identify opportunities for process improvements
  • Demonstrated experience using Excel, COGNOS (or similar software package)
  • Knowledge of Accounting principles and processes
  • Experience of working in a government or council based Finance team

Essential Qualifications
Diploma in Accounting or studying a degree in Accounting or closely related discipline or or a minimum of 5 years' experience of working in a Finance team.

Special Conditions

title: Finance Officer
description:
About the EPA
The Environment Protection Authority (EPA) is South Australia’s independent environment protection regulator. We protect, restore and enhance the environment through the risk-based regulation of pollution, waste, noise and radiation. We work closely with industry, the community and government to protect our unique natural environment while supporting economic growth and improving wellbeing.

Role Detail
We are seeking an enthusiastic person with a commitment to service excellence to join our small team that provides accounting services to the EPA. The primary purpose of the role is to contribute to effective budget management and financial reporting.

What We Are Looking For
To be successful in the role you will have:

  • Excellent communication and engagement skills, with strong attention to detail
  • Experience, enthusiasm and self-motivation in providing financial services, data analysis and interpretation
  • Be able to identify opportunities for process improvements
  • Demonstrated experience using Excel, COGNOS (or similar software package)
  • Knowledge of Accounting principles and processes
  • Experience of working in a government or council based Finance team

Essential Qualifications
Diploma in Accounting or studying a degree in Accounting or closely related discipline or or a minimum of 5 years' experience of working in a Finance team.

Special Conditions
This is a temporary role available for up to 13 months.

Enquiries
Gabrielle Jansen
Principal Accountant
Phone Enquiries: 8124 4208
Email Enquiries: gabrielle.jansen@sa.gov.au

Applications To
EPAApply@sa.gov.au (through IWorkForSA website)
