title: Learning and Development Coordinator/Project Officer
description:
Due to an internal promotion, we currently have an exciting opportunity for an experienced L&D Coordinator with strong coordination and administration skills, proven experience and prowess in using Learning Management systems (LMS) and a strong customer experience focus to form an integral part of our dynamic, professional and friendly team where you will support and make a different to our workforce.

The career development, retention and talent management of our employees has been identified as a focus for the organisation, so this unique opportunity will play a key role in ensuring that our L&D programs and systems align to and meet the needs of employees and the organisation into the future.

The City of Salisbury is a local government entity and encompasses an area of 158km2. We are a community focused organisation, providing essential services to residents and visitors, in a dynamic and flexible working environment.

We are a progressive, sustainable and connected community, where we celebrate our employee's and community's diversity and where people are valued and feel safe, included, connected and have a sense of belonging.

Our values (ReACH) encompass Respect, Accountability, Collaboration and Helpfulness. Do these align with your desire to work in a team-based environment, delivering projects for the benefit of the community while also liaising with a wide variety of stakeholders?

The role:

Reporting to the Manager People and Culture this anchor role requires a self-motivated and systems focussed individual who likes to hit the ground running and who is proactive with attention to detail.

The main objectives of this diverse role are:

  • Coordinate our suite of compliance, personal, professional and leadership development training activities.
  • Coordinate forward planning of Learning and Development activities, staff events and programs and other People & Culture programs; aligning to the strategy and direction of Council.
  • Monitor, analyse, evaluate and report on Corporate training activities and identify gaps where relevant with regards to future opportunities.
  • Maintain Learning Management System (LMS) data, ensuring that record keeping and reporting is accurate, effective and timely and producing reports as required.
  • Working closely with the People and Culture and Business Transformation teams to implement changes to our L&D function and the LMS and maintain carriage of day to day functionality of relevant processes.

Skills, Knowledge, Experience:

To be successful to excel in this role you will have:

  • Demonstrated sound knowledge of operational methods/ work activities in administering and reporting of learning and development programs.
  • Demonstrated experience coordinating and managing events and functions.
  • Demonstrated research skills in relation to identification of training providers.
  • Knowledge of Learning Management systems, evaluations and data analysis.
  • Ability to analyse, review, and report on data.
  • Demonstrated initiative to plan and organise work.
  • Excellent organisation and time management skills, including ability to meet deadlines. prioritise, plan, coordinate and organise a diverse range of administrative support activities.
  • Certificate qualification in Training and Assessment or Human Resources or proven experience in a L&D Coordinator role.

What's in it for you?

Ability to become part of a dedicated team, owning key tasks and driving an exceptional community experience through internal change and support, with the flexibility to manage what's important through an excellent work life balance and an employer committed to your professional development and career.

This is a great opportunity to bring your skills and experience to support us to reshape L&D within the City of Salisbury.

Further information is available by accessing the Position Description .

Specific enquiries should be directed to Bronwen Fisher, Human Resources Business Partner - L&D on 0419 158 249

Applications close 9.00 am, Monday 23 May 2022.

title: Total Equipment Strategy Lead
description:
Use your technical skillset to create operational improvements through developing new maintenance strategies

In conjunction with our client, and our commitment to achieving a diverse workforce, we strongly encourage applications from Females, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. Hays are an equal opportunity employer and working in accordance with our client to achieve equality under the Equal Opportunity Act 1984 WA Legislation (section 13).


Your new company
Our client is among the world's top producers of major commodities including iron ore, metallurgical coal, copper and uranium. They extract and process minerals, oil and gas from its production operations located primarily in Australia and the Americas.

Your new role
You will be part of a team designed to improve safety, reduce maintenance costs and increase production through the identification and delivery of maintenance improvement projects and the deployment of best practise maintenance strategies.

The TES Lead is responsible for leading Total Equipment Strategy projects to deliver safety, productivity and maintenance cost improvements within Mobile, Fixed Plant and Rail maintenance departments across BHP.

Your Main Accountabilities include:

  • Build and Lead a multidisciplinary team with strong technical competencies in delivering maintenance improvement projects.
  • Engage and manage a large and diverse set of project stakeholders to encourage team collaboration and effective project reporting.
  • Project Management including creating project scopes and delivery specifications, tendering work packages to external vendors, Identifying risk and mitigation strategies and sign off of deliverables.


What you'll need to succeed

  • Experience leading technical teams.
  • Experience managing projects, including budgeting and scheduling (Microsoft Project).
  • Ability to multi-task, solve problems and meet deadlines under pressure.
  • Ability to identify project risks and implement mitigation strategies.
  • Basic understanding of mining equipment or heavy machinery.
  • Basic understand of equipment maintenance and reliability.
  • Good awareness of site safety culture/practices (some site experience desirable).
  • Advanced workshop facilitation, public speaking and presentation abilities.
  • Negotiation, conflict resolution and mediation skills.
  • The ability to interpret and visualise data and trends and provide guidance to data analysis teams.
  • Experience in maintenance and reliability improvement, including defect elimination, Reliability Centred Maintenance (RCM) and random delay analysis.
  • Experience working in either Mobile, Fixed Plant or Rail maintenance departments would be ideal but not essential
  • Experience in establishing workflows and engineering discipline.

Before applying, it is essential that

  • You are based in Australia and have full working rights and willing to live or commute to South Australia at your own cost
  • You are double vaccinated for COVID-19 in order to be considered for the role due to company mandates


What you'll get in return

You will be a key member of a program that sits within in the company's maintenance and engineering centre of excellence which is a global function that supports maintenance and engineering teams to exceptional performance long into the future of the company.

This role comes with a competitive pay rate that will be negotiated at shortlist stage. If you are set up as a Pty Ltd company, options to engage you through your ABN are also available.

Roster will be a 5/2 with occasional site visits to be expected.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, call Karl Edgar or Everett Cormack at Hays on (08) 7221 4128

If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.


SA Licence number : LHS 297508

title: Environmental Consultants (Various Positions) - Impact Assessment & Permitting
description:
The Opportunity

AECOM’s pipeline of work continues to grow and as a result, we are seeking applications from experienced Environmental Planners / Engineers / Scientists to join our Impact Assessment and Permitting team in Adelaide to support existing projects and pursue the exciting opportunities ahead.

This is a fantastic opportunity for technical growth, working across a diverse range of environments both in South Australia, Victoria and other regions across Australia. You will work amongst a team of peers and alongside our diverse range of clients on an array of high profile, major projects predominantly focused on transport, infrastructure, defence and renewables with a potential future across a range of sectors. As part of a multi-disciplinary organisation, this role will see you collaborating with other disciplines, giving you wider exposure and understanding.

AECOM provides a great place to work where we place a high priority on a fun and engaging work environment offering career development and mentoring as well as social and wellbeing opportunities. You will be working with driven professionals who are passionate, smart, creative, and quirky but proud to be part of a company that is dedicated to delivering a better world. Our Freedom to Grow program offers potential flexibility to the preferred candidate to partially work remotely and/or from home.

If you are looking to take the next step in your career, or you are coming from another city to establish yourself in Adelaide – AECOM will support you in deepening your technical expertise and growth potential whilst allowing you to enjoy the benefits of Australia’s most liveable city.

Key roles for our Environmental team include:

  • Principal Environmental Planner / Engineer / Scientist

As a principal, you will have strong environmental advisory and impact assessment experience, a detailed legislative understanding and an excellent industry reputation. Your strong commercial acumen and emotional intelligence will help you to develop and maintain positive relationships to enhance client retention and growth, while you draw on your skills to effectively manage resources, timelines, quality and budgets. You will lead junior team members through work activities by providing technical and operational guidance and support.

  • Senior Environmental Planner / Engineer / Scientist

As an experienced environmental professional, you will prepare and step up to manage timely and high-quality environmental impact assessments, constraints analyses, strategic assessments, and environmental management plans and assist in the organisation of resources, budgets, and timelines for the management of these projects. You will develop your skills by working collaboratively to prepare advice, reports, and proposals to clients, and develop effective relationships with key stakeholders to ensure projects are delivered successfully. You will also be responsible for key project-related tasks as required, which may include studies and assessments, data analysis, technical writing, and presentations.

  • Professional Environmental Planner / Engineer / Scientist

As a professional within the team, you will have the opportunity to learn first-hand from our in-house senior advisors and technical leaders. You will work collaboratively to prepare and manage timely and high-quality environmental impact assessments, constraints analyses, strategic assessments and environmental management plans, verifying that construction teams are implementing as planned. You will assist in the organisation of resources, budgets and timelines for the management of these projects where needed and to develop effective relationships with our clients, in-house design teams and technical specialists to ensure projects are delivered successfully.

About You

Ideally, you will have:

  • Relevant years post-graduate experience in impact assessment, ideally in a consulting environment
  • Bachelor’s degree in an appropriate discipline
  • Strong client focus, high level of motivation and dedication and the ability work well in a team environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Well-developed organisational and time management skills
  • A keen interest in further developing your existing skillset but also broadening your experience across a wide range of projects.

Benefits

AECOM is a place where you can maximize your innovative thinking and collaborate with a diverse range of highly intelligent and talented people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, transformational, and iconic projects.

​​​​We're an Equal Opportunity Employer and we've committed to creating a culture that embraces flexibility for all team members. We provide a diverse and inclusive work environment and offer many benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing.

  • Flexible start and finish times, working from home, part-time and job share options
  • Working from Home Tool Kits + Mobile Phone
  • State of the art, modern and contemporary offices
  • Paid Parental and Partner Leave
  • Purchased additional annual leave + salary packaging
  • Corporate Employee discounts from up to 400 retailers
  • Wellbeing benefits e.g., vaccinations, health insurance discounts
  • Employee stock purchase plans
  • Professional memberships
  • Professional and technical development opportunities.

AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or recruitment agencies. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM and in the absence of a signed Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any recruitment fee.

title: Case Navigator (Case Manager)
description:
Are you passionate about ensuring positive outcomes for people experiencing homelessness?  Are you willing to be challenged by your role?

How you will make a difference

As a Case Navigator (Case Manager), you will support clients on a longer term basis, to address the life issues that have caused and perpetuated their homelessness. This will be achieved through housing, social engagement, education, employment, skill development and improved wellbeing.

This position will be offered on a full time, fixed term contract until 30 December 2022.

About you
We are seeking applications from experienced case managers who understand the importance of confidentiality and information sharing guidelines. Your ability to build rapport and work in a client-centred way is essential for this role. You must have previous experience in the development and maintenance of case plans and be willing to work in a collaborative, multi-disciplinary team. Your high quality client records and case notes will also capture appropriate statistical data for contribution to research, needs assessment and data analysis.

Tertiary qualifications in the social services field are highly desirable. Knowledge of, or experience in the issues facing people at risk of or experiencing homelessness, along with an understanding of homelessness services will set you in good stead to succeed in this role.

You must have, or be willing to obtain a satisfactory National Police Clearance and Working with Children Check and hold a valid driver’s license.

Full verifiable vaccination against COVID-19 (including booster) or an approved medical exemption is a requirement for all Hutt St Centre employees and volunteers.

What we can offer

  • Passionate caring team who are united in our purpose to end homelessness
  • An additional leave day
  • A focus on wellbeing
  • Increase your take-home pay by salary packaging

How to apply
If you would like further information about this rewarding opportunity, please contact Tameka Thompson, Aspire Program Manager or Alicia Hassan, People and Culture Advisor on 8418 2500 .

A copy of the position description can be requested by emailing work@huttstcentre.org.au

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

title: Marketing Assistant
description:
Would you like to join a thriving iconic South Australian business?

Benson Radiology is an industry leader in the field of medical imaging. We celebrate over 60 years of providing services to the South Australian community and remain owned and operated by radiologist partners. Now with 25 branches and more than 700 staff, an exciting opportunity is available for an experienced Marketing Assistant to join our established and supportive marketing team.

Reporting to the General Manager - Marketing your role will be responsible for helping the marketing team in fostering the Practice’s relationships with key stakeholders, managing the external perception of the Benson Radiology brand and our position in the market, and driving the growth of the Practice’s examination numbers and revenue.

About the role

You will be passionate about working together to provide a high quality service for our patients and referrers. Your strong teamwork and ability to develop constructive working relationships with your key stakeholders will be essential in this role.

Your key responsibilities are to:

  • Proactively assisting in the management of the Practice’s marketing materials and liaison with suppliers
  • Managing the Practice’s website and other digital assets
  • Management of sponsor obligations and coordination of Practice events and hosting
  • Play a lead role in Business Intelligence data analysis and reporting
  • Coordinate the Practice customer surveying process
  • Providing support to the marketing team to ensure efficient implementation of marketing activity
  • Working closely and collaboratively with our branches and staff to ensure a common understanding of the marketing objectives and high level of internal service.

You will have:

  • First and foremost, an unwavering team focus and genuine want to contribute to the marketing team’s collective goals
  • An outgoing personality and the ability to build and maintain mutually beneficial working relationships (both internally and externally)
  • Strong organisational and time management skills
  • Understanding of the Microsoft Office and Adobe suites
  • Experience with Electronic Direct Marketing and management of social media assets
  • Good writing skills and an attention to detail
  • High levels of confidentiality
  • A professional presentation

If this sounds like you, please use the “apply now” button and attach your cover letter and resume in strict confidence.

For a confidential discussion regarding the role, please contact Claudette or Sharon on 08 8394 4910 .

To find out more about our practice please visit our website: https://bensonradiology.com.au/

title: Senior Learning & Capability Specialist
description:
• Key role as Subject Matter Expert
  • Dynamic ASX Listed Energy company
  • Competitive package and benefits

Beach Energy is looking for an experienced Learning & Capability Specialist to work with our technical, office and site-based teams to assess and elevate organisational capability.

Can you translate the organisational business objectives and diagnostics into contemporary learning frameworks for our people to reach their potential and remain compliant in role? Can you connect to our site-based teams and senior leadership to implement competency frameworks, facilitate training programs, or find innovative ways to ensure our teams have access to the right development opportunities? If so, then this is the opportunity for you.

About the Role

As key member of the Organisational Development function, your role is in a team who leads Diversity, Inclusion, Wellbeing, Resourcing, Graduate and Apprentice Pathways, Talent and Succession programs and the training learning and development specialist area. Our team whilst small, will work with you to deliver together as One Beach Team.

The Beach learning team has in place a matured Learning Management System (SuccessFactors) and contemporary online offerings linked to technical or professional development plans and goals.

The opportunity for this role is to focus on using SuccessFactors or other diagnostic tools to build a two-year training needs analysis plan and lead multiple specialist learning projects that support site-based competency matrices, as aligned to the organisational strategy and employee career goals.

This role relies on your lateral thinking and the use of factual data to support tapping into your creative side for solutions on design and facilitation.

Key responsibilities will include:

  • Lead multiple learning projects to support site and office-based employees.
  • Design and facilitate high-quality, contemporary learning experiences for Beach employees, applying best practise adult learning design principles.
  • Lead the development of training needs analysis, training calendar and its successful deployment to the organisation.
  • Creating and identifying learning course content that enhances retention and builds the capability of leadership and technical progression for Beach employee careers.
  • Facilitating regular training review meetings with technical discipline leads, General Managers or Executives to forecast training requirements.
  • Maximising the potential of SuccessFactors, (or other Learning Management System), modules to support our learner experience and drive continuously improved user experience.
  • Building key stakeholder relationships as part of diagnosing capability requirements and providing OD service offerings to the business.
  • Undertaking employee and organisational data analysis as part of determining longer term strategic learning needs.
  • Maintain existing competency frameworks per discipline and govern the automation of those moving to SuccessFactors.
  • Partner with your Human Resources team to consult with employees on learning opportunities.
  • Build strong relationships and industry partnerships with external bodies.

About You

We operate in a fast-paced dynamic environment, so you will have the ability to prioritise, build strong stakeholder relationships at all levels and anticipate the needs of the business. You will be a natural problem solver, and keen analyst, and an engaging facilitator.

  • Significant experience as a Learning designer, creation of training needs analysis and competency matrices.
  • Ability to think critically, analyse, and interpret complex data and data structures.
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to problem solve complex scenarios including the identification of root causes and recommendation for corrective / preventative action.
  • Demonstrated experience with relevant software packages including Learning Management Systems (LMS) such as SuccessFactors.
  • Relevant tertiary qualification in Business (Human Resources) or Adult Learning or equivalent with a minimum of 10 years of experience in a learning and development function in a multi-disciplinary organisation.
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills.
  • Proven ability to build highly effective consultative and collaborative relationships.
  • Experience designing or curating content for a variety of audiences including front line employees and leaders as well as diverse learners.
  • Previous experience with SuccessFactors (or other LMS), Articulate, Excel and PowerBI.
  • Demonstrated ability to identify organisational learning needs and develop strategies and associated plans.
  • Demonstrated experience in the development, implementation, and evaluation of effective and contemporary learning programs.
  • Proven ability to collaborate and consult to obtain relevant information from subject matter experts.

About Us

Beach Energy is a proud South Australian, Energy exploration and production company headquartered in Adelaide. For more than 60 years, Beach has operated onshore and offshore, oil and natural gas production across South Australia, Western Australia, Victoria, and New Zealand.

We seek to deliver long-term value to our shareholders, and focus on the safety of our people, their work environment, and the sustainability of our practices and environment we work in.

Working with Beach, you will make a difference in the delivery of key oil and gas projects within a growth organisation.

At Beach our values govern our decisions and interactions. Our values are Safety, Creativity, Respect, Integrity, Performance and Teamwork .

How to Apply

Beach is committed to improving gender diversity and Indigenous participation; we encourage all applications.

Please submit your cover letter and updated CV by 24 May 2022.

For this opportunity you must be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident.

To keep our community safe, candidates are required to comply with COVID related state specific public health orders.

title: WHSE Systems and Governance Advisor
description:
ASC is Australia’s only established sovereign submarine company.  Our team of leading, submarine platform engineers, trades and professionals are committed to the delivery of an agile and potent submarine capability for the Royal Australian Navy.

About the Opportunity:

A newly created role within the WHSE space, the WHSE Systems and Governance Advisor will be responsible for supporting the design and development of industry-leading WHSE frameworks, systems and processes to support delivery of the overall WHSE strategy.

The WHSE Systems and Governance Advisor will support the continuous improvement effort from a reporting, process and system perspective in accordance with the WHSE strategy. This role will also support with our System vendor relationships and design improvements to reduce information overlap in WHSE systems ensuring governance and compliance outcomes are met. Candidates will also be considered by their can-do attitude and their willingness and passion to learn WHSE and not necessarily their years of experience within the field.

Responsibilities:

  • Acting as an advisor, coach and facilitator this role will support collaboration with the broader WHSE function
  • Assist in building a WHSE coaching capability and capacity
  • Reviewing WHSE workflows to ensure efficient and effective WHSE processes are aligned to strategic WHSE outcomes
  • Support and contribute to a positive people culture that values continuous improvement and support design, development and review of systems, processes and procedures in line with the Company’s focus on ‘Lean’ thinking

About you:

  • Relevant tertiary qualifications in workplace health and safety management, environmental science, engineering or equivalent and/or
  • Up to 5 years of experience in a similar role or senior system role
  • Desire to expand knowledge of WHSE
  • Understanding of WHSE legislations and management systems
  • Ability to problem solve and apply analytical thinking
  • Demonstrate strong written and verbal communication

Desirable competencies and experiences

  • Superior comprehension of Work Health and Safety and Environment Legislation and application of relevant standards
  • Experience in data analysis, workflow design and governance frameworks
  • Strong Microsoft Office skills (particularly MS Project and MS Excel)
  • Demonstrate strong ability to collaborate with a whole of team approach
  • Demonstrate high level of integrity and resilience

If you would like to be considered for this opportunity and secure yourself a promising future with an industry leader with long term career prospects and exciting career opportunities, please submit your application by applying online.

Eligibility and Requirements

The successful candidate must provide ASC with a current National Police Clearance prior as well as be eligible for an Australian Defence Security Clearance.  Access protected US Defence Technology will be taken into account in assessing an applicant's suitability for this role. [link removed]

ASC also requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to ensure the safety and wellbeing of our people. If you are applying for a role at ASC please consider this new requirement when submitting your application. ASC will also adhere to any relevant health directives that may be made that affects our workforce.

About our offer

We offer more than just a challenging and rewarding career.  We have put together a range of programs, initiatives and benefits that help empower our employees to reach their personal and professional goals to ensure their career with us is both challenging and rewarding.

  • Staff training and leadership development programs
  • Additional 2 weeks of leave
  • Paid parental leave
  • Salary sacrificing options
  • Paid defence reservist leave
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Onsite cafeteria & parking

About ASC

With more than 1,300 employees based at two world-class facilities in South Australia and Western Australia, ASC has the expertise and resources unparalleled within Australia’s defence industry.

At ASC we not only offer challenging and rewarding work on Australia’s Collins Class submarines, we provide programs, initiatives and benefits that ensure our people reach their true potential.

After 35 years building Australia’s submarine industrial base, ASC is now diversifying our business activities, forging new partnerships and initiatives and helping to deliver successful submarine programs in Australia, Europe and North America.

The opportunities are endless, and it has never been a more exciting time to come on board.

ASC is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunities employer that provides an environment that encourages diversity and inclusion in all of its forms.

title: advanced munitions Materials Chemist / Chemical Engineer
description:
• $ Based on Experience
  • Australian Citizenship essential

Your Next Employer...

You'll be working with the R&D department for the Department of Defence (Defence Science Technology Group, DTSG) in Edinburgh.

The Role...

This role will be focused on providing technical support in the development of advanced munitions with Defence. The role is a 24 month full time contract and will give you the opportunity to work in a state of the art environment and gain excellent exposure for your career.

The Major Responsibilities of your role will include:

  • Set-up test equipment for laboratory activities;
  • General upkeep of test and laboratory facilities;
  • Prepare risk assessments and standard operating procedures for facilities and processes;
  • Liaise with workshop staff as required to prepare hardware and materials for testing;
  • Characterise explosive formulations for their chemical, sensitiveness and mechanical properties;
  • Obtain quotes for laboratory supplies or other consumables
  • Data analysis

You Will Need...

  • Tertiary Level Qualifications in Chemistry, Materials Science or Chemical Engineering or related field
  • Experience in the safe handling of hazardous chemicals
  • Experience with explosive technologies, safe energetic materials handling, test and evaluation
  • Competent in Microsoft desktop applications and ChemAlert Software
  • Must be an Australian Citizen and Willing to obtain a Defence security clearance

title: Key Account Manager (Hybrid)
description:
Role Description

Reporting to the State Sales Manager, the Key Account Manager – SA/NT is responsible for significantly growing key accounts and managing relationships with clients, to engage in and support the sales team and implement and maintain agreed sales & marketing initiatives.

All applicants must have received their COVID-19 Vaccination.

Key responsibilities:

  • To maintain a high level of activity in the field to ensure the achievement sales in line with business objectives
  • Source, qualify and secure new business opportunities
  • Ensure consistent and professional servicing of key existing clients by regular contact and strategic relationship building
  • Conduct professional and highly engaging sales presentations that result in specific outcomes that directly impact the achievement of business targets and objectives.
  • Effectively manage all leads & opportunities within established disciplines to ensure optimum results are achieved.
  • Maintain detailed activity and client contact records to support sales and marketing activities.

Key Skills and experience:

  • Significant B2B and F2F sales experience is highly desirable.
  • Must have extensive skills in Microsoft Excel.
  • Leadership and management ability; willing to work with different types of people, and able to adapt to various personality types.
  • Coaching ability. Call listening, training and feedback delivery to improve sales outcomes.
  • Not afraid to get involved and perform sales calls on the phone to assist with achievement of company budgets if and where required.
  • CRM experience is a must. Familiar with the basics of data input, management, and segmentation.
  • A strong understanding of the impact of data analysis. Able to take a large existing database, and segment that data to find key areas where a high likelihood of purchase is apparent.
  • Must be able to liaise with different departments, managing laterally and collaborating to achieve win/win outcomes.

What do you get?
Joining a market leading group of brands in Waterlogic, Billi and Purezza in the filtered water market. This company is passionate about the environment, hygiene, technology, and professional and quality service.

  • A strong company culture which is focused on idea sharing, collaboration and customer focused outcomes.
  • A modern and forward-thinking executive and leadership team.
  • Personal development and coaching to assist you as you continue to grow in your career
  • A competitive package and bonus structure which rewards performance.

title: Maintenance Lead
description:
Lead Maintenance Fitter

Enoplastic is a global company that is a leading supplier of Hoods and Closures to the wine industry. Our Australian manufacturing facility based in Regency Park is looking to employ an experienced lead Maintenance Fitter.

The lead Maintenance Fitter is responsible for performing all mechanical maintenance and repairs to plant and equipment for the printing and forming departments.

The Maintenance Fitter reports to the Factory Manager.

The role operates as head of the team in the Maintenance Department with emphasis on providing a responsive, efficient, timely and proactive maintenance service to production facilities within the printing and forming areas.

The outcomes will be focussed on providing maintenance support to enable the continual production of capsules to an agreed quality of product with an emphasis on reliability of equipment and process repeatability.

Principal Accountabilities

  1. Install Production Machinery
  2. Perform regular services on production machinery to reduce the risk of breakdowns
  3. Repair production machinery and fabricate replacement parts when necessary
  4. Fabricate jigs, tools and other hardware
  5. Recondition, rebuild and modify production machinery when necessary
  6. Perform machine settings when necessary
  7. Support manufacturing to ensure that the machines are maintained to maximise available up time
  8. Maintain effective relationships with immediate team members and provide high quality service to internal customers
  9. Maintain records for data analysis for continual improvement and effective service
  10. Internal maintenance, service and ordering for items such as lighting, forklifts and all other ancillary equipment

Training, Skills and Experience Required

Indentured Fitter and Machinist and experience in a manufacturing Environment are essential.

Electrical B-class licence, forklift licence, knowledge of pneumatic and vacuum systems, experience with fine tolerance tooling and welding skills would be an advantage.

Competencies Required

Initiative                                                              Judgement/Problem Solving

Analysis/Problem Assessment                          Work Standards

Safety Awareness                                              Customer Service Orientation

Teamwork/Collaboration                                   Adaptability

Address Applications to Mr. J. Evans Factory Manager

title: Sales and Marketing Assistant
description:
Claymore Wines, based in the beautiful Clare Valley, is seeking a savvy sales and marketing assistant to support growth of our dynamic boutique wine enterprise.

If you are passionate about wine and the wine industry, with a desire to work within a small, dedicated, and fun-loving team developing our boutique brand, please read on.

Previous experience in the wine or food / liquor industry is essential, including demonstrated experience in supporting the establishing and execution of sales and marketing strategies.  From a marketing context experience working with CRM systems, Microsoft Office Suite and the capacity to work independently within a small team is also essential.  Knowledge of basic graphic design software (Adobe Illustrator/Canva/Creative or similar) would be advantageous.

In addition to marketing support this role will also provide critical in market sales support to the National Sales Manager, through account support activities including but not limited to consumer data analysis, merchandising, buyer and consumer tastings and various brand ambassador and account management activities; both in South Australia and Victoria.  This support aimed at driving growth in existing channels as well as identifying and providing feedback on new opportunities for the brand.

There is potential for the scope of the role to increase over time.

This position can be a part-time or full-time position based in our Adelaide office. Remuneration will be negotiated based on the applicants experience and agreed hours.

Applicants must have the right to live and work in Australia and must have a valid Australian work permit.  Applicants must also have a full, clean Australian drivers licence.

Please hit the apply button on this job ad or email your cover letter and full resume to: production@claymorewines.com.au

Applications close as soon as the right candidate has been identified.

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Mobility and Partnerships Coordinator
description:
Here at Torrens University Australia, we do things a little differently. Our staff and teams thrive on being dynamic, resilient and responsive and this role is no exception. Reporting to International Stakeholder Manager you will join a team of passionate staff who are playing their part in making sure that we are here to deliver an exceptional learning experience for students.

This role is heavily involved in managing the processes and workflows for TGES which are accredited for international students with relation to the following - trimester abroad programs, student exchange, dual qualifications and any other related program that aligns with our globalisation and internationalisation objectives. This role will also be involved in the administration, sales/marketing proposition to students and associated travel arrangements for the New Colombo Mobility Plan.

On a typical day in this role you will be responsible for:

  • Setting up and maintaining the Trimester Abroad Program for TGES which involves tasks like working from the foundation of the international experience and trimester abroad program currently in existence and expand the offering to all potential students, both undergraduate and postgraduate; Researching and recommending a pricing strategy for various trimester abroad or international experience options for defined cohorts of domestic and international students
  • Partner and Pathway student progression, which involves maximising the possibilities of students in partner institutions to continue with further studies at an SEI entity; participating in recruiting fairs, networks, marketing or other promotional activities
  • Administration of Process/ Procedures which includes preparing reports, business cases, planning documentation; Establishing and maintaining a robust system of reporting and conversion metrics on pathways and partners student numbers
  • Data Analysis through reporting and maintenance of databases

This is a permanent full-time role with a preference to be based in Adelaide but will also consider Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane.

Click here for the Job Description [link removed]

To be successful in this position you will have:

  • Demonstrated experience within education, preferably international, with previous experience in a similar role
  • Extensive knowledge of the ESOS Act, CRICOS, PRISMS, The National Code and DIBP regulations
  • Demonstrated understanding of the student lifecycle and processes
  • High level of competence in use of Microsoft Office products
  • Marketing/sales background within international sector is an advantage

Please note: Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. All applicants require current and valid working rights for Australia.

Who are we?
Our ambition is to revolutionise the world of education, increase student employability and make a positive impact. We believe in the power of education to transform lives, and we put our people and students at the heart of everything we do . We want you to be bold, be creative, be good, and be global .

If you want to learn more about our story, our people and some of the great reasons to come and work with us - visit our Torrens University Blog (https://www.torrens.edu.au/blog)

Torrens University Australia is an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and inclusion and are committed to the attraction, retention and development of all people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation and disability.


Benefits:

We partner with a range of top providers to make your working life a more rewarding and flexible experience. These include:

  • Tuition reduction benefits on a range of courses
  • Flexible working conditions
  • Opportunity for career growth

Ready to make your difference?
Join the Torrens University Australia team by clicking "APPLY" now!

Job Reference Number: 15653

Have questions? Send them through to our friendly Talent Acquisition Team at anne.devoronine@torrens.edu.au .

title: Management Accountant
description:
The Role:

Excellent permanent opportunity for a Management Accountant to join our Finance team to provide financial services including financial and management reporting, performance measurement, business planning and provide financial and data analysis to optimise ENGIE ANZ’s assets.

The role will ideally be based at the Pelican Point Power Station in South Australia with flexibility to work partially from home.  We will consider applicants based in Melbourne who are willing to travel to South Australia approximatley once a fortnight.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Preparation of internal financial statements and analysis of monthly performance. This includes the monthly Business entity performance reports, and “flash” reports and analysis of performance against budgets and forecasts.
  • Translate strategic goals into measurable medium and long-term plans, budgets, forecasts, plans and goals
  • Maintain compliance with control mechanisms, including monitoring compliance with internal controls
  • Maintain and develop the reporting processes, including data input templates and reports.
  • Review Fixed Asset Registers, including additions, disposals and preparation depreciation expense schedules.
  • Review entity statutory reports for the business entities.

About You:

To be successful in this role, you will have solid management accounting experience in a large, complex organisation and be competent with using financial systems such as consolidation systems and management reporting systems.  You will also have experience in the preparation of financial statements for separate entities and provide useful analysis to identify key issues/risks/opportunities and to support decision making.  You possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills and will be able to balance stakeholders.  You can plan and prioritise work and optimise work processes.

Energy industry experience or willingness to develop an understanding of electricity and gas generating markets.

CPA and CA qualifications preferred.

Next Steps:

If you have the relevant experience and interested in the role, apply with a covering letter to address each of the key responsibilities and an up-to-date resume.

All applicants must have unlimited work rights in Australia.

Please note we consider applications on an ongoing basis and therefore encourage you to apply at your earliest opportunity.

Government and some client directions regarding vaccination against COVID-19 apply to various aspects of ENGIE’s work across Australia. If your application is successful, ENGIE may require you to provide evidence of vaccination against COVID-19 as necessary to comply with any such government and client directions that apply to your work in this position.

About ENGIE ANZ

ENGIE is building better lives by energising people and communities.  Our mission is  to accelerate and support the transition towards a carbon-neutral economy, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions.

ENGIE Asia-Pacific is a diversified business which includes power generation, natural gas distribution, retail businesses and multi-technical services.  The energy mix and fast-growing demand for power in the region provides significant opportunities for growth.

Our main presence in the region is in Australia, Thailand, Singapore and Indonesia.  Across these countries we operate gas-fired power plants as well as wind and solar and hydro plants.  Using globally-leading technologies, we create innovative energy and smart solutions that enhance the performance of our homes, businesses and communities.

ENGIE Australia & New Zealand has four key business streams:

1)  Energy Management is responsible for the commercial operation of renewable and thermal generating plants, the sales and marketing of energy solutions to B2B customers as well as large-scale asset development – predominantly in solar, wind and industrial-scale battery storage through a joint with ENGIE (72% Ownership) and Mitsui (28% Ownership).

2)  Simply Energy is part of this joint venture and is one of Australia’s fastest growing energy retailers, with more than 750,000 electricity and gas customer accounts in Victoria, South Australia, New South Wales, Western Australia, The Australian Capital Territory and Queensland.

3) ENGIE Net Zero Energy Solutions is committed to building long-term partnerships to define, design, develop and deliver positive outcomes for our customers.

4)  Hazelwood Rehabilitation Project is a dedicated business stream leading the safe, stable and sustainable rehabilitation of the former Hazelwood Power Station and Mine, which ceased operation in 2017.

title: Accountant
description:
About the business

Our client has a rare job opportunity available for a talented  Accountant to join their Finance division.

This is an excellent opportunity to be part of an organisation that is focused on delivering successful outcomes.

About the role

The candidate should have accounting experience coupled with experience relating to data analysis, process improvement and internal controls.

Your Responsibilities

  1. Preparation of Monthly Financial Statements with proper schedules and reconciliations.
  2. Liaise and work with statutory auditors
  3. The preparation of the Monthly BAS return, Annual FBT returns  and comply with all Statutory documentation
  4. Maintenance of the fixed asset register and be responsible for the Capex controls.
  5. Assisting the Finance Manager with Budgeting and Forecasting -
  6. Monthly Management Reporting.
  7. Various other ad-hoc projects as required by business

Benefits and perks

  • Competitive salary
  • Work Life balance
  • Innovative and supportive employee benefits
  • A strong commitment to career development
  • A positive and inclusive culture and a beautiful place to live and work.

Skills and experience

  • Tertiary qualifications in accounting or commerce.
  • Working towards or existing CA/CPA qualification
  • Experience in Excel/working from spreadsheets
  • Minimum 3-5 years' experience.
  • An enthusiastic team player.
  • Experience in financial accounting.
  • Strong IT and systems skills having work experience in an ERP system.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • A strong work ethic and a keen eye for attention to detail.

If you have local experience in these areas, full working rights in Australia and want to join an organisation that are professional and provide an opportunity to grow, then apply today to be considered.

To submit your application, please apply today with your Resume and a Cover letter in WORD format only.

Sue Cabral
Director - Powerstaff Consulting
sue.cabral@powerstaff.com.au

Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

Please note: If you have not heard from us within seven (7) working days of submitting your resume, your application will be kept on file and we will contact you if a suitable position becomes available.

title: Behavioural Scientist / Psychologist
description:
The Australian Wine Research Institute is looking for someone to bring insights and practices from behavioural science and organisational psychology to our extension and adoption programs. These programs are designed to disseminate knowledge and promote practice change in the grape and wine sector.

The ideal candidate will hold a degree in psychology, behavioural science or a related discipline. Ability to design and manage projects, superior communication skills and teamwork experience are also prerequisites.

The Australian Wine Research Institute (AWRI) is the Australian grape and wine industry’s own research organisation. It supports a sustainable and successful grape and wine industry through world-class research, practical solutions and knowledge transfer. The AWRI has strong links with the wine industry and other research organisations and provides a stimulating and challenging work environment.

The position will be based at the Waite Research Precinct, Adelaide, SA and will work closely with several teams at the AWRI.

A position description is available from Behavioural Scientist/Psychologist Position Description. For further information, please contact the Group Manager – Industry Development and Support, Con Simos, on 0448889432 or con.simos@awri.com.au .

Applications should be completed via the online form at https://www.awri.com.au/about_the_awri/people/careers/ Only applications that are completed via the online application form will be considered. Applications will be assessed as they are received.

title: Configuration and Data Controller
description:
• All Systems GO! Be part of the next generation of defence technology
  • Ongoing career development and opportunity to work on a variety of interesting Defence projects
  • Enjoy flexibility , engaging work and a culture that embraces diversity and open-mindedness

At BAE Systems we are all systems go as we continue to drive innovation and seek passionate and talented people to join our business. We currently have a new opportunity as a Configuration and Data Controller within our Defence Manufacturing and Support business based in Edinburgh Parks, Adelaide.

What this opportunity will mean for you:

  • Purposeful work where your efforts are recognised in an environment where you can thrive
  • Joining an organisation that is passionate about developing some of the most impressive careers in the world
  • Industry-leading flexibility options to unlock the talent and diversity of every individual
  • Unique opportunities to contribute to programs of national significance whilst growing your skills
  • A strong safety culture, inclusive teams and work to be proud of, underpinned by a compelling set of values

Your new role:

An opportunity has arisen for a committed Configuration and Data Controller to apply their analytical skills and make a valuable contribution within our Defence Manufacturing and Support business.

Reporting to the Manufacturing and Support Engineering Manager, you will be part of an inclusive and supportive team, and will join our growing business in an exciting time on a permanent and full time basis.

Supported by a business wide Configuration Management network, this opportunity will see you:

  • Maintain the configuration and data management practices and systems within our Manufacturing and Support business
  • Undertake configuration and data management planning, including product and documentation identification and control
  • Perform configuration and data status accounting and reporting
  • Provide configuration and data management advice, support and training to internal and external stakeholders
  • Contribute to the integrity of the configuration management system including processes, tools and data
  • Perform other configuration management tasks including managing data, parts, software and documents
  • Ensure program documents are reviewed, approved and authorised in accordance with defined processes
  • Identify and investigate configuration and data problems and formulate strategies for their resolution

About you

As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you'll have:

  • Configuration or Data control/management experience or relevant experience in an engineering/technical environment.  Applicants with relevant experience within other industries are encouraged to apply
  • Good attention to detail and good communication skills with the ability to develop effective relationships with stakeholders
  • Strong computer literacy skills, analytical and problem solving skills
  • Self-motivation and the drive to improve current processes

Whilst not essential, a technical qualification or experience utilising engineering/manufacturing configuration data management systems, will be highly regarded.

Research shows that some candidates hesitate to apply for roles if they feel they don't meet 100% of the criteria. So, if this opportunity excites you and you have the right foundational experience and qualifications, we encourage you to apply. Whether it be for this role or another, your skills and competencies are of interest to us.

Clearances

As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance.

International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.

Further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html

Applications should be addressed to: Kon Yiannikopoulos, Talent Acquisition Specialist - Engineering, and made online here.  Whilst applications must be made online, confidential enquiries are very welcome via email: kon.yiannikopoulos@baesystems.com

Please be aware that pursuant to different State government health directions, vaccination mandates regarding your ability to attend our Company sites may be applicable.  Please be prepared to discuss your vaccination status with our recruiters as part of the recruitment process.

We are a 2021 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.

Our culture

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment where our people can thrive. For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of our employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation.

If you would like to know more information about how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives via this link .

To learn about other employment opportunities at BAE Systems, please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au

title: Data Scientist
company: Department of Education, Skills and Employment
description:
Position Summary

The National Skills Commission (NSC) is seeking an experienced Data Scientist for an Assistant Director role to lead the analysis and modelling of labour markets, skills, higher education sector and the vocational education and training (VET) sector using complex datasets. This will contribute to the NSC’s role in providing advice and national leadership on Australia’s labour market and current, emerging, and future workforce skills needs.

The Skills Intelligence team is a fast paced, high performing area in the NSC. Reporting to the Director of the Skills Intelligence team, the Data Scientist will be responsible for collaborating across our multi-disciplinary team to understand stakeholder needs and deliver fit-for-purpose strategic improvements to the Classification. You will perform data analysis and provide expert analytical knowledge to support the development, publication, and maintenance of the Australian Skills Classification.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Responsibilities of the EL1 Data Scientist may include:
  • Assist the Director in the management of a section.
  • Lead a small team of data analysts and qualitative researchers to deliver new profiles and improvements to the Classification.
  • Lead and manage a portfolio of methodological work, giving important methodological advice and assistance to other parts of the NSC and the wider department.
  • Establish and maintain strong collaborative relationships with a range of key internal and external stakeholders.
  • Undertake complex analytical tasks and produce timely, purpose-specific, and appropriate solutions, technical reports, and executive briefings.
  • Apply statistical computing languages (such as R, Python or SAS) and tools to manipulate data for analysis.

Qualifications and Education

  • Academic qualifications or equivalent experience in mathematics, statistics, data science, physics, economics/econometrics, computer science, engineering, bioinformatics, psychology, or another field with a strong quantitative component are highly desirable. A demonstrated ability to learn and apply new methods and technologies will also be highly regarded.

Capabilities

We are seeking individuals with the following skills and capabilities:

  • Demonstrated experience with Natural Language Processing techniques.
  • Knowledge/Experience in Labour Markets, higher education or VET would be an advantage but not essential.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team on multiple competing priorities of varying complexity and urgency while sustaining positive team culture.
  • Proven ability to work effectively and supervise staff in a multidisciplinary and geographically distributed team, and to supervise and develop specialist staff in a high-performance culture.
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills, and the ability to convey complex and sensitive information, and engage with a range of stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated experience in understanding business needs, technical requirements, undertaking business analysis and advising on business process improvements.
  • Ability to manage data science quality assurance.
  • Ability to identify business needs, understand policy context in a complex environment.
  • Experience in the use of visualisation tools such as R-shiny, Power BI and Qlik.
  • Experience working in an agile environment using tools such as DevOps.

For further information please review the job information pack and position description available here .

Job Reference Number: 22/0529 EXT Assistant Director (Data Scientist)
