title: Data Scientist
description:
CPB Contractors is the CIMIC Group’s construction company and a leading international construction contractor, with operations across Australia, New Zealand and Papua New Guinea.

Combining the expertise and track record formerly delivered by Leighton Contractors and Thiess, we deliver projects spanning all key sectors of the construction industry, including roads, rail, tunnelling, defence and building.

Our Mission is to generate sustainable returns for our shareholders by delivering projects for our clients, while providing safe, rewarding and fulfilling careers for our people.

We need people who are talented, motivated and disciplined, and who have a strong work ethic that drives them to succeed.

Your Opportunity

As the Data Scientist you will be responsible for performing quantitative and qualitive analysis on project reporting data supplied by our numerous sub-contracting construction partners and other internal and external project stakeholders. The primary purpose of the position is to provide first reporting, interpretation and insight on project compliance and associated activities while seeking to continuously improve the quality of information provided to the wider business. You will build and maintain productive working relationship with internal and external project stakeholders to provide insight and manage the quality of incoming data.

Our minimum requirements for this role are:

  • Tertiary qualification in Business/Computer Science/Data Science
  • Demonstrated data analysis experience in fast moving and complex project or work streams with the ability to provide meaningful insights and recommendations
  • Exposure to Power BI reporting tools and ability develop dashboards
  • You will have strong written and verbal communication skills for providing clear and concise analysis and insight to stakeholders and are able to work autonomously with minimal direction

If you are interested in this role and meet the above requirements, please apply below.

We are committed to workplace diversity and to providing flexible work opportunities on our project. We support women in construction and Indigenous advancement and participation. Women and people who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander are encouraged to apply.

Please note: This role is being sourced through CPB Contractors directly and we will not accept applications via external recruitment agencies.

Given the nature of the position being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may be an inherent requirement of this role.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Unlock your potential and help us challenge the status quo, while doing the best work of your life. We want creative and passionate people on our team, who can go beyond what's possible to make lives better. What we do is centered around creating shared value for our stakeholders. And how we do things is what makes us unique. We know everyone's best work takes different shapes and forms, and we are committed to empowering and harnessing this difference. For us, development is continuous, learning is holistic, and How We Work Together is more than just a tagline.

Who are we? We are OZ Minerals, a modern mining company.

Your new role:

We are looking for passionate Data Engineers who aren't afraid to approach complex problems head on, have a ‘can do' attitude and take great pride in their work. You will play a key role in delivering high quality and innovative solutions / insights contributing to successful outcomes for the Company. Permanent and Contract roles available .

As a key member of our Digital, Robotics and Automation team, you will:
  • ​​​Work with a best of breed cloud technology stack - Airflow, Snowflake, dbt & Tableau
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team
  • Question the WHY; innovate and think differently.
  • Be empowered to take responsibility for your own deliverables.
  • Enjoy our flexible working culture, that focuses on WHAT you deliver, not WHERE you deliver it.
How you will create impact:
  • Focusing on partnerships and collaboration, contributing to the overall success of the team.
  • Continuous improvement of end-to-end processes, standards, and quality.
  • Take a lead in the Data and Analytics Community of Practice, in uplifting the data literacy of the organisation.
What we value:
  • Passionate about new technology, data and data driven insights
  • Strong experience in SQL and any programming language (i.e. Python, Java, C#) is a must
  • An agile approach to your work, managing fast-paced incremental delivery of value to stakeholders
  • The ability to bridge the gap between the business problem and the technical solution
  • Bringing creativity, diversity of thought, experience, and knowledge to deliver great outcomes.
To Apply:

If the above excites you, and even makes you a little nervous, then we want you to apply! It's an exciting and transformative time for us; and we need creative, collaborative, and great people like you.

#comeworkwithus

Applications close date: Friday 10 June 2022

title: Data Engineer
description:
• Exciting opportunity to join SA's iconic RAA
  • 12 month full-time position based in Mile End- including working from home
  • Join a tight-knit team with a fun, inclusive and supportive culture

Who we are -

As one of the state's largest and most iconic organisations, we're proud to make things better for members and better for our community. More than 780,000 members choose us to deliver peace of mind through our trusted range of motor, home and travel products and services. We're also one of the state's largest employers (and growing!), with more than 1200 employees working collectively with the common goal to keep our members moving.

Your new opportunity

An exciting opportunity has become available to design and implement data warehouses, data marts and data stores for current and future needs and to enhance the value of data analytics. As an integral member of our team your role will be to:

  • Design data models to store new datasets or changes in requirements
  • Develop, test, document, implement and support data platform solutions to acquire data, transform it and prepare it for business consumption
  • Identify data discrepancies and data quality issues, and work to ensure data consistency and integrity
  • Diagnose and resolve data platform performance issues
  • Identify opportunities for process improvements within the team, such as automation and advise on solutions
  • Deliver quality and professional service to internal customers at RAA by identifying and responding to their needs

What will set you apart from the rest

At RAA we hire on cultural add first and technical fit second, however, to be successful in this role you will need:

  • In depth skills in analytics database platforms, including the Microsoft SQL Server stack and preferably Azure Data Factory
  • Demonstrated experience in data modelling, database design, implementation, and support
  • Strong ability to understand business requirements and translate into technical solutions
  • Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities
  • Excellent technical architecture and technical support documentation skills
  • Ability to conduct research into database issues, standards and products as required

What sets us apart from the rest

  • To ensure our employees feel valued, empowered and celebrated we provide a range of employee benefits including:
  • Free RAA premium road service & discounts on all RAA Products
  • Flexible Work Arrangements
  • Ongoing Training & Development Opportunities & Study Support Program
  • Wellbeing Facilities and Corporate Health Insurance Plan
  • On-site Cafe with Barista - plus much more!

How to apply

Simply hit "Apply for this job" to access further information found in the position description or follow the prompts to apply.

Applications Close: 9:00am Wednesday 1 June

Please note applications may be short-listed and progressed prior to the closing date.

We're committed to building a workplace that's diverse and inclusive, where employees are embraced for their unique qualities and valued for their contributions. We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in everyone, and helps us to give our members better service.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
About Tic:Toc
Faster. Smarter. Simpler.

Tic:Toc is a world-leading fintech company based in Adelaide. We use technology and Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) to reimagine financial services processes and create superior experiences for our customers. And we’re growing fast.

You will find an environment waiting for you that is creative, friendly and a lot of fun. We are passionate about what we do, and it shows.

Tic:Toc expects and supports you to challenge traditional thinking and take risks. We are straight-talking and our team is full of bold, brave and energised talent.

What you’ll do
As a Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll work collaboratively day to day with the Data Science and Business teams to build, solve and challenge complex business problems and solutions.

Being in a pivotal role, you will also benefit from being in Tic:Toc’s tight knit workplace and often find yourself interacting with other functions.

At Tic:Toc, we work Agile. While you will be supported with our ways of working, we expect you to work autonomously to achieve defined sprint objectives in the desired timeframes.

Here’s a few other things you’ll do:
  • Develop, mature and modularise all elements of AI models from pre-processing, training/testing through to deployment.
  • Measure, monitor, optimise and recommend changes to productionised models.
  • Build your own models to solve real problems, applying rigour from exploration and experimentation through to production.
  • ETL & data warehousing: don’t worry... we already do this well, so you don’t have to fret about wrangling too much untidy data. But we don’t know everything, so please bring your ideas on how we can evolve!
  • Manage infrastructure associated with all things machine learning and advanced analytics.
  • Be empowered to suggest and action change, drawing on your experience and smarts.
  • Facilitate advanced analytics and computationally expensive modelling using warehoused data.
  • Support ongoing embedding of analytical products within the user experience.
  • Utilise and adhere to Tic:Toc software tools, methodologies, and standards.
You will bring to us
Essential
  • Demonstrated capability in a developer role, ideally with analytical experience.
  • Demonstrated experience in working with and productionising advanced analytics solutions.
  • Demonstrated experience in one or more of these programming/scripting languages: Python, C#, SQL, R, Bash, PowerShell.
  • Demonstrated expertise with deep learning architectures (RNN, LSTM, CNN, reinforcement etc.) and applications (time series, NLP, computer vision, recommendation).
  • Experience with data science ecosystem including Python, Jupyter Notebooks, Anaconda and R.
  • Demonstrated experience with exposing your models via API within a cloud-based environment.
  • At ease with common libraries such as Numpy, Pandas, Keras, Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, fastai, Scikit-Learn.
  • Sound knowledge of probability, machine learning (supervised, unsupervised, semi-supervised) and statistics
  • Demonstrated experience in data processing
Desirable
  • Demonstrated ETL muscle.
  • Experience working in Agile development environments.
  • Experience working with cloud-based technologies such as AWS including but not limited to SageMaker, Redshift, Lambda, S3, Athena, Glue, CloudFormation.
  • Familiarity with Apache Ecosystem including Airflow, Spark, Kafka etc.
  • Experience in Financial Services and familiar within home loan processes and language.
  • Cloud technology and/or Big Data certification.
  • Real-time ETL (streaming).
  • Experience with Big Data tools such as Hadoop, Spark, Pig, Hive, Scala.
  • Tertiary Qualifications in Computer Science, Engineering or Advanced Analytics.
What you’ll get in return
  • We offer an attractive remuneration package + generous employee share plans;
  • We offer flexible working hours and work from home arrangements to balance your work and lifestyle;
  • We offer opportunities to expand career development outside of your everyday including providing leadership training and opportunities;
  • We also offer 1:1 Training, Learning Programs and Mentoring to help you succeed;
  • We have a vibrant culture and workspace to help you do great work;
  • You’ll be part of a company that’s growing rapidly, building products customer’s love.
Whilst all of our job opportunities have specific criteria, if the above describes who you are but you don’t tick all of our boxes, we still encourage you to apply. If you have any questions, you can get in touch with Karam Singh our Talent Sourcer at ksingh@tictoc.com.au or 0401799479 .

title: Multiple Data Analysts (APS4)
description:
About the ABS

We are Australia’s national statistical agency and an official source of independent, reliable information. We tell the real story of Australia, its economy, and its people by bringing life and meaning to numbers. We employ around 3,000 office/ work from home staff located across all capital cities and Geelong as well as 500 field-based interviewers.

About the roles

These are multiple permanent APS4 positions available full-time and part-time. Roles are based in Canberra, Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne, Adelaide, Hobart and Perth in our Macroeconomic Statistics, Industry Statistics, Population and Labour Statistics teams.

As a Data Analyst you will be expected to have some relevant work experience however, we will support you with training, coaching and development opportunities.

You will work in one of our divisional teams which have a diversity of work, people and locations. You will work collaboratively in a team of professionals to produce high quality statistics that Australia needs, and learn about relevant concepts, classifications, frameworks, data sources, methods and different types of analysis.

You will have opportunities to work on new developments such as evaluating and using new data sources and improving the processes and systems.  For example we have recently implemented the use of bank data to develop a monthly household spending indicator.

View this video for more information on the types of work/ teams – APS4 Data Analysts

Duties


Your responsibilities, depending on the role, may include:

  • analysing data from statistical collections or administrive sources and comparing against other sources
  • communicating findings, using judgement and real-world insights
  • applying statistical frameworks, classifications, standards and concepts that underpin the statistics
  • working with internal and external clients to develop fit for purpose specifications of data solutions requirements
  • critical thinking and reasoning: anticipating and analysing issues and developing logical conclusions
  • contributing to the design and testing of collection questionnaires and survey forms

We are seeking people who have:

  • sound, analytical, and creative skills, including the ability to problem solve and make decisions based on analytical evidence
  • ability to work in and add value to a team
  • good oral, and written communication skills
  • ability to work flexibly in a changing environment.

Desirable (but not essential) are:

  • previous work experience in a data compilation or statistical analysis role
  • previous experience of working in and contributing to a high performing team
  • academic qualifications in statistics, data science, mathematics, economics or other fields with a strong quantitative component

Benefits

  • Annual salary increases
  • Hybrid working (office and work from home)
  • Inclusion and diversity networks
  • Access to mentors and coaches
  • Christmas to New Year shutdown (without using your leave)


Applications close 11:30 PM AEDT, Sunday 6th February

title: Data Engineer
description:
Data Action (DA) has over 30 years' experience as a specialist software and services provider to the alternate banking and financial services industry. Operating nationally and servicing a broad client base including customer owned banks, credit unions, neobanks and financial services membership organisations, DA's focus of supporting the financial wellbeing of Australians is echoed through our values:

  • No goldfish - Go beyond your bowl, share knowledge, stay curious and keep learning.
  • Fail forward - Learn from mistakes and keep moving forward.
  • Cheer loudly - Be proud of the team's results and celebrate successes.
  • Own it - Throw yourself in and own your work, taking responsibility until the end.
  • Think Client - Put yourself in our Client's shoes - consider the impact for their customers and deliver.

DA has evolved to become a provider of core banking and digital platforms and services to some of Australia's leading customer-owned, challenger banks, aggregators, and the financial services industry, aligned with our purpose - powering innovation in banking.

DA operates nationally with close to 300 staff based in Adelaide, Sydney, Melbourne, and Brisbane - enhancing the banking experience of more than 1.43 million Australians via its core banking and digital platforms, powering customer transactions across 3.2 million accounts every day.

About the Role:

The Data Engineer is primarily responsible for the successful conversion and migration of core banking systems onto and off the DA CBS and ancillary systems.

Other responsibilities include helping other teams, being involved in projects, assisting in gathering requirements, and other migration tasks as needed at DA and to DA Clients and/or potential Clients.

Primarily the Data Engineer works with the DA Core Banking System (CBS) but needs to be aware of the relationship between the CBS and ancillary products and works diligently to resolve any issues in communication between the CBS and any products that interface to it.

Key responsibilities of the role include:

  • As part of the merger and conversion of Financial Institutions (FI) onto the DA CBS, the Data Engineer will liaise with financial institution (FI) staff and analyse and document their requirements and determine the best way to implement the requirements onto the DA CBS
  • During a merger and conversion, be proactive in identifying and communicating any gaps to the project team
  • Knowledge sharing both internally and externally on CBS areas of expertise (as well as any other subject matter expertise)
  • Assist in pre-sales, talking to potential customers or assisting with RFI's/RFP's as well as involvement in the discovery process before a merger/conversion.

What You'll Need to Succeed:

  • Qualifications in Data Analysis, Science or Engineering or equivalent industry experience
  • Advanced experience with Structured Query Language (SQL)/Transact-SQL (T-SQL) programming
  • Experience in designing Extract Transform Load (ETL) solutions
  • Experience with Python or Java programming
  • Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
  • Experience within an environment eliciting and documenting effective business requirements
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts
  • Ability to identify user requirements and problems and respond appropriately.

DA understands the importance of having quality people in our business and provides unique opportunities for the right people to become an integral part of our team.  We offer avenues for professional development and career progression for committed individuals.

If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you! Please be sure to combine a covering letter addressing the key criteria set out above as the first page of your resume.

To be considered for this role you will need to be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident, or have a current visa that permits you to work in Australia.

title: Machine Learning
description:
About the Role:

As a Consunet Applied Scientist you will perform a vital role with the use of your Machine Learning knowledge to support our Cyber and Electronic Warfare technology company. The role will consist of project research, development, and demonstration of near real-time autonomous electromagnetic spectrum management to deliver orders of magnitude increase in agility and efficiency cost savings for Australian Defence and commerce. You will be working within an agile environment with a team of professionals to achieve the organisations research goals. The applied research of the project you will be undertaking is in the application of advanced computational methods (Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Data Science) to a problem domain requiring pattern recognition, forecasting and planning.

To be considered for this role, you must be an Australian citizen.

Essential Knowledge and Skills:

  • Understanding software engineering and problem solving.
  • In-depth knowledge of Python programming skills including experience with Pytorch, TensorFlow, NumPy, Panda and Matplotlib.
  • A comprehension understanding of Mathematics, especially statistics, vectors and matrices, optimisation, and complex algorithm development and the ability to link these to modelling and machine learning.
  • Experience with training and testing of machine learning models, including data preparation, data leakage and performance assessment.
  • You will have demonstrable experience with Neural Network based technologies and understand Model based and Model free based approaches, with the familiarity of building models within an R&D environment.
  • You are an adaptable individual who can communicate fluently, both orally and in writing, and are comfortable with presenting complex information to both technical and non-technical audiences such as internal and external stakeholders.

Desirable Knowledge and Skills:

  • Background in Radar, EW or Comms
  • Understanding of distributed systems
  • Government/Defence Industry experience
  • Recommending and designing technical solutions
  • Writing and maintaining technical documentation
  • Implementing and testing software using edge technologies and frameworks
  • Experience working in teams applying Agile software engineering best practices
  • Post graduate degree within Machine Learning, Pattern Matching, Data Science are preferred, however established equivalent expertise will be considered

To be considered, candidates will have:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Successful candidates must be eligible to hold and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance. Eligibility requirements can be found at http://www.defence.gov.au/agsva.

Benefits working for Consunet:

  • A workplace that believes in innovation, quality, and a work-life balance.
  • Flexible, inclusive and friendly work environment.
  • Competitive remuneration.
  • Salary packaging options.
  • Career and skills progression through training and development to team members.
  • Access to cutting-edge technology, research, and agile project management practices.
  • Mentoring and support from our experienced team members.

About the Company:

Consunet is headquartered in the Adelaide CBD with operations in Adelaide, Edinburgh (SA) and Canberra. A level of flexibility is generally offered with respect to work location. If you have specific requirements, please discuss them during your interview.

Our people create world-leading trusted cyber and spectrum security technology solutions that safeguard our customers' interests. As a 100% Australian-owned and operated corporation, Consunet strives to be the country's leading sovereign cyber and spectrum security solution developer, and trusted industry partner to the Australian Defence and cyber security communities. The company has a strong research and development and collaboration emphasis, implements Agile development and management processes, and has a proven track record of delivering and sustaining in-service operational capabilities for defence and commercial customers. Our vision “to build the Australian cyber and spectrum security future” is firmly rooted in everything we do.

To Apply:

Click “Apply Now”. Please attach a cover letter summarising your experience when applying.

title: Science Team Leader – Data Science (Hamilton, New Zealand)
description:
The role and opportunity

Please note this role is based in Hamilton, New Zealand.

We are looking for a strong people leader to join the Digital Agriculture leadership team and lead the Data Science - Ruakura Team at AgResearch.

As a Science Team leader, your role will be split between, 50% team leadership and 50% as a senior statistician. As a Science Team Leader you will lead a team of scientists that advocate data science principles, working collaboratively in multi-disciplinary project teams to apply new technologies and to develop data-driven solutions for New Zealand’s agricultural sector. The second part of your role will be as a consulting senior statistician.

This role will ensure current and future capability is aligned to the Science Plan, while ensuring an innovation pipeline and culture of innovation excellence continues to be achieved.  We are looking for someone with proven leadership experience and someone that relishes getting the best out of their people.

This leadership role will lead the Data Science - Ruakura Team, ensuring it has the current and future capability requirements (both personnel and science-based infrastructure/equipment) which are aligned to the Science Plan as well as ensuring a vital science driven innovation pipeline and Culture of Innovation Excellence.  You will provide direction and oversight for career progression opportunities, science expertise, staff allocation/deployment and champion science creativity and quality for the team.

What you will be doing

  • Lead a high performing team in unlocking business value by coaching, developing, and managing employees to deliver innovative solutions.
  • Ensure the members of their science team are directed towards and valued as critical contributors to projects that produce high quality science and innovation aligned to the strategic and operational needs of our Science Plan.
  • Maximise allocation of science and innovation employee capabilities by integrating them into AgResearch project design and research investment activities.
  • Implement decision-making frameworks that can inform our critical investments in staff development, recruitment and external capability partnering.

Your ideal background

  • PhD (or equivalent experience) in statistics, data science or mathematics is preferred. Ideally at a senior level.
  • Experience in the leadership/supervision of individuals/groups in science, innovation or technology, including setting and reviewing their progress against objectives and individual development.
  • Proven experience in developing individuals and mentorship.
  • Ability to work with senior leaders.

Our benefits

When your work environment fits your values and your lifestyle, it is a better place to be. Our campuses are green, open, and developing, allowing you to enjoy your work and be productive at the same time – we offer flexibility (work from home, flexible hours) and generous benefits to make sure our people feel supported and enjoy being part of the AgResearch team.

You can view the complete list here: http://www.agresearchcareers.co.nz/working-here/our-benefits/

How to apply

This role will suit a passionate, talented and collaborative person who is motivated to drive their career forward within this vital New Zealand organisation. If this sounds like you, apply today using the link below, including a cover letter detailing why you feel you would be suitable for this position.

For further information, please contact Penny Hall, HR Advisor, on penny.hall@agresearch.co.nz .

To apply, or to view the full Position Description for this role, please go to our Careers Page http://www.agresearchcareers.co.nz/

Applications close: Wednesday 1 June 2022.

title: Machine Learning Researcher
description:
About us:

STELaRLab is Lockheed Martin’s first dedicated multi-disciplinary research lab to be setup outside of the US and conducts research in artificial intelligence, signal and image processing, communication systems and multidomain operations (MDO) to deliver exciting outcomes that advance Australian capability.

STELaRLab maintains strong partnerships with academia, government, and wider industry to execute research and development from conceptual prototyping through to simulated and/or live trials. This exciting new position will be located and works closely with the Australian Institute of Machine Learning (AIML), working with world-class researchers with the opportunity to build your career and reputation and work in one of the world’s most liveable cities.

AIML is Australia’s leading research institute in machine learning, artificial intelligence and computer vision. With world-leading researchers, modern facilities and an innovative culture, delivering research that is highly valued to local and global communities. AIML is the largest computer vision and machine learning group in Australia with over 130 members including academics, research staff and students. The institute works on a mixture of fundamental and commercially orientated research projects in computer vision and machine learning, with a strong track record of publication in the top venues. The University’s Computer Vision research is amongst the best in the world. Find out more at https://www.adelaide.edu.au/aiml/home.

About the role:

As a Machine Learning Researcher , you will perform research and/or product development for multiple scientific or engineering disciplines including Machine Learning, Computer Science, Signal or Image Processing, Communication and Analytics with tasks including:

  • Executing application-driven R&D projects within a multi-disciplinary team.
  • Designing and implementing solutions and prototypes that draw from the state-of-the-art in academic literature to deliver transformational capability.
  • Partnering with academia, government and industry to advance technologies with practical relevance, and engaging with the community to showcase your capabilities.
  • Developing your technical and professional expertise to expand the breadth of solutions you may bring to any given problem.

Essential skills and experience:

  • PhD in a related discipline from a recognised institute.
  • Execution of R&D tasks for projects in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Signal or Image Processing, Analytics, or associated disciplines.
  • Participation in multi-disciplinary research teams.
  • Strong communication and influencing skills including the ability to prepare and present concise oral and written reports to stakeholders.

Desirable knowledge and experience:

  • Machine Learning.
  • Signal and /or image processing.
  • Communications and/or radar electronic warfare processing.
  • Communications engineering/modelling, including space-based systems.
  • Sensor systems (imaging, radio frequency, other).
  • Sensor and information fusion, and methods for accounting for data uncertainty.
  • Space systems.

How we reward and support you:

At Lockheed Martin we value our team and the contribution they make every day. We offer rewarding career pathways working on interesting projects that make a difference, continuous professional development and the opportunity to learn from a diverse team of talented individuals.

In return we offer:

  • Competitive Remuneration.
  • Options for genuine work/life flexibility – 9 day fortnight.
  • Membership to Destination Discounts – that saves you money on many every day purchases including supermarkets, petrol, department stores to name a few.
  • Salary packaging for car leasing.

Special Requirements:

Applicants must be eligible for and are required to apply for and maintain a CoA Baseline security clearance.

Employment may be contingent on the satisfactory result of criminal and/or other background screens, which require the collection and transfer of personal information.

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Lockheed Martin supports Equal Employment Opportunity and Diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, harassment free, diverse, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. Diversity and inclusion are the foundation of our culture and reflect our values of doing what’s right, respecting others and performing with excellence. By leveraging our employees’ unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

title: Data & Analytics Technical Consultant (Work from anywhere)
description:
Exposé is one of Australia’s leading Data & Analytics Consultancies. We have offices in Adelaide and Melbourne and team members all over Australia! We are super proud to provide a fantastic work culture, flexible working arrangements, access to leading-edge technology and projects, professional development and much more!

At exposé, culture comes first (happy employee = happy client = happy employer), and we believe that is why our amazing team are motivated to get up out of bed to come to work every day.

We are currently looking to fill multiple positions in our team at the mid to senior levels. As a consultant, you will be supported and trained to become a leading Data Specialist, involved in challenging projects from start to end. Putting your professional mark on work.

About the role:

In this role, you will work collaboratively with our team and clients to create insightful solutions to help clients make informed decisions. Use your Data Engineering skills and experience to analyse, integrate, model, and move data to create data and analytics solutions for our clients. Let’s help our clients “do better with data”!

Technical Requirements for the role:

  • Strong experience in on-premise and cloud-based technologies and creation of hybrid solutions
  • Strong Microsoft Azure Data Services experience is preferable
  • AWS or Google Cloud platform is advantageous

Conventional Business Intelligence - >4 years’ experience

  • Data integration, ETL, Data architecture, and modelling
  • Reporting
  • Database management systems (RDBMS) and its architecture
  • Semantic models (multi-dimensional)

Advanced Analytics - >2 years’ experience in one or more areas

  • IoT
  • Machine learning
  • Interactive visualisations
  • Semantic models (Tabular/Columnar)
  • Big data solutions
  • Real-time data streams
  • Mobile integration
  • Data lakes & Databricks

Other Requirements:

  • A relevant tertiary qualification is highly advantageous
  • Microsoft/AWS certifications are highly advantageous
  • Ability to solve client business problems using Data and Analytical solutions
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must
  • Prior experience in client-facing roles, exceptional interpersonal & relationship building skills
  • Current police clearance or be willing to obtain one at short notice

Please note that this is not a Data Scientist role - data science experience and qualifications are a bonus. Still, we require a Technical Consultant who has the depth and breadth of skills across the entire Data Analytics landscape.

Why join Exposé?

  • Second to none culture –join our Purple Peeps Team!
  • Flexible working arrangements (you can work from anywhere in Australia)
  • Excellent employee benefits, including technology & professional development allowances and paid development days off!
  • We're a collaborative bunch that loves getting together and making a positive difference across our team and clients.
  • We are actively involved in the community, regularly hosting networking events and supporting our staff to speak at relevant forums and events.

Suppose you want to work with some of the most talented Data & Analytics technologists in the market who are genuinely passionate about what they do. In that case, this could be your opportunity to join a secure and growing consultancy.

Please apply via Seek or reach out to Oli or Caila at oliver.blaquiere@exposedata.com.au or caila.hancl@exposedata.com.au for more information and a confidential chat.

*Exposé will not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies.

title: Data Engineer
description:
• All Systems GO! Be part of the next generation of defence technology
  • Design, build and preparation of data platforms using Tableau and other visualisation tools
  • Enjoy flexibility , engaging work and a culture that embraces diversity and open-mindedness
  • This role could be  based in Adelaide or Melbourne.

At BAE Systemswe are all systems go as we continue to drive innovation and seek passionate and talented people to join our business. We currently have a unique opportunity as a Data Engineer within our Central Business function, the role could be based in Adelaide, SA or Melbourne, Victoria.

What this opportunity will mean for you:

  • Purposeful work where your efforts are recognized in an environment where you can thrive
  • Joining an organisation that is passionate about developing some of the most impressive careers in the world
  • Industry-leading flexibility options to unlock the talent and diversity of every individual
  • Unique opportunities to contribute to programs of national significance whilst growing your skills
  • A strong safety culture, inclusive teams and work to be proud of, underpinned by a compelling set of values

Your new role:

As the Data Engineer , you will be responsible for the design, build and preparation of data platforms and the associated integration from systems of record to facilitate analysis, visualisation and communication of data and analytics.

You will interact with business and IT teams and Senior Stakeholders on a regular basis to support them and the broader business by providing guidance on reporting and analytics dashboard design and build to facilitate accurate and timely reporting, insights, and analysis to better inform their decision-making.

You will provide advice and coaching on taking evidenced based approaches and undertake detailed analysis of prioritised analytics programs.

In terms of specific responsibilities, you will:

  • Ensure integrity of any integration between source systems/systems of record and relevant data platforms
  • Ensure efficient, sustainable and best practice design and build of data platforms to facilitate efficient analysis
  • Ensure security requirements are adhered to and appropriate data sets are available to relevant teams and users within our company so as to ensure our Commonwealth obligations are met and adhered to
  • Liaise with key stakeholders to assist them to communicate and interpret reporting to support decision-making.
  • Work with relevant stakeholders and provide guidance on data structures to deliver impactful reporting and analytics.
  • Provide coaching, training and guidance to the data and information community on data and analysis.
  • Provide thought leadership towards key enterprise wide dashboards and analytic solutions
  • Stay up to date with the latest analytics methods and data model design practices
  • Development and continuous improvement of enterprise data management for effective use of analytics and reporting solution
  • Design and change management of enterprise database structures and data extraction and loading.
  • Work with user community to ensure agreed frameworks and governance is adhered to
  • Address Ad hoc data queries from senior stakeholders as required (ELT).
  • Engage with internal and external stakeholders to develop suitable solutions.

About you

As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you'll have:

  • Demonstrated experience working as Data Engineer
  • Broad experience with Tableau tools including server administration of Tableau with Server and Data Administration and Management
  • Significant experience in designing solutions to capture, transform and analyse large and complex data sets. ODI and Informatica are an advantage
  • Significant experience in designing and maintaining data repositories to allow data to be analysed quickly and efficiently within the agreed governance frameworks
  • Proven track record of success working on analytics projects
  • Broad experience with any of the Analytics tools (ideally with Tableau, but other tools like Qlik or Power BI will be considered)
  • Experience in designing, implementing and extending data mart & warehouse solutions
  • Experience in the implementation of Analytics Solutions that incorporate Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
  • Experience in managing internal customers and devising fit for purpose governance models around reporting and data
  • Experience in managing and leading Analytics Communities of Practice
  • Experience in Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) will be an advantage
  • Experience in Oracle E-Business Suite will be an advantage

A Degree level qualification in IT disciplines related to data management and database management and design is desirable in the role.

Clearances

As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance.

International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.

Further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html

Applications should be addressed to: Calvin Ebenezer - Talent Acquisition Specialist - IM&T and made online here. Confidential enquiries are welcome via email: calvin.ebenezer@baesystems.com

Please be aware that pursuant to different State government health directions, vaccination mandates regarding your ability to attend our Company sites may be applicable.  Please be prepared to discuss your vaccination status with our recruiters as part of the recruitment process.

We are a 2021 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.

Our culture

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment where our people can thrive. For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of our employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation.

If you would like to know more information about how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives via this link .

To learn about other employment opportunities at BAE Systems, please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au

title: Adversarial Machine Learning Researcher/Engineer APS Level 4/5-6
description:
The Role
This role can be filled as either:
• Adversarial Machine Learning Researcher
• Adversarial Machine Learning Engineer

You will be part of an S&T team working in the area of Adversarial Machine Learning (AML) undertaking applied research, or engineering tasks, towards quantifying and enhancing the robustness of Machine Learning (ML) solutions for Defence applications.

AML involves countering data-driven attacks on ML solutions, whereby malicious actors modify training or test data to mislead and/or subvert ML predictions. You will help to devise, or implement and evaluate, new robust learning approaches suitable for adversarial environments and undertake research and development into the design and assessment of robust ML solutions for Defence applications, including reinforcement learning and deep learning.

Both roles provide exposure to S&T challenges in cyber security and operations in a military context. In addition, there exists the opportunity to work closely with Australian and international research partners, Defence clients and cyber security domain experts. You will also be supported with training in aspects of cyber security and ML as required, and encouraged to further develop your expertise.

The AML Researcher will also be encouraged to engage with the scientific community. The AML Researcher, under guidance and as part of a multi-disciplinary team, will:

• Contribute to research developing, adapting, applying and assessing robust ML techniques in the context of Defence applications.
• Prepare scientific publications and reports, present outcomes, demonstrate technologies and interact with both Defence clients and the academic/scientific community.
• Maintain up to date knowledge in specific areas of ML and broaden knowledge across areas relating to AML, including cyber security.
• Enhance S&T capability through targeted collaboration with other DST Group teams, academia, industry and other national/international research agencies.

The AML Engineer , under guidance and as part of a multi-disciplinary team, will:

• Contribute to developing, adapting, applying and assessing robust ML techniques in the context of Defence applications.
• Develop software as required to support the development and evaluation of attacks against and defences of ML algorithms.
• Contribute to scientific publications and reports to present outcomes and demonstrate technologies to both Defence clients and the academic/scientific community.
• Maintain up to date knowledge in specific areas of ML and broaden knowledge across areas relating to AML, including cyber security.

• Provide support to enhancing S&T capability through targeted collaboration with other DST Group teams, academia, industry and other national/international research agencies.

About our Team
Cyber and Electronic Warfare Division undertakes research and development focused on identifying, analysing and countering threats to Australia’s defence and national security through electronic means.

Cyberwarfare Operations branch undertakes research and development to help Australian Defence develop an effective cyber warfare capability that enables fight-through in a contested cyber environment.

The Counter Cyber Threats group undertakes research and development to identify, understand and defeat threats to key cyber terrain. Their work supports ADF cyber operations, with a particular focus on defence of military mission systems and platform systems.

Our Ideal Candidate
We are looking for candidates who can build and sustain positive relationships with team members, actively participate in team work and group activities, work collaboratively and operate as effective team members.

The ideal AML Researcher shall also be able to:

• Conduct research into and assist in the development of tools and techniques.
• Contribute to novel techniques published in the scientific literature.
• Research developments in the field and maintain currency through participating in professional activities.

While the ideal AML Engineer shall also be able to:

• Be accountable for and apply software engineering principles to the development of tools and techniques.
• Be current with and experienced in mainstream machine learning libraries.
• Investigate emerging technologies and maintain currency in the field through participating in professional activities.

Application closing date: Sunday the 29th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference DSTG/01991/22 on

title: Adversarial Machine Learning Researcher/Engineer APS Level 4/5-6
description:
The Role
This role can be filled as either:
• Adversarial Machine Learning Researcher
• Adversarial Machine Learning Engineer

You will be part of an S&T team working in the area of Adversarial Machine Learning (AML) undertaking applied research, or engineering tasks, towards quantifying and enhancing the robustness of Machine Learning (ML) solutions for Defence applications.

AML involves countering data-driven attacks on ML solutions, whereby malicious actors modify training or test data to mislead and/or subvert ML predictions. You will help to devise, or implement and evaluate, new robust learning approaches suitable for adversarial environments and undertake research and development into the design and assessment of robust ML solutions for Defence applications, including reinforcement learning and deep learning.

Both roles provide exposure to S&T challenges in cyber security and operations in a military context. In addition, there exists the opportunity to work closely with Australian and international research partners, Defence clients and cyber security domain experts. You will also be supported with training in aspects of cyber security and ML as required, and encouraged to further develop your expertise.

The AML Researcher will also be encouraged to engage with the scientific community. The AML Researcher, under guidance and as part of a multi-disciplinary team, will:

• Contribute to research developing, adapting, applying and assessing robust ML techniques in the context of Defence applications.
• Prepare scientific publications and reports, present outcomes, demonstrate technologies and interact with both Defence clients and the academic/scientific community.
• Maintain up to date knowledge in specific areas of ML and broaden knowledge across areas relating to AML, including cyber security.
• Enhance S&T capability through targeted collaboration with other DST Group teams, academia, industry and other national/international research agencies.

The AML Engineer , under guidance and as part of a multi-disciplinary team, will:

• Contribute to developing, adapting, applying and assessing robust ML techniques in the context of Defence applications.
• Develop software as required to support the development and evaluation of attacks against and defences of ML algorithms.
• Contribute to scientific publications and reports to present outcomes and demonstrate technologies to both Defence clients and the academic/scientific community.
• Maintain up to date knowledge in specific areas of ML and broaden knowledge across areas relating to AML, including cyber security.

• Provide support to enhancing S&T capability through targeted collaboration with other DST Group teams, academia, industry and other national/international research agencies.

About our Team
Cyber and Electronic Warfare Division undertakes research and development focused on identifying, analysing and countering threats to Australia’s defence and national security through electronic means.

Cyberwarfare Operations branch undertakes research and development to help Australian Defence develop an effective cyber warfare capability that enables fight-through in a contested cyber environment.

The Counter Cyber Threats group undertakes research and development to identify, understand and defeat threats to key cyber terrain. Their work supports ADF cyber operations, with a particular focus on defence of military mission systems and platform systems.

Our Ideal Candidate
We are looking for candidates who can build and sustain positive relationships with team members, actively participate in team work and group activities, work collaboratively and operate as effective team members.

The ideal AML Researcher shall also be able to:

• Conduct research into and assist in the development of tools and techniques.
• Contribute to novel techniques published in the scientific literature.
• Research developments in the field and maintain currency through participating in professional activities.

While the ideal AML Engineer shall also be able to:

• Be accountable for and apply software engineering principles to the development of tools and techniques.
• Be current with and experienced in mainstream machine learning libraries.
• Investigate emerging technologies and maintain currency in the field through participating in professional activities.

Application closing date: Sunday the 29th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference DSTG/01991/22 on

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=848A8DDC-B929-A72D-C814-C88BDFD8D8CD

title: Text Analytics Team Lead Executive Level 2 (S&T Level 6)
description:
Text Analytics Team Lead

  • Inspire and mentor a small team of text analytics researchers and engineers
  • Contribute to innovation of scientific research in a Defence environment
  • Enjoy flexible working arrangements

This exciting role involves inspiring a small high-performing team of scientists and researchers that contribute to the development of science and technology in the domains of multilingual text and content analytics to high international standards. The ideal applicant will have experience and a passion for computational linguistics. You will represent DSTG on Australian and international groups within the text and content analytics domains. This role will contribute to a culture of innovation that drives our More Together: Defence Science and Technology Strategy.

As the Text Analytics Team Lead, you will:
Lead a research program to develop multilingual text analytics for processing, enriching and translating unstructured text content; as well as build linguistic resources, language models and advanced content analytics solutions.

  • Develop initiatives on priority science areas relating to multilingual text and content analytics for Defence and national security agencies.
  • Provide high-level technical and administrative advice in the field of multilingual text and content analytics.
  • Supervise and mentor staff to promote a healthy culture that values staff, innovation and excellence in science.
  • Manage allocated resources, set work area priorities, manage workflows, develop strategies and evaluate business outcomes.
  • Manage stakeholder relationships and play a key role in building relationships with Defence and national security agencies, and their international equivalents, as well as academia and industry.
  • Report research findings to Defence partners and the scientific community through high quality scientific reports, briefs, publications and presentations.

About our Team
Intelligence, Surveillance and Space Division (ISSD) undertakes internationally-recognised research and development into technologies aimed at enhancing national capability for Defence and national agency decision makers.

The role is within Identity Intelligence group, within Intelligence Analysis branch in ISSD.

Identity Intelligence works closely with Defence and other elements of Australia’s national power to deliver tools and technologies that better prepare Defence to respond to grey-zone activities. The group enhances Defence’s video, imagery, and multilingual text and speech capabilities to identify and characterise persons of interest and detect misinformation and disinformation within contested information environments. The group also aims to understand and defend the vulnerabilities inherent in deploying new identification technologies and the information they are applied to.


Our Ideal Candidate
We are looking for a motivated team player who is able to understand the broad strategic context and has sound stakeholder engagement skills.


To succeed in in this role, you must be able to demonstrate the following:

  • Specialised knowledge and research experience in multilingual text and content analytics to generate new knowledge and produce enhanced capabilities for clients and sponsors.
  • Ability to lead the development of Science & Technology (S&T) initiatives.
  • Ability to think strategically, problem solve and operate with considerable autonomy to achieve corporate impact.
  • Sound communication skills, both written and verbal, with an ability to foster effective stakeholder relationships.
  • Adaptability and resilience in a dynamically changing environment.
  • Working collaboratively across different teams, harnessing diverse views and encouraging an inclusive team culture.
  • Supervise, mentor and develop staff.
  • Commitment towards ongoing self-improvement and professional development.

Application closing date: Sunday the 29th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference DSTG/02005/22 on

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=9C7896E7-2B42-0DDB-D044-C88BE12833E2
