title: Data Management & digital Security officer
description:
Provide Data Management & digital Security to secure Dept of Defences research into prototyping guided weapons. 12 Months minimum contract

  • Requires past experience as a Data Manager and Australian Citizenship essential (For security Clearances)
  • $ Based on Experience
  • 12 month full time contract, with potential to go longer

Your Next Employer...

You'll be working with the R&D department for the Department of Defence (Defence Science Technology Group, DTSG) in Edinburgh.

DSTG is currently supporting research into guided weapons prototyping.

The Role...

1. Develop and implement efficient and secure procedures for data handling and compliant with all DSTG policies;

2. Ensure digital databases and archives are protected from security breaches and data losses;

3. Support staff with the use of data systems

You Will Need...

1. Proven experience as Data manager

2. Proficient in MS Office

3. To be an Australian Citizen

For more information, call Soyuz on 03 9573 1500

title: Geospatial Engineer - Adelaide
description:
Nova Systems Geospatial is a multidisciplinary team of Software Developers, Designers, DevOps Specialists and Geospatial Consultants with a proven track record of building and supplying innovative, high value enterprise spatially enabled software and data solutions. The Geospatial team leads the development of software and geospatial solutions and the provision of geospatial products at Nova Systems. Our services are a significant part of Nova's broad range of professional services across Defence, Essential Services, Land Management, Government, Utilities, Energy and Resources.

We are flexible in the way we work, and receptive to improving process and ways of bringing new ideas to life through innovation. We challenge convention when it is in the interest of our customers and actively seek employees that think the same way. Our success is built on collaboration, so you can expect to work closely with your colleagues and customers in our mission to build and deliver high value solutions.

We pride ourselves on transparency, compassion for our people and building a safe, fun and inclusive environment where everyone has the freedom to be their full self. Just to seal the deal, you'll get heaps of flexibility on how you work and be part of a culture where you can contribute and succeed.

About the Role:

We have opportunities for Geospatial Engineers with a strong background in IT working with our team of specialists. In this role, you will be able to engage closely with our clients to provide cutting edge geospatial technological solutions. Our projects span across enterprise geospatial applications, spatial data processing, visualisation, analytics, and platform maintenance. A consultative approach to working with clients is a key enabler for this role.

What you will be involved in:

  • A variety of technical work focused on geospatial platform configuration, customization, and deployment
  • Using geospatial (GIS) software and processes to perform spatial data analysis, visualization, and translation
  • Helping develop project requirements and solution design
  • Supporting the optimization, maintenance, and upgrade of geospatial platforms
  • Being part of a talented and motivated multidisciplinary team, with a focus on building high quality geospatial solutions and products
  • Working in a collaborative, lean and agile environment
  • Delivering successful customer outcomes

What we would expect from you:

  • Demonstrated experience with commercial or Open-Source geospatial platforms such as ESRI, FME, Mapbox, Geoserver, Leaflet, or Google
  • Skills and experience in the automation of geospatial software and data processes using modern scripting languages, such as Python
  • Working knowledge of the software development life cycle, software deployment processes and cloud infrastructure
  • The ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment and customer facing role
  • A Bachelor's degree in associated business disciplines (Geomatics, Land Information, Geography, Computer Science, Information Technology, Remote Sensing)
  • Australian Citizenship and the ability to obtain and maintain a Defence security clearance

Nova's Value Proposition; Beyond the pay cheque:

In addition to salary, you are supported with:

  • Flexible working conditions to suit individual needs and dress for your day
  • Commitment to Professional and Personal Development (up to $5000 per year)
  • Reward & Recognition Program offering exclusive discounts from hundreds of major retailers, helping you to save on groceries, petrol, holidays and more!
  • Additional Leave entitlements include Reserve Leave, Loyalty Leave, Parental Leave and Purchased Leave
  • Wellbeing Hub with access to health and fitness content
  • Employee Assistance Program for employees and family members
  • Access to Defence Health and Travel Insurance
  • Novated Leasing and Salary Sacrifice
  • Nova Employee Share Offer
  • An inclusive and supportive culture
  • A range of other great benefits, just ask us!

To apply, please click on the "apply now" button and submit your resume using the "upload resume" function in PDF Format (only).

Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please call Serena in Nova Talent Acquisition Team on: (08) 8252 7100

Nova Systems does not accept any recruitment agency solicitations.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Do you love a good lamb roast? We’re developing the world’s best technology to measure meat quality. We need a Senior Software Engineer to help us bring it to market.

Miniprobes is a high-tech spin-out from the University of Adelaide. We use precision fibre-optics and near-infrared lasers to build imaging devices less than a millimetre in diameter. Based on 10 years of R&D, our team has developed a new type of imaging technology which we are using to measure meat quality for the livestock industry.

It’s an exciting time to join Miniprobes . We are developing our first product for commercial release. You can be pivotal in creating this new product. We have the expertise, funding and industry partnerships to deliver it to the livestock industry within the next 2 years. You will be part of the team that develops this product. You will also be a foundational employee in this young company as we start on a trajectory of rapid growth.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will help us to develop the software that is at the heart of this system. This includes acquisition, processing and analysis of data from our imaging hardware as well as creating tools to remotely manage installed systems. You will be involved in a range of areas including real-time systems, image processing and machine learning, targeted at a Windows platform.

To be considered for this role you will need:

  • Bachelor of Engineering, Computer Science or related area;
  • At least 5 years software development experience;
  • Experience with C++ and OO concepts.

To apply, submit your resume/CV and a cover letter highlighting any skills and experiences that would make you a vital part of our team.

For further information regarding this position, please contact the Director (Software) at rodney.kirk@miniprobes.com .

title: Residential Drafter
description:
Enduro Builders is a technology driven construction company.  We are at the leading edge of Low Energy and Passive House construction in South Australia.

We leverage our IT assets to produce cost efficient homes and industry leading levels of collaboration, making sure details are sorted out BEFORE the building starts.

Having grown our design arm significantly in the last 12 months, we are looking for an experienced residential drafter, preferably with custom home experience.

Being part of a close knit team means that everyone pulls their weight and we all support each other in making sure we are delivering high quality homes, on time, on budget and defect free.

The scope of this drafting role includes;

  • Carrying out Site measures and drawing up existing conditions
  • Residential custom homes, with an occasional commercial project
  • 3D Modelling
  • Leveraging your IT and CAD skills to assist with data collection and cross checking for Estimating
  • Review of Architectural plans for errors and omissions
  • Carrying out material take offs

Do you think you might have these skills?

  • Some Design flair (you don’t have to have it all, but a little of an eye for it would be invaluable)
  • Comfortable working with clients to review and change drawings to reflect their project needs
  • Good knowledge of building terminology
  • Excellent communication and customer service skills
  • Interest in leveraging your IT and CAD skills into Estimating
  • High level of comfort and speed in Revit and Sketchup (weighted more heavily to Revit)

We would love for you to have an interest in Energy Efficient building , building science and have a passion for delivering the best possible result for clients, this role has the potential growth to learn about estimating and project management.

How to Apply

Do you reckon you’re made of the right stuff to be part of our team?

Applying is simple, just follow the instructions below….if you don’t hear back from us, it's because you missed a step!

Simply call Amy on 0448 616 304 to discuss the role and she will give you an email address to send in your application.

title: Applied Intelligence Support (Data Hub, AiOps, Visualisation)
description:
DXC Technology (DXC: NYSE) is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries.  The company’s technology independence, global talent and extensive partner network combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally. For more information, visit www.dxc.com

Our Applied Intelligence Team (Datahub, AiOps and Visualization products) provides a foundation of information management and analytic capabilities to harness all value from data that matters, to deliver insights at the speed of business and improve business outcomes. Platform X Applied Intelligence products harness the power of data mining, machine learning, Journey Analytics and predictive intelligence to create actionable insight from an operation’s digital footprint.

You will provide support function for our regional toolset covering Applied Intelligence (Datahub, AiOps and Visualisation) activities, that are underpinned by Amazon Web Services (AWS) S3, Athena, AWS IAM and Github. Where an issue is unable to be resolved work with the Intelligence development teams to work through the root cause and issue resolution.

Essential Job Functions

  • Understanding of how to navigate and trouble shoot issues with AWS data toolsets.

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, or related field preferred
  • Three or more years of experience with computer systems or networking
  • Experience working with file and system maintenance procedures

Other Qualifications

  • Good organization skills to balance and prioritize work, and multitask
  • Good analytical and problem solving skills to troubleshoot systems problems
  • Good communication skills to communicate with support personnel, customers, and managers
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Ability to work from home
  • May require on-call and evening work to work with our partners in the US and India
  • Australian Citizenship

Essential Skills/Qualifications:

  • Knowledge and experience in Intelligence / Visualization applications. Support would include, but are not limited to, providing deep level technical support for incidents/break-fix, Participating in DevOps Concepts & Agile methodology. Below are role description/responsibilities (not all inclusive):
  • Data science exposure / experience
  • Hands-On support experience in Intelligence / Visualization applications.
  • Knowledge of key tools used (AWS) S3, AWS Athena, Python, SQL, Ability to do API calls from the desktop , Linux, Windows and Github.
  • Fulfill requests, Investigate and resolve application and infrastructure related incidents
  • Contribute and adhere to defined Request, Incident, Problem and Change Management processes and required SLAs.
  • Perform application run and maintain functions as defined
  • Deploy application releases and patches, update sets using Pipeline release mechanism
  • Participate in the On Call rotation for Severity 1 and 2 incident resolutions
  • Work with product engineering teams to build, design and implement automation, tooling, and coding to continuously improve applications and systems reliability, scalability, and performance
  • Work with product engineering teams throughout the software life cycle ensuring sustainable software releases
  • Act as escalation point for complex or critical issues that have not yet been documented as Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
  • Utilize a deep understanding of service topology and their dependencies required to troubleshoot issues, define mitigations, and facilitate blameless post evaluations
  • Maintain and adhere to operational documentation of standard processes and best practices
  • Maintain application specific support documentation
  • ITIL Process knowledge

Desirable Skills/Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of AWS, DevOps tools: Jenkins, GitHub including Automated Release Pipelines
  • Knowledge of SQL, REST and Integration

Our culture and benefits

DXC is committed to building better futures for our customers, colleagues, environment, and communities. We take care of each other and foster a culture of inclusion, belonging and corporate citizenship. We put this to action developing and implementing societal initiatives within our Social Impact Practice . #WeAreDXC

As an employer of choice, our “people first” philosophy means we offer competitive remuneration, benefits, training and career opportunities that reflect our commitment to improving the lives of our employees, and the communities in which we live and work. Some of these include;

  • Extensive resources to support your onboarding and continual development including DXC University
  • DXC Recognition, our global virtual platform that fosters a culture of appreciation and celebration with real-time reward and recognition
  • We know that great people refer great people. We will reward you when you bring your friends and family to work at DXC
  • More time to do the things you love with flexible leave options, including purchased leave
  • Take time to give back with charitable and emergency services volunteer days
  • Well-being matters to us and our Employee Assistance Program is there to support you and your family
  • And of course, all the basics; novated leasing, discounted health insurance, paid parental leave and many other discounts


Australian Citizenship is essential for this role.

If you're interested in the role and your skills and experience match what we're looking for, please apply!

title: ASO6 Data Analyst (Multiple Positions)
description:
The Data Analyst in the Performance Reporting and Analytics team is responsible for coordinating and undertaking a range of complex data analyses and writing high quality reports which can be used to identify policy and strategic implications. The work of the Data Analyst informs and complements the department’s business intelligence capability and capacity to analyse, manipulate and present data in ways that support the strategic directions of the agency and government.

Please note there are 2 x full-time (1.0 FTE) contracts up to 30 June 2023 and one full-time (1.0 FTE) ongoing role.

Please note to be employed by the department, applicants must be vaccinated against COVID-19 or have an approved medical exemption endorsed by a duly qualified medical practitioner. Unvaccinated people must comply with conditions for unvaccinated people as outlined in the Department’s website. Proof of vaccination status must be provided for sighting on request.

The successful applicant is required to gain a Department for Human Services (DHS) working with children check (WWCC) prior to being employed which is required to be renewed every five years before expiry. The incumbent will be required to undertake RRHAN –EC (Responding to Risks of Harm, Abuse and Neglect - Education Care) Facilitator Lead (Masterclass) extended course or the online (Fundamentals) course which will be required to be updated every three years.
For all other Special Conditions please refer to the Role Description.

Applicants are required to submit a CV, the Application Cover Sheet, Employment Declaration, and a written statement of no more than 1500 words. Written statements should address the criteria outlined in the Role Description. Applicants should include the name, address and contact number of three (3) referees, one being your current line manager.

Enquiries may be addressed to Sandra Pattison on Tel: 8226 1104 or Email: Sandra.pattison@sa.gov.au

For further information and details on how to apply for this vacancy, please go to iworkfor.sa.gov.au and search for vacancy number 484175.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working including part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role.

Closing date is 22/05/2022  5.00PM

title: Research Scientist
description:
The Opportunity
The primary purpose of the role is to manage and deliver scientific outcomes relating to the South Australian Marine Scalefish Fishery, South Australian Lakes and Coorong Fishery (Finfish) and provide scientific support to other projects in the Community-Based Fisheries Sub-Program within the Fisheries Program at SARDI Aquatic Sciences. The Community-Based Fisheries Sub-Program undertakes stock assessments and carries out biological and ecological research to meet the information needs of managers charged with responsibility for managing sustainable exploitation and equitable allocation of finfish fisheries resources in South Australia.

The role contributes to delivering high-quality scientific information and advice to facilitate the sustainable management of community-based fishery resources in South Australian waters, through successful and timely delivery of research, publishing stock assessment reports and articles in peer-reviewed scientific journals. The role contributes to the research assessments and projects overseen by the Community-Based Fisheries Sub-Program. The primary focus of the group is on the population dynamics and fisheries biology of key finfish species and application of the daily egg production method to estimate spawning biomass. Fishery dependent and biological data are integrated in stock assessments that determine the status of harvested populations. The primary outputs are stock assessment reports that provide the scientific basis for sustainable fisheries management. Scientific findings are published in peer-reviewed reports, and national and international journals. Research findings are also communicated directly to PIRSA fisheries managers, fishery licence holders and national and international scientists through relevant steering committees, meetings and conferences. The role is also responsible for exploring opportunities for external funding to conduct new research projects.

The role contributes delivering the agency’s priorities including securing production through biosecurity and efficient and sustainable use of resources.

About Us
The Department of Primary Industries and Regions, as a key economic development agency of the South Australian Government, works across a diverse range of industry sectors including agriculture, livestock, forestry, fishing and aquaculture and regional development. We involve and engage with others to ensure we make good decisions, have clear policies, plan and implement effective programs, drive relevant projects, promote efficient resource use and broker shared responsibility. In this way we enable the State’s primary industry sectors and regions to remain competitive, productive and sustainable.

Benefits
At the Department of Primary Industries and Regions, we offer our employees challenging and rewarding work with opportunities for career progression, learning and development and flexibility.

Our Commitment to Diversity
The Department of Primary Industries and Regions is committed to building a flexible, diverse and inclusive culture, planning for and promoting diversity. We welcome and encourage applications from diverse community groups and ages including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, LGBTIQ, people with disabilities, women and other diversity groups. The Department of Primary Industries and Regions recognises the benefits that such an approach brings for our staff and customers in delivering the future of SA.

Special Conditions

  • Successful applicant will be required to satisfactorily complete a National Police Check (NPC) prior to being made an offer of employment

Requirements

  • To be eligible for this position applicants must be an Australian Citizen or hold a visa that permits you to work in Australia
  • A post-graduate degree in Science with a major in fisheries, zoology or related discipline (or equivalent research experience) is required.
  • Regular intra-state and occasional inter-state travel
  • Full time ongoing role based at West Beach
  • Regular work outside normal working hours
  • Possession of a current C class driver’s licence and willingness to drive
  • May require field trips on research and commercial vessels
  • Willingness to complete additional training as required (e.g. coxswains)
  • You acknowledge your work, health and safety obligations and our expectations

Remuneration
PO3 $96,860 - $102,400 per annum

Enquiries
Jonathan Smart
Phone: 0403555682
Email: jonathan.smart@sa.gov.au
Website: www.pir.sa.gov.au

Applicants must include the contact information of at least 2 referees with 1 being your immediate supervisor/manager and a completed “Pre-Employment Declaration in the SA Public Sector” form.

title: Python Developer
description:
Python Developer

$120k - $130k plus super - ESOP available
Remote distributed team throughout Australia - WFH - offices available in Sydney



If you're a Python Developer who's all about solving interesting problems with robust, well-tested back end logic, then this is the role you've been looking for.

You'd be joining a world-class team of engineers on a truly one-of-a-kind payment & financial management application. The platform has already been extremely well received by the Australian market. Following a $20 million funding round, the plan now is to (quite literally) take on the world.

You'll be joining the team to as they look to internationalise the platform. That means integrating with a new card issuing partner who can support global payments, as well as a rift of new feature/product builds to service and overseas userbase.


Key skills/experience

There's a strong, quality focused engineering culture here, that champions TDD and well designed, well tested solutions. As well as implementing code, you'll also be involved with solution design/architecture and advocating for best practices like TDD.

Key tools/tech you'll work with day-to-day include:

  • Python
  • AWS
  • Relational databases like Postgres/MySQL


Other things that make this role interesting:

  • You'll be joining a business with massive investment that's growing. Fast. That means real opportunity to climb into more senior, challenging positions as the company develops
  • A role that *actually* supports home working. You'll be working as part of a fully distributed team. There's an office in Sydney if you want to use it. It's not mandatory though.
  • Whilst you'll be working on a product that's market tested, there's still a ton of new things to build, and challenges to be worked through. If you enjoy the process of solving technical problems, there's heaps to keep you engaged.


Want to find out more? Just hit "apply" to register your interest.

Alternatively contact Jay at Aurec for more details on this and other Python Developer positions that are remote or remote-first.

title: PhD Scholarship - Parametric VR: Applying and Exploring Virtual Reality Systems
description:
The University of South Australia (UniSA) is Australia’s University of Enterprise. We are South Australia’s largest university and one of the very best young universities in the world. At UniSA, we are authentic, resilient, and influential - and we deliver results. We pride ourselves on our dynamic and agile culture, which embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Plus, we are committed to the principles of excellence and equity.

Our people are critical to our success. They are creative, enterprising and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm.

We educate global professionals ready to create and inspire change, through more than 200 world-class degrees. We deliver outcomes-focused research that is inspired by global challenges and opportunities, to deliver economic and social prosperity.

Our strategic plan, Enterprise25, focusses on our people, programs and precincts, and sets out our path to ensure that we continue to deliver quality teaching, research and student outcomes.

  • 100% of our assessed research rated at or above world-class - 2018 Excellence in Research for Australia (ERA), 4-digit Fields of Research.
  • No. 1 in Australia for industry research income - 2019 THE World University Rankings.
  • No. 1 in Australia for research impact & engagement - 2018 ARC Engagement and Impact Assessment (EI), Combined Impact – Approach to Impact and Engagement on Assessed Fields.
  • Athena Swan Bronze Award.

About the research degree project:

PhD Project - Parametric VR: Applying and Exploring Virtual Reality Systems to Better Support Parametric Design

Inform the impact on architects and industry perceptions regarding adopting VR in Parametric Design

An Australian Research Council (ARC) Discovery Project has been established at the University of South Australia (UniSA) to investigate a new and intuitive set of user interactions for Virtual Reality (VR) to support parametric design in architecture. 'Parametric VR' is a new and exciting research topic that can advance the architecture and construction sector by supporting highly innovative design processes, improved design performances, optimised design interactions, and simplified workflows. These improvements are realised through VR-enabled capabilities: design immersion, virtual prototyping, and cognitive enhancement. As more daily activities are conducted remotely, VR immersive technologies can also effectively support design collaborations. VR can improve interactions in parametric design, which have been critically underdeveloped. Parametric VR will further the developments of both technologies and deepen their impact on the global design industry.

Supported by the Discovery Project team, UniSA Creative is seeking a qualified candidate to conduct a PhD research project to develop and test prototype(s) of Parametric VR, a novel system of VR tools to support parametric design, allowing architects to directly edit parametric design in VR across the project lifecycle. This PhD will specifically focus on design application and adoption of the technological developments including:

  1. Determining appropriate application(s) of VR to the parametric design pipeline and at the true scale of architectural design projects.
  2. Developing/adopting and mapping software tools and VR interactions against the selected parametric processes and tasks.
  3. Testing the effectiveness of Parametric VR prototype(s) and design scenario(s) through user studies with architects.


The project will be hosted at UniSA Creative and the Australian Research Centre for Interactive and Virtual Environments (IVE), in collaboration with UniSA STEM. The successful PhD candidate will be supported by the extended research networks including end-user organisations and international collaborators as enabled by the ARC Discovery Project. The successful candidate will be working amongst a strong cohort of PhD students in IVE, who share similar passion and research interests to create high-impact outputs with strong peer support. During the project, the PhD candidate will be guided to develop research publications in journals and conference for knowledge dissemination and exchange. The successful candidate will also have the opportunity to undertake a placement at the end user organisation to gain end-user/industry experiences and to further validate and disseminate the research.

Supervisory Team

  • Professor Ning Gu - Principal Supervisor
  • Professor Bruce Thomas - Co-Supervisor
  • Dr Andrew Cunningham - Co-Supervisor


Financial Support

This project is funded for reasonable research expenses. Additionally, a living allowance scholarship of $28,854 per annum is available to eligible applicants. A fee-offset or waiver for the standard term of the program is also included. For full terms and benefits of the scholarship please refer to our scholarship information for domestic students or international students.

Eligibility and Selection

This project is open to applications from both domestic and international applicants. Applicants must meet the eligibility criteria for entrance into a PhD. Additionally, applicants must meet the projects selection criteria:

  • Hold a Master of Architecture or an equivalent degree from a related design discipline.
  • Skills and experiences in applying computational design tools in the Architecture, Engineering and Construction (AEC) sectors, especially related to parametric design.
  • Applicants should submit a full research proposal (approximately 2500 words) that has been developed in consultation with the proposed lead supervisor. A template to help guide this application is available here .


Applicants who can also demonstrate the following will be highly regarded:

  • Skills and experiences in developing immersive virtual environments such as VR, Augmented Reality (AR) and other related technologies.
  • Skills and experiences in applying VR, AR and other related technologies in the AEC and other design disciplines.
  • Skills and experiences in computer programming or scripting.


The successful applicant is expected to study full-time and to be based at our City West campus in the heart of Adelaide.

Essential Dates

Applicants are expected to start in a timely fashion upon receipt of an offer. Extended deferral periods are not available. Applications close on Sunday 5 June 2022.

title: Research Officer (Digital Automation Solutions)
description:
The Opportunity

We have an opportunity for a Research Officer (Digital Automation Solutions) to be part of our South Australian Research and Development Institute (SARDI) Division within the Department of Primary Industries and Regions.

The primary purpose of the role is to investigate and deliver new protocols to improve data management and laboratory automation in molecular diagnostics.

The role contributes to delivering the agency’s priorities including growing primary industries and drive regional development.

The role contributes to improving the efficiency of delivering diagnostics to reduce the impact of soil borne diseases to increase productivity of the primary industries.

About Us

The Department of Primary Industries and Regions, as a key economic development agency of the South Australian Government, works across a diverse range of industry sectors including agriculture, livestock, forestry, fishing and aquaculture and regional development. title: Data Platform Architect
description:
The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services, is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organisations to realise their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2020 combined revenues of EUR 15.8 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com [link removed].

Let's talk about the team:

Our Insights and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner with Capgemini for a very good reason - our exceptional people.

Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:

  • Define and ensure a comprehensive and coherent view across Business, Information, Systems and Technology, not just to design IT systems but to deliver Business Change which may also be supported and enabled by IT.
  • Define solutions strategies and roadmaps. Builds Capgemini's image and reputation to the client and the marketplace. Leads coordination of architecture solutions to meet senior level expectations at both client and Capgemini and/or partners. Leads strategic planning of technology and business solutions for the enterprise.  Demonstrates thought leadership in topics in the architect community and shows a passion for technology. Demonstrates business acumen by delivering the architecture program.
  • Define and ensure comprehensive and coherent view across Business, Information Systems and Technology
  • Define strategy and architecture for data estate modernisation, legacy to cloud data migration, data pipeline, data analytics, machine learning pipeline, data trust and data engineering solutions
  • Drive business change supported and enabled by Data and AI
  • You will provide technical solutions to project team to perform design to deployment related activities, provide guidance, perform reviews, prevent, and resolve technical issues
  • You will work with stakeholders including the Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues
  • You will assess and propose methods to improve system performance by conducting tests, troubleshooting, and integrating new element

Let's talk about your capability and experience:

  • Have a minimum of 10 years IT experience and minimum 5 years in solution architecture with data background, whilst leading architecture and solutioning strategy
  • Develop portfolio products and service solutions for Capgemini and Clients
  • Demonstrate technical strategy leadership in one or more technology areas and/or one or more customer facing situations
  • Show proven thought leadership in technical implementation and practices
  • Lead and motivate multi-functional teams in dispersed or complex environments
  • Set and manage the client's expectations from the start
  • Be able to drive projects and initiatives from conception through to implementation
  • Demonstrate excellent written, verbal communication and listening skills
  • Harness your excellent teamwork and leadership skills
  • Have experience managing business and technical stakeholders, managing multi-shore resources in a particular technical area (those being configuration, customisation, data estate modernisation, integration)
  • Be Knowledgable and experienced in Functional Architecture Design, Technical Solution Design
  • Have experience with cloud data platforms and technologies (AWS/Azure) and Big Data technologies (Hadoop/Spark)

Let's talk about what's in it for you!

Passionate people are Capgemini's Ace of Spades - join us to discover a career that will challenge, support and inspire you. Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. You will work alongside some very smart and inspiring people on exciting projects and you will also enjoy incredible benefits.  We offer flexible work practices and 40 hours of self-development every year with a huge selection of learning opportunities to choose from. Capgemini constantly aims for excellence in its operations and the employee experience it provides. In line with our Purpose, Flexible Working aims to improve the overall people experience by providing an optimal work-life balance, more autonomy and freedom in when, where and how we work.

As "Architects of Positive Futures", Capgemini actively supports the community in 3 ways:

Diversity and Inclusion - we believe diversity of thought fuels excellence and innovation, which is why we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age.  To support our commitment to diversity and inclusion, we celebrate or recognise special events and days of significance that are important to our employees such as Diwali, Bastille Day, Pride, IDAHOBIT, IWD and International day of people with Disabilities.  Our Employee Resource Groups Women@Capgemini, OutFront, Indigenous, Parents and Carers and Sustainability Community of Practice support the grassroots passion of employees to drive our diversity agenda and effect change.

Digital inclusion - at Capgemini we are using our skills to drive social impact initiatives focusing on helping society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution.  We also provide employees with opportunities to give back to the community through charity projects and volunteer days.

Environmental Sustainability - Capgemini joined the CDP's (Carbon Disclosure Project) prestigious "A list" for its commitment to the Net-Zero economy. As well as focusing on helping our clients transform towards more sustainable business models, Capgemini recently announced its commitment to becoming a netzero busines by 2030 .

Recognised by Ethisphere as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the last 9 years in a row, ethics and values are at the heart of Capgemini's corporate culture and business.  Embedded in our DNA, our seven values - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty - have remained the same since company inception in 1967. To see how we bring these values to life, visit www.capgemini.com/au-en/careers/ [link removed] and listen to some of our employee's stories.

#GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.

Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.

#LI-YT1

title: Environmental Consultants (Various Positions) - Impact Assessment & Permitting
description:
The Opportunity

AECOM’s pipeline of work continues to grow and as a result, we are seeking applications from experienced Environmental Planners / Engineers / Scientists to join our Impact Assessment and Permitting team in Adelaide to support existing projects and pursue the exciting opportunities ahead.

This is a fantastic opportunity for technical growth, working across a diverse range of environments both in South Australia, Victoria and other regions across Australia. You will work amongst a team of peers and alongside our diverse range of clients on an array of high profile, major projects predominantly focused on transport, infrastructure, defence and renewables with a potential future across a range of sectors. As part of a multi-disciplinary organisation, this role will see you collaborating with other disciplines, giving you wider exposure and understanding.

AECOM provides a great place to work where we place a high priority on a fun and engaging work environment offering career development and mentoring as well as social and wellbeing opportunities. You will be working with driven professionals who are passionate, smart, creative, and quirky but proud to be part of a company that is dedicated to delivering a better world. Our Freedom to Grow program offers potential flexibility to the preferred candidate to partially work remotely and/or from home.

If you are looking to take the next step in your career, or you are coming from another city to establish yourself in Adelaide – AECOM will support you in deepening your technical expertise and growth potential whilst allowing you to enjoy the benefits of Australia’s most liveable city.

Key roles for our Environmental team include:

  • Principal Environmental Planner / Engineer / Scientist

As a principal, you will have strong environmental advisory and impact assessment experience, a detailed legislative understanding and an excellent industry reputation. Your strong commercial acumen and emotional intelligence will help you to develop and maintain positive relationships to enhance client retention and growth, while you draw on your skills to effectively manage resources, timelines, quality and budgets. You will lead junior team members through work activities by providing technical and operational guidance and support.

  • Senior Environmental Planner / Engineer / Scientist

As an experienced environmental professional, you will prepare and step up to manage timely and high-quality environmental impact assessments, constraints analyses, strategic assessments, and environmental management plans and assist in the organisation of resources, budgets, and timelines for the management of these projects. You will develop your skills by working collaboratively to prepare advice, reports, and proposals to clients, and develop effective relationships with key stakeholders to ensure projects are delivered successfully. You will also be responsible for key project-related tasks as required, which may include studies and assessments, data analysis, technical writing, and presentations.

  • Professional Environmental Planner / Engineer / Scientist

As a professional within the team, you will have the opportunity to learn first-hand from our in-house senior advisors and technical leaders. You will work collaboratively to prepare and manage timely and high-quality environmental impact assessments, constraints analyses, strategic assessments and environmental management plans, verifying that construction teams are implementing as planned. You will assist in the organisation of resources, budgets and timelines for the management of these projects where needed and to develop effective relationships with our clients, in-house design teams and technical specialists to ensure projects are delivered successfully.

About You

Ideally, you will have:

  • Relevant years post-graduate experience in impact assessment, ideally in a consulting environment
  • Bachelor’s degree in an appropriate discipline
  • Strong client focus, high level of motivation and dedication and the ability work well in a team environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Well-developed organisational and time management skills
  • A keen interest in further developing your existing skillset but also broadening your experience across a wide range of projects.

Benefits

AECOM is a place where you can maximize your innovative thinking and collaborate with a diverse range of highly intelligent and talented people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, transformational, and iconic projects.

​​​​We're an Equal Opportunity Employer and we've committed to creating a culture that embraces flexibility for all team members. We provide a diverse and inclusive work environment and offer many benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing.

  • Flexible start and finish times, working from home, part-time and job share options
  • Working from Home Tool Kits + Mobile Phone
  • State of the art, modern and contemporary offices
  • Paid Parental and Partner Leave
  • Purchased additional annual leave + salary packaging
  • Corporate Employee discounts from up to 400 retailers
  • Wellbeing benefits e.g., vaccinations, health insurance discounts
  • Employee stock purchase plans
  • Professional memberships
  • Professional and technical development opportunities.

AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or recruitment agencies. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM and in the absence of a signed Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any recruitment fee.

title: Senior SAS Programmer / Statistical Programmer
description:
Avance Clinical - our most important asset is our people. We offer a fun, friendly work environment and a culture that values honesty and respects its people.

Avance Clinical is a Contract Research Organisation which offers specialised services supporting clinical drug development for the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industry.

The Opportunity

If you are highly skilled in SAS programming, are passionate about clinical research and want to work in a challenging and stimulating environment where what you do matters, then we want to hear from you now.

Responsibilities

  • Preparation of listings, tables and figures for clinical study reports.
  • Assist Data Management team in the development and implementation of programmed data checks.
  • Assist Data Management team in reconciliation of external data with data collected in the study database.
  • Preparation of SDTM datasets from various types of source databases.
  • Preparation of analysis datasets based on the CDISC ADaM standard.
  • Preparation of support documentation for CDISC compliant submission packages.

What you’ll need to succeed

  • Ordinary degree in the appropriate discipline or appropriate industry experience.
  • Minimum 4 years’ experience in pharmaceutical / health research.
  • SAS programming experience.
  • Knowledge of ICH GCP Guidelines, medical terminology and clinical trials processes.
  • Formal training in SAS programming (desirable).
  • Experience working with CDISC standards, especially SDTM and ADaM (Highly desirable) .
  • Knowledge of database management (desirable) .
  • Excellent MS Word and Excel skills.
  • Demonstrated initiative, trust and reliability and the ability to work unsupervised.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills.

Benefits

  • Reputable growing CRO with stability
  • Challenging and stimulating environment where what you do matters
  • A diverse and inclusive culture with a strong emphasis on team collaboration
  • Training and career development opportunities
  • Attractive remuneration

To apply

  • Join our team and submit your CV along with a cover letter outlining your skills and experience - please submit as one PDF document.
  • No agencies please

www.avancecro.com

title: Postdoctoral Research Scientist
description:
JR0000004510

Availability:

Fixed-Term until Dec 2025 | Full-Time

Compensation:

Level A

Salary Range:

$78,340 - $94,938 p.a.

Reporting to:

Postdoctoral Research Scientist

Flinders Health and Medical Research Institute

About the Role

An exciting research opportunity is available for a postdoctoral researcher to support Australian Research Council (ARC)-funded research in the team of Dr Yee Lian Chew, based at the Flinders Health and Medical Research Institute, Bedford Park, Flinders University (Kaurna Country).

This project focuses on identifying how proteostasis mechanisms contribute to neuronal ageing using protein proximity-labelling techniques in cultured cells and in Caenorhabditis elegans (nematode roundworm).

The Postdoctoral Research Scientist will drive research activities using cultured cells and C. elegans models, using a combination of protein biochemistry, genetics and microscopy. In this role you will be expected to work under guidance from supervisors (weekly/fortnightly) but will work autonomously on a day-to-day basis.

Our team is dedicated to both promoting equity and inclusivity and acting in an equitable and inclusive way. We also celebrate and champion diversity. We are keen to support the careers of researchers who have had career disruptions or who currently or will in the future, have caring roles. We encourage women and gender diverse applicants, people with a disability, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander descent, and those from culturally diverse backgrounds to apply. The work involves tasks requiring manual dexterity, visual acuity adequate to perform microscopy and dispense small volume, and a willingness to work with nematodes.

About You

You will be an enthusiastic and motivated Postdoctoral Research Scientist with demonstrated organisational skill and the motivation to carry out autonomous research and meet deadlines. You will have well developed interpersonal skills, demonstrating cultural sensitivity and the ability to work effectively as part of a team. You will also show evidence of well-developed written and verbal communication skills, for example, publications or submissions to scientific journals/conference presentations. To be successful in this role you will also demonstrate:

  • A PhD (or will shortly satisfy the requirements of a PhD) in a relevant discipline such as Molecular Biology, Biochemistry and/or Neuroscience (or any relevant field).
  • An ability to apply skills in protein biochemistry, genetics and microscopy across a range of tasks in the completion of research projects.
  • Experience with protein biochemistry (western blotting, sample preparation for mass spectrometry) is highly desirable.
  • Experience with tissue culture and/or elegans is desirable but not essential.

For more information regarding the position, or to have a confidential discussion, please contact: Dr Yee Lian Chew

Life at Flinders

We're transforming, and investing in people and facilities, to create contemporary, stimulating and satisfying learning and work environments that reflect our core values of excellence, innovation, courage, and integrity. Flinders is refocusing its strategic priorities with the aim of elevating its performance to be a top ten Australian university, and amongst the top 1% in the world.

Reaching beyond the limits of buildings, borders, and backgrounds, ours is an inclusive culture that believes absolutely in equality and opportunity for all. We don't just accommodate differences; we embrace and celebrate them. So, why work at Flinders?

  • 17% Superannuation + salary packaging options
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Wide range of professional development activities and services
  • We embrace diversity and promote equity and inclusion for students and staff with disabilities and health conditions , we are committed to Indigenous education and engagement and support initiatives such as The Pride Network
  • Vibrant campus life and amenities including on campus health care services , gym and childcare centre

Prescribed Conditions for Employment

A valid National Police Certificate which is satisfactory to the University will also be required before the successful applicant can commence in this position.

Flinders University has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that requires all new staff members to be up to date with their COVID-19 vaccinations, subject to medical exemptions and limited exemptions.

How to Apply and Information

To view the full position description and apply online , please visit the Jobs@Flinders website via the job portal: JR0000004510 - Postdoctoral Research Scientist

Applications to be submitted before 11:59pm Wednesday 15 June 2022

Please note, late applications and applications sent via agencies will not be accepted .

title: Senior Ecologist
description:
About us:
Succession Ecology is a multi-faceted environmental business, providing a broad range of services in ecological consulting and research, landscape scale restoration and native seed supply. We specialise in large-scale management and restoration of arid systems and the production and sale of native seed. Our focus is on finding unique solutions in nature and applying new and innovative techniques to ecosystem management, which sets us apart in the environment industry.


We are seeking a Senior Ecologist to join our Ecological consulting team. This team works across a broad range of projects including ecosystem recovery, design, management and monitoring, development projects and tailored research programs to support project outcomes. The position will involve field work in locations throughout Australia (typically in SA) and office work based at Edwardstown.


Succession Ecology is a culture and values driven organisation. We are passionate about what we do and look forward to finding a new team member that can contribute to building our positive impact on the environment in Australia. The ideal candidate will be hardworking and adaptable person with an enthusiasm for learning, innovation and being actively involved in making a difference in our unique environment.
Position:


You will need:
• PhD qualification in Ecology or Environmental Science.
• 15 years + experience in the environment industry.
• Extensive research program experience (i.e. ecological surveys, flora and fauna identification, data collection, managing field teams, etc.).
• Highly developed written and verbal communication skills, with experience in data analysis, report writing and preparing management plans.
• Project Management experience
• Botany skills
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team of professionals.
• Ability to travel and stay away for multiple nights.
• Driver’s licence and Four-Wheel Drive Experience.


Beneficial attributes include:
• Experience in GIS, field mapping and developing and managing spatial datasets.
• Knowledge of State/Commonwealth regulatory frameworks and policy.
• Knowledge of South Australian ecosystems.
• NVC accreditation.
• First Aid and White card accreditation.

Applications:
Any queries please call Briony (0410 526 210 ) during business hours.
Otherwise, applications should be sent to jobs@successionecology.com.au


www.successionecology.com.au
Closing Date: Friday 10th June 2022

title: Contaminated Land Consultant
description:
The Role

We have a unique opportunity for an Environmental Scientist / Engineer to join our Environmental Team based in Adelaide and to take the next step in their career. You will primarily assist with fieldwork, reporting and project management aspects of multiple concurrent contamination investigations and remediation projects of varying size and complexity.

This position will provide experience and a greater level of responsibility working on a diverse array of projects across private and public (State and Federal) sector clients including Department of Defence, oil and gas, transport, mining, water and energy. You will work amongst a team of peers and alongside our clients and subcontractors, while learning first-hand from our in-house senior advisors and technical leaders both in Adelaide and across the world.

You will be required to multi-task, contribute to and prepare reports independently, plan, manage and supervise out field work, liaise with subcontractors and the client, and assist with preparing bid and tender processes. The typical works expected to be undertaken in this position may include:

  • Preliminary and Detailed Site Investigations
  • Remedial Action Plans
  • Site Validation Reports
  • Waste Classifications
  • Site supervision and contractor management
  • Data management and validation
  • Project management tasks.

AECOM provides a great place to work where we place a high priority on an engaging work environment offering career and technical development, as well as social and wellbeing opportunities.

We aim to deliver excellence by making sure that our staff are “Set up for Success” and that the projects and works we do are balanced between the skills and support of staff members, the opportunity for staff to grow their skills and experience, and the needs of our clients are met to the high professional and technical standards.

About You

  • Relevant experience (approx. 5-10 years) in a consultancy environment or related industry, specifically in contaminated land assessment and remediation.
  • Experience in preliminary and detailed site investigations for soil, vapour and groundwater.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently or in groups.
  • Commitment to safety and safe management of works.
  • Bachelor's degree in an appropriate discipline such as environmental science, engineering, geology, or earth science.
  • Experience in data management software (ESDAT / Equis) and preparation of environmental reports.
  • Experience in communication and management of subcontractors or client expectations.
  • Defence Baseline Clearance or experience with Department of Defence works (preferred).

Benefits at AECOM

AECOM is a place where you can maximize your innovative thinking and collaborate with a diverse range of highly intelligent and talented people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, transformational, and iconic projects.

We're an Equal Opportunity Employer and we've committed to creating a culture that embraces flexibility for all team members. We provide a diverse and inclusive work environment and offer many benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing.

  • Flexible start and finish times, working from home, part-time and job share options
  • Working from Home Tool Kits + Mobile Phone
  • State of the art, modern and contemporary offices
  • Paid Parental and Partner Leave
  • Purchased additional annual leave + salary packaging
  • Corporate Employee discounts from up to 400 retailers
  • Wellbeing benefits e.g. vaccinations, health insurance discounts
  • Employee stock purchase plans
  • Professional memberships
  • Professional and technical development opportunities.

AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or recruitment agencies. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM and in the absence of a signed Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any recruitment fee.

title: Principal Mechanical Engineer
description:
48,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.
We’re not just engineers. We’re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet’s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.

Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visit Worley.com [link removed]

Purpose You will provide mechanical engineering services on large or mega projects to Worley' and its customers', including technical support and supervision within the mechanical engineering team.
Responsibilities
  • Manage mechanical engineering services that meet Worley', its customers' and applicable statutory and regulatory specifications, on time and within budget.
  • Manage mechanical engineering project requirements.
  • Manage mechanical engineering services such as:
    • participate in relevant meetings, prepare progress reports and comply with required checking procedures;
    • ensure the project scope is clear and that changes comply with project change management processes;
    • provide advice during procurement, construction and commissioning activities.  For example, oversee requisitions, technical bid evaluations and purchase order preparation.
  • Act as the mechanical engineering Lead on specific projects.
  • If responsible for a team:
    • outline project requirements including actively promoting workshare, where appropriate, assign tasks and supervise progress; and
    • ensure the required services meet Worley, its customers and applicable statutory and regulatory requirements, on time and within budget.
  • Proactively resolve any discrepancies between Worley and its Customer's requirements.
  • Keep up-to-date with the latest developments and technical innovations in mechanical engineering.
  • If required, assist and support junior personnel within the mechanical engineering team.
  • Communicate effectively with the mechanical engineering team and project stakeholders, including the Customer.
  • Identify issues and problems, develop appropriate solutions, and ask for assistance when required.

What you will bring Technical and Industry Experience
  • Excellent technical and practical engineering skills and ability to consistently deliver quality, accurate and timely work to Worley and its clients.
  • Excellent knowledge of the fundamental requirements of the mechanical engineering, and the basic requirements of other engineering fields.
  • Excellent knowledge of applicable local and international standards and statutory and regulatory specifications.
  • Competent use of relevant software such as MS Office Suite and mechanical engineering specific software.
  • Extensive technical and practical experience in mechanical engineering in the same or similar industry including experience in working in multi-disciplinary projects and teams.
Education – Qualifications, Accreditation, Training Required:
  • A recognized and relevant engineering degree.
  • Chartered Professional Engineer (CPEng) status.
  • Relevant postgraduate qualifications in engineering; management, project management or supervisory qualifications or equivalent.
Our goal is to develop and most importantly retain the people who share our vision and strategy.  To help us achieve our vision and yours, apply now.

title: Director of Engineering Excellence
description:
Job Title:                       Director of Engineering Excellence

Location:                      South Australia, Australia

Division:                        Australian Cycling Team

Reports to:                   Executive General Manager - Performance

Pre-amble

We exist to unleash the unbound potential of every body.

Cycling is more than a sport - it’s a lifestyle.

Our DNA was forged from more than 130-years of history and an unwavering pursuit of excellence.

We believe in the joy and positive power of cycling.  We believe that every time we jump on a bike, we’re choosing to make a difference – to our mind, body and country.

We know that riding a bike can transform us individually, connect us as a community, inspire us as a Nation and create a healthier Australia.

And it doesn’t matter what bike or where we ride it, as our strength is in our diversity.

We’re here to inspire and ensure that current and future generations experience both the simple joy of riding a bike and the opportunity to reach their full potential.

We exist because riding a bike matters to Australia.

Our commitment is to be a leader in the movement that unites Australia around a passion for cycling.

We are here to Unite, Empower, Inspire, Connect, Grow.

#RideNation #LetsRideTogether #UnleashOurUnboundPotential

Description of Role:

The Director of Engineering Excellence will plan and deliver all equipment research, design and development plus reliability systems.  This will include;

  1. Line manage equipment and data facing staff members in the Engineering Excellence branch
  2. define equipment requirements and specification
  3. lead design work within and outside AusCycling
  4. oversee equipment construction, assembly, and qualification
  5. define and lead reliability systems, including daily service part lifespan
  6. engage in development and work within the Quality-of-Service framework of AusCycling
  7. support technical projects for Athlete Performance Development including data, electronic and other technical projects

The Director of Engineering Excellence will answer directly to the EGM Performance and maintain close contact with the Australian Institute of Sport’s Applied Technology (AT&I) department including the AT&I Director.  Projects shall include Engineering, Data and Electronic projects and Technical Lead will need to be able to demonstrate competence and ability to deliver across many skill sets.   Delivery will be across numerous cycling disciplines (within and without the ACT) and potentially other sports and will require a candidate who will adhere to the highest standards of professional excellence to ensure all equipment is fit for purpose.
Objectives

  • Australians contesting the biggest bike events on the planet

Key Results

  • Quality of new and existing products, physical and data driver
  • Equipment failures (lack thereof)
  • Results at World Championships and Major Games

Key Role Responsibilities:

Be part of the AusCycling Performance Senior Management Team (SMT).

Definition and ongoing development of the ACT’s Quality Operating System as it pertains to equipment including;

  • Governance
  • Usage definitions – load cases, lifing, fitness for purpose
  • Workshop/mechanic procedure definitions
  • Sign-off procedures – component verification testing
  • Lead all equipment development and specification
  • Support and deliver technical projects required by AusCycling as defined by the EGM – Performance
  • Lead and develop Engineering and Design capacity within AusCycling to enable delivery of world best equipment.
  • Uphold AusCycling Code of Conduct

People Management

  • Manages the Service Course Manager, Data scientist, Graduate Data Scientist, Head of Aerodynamics
  • Collaborates and seeks advise from the special advisor - engineering

Budget Management

Be the overall budget holder for the Engineering Excellence branch. Assist the Head of Performance Support and Head of Aerodynamic Solutions in the development of Equipment / Technology Roadmap and budgets, specifically in relation to:

  • Identification of equipment performance / reliability opportunities
  • Management of engineering projects, resources and budgets
  • Relationships with equipment partners.

Experience and Qualifications:

  • Minimum Graduate Degree in Mechanical Engineering
  • At least 5 years professional experience in a relevant high performance environment – e.g. Defence, Motorsport, Aerospace
  • Familiar with relevant mechanical engineering design standards.
  • CAD and FEA toolset experience.

Skills Knowledge and Experience:

  • Strong first principles mechanical engineering design
  • Creating an Inclusive Environment
    • Making decisions and initiating action to ensure that high performance system policies and practices leverage the capabilities and insights of individuals with diverse backgrounds, cultures, styles, abilities, and motivation.
  • Coaching and Developing Others
    • Providing feedback, instruction, and development guidance to help others excel in their current or future job responsibilities, planning and supporting the development of individual skills and abilities
  • Numeracy and analytical capability to enable modelling of complex systems – solid mechanics, dynamics and physics fundamentals
  • Demonstrated interpersonal and written communication skills to provide advice and guidance to a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Diverse technical background to project leadership level in all areas of technical projects.
  • Good time management, with the ability to identify and achieve work objectives within a fast-moving environment.
  • Able to engage with external partners – industrial and academic, in short- and longer-term R&D projects, as required.

Key High Performance Behaviours:

  • Commitment, drive and initiative to achieve program outcomes, with the ability to work as a member of a team and unsupervised
  • Capacity to cooperate and work well with others in a cross-functional environment to pursue team goals, share information, support others, show consideration and respect for alternate ideas and solutions.
  • Motivation and passion to study a situation at all levels and help in defining the core issues before then working on solutions
  • Adherence to best practice at all times, willing to check and challenge, able to give positive feedback
  • A team player who not only delivers excellence but brings this out in those around them
  • Passion for excellence and strong desire to excel | actively accommodates and implements change initiatives; identifies opportunities for improvement and constructively challenges traditional assumptions and methods
  • Team working | brings vision and develops direction and structure, ensures clarity of role and purpose; facilitates the completion of team goals; involves others in team decisions and shares important and relevant information
  • Sets high standards of performance for self and others | assumes responsibility and accountability for successfully completing tasks, ensuring high quality; sets standards for excellenc
  • Communication | clearly conveys information and ideas to individuals and groups; adjusts communication to meet expectations
  • Commitment to continuous learning | actively identifies new areas for learning; regularly takes advantage of learning opportunities

Mandatory employment conditions include:

  • Working with Children’s Check clearance from the relevant authority;
  • Satisfactory Police Check (in the absolute discretion of the Company);
  • Satisfactory No Doping Declaration (in the absolute discretion of the Company).
  • Successful completion and currency of Level 1 & 2 Sport Integrity Australia (SIA) accreditation
  • Successful completion of SIA "Keep Sport Honest" Anti-match fixing education components

Application Instruction:

To be considered for this role, please send you current CV and cover letter to Irene Stamatopoulos at recruitment@auscycling.org.au

Only those applicants shortlisted for interview will be contacted

title: Full Stack Developer
company: Talent – SEEK Recruitment Agency of the Year | 7 Time Winner
description:
Our client is a leading financial advisor and solutions provider across Australia and New Zealand. They have a team of developers empowered to contribute to our technical direction and work closely with data science team to develop cloud-based scalable software solutions for small/medium size businesses (SMEs) using cutting-edge technologies.

This organisation is looking for a Full Stack Developer (60% Front-end and 40% Back-end) who is comfortable with both front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks and third-party libraries. As well as be a team player with a knack for visual design and utility.

What to expect in this role:
  • Develop and implement complex frontend web applications using React, Vue js, Typescript
  • Adopt best practices for DevOps, follow our agile process and improve application performance wherever possible
  • Strong experience in working with APIs and set up data pipeline through APIs to integrate developed portals with other platforms
  • Build scalable cloud services and functions that integrate with a variety of data stores, queues, hubs and 3rd party services
  • Ship reliable, efficient and well documented code
  • Work collaboratively with our data scientists to drive work to completion
  • Work with internal and external delivery teams to ensure that the end product meets the goals of the company and users
  • Ensure the continual improvement of quality through maintenance of unit tests and other testing
  • Participate in the team development cycle via sprint planning, execution, retrospectives and backlog grooming etc.
  • Help to determine product development direction by providing technical and non-technical feedback on the product backlog
  • Ensure development follows systems and solutions architectures in support of the product roadmap and company vision
  • Collaborate to create supporting documentation around software solutions
What you’ll need:
  • Experience building secure, scalable and cost-efficient PaaS services on the Microsoft Azure platform, AWS or equivalent cloud platforms
  • Strong programming skills using Python for back end and React for front end development
  • Experience developing applications with Django backend framework
  • Experience building REST APIs
  • Experience with common data stores (SQL, Document DB, Blob storage, etc.)
  • Experience working in an Agile methodology (Scrum/Kanban/etc.) with the ability to perform multiple roles (Developer, Scrum Master) Good interpersonal skills, with excellent written and verbal communication.
  • Minimum 3 years’ relevant experience
  • Able to analyse problems and strategies to formulate better solutions.
  • Forensic eye for detail, with the capacity to prioritise and manage time effectively.
  • Creative problem solver who thrives when presented with a challenge.
  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Up-to-date on the latest industry trends; able to articulate trends and potential clearly and confidently.
Preferred, not required:
  • Experience with microservices and serverless architectures
  • Azure deployment experience, especially serverless functions and Azure authentication management
Benefit to expect:
  • Great culture and work life balance
  • Ability to work remotely across Australia
  • Supportive environment and self-developments
If the role sounds of interest, please apply by clicking the "APPLY” button today! For more information feel free to contact Peter Li on 0431 436 660 or at peter.li@talentinternational.co
