title: Client Services - Associate
description:
Who are we?
CoreLogic is the leading provider of property data and analytics in Australia and New Zealand. We’re fiercely independent, and we’re considered the best in the business. Every day, our data scientists and researchers collect data from over 4.5 billion points across the CoreLogic universe. We then rinse and finesse this data to transform it into powerful property market insights that drive the best property decisions.

Our purpose
At CoreLogic, we help people build better lives by providing rich property insights that inform the very best property decisions. We know that behind all the numbers, algorithms, and sophisticated data technology there are people, families, and communities. There are hopes, dreams, ambitions, journeys, expectations, fears, crossed fingers and vulnerability. It’s those things that matter. And it’s those things that we want to connect with, enable and tackle.


Our principles
Our four principles are the backbone of our organisation. They represent what we believe in and they guide the way we behave.

  • Accuracy is everything
  • We remain independent
  • Our data vision is 360
  • We seize the opportunity


We’re an agile, empowered and pragmatic workforce, driven to forge meaningful, mutually beneficial relationships with our diverse range of customers.

Who are you?

You live and breathe customer service. You’re passionate about helping our customers uncover the value in our products and services and use them to their full capabilities – if our customers need some help to navigate a feature or they request a status update you are patient and energised about expertly guiding them through this.

Your service ethos is excellent, you know how to have great conversations with customers. That’s why you trust your own judgment and your ability to positively influence an organisation, even without a direct reporting line.

But you’re also a team player. You thrive in a collaborative environment, working with like-minded colleagues to build a world-class customer service function and create memorable experiences.

What’s the role?

Our business is only as strong as the service we provide to our customers. That’s where you come in. Your work lays the foundation for all of the customer promises we have made when they selected to do business with CoreLogic, ensuring we deliver world-class, scalable customer experiences for our market leading products.

This role is critical to the success of CoreLogic. You’ll be responsible for driving customer outcomes across the business, by ensuring our customers get value from our products and services, they receive help when they need it and you always offer more than what they are asking – this could be promoting our free training, helping our suppliers to deliver on time to our customers or understanding the incredible breadth of our data. Working closely with our leadership team, you’ll also have a hand in boosting advocacy and increasing customer satisfaction across all our channels.

Your purpose?

To create a memorable impression for CoreLogic’s customers, knowing that we are enthusiastic about providing them the very best service experience possible and they look forward to talking to us again.

What will you be doing?

The role includes:

  • ensuring all customer enquiries, through phone, chat and email are undertaken with care
  • removing roadblocks for our customers and suppliers, making it really easy to do business with us
  • perform workflow system and administrative updates
  • shaping the service culture across the business by supporting the removal of customer points of friction and promoting self-serve data capabilities

​

Are you the right fit?

You need to have:

  • proven experience in
  • creating great customer relationships and building rapport – we don’t focus on handle time here, just customer satisfaction.
  • producing simple, easy to understand help for our customers to use our products effectively
  • you can help a customer get the outcome they are looking for, without arduously explaining internal processes – make it effortless!
  • great adaptability in learning new systems with speed and ability to multi task
  • a demonstrated ability to
  • deal with complexity and many unknowns in a decision process
  • champion customer outcomes within our organisation, don’t settle for the status quo if it impacts a customer’s impression of products
  • quickly build valuable relationships within a business
  • excellent written and oral communication skills
  • confidence in speaking to customers to present complex processes in simple ways
  • collaborate and want to immerse yourself in a highly engaged and positive culture

What credentials do you need?

  • A solid understanding of, and expertise in delivering fantastic customer outcomes
  • 1+ years of service experience, in a call centre, retail or hospitality​

​

What does success look like?

Your Key Performance Indicators are based on:

  • customer service survey results
  • ensuring our customers have a consistent and quality outcome
  • servicing our enquiry channels promptly inline with SLAs

title: Graduate Software Engineer
description:
About Consilium Technology:

As leaders in artificial intelligence, we are on a mission to unlock the world's creativity. We're achieving this by providing modelling, simulation, and machine learning solutions that allow our customers to make more informed, data-driven decisions. As a team, we are committed to embracing the unknown and pushing the boundaries.

Our strong presence within defence enables us to remain abreast of technological advances - with our innovative solutions having a transformational impact in the mining, energy, manufacturing and agriculture industries. We've also launched a number of revolutionary products and are currently solving some of industry's most complex problems.

Join us as we challenge the status quo and solve the puzzle together. Let's deliver awesome and define what is possible!

The opportunity:

We pride ourselves on delivering the best possible modelling, simulation, and machine intelligence solutions by working with private and public sector clients.

We're currently looking for a Graduate Software Engineer to work with on a new project.

This role will involve collaborating with a passionate team of software engineers and data scientists, shaping software to meet client needs. You will provide best practice software development in various modern languages and cloud-based deployment as well as participate in release and sprint planning sessions, daily stand-up meetings, sprint demos, retrospectives, story grooming sessions, and any other Kanban/Scrum-related meetings.

This role is located in the Adelaide CBD with some reasonable business travel required.

If this sounds like you, please read on.

What you'll need to succeed:

  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline
  • Thorough understanding of the entire software development lifecycle
  • Knowledge of contemporary software engineering process, standards, principles and best practices
  • Knowledge of object oriented programming languages (e.g. Python, C++, Java or C#)
  • Knowledge of version control tools (e.g. Git)
  • Ability to work autonomously and within a team
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Initiative and a desire to challenge yourself and continuously improve

What will make you stand out from the rest:

  • Knowledge of diverse software development principles, covering concurrency, design patterns and performance profiling and tuning
  • Knowledge of multiple software languages and environments
  • Knowledge of cloud development platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.)
  • Knowledge in developing cloud-based web applications

What's in it for you?

In return for your hard work, we offer an attractive salary, a flexible family-friendly culture that fosters collaborative work practices, leaders who care and an ongoing commitment to employee development through training and professional development opportunities.

This is a great opportunity to further expand your professional skills and collaborate with the best in your industry.

How to apply

Applicants must have full work rights to apply. Eligible applicants should apply online and submit a cover letter and resume. Applications close Friday, 27 May 2022 , however, if this position interests you, we strongly encourage you to submit an application as soon as possible. We will be reviewing applications as they are received and may conduct interviews prior to this date.

For more information about Consilium Technology, please visit our website at https://consilium.technology.

Recruiters, we got this!

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
• Work on innovative projects with great people
  • Gain experience with leading edge technology stacks.
  • Working within a highly experienced Agile team
  • Truly global business

About Us

EduCo is a globally connected team of international education professionals who deliver customised solutions to our partner universities. With more than 200 staff operating in 20 countries, we have the knowledge, experience, and software platforms (Accelerate) to maintain our leading edge.

Accelerate is an intelligent digital platform that enables universities to rapidly scale up and diversify their global reach and international enrolments. Utilising the latest Technologies, Cloud Platforms, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Analytics, Microservices and Responsive Design. Our vision for Accelerate is for it to become the international education industry’s leading B2B student recruitment platform.

Key Technologies

  • Languages: Java, Python or equivalent OO structural programming languages
  • Platforms: AWS (EC2,S3, RDS, Elastic Search), Liferay, Salesforce, HubSpot
  • Service: AppSync, GraphQL, REST, API technologies. RPA technologies
  • Tooling: Jira, Confluence, GitHub, AWS Pipeline, Docker, Kibana, CloudWatch
  • Front-End: HTML/CSS/JavaScript, basic React/Redux desirable.

The Opportunity

Are you looking for a role that allows you to work in a global organization in a solid growth phase, with talented individuals and opportunities to develop and grow with the organization?

A new opportunity exists for an energetic and results-focused Senior Full Stack Developer to join our Technology team at Accelerate.

Reporting to the SVP Information Technology, you will work as the Senior Full Stack Developer in the Technology team at Accelerate. As part of a cross-functional team you will be responsible for designing and implementing future-proof solutions that best meets the technical and operational requirements of the business and the users.

The role can be based in Melbourne or Adelaide with the opportunity to work remotely from home.

What you will do

As the Senior Full Stack Developer, you will be responsible for developing new features (front, middle and back office), building linkages between internal and client systems, and maintaining current platforms. To create fully functional and robust solutions which are embedded or integrated with our various platforms.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Work collaboratively with the internal development team, product managers and external vendors to ideate software solutions based on a project brief.
  • Implement future-proof solutions that best meet the technical and operational requirements of the business whilst optimising quality, performance, security and maintainability.
  • Design, develop, test and document software and systems that are performant and maintainable.
  • Developing back-end services that will serve both external and internal website applications.
  • Design, write, develop and implement effective and scalable web service APIs.
  • Create and ensure that non-functional requirements such as security, data protection, performance, maintainability, scalability, usability, and reliability are being considered when architecting solutions.
  • Partner with data scientists and analysts to improve software meeting both technical and user needs.
  • Delivery of project from conception to finished product.

About You

You will have.

  • Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role in a commercial environment with
  • 5+ years software development experience
  • 3+ years working within an agile / lean delivery framework (Scrum, RUP, XP, DSDM, SAFE).
  • Strong appreciation of Software Design principles, software patterns, best practice and software architecture
  • Strong Focus on security and cyber awareness.
  • Strong technical foundation and experience with:
  • advanced structured programming such as Java, PHP, C#, C++, LAMP, Node.js, MEAN, MERN, WISA, React
  • Enterprise platforms to achieve business goals (Liferay, Salesforce, AWS, SharePoint, HubSpot) or equivalents.
  • Good expwreince working with AWS Cloud
  • API technologies (AppSync, HTTP, REST, GraphQL)
  • OO concepts, unit testing, TDD, refactoring techniques, continuous integration, standard messaging, and communication protocols
  • Tertiary qualifications in engineering, software engineering, science or related is required and relevant certifications within Information Technology/Computer Systems Technology will be highly regarded.

Benefits

In return, the successful candidate will be rewarded with a competitive salary, and most importantly an opportunity to grow and develop and to build a successful career with support from experienced and highly respected colleagues in a global business, work within a fun, friendly and, culturally diverse environment.

  • Supportive, friendly, experienced team members, working within a collaborative and inclusive culture.
  • Flexible work arrangements & work-life balance, including working remotely from home.
  • Agile work practices that focus to drive innovation and entrepreneurship.
  • Professional Development: LinkedIn Learning and Well-being Lunch and Learn series
  • Star: Employee Reward & Recognition Program
  • Employee Assistance and Wellness Program
  • Opportunity to shape and drive the development of an innovative fast-growing business.
  • CBD location and walking distance from public transport.

For interested candidates click Apply for this job.

As an equal opportunity employer, EduCo values employee diversity and we are committed to building a more inclusive workplace. We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community.

Please note: Only people with the right to work in Australia may apply for this position.

title: Risk Advisory - Data & Analytics - 2022/23 Graduate Program (Adelaide)
description:
Job Requisition ID: 27675

  • Start your career with Australia’s most impactful risk advisory team and be empowered and trusted to build your skills on real client work and purpose led transformation projects at some of Australia’s most significant organisations
  • Be part of Australia’s largest cohort of graduates – meaning you’ll have a community of other grads to lean on and learn from!
  • Join an organisation recognised for its commitment to diversity and wellbeing in the workplace, and where making an impact that matters is our goal

You love working with numbers and large data sets (the more unstructured – the better!). In Data and Analytics (Adelaide), we help clients navigate risks and capture opportunities with insights from their data.

What will you get to do?
With a focus in the Adelaide market and working with leaders across the Deloitte network as part of the new centre for innovation and technology. Your passion for all things data and numbers will help deliver solutions to our clients whilst developing meaningful insights with our clients and network of talented specialists.
On a typical project, you’ll start off by sourcing and preparing data for analysis. Then, you’ll dive deep into the data using software like Excel, SQL and statistical modelling and visualisation software such as SAS, SPSS, R, Tableau and Power BI. Don’t fret, you'll have 100% support from the team as you pick up these new skills! Once you’ve discovered hidden data insights, you’ll get to develop tailored recommendations and solutions for the client. Pretty cool, right?
Working with our team you will apply Deloitte best practice data tools and techniques for use cases such as Risk Analytics, Financial Services, Cyber Security, Business Analytics, Operational intelligence and IoT.

Your future starts with us.
At Deloitte, diversity in our teams make us unique and supports our aspiration of making an impact that matters to our clients and teams, in this team you will gain exposure to a number of areas: -

  • Data analytics and insights
  • Data engineering
  • Big data, artificial intelligence and machine learning
  • Data quality and integration
  • Data management and governance
  • Enterprise data warehouse design and implementation
  • Cloud-based modern data platforms
  • Complex, large-scale data programs

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.
You are an inquisitive student with a knack for solving complex problems. You may also have:

  • Bachelor degree or higher qualification in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Commerce, IT, Computer Science or equivalent fields
  • Great attention to detail
  • Strong interpersonal skills and thrive in collaborative environments
  • A passion for data analysis and presenting data for visual impact
  • Not essential but desirable knowledge in SQL, SAS, Python, Power BI, Tableau, or other programming languages

Why Deloitte?
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.
We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.
We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

Next Steps
Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

By applying to this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.

At Deloitte, we know we’re at our best when we look out for one another; prioritise respect, fairness, development and wellbeing; foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their background, experience, identity, ability or thinking style, and if you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process for accessibility reasons this is available upon request.

The preferred candidate will be subject to background screening by Deloitte or by their external third-party provider.

title: Environmental Consultants – Impact Assessment & Permitting
description:
Job Summary

AECOM’s pipeline of work continues to grow and as a result, we are seeking applications from experienced Environmental Planners / Engineers / Scientists to join our Impact Assessment and Permitting team in Adelaide to support existing projects and pursue the exciting opportunities ahead.

This is a fantastic opportunity for technical growth, working across a diverse range of environments both in South Australia, Victoria and other regions across Australia. You will work amongst a team of peers and alongside our diverse range of clients on an array of high profile, major projects predominantly focused on transport, infrastructure, defence and renewables with a potential future across a range of sectors. As part of a multi-disciplinary organisation, this role will see you collaborating with other disciplines, giving you wider exposure and understanding.

AECOM provides a great place to work where we place a high priority on a fun and engaging work environment offering career development and mentoring as well as social and wellbeing opportunities. You will be working with driven professionals who are passionate, smart, creative, and quirky but proud to be part of a company that is dedicated to delivering a better world. Our Freedom to Grow program offers potential flexibility to the preferred candidate to partially work remotely and/or from home.

If you are looking to take the next step in your career, or you are coming from another city to establish yourself in Adelaide – AECOM will support you in deepening your technical expertise and growth potential whilst allowing you to enjoy the benefits of Australia’s most liveable city.

Key roles for our Environmental team include:

  • Principal Environmental Planner / Engineer / Scientist

As a principal, you will have strong environmental advisory and impact assessment experience, a detailed legislative understanding and an excellent industry reputation. Your strong commercial acumen and emotional intelligence will help you to develop and maintain positive relationships to enhance client retention and growth, while you draw on your skills to effectively manage resources, timelines, quality and budgets. You will lead junior team members through work activities by providing technical and operational guidance and support.

  • Senior Environmental Planner / Engineer / Scientist

As an experienced environmental professional, you will prepare and step up to manage timely and high-quality environmental impact assessments, constraints analyses, strategic assessments, and environmental management plans and assist in the organisation of resources, budgets, and timelines for the management of these projects. You will develop your skills by working collaboratively to prepare advice, reports, and proposals to clients, and develop effective relationships with key stakeholders to ensure projects are delivered successfully. You will also be responsible for key project-related tasks as required, which may include studies and assessments, data analysis, technical writing, and presentations.

  • Professional Environmental Planner / Engineer / Scientist

As a professional within the team, you will have the opportunity to learn first-hand from our in-house senior advisors and technical leaders. You will work collaboratively to prepare and manage timely and high-quality environmental impact assessments, constraints analyses, strategic assessments and environmental management plans, verifying that construction teams are implementing as planned. You will assist in the organisation of resources, budgets and timelines for the management of these projects where needed and to develop effective relationships with our clients, in-house design teams and technical specialists to ensure projects are delivered successfully.

Minimum Requirements

Ideally, you will have:

  • Relevant years post-graduate experience in impact assessment, ideally in a consulting environment

  • Strong client focus, high level of motivation and dedication and the ability work well in a team environment

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Well-developed organisational and time management skills

  • A keen interest in further developing your existing skillset but also broadening your experience across a wide range of projects.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in an appropriate discipline.

Benefits at AECOM

AECOM is a place where you can maximize your innovative thinking and collaborate with a diverse range of highly intelligent and talented people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, transformational, and iconic projects.

​​​​​​​

We're an Equal Opportunity Employer and we've committed to creating a culture that embraces flexibility for all team members. We provide a diverse and inclusive work environment and offer many benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing.

  • Flexible start and finish times, working from home, part-time and job share options

  • Working from Home Tool Kits + Mobile Phone

  • State of the art, modern and contemporary offices

  • Paid Parental and Partner Leave

  • Purchased additional annual leave + salary packaging

  • Corporate Employee discounts from up to 400 retailers

  • Wellbeing benefits e.g., vaccinations, health insurance discounts

  • Employee stock purchase plans

  • Professional memberships

  • Professional and technical development opportunities.

What We Offer

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Job Category Engineering - Environmental

Business Line Environment

Business Group Design and Consulting Services Group (DCS)

Country Australia

Position Status Full Time

Requisition/Vacancy No. 266409BR

Virtual: No

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

title: Materials Scientist
description:
TekCyte is a medical coating company, based at Mawson Lakes SA, that develops and manufactures polymer coatings for the medical device industry. The facility is situated on the UniSA Mawson Lakes Campus.

We are currently seeking an energetic and enthusiastic scientist, with a background in chemistry and/or materials sciences. Experience in surface analytical techniques is desirable but not essential. The role requires working in a team to develop novel coating technologies for biomedical and industrial applications. The right candidate will need to ﬁt into our dynamic technology development team.

Tasks and Responsibilities

  • Report to the Senior Materials Engineer
  • Carry out experiments and research work according to protocols provided by the Senior Materials Engineer.
  • Record all experimental details according to TekCyte’s quality policies. Perform data analysis and prepare graphs.
  • Create presentation slides to help Senior Materials Engineer present results.
  • Ability to navigate online resources to gather information.
  • Produce technical documents such as technical reports, standard operating procedures and work instructions.
  • Adhere to TekCyte and UniSA OHS guidelines while working within TekCyte’s or UniSA’s laboratories.
  • Maintain laboratory equipment in good working order.

Skills and Experience

Essential

  • A Bachelor degree in relevant disciplines (e.g. materials science, chemistry, physics, chemical engineering or biochemistry)
  • Knowledge of thin ﬁlm coating techniques
  • Excellent analytical and technical skills.
  • Good observational skills
  • Good time-management skills
  • Good writing and communication skills

Desirable

  • Experience in biomedical and/or medical device industry
  • Experience in developing coatings for biomedical devices
  • Experience with analytical techniques such as XPS, SEM, and Sessile drop
  • Experience in research laboratories

title: Digital Advertising Agency - Multiple Positions at RQmedia
description:
RQmedia is at the fore of e-commerce advertising.  We work with over 100 national brands and grow their sales through online advertising.   We have won numerous awards and provide ongoing career opportunities.  We are growing and have several exciting opportunities.

New roles available

  • Experienced Digital Account managers - who love talking to customers and working on advertising plans to achieve customer goals
  • Graduate roles for those who have just completed their degrees

Experienced Account Manager

Do you know the fundamentals about Google and/or Facebook advertising.  We are always looking for experienced people to join our team.  You should ideally have 3-5 years experience growing and managing a portfolio of retail brands.  Please be specific about your experience and skill set.

You will love communicating in all forms, can use data to create digital media strategies and know what campaign types to recommend to scale online results.  You also are data driven and very responsive to customers.

Graduate Positions available

We are looking for the best and brightest who have a high GPA and track record of outstanding results in their education and work experience.

You will learn about Google, Facebook and Microsoft advertising as these are all part of our digital media agency.

This is an outstanding opportunity for commerce, business, management, science, maths, journalism or commerce students.  No one degree provides you with the skills for what we do (we have successfully employed law, media, commerce, event management and physics grads!).  We provide full training in the growth economy of digital advertising.  You just need to be top of your class, learn fast, results driven and able to take the rapid pace of our industry.

For all roles - required as a minimum:

  • Intelligent and inquiry driven
  • Fast learner
  • Ability to deliver KPIs
  • Excellent English writing ability
  • Persistence
  • Proficient with word processing and spreadsheets
  • Excellent communication skills and a team player
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet scheduled due dates
  • Ability to analyse, report and act on data
  • High attention to detail
  • Ability to take on board customer feedback

If any of these positions sounds like you, please specify which role you are after, send your resume and a short cover letter.

For the graduate positions please include your ATAR and GPA (bullet points are fine!).

This job is only open to Australian permanent residents and citizens. No Agencies please.

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
About Us

Bridgestone is a global leader in sustainable mobility and advanced solutions, providing products, services and solutions for a world in motion. We have a long-held tradition of excellence supported by a commitment to offer the highest quality products and services to all customers. Through our mission of "Serving Society with Superior Quality" Bridgestone strives to be a company trusted by the community and valued by its employees.

About the role

Reporting directly to the SAP Business Applications Manager, you will work closely with the Business Systems team to provide high levels of customer service to the company’s end users. Your key responsibilities will include interpreting, analysing and documenting business reporting requirements, identifying solutions to fulfil business needs and developing solutions to contribute to the continuous improvement of business processes and procedures primarily focused on SAP ERP and SAP BW systems. You will also be responsible for designing specification documents, writing test cases, processing and implementing change requests and assisting management with the implementation of various systems projects as required.

About you

This is an excellent opportunity to build on your prior business analyst experience with a multi-national organisation. This role offers broad scope and will require exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities, coupled with high-level written and oral communication skills. Your flexibility, initiative and outstanding ability to develop and maintain relationships at all levels will add further to your success.

  • Tertiary qualifications in IT, Computer Science or a Business related discipline are highly desirable.
  • Experience in Data Modelling with SAP BW and business reporting within SAP Business Objects will be very well regarded.

This is an excellent opportunity for an enthusiastic, dynamic and proactive individual to join a National icon that provides exceptional working conditions and a positive and engaged organisational culture.

What we offer

The successful candidate will be rewarded with a competitive salary and staff discounts. You will also join a globally recognised company that values its employees. Working in a City Fringe location with your own undercover carpark.

To apply, please provide a Cover Letter and Resume quoting reference number: S21215

title: ERP & Data Operations Manager
description:
Southcott Pty Ltd is one of Australia's leading Hydraulic businesses offering system design, supplier, manufacturer and distribution.  Southcott manufacture hydraulic components and import leading brands such as Walvoil, Casappa, Command Controls, Faster, Gates Hose, Child Couplings and power units. We sell our products through a network of branches and distributors across the country. Founded in 1886, we believe our relentless ambition, customer centricity and focus on people have contributed significantly to our success to date.

Southcott Pty Ltd is embarking on a transformational journey to support our significant growth agenda. We are seeking an ERP & Data Operations Manager to help enable the organisation to achieve success through planning, delivering & managing data strategies and related applications to support Southcott’s transition to a data led culture.  Your role will be pivotal in the ERP implementation project and will continue post-implementation to support the business in maximising the ongoing benefits of the solution as well as enabling the business to drive insights from its data.

This is a newly created role and is a great opportunity for an experienced and commercially minded individual to add value through your passion for data.

Reporting to the Head of Business Operations, you will be able to view the business through a holistic data lens as well as play in the detail. You will be experienced and comfortable playing in the application, infrastructure and analysis domains and will be adept at partnering with different business functions, to work collaboratively to drive better customer and business outcomes.

Specifically, this role will:

  • Administer and manage the Cloud based ERP system, BI Applications & SQL Databases
  • Coordinate with providers & IT Team - system implementations, upgrades and modifications
  • Oversee the operational maintenance of ERP functions & application access with the IT Team
  • Review & improve data integration design to drive performance & maintenance efficiencies
  • Manage and improve data pipelines & partner with wider IT team on application integrations & infrastructure
  • Own and drive data hygiene amongst users through controls/process & governance, collaborating with stakeholders for optimal outcomes
  • Drive effectiveness of the ERP & Data systems, partnering with key stakeholders to ensure business alignment & enhanced user experience
  • Assist with the system design of quality assurance practices
  • Participate in any change management projects to identify potential risks/impacts of wider system changes
  • Provide analysis support for large datasets in applicable programme

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Applied Maths, Information Technology, Data Science or related qualifications or equivalent experience
  • Significant experience as a System Administrator for a cloud-based ERP/BI application
  • Significant experience with DBMS (MySQL, SQL server or equivalent)
  • Technical proficiency regarding Database design development, Data models, Data Analysis & Insights, techniques for data mining
  • Experience in Tableau, COGNOS, managing large data sets and process improvement training and / qualifications would be looked on favourably
  • Demonstrated change agility and resilience
  • Strong business partnering and stakeholder management skills
  • Superior interpersonal and verbal and written communications skills
  • Strong influencing skills
  • Ability to manage workloads and meet delivery deadlines
  • A demonstrated commitment to ongoing professional development

We have a significant growth agenda and encourage you to apply if believe you can contribute to our journey. For a confidential discussion about this role, please call Clare Kelly, Head of People & Culture on 08 8228 2423 . Otherwise, please apply via SEEK.

title: Business Analyst - Data
description:
• July Start
  • Initial 12-month contract with a 12-month extension available
  • $950/day plus Super
  • Open to Australian Citizens

We are looking for an experienced business analyst with detailed data and analytics experience to work in the new Data and Analytics Office (DAO).

Responsibilities:

  • Working in multi-disciplinary teams to deliver data and analytics projects using Agile approaches.
  • Working with business to understand data requirements and issues.
  • Working with ICT and business systems teams to identify data and make data available for analysis.
  • Delivering robust, user-focused data insights using Power BI, and other BI tools.
  • Establishing productivity systems and processes – providing input into processes and systems (e.g. DevOps and Git) to manage work and share code.

Essential Criteria:

  • Active engagement with the business to understand data requirements and issues.
  • Assistance drafting business requirements and scoping material to suit business needs.
  • Assist with data analysis and investigation.
  • Work with ICT and Business Systems teams to confirm requirements, remediate issues and communicate with the business.
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications (in business analysis, computer science, science) or comparable industry experience.
  • Ability to obtain baseline clearance.

Desirable Criteria:

  • Azure DevOps for managing work activities.
  • Power BI experience.

Thank you for your application; due to the volume of applications we may not be able to respond to all applicants.

Best of luck with your job search.

title: Data Analyst - Funds Management
description:
About the Company:

Funds SA is a South Australian Government Corporation that invests and manages over AUD$42 billion on behalf of South Australian public-sector superannuation funds and approved public authorities.

Funds SA is a collaborative, innovative, and professional organisation with the primary aim of building prosperity for South Australians whilst achieving the highest return on investment possible.

Based in Adelaide and globally connected, Funds SA are well-known for their deep investment expertise. National and international partnerships and a “manager of managers” approach drive their pursuit of future financial prosperity through global market reach.

Funds SA prides itself on strong leadership driving a values led, supportive culture, focused on providing opportunities to learn, grow, and work with great people.

The Opportunity:
This is an exceptional opportunity emerging from commencement of a critical data analytics project , to join a high-performing team. Reporting to the Manager, Data you will work closely with the investment team members and key internal and external stakeholders.

You will be responsible for significant contribution to projects in addition to the BAU of the investment data management, across a multi-asset class portfolio.

Key responsibilities:
  • Contribute to investment data management - maintenance of investment systems and monitor and enhance data governance and quality frameworks across a multi-asset class portfolio;
  • Enhance portfolio exposure management capabilities, conduct analysis on parameters impacting exposure specifically to Funds SA;
  • Assist with providing and validating investment data and analytics for exposure, risk and performance reporting;
  • Support reporting on investment manager performance against custodian data;
  • Support continuous improvement initiatives across technical advancements and reporting;
  • Participate in a significant project to implement a new system; AND
  • Help initiate and drive process enhancements, supporting the team and management with other adhoc tasks.
What we are looking for:
  • Proven 3+ years’ experience in investment data analytics, database management and reporting, within funds management or superannuation is ideal, investment reporting experience will be considered;
  • Demonstrated experience in development and competency in SQL/Python, Agile Technologies will be ideal;
  • Experience in R-studio, C Sharp, Azure technologies and with project management experience will be looked upon favourably;
  • Mathematics/Engineering/Computer Science degree qualified is ideal, Finance or Statistics could be considered;
  • Strong understanding of Australian and international investment markets and instruments is a must, along with technology systems; AND
  • Strong written and verbal communication and stakeholder management skills are a must.
This is an exceptional opportunity for a data analyst to grow their career at a leading funds manager, which provides genuine professional development opportunities within a collaborative and high-performance culture.

If you are interested in learning more about this position, please contact Matt McGilton at 0439 028 222 at Nupur Gill at 0421 828 693 at Kaizen Recruitment or apply via the included link.

#SCR-nupur-gill
#SCR-matt-mcgilton

title: Data Migration Analyst - .Net, ETL, SSIS, TFS - based in Darwin
description:
Large enterprise organisation based in Darwin and delivering very complex, high value, and / or high-risk ICT programs and multi-year digital transformation initiatives is seeking Data Analysts to work on data migration and other data related activities within an Enterprise Project Services program and contribute to design and architecture deliverables.

Key Duties & Responsibilities:

The Data Analyst(s) will be required to work on data migration and other data related activities for their allocated EPS program and contribute to design and architecture deliverables. High-level responsibilities are as follows:

• Work with subject matter experts and project team members to define, document and communicate data migration requirements and associated data migration business rules; and conduct walk throughs with stakeholders to obtain validation and approvals.

• Develop and provide input into the design, planning and management of data migration processes to deliver source to target data mapping and data convergence, cleansing validation and synchronisation rules.

• Provide input and support to the migration of data from one system to another including legacy and staging source environments.

• Perform data migration testing, reconciliation and exception reporting. • Identify opportunities for enhancements and refinements to data governance and data management practices, processes and standards for effectively carrying out data migration activities.

• Identify data quality issues and recommend remediation actions.

Essential Skills and Experience:

• Demonstrated experience in data analysis on multi system data convergence and migration projects.

• Demonstrated extensive experience (at least 5 years) in gathering and documenting data requirements, data migration business rules and development of complex data maps.

• Experience as an MSSQL Database Developer in creating Stored Procedures and Views.

• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse and disseminate significant amounts of information across project teams and stakeholders with attention to detail and accuracy.

• High level oral, written and interpersonal communication skills including ability to communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders.

• Experience in project/program management within established structures with the ability to work to tight deadlines and competing priorities.

• Experience in working collaboratively within a team environment with high priority deliverables, and ability to guide and knowledge transfer to project team members.

• Experience in developing extract-transform-load (ETL) processes using tools such as Microsoft SSIS or IBM InfoSphere DataStag

Desirable Skills and Experience:

• Tertiary qualifications in IT, computer science or software engineering.

• Experience using Atlassian tools such as Jira, Bitbucket (Git) and Confluence.

• Experience with Microsoft data platform, including tools such as SSIS and Master Data Services.

• Experience with the Microsoft platform in the development of data migration processes e.g: .NET Framework, Team Foundation Server (TFS), T-SQL.

• Experience with Enterprise Architect Data modelling methodology.

Personal Qualities required of Candidate(s):

• High level social and written skills with ability to effectively support colleagues and stakeholders in the project and other interested stakeholders.

• Ability to work either in a large team environment with members of diverse cultures and backgrounds or remote offices connected to Darwin.

• Self-starter with high personal drive and a positive attitude.

• Disciplined and accountable for supporting and maintaining work products.

• Behaves in a respectful and professional manner, maintaining high integrity and transparency when delivering work.

• Excellent problem solver and critical thinker.

• Promotes teamwork and collaboration by engaging stakeholders and team members.

• Services Personnel are also expected to abide (and confirm they will) by the DCDD Corporate Values of Honesty, Professional, Respectful, Accountable and Innovative.

The successful applicant will be required to be based in Darwin for the duration of the contract.

title: Instrumentations Electronics Engineer
description:
12 month minimum contract Design, construct and test sensors and data capture systems on prototype guided weapons for Defence

  • Requires ability to design, setup and operate instrumentation systems for acquiring scientific data; and Australian Citizenship essential (for security Clearances)
  • $ Based on Experience
  • Edinburgh South Australia

Your Next Employer...

You'll be working with the R&D department for the Department of Defence (Defence Science Technology Group, DTSG) in Edinburgh. DSTG is currently supporting research into guided weapons prototyping.

The Role...

The Instrumentation Technicians will, under direction, undertake the following major duties:

1. Participate in the specification, acquisition and setup of sensors, data acquisition, processing and recording equipment. This includes design, construction and testing of sensor and data capture systems.

2. Assist in the development of data acquisition aspects of the design of experiments.

3. Set up and use high speed photo instrumentation equipment and assist in imagery analysis and interpretation.

4. Participate in the setting up and the conduct of experiments and trials with energetic materials in laboratories, specialist test facilities and outdoor ranges.

5. Use knowledge of sensors and data systems to assist in the interpretation and reporting of captured data from weapons and explosives trials.

6. Assist in the maintenance of laboratories and equipment including calibration

You will IDEALLY have

Demonstrated experience, knowledge & skills in the following areas:

1. Ability to design, setup and operate instrumentation systems for acquiring scientific data;

2. Electronics and instrumentation expertise including knowledge and/or experience in circuit design and fabrication (including proficiency in soldering, prototyping, PCB loading, cable manufacture and connector termination);

3. Demonstrable knowledge and/or experience in building instrumentation and associated hardware for testing.

4. Sound mechanical aptitude

5. Experience in handling energetic materials (desirable)

Qualification(s):

Vocational and/or tertiary qualification in electronic engineering

To be an Australian Citizen (ESSENTIAL)

For more information, call Soyuz on 03 9573 1500

title: Career Relaunch Program 2022 - Science (Australia)
description:
GHD's Career Relaunch Program is back in 2022

Are you looking to return to work after a career break?

Returning to work after an extended career break can be challenging. That's why we've developed a Career Relaunch Program to encourage and welcome professionals back to the workforce in a flexible environment with excellent growth opportunities.

This initiative is motivated by GHD's dedication to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. It was first launched in 2017 and is now a national annual program that is growing every year.

We will provide you with a support network and training opportunities crafted to ease your transition back into the workplace. After the program, there will be potential for ongoing employment with GHD for suitable candidates.

To be considered for the program you will be:

  • Available on a casual basis for a minimum of 20 hours per week, ideally for the duration of the program
  • Someone who has had a career break and is seeking a supportive return to work program
  • A professional with commercial experience (prior to a career break) who has worked in any of the following areas:
    • Engineering (building services, civil/structural, electrical, mechanical, process, renewables)
    • Environmental and earth geosciences (including sustainability)
    • Architecture and urban design and planning
    • Modelling / drafting (Revit, 12d, AutoCad, Civil 3d, SolidWorks)
    • Project management (PMCA)
    • Advisory (including economics, mathematics, journalism, business, commerce, finance, risk and chemical, civil, electrical and power systems engineering)
    • Digital (data science, AI, GIS/location intelligence, cyber security, applications development, and software development)
    • Information Services (I.T) (business analysis, project management and security)
    • Business Services (finance, marketing and communications, people, and culture)

See what some of our relaunch alumni have to say about this program:

Emma Harrison | Business Group Leader – Contamination and Environmental Management | Sydney, NSW

"As a mother of four, I felt resigned to the fact that after ten years out of the scientific industry, the only way back in was through full-time study. Then I found GHD's Career Relaunch Program in 2018, which offered me a genuine opportunity to redevelop my career while still being able to support my four children as a single parent. I was offered an ongoing role as Senior Environmental Geologist after the program ended, and now three years later, I have recently moved into the Business Group Leader for Contamination and Environmental Management role, looking after 40 wonderful, talented professionals in this group."

Marguerite Cooper | Environmental Scientist | Sydney, NSW

“I reached a point after the birth of my second child, where I felt I was unable to perform to the best of my ability in either role as a scientist or a mum. I decided to take some time off to focus on my family, and two years later I was ready to return to work. I had been looking for work for around 18 months before I came across GHD’s Career Relaunch Program. GHD’s flexible working policy allowed me to re-join the workforce while still managing school and childcare requirements. It was wonderful to see that colleagues understood what the Career Relaunch Program was all about and were happy to provide me with a little extra time and flexibility to find my feet.”

Sam Marsh | Environmental Scientist | Hobart, TAS

“After moving from sunny Cairns to Hobart, I spent some time travelling around Australia, trying new jobs including working as a farm attendant on a Tassal fish farm in Tasmania. When I was ready to get back into my professional field, I was worried about learning how to work in a corporate environment once again. For me GHD's Career Relaunch Program meant I was able to develop new skills in the science industry and personally develop lifelong skills working with others and communicating on a professional level.”

Find out more about the program at ghd.com/careerrelaunch.

Apply

To apply, please submit a cover letter outlining your interest in the program and your CV before Tuesday 31 May 2022.

GHD is an equal opportunity employer, and we want everyone to be able to fully participate in our recruitment process. We value a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and people of all identities.

LI-JW1

#LI-REMOTE

title: Team Leader, Information, Analysis and Reporting
description:
The South Australian Certificate of Education Board (SACE Board) of South Australia’s primary role is the provision of the South Australian Certificate of Education (SACE) to government, non-government and international schools.

Our purpose is to “shape education so that students thrive” which is achieved through working closely with our stakeholders to inspire, innovate and create the best outcomes for students and their communities so that SACE Graduates are capable to construct their own futures to contribute to a sustainable and socially just world.

The IMPACT you will drive at the SACE Board

The Team Leader, Information Analysis and Reporting has been created to lead and manage a team to deliver on the proactive reporting, implementation and evaluation of activities and projects for the SACE Board of South Australia (SACE Board). The role also seeks continuous improvement opportunities and keeps abreast of current trends to build upon the information, analysis and reporting capabilities.

What you will BRING

  • Proven ability to understand complex business problems and processes, and consequent data required to analyse and provide solutions.
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret and represent and communicate data analysis and trends to stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated analytical and critical thinking skills, including an ability to engage in research related educational discussion and debate.
  • Knowledge of tools and techniques in educational research including recent developments and validity, reliability and equity issues.
  • Demonstrated understanding of the functionality associated with the SACE Board’s IT systems.

Qualifications

Tertiary qualifications in Data Science or related discipline is desirable.

Special Conditions

  • Intrastate travel to regional and remote locations; international and interstate travel may be required.
  • Some out-of-hours work.
  • The incumbent works under the SACE Board of South Australia Act 1983 .
  • Appointment is subject to a satisfactory Working with Children Check from the Department of Human Services and in accordance with the SACE Board policy.

What we can OFFER you!

  • A supportive and dynamic team environment that values the work that you do.
  • Professional development in education, project management and engagement.
  • Salary Sacrifice Benefits.
  • Flexible work and wellbeing provisions.

Remuneration

ASO7 classification level. Salary range $103,387 to $111,759 per annum plus super.

APPLYING with Us

If you are passionate about young people and their education, we want to hear from you!

For further information including the role description and to apply, please https://iworkfor.sa.gov.au/page.php?pageID=160&windowUID=0&AdvertID=638869#brs_jbcontent

ENQUIRIES to,

Ines Sodano, Head of Business Operations, Ines.sodano@sa.gov.au or telephone 8115 4899

Applications close: 11:45pm on Sunday 22 May 2022

title: Delivery Manager
description:
Semantic Sciences – Text and Data Analytics Software

Semantic Sciences has pioneered Sensuris, a software solution which offers advanced processes and sophisticated algorithms for grant management suitable for the largest grant providers. Sensuris is delivered from the cloud and offers unparalleled automation and efficiency.

Semantic Sciences combines excellence in advanced data science with technology delivery.

We are a company of diverse & talented individuals with a passion for advanced technology, who love seeing our software benefit humanity.

At Semantic Sciences, our goal is to create a space where our people have the chance to achieve excellence within a warm an encouraging environment. We go to great lengths to create wonderful products and provide excellent service to our clients. Our solutions are usually world-leading in quality and performance. Elegance, simplicity and effectiveness flow into everything we do.

THE ROLE

The Delivery Manager is a critical role for Semantic Sciences, replacing a key member of our team. Set against a background of continued rapid growth, your role will be pivotal in working with our clients to understand their needs and develop solutions in collaboration with a great team.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE

Product Strategy & Management

  • Business Vision – Contribute to the development of the business vision and strategy for Semantic Sciences and Sensuris, it’s high-productivity grant management system
  • Product Roadmap – Contribute to the development roadmap for Sensuris and identify the upcoming stream of development projects
  • Release Schedules – Manage version releases of Sensuris in the Amazon cloud
  • Workflows & Wireframes – Assist with high-level workflows and conceptual wireframes for new software modules and minor projects
  • Sensuris Knowledge - Develop an encyclopaedic knowledge of the use, operation and administration of Sensuris
  • Customer Journeys - Reviewing the main customer journeys to identify friction and problems and recommend fixes likely to lead to improved customer value and increases in revenue

Project Management & Delivery Process

  • Resource Allocation – Plan resourcing options for multiple production streams
  • Delivery System – Maintain high quality, frictionless, logged delivery systems that are easy for customers and staff to use without ambiguity and error
  • Customer Requests - Manage customer enhancement requests with Business Analyst; including prioritisation of requests against product vision
  • Project Communications - Manage all project communications with customers and stakeholders with meticulousness, courtesy and precision
  • Delivery Data – Analyse delivery data and metrics; and develop, implement, operate, and refine processes relating to the delivery of customer projects

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU

  • Attractive remuneration - including a range of bonuses
  • Hybrid model - we understand the new era of work-life across the office and work from home
  • Flexible hours - working hours and arrangements to balance your work & lifestyle
  • Career development - mentoring & development opportunities are a vital part of what we do
  • Great team - we all want each other to succeed, and pride ourselves on our collaboration, team-work and support of one another

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

  • Tertiary qualified in a relevant field
  • Understanding of full stack development and the ability to work effectively with FSD team leads and developers
  • Excellent written communication skills with experience in writing reports
  • Excellent oral communication skills
  • Ability to create and maintain warm, trusting relationships
  • Good emotional intelligence and high ability to manage interpersonal relationships to achieve results
  • High level analytical skills, with experience solving complex problems and making well-judged decisions
  • Strategic mindset – the ability to think and plan ahead to deliver excellent results now and in the future.
  • Detail-oriented problem-solving skills, with the ability to employ critical thinking and time management skills
  • Grit - tenacity in the face of difficulty
  • Grip - determination to be completely on top of all aspects of one's work and its context; never letting things go; leading to constant reliable performance
  • Ability to lead meetings with customers and internal stakeholders
  • Strong ability to manage relationships with various stakeholders (internal and external)

NEXT STEPS

Research shows that whilst men apply for jobs when they only meet 60% of the requirements, women and other marginalised people only apply if they generally meet 100% of the requirements. If you’re enthusiastic about this opportunity, have a tertiary qualification in a relevant field and it sounds like you (even if you don’t tick all the boxes!), please still get in touch.

If you have any questions, please contact our Recruitment Manager Cam Agnew at cam.agnew@sintelix.com or on 08 7221 3207

Otherwise, please apply online at your earliest convenience!

*Applicants must have legal work rights within Australia and the successful applicant will be required to undertake relevant probity screening, including a criminal history check.

title: Central Services Team Member - Casual Positions
description:
Australian Clinical Labs was created through the merge of Healthscope, St John of God and Perth Pathology. Through the long term relationships with these organisations and our public hospital contacts, Clinical Labs is now the leading provider of Hospital/Specialist pathology services in Australia. We see our future in the industry as taking a leadership role in science, technology, people and process. With 88 accredited pathology laboratories and over 1020 collection centres, we have a strong footprint across Australia.

Australian Clinical Labs has newly become a publicly listed organisation with strong growth aspirations, this is a place for someone who wants to help us in transitioning to a market leader.  We currently have a Full Tine opportunity to work across our Customer Service/Data Entry departments in our Adelaide Airport Laboratory. Your role will provide flexibility to work a variety of shifts on our rotating roster including days, evenings, weekends and public holidays. Training will be provided but previous customer service experience is required. You will be well supported by your fellow staff and management.

You will provide quality service to our doctors, specialists, patients and other care providers through the handling of telephone queries and general administrative duties relating to pathology services including data entry of requests.

To be successful in this role, you will pride yourself in managing customer enquiries in a friendly, professional and timely manner. It is expected the successful applicant possesses excellent computer skills, has an enthusiastic and flexible approach to their work, together with the ability to multitask and successfully work as part of a team.

To be considered for this role you must possess:

  • Ability to work a 7-day rotational shift roster covering a range of hours
  • Recent customer service experience
  • Excellent computer and typing skills
  • A strong communicator, and listener
  • Ability to work both in a team environment and independently
  • Previous experience in pathology and a familiarity with medical terminology is preferred, but not essential.

Australian Clinical Labs is an equal opportunities employer, we encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities and cultures – including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBTQI+ community and people living with disability. We’re happy to adjust our recruitment process to support accessibility needs.

Please note, only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

Applications Close: 27th May 2022

title: AH-MAZING Marketing Data Analyst/Paid Media Buyer
description:
Want to be part of a brand that values health, wellness, and FUN?!

Are you an inspiring leader who’s passionate about digital marketing/analytics and dedicated to building a brand and community through effective content strategies and advertisements?

Do you want to inspire others to be their happiest and healthiest selves?

If we’ve got your attention and you’re screaming a big YES to all of the above, then have we got an opportunity for you!

At Happy Way, we’re on the hunt for an AH-MAZING Marketing Data Analyst/Paid Media Buyer to join our creative team at Happy Way HQ in Adelaide, SA. This is an in-house position, so you must be living in Australia’s most liveable city!

We’re looking for someone who not only aligns with our brand values, but radiates feel-good vibes, oozes positivity, and loves to work hard whilst having fun along the way—you’re the missing ingredient in our protein smoothie!

SO WHAT’S THIS DREAM ROLE YOU ASK?

Reporting to Happy Way’s senior management team, the focus of your role will be monitoring all things digital marketing and data analytics across our paid platforms and social media channels, as well as creating and implementing effective ad campaigns to increase engagement and build our community. You will work closely with our marketing stakeholders and CEOs, sharing insights and ideas, and effectively plan growth strategies for the brand. You will also collaborate with our creative team, leading and driving projects to achieve results.

Because of the diversity and depth of this role, we require an experienced marketing guru that can confidently identify opportunities, initiate and implement ideas and see them through to the final product! We want someone who is confident in their abilities and a passionate team player, who is focused on inspiring and nurturing relationships with our team, our community, and beyond!


WHAT WILL BE ON YOUR WEEKLY CHECKLIST

  • Work as a trusted advisor to the company CEOs, with the responsibility of creating an effective modern analytics system at Happy Way.
  • Lead data/insights across the marketing team.
  • Collaborate daily with our growth and marketing stakeholders to establish priorities and key growth paths for the brand.
  • Design and build dashboards in data studio/super metrics to determine clear o/results, creating a clean reporting space for all marketing metrics.
  • Suggest and perform analysis of landing pages, A/B tests, audiences, segments, ads, and creatives.
  • Constantly review and monitor all paid platforms to avoid any data integrity issues.
  • Launch and manage effective advertising campaigns across multiple paid channels as required, to increase our brand awareness, build upon our community, and nurture relationships with our existing customer base, essentially meeting our new customer and retention goals.
  • Forecast and understand desired customer acquisition costs, revenue benchmarks, and advanced data analytics (specifically, Lifetime Value data)—this is to provide actionable insights and develop new tests to run, with the goal of increasing the overall ROI of the funnel. (This includes studying other funnels, books, webinars, etc. for ideas).
  • Strategize and apply learnings across other paid acquisition channels (i.e., Facebook, Google, YouTube, TikTok).
  • Drive target audience segmentation, attribution modeling, lead generation analytics, paid and unpaid channels optimizations.
  • Assist with the development and maintenance of our business data warehouse.
  • Effectively translate business requirements to technical specialists (developers and engineers).

WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics, or an equivalent degree.
  • 1-3 years of experience planning, developing, executing, and optimizing paid advertising campaigns for direct-to-consumer products with $15k+ in monthly spend.
  • 1-3 years of experience creating and managing paid funnels while having an undeniable passion for lead generation marketing.
  • 1-3 years of experience using analytics to provide strategic recommendations and drive business growth.
  • Outstanding understanding of all marketing channels (content, email, social media, SEO, SEM, Display, Affiliate).
  • An exceptional communicator, with the ability to give and receive constructive feedback whilst ensuring there’s clarity on objectives and results.
  • Nurture and develop relationships with team members, senior management, and brand associates, being the go-to person for all things digital marketing and analytics.
  • Must have a unique combination of humility (willing to do the dirty work) and ambition and drive to work towards a collective goal.
  • Perfect understanding of all marketing metrics (CPA, CPL, CLV, CTR, CAC, ROI, ROAS).
  • Proficiency in SQL, Data Science, and Python.
  • A natural instinct to think outside the box and take risks—only after careful examination of the opportunity, potential costs, and determining that your chosen course of action is the most effective.
  • A desire to lead the team towards a common goal, delegating effectively with limited supervision.

WHAT YOU’LL GET FROM US!

  • A fun, engaging, and supportive team culture that’s passionate about growth and development.
  • Inspiring office space to work your magic in, just on the city fringe—our pups love it too!
  • Competitive salary.
  • Discounts on the best protein and health supplements out there!
  • Invites to team bonding days and events.
  • Did we mention regular office treats made by our Happy Way nutritionist?! YUM!

THE BIG PICTURE

At Happy Way, our mission is to connect, inspire and empower the world, creating a community that values health, well-being, happiness, and FUN!

We not only care about the well-being of each other but we also care deeply about the well-being of our planet—giving back to Mother Nature and prioritizing sustainability is something we’re focused on as a brand. We’re determined to have a positive social and environmental impact and understand that we have an opportunity to do more than just create nutritious, drool-worthy health food supplements—we’re here to build connection, encourage growth, and sprinkle our feel-good vibes everywhere, so it creates a ripple effect across the globe!


So, why not choose to live life the Happy Way?!

If this sounds like you and you want to be a part of our story, please apply now—we can’t wait to meet you!

(only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.)

title: National Naval Shipbuilding – Multi-discipline Researchers, Scientists/Engineers
description:
In its 2017 Naval Shipbuilding Plan, the Australian Government made clear that a skilled workforce is critical to the success of the National Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise.  As the largest capital investment ever undertaken in Australia, the National Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise represents an entirely new direction in the way Australia underpins its national security interests. We are seeking applications from individuals interested in undertaking challenging, interesting and important work that is front and centre for the Australian Government within the Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise.

Maritime Division uses science and technology to deliver a capability edge to the Australian Defence Force in the maritime domain. We have expertise in a diverse range of technologies including sensors, statistics, materials, propulsion, automation, systems integration, signatures, and ship building. These are combined in a multidisciplinary research program to improve the operational capability, availability, reliability and safety of existing maritime and air platforms, and to reduce their vulnerabilities. We are at the forefront of future systems, including autonomous vehicles, and the Defence Force’s future submarine and surface ship programs. Maritime Division has an emphasis on delivering impact to the Australian Defence Force.

Our ideal candidates will have a passion for and demonstrated ability to solve highly complex problems and demonstrating solutions through prototyping using a high degree of rigor (using proven engineering and or scientific methods). You will be able to apply your knowledge to solve complex real world problems, and work with a diverse range of stakeholders to understand their needs and adjust and communicate their approach accordingly to meet any imposed timelines/milestones, working effectively in a team environment. You will demonstrate good communication skills and be willing to work as part of a team to achieve the required defence outcomes in the information sciences domain.

We have multiple positions available in the following disciplines:

  • Non-Acoustic Signature Management (NASM)

The Non-Acoustic Signature Management group provides research and engineering support to the Maritime Domain, in particular the group supports the following areas:

  • Electromagnetic Signature Control provides a sovereign capability to enhance the operational effectiveness and survivability of current and future platforms through the control of Radar, Infrared and Visible signatures using specialised treatments, computer modelling and measurement techniques.
  • Specialised Coatings and Corrosion Science area enhances the operational effectiveness, safety and availability, and reduces the cost of ownership, of ADF platforms through application of corrosion prevention technologies to minimise platform signatures and structural degradation.

  • Undersea Command and Control (UCC)

The Undersea Command and Control Branch is seeking multiple S&T 3-4 (Above) Researchers to undertake research in the undersea warfare domain. This includes research activities associated with torpedoes, torpedo defence, submarine combat control systems, submarine sonar systems, optronics, and human sciences for enhancing crewing systems and control room design/innovation.

  • Acoustic Signature Management (ASM)

The Acoustic Signature Management branch of Maritime Division provides Australia’s primary capability for the management and control of acoustic signatures, hydrodynamics, and manoeuvring performance of defence maritime platforms.  The branch consist of the Acoustic Signature Control, Hydroacoustics, and Acoustic Materials Systems groups. The work involves analytical and numerical prediction capability and has access to a number of world class experimental facilities.

  • Maritime Platform Performance (MPP)

The Maritime Platform Performance Group provides research and engineering support to the Maritime Domain, in particular the group supports the following areas:

  • The Power and Energy Systems Group provides research and engineering support to the Maritime Domain, in particular the group supports the following areas:
    • Mechanical Systems – research, modelling and engineering support for diesel performance and reliability, energy reduction and waste energy recovery technologies
    • Electrical Systems – development and exploitation of electrical power and energy system models (main propulsion motors, power electronics and hardware power in the loop) and Pb-acid battery performance, integration and optimisation
    • Electro-Chemical – materials development, performance modelling and prognosis and safety assessment of alternative battery chemistries
    • Naval Platform Survivability (NPS) leads the research and development of advanced modelling and technologies to support ADF surface ships and submarines in the areas of material analysis and design; fire-fighting and atmosphere; platform vulnerability and recoverability to underwater and air water weapon effects.
    • Naval Architecture and Platform System Analysis (NAPSA) guides research and development of advanced tools and methods to assess the whole-of-vessel performance for the Australian Defence Force. Whole-of-vessel performance includes: seakeeping; multi-vessel interactions; operational loads; whole-of-vessel performance; structural response; integrated model based systems exploration and design trade-off studies.
  • Littoral Autonomy Sensors and Systems

The Littoral Autonomy Sensors and Systems (LASS) Major Science Technology Capability (MSTC) has a major focus on the development of robotic and autonomous systems (RAS) to support future Navy capabilities, including in littoral and undersea warfare. The MSTC is comprised of three Science and Technology Capabilities (STC) centred around:

  • Robotics, vehicle architectures and autonomy, underwater communications, integration and performance;
  • Sensing and perception, including underwater object detection and classification; and
  • Mine countermeasure systems.

As a member of the MSTC you will collaborate with a team of motivated engineers, scientists and mathematicians whose mission is to increase capability through improved employment of robotic and autonomous systems, and / or the exploitation of sensor data for undersea perception and cueing of autonomous systems.

Application Closing Date: 30 May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, reference the following links:

DSTG/02466/22 (NASM)

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=8259F4E9-54F1-5733-D149-C88D853B5DE3

DSTG/2439/22 (UCC)

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=63E3DB0A-024E-8A01-3986-C88D84A16E95

DSTG/02431/22 (ASM)

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=66A738A7-D3D8-254F-2E41-C88D84141129

DSTG/02455/22 (MPP)

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=C89293FC-633E-F7D1-1FFD-C88D84CB0265

DSTG/02397/22 (LSS)

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=C09992B9-BB74-845A-5CA2-C88D8554766F
