This includes research activities associated with torpedoes, torpedo defence, submarine combat control systems, submarine sonar systems, optronics, and human sciences for enhancing crewing systems and control room design/innovation.

  • Acoustic Signature Management (ASM)

The Acoustic Signature Management branch of Maritime Division provides Australia’s primary capability for the management and control of acoustic signatures, hydrodynamics, and manoeuvring performance of defence maritime platforms.  The branch consist of the Acoustic Signature Control, Hydroacoustics, and Acoustic Materials Systems groups. The work involves analytical and numerical prediction capability and has access to a number of world class experimental facilities.

  • Maritime Platform Performance (MPP)

The Maritime Platform Performance Group provides research and engineering support to the Maritime Domain, in particular the group supports the following areas:

  • The Power and Energy Systems Group provides research and engineering support to the Maritime Domain, in particular the group supports the following areas:
    • Mechanical Systems – research, modelling and engineering support for diesel performance and reliability, energy reduction and waste energy recovery technologies
    • Electrical Systems – development and exploitation of electrical power and energy system models (main propulsion motors, power electronics and hardware power in the loop) and Pb-acid battery performance, integration and optimisation
    • Electro-Chemical – materials development, performance modelling and prognosis and safety assessment of alternative battery chemistries
    • Naval Platform Survivability (NPS) leads the research and development of advanced modelling and technologies to support ADF surface ships and submarines in the areas of material analysis and design; fire-fighting and atmosphere; platform vulnerability and recoverability to underwater and air water weapon effects.
    • Naval Architecture and Platform System Analysis (NAPSA) guides research and development of advanced tools and methods to assess the whole-of-vessel performance for the Australian Defence Force. Whole-of-vessel performance includes: seakeeping; multi-vessel interactions; operational loads; whole-of-vessel performance; structural response; integrated model based systems exploration and design trade-off studies.
  • Littoral Autonomy Sensors and Systems

The Littoral Autonomy Sensors and Systems (LASS) Major Science Technology Capability (MSTC) has a major focus on the development of robotic and autonomous systems (RAS) to support future Navy capabilities, including in littoral and undersea warfare. The MSTC is comprised of three Science and Technology Capabilities (STC) centred around:

  • Robotics, vehicle architectures and autonomy, underwater communications, integration and performance;
  • Sensing and perception, including underwater object detection and classification; and
  • Mine countermeasure systems.

As a member of the MSTC you will collaborate with a team of motivated engineers, scientists and mathematicians whose mission is to increase capability through improved employment of robotic and autonomous systems, and / or the exploitation of sensor data for undersea perception and cueing of autonomous systems.

Application Closing Date: 30 May 2022

title: Senior Technical Officer
description:
(HE06) $81,254 to $87,770 plus an employer contribution of up to 17% superannuation may apply.

Continuing full time position available immediately.

The Technical Services team provide operational support across the Faculty relating to laboratory management, Health, Safety and Wellbeing (HSW), Infrastructure support, teaching and shared laboratory support and laboratory materials receipt and distribution. The position will be primarily located at the Adelaide Health and Medical Sciences building adjacent SAHMRI, but on occasion will be required to assist the team located on the eastern side down at Helen Mayo North and Helen Mayo South.

The Senior Technical Officer works under general direction, to deliver high quality services in the management and coordination of precinct research operations, liaising with researchers and Faculty support services, to enhance Faculty of Health & Medical Sciences research activities.

The Senior Technical Officer provides support for research operations, facilities, infrastructure and events, as required. The position facilitates researcher accommodation, facilities, procurement, finance and data needs and works closely with researchers, affiliates and Faculty service providers to ensure seamless and cohesive support services.

To be successful you will need:

  • Knowledge of the University sector, funding of research and of related structures and processes in a research-oriented field.
  • Demonstrated experience in coordinating and undertaking a range of operational research support services including administrative, financial, facilities management, asset management and data management functions at the faculty level.
  • Demonstrated experience communicating, both verbally and in writing, in a succinct, professional and responsive manner to deliver client centric results.
  • Demonstrated experience delivering high quality administrative support and services to senior professional and academic staff.
  • Demonstrated ability to promote the organisational values of integrity, respect, collegiality, excellence and discovery, and a commitment to positively comply with the associated behaviour expectations.

Enjoy an outstanding career environment

The University of Adelaide is a uniquely rewarding workplace. The size, breadth and quality of our education and research programs - including significant industry, government and community collaborations - offers you a vast scope and opportunity for a long, fulfilling career.

It also enables us to attract high-calibre people in all facets of our operations, ensuring you will be surrounded by talented colleagues, many world-leading. Our work's cutting-edge nature - not just in your own area, but across virtually the full spectrum of human endeavour - provides a constant source of inspiration.

Our culture is one that welcomes all and embraces diversity consistent with our Staff Values and Behaviour Framework and our Values of integrity, respect, collegiality, excellence and discovery. We firmly believe that our people are our most valuable asset, so we work to grow and diversify the skills, knowledge and capability of all our staff.

We embrace flexibility as a key principle to allow our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal and family life. Flexible working arrangements are on offer for all roles at the University.

In addition, we offer a wide range of attractive staff benefits. These include: salary packaging; flexible work arrangements; high-quality professional development programs and activities; and an on-campus health clinic, gym and other fitness facilities.

Learn more at: adelaide.edu.au/jobs

Your faculty's broader role

The Faculty of Health and Medical Sciences contains one of Australia's largest concentrations of leading health researchers, teachers and clinical titleholders. It's comprised of eight schools and a number of specialist disciplines, institutes and centres, variously focused on world-class research, and training the next generation of: medical doctors; surgeons; dentists; nurses; psychiatrists; psychologists; and other health professionals.

Learn more at: health.adelaide.edu.au

If you have the talent, we'll give you the opportunity. Together, let's make history.

‘Click on the link below for a copy of the position description and to apply:’

https://careers.adelaide.edu.au/cw/en/job/509498/senior-technical-officer

Please ensure you submit a cover letter, resume, and upload a document that includes your responses to all of the selection criteria for the position as contained in the position description or selection criteria document.

Applications close 11:55pm, 22 May 2022.

For further information

For a confidential discussion regarding this position, contact:

Jim Manavis
Team Leader, Laboratory and technical Support
P: +61 (8) 83130131
E: jim.manavis@adelaide.edu.au

You'll find a full position description and/or selection criteria below: (If no links appear, try viewing on another device)

The University of Adelaide is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people who meet the requirements of this position are strongly encouraged to apply.

title: Backup Engineer
description:
DXC Technology (NYSE:DXC) - where brilliant people embrace change and seize opportunities to advance their careers and amplify customer success.

Deliver Excellence: an exciting opportunity now exists in the Backups Team. We are looking for individuals with a passion for data backups and restores using industry leading technologies.

Responsibilities:

  • Work within a high-paced Backups Support Capability
  • Responsible for implementing part or all of the technical solution to the client
  • Independently take on tasks within multiple projects and BAU activities simultaneously
  • Provide technical support and input on applications
  • Provide advice on solutions and integration opportunities
  • Ability to work unsupervised / remotely with great time management skills
  • Be a part of on call roster
  • Keep clients informed at all times as to progress of assigned tasks

Knowledge and Experience:

  • 5+ years of professional experience or equivalent degree in computer science or related area of study.
  • Sufficient depth and breadth of technical knowledge to be individually responsible for the design and scope of deliverables within a field of expertise
  • Possesses advanced level of business, technical, or functional knowledge
  • Able to communicate and present complex issues with assurance and confidence
  • Experience with tape and disk backups
  • Experience with SQL, Oracle and VMware integration
  • Product knowledge in various backup technologies such as Veeam, Netbackup, Commvault, Networker or Avamar.
  • Ability to work with a team to provide written responses to technical proposals and /or reports/documentation for delivery

Applicants must be Australian Citizens . If you would like to be part of a culture that drives innovation, delivers results, rewards performance and encourages ideas, then please press the "Apply Now" button to submit your resume.

As an employer of choice, our “people first” philosophy means we offer competitive remuneration, benefits, training and career opportunities that reflect our commitment to improving the lives of our employees, and the communities in which we live and work. Some of these include;

  • Extensive resources to support your onboarding and continual development including DXC University
  • DXC Recognition, our global virtual platform that fosters a culture of appreciation and celebration with real-time reward and recognition
  • We know that great people refer great people. We will reward you when you bring your friends and family to work at DXC
  • More time to do the things you love with flexible leave options, including purchased leave
  • Take time to give back with charitable and emergency services volunteer days
  • Well-being matters to us and our Employee Assistance Program is there to support you and your family
  • And of course, all the basics; novated leasing, discounted health insurance, paid parental leave and many other discounts

title: Team Leader - Service Desk and Operations
description:
Data Action (DA) has over 30 years' experience as a specialist software and services provider to the alternate banking and financial services industry. Operating nationally and servicing a broad client base including customer owned banks, credit unions, neobanks and financial services membership organisations, DA's focus of supporting the financial wellbeing of Australians is echoed through our values:

  • No goldfish - Go beyond your bowl, share knowledge, stay curious and keep learning.
  • Fail forward - Learn from mistakes and keep moving forward.
  • Cheer loudly - Be proud of the team's results and celebrate successes.
  • Own it - Throw yourself in and own your work, taking responsibility until the end.
  • Think Client - Put yourself in our Client's shoes - consider the impact for their customers and deliver.

DA has evolved to become a provider of core banking and digital platforms and services to some of Australia's leading customer-owned, challenger banks, aggregators, and the financial services industry, aligned with our purpose - powering innovation in banking.

DA operates nationally with close to 300 staff based in Adelaide, Sydney, and Melbourne - enhancing the banking experience of more than 1.43 million Australians via its core banking and digital platforms, powering customer transactions across 3.2 million accounts every day.

About the Role:

The Service Desk and Operations functions at DA are the central communications point for our customers, vendors and staff for ICT support and services.

The Team Leader is a primary point of contact and management for System Events, Incidents, Service Requests and customer enquiries, providing a timely professional response to these activities.

In addition to these the Team Leader also:

  • 2IC with the absence of the Service Desk and Operations Manager
  • Is the Major Incident Manager during a major incident
  • Has additional operational tasks which require greater experience and training from an Operations officer
  • Is expected to support Operations officers with regards to questions, queries, concerns, and client support escalations

A key function of the Team Leader is to initiate, action and monitor scheduled daily/nightly operational tasks, such as batch processing and script execution.

You Will be Responsible for:

  • Provide first level 24/7 Service Desk point of contact and support for customers, vendors and DA staff
  • Responding, diagnosing, resolving and escalating; Incidents, Events and customer enquiries as appropriate to minimise disruptions to staff and external clients
  • Monitor the performance of various systems using tools provided to identify potential issues, outages, analyse trends and investigate alerts
  • Provision Service requests where required
  • Provide effective and timely customer communications
  • Follow the procedures and work instructions on the Operations Wiki site for the execution of daily/nightly tasks and activities
  • Acts as the Major Incident Manager during a Major incident
  • Trains and supports Operations Officers during their day to day duties
  • Has additional access, tasks and responsibilities detailed in the Operations Wiki site.

What You'll Need to Succeed:

  • Tertiary degree in Computer Science or related field would be highly advantageous
  • Relevant experience working on Service desk and/or 24/7 operations centre, including roster management
  • ITIL V3 Foundations qualifications or equivalent experience
  • Strong customer service focus with the ability to empathise as well as prioritise
  • Experience coaching a team to take responsibility for their actions and to deploy agile values, principles, and practices.

DA offers exciting opportunities for professional development and we have a strong focus on career progression for our employees. Flexible and supportive working arrangements are encouraged.

If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you! Please be sure to combine a covering letter addressing the key criteria set out above as the first page of your resume.

To be considered for this role you will need to be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident, or have a current visa that permits you to work in Australia.

title: Lecturer - Computer Science
description:
JR0000004317

Availability:
Continuing | Full-Time

Compensation Grade:
Academic Level B

Salary Range:
$99,827 - $118,135

Reporting to:
Dean, People and Resources (or Delegate)
Computer Science

About the College of Science and Engineering

At the College of Science and Engineering we believe in the power of science and engineering to solve real world problems. We strive to advance fundamental science, to create new technologies, and to work across discipline boundaries. Our interests scale from the sub-atomic through to entire oceans, forests and beyond. We seek to understand the past, but also to create the world of the future. Our college is an exciting place to research, study, and work, supported by best practice teaching methods, practical work-related learning, and advanced facilities.

About the Role

The Lecturer in Computer Science will produce quality research and deliver undergraduate and/or postgraduate teaching in the broad area of computing sciences. The Lecturer will be responsible for the development of innovative teaching materials, multi-mode teaching delivery, including face to face and online, and other innovative and contemporary teaching and learning strategies, appropriate for the discipline.

This position will make independent high quality contributions to research and/or creative activity, through activities such as quality publications, external grant acquisition and research student supervision and will also contribute to strengthening existing partnerships or exploring new partnerships with external stakeholders that have potential for providing improved teaching, learning and/or research outcomes for the University.

This role will prioritise, coordinate, monitor workflow and provide informal day‐to-day feedback to research support staff and casual academic teaching staff according to the University's policies, practices and standards.

About You

You will be a high-level communicator with excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to establish effective relationships with staff, students and industry. You will be passionate about enhancing the student experience and have a demonstrated understanding of the nexus between teaching and learning, research and scholarship.

To be successful in this role you will demonstrate:

  • Completion of a PhD, or equivalent qualification in a relevant area.

  • Demonstrated evidence of, or capacity to, undertake high quality teaching in a tertiary environment, including involvement in topic coordination and curriculum design.

  • Demonstrated evidence of a strong research track record (for career stage) in an area that augments and/or complements the existing research strengths of the University.

  • Demonstrated experience in one of the following (Desirable)

    • Modern software development and deployment (DevOps)
    • Data engineering
    • Human factors and Human Computer Interface (HCI) including affective computing, brain computer interfaces, natural language processing, ethics and privacy.

For more information regarding the position, or to have a confidential discussion, please contact: Dr Greg Falzon

Life at Flinders

We're transforming, and investing in people and facilities, to create contemporary, stimulating and satisfying learning and work environments that reflect our core values of excellence, innovation, courage, and integrity. Flinders is refocusing its strategic priorities with the aim of elevating its performance to be a top ten Australian university, and amongst the top 1% in the world.

Reaching beyond the limits of buildings, borders, and backgrounds, ours is an inclusive culture that believes absolutely in equality and opportunity for all. We don't just accommodate differences; we embrace and celebrate them. So, why work at Flinders?

  • 17% Superannuation + salary packaging options
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Wide range of professional development activities and services
  • We embrace diversity and promote equity and inclusion for students and staff with disabilities and health conditions , we are committed to Indigenous education and engagement and support initiatives such as The Pride Network
  • Vibrant campus life and amenities including on campus health care services , gym and childcare centre

Prescribed Conditions for Employment

A valid National Police Certificate which is satisfactory to the University will also be required before the successful applicant can commence in this position.

Flinders University has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that requires all new staff members to be up to date with their COVID-19 vaccinations, subject to medical exemptions and limited exemptions.

How to Apply and Information

To view the full position description and apply online , please visit the Jobs@Flinders website via the job portal: JR0000004317 - Lecturer in Computer Science

Applications to be submitted before 11:59pm Wednesday 25th May 2022

Please note, late applications and applications sent via agencies will not be accepted .

title: Senior Electrical Engineer / Electrical Lead
salary: Excellent salary + super + SCI + work-life balance
description:
Communities are fundamental. Whether around the corner or across the globe, they provide a foundation, a sense of place and of belonging. That's why at Stantec, we always design with community in mind.

We care about the communities we serve—because they're our communities too. We're designers, engineers, scientists, and project managers, innovating together at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. Balancing these priorities results in projects that advance the quality of life in communities across the globe.

About the role

The role of Electrical lead is suited to a proactive individual who is looking to take the next step in their career. We are ideally seeking a qualified candidate with substantial experience across all project sizes related to building projects with health bias. We are involved in a vast variety of project types including, health and aged care office, laboratories, defence, high rise residential, commercial buildings, data centres, education and hotels projects.

Provide required support to Project managers / Engineers to ensure overall focussed in terms of financial performance, QA adherence, risk management, and staff morale. Represent the company externally to Clients and play a senior and active role in managing these relationships. Reinforce cultural behaviours across the disciplines in the Adelaide Buildings Group.

You will enjoy a diverse position and will need to have the ability to multitask and share your time between project involvement, business development, project performance and management responsibilities.

Day to day tasks would involve:

  • Management of current and future workloads within the Electrical discipline to achieve attainment of financial targets.
  • Electrical design for a range of building projects, providing reports, studies, design calculations, drawings and specifications
  • LV power system modelling and light modelling using industry standard software such as PowerCAD, AGI/Dialux
  • Support and offer guidance to Project Engineers, Engineers and Graduate Engineers to enable them to perform successfully at all levels.
  • Ensure that the Electrical discipline maintains an appropriate level of service to key Clients.
  • Design, documentation and superintendence including project review, liaison with client and consultant team, liaison with authorities, reporting, contract administration and quality audits.
  • Adhere to professional standards, ethics and Stantec quality procedures.
  • Contribute to our company culture.

To be successful for this role you'll need:

  • Previous experience in Consulting environment within the Building services industry with a preference of health and laboratory type of projects
  • Knowledge of the Building Code of Australia and relevant Australian Standards
  • Bachelor of Electrical Engineering
  • Willingness to establish and maintain strong client relationships to formulate repeat opportunities
  • Ability to multitask between project involvement, lead multi-disciplinary teams
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

What we offer

Along with a competitive salary we offer many other benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing is ongoing.

  • Flexible Working Arrangements including purchasing up to 4 weeks additional leave and provision for school term contracts, work from home, job sharing and part-time employment.
  • Learning and Talent Development Programs including Global programmes, online learning and on-the-job learning
  • Mentoring for your own development and the opportunity to mentor others
  • Professional Memberships
  • Salary Continuance Insurance (SCI)
  • Service Recognition Awards
  • Employee Assistance Program

About Stantec

The Stantec community unites approximately 25,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring buildings, energy, resources, water, environmental, transport and infrastructure projects to life.

Our work from initial project concept and planning through design, construction, and commissioning begins at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships.

How to apply

If this position is of interest, please apply via the link below.
Please note that no agency applications will be accepted at this time.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
About Us

GaP Solutions is a leading and innovative provider of retail solutions used by our clients across Australia and internationally. Our cloud-based applications cover the key retail operations of point of sale (POS), shop floor scanning, and back-office retail management for supermarkets and fresh food retail businesses. Our software plays a vital role in getting fresh food packed, shelves stocked, checkout lines moving, and payment cards tapping for our partner retailers and their customers.

Due to sustained growth and our commitment to continuous improvement, we are looking for a Full Stack Developer to join our development team. If you are comfortable working across the stack of a SaaS web application, and are eager to be deeply involved in the design of our product, to enhance our development methodology, and to ask and answer the technical questions defining our architecture, then we would love to hear from you.

Why do we have this role in our team, and how might you fit in?

You'll be part of an agile, small, and supportive development team that is empowered to take full ownership of our technical solution, and collaborates with our product owners, customer support team, and clients to shape the future of retail by creating useful and delightful software improvements and features - all the way from idea initiation to long-term deployment in production.

Our team is on the lookout for another experienced developer who is passionate about writing clean and reliable code, influencing technical decision making, and working collaboratively to deliver the best possible product for our customers.

What might you have done in a typical month in this role?

The most notable ingredients in our stack are C#, ASP.NET Core, React, MariaDB, AWS, and Redis. If you are interested in writing code with the latest Microsoft tools such as .NET 6, or being part of an autonomous team that gets to see projects through from start to finish, or making life a little bit easier for our many users working hard in essential supermarkets and retailers - then this role is for you!

What should you bring to the role?

To be successful, you will have:

  • A demonstrable track record of delivering reliable, scalable, and high performing software
  • Well-practiced and resilient problem-solving skills, especially when problems are ambiguous, mysterious, or technically complex
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, and ability to influence non-technical audiences
  • Experience with:
    • Back-end object-oriented development (e.g. C# or Java)
    • Designing and querying relational database schemas (e.g. MySQL or SQL Server)
    • Defining and consuming APIs (e.g. GraphQL or REST architectures)
    • Creating reusable and efficient front end UI components
    • The ability to write testable, maintainable, and extensible code, and the enthusiasm to support others to do the same
    • The determination to contribute to the continuous improvement of our development methodology, the design and value of our product, and ultimately the outcomes for our customers

To stand out, you might have:

  • Tertiary qualifications in computer science or a related discipline
  • Experience with .NET 5/6, .NET Core, .NET Framework, or ASP.NET (Core, MVC, or Web API)
  • Experience with React and TypeScript
  • Experience building system architecture from the ground up
  • Experience with public cloud and serverless solutions
  • Experience with best practices and tools for cloud-based, distributed, and data-intensive applications (e.g. containers, Docker, Kubernetes, microservices, caching, event sourcing, Elasticsearch, Kafka)
  • An eye for performance, especially API throughput and database indexing and tuning

What can GaP Solutions offer you in return?

  • Competitive remuneration, and the job security of a permanent position with a longstanding and proudly South Australian organisation - software is part of our core business!
  • A commitment to work/life balance and flexible working arrangements, including flexible start and finish times
  • Hybrid work environment, including work from home days (as we sometimes develop and test with specialised hardware, we, unfortunately, cannot work 100% remotely)
  • A conveniently located suburban head office, with all-day on-street parking, and a short walk to a shopping centre and train line
  • Continuing learning and development - if the newest tech is right for us, we'll use it
  • The opportunity to collaborate directly with our customers - your efforts matter, and chances are you will see the fruits of your labour being actively used in shops every day
  • An inclusive and 100% technical team that communicates openly - everyone here codes every day, and you will be respected as an expert voice on processes and tools, product design, and technical decision making

title: Outreach and STEM Outreach Officer and Manager STEM Engagement  APS and APS 6
description:
The Role
In its 2017 Naval Shipbuilding Plan, the Australian Government made clear that a skilled workforce is critical to the success of the National Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise. As the largest capital investment ever undertaken in Australia, the National Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise represents an entirely new direction in the way Australia underpins its national security interests. We are seeking applications from individuals interest in undertaking challenging, interesting and important work that is front and center for the Australian Government within the Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise.

Are you looking for your next challenge?

Are you interested in building the next generation of S&T to support Naval Shipbuilding in the future?

Can you build strong sustainable partnerships to deliver integrated strategies and solutions?

Join DSTG and help us connect with the next generation to deliver More, together!

We are offering two exciting roles within Defence Science and Technology Group in STEM Outreach and Engagement. In these roles, you will help us build the Defence Science & Technology (S&T) workforce through nurturing the next generation to seek careers in science and technology and supporting the Chief Defence Scientist in the responsibility of building Defence S&T shipbuilding workforce capability .

It is recommended you contact Broderick Matthews at Broderick.Matthews@defence.gov.au for specific information on these roles.


About our Team
The Science Engagement and Impact Division (SEID) is responsible for strategically positioning DSTG to deliver maximum impact for Defence. The division co-ordinates and develops DSTGs external engagements and leads the development of science policy, the formulation of strategic research programs, and the investment of resources into DSTGs science and technology capabilities. The division also develops our highly skilled and collaborative workforce, recognising diversity in partnerships and building a shared culture.

Workforce Capability and Talent (WCT) Branch within SEID is responsible for building Defence capability through the strategic management of the Defence S&T workforce. WCT ensures there is a strong, diverse pipeline to meet the future workforce demand for Defence science and technology through planning workforce capability, partnering to raise the profile of STEM, engaging with talent pools and developing sustainable talent management strategies.

We also lead the implementation of the Brilliant People, Collaborative Culture pillar of the More, Together: Defence Science and Technology Strategy 2030 which focusses on developing a highly skilled and collaborative workforce that recognises diversity in partnerships and builds a shared culture.

Our Ideal Candidate
Our ideal candidates will be great communicators, who act with purpose to help shape innovation, science and technology within Defence and across the eco-system. You will be adept at using and presenting information to inform data driven decisions and enjoy a fast paced, agile environment. You will be a team player who is open to consulting with a range of stakeholders and teams to seek diversity of thought and new ideas. You will be inclusive to deliver progressive, pragmatic solutions for the Defence S&T eco-system.

The ideal candidates for these roles will have a well-developed understanding of the STEM ecosystem across Australia, with a focus on education including the tertiary sector and a proven ability to liaise and collaborate with schools and other relevant institutions and industry bodies.

An ability to collaborate, influence and build a strong rapport with a range of stakeholders to effectively facilitate delivery of cross-organisational programs is key to this role. Strong communication skills, with the ability to strategically communicate to a wide range of audiences using multiple mediums will be required.

You will have strong capabilities in program management, with demonstrated experience in working with a small team to achieve results within defined timeframes. The ability to perform analysis, identifying requirements and determining appropriate courses of action to meet organisational needs.

The ideal candidates will have a qualification, or equivalent experience, in science, technology and/or engineering, science communication, STEM education or equivalent experience with STEM outreach and engagement.

We will be creating a merit pool to fill any similar ongoing and non-ongoing vacancies over the next 12 months.

Application Closing Date: Friday 27 May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, reference DSTG/02757/22

on https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=D7CC8B47-B625-C5A6-E41E-C88D4923DACD .

title: Outreach and STEM Outreach Officer and Manager STEM Engagement  APS and APS 6
description:
The Role
In its 2017 Naval Shipbuilding Plan, the Australian Government made clear that a skilled workforce is critical to the success of the National Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise. As the largest capital investment ever undertaken in Australia, the National Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise represents an entirely new direction in the way Australia underpins its national security interests. We are seeking applications from individuals interest in undertaking challenging, interesting and important work that is front and center for the Australian Government within the Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise.

Are you looking for your next challenge?

Are you interested in building the next generation of S&T to support Naval Shipbuilding in the future?

Can you build strong sustainable partnerships to deliver integrated strategies and solutions?

Join DSTG and help us connect with the next generation to deliver More, together!

We are offering two exciting roles within Defence Science and Technology Group in STEM Outreach and Engagement. In these roles, you will help us build the Defence Science & Technology (S&T) workforce through nurturing the next generation to seek careers in science and technology and supporting the Chief Defence Scientist in the responsibility of building Defence S&T shipbuilding workforce capability .

It is recommended you contact Broderick Matthews at Broderick.Matthews@defence.gov.au for specific information on these roles.


About our Team
The Science Engagement and Impact Division (SEID) is responsible for strategically positioning DSTG to deliver maximum impact for Defence. The division co-ordinates and develops DSTGs external engagements and leads the development of science policy, the formulation of strategic research programs, and the investment of resources into DSTGs science and technology capabilities. The division also develops our highly skilled and collaborative workforce, recognising diversity in partnerships and building a shared culture.

Workforce Capability and Talent (WCT) Branch within SEID is responsible for building Defence capability through the strategic management of the Defence S&T workforce. WCT ensures there is a strong, diverse pipeline to meet the future workforce demand for Defence science and technology through planning workforce capability, partnering to raise the profile of STEM, engaging with talent pools and developing sustainable talent management strategies.

We also lead the implementation of the Brilliant People, Collaborative Culture pillar of the More, Together: Defence Science and Technology Strategy 2030 which focusses on developing a highly skilled and collaborative workforce that recognises diversity in partnerships and builds a shared culture.

Our Ideal Candidate
Our ideal candidates will be great communicators, who act with purpose to help shape innovation, science and technology within Defence and across the eco-system. You will be adept at using and presenting information to inform data driven decisions and enjoy a fast paced, agile environment. You will be a team player who is open to consulting with a range of stakeholders and teams to seek diversity of thought and new ideas. You will be inclusive to deliver progressive, pragmatic solutions for the Defence S&T eco-system.

The ideal candidates for these roles will have a well-developed understanding of the STEM ecosystem across Australia, with a focus on education including the tertiary sector and a proven ability to liaise and collaborate with schools and other relevant institutions and industry bodies.

An ability to collaborate, influence and build a strong rapport with a range of stakeholders to effectively facilitate delivery of cross-organisational programs is key to this role. Strong communication skills, with the ability to strategically communicate to a wide range of audiences using multiple mediums will be required.

You will have strong capabilities in program management, with demonstrated experience in working with a small team to achieve results within defined timeframes. The ability to perform analysis, identifying requirements and determining appropriate courses of action to meet organisational needs.

The ideal candidates will have a qualification, or equivalent experience, in science, technology and/or engineering, science communication, STEM education or equivalent experience with STEM outreach and engagement.

We will be creating a merit pool to fill any similar ongoing and non-ongoing vacancies over the next 12 months.

Application Closing Date: Friday 27 May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, reference DSTG/02757/22

on https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=D7CC8B47-B625-C5A6-E41E-C88D4923DACD .

title: Tableau Analytics Consultant
description:
About the job:

This role is a key position within a professional, friendly team of data specialists. The successful candidate will take a key role in delivery of Tableau projects and provides an opportunity for a variety of work including reporting & dashboards, integration and data science.

What DataSpark is like to work at:

DataSpark is a small, fast-paced team with terrific clients and interesting projects. Lots of dashboard development work, a bunch of data integration and wrangling.

The core of the team culture is that we're here for our clients and not the other way around. The successful candidate will demonstrate that they share our customer-first priority.

Although we are based in Adelaide, we have an extensive set of clients across Australia and New Zealand and are open to candidates working remotely.

Essential requirements:

  • Experience in a consulting role working directly with clients (internal or external).
  • Able to work both within a team and independently and manage multiple tasks and priorities.
  • Intermediate to strong Tableau software skills.
  • Imaginative. A good eye for detail. Good team player.

Desirable skills, experience and attributes (although not essential ideally you will have at least one of these):

  • Database and SQL
  • ETL or integration development
  • Experience with other BI/DA suites
  • Data Science

In your application, please provide a cover letter with the following details.

  • What attracted you to apply for this role?
  • What experience and skills do you believe make you a good fit for this role?
  • What career and professional development opportunities are important to you?
  • What is your definition of customer service?

To be upfront we would like to advise that this job is not a good fit for you if you want to:

  • Be placed at a customer site for months at a time. Instead, we run a remote delivery model with the team working together to achieve awesome things for our clients.
  • Spend all of your time doing pure data science. Instead, we spend a lot of our time coming up with innovative solutions to customer challenges, wrangling data and building dashboards.
  • Do one job at a time and the same thing every day. Instead...well, we work in a data analytics agency!

If this role sounds like it might suit you, please send through your resume with your updated cover letter, outlining your answers to the details written above.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Minimum NV1 Defence clearance or eligibility to acquire one is mandatory (requires Australian Citizenship).

About Fivecast
Fivecast is a world-leading provider of digital intelligence solutions. We enable the world’s most important public and private organizations to explore masses of data and uncover actionable insights, critical to protecting global communities.
Fivecast is an inclusive employer, we value diversity of thought and experience, and we believe our inclusive culture contributes to our success. We are committed to building a workforce that is representative of the communities in which we live and work.
As a growing start-up, all team members are provided with the opportunity to directly contribute to our success, participate in the development of new and emerging technologies and grow their career in a challenging and dynamic high-tech environment.

About the Role
A Fivecast Software Engineer will be working as a part of our best-in-class development team on challenging software problems. You will also be applying complex machine learning models developed by our Data Science team to large volumes of unstructured data.
This opportunity exists for candidates of varied backgrounds, and with different levels of experience; graduates, experienced developers as well as highly experienced senior developers are all encouraged to apply.
Our software stack is built on React.JS, Spring Boot and Java.
Fivecast are focused on our customers and regularly ship planned releases to production, while listening to users and responding to their feedback.

Requirements
  • Bachelor Degree level qualifications e.g. Computer Science, Software Engineering
  • Experience designing, implementing and testing software applications in Java
  • Experience with web front-end technologies e.g. HTML, CSS, and Javascript frameworks such as React or Angular
  • Experience using relational databases
  • Strong communication skills
  • Strong academic results are essential and academic transcripts must be provided
Desirable:
  • Experience with search engines or NoSQL document stores e.g. Elasticsearch, Solr, MongoDB
  • An understanding of data science and machine learning techniques
Our Work Environment and Culture
Only a few minutes from the city, Fivecast is located at Base 64 on North Terrace, home to other innovative and interesting Australian technology start-ups. Enjoy a casual, relaxed atmosphere that encourages collaboration and includes a fully equipped kitchen, barista quality coffee machine, end of trip facilities, comfortable indoor and outdoor spaces for meetings and eating. Base 64 also provides onsite parking or unmetered street parking is available nearby.

Fivecast has a connected work culture with team members often taking advantage of the in-house Foosball table, local cafes, bars, pubs and sporting facilities for Friday lunches, after work drinks and group activities. At Fivecast we understand the importance of a good work-life balance and support flexible work arrangements.

title: Career Relaunch Program 2022 - Engineering (Australia)
description:
GHD's Career Relaunch Program is back in 2022

Are you looking to return to work after a career break?

Returning to work after an extended career break can be challenging. That's why we've developed a Career Relaunch Program to encourage and welcome professionals back to the workforce in a flexible environment with excellent growth opportunities.

This initiative is motivated by GHD's dedication to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. It was first launched in 2017 and is now a national annual program that is growing every year.

We will provide you with a support network and training opportunities crafted to ease your transition back into the workplace. After the program, there will be potential for ongoing employment with GHD for suitable candidates.

To be considered for the program you will be:

  • Available on a casual basis for a minimum of 20 hours per week, ideally for the duration of the program
  • Someone who has had a career break and is seeking a supportive return to work program
  • A professional with commercial experience (prior to a career break) who has worked in any of the following areas:
    • Engineering (building services, civil/structural, electrical, mechanical, process, renewables)
    • Environmental and earth geosciences (including sustainability)
    • Architecture and urban design and planning
    • Modelling / drafting (Revit, 12d, AutoCad, Civil 3d, SolidWorks)
    • Project management (PMCA)
    • Advisory (including economics, mathematics, journalism, business, commerce, finance, risk and chemical, civil, electrical and power systems engineering)
    • Digital (data science, AI, GIS/location intelligence, cyber security, applications development, and software development)
    • Information Services (I.T) (business analysis, project management and security)
    • Business Services (finance, marketing and communications, people, and culture)

See what some of our relaunch alumni have to say about this program:

Emma Harrison | Business Group Leader – Contamination and Environmental Management | Sydney, NSW

"As a mother of four, I felt resigned to the fact that after ten years out of the scientific industry, the only way back in was through full-time study. Then I found GHD's Career Relaunch Program in 2018, which offered me a genuine opportunity to redevelop my career while still being able to support my four children as a single parent. I was offered an ongoing role as Senior Environmental Geologist after the program ended, and now three years later, I have recently moved into the Business Group Leader for Contamination and Environmental Management role, looking after 40 wonderful, talented professionals in this group."

Marguerite Cooper | Environmental Scientist | Sydney, NSW

“I reached a point after the birth of my second child, where I felt I was unable to perform to the best of my ability in either role as a scientist or a mum. I decided to take some time off to focus on my family, and two years later I was ready to return to work. I had been looking for work for around 18 months before I came across GHD’s Career Relaunch Program. GHD’s flexible working policy allowed me to re-join the workforce while still managing school and childcare requirements. It was wonderful to see that colleagues understood what the Career Relaunch Program was all about and were happy to provide me with a little extra time and flexibility to find my feet.”

Sam Marsh | Environmental Scientist | Hobart, TAS

“After moving from sunny Cairns to Hobart, I spent some time travelling around Australia, trying new jobs including working as a farm attendant on a Tassal fish farm in Tasmania. When I was ready to get back into my professional field, I was worried about learning how to work in a corporate environment once again. For me GHD's Career Relaunch Program meant I was able to develop new skills in the science industry and personally develop lifelong skills working with others and communicating on a professional level.”

Find out more about the program at ghd.com/careerrelaunch.

Apply

To apply, please submit a cover letter outlining your interest in the program and your CV before Tuesday 31 May 2022.

GHD is an equal opportunity employer, and we want everyone to be able to fully participate in our recruitment process. We value a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and people of all identities.

LI-JW1

#LI-REMOTE

title: Senior Research Officer
description:
The Opportunity
The role contributes scientific support in delivering high-quality scientific information and advice to facilitate the sustainable management of fishery resources in South Australian waters, through successful and timely delivery of research, publishing stock assessment reports and articles in peer-reviewed scientific journals. The role contributes to the research assessments and projects overseen by the Community-Based Fisheries Sub-Program. The primary focus of the group is on the population dynamics and fisheries biology of key species taken in shared access fisheries. Fishery dependent and biological data are integrated in stock assessments that determine the status of harvested populations. The primary outputs are stock assessment reports that provide the scientific basis for fisheries management. Scientific findings are published in peer-reviewed reports, and national and international journals. Research findings are also communicated directly to PIRSA fisheries managers, fishery licence holders and national and international scientists through relevant steering committees, meetings, and conferences.

The role contributes delivering the agency’s priorities including (1) Increasing productivity of our primary industries and agribusinesses (Stimulating Value Growth); (2) Securing production through biosecurity and efficient and sustainable use of resources (Sustaining the Resource); (3) Growing regions by supporting key regional development drivers and growing opportunities available to our regional communities; (4) Building partnerships with industry, stakeholders, research organisations and regional communities; and (5) preparedness to contribute to PIRSA’s response and recovery obligations in emergency situations.

About Us
The Department of Primary Industries and Regions, as a key economic development agency of the South Australian Government, works across a diverse range of industry sectors including agriculture, livestock, forestry, fishing and aquaculture and regional development. We involve and engage with others to ensure we make good decisions, have clear policies, plan and implement effective programs, drive relevant projects, promote efficient resource use and broker shared responsibility. In this way we enable the State’s primary industry sectors and regions to remain competitive, productive and sustainable.

Benefits
At the Department of Primary Industries and Regions, we offer our employees challenging and rewarding work with opportunities for career progression, learning and development and flexibility.

Our Commitment to Diversity
The Department of Primary Industries and Regions is committed to building a flexible, diverse and inclusive culture, planning for and promoting diversity. We welcome and encourage applications from diverse community groups and ages including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, LGBTIQ, people with disabilities, women and other diversity groups. The Department of Primary Industries and Regions recognises the benefits that such an approach brings for our staff and customers in delivering the future of SA.

Special Conditions
Successful applicant will be required to satisfactorily complete a National Police Check (NPC) prior to being made an offer of employment

Requirements

  • Regular intra-state and occasional inter-state travel
  • Term until 30 June 2023, full time based at West Beach
  • Possession of a current Class C driver’s licence and a willingness to drive
  • A degree in Science with a major in fisheries, zoology or related discipline (or equivalent research experience) is required
  • Regular work outside normal working hours
  • Possession of a current C class driver’s licence and willingness to drive
  • May require field trips on research and commercial vessels
  • Willingness to complete additional training as required (e.g. coxswains)
  • You acknowledge your work, health and safety obligations and our expectations


Remuneration
PO2 $84,399 - $93,400 per annum


Enquiries
Troy Rogers - Research Scientist
Phone: 8429 0558
Email: troy.rogers@sa.gov.au
Website: www.pir.sa.gov.au

Application Instructions
All applications must be submitted online.

If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit a Covering Letter (no more than 3 pages) outlining your skills and experience in relation to the Professional and Technical Knowledge, Communication and Initiative capabilities of the role description and a current CV (no more than 5 pages). Applicants must include the contact information of at least 2 referees with 1 being your immediate supervisor/manager and a completed “Pre-Employment Declaration in the SA Public Sector” form.

All applications must be submitted online via http://iworkfor.sa.gov.au/, citing Reference Number:  484569

title: Lab Technicians and Technical Officers - Defence
description:
Lab Technician and Technical Officer Roles - Defence R&D

Guided Weapons and Explosive Ordnance Program

  • Exciting Technical Support Opportunities
  • Attractive, Negotiable Remuneration
  • Adelaide based

YTEK is an independent Australian engineering and technology development organization, and a longstanding and trusted supplier of services to Australian Defence R&D with a proud record of continuous support since 2011 in the subject disciplines. Due to increasing demand from our Defence Energetics Support Group in Adelaide, YTEK now requires several suitably qualified Practitioners to join its ranks to support Research Prototyping to meet Capability and Strategy objectives for a pilot to a high priority multiyear program of sovereign significance.


The Roles: As part of a development team, incumbents will provide technical and practical lab support via several roles, categorised as follows:

  1. Firing Officer
  2. Instrumentation Technician
  3. Chemical Analysis Technician
  4. Explosive Ordnance Processing Technicians
  5. Mechanical Testing and Characterisation Technician

The major tasks associated with these roles, variously, include:

Firing Officer

  • Perform specific types of firings, including but not limited to, Intentional functioning of detonators, High explosive charges, Pyrotechnic devices, Rocket motors, Weapons, Gas guns, Propellant charges
  • Prepare weapons, firing systems and/or explosive charges as appropriate

Instrumentation Technician

  • Participate in specification, acquisition and setup of sensors, data acquisition, processing and recording equipment. Design, construction and testing of sensor and data capture systems.
  • Assist in development of data acquisition aspects of the design of experiments.
  • Set up and use high speed photo instrumentation equipment and assist in imagery analysis and interpretation.
  • Participate in the setting up and the conduct of experiments and trials with energetic materials in laboratories, specialist test facilities and outdoor ranges.
  • Use knowledge of sensors and data systems to assist in the interpretation and reporting of captured data from weapons and explosives trials.

Chemical Analysis Technician

  • Undertake a range of chemical analysis techniques on inert and energetic materials, including liquid and gas chromatography, mass spectrometry, ion chromatography, and various spectroscopic and microscopy techniques
  • Prepare chemical samples, including extraction of trace quantities of analytes from complex matrices
  • Undertake method development on new materials and/or chemical matrices
  • Interpret analytical results with reference to the appropriate Defence/International testing standards

Explosive Ordnance Processing Technicians

  • Undertake EO processing activities including mixing and casting
  • Inert and energetic ingredient preparation

Mechanical Testing and Characterisation Technician

  • Mechanical and performance characterisation of energetic materials; including mechanical property assessment, burn rate determination and physical properties
  • Analysis of test data

The Working Environment: A relaxed, professional and collaborative space, with the buzz of Defence research and advanced technology all around.

The Candidates: We are looking for a suitably qualified, responsible Lab Technicians and/or Tertiary qualified persons with a high level of initiative and self-motivation whose credentials align with the listed requirements.

Prerequisite qualifications: Formal training in technical aspects of relevant laboratory work as listed below or Equivalent or Higher Qualifications

Demonstrated experience, knowledge and skills in the following areas:

Firing officer

  • Storage, handling and firing of EO
  • Handling and preparation of explosive devices and charges
  • Ability to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team
  • Basic electronics knowledge including and understanding of firing and instrumentation systems used with explosive ordnance

Qualification: Relevant Defence EO qualification, equivalent to Army Ammunition Technician or relevant Industry training and/or experience

Instrumentation Technician

  • Ability to design, setup and operate data acquisition instrumentation systems
  • Electronics and instrumentation expertise including knowledge and/or experience in circuit design and fabrication
  • Demonstrable knowledge and/or experience in building instrumentation and associated hardware for testing
  • Experience in handling energetic materials (desirable)

Qualification: Vocational and/or tertiary qualification in Electronic Engineering

Chemical Analysis Technician

  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in analytical chemistry
  • Demonstrated understanding of QA/QC as it applies to analytical chemistry
  • Demonstrated practical experience using a range of analytical chemistry testing equipment
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience working with hazardous chemicals

Qualification: Tertiary qualification in Science, majoring in Chemistry

Explosive Ordnance Processing Technician

  • Materials processing and/or testing
  • Working safely with hazardous materials (including energetic materials)
  • Ability to operate computer-controlled equipment and processes
  • Preparation of and compliance with safety documentation including process instructions and risk assessments

Qualification: Tertiary qualification in Science or Engineering - highly desirable but not essential

Mechanical Testing and Characterisation Technician

  • Demonstrated experience in lab testing, especially mechanical testing
  • Ability to interpret and follow testing protocols and standards
  • Understanding of chemical lab WHS principles
  • Experience in handling energetic materials

Qualification: Tertiary qualification in Science or Engineering - highly desirable

Other desirable attributes:

  • These roles require incumbents to obtain and hold Australian Defence Security Clearance. Australian Citizenship is essential. A previous or current Australian Security Clearance would put you ahead of the queue.


New applications CLOSE at MIDDAY on 24 May 2022.

Please apply with covering letter - stating the role you are applying for - and CV, quoting role Ref ID GWEO2201 . For further details please contact Richard on 04 1902 7128 .

title: HR Reporting Coordinator
description:
About the role

We are seeking an experienced Reporting Coordinator to design and deliver standard and adhoc reports across the HR function, specialising in using MS excel and or Power BI as the delivery platform.

This role will be focused on faciltating adhoc and scheduled reports with in delivery timelines and assisting in the development of long term strategic reporting initiatives. This role has been created to provide meaningful analytics; effectively visualise, communicate, and disseminate data insights to better enable the business to make strategic decisions across the employee lifecycle.

Responsibilities include:

  • Identification & delivery of the most improtatnt suite of reports for internal and external customer requirements with ongoing process improvement
  • Co-ordinate/ facilitate feedback and training sessions to clients either individually or as a group as required to make the reporting function more efficient
  • Identification of effencies that can be gained through dispersal of duplications and automation of manaul tasks
  • Proactive analytics and implementation of change to enhance and improve efficiencies of reporting and all levels
About your experience

We are looking for a highly motivated and driven individual who is results focused and willing to challenge the ‘status quo'. You are someone who thrives working in a rapidly changing environment and are comfortable with proposing, justifying, initiating and implementing change. You will also have excellent communication and interpersonal skills to establish and maintain effective working relationship.

You will need to demonstrate:

  • Broad perspective and understanding of HR end to end employee life cycle
  • Experience in reporting, data analytics, data science and associated activites relevant to the role
  • Strong experience with MS Excel is mandatory
  • Power BI knowledge will be highly regarded
About our team

GFG Alliance has an agile, entrepreneurial culture with high energy, strong levels of ambition, and sustainable growth plans. This brings opportunities for GFG's people and businesses to flourish and develop. We work with our people to determine how we can grow our business and our future. We are committed to uncompromising levels of safety, strong customer centricity and diversity. Wherever they are in the world, our people are our greatest asset.

Next steps

Across our different business units, we offer career opportunities for people who share our drive, passion and ambition. From apprentices and graduates to experienced professionals, we are committed to offering fulfilling careers and the chance to grow as our business grows. We would love you to be part of our journey.

Apply today.

title: Support Analyst
description:
Bravura is seeking a Support Analyst to join our dynamic Corporate Systems team. The Support Analyst is responsible for understanding and evaluating internal client issues with software solutions in Bravura’s ERP Systems, data warehouse and reporting solutions, then helping to resolve those issues.

Strong analytical skills and a hunger for knowledge will help the successful candidate deliver quality outcomes for Bravura’s Internal clients. This position can be based in Adelaide, Sydney, or Melbourne with the flexibility to attend the office on an ad hoc basis.

The role will have responsibility for

  • Analysing issues raised by internal clients, determining the best course of action for resolution, actioning or facilitating that resolution
  • Documenting software bugs, data translation issues or workflow failure, working with the corporate systems team to ensure that the software delivered meets the requirements
  • Management of client raised helpdesk tickets to resolution
  • Analysis and replication of defects, and testing of software fixes
  • Actively improving software development and business processes


Key skills

  • Excellent communication and customer service skills
  • Proven ability of identifying software/data problems and translating these into effective, quality solutions
  • Ability to distinguish between software, environmental and user errors
  • A disciplined approach to planning and managing goals, coupled with the ability to prioritise deliverables
  • Results oriented, analytical and resourceful in finding solutions
  • A clear understanding of the Quote to cash lifecycle for professional service organisations, and financial/management reporting
  • A clear understanding of databases, systems integration, segregation of duties, security and data management


Qualifications and Experience

  • 3+ years’ experience in a similar Software support role
  • Familiarity with relational databases, SQL and the software development lifecycle
  • Experience working within helpdesk/service desk environment with ability to understand and act appropriately when presented with conflicting priorities
  • Tertiary education in Computer Science/Information Technology seen favourably
  • Advanced skills in one or more of the major programming languages, SQL and in the evaluation of hardware and software options seen favourably
  • Workday, MS project server, and TM1 administration experience seen favourably


What we offer you:

We are passionate about what we do, holding ourselves accountable to standards of excellence while celebrating our successes along the way. Our people are at the heart of our business. We work hard to provide a rich employee experience and a robust framework for ongoing career development.

  • A friendly, social and supportive global team that thrives on delivery & embraces diversity
  • We are enthusiastic and adventurous with a large global reach; we have employees, offices, and customers across the world utilising our award-winning solutions
  • Competitive salary and employee benefits scheme
  • Flexible working hours, we value work-life balance
  • Newly renovated offices that inspire Agile and collaborative ways of working


About Bravura Solutions

At Bravura Solutions, collaboration, diversity and excellence matter. We value your ideas, giving you room to be curious and innovate in an exciting, fast-paced, and flexible environment.


As a market leader and ASX 200 company, we are a trusted partner to over 350 leading financial services clients. We invest significantly in our technology hubs and innovation labs, which inspire and drive our creative, future-focused mindset. We take pride in developing cutting-edge technology solutions that support our clients to achieve financial security and prosperity for their customers.


How to apply?


If you are interested in joining an ASX listed fintech powering the world’s leading financial institutions, we would love to hear from you so apply online today.


Please note, as part of the job application process, you will be taken to Bravura Solutions’ careers portal. We don’t always work to fixed closing dates and will consider candidates as and when they apply.

title: Software Engineer (Client Integrations)
description:
About the Company

Our clients is a rapidly growing team of 100+ mathematicians, engineers, designers, computer scientists, strategists and client success experts based in the U.S., Canada, Australia, and New Zealand building a machine learning-based, advanced analytics workforce and human capital management platform.

They offer awesome work culture, hybrid (remote), and respect work/life balance, have a great office culture (kitchen filled with snacks, pizza Fridays etc), along with just a terrific bunch of people!

About the role

The client delivery team is responsible for all aspects of implementation services. We're looking for highly talented Software Engineers with Ruby and/or Java backgrounds to be part of our growing integration team to help us deliver our platform at scale to some of the largest organisations in the world.

Responsibilities

  • Be an integral part of our team responsible for implementation to large enterprise clients.
  • Understand system and data integration requirements in collaboration with client's technology and operations teams.
  • Configure / customise platform and integrate with client's systems as per the defined integration approach.
  • Develop integrations with client's systems for movement of data to / from client environments.
  • Work with other teams to diagnose and improve overall data processing efficiency.
  • Collaborate with client's internal technology teams and external partners to ensure timely completion of implementation projects.

Skills and experience
