For more information or a confidential discussion, please contact Jessica Gadsby on (08) 8112 7417 quoting reference 246315.

To apply please click the 'Apply Now' button.

title: Graduate IT Administrator
description:
Graduate IT Administrator - Adelaide Based

About Us

Prophecy International is an Australian-based multinational that develops software used by large and complex organizations worldwide. We design and develop software and bring it to the world through our global business partner channel in each of our territories – America, Europe, Middle East, Africa, and Asia/Pacific. Our software solutions include eMite and Snare.

• eMite is a cloud-based data analytics platform which provides contact center analytics, data visualization, and data correlation solutions to over 200 customers worldwide

• The Snare suite of security and compliance products range from small footprint, highly effective device and network logging and log-management tools through to advanced IT infrastructure threat protection solutions.

We are currently on the lookout for a Graduate IT Administrator who will play a key role in the local team as well as contributing to the overall business success.

Working with passionate professionals you will join a team that plays a key role in the delivery of all parts of IT and Security across the business.   This is a great opportunity to develop your career within an organisation that continues to lead the way in design, development, quality, and customer service within the software and development industry.   We are passionate about embracing flexibility and are happy to roll up our sleeves to get the job done and to exceed the requirements of our customers. We truly know what it means to work as a team where no one feels that they have to go it alone and our satisfaction comes from the value we add, big or small, in helping our team to do their best.

The Role

As a graduate beginning your career at Prophecy International, you will explore what’s possible for your future with hands-on, real-life experience on our full suite of projects and disciplines, with guidance and mentoring from experienced professionals who will help you grow into a leading professional in your sphere of expertise.

This is a true IT Administrator role where no two days look alike.   Based out of our Adelaide office and reporting to the CISO, your main responsibilities will include:

  • Performing daily system administration activities for the Snare and eMite (and legacy Prophecy systems)
  • Helping with patching and maintaining systems,
  • VMware cluster maintenance
  • Configuration for the Snare and eMite systems for the development teams, cloud systems (Oracle, Amazon and Microsoft) including O365,
  • User provisioning and maintenance.
  • System access reviews
  • Malware protection updates and following up alerts.
  • Configuration and building/rebuilding staff laptops as needed.
  • Assist with the ISO27001 program with operation of systems and compliance activities and work with the CISO as needed.
  • Work on system and security remediation activities from any security findings.
  • Be a part of development scrum team as needed helping with IT system administration activities
  • Ensure JIRA data and timesheets are kept up to date and accurate for financial reporting
  • Supporting the IT Department with on-boarding and off-boarding of Computer users etc.
  • Stay up to date with current industry trends, tools and methodologies through additional training and conferences where required.
  • Other IT Administration duties as requested by the CISO; and
  • Work towards certification such as in products such as VMWare, Oracle/Microsoft/Amazon cloud administration


Your Profile

You will do well in this role with your strong passion for IT Systems and Administration and ultimately improving the business, ability to anticipate stakeholder needs and your keen eye for all the details. You know your way around general IT Administration matters and system remediation activities and feel confident providing advice on IT System Administration.    Your IT admin skills are sharp – balancing efficiency and accuracy. You are well versed in the IT space and have a clear eye on when it comes to best quality IT system administration practices.

You pride yourself on your ability to get things done.  You communicate with confidence, and you know the importance of developing strong relationships.  You are an eager individual with the excitement to learn more and not shy away from asking questions that will help further develop you.  You are driven by results, are not afraid to step-up when needed and thrive being in a busy admin role that plays a pivotal part in the business’ continued success.

Skills & Experience:

  • Recent Graduates in IT or 1+ years’ experience in a role with IT system administration
  • A genuine interest in the IT / cybersecurity domain with a natural talent for learning, allowing you to quickly master new domains.
  • Experience with Microsoft Windows desktop and Server platforms, Linux flavour's such as Ubuntu, RHEL
  • Basic understanding of networking protocols such as TCP/IP, DNS, Email, file transfers, Web protocols such as HTTP and HTTPS, routers, switches and firewalls.
  • Highly analytical and can apply your skill to solve a wide array of problems.
  • Articulate and have great presentation skills that allow you to simplify complex concepts for both technical and non-technical audience.
  • Relevant Degree in Computer Science or information Systems (or studying towards).
  • Influencing skills and experience in working with multiple internal and external stakeholders.
  • Ability to review and develop policies and procedures, including compliance activities.
  • Australian Citizenship or Permanent Resident
  • Ability to work with and apply emerging technologies and to evolve the way of working with contemporary methodologies and practices.
  • Comprehensive knowledge and understanding of technology service methods, policies and procedures.
  • Sound knowledge of internet security and data privacy principles
  • Knowledge of networked computer system environments.
  • Knowledge in Microsoft Office computer applications and operating systems.
  • Ability to troubleshoot.
  • Ability to assess customer support needs and implement effective and administration solutions.
  • Proficient skills in Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality when working with sensitive information and to comply with all record retention laws and corporate policies.
  • Ability to maintain proficiency and knowledge of current and/or new regulations/legislation within areas of responsibility.

Highly Desirable

  • Windows Active Directory configuration
  • Any cloud administration experience with Oracle, Amazon, Azure, Google.
  • A tertiary qualification and/or industry security certifications

Soft Skills

  • “CAN-DO” Attitude and Mindset.
  • A good level of business awareness and commercial acumen.
  • Strong communication and relationship building skills with both internal teams and external customers.
  • Creative/tenacious problem solver, who will think beyond the status quo and will own issues until full resolution.
  • High energy level coupled with a desire to take on responsibility.
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize work to maintain required productivity levels.
  • Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team.
  • Are ambitious/passionate about what you do, and enthusiasm to grow your career at Prophecy International.
  • Push the boundaries to create innovative solutions and love a challenge.
  • Thrive in a culture that’s all about teamwork and we are here for our customers no matter what.

How to Apply

Please follow the instructions to apply via Seek.  Your application should include:

  1. A brief Cover Letter outlining your suitability for the role.
  2. A current CV / Resume with contact details of at least two referees (who will only be contacted with your consent following interview).

We offer our staff a competitive salary package and a supportive, flexible working environment.  If you want to join a global ASX company that is making a difference, apply now.

Flexibility and WFH Options available.

Good Luck and we look forward to receiving your application.

No Recruitment Agencies Please.

title: Integration and Test Engineer
description:
• All Systems GO! Be part of the next generation of defence technology
  • Excellent opportunity for growth and career progression
  • Enjoy flexibility, engaging work and a culture that embraces diversity and open-mindedness

At BAE Systems we are all systems go as we continue to drive innovation and seek passionate and talented people to join our business. We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Integration and Test Engineer within the Wedgetail project . This role will be based in Adelaide, Edinburgh Parks.

What this opportunity will mean for you:

  • Purposeful work where your efforts are recognized in an environment where you can thrive
  • Joining an organization that is passionate about developing some of the most impressive careers in the world
  • Industry-leading flexibility options to unlock the talent and diversity of every individual
  • Unique opportunities to contribute to programs of national significance whilst growing your skills
  • A strong safety culture, inclusive teams and work to be proud of, underpinned by a compelling set of values

Your new role:

The Test and Integration Engineer works in the Wedgetail team environment and conducts test and integration engineering related activities in accordance with Wedgetail project procedures and work instructions.

In particular, this role will see you:

  • Responsible for complying with requirements of BAE Systems Australia Quality Systems as they relate to areas of activity
  • Work within agreed project technical, cost and schedule constraints
  • Provide support to other teams or individuals with regards to activities performed by the team. Promote and encourage co-operation within the team
  • Undertake systems integration and hardening activities
  • Undertake physical and functional installation of qualified components into the system, and  incremental verification of physical and functional interfaces
  • Undertake all assigned test and integration activities in accordance with project directives and standards
  • Develop test and integration related documentation in accordance with appropriate standards
  • Assist in development of any tools/ rigs necessary for integration of the deliverable system
  • Identify opportunities for improvement of test and integration practices
  • Ensure Problem Reports are raised for all system problems identified during system integration, and where possible, isolate such problems to specific system components

About you:

As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you will have;

  • Bachelor Degree in Engineering or Science, with working experience as a qualified Engineer or Scientist after qualification has been received, in engineering discipline or integration, test and evaluation specialisation
  • Experience in Integrating and testing complex systems; investigation and fault finding.
  • Experience in managing and executing test programs.
  • Strong technical writing and technical discussion skills.
  • Experience in working with SQL Server for test data creation and data inspection, knowledge of managing and maintaining multiple datasets.
  • Experience working with both Windows and Linux environments.
  • Experience working with Change and Configuration management tools.
  • Estimation skills particularly in the test documentation and execution field

Research shows that some candidates hesitate to apply for roles if they feel they don't meet 100% of the criteria. So, if this opportunity excites you and you have the right foundational experience and qualifications, we encourage you to apply. Whether it be for this role or another, your skills and competencies are of interest to us.

Clearances:

As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance.

International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.

Further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html

Applications should be addressed to: Bradley Schulz and made online here. Confidential enquiries are welcome via email: Bradley.Schulz@baesystems.com

Please be aware that pursuant to different State government health directions, vaccination mandates regarding your ability to attend our Company sites may be applicable.  Please be prepared to discuss your vaccination status with our recruiters as part of the recruitment process.

We are a 2021 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.

Our culture:

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment where our people can thrive. For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of our employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation.

If you would like to know more information about how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives here: https://au.work180.co/employer/bae-systems/benefits

To learn about other employment opportunities at BAE Systems, please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au

title: Frontline Leader Coach - Associate / Senior Associate
description:
As an Associate/ Senior Associate in our ‘Perform’ team, you’ll work with clients to coach frontline leaders to create value at the intersection of human and digital. ‘Perform’ is our global people-productivity methodology for frontline leaders aimed at embedding new behaviors, ways of working and key skills to leverage people performance.  Delivered through our coaches, we play a key role in helping some of the largest operations teams (e.g. contact centers, processing teams, field services) across Australia to create value and improve the way they work. This is done by digitising operations, shifting to contemporary operating models and improving the way they operate reducing costs

About you:

As a Frontline Leader Coach Associate/ Senior Associate in our ‘Perform’ team your impact will be seen by:

  • Training front line operational leaders and their teams on the ‘Perform’ methodology to uplift their capability;
  • Coaching front line operational leaders to embed the ‘Perform’ methodology in their teams and deliver productivity improvements through people performance
  • Driving practical process optimisation, operational excellence, automation or people capability based programs to uplift performance;
  • Communicating clearly and effectively with clients and senior leadership on progress of leader capability uplift and team performance outcomes;
  • Delivering crucial business insights to clients through data analytics and data visualisation, to improve performance or reduce costs

You have experience in working in a fast moving, client focused and project based environment - this may include experience working within a consulting firm or corporate environment. You also may have an operational background and experience in driving performance improvement.  You are skilled in data analysis, coaching and influencing others, running workshops, with exceptional verbal and written presentation skills and hold an understanding of operating model design, process improvement (e.g. Lean / Six Sigma), or embedding new ways of working.

Your core skill set including communication, presentation, stakeholder management and ability to work in cross-functional teams are considered to be strong

Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our ‘Perform’ team deliver practical advice that speaks straight to the heart of our clients’ business issues and delivers innovative results.

You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.

You’re also keen to learn, to take up opportunities to improve your craft and continuously work towards the success of our clients. You are fascinated by the future and how the forces of change are influencing how we work, play and live. Most importantly, you’re keen and willing to learn to succeed in your role, and you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.

For significant parts of our client base we will require Australian citizenship and eligibility to hold an AGSVA issued security clearance.

Examples of degrees that could be relevant are: Psychology, Communications, Commerce, Economics, Behavioural Science, Education, Human Resources, Arts

PwC is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, as well as visitors to our offices and events.

PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff, contractors, clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices, attend client sites, undertake work-related travel, or attend work-related events, subject to limited exemptions. For more information: https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html

title: Software Engineer (Client Integrations)
description:
LIFELENZ is a rapidly growing team of 100+ mathematicians, engineers, designers, computer scientists, strategists and client success experts based in the U.S., Canada, Australia, and New Zealand building a machine learning-based, advanced analytics workforce and human capital management platform. We have built and maintained over 20+ platforms over a 19-year period. We have won many awards for client delivery and collectively contributed to over 100+ global patents for complex software platforms.  We have recently closed our financing B round bringing our total capital raised to over $55M.

Our mission is to create optimized outcomes for both employers and employees.

We are proud to have had a transformative impact on society with our platform, born from an idea to better the lives of the liquid workforce where there are high volumes of shift workers.

LIFELENZ is an automated workforce and human capital management platform solving challenges related to onboarding, sales & labour forecasting, scheduling & time clock/keeping, insights & reporting and labour law compliance.  It uses machine learning to automatically self-tune and self-manage models to a particular store with hyper-local attributes.  The technology approach and analytic methodologies used enable the distribution across large-scale centralized ownership and highly fragmented franchised ownership companies.

Who are we seeking:

LIFELENZ is expanding its Client Delivery Team in Australia. The Client Delivery Team is responsible for all aspects of implementation services for our customers.

We're looking for highly talented Software Engineers with Ruby and/or Java backgrounds to be part of our growing integration team to help us deliver our platform at scale to some of the largest organisations in the world.

What you can expect:

  • Be an integral part of our team responsible for implementation of the LIFELENZ platform for our large enterprise clients.
  • Understand client's business processes and technology environment.
  • Understand system and data integration requirements in collaboration with client's technology and operations teams.
  • Configure / customise platform and integrate with client's systems as per the defined integration approach.
  • Understand LIFELENZ data model and data integration frameworks.
  • Develop integrations with client’s systems for movement of data to / from client environments.
  • Work with other teams to diagnose and improve overall data processing efficiency.
  • Collaborate with client's internal technology teams and external partners to ensure timely completion of implementation projects.
  • Serve as primary point of contact for any technical queries from the clients.

What you bring:

  • Prior experience in system integration and / or backend software development.
  • 3+ years of development experience in Ruby (preferred) or Java.
  • Strong interpersonal and client communication skills.
  • Understanding of clean code and testing principles.
  • Experience working with a Linux based environment.
  • Proven resilience to handle challenges and solve complex client problems.
  • Nice to have
    • Experience in system integration roles as part of an enterprise software implementation in a cloud-based environment.
    • Familiarity with REST & GraphQL API’s.
    • Prior experience in workforce management solutions.
    • Prior experience working with Quick Service Restaurant and/or Retail industries.

And to be successful in LIFELENZ you would have to…

  • Be an aspiring individual who enjoys variety and unpredictability in a role.
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment with demonstrated ability to quickly learn and adapt to new processes, tools, and software engineering concepts (where relevant to recruitment of course!)
  • Demonstrate tenacious problem-solving and critical thinking skills, attention to detail and a passion for driving efficient and scalable solutions / processes.
  • Be a self-starter and naturally curious individual who thrives in a dynamic work environment on individual initiatives, and as part of a team.

Why LIFELENZ?

We are a ground-breaking platform with a unique vision (we can’t give away our secrets here!).  We have office locations in Adelaide, Chicago, Washington D.C., Lehi in the US, and people based in San Francisco, New York City, Toronto, and New Zealand.

We are proud to be headquartered in Adelaide (80+ of us here in the heart of the CBD), deploying on a global scale to our clients.

We offer awesome work culture, hybrid (remote) working has been in our DNA well before COVID, leaders who really respect work/life balance, great office culture (kitchen filled with snacks, pizza Fridays etc),  along with just a terrific bunch of people with the same goal!

If you feel this role is for you, and you have full working rights in Australia, please apply – an enthusiastic, high performing team awaits!

For any questions, or a highly confidential chat, please don't hesitate to get in contact with me - katrina.pathrikar@lifelenz.com.au

title: Software Developer
description:
Fyfe is a multi-disciplinary consultancy providing comprehensive engineering, environmental, planning and surveying services throughout Australia. Fyfe work with a wide range of clients in the Property & Infrastructure and Energy & Resources sectors to provide high quality, commercially pragmatic solutions with a strong focus on client service and delivery.

About the Role

We are seeking a highly motivated Software Developer with data analytics and reporting skills to join our IT Team.

This dynamic position will work collaboratively with the IT Team and will play a pivotal role within the wider business. In this role, you will be responsible to assess and gather business requirements and process improvements with proven ability to design, develop, test, and deploy necessary changes. We require someone resolution focussed with good problem-solving skills to determine the improvement implementation process of either enhancing our existing applications or building new ones.

Additionally, you will assist with data analytics and reporting as required by the business such as ad-hoc queries, Crystal Reports or Power BI interactive Data Visualisations.

Requirements and Systems Knowledge

  • Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science and/or Software Engineering or equivalent
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels of the business
  • VB.net development
  • SQL Server and T-SQL development
  • Power BI
  • Crystal Report

Desirable Systems Knowledge

  • Laserfiche Forms or Forms based workflow development
  • C#
  • Powershell

Culture

Fyfe values our clients and our people and has a culture built on respect, integrity and the delivery of value. This is achieved through a combination of flexible and contemporary working conditions supported by an inclusive management style which sees all levels of management being accessible through an open-door policy applicable to everyone. Fyfe have also engaged various corporate entities to offer benefits to staff, have a social club and encourage an innovative and pro-active approach to projects. With 15 offices nationally, staff are encouraged to tap into the wealth of knowledge that we have, welcoming information sharing and troubleshooting among colleagues.

Benefits

  • Competitive Salary
  • Opportunity of equity at Fyfe and celebrate in our successes
  • Employee benefits scheme
  • Support and contribute to the candidates continued Professional Development (CPD)

How to apply

If you believe you meet the above criteria and would like to join our team, click on the APPLY FOR THIS JOB button to submit your application.

Follow us on LinkedIn to keep up to date with our news and projects.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
BI Reporting Expert needed for Adelaide Tech Company

  • Huge impact, loads of autonomy and opportunities for growth
  • Flexible office / work from home arrangements
  • We've even got dogs in the office, what's not to like?

Guided by a domain expert, your reports will be used across the globe to make multi-million dollar operational decisions.

About Us

One of the great challenges in the world right now is the need to move to greener energy and technology solutions. To do that the world needs more copper, steel and rare earth metals than ever before. So here’s the challenge: to go green the world needs (much) more mining, but mining already contributes to about 6% of global greenhouse gas emissions every year.

At MaxMine we work to improve mining efficiency - we focus on what we can do today to improve that situation. We’ve demonstrated productivity improvements of 15% on some sites with corresponding reductions in effective greenhouse gas emissions by 5-10% from current operational baselines. Our client base is growing and our analytics services are rapidly expanding.

In short, we solve real problems with innovative and tangible solutions that actually stick. With your help, we hope to make it even better!

About You

You are a business analyst and report developer that is motivated by working on interesting and innovative products. We are looking for people that have a knack for reading a problem statement and finding the solution in a complex system of data. You are keen to get stuck in and solve big, challenging problems. Not afraid to get your hands dirty in order to deliver a big outcome for clients.

  • You are a curious person and a problem solver.
  • Ideally have experience developing visualisations and reports using SQL and BI tools
  • You prefer simple and effective, over complicated and efficient.
  • You like to solve problems once, so that they stay solved.
  • You want your work to matter, to make an impact

Your Skills

We are currently seeking expressions of interest from current candidates who have some of the following:

  • Passion for telling stories with data and making the complex simple
  • Some interest in design, design thinking and product thinking (thinking beyond just the visualisation)
  • Experience working with a low-code visualisation tool such as PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, QuickSight, TIBCO Spotfire
  • Some understanding of SQL and databases
  • Solved real world problems using data analytics and reporting
  • Strong communication skills, able to provide analysis and reporting that suits the context and audience
  • Attention to detail producing tested, repeatable analysis

Our Technology

We work with a range of technologies across the full spectrum of dev-ops and data-science. Our platform is based on:

  • AWS, Snowflake, DBT and Power BI
  • SQL and Python programming languages
  • Git, Bitbucket, JIRA, Confluence

We expect you to be able to build, maintain and evolve our low-code visualisation stack, which is currently Power BI connected to Snowflake.

There is also scope to bring new technologies to our platform team where they fit within our existing technology and can deliver business value.

Our Values

Our team's cohesion and success draws from a culture of shared values.

  • Impact: We move the needle for our customers, people and environment.
  • Finishing: We celebrate when things are done.
  • Excellence: We take pride in our work. Quality output, with a sense of urgency.
  • Customer: We play the long game, as one team.
  • Ubuntu: We believe ‘I am because we are’.
  • Playful spirit: We have a good laugh.

What We Offer

  • Lots of chances to learn and grow – you’ll be surrounded by some of the brightest minds in the city, part of a culture which values sharing knowledge every day
  • A chance to join a rapidly scaling start-up
  • The opportunity to shape your role, our team and our product

If this sounds like you, please apply via seek and check out our website at maxmine.com.au

title: Medical Imaging Service Engineer
description:
Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world's most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world? At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere.

We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting?

Then come and join our global team as a Customer Service Engineer working across our Computed Tomography (CT) and Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) modalities. As a result of recent growth, we have positions available in several states across Australia including Victoria, New South Wales, Queensland and South Australia.

Reporting into the local Team Leader, the primary function of this position will be to carry out all day-to-day service, maintenance and/or installation activities across the relevant state with minimal supervision ensuring compliance with customer satisfaction, quality and safety standards.

This position will require you to be available to work between the hours of 7am to 7pm to meet the operational requirements of the business and participate in a rotational ‘on call’ roster.

Your tasks and responsibilities:

  • Fulfilling the customer's needs for Preventative Maintenance (PM), any updates/upgrades, corrective service, installations in accordance with business contractual obligations (contract obligations or billing policy)
  • Timely completion of Service Reports with good liaison with the Customer Care Centre (CCC), management, sales, marketing and/or customers ensuring current location and job status is communicated back to Customer Call Centre
  • Comply with all Environment & Safety (EH&S) policies, service escalation procedures and that all customer requests, complaints and comments communicated to the jobholder are passed to the relevant department for action
  • Maintaining personal knowledge of safety instructions and operational procedures and participate in training courses including 'self-learning', computer based and 'on the job' training.

Your qualifications and experience:

  • The successful candidate will be technical, or university trained
  • Experience in service, maintenance, and installations on relevant technologies i.e., medical equipment
  • Extensive experience in CT and MRI systems is preferred
  • Ideally hold the applicable licensing as per state requirement such as a radiation and electrical licence.

Your attributes and skills:

  • A strong communicator
  • Ability to build sound working relationships internally and externally
  • Ability to work autonomously and as part of a wider team
  • Customer empathy and interaction skills
  • Ability to problem solve and work under pressure

Our global team:

We are a team of 66,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in healthcare to help improve people’s lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

Our culture:

We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success.

We are an equal opportunity employer.

Applications close 19 June 2022 or sooner should sufficient applications be received.

We care about your data privacy and take compliance with GDPR as well as other data protection legislation seriously. For this reason, we ask you not to send us your CV or resume by email. We ask instead that you create a profile in our talent community where you can upload your CV. Setting up a profile lets us know you are interested in career opportunities with us and makes it easy for us to send you an alert when relevant positions become open.

To all recruitment agencies: Siemens Healthineers does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, employees, or any other company location. Siemens Healthineers is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Application Developer
description:
• Help build a data driven culture
  • Work  within a dynamic team
  • Opportunity for professional development
  • Be part of a Medical Imaging Practice that empowers staff to deliver exceptional service

Excellent full-time opportunity for an experienced Application Developer

About Us

At Dr Jones & Partners we are committed to minimising patient effort in  delivering the best possible patient experience. We do this by investing in our people, systems and technology. Dr Jones & Partners is the provider of choice for referrers and patients in our communities.

About the Role

Due to our continuous growth and our innovative roadmap, we are looking for an Application Developer (Java/Python) to join our team in Adelaide.

  • Work in an agile team with a ‘start-up’ culture to develop and support applications supporting our practice vision to transform Radiology
  • We solve problems as a service. No day is the same!
  • Help our amazing clinical team by building applications sync with emerging suite of enriched data products to provide front-end application view to end users.
  • Help us realise our product roadmap with exciting and transformative features providing genuine and tangible impact to our team, our patients, and our referrers.
  • Bring your experience to the team and help us evolve and become a better innovation unit.

Essential Skills, Knowledge, Experience and Leadership Competencies

  • Experience in Java and Python software development.
  • Experience working with functional/lambda programming paradigms (e.g. Java Streams)
  • 3-4 year degree in Engineering and/or Computer Science (or Masters/PhD relating to Software Engineering and/or Computer Science)
  • Good knowledge about Software Development Life Cycle, development, test/deployment automation.
  • Strong understanding of APIs.
  • Strong background working with relational databases
  • Development, implementation and maintenance of web applications and systems.
  • Creating and consuming REST web services
  • Experience in Agile methodologies and Cloud Services.
  • Providing specialist advice and support to aid diagnostics and issues resolution.
  • Azure function apps, App Services, Storage accounts and resource groups
  • Comfort with the Atlassian suite (Jira / Confluence / BitBucket)

If you’re seeking your next career challenge and are passionate about the delivery of excellence in medical imaging services to patients, referrers and the community, we encourage you to apply to Dr Jones & Partners today.

Simply complete the application process by clicking the Apply Now button and we’ll be in touch.

APPLY NOW!!

No recruitment agencies please

title: Ecology Team Manager
description:
Succession Ecology is a multi-faceted environmental business, providing a broad range of services in ecological consulting and research, landscape scale restoration and native seed supply. We specialise in large-scale management and restoration of arid systems and the production and sale of native seed. Our focus is on finding unique solutions in nature and applying new and innovative techniques to ecosystem management, which sets us apart in the environment industry.


Succession Ecology is expanding in response to market demand and are looking to add Executive roles to join our management team. We are looking for an enthusiastic person interested in joining our team with a focus on culture, values, team building and business growth.


This position requires an experienced Ecologist to join and manage our Ecological consulting team. Our Ecology team works across a broad range of projects including ecosystem recovery, design, management and monitoring, development projects and tailored research programs to support project outcomes. The position will involve field work in locations throughout Australia (typically in SA) and office work based at Edwardstown.


We are passionate about what we do and look forward to finding a new team member that can contribute to building our positive impact on the environment in Australia. The ideal candidate will be hardworking and adaptable person with an enthusiasm for learning, innovation and being actively involved in making a difference in our unique environment.


You will need:
• PhD qualification in Ecology or Environmental Science.
• 15 years + experience in the environment industry.
• A diverse range of experience in the environment industry.
• Extensive research program experience (i.e. ecological surveys, flora and fauna identification, data collection, managing field teams, etc.).
• Highly developed written and verbal communication skills, with extensive experience in data analysing report writing and preparing management plans.
• Project Management experience
• Advanced botany skills
• Experience running a team of professional staff using a collaborative approach.
• Ability to work independently or as part of a team of professionals.
• Ability to travel and stay away for multiple nights.
• Driver’s licence and Four-Wheel Drive Experience.

Beneficial attributes include:
• Experience with business growth and team building.
• Experience in GIS, field mapping and developing and managing spatial datasets.
• Knowledge of State/Commonwealth regulatory frameworks and policy.
• Knowledge of South Australian ecosystems
• NVC accreditation.
• First Aid and White card accreditation.

Applications:
Applications should be sent to jobs@successionecology.com.au
www.successionecology.com.au
Closing Date: Friday 10th June 2022

title: Business Analyst
description:
Bravura is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join our dynamic Corporate Systems team. This position can be based in Adelaide, Sydney, or Melbourne with the flexibility to attend the office on an ad hoc basis.

The Business Analyst will have responsibility for translating requirements into software specifications and ensuring that the software delivered meets the requirements; management of client raised helpdesk tickets to resolution; the analysis and replication of defects, and testing of software fixes; and actively improving software development and business processes.

You will be responsible for understanding and evaluating internal client requirements and turning these into effective software solutions in Bravura’s ERP Systems, data warehouse and reporting solution. Strong analytical skills and a hunger for knowledge will help the successful candidate deliver quality outcomes for Bravura’s Internal clients.

Key skills

  • Excellent communication and customer service skills.
  • Proven ability of identifying requirements and translating these into effective, quality solutions.
  • Ability to distinguish between software, environmental and user errors.
  • A disciplined approach to planning and managing goals, coupled with the ability to prioritise deliverables.
  • Results oriented, analytical and resourceful in finding solutions.
  • A clear understanding of the Quote to cash lifecycle for professional service organisations, and financial/management reporting.
  • A clear understanding of databases, systems integration, segregation of duties, security and data management.

Qualifications and Experience

  • 3+ years’ experience in a similar business analyst role
  • Proven experience in troubleshooting software defects and the ability to understand and act appropriately when presented with conflicting priorities
  • Familiarity with relational databases, SQL and the software development lifecycle
  • Experience working within helpdesk/service desk environment
  • Tertiary education in Computer Science/Information Technology seen favourably
  • Workday, MS project server, TM1 and SQL experience seen favourably


What we offer you:

We are passionate about what we do, holding ourselves accountable to standards of excellence while celebrating our successes along the way. Our people are at the heart of our business. We work hard to provide a rich employee experience and a robust framework for ongoing career development.

  • A friendly, social and supportive global team that thrives on delivery & embraces diversity
  • We are enthusiastic and adventurous with a large global reach; we have employees, offices, and customers across the world utilising our award-winning solutions
  • Competitive salary and employee benefits scheme
  • Flexible working hours, we value work-life balance
  • Newly renovated offices that inspire Agile and collaborative ways of working


About Bravura Solutions

At Bravura Solutions, collaboration, diversity and excellence matter. We value your ideas, giving you room to be curious and innovate in an exciting, fast-paced, and flexible environment.

As a market leader and ASX 200 company, we are a trusted partner to over 350 leading financial services clients. We invest significantly in our technology hubs and innovation labs, which inspire and drive our creative, future-focused mindset. We take pride in developing cutting-edge technology solutions that support our clients to achieve financial security and prosperity for their customers.

How to apply?

If you are interested in joining an ASX listed fintech powering the world’s leading financial institutions, we would love to hear from you so apply online today.

Please note, as part of the job application process, you will be taken to Bravura Solutions’ careers portal. We don’t always work to fixed closing dates and will consider candidates as and when they apply.

title: Digital Advertising Graduate Positions at RQmedia
description:
New Graduate roles

  • Looking for the best and brightest who want to work in Digital Media
  • This is a challenging role that requires analytical, data, technical and communciation skills

We are not a creative agency.  We are an advertising performance agency. RQmedia creates and manages ads and takes accountability for our customers sales results.

You must have Year 12 result above 90 and a GPA of at least over 5.5 (please specify your results).

You will work in a team that creates and manages ads in  Google, Facebook and Microsoft - as these are all part of our full service, omni channel offering.

Positions available.

This is an outstanding opportunity for law, business, management, science, maths or commerce students.  No one degree provides you with the skills for what we do (we have successfully employed law, commerce, event management and science grads).  We give you the underlying skills required in the growth economy of digital advertising.  You just need to be top of your class, learn fast, results driven and able to take the rapid pace of our industry.


Required as a minimum:

  • Intelligent and inquiry driven
  • Fast learner
  • Ability to deliver KPIs
  • Excellent English writing ability
  • Persistence
  • Proficient with word processing and spreadsheets
  • Excellent communication skills and a team player
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet scheduled due dates
  • Ability to analyse, report and act on data
  • High attention to detail
  • Ability to take on board customer feedback

If this sounds like you, and you would like to secure an internship with an opportunity to start your career in a market-leading digital organisation, send your resume , a short cover letter and a copy of your university transcript via Seek (combine your docs and upload them together).

You must submit a cover letter addressing our criteria and include your TER and GPA (bullet points are fine!).

This job is only open to Australian permanent residents and citizens. No Agencies please.

title: PhD Scholarship: ePortfolios and self-regulated learning in higher education
description:
The University of South Australia (UniSA) is Australia’s University of Enterprise. We are South Australia’s largest university and one of the very best young universities in the world. At UniSA, we are authentic, resilient, and influential - and we deliver results. We pride ourselves on our dynamic and agile culture, which embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Plus, we are committed to the principles of excellence and equity.

Our people are critical to our success. They are creative, enterprising and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm.

We educate global professionals ready to create and inspire change, through more than 200 world-class degrees. We deliver outcomes-focused research that is inspired by global challenges and opportunities, to deliver economic and social prosperity.

Our strategic plan, Enterprise25, focusses on our people, programs and precincts, and sets out our path to ensure that we continue to deliver quality teaching, research and student outcomes.

  • 100% of our assessed research rated at or above world-class - 2018 Excellence in Research for Australia (ERA), 4-digit Fields of Research.
  • No. 1 in Australia for industry research income - 2019 THE World University Rankings.
  • No. 1 in Australia for research impact & engagement - 2018 ARC Engagement and Impact Assessment (EI), Combined Impact – Approach to Impact and Engagement on Assessed Fields.
  • Athena Swan Bronze Award.

About the research degree project

PhD Project: ePortfolios and self-regulated learning in higher education

Positively impact higher education policy and practice on an international scale.

Are you seeking to advance your career in higher education through defining education policy and practice nationally and internationally? The University of South Australia – Australia’s University of Enterprise – is offering a unique opportunity to apply for an innovative, project-based PhD aimed at accomplishing this.

In response to current and future priorities, higher education institutions are increasingly positioning ePortfolios to develop and evidence competencies and skills that are highly correspondent to self-regulated learning (SRL). Research into ePortfolios and their relationships to SRL, however demonstrate limitations in methodology and potential impact. Therefore, there is a timely need to advance research into relationships between ePortfolios and SRL.

In this collaborative research project involving four universities – one American and three Australian – you will  be expected to use qualitative and quantitative approaches to investigate the relationship between ePortfolios and SRL in the higher education context. Our intention is to impact research, policy and practice within both Australia and the United States.

You will join the Centre for Change and Complexity in Learning (C3L), which provides a vibrant research culture and opportunities for skills and knowledge development. In addition to the skills gained through the larger research project, you will also have opportunities to develop an international network with key stakeholders involved in ePortfolios, SRL and, more broadly, learning engagement in higher education.

Completion of this project will provide you with highly desirable skills in a growing area, advancing your employability within and beyond the higher education sector.

What you’ll do

In this project-based research degree, you will undertake activities standard to a large-scale project of this nature. These include reviews of research, development of methodology, data collection, data cleaning and data set development, analysis and write up of results.

There may also be opportunities for travel and placement, such as travel to data collection sites (e.g. other universities) as well as travel to international conferences.

Intended results will include a completed thesis by the successful candidate, publication opportunities, and development of an international collaboration network of both universities and strategic partners.

Where you’ll be based

You will be based at UniSA’s Centre for Change and Complexity in Learning (C3L). The Centre focuses on the complex relationship between human and artificial cognition, how it changes society, knowledge processes, and teaching and learning.

C3L uses complexity science methodologies, promotes the uptake of applied research, and engages with the community, government agencies (healthcare, education, defence, cultural) and industry to research the lifespan of learning and the role of UniSA in serving all stages of knowledge and learning processes.

Situated within UniSA Education Futures, who conducts powerful research in partnership with academia and industry. We contribute to a global knowledge base and find solutions to common challenges faced by rapidly evolving societies worldwide. We embed digital opportunities into the everyday. The Samsung SMARTSchool combines teaching and learning with the latest IT technology, facilitating innovation, problem-solving and team-based learning.

Supervisory Team

  • Associate Professor Chris Deneen - Principal Supervisor
  • Dr Rebecca Marrone - Co Supervisor


Financial Support

This project is funded for reasonable research expenses.  Additionally, a living allowance scholarship of $28,854 per annum is available to eligible applicants. A fee-offset or waiver for the standard term of the program is also included. For full terms and benefits of the scholarship please refer to our scholarship information for domestic students or international students.

Eligibility and Selection

This project is open to application from both domestic and international applicants.

Applicants must meet the eligibility criteria for entrance into a PhD.

All applications that meet the eligibility and selection criteria will be considered for this project. A merit selection process will be used to determine the successful candidate.

The successful applicant is expected to study full-time, and to be based at our City West campus in the heart of Adelaide.

Essential Dates

Applicants are expected to start in a timely f ashion upon receipt of an offer.  Extended deferral periods are not available. Applications close on Friday, 3 June, 2022

title: Technology Manager
description:
• Use your expertise to enable high performance
  • Develop and deliver our technology strategy
  • Permanent role

We’re embarking on an exciting journey at the Club with the development of a new strategic plan, which will include a continued focus on improvement, collaboration and ultimately delivering exceptional services and experiences for our stakeholders and staff.

Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, the Technology Manager is responsible for: the development, support and maintenance of the hardware and software environment, network and server infrastructure strategy and planning, telecommunication systems, capacity planning and monitoring, testing, and evaluating systems and compliance relating to system security.

About you

To be successful in this role, you will have:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science and/or Information Technology
  • Experience in an IT leadership role with full accountability for: systems, applications, data, reporting and infrastructure (3+ years as a guide)
  • Demonstrated experience in negotiating with business leaders to drive effectiveness of the IT department
  • Excellent stakeholder management skills and the ability to liaise with technical and nontechnical individuals
  • Experience driving and embedding change
  • A focus on customer service and continuous improvement

Why Join Us?

When you join the Adelaide Football Club you become part of a team committed to supporting people to fulfil their potential. You will work with passionate and dedicated people who share a common goal to deliver excellence to our members, our community and each other.

To Apply

To be considered, please apply with your CV and a cover letter to AFC Employment employment@afc.com.au

Closing date for applications is Monday 30 May 2022

No Recruitment Agencies Please

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

title: Geotechnical Engineer/Senior Geotechnical Engineer
description:
FMG Engineering is a very well-known and highly regarded multi-disciplinary National Engineering Consultancy providing services and solutions to the development, property and urban infrastructure sectors. With offices in Adelaide, Melbourne and Sydney, we employ over 140 staff, comprising engineers, scientists, technicians and support staff.

Ambitious, positive, passionate and energetic – you will have outstanding interpersonal skills and be motivated by working in a team of high performing professionals. Analytical, technically proficient and flexible – you will relish challenges where your rewards and responsibilities will be based on your positive attitude and ability.

Key responsibilities of this role include:

  • Develop and maintain client relationships
  • Undertake geotechnical investigations, assessments and report writing
  • Provide geotechnical advice to internal and external clients
  • Liaise with clients, with regards to preparation of quotes and tenders
  • Supervising, mentoring and peer reviewing the technical work of other team members
  • Interact with and provide guidance within our NATA accredited materials testing laboratory (AN 544) maybe no need for engineers at the level, we are looking for, rather than some lab technician to apply?

Key selection criteria:

  • A minimum 3 years’ experience or 7 years' experience for the senior role in geotechnical engineering/engineering geology
  • Tertiary qualifications in civil/geotechnical engineering or related discipline
  • Familiar with South Australian soil/rock conditions plus proven track record of soil logging and/or rock coring experiences based on Australian Standard
  • Proven skills in building and maintaining client relationships
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, with strong report writing ability
  • Advanced excel data analysis and interpretive reporting skill is highly regarded for senior role
  • Strong project/site management/supervision skills
  • Flexibility to work either in the office, out on site or interstate
  • Experience with geotechnical/pavement software packages is highly regarded – especially Circly, Plaxis and Slope/W

This role represents an outstanding opportunity for the right person to join the FMG family and continue to develop their professional career.

If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your resume and cover letter (outlining which of the above-mentioned criteria makes you suitable for this role) via SEEK or email to recruitment@fmgengineering.com.au. Applications close 10 June2022.

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Engagement and Delivery Officer – Workforce Australia
company: Department of Education, Skills and Employment
description:
Position Summary

As an Engagement and Delivery Officer in the South Australian State Office, you will work as part of a flexible delivery team involved in monitoring and managing contract performance, implementing labour market strategies, contributing to regional place-based projects, and representing and engaging across the Department, with external stakeholders and contracted providers, to collaboratively advance the Department's business activities. You will also contribute to policy development, local intelligence gathering and program design and be required to undertake work that is complex in nature, and work under limited direction with the opportunity for reasonable autonomy and accountability.

Your achievements will contribute substantially to government policy measures that sustain broader government economic performance, employment, skills, education, and social goals. You will demonstrate a high level of productivity, resourcefulness, initiative, and flexibility to deliver results, as well as collaborate effectively with your colleagues and staff.

Duties and Responsibilities

Reporting to a Team Leader, the responsibilities of the Engagement and Delivery Officer APS Level 6 may include:

  • Support the delivery of employment programs in South Australia by performing a range of program assurance, contract management and stakeholder engagement activities.
  • Research and interpret complex program guidelines and policies to provide advice and guidance to internal and external stakeholders.
  • Undertake data analysis to support a range of contract management duties such as performance assessments and compliance activities.
  • Communicate effectively with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders, including employment services providers, local, state and commonwealth public officers, employers, and other relevant parties.
  • Draft a range of documents tailored to the audience.
  • Work under limited supervision to manage competing priorities.
  • Collaborate in a team environment and contribute to the activities of the South Australian State Office.
  • Demonstrate leadership qualities at level.

Qualifications and Education

  • Relevant tertiary qualifications in Political Science and Policy, Human Society and Welfare, Behavioural Science, Economics, Business and Management, and / or Project Management desirable.

Capabilities

We are seeking enthusiastic, curious, and motivated individuals with the following skills and capabilities:

  • An understanding of contemporary labour market challenges, including those that relate to South Australia, and awareness of education, skills and employment policy and programs and/or experience will be favourably regarded.
  • Leadership abilities, including the ability to coach staff to drive quality outputs, accountability of work areas, and contribute to issues management.
  • Demonstrate analytical skills and the ability to interpret data, program guidelines and contractual frameworks correctly to resolve complex issues.
  • The ability to build positive working relationships with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders and to represent the department professionally at meetings and events, both virtually and in person.
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills and the ability to provide clear and accurate advice to stakeholders including providers, colleagues, and managers.
  • Initiative, flexibility, and the capacity to adapt to change to meet current and future business priorities and an ability to assist other team members to adapt to change.

Additional Information: Some travel, including overnight travel, will be required. Candidate must hold a valid Driver’s licence.

For further information please review the job information pack and position description available here .

Job Reference Number: 22/0524 EXT Engagement and Delivery Officer

title: Solutions architect
description:
We are currently seeking a Technical Sales Consultant to join our Digital team. This role can be based out of Melbourne, Sydney, Adelaide or Brisbane with work from home/flexible working options available.

About us

TRILITY is an established industry leader, solely dedicated to the delivery of water, wastewater and reuse solutions across New Zealand and Australia’s municipal, industrial and resource sectors.

Our software KDX DatalytiX delivers world-leading analytics, applications and expertise to water management authorities. We use advanced, predictive data analytics and our deep industry knowledge to provide consistent, reliable data, improve capability and identify clear insights and understanding.

This ensures that water authorities and operators have the confidence to make smart, efficient decisions that will optimise water operations and ultimately benefit the communities we serve.

The role

As a Technical Sales Specialist you will support sales, business development and marketing through a full understanding of the solutions, value proposition, customer requirements and industry challenges.

This role will act as the trusted technical advisor throughout all stages of customer engagement to demonstrate KDX solution value and capability before supporting the account owner in submitting pricing to the customer.

Key responsibilities

  • Liaise directly with customers to ensure technical requirements are met
  • Develop scripts and demonstrate solution capabilities to partners and customers
  • Explanation of technical concepts and technology to assist customers to understand the value proposition of the platform to their business
  • Plan, execute and provide final documentation for opportunity assessments, proof of concepts, site visits, and interviews of potential users of the solution
  • Assist in the strategic development of product and systems support teams and functions
  • Input to the product roadmap and priorities and feedback market insights and customer comments to developers acting as the voice of the customer
  • Assist in the development of documentation for technical sales strategy, APIs, root cause analysis and reporting
  • Supporting preparation of budgets and business cases


What we are looking for

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in technical sales and requirements/business analysis
  • A deep understanding and knowledge of operations technologies standards, SCADA applications, security requirements and historian applications for industrial utilities and the process engineering sector
  • Ability to coordinate technical teams, deliver presentations, demonstrations, workshops, architecture design sessions, proof of concepts, and pilots
  • Confidence developing demonstration scripts and working with partners to tailor solution demonstrations to local markets and events
  • Strong project experience with database engineering, industrial systems integration, data science or Machine Learning
  • Ability to communicate complex technical items with non-technical audiences clearly
  • Basic understanding ofwater and wastewater technologies and processes
  • Willingness to travel (domestical and potentially for brief periods internationally)

We offer

  • Flexible/remote working
  • A dynamic and positive work culture, where hard work is recognised
  • Autonomy and ownership in your role
  • An attractive remuneration package + incentive scheme
  • Career development opportunities within a growing company
  • Wellbeing program including a free membership to Headspace

To apply

If you are looking for a fast-paced, diverse role, then please submit your application, including a cover letter and resume, via the Seek apply button.

For further information on TRILITY, please view our website at www.TRILITY.com.au

TRILITY is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer who seeks to increase the diversity of its workforce. We encourage people from any background/culture, age, gender, sexual orientation, or people with an impairment to apply for this role.

The successful applicant will be required to comply with the current business requirements of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and providing TRILITY with evidence of their vaccination status.

title: EL1 Assistant Director – Policy – Environmental markets development
company: Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment
description:
Provide specialist policy and program advice and contribute to the delivery of innovative initiatives which increase Australia’s resilience to climate change.

Opportunities and Challenges

Join one of our high-performing and dedicated teams navigating uncharted territories in policy and program design.

Our ultimate goal is to increase the resilience of Australia’s natural environment and the agricultural sector to climate change.

The Climate Adaption & Resilience Division has multiple opportunities for experienced policy professionals in a range of impactful areas including:

  • Agricultural Stewardship - leading the development of the Australian Government’s Agriculture Biodiversity Stewardship package, developing credible market approaches for farmers to gain private investment in farm biodiversity services.
  • Financing Solutions for Nature team - developing frontier policy initiatives to increase private investment in Australia’s natural capital by helping the finance sector to recognise, value and invest in natural capital.
  • Environmental Markets - facilitating a private market through which farmers can sell the benefits of biodiversity projects to corporations and private investors who wish to support environmental outcomes


The Role

As a key advisor and leader in the Climate Adaption and Resilience Division, you will provide specialist policy and program advice to help establish these innovative initiatives and drive policy development.

Responsibilities include:

  • Leading a team to deliver high quality, accurate and consistent analysis and policy advice including to the minister and senior executives
  • Leading aspects of policy and program development, planning and project management
  • Contributing to the strategic direction of the work area through planning and identifying and managing risks

To learn more about the opportunity, please review the position description.

Erecruit job reference: 2022/2365

Your Background & Experience


We welcome individuals with a diverse range of skills, knowledge and experiences – both from in and outside government.

You will need to demonstrate:

  • Experience in policy development, and/or program development and delivery
  • Well-developed interpersonal skills and the ability to develop productive working relationships
  • Familiarity with any of the following will be well regarded: environmental markets, sustainable finance, legislative development and/or data analysis and integration/ management

The following areas of formal study will be highly regarded:

  • Public policy
  • Economics/ banking/ finance
  • Law
  • Natural resource management/ economics
  • Data analytics/ integration
  • Science

Work With Us

The work we do today, matters for tomorrow. Join the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment (DAWE) and enjoy:

  • Access to training and development
  • Health and wellbeing focused culture
  • Permanent full-time or part-time hours
  • Salary: $112,294 - $120,780 + Super

We are Canberra based however we are open to discussing flexible working arrangements, including working remotely from other locations in Australia. For further information please speak with the contact officer prior to submitting your application.

To be eligible for employment with the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment you must be an Australian citizen.

How to apply

For more details on how to apply, please click the appropriate link below.

Alternatively for a discussion regarding this role please contact:

Name:  Jeremy Thomas

Phone number: 02 5156 5721

Email address: Jeremy.thomas@agriculture.gov.au

Flexible employment arrangements are available with the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment

  • Contributing to the strategic direction of the work area through planning and identifying and managing risks

To learn more about the opportunity, please review the position description.

Erecruit job reference: 2022/2365

Your Background & Experience


We welcome individuals with a diverse range of skills, knowledge and experiences – both from in and outside government.

You will need to demonstrate:

  • Experience in policy development, and/or program development and delivery
  • Well-developed interpersonal skills and the ability to develop productive working relationships
  • Familiarity with any of the following will be well regarded: environmental markets, sustainable finance, legislative development and/or data analysis and integration/ management

The following areas of formal study will be highly regarded:

  • Public policy
  • Economics/ banking/ finance
  • Law
  • Natural resource management/ economics
  • Data analytics/ integration
  • Science

Work With Us

The work we do today, matters for tomorrow. Join the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment (DAWE) and enjoy:

  • Access to training and development
  • Health and wellbeing focused culture
  • Permanent full-time or part-time hours
  • Salary: $112,294 - $120,780 + Super

We are Canberra based however we are open to discussing flexible working arrangements, including working remotely from other locations in Australia. For further information please speak with the contact officer prior to submitting your application.

To be eligible for employment with the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment you must be an Australian citizen.

How to apply

title: Quality Control Analytical Specialist
description:
Quality Control Analytical Specialist

Are you experienced in Quality Control, analytics and thrive in achieving excellence in a dynamic environment? Do you deliver standout results first time, every time?

If so, you’ll fit right in at Mayne Pharma.

Our team is rapidly growing, and we’re searching for professionals looking to make their mark.

What’s in it for you? You’ll help us achieve our mission of delivering better, safer and more accessible pharmaceutical products.

At Mayne Pharma, the results speak for themselves

Mayne Pharma has a 40-year track record and has set about delivering the highest quality products and strictest quality control protocols for the pharmaceuticals industry. This extends to a robust portfolio of branded and generic drugs spanning dermatology, women’s health, urology and more.

We’re always searching for ways to improve.

That’s why we develop new technologies, delivery systems and products to better serve our customers. To make this possible, Mayne Pharma employs over 900 staff globally – including more than 200 scientists.

Culture comes first

We put people first at Mayne Pharma.

And the reason is simple: we know that cultivating a strong culture means we can deliver on our promise ­– to offer better, safer and more accessible medicines.

To make hard work rewarding, you will enjoy a competitive salary, development opportunities and a plethora of health, wealth and lifestyle benefits – including:

  • Salary packaging
  • Financial bonuses
  • Travel discounts
  • Pandemic leave
  • EAP and wellness programs
  • Discounted gym memberships

Did we mention our values?

Accountability, agility, creativity, empowerment, integrity and passion. That’s what we stand for. So if these resonate with you, you’ve found the perfect match.

Here’s where you come in

As an experienced Quality Control Analytical Specialist, you’ll join a fast-paced environment that pushes you to achieve your best as you partner the business to deliver its products and improve its processes.

But you won’t do it alone. You’ll be supported – every step of the way as part of a high achieving Quality Control Team.

Your responsibilities, at a glance:

  • Directly support the QC Co-ordinator for authorising QC laboratory data as it relates to raw materials and liquids and creams products.
  • Manage changes (for example through change control) to QC specifications in approved documentation management processes and laboratory data management systems.
  • Provide in depth technical knowledge and specialist skills with respect to use, maintenance, troubleshooting and revision of cGMP analytical laboratory methods and equipment (i.e. HPLC, GC, UV spectroscopy etc).
  • Lead and administer the compendial review program for the QC department, inclusive of driving compendial method verifications as required.
  • Support continuous improvement in the QC laboratory through aligning raw material test requirements (Assay/Related compounds for example) with finish product testing.

Support the QC laboratory by ensuring responsibility for the provision of Specialist analytical knowledge, analytical method, validation verification, GMP compliance and training.

You need to tick these boxes.

We pick applicants based on capability and aptitude. But we also emphasise cultural fit.

Therefore, you’ll need to have a positive mindset and be prepared to take ownership of your performance.

You’ll also need to hold a Degree in Science (Chemistry or related field)

Experience in Pharmaceutical (GMP) or related industry (preferably a QC environment)

Extensive experience with analytical equipment and techniques (HPLC and GC)

Ability to clearly and logically present complex technical information in written and oral formats

Formal Supervisory or management training and/ or experience (desirable)

Ready to become part of the Mayne Pharma story?

Join the Mayne Pharma team today and help us deliver better, safer and more accessible pharmaceutical products.

To apply, please forward your application, including a cover letter and resume.

APPLY NOW

*We are offering a permanent position.

From 1st December 2021, all new employees at Mayne Pharma must be fully vaccinated with a TGA-recognised COVID-19 vaccine and provide evidence of vaccine status

At Mayne Pharma we value work-life balance and support our people in maintaining a strong sense of personal wellbeing and purpose. That’s why we are committed to providing opportunities for our people to grow and develop both personally and professionally and have a strong culture of promoting and developing talent from within.

title: Assistant Director - Sustainable Finance
company: Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment
description:
Apply your finance and banking expertise to increase the resilience of Australia’s natural environment and the agricultural sector to climate change

Opportunities and Challenges

The Financing Solutions for Nature team has an exciting opportunity for a finance professional with experience in the commercial finance and banking sectors to combine a passion for positively impacting climate change challenges with a federal government role.

The team is developing frontier policy initiatives to increase private investment in Australia’s natural capital by helping the finance sector to recognise, value and invest in natural capital.

You will be joining a high-performing and dedicated team that aims to progress the recognition of natural capital as a financial asset class and demonstrate that improvements to natural capital will provide productivity, profitability and resilience benefits.

This exciting work also involves engaging with a range of industry, government, finance and scientific stakeholders.

The Role

As a key advisor and leader in the Financing Solutions for Nature team, you will draw on your understanding of the finance and banking sectors, and your ability to identify opportunities to catalyse increased private sector investment in Australia’s natural capital. Your specialist policy advice will help establish innovative initiatives and drive policy development.

Responsibilities include:

  • Leading a team to deliver high quality analysis and policy advice with a particular focus on advising on how natural capital considerations can be integrated into financial sector decision making, including to the minister and senior executives
  • Developing and managing effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders, to achieve area and agency goals
  • Managing the day to day operations of a small team, including coaching and monitoring staff workload and performance, and quality assuring team outputs

To learn more about the opportunity, please review the position description.

Erecruit job reference:  2022/2498

Your Background & Experience


We welcome individuals with a diverse range of skills, knowledge and experiences – both from in and outside government.

You will need to demonstrate:

  • Familiarity with the banking and finance sectors OR sustainable finance, ESG reporting and disclosure
  • A strong track record of exercising sound judgement; drawing on strategic thinking and problem-solving skills to deliver results
  • The ability to provide advice on complex areas of policy to a minister and/or senior executive
  • Experience informing the development of data driven decision-making support tools for the finance sector

The following areas of formal study will be highly regarded:

  • Economics/ banking/ finance
  • Law
  • Natural resource management/ economics
  • Data analytics/ integration

Work With Us

The work we do today, matters for tomorrow. Join the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment (DAWE) and enjoy:

  • Access to training and development
  • Health and wellbeing focused culture
  • Permanent full-time or part-time hours
  • Salary: $112,294 - $120,780 + Super

We are Canberra based however we are open to discussing flexible working arrangements, including working remotely from other locations in Australia.

To be eligible for employment with the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment you must be an Australian citizen.

How to apply

For more details on how to apply, please click the appropriate link below.

Alternatively for a discussion regarding this role please contact:

Name: Nicole Yazbek-Martin

Phone number: 02 5156 5721

Email address: nicole-yazbek-martin1@environment.gov.au

Flexible employment arrangements are available with the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment
