title: Product and Customer Success Coordinator
description:
• Join an innovative, flexible & family-friendly team in this permanent full-time role
  • Generous salary + incentives with excellent benefits
  • Ongoing professional development & training opportunities

An exciting opportunity to join a hi-tech, fast-growing agritech company and enjoy a regional lifestyle in the beautiful Barossa Valley!

About the Opportunity

For this rare industry opportunity, using industry data & customer-specific insights, you will oversee the development of unique, world-leading precision viticulture tools on the online platform that utilises the latest developments in machine learning and satellite technology. Building on your industry experience, you will perform market research, analyse market data, and identify consumer behaviour and trends to inform long-term product strategy.

As Deep Planet’s Product & Customer Success Coordinator you will monitor product performance and create policies and procedures that optimize the customer experience, ultimately building customer relationships that promote retention and loyalty. As a pivotal part of the team, you will provide product demonstrations and deep technical support, enabling customers to optimise their vineyard management process through effective utilisation of Deep Planet’s precision viticulture tools, generating increased profits for the Australian wine industry and reducing its environmental footprint.

Using your strong relationship building skills, you will gather feedback and insights that inform Deep Planet’s product roadmap, helping to build a world-leading precision viticulture platform!

In addition to the above, as the Product and Customer Success Coordinator, your responsibilities include:

  • Writing user stories and other feature descriptions for the engineering team and maintaining a prioritised product backlog based on business and customer impact
  • Documenting value proposition information and supporting marketing and sales efforts with written content
  • Taking on a pro-active role in potential client evaluation based on their needs and Deep Planet’s unique tech capabilities
  • Working directly with the client and their technical team to determine objectives, milestones, and deliverables with regards to initial integration and rollout plans
  • Delivering client insights and drawing on internal resources to deliver best possible results to clients (sales, marketing, product, engineering and research)
  • Deep-dive technical assistance for customers; including conducting screen share sessions with customers to guide them through installations, tech evaluations as well as resolving technical issues with high customer satisfaction
  • Analysing quantitative information from products to gather information on product usage

The full Job Description has been made available for you to view/download once you select 'Apply Now'.

About You

With environmental benefit front of mind, you have a desire to make a positive impact on the industry and the planet. You could be a recent viticulture or plant science graduate, someone with a strong agricultural background, a data or business analyst, or someone who is eager to be a part of the agtech community and help contribute to the building of the agriculture technology of tomorrow!

We are looking for passionate candidates that may bring:

  • Organized, personable, and tech-savvy with background knowledge of the agritech industry, satellite technology and artificial intelligence
  • Data-centric mindset and strong analytical skills
  • Creative thinker with the ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills to convey highly technical concepts to a variety of audiences

About Our Client

Deep Planet is a global Agri Tech startup that was born out of the vision of world-class scientists and engineers from Oxford University.

Deep Planet are focused and creative thinkers with a goal to use Machine Learning for the benefit of the Planet. In 2018, Deep Planet was founded from an idea to address environmental risk. The founding team has more than 15 years of experience starting and scaling deep technology companies worldwide.

Their product, VineSignal, assists winemakers and growers to manage and predict vine health, yield, maturity and irrigation. It allows for improved management practices in the vineyard that reduce cost of production, improve quality and enhances efficiency to maximise commercial returns.

We've shared the client's name to help you assess your suitability for the role.  Please DO NOT contact them directly.

Apply Now!

If you have any queries please email humans(at)humanologyrecruit.com.au in the first instance, or call 1300 2 HUMAN.

To apply, please ensure you click the Apply button , upload a CV and cover letter contained in one document.  Please do not email your CV .  All applications MUST be made online. The position description is also available to download when you click 'apply'.

Please Note:  Our recruitment process will keep you regularly informed of the progress of your application.  Please ensure that you check your email for updates (including your junk mail folder).  Applications will remain open until a suitable candidate is appointed.

title: Senior QA/Test Analyst
description:
Ceridian is a global leader in Human Capital Management technology. Simply put, we allow our customers to do the most complex things well (HR, Payroll, Benefits Administration, Workforce Management and Talent Management) and do them to scale.

Makes Work Life Better™ is our brand promise, not only to our customers, but to our employees as well. Our flagship platform, Dayforce, helps leaders make smart decisions based on data, strategy and intelligence that create value and maximize productivity.

How do we make work life better?

  • By delivering an award-winning product, conceptualized and developed by award-winning leaders, that result in award-winning customer employee experiences
  • By hiring highly innovative, diverse talent that fully embraces and embodies our core values in everything they do: Customer Focus, Equity, Shared Ambition, Agility, Transparency, Optimism
  • By using modern technology, such as voice-activation with Dayforce Assistant and access to your money as soon as you earn it with Dayforce Wallet to stay in rhythm with the evolving demands of our 4 million global users

We understand that no matter where you are, choosing a new employer is always one of life’s most stressful events. We encourage you to check us out at Ceridian.com to learn more about how we are impacting the world of work for our customers, employees and you!

Location: For this role, we are open to remote work and can hire anywhere in the Australia.

About the opportunity

The Senior QA/Test Analyst contributes to the review and verification and validation of business and software needs with appropriate Test Strategy. They plan and execute software testing to ensure that it is in line with design document provided as well as ensure that it fulfils the end user’s needs. They ensure that all testing is according to process, ensuring test steps and evidence are stored, and clear communication to all internal stakeholders to ensure that an optimal system is develop for our clients. They own the plan, design and review of Test Strategy, test plan and test cases. And where applicable ensure the end-to-end execution of the test planned. They develop test plans and implements testing to ascertain the functionality of software/applications. They prepare technical documentation and reports on software/applications testing. They also work with Application Development in investigating and resolving software/applications issues.

What you’ll get to do

  • Guide team in terms of test execution and review/audit the work done to ensure completeness.
  • Monitor development/test processes and improve where applicable.
  • Escalate issues and lead discussions to ensure that product risks are controlled.
  • Analyze design documents to understand the enhancement or fixes required
  • Design test scenario to test the required outcome of the design and ensuring the system remains fully functional
  • Create test data files to test program logic and verify system flow
  • Execute the test cases and noting any deviation from the actual design
  • Ensure all deviation from actual design are recorded in the tracking tool and are followed up
  • Understand and negotiate with relevant stakeholders on identifying the severity and follow up until issues found are closed
  • Identify potential problems that end user might encounter and make suggestion on improvements required
  • Be an advocate for our end user needs
  • Ensure that internal development processes are adhered to on a timely manner
  • Provide support for other business areas regarding system functionality
  • Provide input / contribute to development / maintenance of automated test scripts
  • Prepare and maintain all QA documentation such as Test Plan, Test Cases, Test Metrics, Issues List and relevant records.
  • Adding automation scripts to the existing Automation Suite (Playwright with Java Scripting)
  • Payroll domain knowledge is desirable but not mandatory

What’s in it for you

  • Encouragement to be the best version of yourself at and away from work:
    • YOUnity diversity and inclusion programs
    • Amazing time away from work programs
  • Support for your total well-being through our Live Well, Work Well programs targeting all aspects of your life
  • Recognition for your contributions through excellent pay, perks, and rewards
  • Giving where you’re living: volunteer days, Ceridian sponsored events, and our very own charity, Ceridian Cares
  • Opportunities to fuel your career growth through numerous internal and external programs and events

Skills and experience we value

  • A bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field
  • Preferably with at least 7 years of software testing experience
  • Knowledge of software test design and testing methodologies
  • Working knowledge of test techniques and compatibility with various software programs
  • Working knowledge of test automation, for e.g., PlayWright or Selenium
  • Working experience on testing payroll system (preferable)
  • Excellent communication and critical thinking skills
  • Good organizational skills
  • Detail-oriented mindset
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Display ability to handle discussion with various stakeholders
  • Working experience in various SDLC
  • Able to work independently

Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider and embrace ALL individuals and what makes them unique. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success.  We encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you are selected for an interview, you will be contacted by a Ceridian Recruiter with a @ceridian.com email directly from our organization.

title: Product Manager
description:
Minimum NV1 Defence clearance or eligibility to acquire one is mandatory (requires Australian Citizenship).

About Fivecast

Fivecast is a world-leading provider of digital intelligence solutions. We enable the world’s most important public and private organizations to explore masses of data and uncover actionable insights, critical to protecting global communities.

Fivecast is an inclusive employer, we value diversity of thought and experience, and we believe our inclusive culture contributes to our success. We are committed to building a workforce that is representative of the communities in which we live and work.

As a growing start-up, all team members are provided with the opportunity to directly contribute to our success, participate in the development of new and emerging technologies and grow their career in a challenging and dynamic high-tech environment.

About the Role

The Product Manager is responsible for identifying, defining and driving Fivecast products and features through a complete lifecycle from inception to support. The Product Manager works with all areas of the Fivecast business, including Product Development, Operations, Tradecraft, Marketing and Sales to help execute the Product Roadmap.

The Product Manager will have a deep understanding of the competitive landscape and understanding of the customer’s problems and will work to define solutions to address them. They will also assist the VP Product Development with shaping the Product Roadmap and work on defining a go to market strategy for identified products and features.

Requirements
  • Bachelor Degree level qualifications e.g. Computer Science, Software Engineering;
  • Minimum 5 years experience in product Management / business analysis / systems engineering;
  • Experience in technology sector working with defence and government clients;
  • Ability to work with stakeholders to elicit requirements, including clients and other engineering staff;
  • Ability to develop product specifications;
  • Strong organisation skills, is detail oriended and pro-active team player;
  • Strong communication skills;
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines; and
  • Understanding of analytic challenges in Defence and national security.
Our Work Environment and Culture

Only a few minutes from the city, Fivecast is located at Base 64 on North Terrace, home to other innovative and interesting Australian technology start-ups. Enjoy a casual, relaxed atmosphere that encourages collaboration and includes a fully equipped kitchen, barista quality coffee machine, end of trip facilities, comfortable indoor and outdoor spaces for meetings and eating. Base 64 also provides onsite parking or unmetered street parking is available nearby.

Fivecast has a connected work culture with team members often taking advantage of the in-house Foosball table, local cafes, bars, pubs and sporting facilities for Friday lunches, after work drinks and group activities. At Fivecast we understand the importance of a good work-life balance and support flexible work arrangements.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Do you love a good lamb roast? We’re developing the world’s best technology to measure meat quality. We need a Senior Software Engineer to help us bring it to market.

Miniprobes is a high-tech spin-out from the University of Adelaide. We use precision fibre-optics and near-infrared lasers to build imaging devices less than a millimetre in diameter. Based on 10 years of R&D, our team has developed a new type of imaging technology which we are using to measure meat quality for the livestock industry.

It’s an exciting time to join Miniprobes . We are developing our first product for commercial release. You can be pivotal in creating this new product. We have the expertise, funding and industry partnerships to deliver it to the livestock industry within the next 2 years. You will be part of the team that develops this product. You will also be a foundational employee in this young company as we start on a trajectory of rapid growth.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will help us to develop the software that is at the heart of this system. This includes acquisition, processing and analysis of data from our imaging hardware as well as creating tools to remotely manage installed systems. You will be involved in a range of areas including real-time systems, image processing and machine learning, targeted at a Windows platform.

To be considered for this role you will need:

  • Bachelor of Engineering, Computer Science or related area;
  • At least 5 years software development experience;
  • Experience with C++ and OO concepts.

To apply, submit your resume/CV and a cover letter highlighting any skills and experiences that would make you a vital part of our team.

For further information regarding this position, please contact the Director (Software) at rodney.kirk@miniprobes.com .

title: Middle School Teacher - Full time Position
description:
Position Details

We are seeking a dynamic Middle School Teacher to join our innovative and collaborative middle school teaching team. The teaching load will include Science, Technologies or English , or a combination of these. At Portside Christian College we believe that every child is worthy of our best every day. Our middle years program encourages students to develop their unique skills, talents and abilities through relevant and engaging curriculum.

This is a full-time contract position, with the option of immediate commencement, or alternatively the start of Semester 2, with the possibility of permanency in 2023. The successful applicant will have demonstrated experience in teaching students at Years 7-9.  This position will be directly responsible to the College Principal through the Deputy Principal of Secondary and the Director of Teacher and Learning.

At Portside Christian College, we deliver:

  • Teaching and Learning programs developed using the Understanding by Design curriculum framework from a Biblical perspective
  • A professional, rewarding and supportive environment
  • Outstanding opportunities for professional development and career progression

If you are committed to high quality teaching and learning, enjoy a challenge, and want to work alongside other professionals dedicated to quality outcomes for learners, then please apply.

Required skills and attributes of the successful candidate include:

  • South Australian Teacher Registration, or be eligible to obtain registration
  • Demonstrated ability to teach Science and/or Technologies and/or English in the Middle School
  • Demonstrated effective pedagogical practice in the key learning areas
  • Ability to work effectively as part of a Teaching and Learning Team
  • Development of collaborative relationships with students, staff and parents
  • Ability to create an engaged, respectful and collaborative classroom culture
  • Ability to actively contribute to the Christian life of the College community
  • Ability to manage the demands of the position including administration and professional responsibilities
  • Proficiency in Digital Technologies

Selection Criteria

  1. A proven understanding of Australian curriculum including differentiated approaches to learning in the middle years
  2. Demonstrated pedagogical approaches to engage learners in Science, Technologies and/or English
  3. Ability to use data to inform teaching for improved student learning
  4. Well-developed classroom management and communication skills that foster restorative approaches
  5. Understanding and ability to teach from a Christian worldview

Applications are to include the following:

  • Cover letter, maximum 1 page.
  • Curriculum Vitae outlining details of qualifications and areas of study, educational history, previous employment and relevant personal information.
  • Completion of the Portside Christian College Application for Employment – Teacher available on our website.
  • Written response to the above selection criteria, maximum 1500 words.
  • Proof of COVID vaccination will be required at interview stage.

Applications are to be received by Friday 27 May 2022 at 9am.

Applications should be addressed to:

Mrs Belinda Elsegood, Human Resources, Portside Christian College

Email: application@portside.sa.edu.au

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
description:
We are a stealth early stage software company whose mission is to build the world's fastest accelerated learning and increased retention experience.

Our products use a neuroscience research-backed approach to create an immersive learning experience that users love to use. We have recently raised significant seven-figure pre-seed funding from a strategic investor.

We are developing several patentable products in the accelerated learning space for Web, Mobile and VR. We are now looking for an experienced full-stack software engineer to join our agile and growing team.

The ideal candidate is a self-motivated, multi-tasker, and demonstrated team-player. You will be a lead developer responsible for the development of new software products and enhancements to existing products. You should excel in working with large-scale applications and frameworks and have outstanding communication and leadership skills.

Objectives of this Role

  • Work across the full stack, building highly scalable distributed solutions that enable beautiful user experiences and measurable business growth
  • Develop new features and infrastructure in support of rapidly emerging business and project requirements
  • Ensure application performance, uptime, and scale, maintaining high standards of code quality and thoughtful application design
  • Work with agile development methodologies, adhering to best practices and pursuing continued learning opportunities

Responsibilities

  • Writing clean, high-quality, high-performance, maintainable code
  • Develop and support software including applications, database integration, interfaces, and new functionality enhancements
  • Coordinate cross-functionally to insure project meets business objectives
  • Support test and deployment of new products and features
  • Participate in all aspects of agile software development including design, implementation, and deployment
  • Collaborate via Slack, GitHub commits, documents, and Google meet

Required Skills and Qualifications

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science (or related field)
  • 5+ years of relevant work experience building large-scale software applications
  • Expertise in Object Oriented Design, Architecture and Database
  • Experience building web applications
  • Experience designing and integrating RESTful APIs
  • Knowledge of Ruby, React, and Javascript
  • Expertise in one of the following programming languages - Go, C++, C#
  • Knowledge of - JavaScript, React, and Angular
  • Ability to learn quickly, organise, and prioritise work

Preferred Skills

  • Experience in VR, Unity, UE5, and Game development
  • Android and/or iOS app development experience
  • Professional certifications in the field of AI/ML/Data analytics
  • Product design and product management

What we offer

  • Salary + equity based on experience
  • Environment to lead new projects from conceptualisation to deployment
  • A collaborative, inclusive, and transparent work culture
  • Engineering best practices
  • Opportunity to work closely with the Founder, CTO, and early-stage engineers
  • Flexible working environment, work from home option.
  • Free access to an onsite gym, pool
  • Team events and BBQ

title: Services Coordinator (NDIS)
description:
About us

Our mission is to help heal the sick with a smile every day through provision of community nursing, disability support and home care services. Our vision is To be the no # 1 Go-To-Community Nurses and Support Workers that make clients feel better and live better in their homes. If our vision inspires you as well, hit apply. You might be on our team sooner than you can imagine. We love staff who do their best and help shape and define why we are both working for Gaval Community Services.

Position Purpose

To be responsible for maintaining a team environment that supports positive relationships with clients and stakeholders and achieves client’s goals and ambitions. To supervise and manage a localised team of highly engaged staff. To directly manage, plan, monitor and report on service delivery to clients and maintain purposeful networks in the local area that provide the framework to support clients to live meaningful and fulfilling lives of their choice.

Responsibilities and duties

  • Engage with their portfolio of clients to ensure their satisfaction with supports and identify any improvement opportunities
  • Maintain a culture of continuous improvement
  • Respond to feedback/complaints from clients, their family or friends, direct reports or any other person as directed
  • Participate in the recruitment and on boarding of new support staff
  • Strive for solutions that proactively manage the balance between client / service provider risks and maximising client outcomes
  • Ability to participate in a rotating on-call roster
  • To ensure appropriate matching of staff to participants, and ensure staff selection incorporates participant choice
  • Collaborating with participants, therapy teams and funding bodies to achieve set outcomes
  • Monitoring service provisions in line with funding budgets
  • Maintaining participant activity records, accurate roster system data and participant specific documentation
  • Build strong collaborative relationships with Community Support Workers and Participants to deliver quality services, ensuring individualised plans are developed and acted upon
  • Compliance with all aspects of NDIS legislation, policies and procedures and the NDIS Quality & Safeguarding Framework

Qualifications and Experience:

  • First Aid Certificate (HLTAID003 & HTLAID001) (Essential)
  • Current NDIS Worker Screening Check or DHS Clearance (Essential)
  • Current Driver's Licence (Essential)
  • Tertiary Qualification in Disability, Social Work, Behavioural Science or similar/equivalent (Bachelor's Degree or higher) (Essential)
  • A preferred minimum of 3 years’ experience as a coordinator of individualised disability services, staff recruitment and staff supervision in a similar working environment.
  • Significant experience in NDIS Plan interpretation and implementation.
  • Commitment to the personal growth and well-being of the people that we support.
  • Excellent written and verbal interpersonal skills.
  • Demonstrable initiative in their work approach.
  • Highly developed organisation, problem solving and time management skills.
  • Sound computer and IT skills.
  • Demonstrated leadership skills.

Benefit

  • Company car
  • Professional development assistance
  • Travel reimbursement

Diversity and Inclusion

Gaval Community Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We embrace diversity and social inclusion and encourage people from a diverse cultural background, people with disabilities and or Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander people to apply.

If you are seeking a positive work environment that offers ongoing training and development please APPLY NOW

title: Teleport Shift Engineer - Level 1
description:
Overview of Position
Speedcast is a global satellite and managed service provider giving satellite reach to oil and gas, energy, government, defence, ISP, and other industries. We are looking for a 24x7 Shift Service Desk and Satellite Teleport Operations Engineer for an immediate start to maintain our satellite earth station facility located in the heart of Technology Park, Mawson Lakes.

What you will do:

  • Maintain the technical RF teleport earth station infrastructure for both the onsite colocation datacentre and antenna earth stations, including antennas and subsystems, frequency converters, amplifiers, baseband equipment, UPS, plant, and generating sets.
  • Assist in the routine maintenance program across the facility across essential services, HVAC, plant, power, and switching systems.
  • Assist with teleport and network upgrades and ongoing projects.
  • Analyze and interpret monitoring and performance data and investigation of trends.
  • Respond to network and teleport events and alarms and work through escalation procedures to ensure timely restoration.
  • Troubleshoot our managed client networks and perform technical analysis and fault restoration across IP networks and satellite infrastructure.
  • Work with the global operations business departments to escalate to other functional groups across Network and Field Engineering.
  • Ensure timely follow-up and resolution of customer requests following established severity level guidelines.
  • 24x7x365 Shift Rostered Position – 12 Hour Shifts

What we need from you:

  • Fluent communication in English
  • It is expected candidates applying for this position are either possess a current CCNA or willing to train and obtain CCNA certification.
  • Minimum of 2 years post qualification experience working within TCP/IP networks.
  • Multi-skilled across both IP Networks and communication systems.
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills in English.
  • A strong technical focus with an ability to read and understand technical documentation and a willingness to understand new concepts.
  • An ability to take leadership and ownership during fault situations to ensure the priority restoration of services.
  • Excellent knowledge of cabling and data communications.
  • Knowledge and experience in industry-standard network monitoring and management tools, e.g. Solarwinds

Desirable Skills/Qualification:

  • A tertiary qualification is a (STEM) Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics field applicable to Telecommunications or Computer Science.
  • Experience in a Service Desk environment and managing of incident tickets.
  • 24x7 Shift experience.
  • Previous experience working with RF communications and within a teleport operation facility.
  • Experience in Satellite technology i.e. GVF qualification, RF Experience, iDirect, Newtec, Gilat, Antenna Installations, Mobile Satellite Services, etc.
  • ITIL Foundation Certificate
  • Australian Citizens will be preferred to meet defence security requirements.

title: advanced munitions Materials Chemist / Chemical Engineer
description:
• $ Based on Experience
  • Australian Citizenship essential

Your Next Employer...

You'll be working with the R&D department for the Department of Defence (Defence Science Technology Group, DTSG) in Edinburgh.

The Role...

This role will be focused on providing technical support in the development of advanced munitions with Defence. The role is a 24 month full time contract and will give you the opportunity to work in a state of the art environment and gain excellent exposure for your career.

The Major Responsibilities of your role will include:

  • Set-up test equipment for laboratory activities;
  • General upkeep of test and laboratory facilities;
  • Prepare risk assessments and standard operating procedures for facilities and processes;
  • Liaise with workshop staff as required to prepare hardware and materials for testing;
  • Characterise explosive formulations for their chemical, sensitiveness and mechanical properties;
  • Obtain quotes for laboratory supplies or other consumables
  • Data analysis

You Will Need...

  • Tertiary Level Qualifications in Chemistry, Materials Science or Chemical Engineering or related field
  • Experience in the safe handling of hazardous chemicals
  • Experience with explosive technologies, safe energetic materials handling, test and evaluation
  • Competent in Microsoft desktop applications and ChemAlert Software
  • Must be an Australian Citizen and Willing to obtain a Defence security clearance

title: Lab / Manufacturing Assistant (Logistics Technician)
description:
Company Description

From global research discoveries to clinical breakthroughs – our vision is to become the most influential life sciences company for researchers. If you are motivated by making a real impact to people’s life and have a desire to work in a passionate and diverse community, Abcam is the place for you.

Our culture is driven by our dedicated, agile and audacious community of professionals who are driven by a combined purpose and sense of belonging. We’re incredibly proud to be recognised as one of the top 5 best places to work in the UK for two years running, as per Glassdoor’s Employees’ Choice Award.

Job Description

Role & Responsibility

  • Assisting in the manufacture, assembly and shipment of kit components required to fill orders of TGR products and for general manufacturing laboratory maintenance.
  • Reporting and Liaison:
    • This position reports to Manufacturing and Logistics Manager.
    • In addition, the position may require liaison with production/Quality Control Staff and other TGR Senior Managers.
  • Assay Kit pre-assembly processes and WIP assembly
    • Assisting with the manufacture and assembly of assay kit components required for the production of pre-assembled Kits (WIPs).  Specific tasks include the following:
      • Processing of WIP work orders. This process requires use of Excel to create individual alliquoting worksheets for components.
      • Preparation and printing of labels.
      • Labelling of bottles and tubes.
      • Buffer alliquoting and torque wrenching of bottles.
      • Individual WIP assembly.
    • Restocking of boxes for key WIPs.
  • Processing Kit Work Orders
    • Processing of assay target work orders to ensure kit components are prepared ready for shipping on designated shipping days. Specific tasks include:
      • Completion of relevant work orders.
      • Completion and printing relevant assay target checklists.
      • Creation of Certificates of Analysis.
      • Printing and folding of manuals.
      • Reagent Buffer alliquoting.
      • Individual Kit assembly.
      • Shrink wrapping.
      • Assist in packaging and shipping.
      • Data entry into relevant databases.
  • General laboratory duties
    • General washing up of laboratory ware and dispensers.
    • Assist with routine stocking of laboratory consumables, ie; Packing pipette tips, etc.
    • Testing and calibration of laboratory pipettes.
    • Assist with receiving goods and batch numbering of incoming goods.
    • General laboratory maintenance.
    • Restocking of key manufacturing supplies ie; shipping boxes, ice packs, packing material.
  • Other duties as required
    • Reagent Buffer maintenance/disposal as specified by production and QC staff.
    • Assist in process change process as required, which may involve changing and or checking documents that have been modified.
    • Carry out other tasks as requested by other managers.

Qualifications

About you

  • Post-secondary qualifications in a relevant field of Science or Laboratory Techniques.
  • Sound written and oral communication skills.
  • High level of attention to detail.
  • Demonstrated ability to follow procedures to ensure components and products are assembled in accordance with quality processes.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Self-motivated and reliable.
  • Demonstrated ability to work well under pressure.
  • Sound organisational and time management skills.
  • Sound understanding of Microsoft Excel.
  • Sound understanding of immunoassay techniques and use of laboratory pipettes.
  • Sound understanding of GLP principles.

Additional information

We know that when it comes to benefits, no one size fits all. Flexibility and choice matter which is why we offer all kinds of ways to enable you and your loved ones to be well and live well. You can expect;

  • A culture focused on well-being and opportunities for growth and development. We provide a wide range of training opportunities, for both professional and personal development.
  • The freedom to work in a way that works for you, with a focus on maximising productivity and innovation at work whilst reducing environmental impact.
  • A performance-based share plan, inspiring and rewarding our people as we deliver Abcam’s strategy.

We offer a truly inclusive environment where you can bring your whole self to work. This is underpinned by our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and our partnerships with WORK180 (endorsed employer for women) and MyGwork (LGBT+ professional community). All our positions are open as a Job Share, where two talented professionals can share the responsibility of a full time position. You can declare your interest in a job share role within the application form.

Abcam is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes all employment decisions without regard to age, national origin, race, ethnicity, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you’re interested in this particular role then we’d love to read your application.

title: Manager Governance and Quality
description:
Resthaven are looking for an enthusiastic and engaged  leader top join the Governance Team as Manager Quality and Governance in a Full Time Fixed Term capacity until 30 June 2023 - Maternity Leave contract

About the role:

  • Effectively manage, coordinate and review the development and implementation of Resthaven's Risk and Quality Objectives

The benefits to you:

Application Close 9am Tuesday 31 May 2022

title: Residential Drafter
description:
Enduro Builders is a technology driven construction company.  We are at the leading edge of Low Energy and Passive House construction in South Australia.

We leverage our IT assets to produce cost efficient homes and industry leading levels of collaboration, making sure details are sorted out BEFORE the building starts.

Having grown our design arm significantly in the last 12 months, we are looking for an experienced residential drafter, preferably with custom home experience.

Being part of a close knit team means that everyone pulls their weight and we all support each other in making sure we are delivering high quality homes, on time, on budget and defect free.

The scope of this drafting role includes;

  • Carrying out Site measures and drawing up existing conditions
  • Residential custom homes, with an occasional commercial project
  • 3D Modelling
  • Leveraging your IT and CAD skills to assist with data collection and cross checking for Estimating
  • Review of Architectural plans for errors and omissions
  • Carrying out material take offs

Do you think you might have these skills?

  • Some Design flair (you don’t have to have it all, but a little of an eye for it would be invaluable)
  • Comfortable working with clients to review and change drawings to reflect their project needs
  • Good knowledge of building terminology
  • Excellent communication and customer service skills
  • Interest in leveraging your IT and CAD skills into Estimating
  • High level of comfort and speed in Revit and Sketchup (weighted more heavily to Revit)

We would love for you to have an interest in Energy Efficient building , building science and have a passion for delivering the best possible result for clients, this role has the potential growth to learn about estimating and project management.

How to Apply

Do you reckon you’re made of the right stuff to be part of our team?

Applying is simple, just follow the instructions below….if you don’t hear back from us, it's because you missed a step!

Simply call Amy on 0448 616 304 to discuss the role and she will give you an email address to send in your application.

title: Analytical Chemist
description:
12 month minimum contract to characterise the performance of energetic materials for the Department of Defence's guided weapons research project.

  • Requires experience working with energetic material and Australian Citizenship essential (for security Clearances)
  • $ Based on Experience
  • Edinburgh South Australia

Your Next Employer...

You'll be working with the R&D department for the Department of Defence (Defence Science Technology Group, DTSG) in Edinburgh. DSTG is currently supporting research into guided weapons prototyping.

The Role...

As a laboratory technician you will undertake the following

1. Mechanical and performance characterisation of energetic materials; including mechanical property assessment, burn rate determination and physical properties.

2. Analysis of test data.

3. Maintenance of test facilities, liaise with workshop staff as required, prepare hardware and materials, conduct pre-test checks and post-test clean-up.

4. Ensure compliance documentation required for the safe operation of the laboratory is in place and current including managing the risks of hazardous chemicals in the workplace

5. Assist in the preparation and review of risk assessments and process documentation

You will need

  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in analytical chemistry.
  • Demonstrated understanding of QA/QC as it applies to analytical chemistry.
  • Demonstrated practical experience using a range of analytical chemistry testing equipment.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience working with hazardous chemicals.
  • A tertiary qualification in Science, majoring in Chemistry
  • To be an Australian Citizen (ESSENTIAL)

For more information, call Soyuz on 03 9573 1500

title: Principal/Senior Structural Engineer - Residential
description:
FMG Engineering is a nationally recognised multi-disciplinary engineering consultancy providing quality services and solutions to the development, property and urban infrastructure sectors for almost 50-years. Offices in Adelaide, Melbourne and Sydney employ 150 engineers, scientists, technicians, and support staff who safely deliver fit for purpose outcomes to time, scope, budget and quality expectations offering clients a great return on their investment.

Primarily the role will be working with a team of other experienced engineers and designers working on large and small residential projects and medium density developments. Your role will be to provide mentoring to other more junior engineers and provide technical guidance and support for small and large projects.

Formal qualifications in structural or civil engineering is required, and you must be able to demonstrate a minimum of 8 years prior work experience in the residential engineering design field, within Australia.

Ideally your experience would include a combination of the following:

  • Residential footing design
  • Residential civil design
  • Residential structural design
  • Knowledge and interpretation of soil data
  • High level verbal and written communication skills are essential for this position
  • Demonstrated experience mentoring and motivating other engineers

What we can offer you:

  • Flexible working life. Work-life balance is important, FMG Engineering offer staff the ability to mix working in the office with a working from home capability
  • A competitive salary commensurate with experience
  • An opportunity to work in a team of likeminded and experienced engineering professionals
  • Exposure to a variety of business sectors and range of responsibilities developing and delivering challenging projects
  • Access to our Employee Assistance Program: A free service that includes counselling for you and your immediate family members

The work is interesting, varied and challenging, and you should be passionate about engineering and have a desire to pass on your technical knowledge to others.  The company culture is one that encourages passion, entrepreneurship and team spirit, and where hard work is rewarded and recognised.

If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your resume and cover letter (outlining which of the above-mentioned criteria makes you suitable for this role) via SEEK or email to recruitment@fmgengineering.com.au.

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Senior Consultant, Cyber Security
description:
Company description:

READY FOR ANYTHING

At IAG, we live and work by our purpose to make your world a safer place. We are motivated by a unique culture that celebrates honesty, creativity, empathy, equity and collaboration. We call it the IAG way, and it means we all share a 'ready for anything' mindset that sets the tone for positive actions and positive outcomes. We put heart into everything we do which guides us to create amazing things for our customers, our people and our communities.

We're brimming with ideas, ambition and a readiness to apply bold thinking and risk awareness to make a difference where it matters most.

As the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, we own some of the region's most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC and WFI. We are ready for anything.



Job description:

  • Permanent Opportunity
  • Australia
  • Senior Cyber Security Analyst (Group Risk)

The Role

The Senior Security Analyst is to provide focused expert knowledge and strategic view around predicting, preventing, detecting and responding to cyber security threats, as well as designing and operating the core technologies used by the Cyber Threat Emulation & Defence team. The role sits in the Defence and Threat Disruption area, which is part of the larger Cyber Threat Emulation & Defence team.

Key Responsibilities

  • Providing situational awareness and reporting on cyber security status, incidents, and trends in adversary behaviours to the appropriate internal and external parties
  • Prevention of cyber security incidents through proactive: I
    • Continuous threat analysis;
    • Network and host scanning for vulnerabilities;
    • Countermeasure deployment coordination;
    • Security policies, architecture and control design advisory
  • Monitoring, detection and analysis of potential intrusions in real time and through historical trending on security relevant data sources
  • Respond to confirmed cyber security incidents, by coordinating resources and directing use of timely and appropriate countermeasures
  • In collaboration with the Adaptive Response and Engineering area, operates the Cyber Defence Centre technologies, such as SIEM, DLP, data collection and analysis systems
  • In collaboration with the Offensive Security Assessment [O.S.A] area, to participate in purple teaming activities.n collaboration with the Threat Analytic Cell area, perform threat hunting activities to detect unknown unknown and develop new detection methodologies.

Skills & Experience

  • 5 - 10 years' experience in large and complex organisations, with 3-5 years of experience working in a threat management, SOC or Threat Intel capability.
  • Lateral thinker / curious / positive mind set / systematic approach to troubleshooting
  • Knowledge of operating systems, SIEM platform (Splunk) and ticket management systems (Service Now)
  • Proficiency on networking skills and comfortable reading / working at the network layer.
  • Comfortable to work as an incident responder and dealing with cyber incidents
  • Penetration testing skills & experience
  • Experience working as a Security Operation Centre team member
  • Knowledge of scripting and programming languages (e.g. bash, perl, python, C)
  • Experience performing pro-active cyber hunting
  • Tertiary qualification in Information Technology, Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • Insurance industry experience
  • Working Knowledge of Agile methodologies
  • ASM knowledge
  • Reverse engineering experience
  • Digital forensic experience
  • Experience working with intelligence agencies
  • ISECOM OPST & OPSA, SANS GSEC and above, other cyber defensive and offensive security certifications will be highly regarded

Let's Talk

Click ‘Apply' and start your career conversation with Talent Acquisition! Applications close on Friday, 13th May 2022

IAG rewards and recognises its people with generous benefits, career development opportunities and real work-life balance. Employees also enjoy 13% superannuation, up to 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work programs, various corporate partner discounts and a people-focused culture that celebrates achievements big and small.
Creating a workforce that actively embraces diversity, inclusion and a sense of belonging is key to our success. We believe in treating everyone fairly which means that inclusion, removing barriers, striving for equity and embracing diversity are woven through our values and behaviours. We encourage applications from all backgrounds and communities and are committed to providing a work environment that enables you to thrive, whatever your circumstances. If we can provide support with access requirements, alternative work arrangements please advise us via your application.
IAG has committed to the reconciliation movement in Australia for First Nations people and focus on providing a safe and supportive work environment for all our employees. More information on our Reconciliation Action Plan can be found on our company website.

MELB1

ADEL1

BRIS1

title: Research Administration Officer
description:
• Attractive salary packaging options available
  • Part-time, 4 days a week (0.8FTE), 12-month contract opportunity
  • Hybrid working options available! Work both from home and the Hamilton, NSW or Glenside, SA office!

Dementia Australia is the national peak body and source of trusted information, education and services for the estimated half a million Australians living with dementia, and the almost 1.6 million people involved in their care. We advocate for positive change and support vital research.  We are here to support people impacted by dementia, and to enable them to live as well as possible. Our commitment to a shared set of values shapes our decisions, actions and behaviours towards achieving our core purpose and strategic priorities.

  • We connect by promoting a people centred way of working and respecting all
  • We collaborate in a supportive manner with each other, other teams, clients and external parties
  • We commit to our purpose and direction, accountable for our actions and support the innovations, reshaping the way we do things

The Research Administration Officer will join the Dementia Australia Research Foundation and help enhance the administration and management of the foundation alongside its funding programs.

The Dementia Australia Research Foundation is the research arm of the organisation and through the Grants Program it provides funding to support innovative Australian research to better understand the causes of dementia, develop strategies, improve treatment and care options as well as finding a cure.

Reporting directly to the General Manager, Dementia Australia Research Foundation, you will also be responsible for:

  • Coordinating and administering key processes associated with the review of grant applications submitted to the Dementia Grants Program. Administrative tasks include collating applications, data entry, coordinating Scientific Panel and external review of applications, meeting coordination, responding to applicants’ queries and other functions as required.
  • Assisting in providing secretariat support for the Dementia Australia Research Foundation Scientific Panel and Board
  • Managing and maintaining research systems, web based databases and processes, including the Foundation email mailbox and shared files
  • Supporting the evaluation of the Dementia Grants Program and the development of key policies and procedures underpinning the operations of the Foundation.

To be successful in the position, you will be a team player, show an absolute commitment to the delivery of high quality results and meet the key selection criteria outlined below.

Key Selection Criteria:

  1. Highly-developed administrative and organisational skills, including attention to detail and the ability to prioritise and manage work efficiently and accurately
  2. Proven ability in identifying, analysing and resolving administrative issues, ensuring effective outcomes and process improvements.
  3. Exemplary communication and interpersonal skills
  4. Advanced level of computer literacy with experience in word processing, database applications, web-conferencing, email applications and spreadsheets

Qualifications:

  • Minimum of Diploma or Certificate IV in Business Administration or experience in health, grant or scholarship administration, or equivalent

This is truly an exceptional opportunity for the right individual to further develop their career and make their mark in a progressive peak body. In return, you will be offered a flexible and supportive work environment as well as a number of attractive staff benefits. You will be making a difference in the lives of people living with dementia, their families and friends.

To continue with your application and to view the position description, please select the 'Apply for this Job' button above. You will be required to provide a cover letter outlining your response to the key selection criteria within the application process. You will also be requested to attach a copy of your resume.

Please note, Applications that do not contain a covering letter that addresses each of the key selection criteria will not be considered.

title: Software Support Engineer
description:
Minimum NV1 Defence clearance or eligibility to acquire one is mandatory (requires Australian Citizenship).

ABOUT US
Fivecast is a world-leading provider of digital intelligence solutions. We enable the world’s most important public and private organizations to explore masses of data and uncover actionable insights, critical to protecting global communities.

Fivecast is an inclusive employer, we value diversity of thought and experience, and we believe our inclusive culture contributes to our success. We are committed to building a workforce that is representative of the communities in which we live and work.

As a growing start-up, all team members are provided with the opportunity to directly contribute to our success, participate in the development of new and emerging technologies and grow their careers in a challenging and dynamic high-tech environment.

ABOUT THE ROLE
The Software Support Engineer will join Fivecast’s technical support team and contribute to our customer’s success by troubleshooting complex software issues, reproducing them, proposing work-arounds, resolving or escalating as required, and communicating with our global customer base as issues are addressed.
You will become a domain expert for our Software-as-a-Service products, understaing the core capabilities and limitations, and how to apply our software to a diverse range of customer requirements. You’ll work closely with our experienced tradecraft, development and operations teams and gain experience in a broad range of technologies across all layers of our software stack.
Beyond immediate remediation, you’ll have the opportunity to modify and improve the core product, addressing common customer feedback, identifying and fixing root causes, building and maintaining tools to help solve underlying or recurring problems and contributing to in-app help and training material to improve the customer experience.


Experience
  • Tertiary qualifications in information technology, software, or computer science
  • Minimum 2 years programming experience, with Java, Javascript, SQL and Linux shell experience preferred.
  • Proven experience in a software service delivery related role.
  • Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with an ability to give technical instructions to a non-technical audience.
  • Experience using Jira service desk, Zendesk or similar support ticketing software desired.

Whilst our preference is for someone who meets the above criteria, the opportunity exists for candidates of various skill levels. If your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you will still be a good fit we encourage you to apply.

Our Work Environment and Culture

Only a few minutes from the city, Fivecast is located at Base 64 on North Terrace, home to other innovative and interesting Australian technology start-ups. Enjoy a casual, relaxed atmosphere that encourages collaboration and includes a fully equipped kitchen, barista-quality coffee machine, end of trip facilities, and comfortable indoor and outdoor spaces for meetings and eating. At Fivecast we understand the importance of a good work-life balance and support flexible work arrangements.

title: Developer
description:
Bravura is looking for an ambitious developer with a strong passion for developing and cementing your career within the Fintech software development services industry.

Form an integral member of the Transactional Services team alongside Developers, Business Analysts, and Technical Consultants, you will develop modern cloud-native solutions to meet business requirements using a range of technologies using agile methodologies.

Reporting to the Practice Lead will assist with breaking down large business and technical problems, solving them systematically, crafting and testing high quality, maintainable and efficient code to meet our industry-leading, international customer requirements.

With a can-do attitude, you will gain exposure to all elements of the software development lifecycle (SDLC). A typical day will also involve some of the following activities:

  • Beginner level software development and coding for Babel messaging and the ePASS employer portal
  • Contribute to developing and executing effective unit and function tests of all software changes
  • Provide assistance as required to other Developers, Business and Test Analysts
  • Undertake troubleshooting and problem solving of software defects and application issues
  • Debug code to identify and rectify defects or data issues
  • Provide technical assistance and support to Bravura clients as and when required
  • Assist with software builds and the preparation and delivery of releases
  • Effective participation in team and project meetings and proactive identification and communication of issues and improvements.

Skills that will help you succeed in this role:

  • You will have completed a Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Computer Science
  • Achieved strong academics with the desire to accelerate your career in a software development
  • You’re a natural at solving problems and have several personal projects on the side
  • You're a good team player and demonstrate a willingness and aptitude for continuous self-learning and are proactive in developing new skills
  • Good working knowledge of a modern, general-purpose, object-oriented programming language

Other desirable skills include:

  • SQL, Entity-Relationship (ER) design, and Relational Databases concepts
  • Object-Oriented design and development methods and practices
  • Application containerization and cloud knowledge including Docker and Kubernetes
  • Familiarity with Web Services – SOAP and/or RESTful APIs
  • Good working knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, CSS & modern web UI frameworks (e.g. Angular)
  • Code refactoring and use of design and code patterns
  • Source Control using and Subversion and GIT
  • Knowledge of relevant Operating System tools, utilities and commands

What we offer you:

  • Our people are the heart of our business. We work hard to provide a rich employee experience and a strong framework for ongoing career development.
  • Flexible hybrid ways of working
  • Value-driven leave offerings; parental, volunteer, and study leave amongst others
  • Access to well-being support, for you and your family
  • Competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits scheme
  • Newly renovated offices that inspire Agile and collaborative ways of working
  • Ongoing opportunities to develop your commercial and technical skills working with international clients

About Bravura Solutions

At Bravura Solutions, collaboration, diversity, and excellence matter. We value your ideas, giving you room to be curious and innovate in an exciting, fast-paced, and flexible environment.

As a market leader and ASX-listed company, we are a trusted partner to over 350 leading financial services clients. We invest significantly in our technology hubs and innovation labs, which inspire and drive our creative, future-focused mindset. We take pride in developing cutting-edge technology solutions that support our clients to achieve financial security and prosperity for their customers.

How to apply?

If you are interested in joining an ASX-listed fintech powering the world’s leading financial institutions, we would love to hear from you so apply online today. Please submit a copy of your transcript if a recent graduate along with your resume and if you have a GitHub account, we would love you to include this in your resume.

title: Digital Advertising Agency - Multiple Positions at RQmedia
description:
RQmedia is at the fore of e-commerce advertising.  We work with over 100 national brands and grow their sales through online advertising.   We have won numerous awards and provide ongoing career opportunities.  We are growing and have several exciting opportunities.

New roles available

  • Experienced Digital Account managers - who love talking to customers and working on advertising plans to achieve customer goals
  • Graduate roles for those who have just completed their degrees

Experienced Account Manager

Do you know the fundamentals about Google and/or Facebook advertising.  We are always looking for experienced people to join our team.  You should ideally have 3-5 years experience growing and managing a portfolio of retail brands.  Please be specific about your experience and skill set.

You will love communicating in all forms, can use data to create digital media strategies and know what campaign types to recommend to scale online results.  You also are data driven and very responsive to customers.

Graduate Positions available

We are looking for the best and brightest who have a high GPA and track record of outstanding results in their education and work experience.

You will learn about Google, Facebook and Microsoft advertising as these are all part of our digital media agency.

This is an outstanding opportunity for commerce, business, management, science, maths, journalism or commerce students.  No one degree provides you with the skills for what we do (we have successfully employed law, media, commerce, event management and physics grads!).  We provide full training in the growth economy of digital advertising.  You just need to be top of your class, learn fast, results driven and able to take the rapid pace of our industry.

For all roles - required as a minimum:

  • Intelligent and inquiry driven
  • Fast learner
  • Ability to deliver KPIs
  • Excellent English writing ability
  • Persistence
  • Proficient with word processing and spreadsheets
  • Excellent communication skills and a team player
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet scheduled due dates
  • Ability to analyse, report and act on data
  • High attention to detail
  • Ability to take on board customer feedback

If any of these positions sounds like you, please specify which role you are after, send your resume and a short cover letter.

For the graduate positions please include your ATAR and GPA (bullet points are fine!).

This job is only open to Australian permanent residents and citizens. No Agencies please.

title: Mechanical Testing Laboratory Technician
description:
12 month minimum contract to mix and cast explosive ordnances being researched by the Department of Defence in South Australia

  • Requires experience working with energetic material and Australian Citizenship essential (for security Clearances)
  • $ Based on Experience
  • Edinburgh South Australia

Your Next Employer...

You'll be working with the R&D department for the Department of Defence (Defence Science Technology Group, DTSG) in Edinburgh. DSTG is currently supporting research into guided weapons prototyping.

The Role...

The laboratory technician will, under direction, undertake the following major duties:

1. Mechanical and performance characterisation of energetic materials; including mechanical property assessment, burn rate determination and physical properties.

2. Analysis of test data.

3. Maintenance of test facilities, liaise with workshop staff as required, prepare hardware and materials, conduct pre-test checks and post-test clean-up.

4. Ensure compliance documentation required for the safe operation of the laboratory is in place and current including managing the risks of hazardous chemicals in the workplace

5. Assist in the preparation and review of risk assessments and process documentation

You Will Need...

Demonstrated experience, knowledge & skills in the following areas:

1. Demonstrated experience in laboratory testing, especially mechanical testing.

2. Ability to interpret and following testing protocols and standards

3. Good oral and written communication skills including the ability to collate, interpret and report technical information, concepts, procedures and laboratory test results.

4. Understanding of WHS principles relating to chemical laboratories.

5. Experience in handling energetic materials

Qualification(s):

1. A tertiary qualification in Science or enginnering is highly desirable.

To be an Australian Citizen (ESSENTIAL)

For more information , call Soyuz on 03 9573 1500

title: Java Developer
description:
Waterfind, a leader in the Australian water market industry, is looking to grow its business. By extending our range of award winning market products and software services available to our 10,000+ customers, Waterfind is seeking to provide enhanced water security and drought resilience to Australian irrigators while helping to safeguard our river environments.

But we need your help to design and build Waterfind's next generation market platform. If you're a solution oriented, team player with a passion for software innovation then we should talk…

We're seeking a talented developer for a permanent role in our team. We're ready to go when you are!

The Position Involves:

  • Designing, developing and delivering continuous improvements to Waterfind's online water trading system
  • Contributing to the ongoing improvement of the cloud-based platform, the software that underpins our water market.
  • Working with the team and following an Agile process to ensure that an impressive level of innovative software is delivered on-time and on-budget.
  • The scope to pursue your interest in data science by contributing to our “deep water” technology road-map.

You'll Need:

  • Solid 3+ years software development experience.
  • Demonstrated experience building web-based systems using Java technologies.
  • Familiarity with service oriented architectures and cloud-based deployment.
  • Experience with Spring, Spring MVC, Hibernate, Tomcat and/or equivalent technologies.
  • Relational database experience.
  • A sound working knowledge of the full software development life-cycle, including release management and quality assurance.
  • A tertiary I.T. qualification.


Waterfind is an equal opportunity employer.

Applicants must be able to demonstrate an existing right to work in Australia. The successful applicant will be required to undertake a police check prior to commencing employment.

title: Store Person
description:
The Chrysos commitment and mission

Here at Chrysos we combine science and software to create technology solutions that are changing the global mining industry; both from a productivity and environmental impact perspective.

Just like atoms and machines, we believe that everyone is different and how individuals come together is what makes us successful. Headquartered in Adelaide and with team members based in Western Australia, Victoria, Africa and North America, Chrysos Corporation’s diverse team of scientists, engineers and industry specialists are coming together to build technologies to provide rapid, accurate and safe ore analysis for the global mining industry.

The company’s flagship technology, PhotonAssay, steps around centuries-old chemistry-based assay methods to deliver true ‘atom-counting’ analysis for the measurement of gold and other high-value metals. With successful installations around Australia and a strong pipeline of global projects, Chrysos is taking PhotonAssay to customers around the world – Chrysos could take you to places that you might not have even imagined yet. There’s opportunity around every corner and the support to help you achieve your goals.

About the role

The Store Person will support the overall day-to-day operations and administration responsibilities of all associated activities of the Warehouse and its logistics. The person will regularly engage with the Chrysos logistics, project management, operations and physics teams.

What you will do:

Support the overall day-to-day operations and administration responsibilities of all associated activities of the Warehouse and its logistics

  • Assist in the maintenance of storage areas by organizing floor space
  • Maintain accurate data
  • Communicate and liaise with all internal customers to ensure excellence in customer service
  • Unloading goods.
  • Receiving and scanning goods and checking against orders.
  • Inspecting for damage.
  • Moving goods around a store.
  • Stocking shelves.
  • Stacking bulky goods safely.
  • Picking goods from shelves and recording their movements.
  • Packing and sending orders to customers.
  • Data entry and paperwork.
  • Moving heavy pallets and goods using mechanical means.

Assist with other activities as required.

Have an eye and voice for safety and contribute to ensuring a safe work environment for all.

Who you are:

Essential

  1. A current LF Forklift License or has the passion and commitment to immediately begin training to obtain the license (and Current Driver’s licence)
  2. Relevant experience in working in a small warehouse environment
  3. Demonstrated ability to work independently, plan and coordinate to meet deadlines
  4. To be able to generate reports such as an open order report, to be able to prepare for the days’ arrivals
  5. Analytical problem solving and judgment ability
  6. A sense of humour and a desire to belong and contribute to a great team and workplace culture which is about respect, inclusion and belonging
  7. The successful candidate will need to be pro-active, and a self-starter type, as there will be periods of relative isolation with only communication via email, teams, or mobile.

Desirable

  1. Experience with any WMS, ERP or other system would be favourable

Personal attributes

  1. Respect – for everyone with due regard for their feelings, wishes or rights
  2. Empathy – the ability to sense what the client, colleague or other stakeholder needs from you.
  3. Integrity – being honest and consistently adhering to strong moral and ethical principles and values.
  4. Ability to communicate effectively
  5. Initiative to undertake what needs to be done
  6. Drive to work autonomously

Why come and join us?

Whether you’re in the office, working from home or on one of our client sites, we recognise that every single person is unique and our Chrysos benefits aim to ensure we cater for all.

We encourage flexibility and wellbeing. In today’s busy world it can be hard to find the right balance. Our people leaders welcome the discussion on flexibility and will always do their best to support your individual situation. To support this, we ensure you are well equipped with a mobile phone and at home computer set-up.

Yes, like many other businesses we have team activities, like pizza or different sports, but with us you will get the chance to work with exciting, ground-breaking equipment that is revolutionising and reducing the environmental impact of our mining industry. You will work with some of the best minds in the industry and be afforded career growth and development opportunities.

If this sounds like what you are looking for. Then send a covering letter, CV and statement addressing the required skills and competencies to careers@chrysos.com.au

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion. When you apply, please feel free to tell us the pronouns you use or any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

title: Enterprise Software Support Analyst
description:
At Esri Australia we share a passion: for solving problems with GIS (Geographical Information Systems) and Enterprise technologies; for contributing to an ongoing geospatial conversation; and collaborating with our clients for a better future.  As part of Esri Australia’s expanding Care Team, you will play a pivotal role in making this vision a reality.

About the team

Join our passionate ArcGIS application enthusiasts and technology specialists to contribute to our well-earned and highly respected team of troubleshooting and solution experts relied upon by a diverse client base. We are proud to support and contribute to ArcGIS solutions supporting both local, national, and even global projects.  Our team members are passionate about the intersection of technology and geographic information systems. We are highly self-driven to grow our skillsets and enthusiastic in our approach to sharing our knowledge with colleagues. Various overlapping backgrounds and skillsets in the team foster plenty of opportunities to share your own expertise and learn from your peers.

We strongly encourage you to apply if you have an enthusiasm for learning new technologies, GIS, problem solving, and knowledge sharing.

About the Role

As an Enterprise Software Support Consultant, you will deliver on our vision and service delivery principles of Ease, Expertise, Collaboration and Consistency, by providing technical software support and training to our clients, ensuring that our contact with clients delivers a user experience consistent with our client experience vision.

Key responsibilities of the role include:

  • Provide high-quality technical software support, training, and customer service to our Esri Australia end users through effective communication and efficient troubleshooting
  • Identify, understand, and articulate solutions for customer issues to resolve ArcGIS Enterprise and related technologies
  • Perform incident management, problem management and change management processes in line with the ITIL best practices
  • Work well in high energy, fast-paced, enthusiastic, positive, and collaborative culture
  • Assist in the development and maintenance of our knowledge base.

Being successful in this role involves being keen to learn more about geospatial technologies, the ArcGIS Enterprise suite, and developing core ArcGIS server-based product knowledge.

It is a fantastic role for an enthusiastic professional willing to apply and grow their Information Technology knowledge and skills across the full stack of ArcGIS Enterprise deployments.

About You

  • Relevant experience and/or qualification (BA preferred) in associated business disciplines (Computer Science, Information Technology)
  • Experience working in software support or technical customer service with the direct end-user contact.
  • Experience with administering Microsoft Windows Server and Linux operating systems highly regarded.
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills. You communicate well in both written and verbal medium. You can communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • The ability to effectively perform fault diagnosis and problem-solving skills; communicate clearly and concisely relevant findings, workarounds, and steps to resolve.
  • Dedicated to continuous learning; a passion for embracing new and emerging technologies.
  • Keen interest and ability to work collaboratively as part of a team.
  • Great attention to detail and time management skills.
  • You must hold current permanent and full-time working rights in Australia.
  • Personality/ Behaviour aligns with Esri Australia’s core values.

The following skills and experience will make a difference:

  • ArcGIS Enterprise (ArcGIS Server, Portal for ArcGIS, and ArcGIS Data Store).
  • Networking Fundamentals (Web server administration, firewalls, load balancing, IIS, DNS, DHCP, TCP/UDP, networking ports).
  • Web Service Fundamentals (SOAP / REST API’s, browser development tools, JavaScript, Python).
  • Web Security and Identity Store integration (Firewalls, SSL Certificates, SSL/TLS, SAML, Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS)).
  • Database Technologies (SQL, MS SQL Server administration, Oracle, PostgreSQL, CouchDB, Elastic).
  • Exposure to environments hosted in Amazon Web Services (AWS) and/or Microsoft Azure Cloud.

For further details or if you have any questions, please contact Tibo Torche, National Talent Acquisition Lead on 07 3218 0448 or mail to ttorche@esriaustralia.com.au .

We are a 2022 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

Please note that Esri Australia does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.

title: Engineering Director - Biogas Systems Australia Pty Ltd
description:
Biogas Systems Australia is a leading provider of turn-key systems for landfill, anaerobic digester and hazardous ground gas projects. We bring proven equipment designed and built specifically for required applications, backed up with our expert support services.

We offer our clients a complete one stop shop for all aspects of project delivery, from feasibility assessment through to construction and providing expert technical advice. Our people are the key to what we do. Our work environment is a flexible, vibrant and fast moving one, where we enable our people to develop and grow with the company. We are firmly committed to looking after and developing our staff, from safety in the workplace through to professional development, ongoing training and equal opportunities.

We invite applications for an exceptional all round hands on Engineering Director to join Biogas Systems with a proven history of working on waste management projects ranging from routine monitoring to large infrastructure related projects. This experience involves the design and manufacture of biogas equipment such as flares, blowers control systems and monitoring systems. The role requires a high level of expertise and liaising with a wide range of project stakeholders.

Reporting to the Managing Director, the main responsibilities of the Engineering Director will be to work within project teams’ delivering construction projects, working across all business activities to provide a leading role in providing equipment and expertise for management of biogas and leachate associated with landfills and anaerobic digestion systems.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Manage and work with the project teams in order to ensure compliance with Client and Biogas Systems’ processes.
  • Design and manufacture of biogas and leachate treatment systems.
  • Providing technical advice in relation to LFG management and wider environmental management issues.
  • Monitoring and maintenance of LFG collection systems.
  • Reviewing reports and data to evaluate engineering management options from both technical and commercial aspects.
  • Obtaining regulatory approvals from all levels of Australian and International governments where required for all equipment supplied by the company.
  • Assisting with the compiling of tender submissions including writing methodologies and providing costings.

The Engineering Director must possess the following skills/qualifications/experience:

  • A Degree in Engineering, Science and/or equivalent is preferred but not essential.
