  • A minimum of 15 years’ experience working in landfill gas with extensive management experience.
  • LFG and anaerobic digester experience.
  • Construction of flare systems.
  • Construction of leachate treatment systems.
  • Experience in Software design applications desirable.
  • Experience in Safety in design desirable.
  • Experience in Civil Construction desirable.

A competitive salary package will be provided to the successful candidate to reflect experience and skill (base salary in the range of $150,000.00-$160,000.00 plus a fully maintained motor vehicle, laptop computer and mobile telephone).

Applications close 11 June 2022 .

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Hospital Specialist Representative - Oncology
description:
Why Our Customers Need You

One way or another, cancer touches all our lives.  Which is why nothing is more personal, or more urgent, than our goal to find cures for cancer and to deliver on our purpose.  This motivates all of us at Pfizer.

The Hospital Portfolio Specialist - Oncology will be the central contact in connecting customers within their territory to our portfolio of innovative cancer therapies.  Known internally as the Health Representative, central to the role will be the introduction of new & promoted medicines and innovative digital services that will support Health Care Professionals’ in their patient care. The role is consultative; spanning Pfizer’s Oncology portfolio for their customer base, and one that will result in long standing and truly valued relationships with customers.

The Health Representative will draw on healthcare knowledge and understanding of the health and pharmaceutical industry, as well as Pfizer and the product portfolio, so that customers achieve the solutions they need.

What You Will Achieve

As the Health Representative, you will be responsible for supporting customers with the Oncology portfolio within a defined geographical territory that includes both metro and regional areas.  You will be the single point of contact for the relevant Pfizer medicines for your accounts, and will ensure a customer centric-comprehensive approach to our healthcare professionals.

This is a permanent role available as 1 full time colleague, or 2 part time colleagues in a job share capacity.

How You Will Achieve It

  • Engaging on promotional science-based brand messages where product could support the HCP in meeting patient needs, with engagement also focused on a broader range of content (e.g., disease state)
  • Acting as a key point of contact for seamless (compliant) reactive only connection to Pfizer SMEs and resources
  • Responsible for onboarding customers to new operating model and to new digital platforms
  • Orchestrating an ideal customer experience through relevant content selection
  • Driving identified customers to the digital service offerings, opening a world of trusted materials and support that can be tailored to their needs and those of their patients.
  • Ensuring customers gain best value from the services, in conjunction with the Pfizer Virtual Health Representative team who are on hand providing virtual support.
  • Leading relationships with Health Care Professionals travelling across metro and rural locations as well as providing support virtually.
  • Gaining a deep understanding of Health Care Professional needs, sharing expert product advice, tailoring data, delivering promotional activities, aligning the customer lifecycle with that of the Pfizer portfolio and connecting them to relevant internal Pfizer colleagues whenever they need it.
  • Providing objective and scientifically sound medical information regarding Pfizer's Oncology portfolio and the cancers for which they are indicated. Incorporating the use of educational programs, outcome and other tools which identify the greatest opportunities for improving patient care.
  • Seeking and developing awareness of external market conditions to drive exceptional customer support and insights, connecting customer discussions with external trends and internal developments within Pfizer.
  • Establishing a strong working relationship with the Pfizer virtual Health Representative, KAM and SME Teams, and sharing insights from customers to make our digital service offering even better.
  • Develop effective cross-functional networks and collaborative working relationships
  • Managing and achieving annual targets and ensuring adherence to Compliance, Legal, Medical and Regulatory requirements.

Must Have

  • A Tertiary Degree preferred in Business or Science or a healthcare background with solid knowledge of the industry.
  • Oncology experience desirable
  • Curiosity and an entrepreneurial mindset.
  • Analytical skills to identify the connections between data, products and the needs of both Health Care Professionals and patients.
  • Written and verbal communication skills to help build trusted, sustainable relationships with your internal and external stakeholders.
  • Solid understanding of the digital space and a willingness to keep learning and upskilling.
  • Strategic thinking and planning to help customers see beyond the day-to-day.
  • Agility, adaptability to change and seasoned negotiation skills.
  • Commercial and business acumen, managing financial budgets, driving sales and achieving performance measures.
  • Sound knowledge of and proven support of Pfizer Policies and Procedures, Compliance requirements as well as the Medicines Australia Code.
  • Demonstrated completion of Medicines Australia training program
  • Able to connect with customers virtually and in person.
  • Can-do attitude and a work ethic underpinned by determination and commitment
  • Valid Driver's License

Additional information:

As part of our commitment to provide opportunities for all colleagues to grow and develop, we encourage colleagues with the appropriate skills and experience to apply

Although the position has been advertised as full time, we encourage those employed under flexible working arrangements to apply. Colleagues working under such arrangements may be able to negotiate flexibility in their working hours or job share arrangements.

Pfizer is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.

title: Senior Specialist, Vulnerability Tools & Assessment
description:
Company description:

READY FOR ANYTHING

At IAG, we live and work by our purpose to make your world a safer place. We are motivated by a unique culture that celebrates honesty, creativity, empathy, equity and collaboration. We call it the IAG way, and it means we all share a 'ready for anything' mindset that sets the tone for positive actions and positive outcomes. We put heart into everything we do which guides us to create amazing things for our customers, our people and our communities.

We're brimming with ideas, ambition and a readiness to apply bold thinking and risk awareness to make a difference where it matters most.

As the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, we own some of the region's most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC and WFI. We are ready for anything.



Job description:

  • Role- Senior Specialist - Vulnerability tools and Assessment
  • Location-Australia
  • Permanent Opportunity

The Role
In this role you will help to protect IAG's digital and information assets by assuring authorized and secure utilization of infrastructure and application resources by managing vulnerability and configuration compliance scanning and associated processes.
A major sophisticated cyber-attack against IAG could have a catastrophic impact on the business, and this team is one of the main lines of defense against such an attack
This role will see you utilise your passion for cyber security to make our world a safer place.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Own and deliver Vulnerability Management and Cloud Posture services end to end.
  • Ensure that infrastructure is scanned for vulnerabilities and compliance validation, that scanning coverage and implementation is optimised and that the service is running.
  • Work with various stakeholders to ensure that remediation management is functioning through assisting with prioritisation, identifying orphan assets, assisting remediation teams by providing vulnerability information etc.
  • Update and maintain operational dashboards that highlight service status and coverage.
  • Work with the broader assessment team to improve and deliver security assessment services
  • Deliver all stages of the technical assessment lifecycle and contribute to the maintenance of technical assessment policies, standards and procedures.
  • Document the findings resulting from technical assessments within work tracking solutions for orchestration for remediation.
  • Identify practical improvements to processes that would improve agility and allow greater utilisation of self-service capabilities.

Skills & Experience:

  • Extensive experience with vulnerability management solutions e.g., Tenable Security Centre, Qualys, BURP enterprise ect.
  • Thorough understanding of Cloud and other Security Standards / Frameworks e.g., CIS Benchmarks, NIST CSF, ISO 27001, PCI-DSS, CVSS
  • Understanding of CIS Benchmarks related to Infrastructure configuration
  • Exposure to and familiarity with ticketing solutions e.g., ServiceNow, Jira etc.
  • Application development exposure in one or more of the following: SQL, PHP, Python, HTML, JavaScript, PowerShell, GoLang (Go)
  • Advanced Excel skills including Excel programming and data modelling
  • Technical understanding of applications developed in web technologies such as HTML, JavaScript, Java/J2EE, ASP/.NET, PHP, Rest APIs, AngularJS, NodeJS, Bootstrap etc.
  • Experience of conducting Vulnerability Assessment of Web Applications within cloud environments (e.g., AWS/Azure etc.).
  • Tertiary qualification in Information Technology, Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent experience.

Ready for anything? Let's talk.

Click ‘Apply' and start your career conversation with Talent Acquisition!

Applications close on 3rd June 2022.

IAG rewards and recognises its people with generous benefits, career development opportunities and real work-life balance. Employees also enjoy 13% superannuation, up to 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work programs, various corporate partner discounts and a people-focused culture that celebrates achievements big and small.

Creating a workforce that actively embraces diversity, inclusion and a sense of belonging is key to our success. We believe in treating everyone fairly which means that inclusion, removing barriers, striving for equity and embracing diversity are woven through our values and behaviours. We encourage applications from all backgrounds and communities and are committed to providing a work environment that enables you to thrive, whatever your circumstances. If we can provide support with access requirements, alternative work arrangements please advise us via your application.

IAG has committed to the reconciliation movement in Australia for First Nations people and focus on providing a safe and supportive work environment for all our employees. More information on our Reconciliation Action Plan can be found on our company website.

MELB1

ADEL1

BRIS1

title: Graduate Professionals
description:
Why join ARRB :
Where else will you make a meaningful impact on the lives of 25 million Australians per day and do your bit towards making the country sustainable?

ARRB is a dynamic and vibrant organisation providing exciting opportunities for people to do great things, to tackle the big transport and infrastructure questions, and to see these solutions being practically applied.

If our values of Collaboration, Transformation, Integrity and Energy & Passion strike a chord with you, then join us and make you mark! This role offers passionate, proactive, talented and energetic professionals the opportunity to make a significant contribution to the sustainability of Australia’s future mobility system!

ARRB is committed to train the brightest minds with an insatiable curiosity about the transport infrastructure arena to become the next generation thinkers, thought-leaders and game-changers.

About ARRB:
The Australian Road Research Board (ARRB) is the source of independent expert transport knowledge, with more than 60 years of experience focused on delivering a connected and adaptable future for Australia and New Zealand.

ARRB has a strong heritage supporting and delivering high quality applied research for Australian and New Zealand state road agencies (our Members) and for the community.  Our teams are made up of world-leading roads, transport and infrastructure professionals who analyse and interpret global research and apply it to the Australian and New Zealand context.

About the role and you:
We are looking for applicants who can demonstrate their interest/field of study in areas within the transportation industry including roads, rail, ports and airports.
  • Are you the type of person who can make things happen and get the job done?
  • Are you committed to improving the national quality of life, environment and economic well-being?
  • Does your curiosity drive you to understand challenges and create solutions focused outcomes?
  • Are you constantly trying to exceed the expectations of those around you?
Use your letter of application to demonstrate your superior understanding and creative thinking and tell us your story about how you want to contribute to shaping our transport future.

Successful applicants will work on a wide range of research, advisory and data-related projects designed to deliver quality and best practice outcomes for our clients.

The successful candidates will have the following skills:
  • Recent Engineering/Science graduate qualifications (within the last 2-3 years)
  • Candidates with 0-5 years working experience will be considered
  • Ability to confidently interact within a team made up of a diverse group of people located across Australia
  • Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written); including technical documentation writing skills
  • Motivated to work and learn with excellent time management skills
  • High attention to detail and ability to solve problems creatively and practically
  • Keen interest in research, creating new knowledge and practical solutions
What we offer:
An exciting, dynamic and collaborative workplace with challenging roles, where your skills, knowledge and experience will be recognised and respected, including:
  • Opportunities to contribute to high-profile and interesting projects which make a difference to the community
  • Opportunities to work collaboratively on local and national projects with a network of experts and colleagues around the country
  • A not-for-profit organisation that focuses on public good and which re-invests operating surpluses into our people, our equipment, and our facilities
  • Healthy work-life balance, with flexible arrangements for accruing time off, shifted work hours, access to paid parental leave
  • Strong support for career development and further study, including an explicit step-by-step guide for progressing in the organisation and a range of professional development options
  • A well-established social club, with regular socialising events, competitions, cook/bake-offs and tournaments
  • We embrace diversity - highlighting a multidisciplinary workforce from all over the world within all of our offices across Australia
  • Contemporary and modern work campuses
To be considered:
  • Applicants must be Australian Citizens / Permanent Resident of Australia who currently reside in Australia.
  • Please ensure you attach your CV, Cover Letter, Academic Transcript and answer the screening questions provided.
  • Clearly state on your Cover Letter for which state you are applying for.
  • Only applications who provide all relevant information will be reviewed.

title: Software Programmer
description:
SOFTWARE PROGRAMMER

Lane Communications is a South Australian based market leader in the provision of print and mail house services. With over 50 years’ of experience and a national customer base, Lane Communications continues to strive for higher levels of customer service through the provision of innovative communication solutions. To assist in achieving this goal, Lane Communications is seeking to appoint a Software Programmer in its Innovative Technology Centre.

Essential criteria:

  • C# .NET
  • Thorough knowledge and understanding of file manipulation
  • Relational databases (MySQL & SQL Server)
  • Data transfer and communications (FTP & SFTP)

Desirable criteria:

  • Windows batch scripting
  • Windows server administration (AD, ISS & Hyper-V)
  • C# .NET & PHP web development

While tertiary qualifications in Computer Science (or related disciplines) are not essential, you will need to demonstrate a solid understanding of software development.

The position involves client liaison and problem solving to achieve tight deadlines. Excellent communication, enthusiasm and creativity are essential along with an ability to work in a team environment. A proven track record of achieving goals under minimal supervision and an ongoing desire to develop new skills are essential.

A competitive salary package will be offered to the successful candidate. Please register your interest by submitting a covering letter (addressing the essential criteria as a minimum) and resume by 6th May 2022 to:

Cameron Obst
Software Manager
LANE COMMUNICATIONS
101 Mooringe Ave, Camden Park SA 5038
cobst@laneprint.com.au

title: Client Engagement Officer
description:
• Part time (0.4 FTE)
  • Family Friendly
  • Ongoing professional development opportunities

The Hospital Research Foundation Group is seeking an outstanding individual to join the Parkinson's and stroke team as our Client Engagement Officer on a part time basis (0.4FTE).

The Hospital Research Foundation Group (THRFG) is an impactful and dynamic not-for-profit, which supports health and medical research at hospitals across South Australia. Parkinson's and Stroke are two of The Hospital Research Foundation Group charities.

THRFG - Parkinson's and THRFG - Stroke are not-for-profit organisations that provide support and information to people living with Parkinson's, Stroke and other movement disorders, their carers, family, community and health professionals for over 30 years.

?The organisations represent and supports the 8,000 people with Parkinson's and stroke and their family members. The organisations provide support across the continuum of the condition, from diagnosis, through the early stages and throughout the progression of the disease. THRFG - Parkinson's and THRFG - Stroke provide expert information and support services that no private or government agency offers.

The Client Engagement Officer is a key front of house support role, assisting people with Parkinson's, Stroke and other movement disorders and / or their family carers to engage with out specialised supports and services. The Client Engagement Officer works closely with other members of the Wellbeing team to provide an integrated response to the client group.

The Client Engagement Officer is responsible for coordinating the Referral and Intake process, assisting within the reception and general office environment, and for providing operational support as required.

Role responsibilities include:

  • Maintain referral database to ensure contact maintained with client through all steps in referral receipt through to relevant support delivery. Ensure all referrals are managed professionally and new clients are allocated to an appropriate person and/or program
  • Take referrals by phone and in person, and ensure the referral process is followed through and completed in a timely, sensitive, trauma informed, supportive and professional manner
  • Provision of initial contact to clients referrals with introduction pack and relevant support and education group information.
  • Maintain accountability and record data according to CHSP, DCSI and group requirements
  • Assist Client and Community Engagement Manager with scheduling and planning of support and recreation activities.

You will ideally have:

  • Tertiary level education in relevant discipline – Social Science, Community Support, Disability Services, Aged Care.
  • Demonstrated relevant workplace experience.
  • Driver’s Licence
  • Highly developed community development skills
  • High level of written and verbal communication skills
  • Mature outlook and caring, responsive manner
  • Organised and self-motivated
  • Able to work autonomously
  • Current employment screenings (or willingness to undergo)
  • Willingness to provide evidence of COVID-19 Vaccination

Please ensure you have read the Position Description provided and addressed the key criteria in your covering letter.

If you are willing to bring your passion and expertise to a fast-paced, challenging and dynamic organisation apply now!

title: ACCC/AER 2023 Graduate Program (EA2022/1)
description:
• Join a Federal Government agency that has a great reputation
• Varied work
• Be part of projects that make a positive difference

Is the ACCC/AER Graduate Program on your wish list?

Congratulations! It’s time for you to start thinking about your career options for 2023 - you’re probably spending some time looking at all the major employers in the graduate market. Have you thought about working at the ACCC/AER?

The ACCC is an independent statutory authority that administers the Competition and Consumer Act 2010 and other Acts.

The ACCC works to promote effective competition and fair trading in the marketplace to benefit consumers, business and the community, and efficiency in the delivery of certain infrastructure services.

The ACCC shares staff, resources and facilities with the Australian Energy Regulator (AER). The AER is staffed by ACCC employees, but operates as a separate legal entity and has its own board. As well as other duties, the AER is responsible for the economic regulation of the wholesale electricity market and gas transmission networks.

Why the ACCC and AER?

The ACCC/AER is a great place to work because:

  • we have a great reputation and we are highly regarded for the work we do;
  • we have the opportunity to work on lots of different, exciting matters;
  • we can see the difference we are making in the Australian community, particularly through high-profile matters such as the NBN, electricity pricing, product safety financial services, digital platforms, the dairy industry, criminal cartels, consumer data and more;
  • we have a culture that encourages continuous development and diversity and employees who are highly engaged and passionate about what we do.

If you have tertiary qualifications, we believe you could be a good fit within the ACCC/AER and we’d encourage you to apply. This could be from any discipline, for example:

  • Arts and design
  • Business and government
  • Communications, public-relations and media
  • Data analysis and statistics
  • Economics
  • Education and social work
  • Finance and accounting
  • IT, computer science and technology
  • Law
  • Mathematics and engineering
  • Medicine, health and psychology
  • Science and humanities

Joining the ACCC/AER as a graduate, you can expect:

  • $64,616 per annum from 6 February 2023, advancing to $68,096 per annum from mid-May 2023, $73,978 in November 2023 and $82,511 upon successful completion of the program in June 2024.
  • challenging rotations across various Divisions
  • ongoing learning and development opportunities
  • flexible working conditions, including the ability to work part-time (minimum 30 hours per week) regular opportunities to network, socialise, share experiences and develop relationships;
  • an entry level program coordinator and assigned buddy;
  • a workplace that promotes diversity, inclusion and equal opportunity.

Want even more benefits?

In addition to the benefits of the graduate program, as an ongoing employee of the ACCC/AER you will also be eligible for:

  • an attractive remuneration package, including a base salary + 15.4% superannuation and annual salary reviews;
  • excellent leave benefits, including four weeks of annual leave and sick leave per year (pro-rated for part time employees), the opportunity to purchase additional annual leave and paid parental leave (after a qualifying period);
  • flexible working conditions, including options to work part-time and access to our flex scheme; and
  • ongoing career development, including chances to work in different ACCC/AER offices, opportunities for advancement and mobility within the organisation, formal and on-the job training programs and possibilities to participate in secondments with other APS agencies.

Need to know more?

Check out our Graduate Opportunities page for more information, including testimonies from some of our recent graduates.

How can you get involved?

We thought you’d never ask! Applications for our 2023 graduate program are now open. To find out more information about the ACCC/AER Graduate Program, our eligibility criteria and what we expect from our graduates, please download our candidate kit. The candidate kit will also provide you with information about the recruitment and selection process for the 2023 program.

Applications close 10 pm (AEST) Sunday 29 May 2022 . Assessment centres will take place in June, with offers made to successful applicants from August 2022.

Know someone who might be interested in a spot in our 2023 Graduate Program? Share this page with them – you never know, you might make their career!

title: Junior Salesforce Developer
description:
Junior Salesforce Developer

  • Exciting opportunity for an enthusiastic developer keen to evolve their skills
  • CBD fringe location with salary packaging
  • Work with Australia's leading cancer charity

About the company

Cancer Council SA’s vision is a cancer free future . Every minute, every hour, every day, we’re getting closer through impactful research, the delivery of cancer prevention activities, education and advocacy programs and providing support to people affected by cancer right here in South Australia.

Cancer Council is the only charity to help people from the point of diagnosis through to treatment and survivorship. We are proud to have served the community for over 90 years and have an enviable reputation as one of South Australia’s most trusted charities.

Role overview

Reporting directly to the Manager, Information Systems & Security and working closely with the CRM Administrator you will primarily be responsible for the delivery, with support from a 3rd party Salesforce vendor, of sound, sustainable and documented Salesforce CRM enhancements and defect triage for our staff, clients, donors and volunteers to improve our use cases and support our mission.

There will be a formal training program for this role which will include appropriate Salesforce administration and development courses and self-paced learning. Time will be provided to attend courses and to undertake course preparation.

This role will work closely with the CRM Administrator to ensure that any development of enhancements by this role or by 3rd party vendors are designed, documented and understood before acceptance by business users.

Key accountabilities

  • Provide support and troubleshoot and resolve bugs and defects with salesforce platform and systems connected to it
  • Follow best practice methodologies to implement technical solutions; develop and innovate on the Salesforce platform
  • Take a holistic view of developments and consider current and potential future interdependencies to avoid technical debt
  • Provide technical advice to the wider business and generally help to lift Salesforce capability
  • Lead and/or assist in the testing of 3rd party development of the Salesforce platform or applications adding data to Salesforce.
  • Develop dashboards, lists and reporting solutions to ensure stakeholders have the information required to make decisions or create actionable items.
  • Work closely with stakeholders across Cancer Council SA to understand processes and implement solutions that enable enhanced user experiences.

Skills, knowledge and experience

Essential
• A degree in Computer Science or related IT field or relevant Salesforce/Software development experience
• Proficient in at least 1 object oriented programming language (e.g. Java, C#) and a query language (e.g. SQL)
• Technical understanding of algorithms, systems architecture and end-user experience.
• Independent, self-motivated and a fast learner
• Results driven and willingness to work in fast-paced environments
• Great communication skills, approachable and a team player

Desirable
• Experience and/or certifications in Salesforce (CRM)
• Understanding or experience HTML/CSS/JavaScript or Integration/WebServices
• Experience with Power BI – new generation analyst reporting tool.
• Experience in SQL including experience in SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) & SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)

Special conditions

  • The successful applicant must be a non-smoker.
  • Intra/inter-state travel, out of hours and weekend work may be required
  • At times planned or emergency work may need to be carried out outside of normal work times.
  • The position requires on call support outside of business hours including weekends and public holidays when providing back up support to the Manager Information Systems & Security. (4 weeks per year)
  • Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory police check and may require a further Department of Human Services clearance.
  • All staff are required to be fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine approved by the Therapeutic Goods Administration or have an exemption that has been endorsed by the Chief Public Health Officer or their delegate.

For more information, please contact Michael Hutchesson on 08 8291 4136 or view the position description.

Applications close at 5pm, Thursday 2 June 2022.

With respect, no recruitment agencies please.

Cancer Council SA promotes and values diversity, applicants from diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

As an organisation, Cancer Council SA are committed to creating a safe workforce for all.

Cancer Council SA employees have been trained by Rosemary Wanganeen in Bi-Cultural Awareness, Safety and Inclusion and we welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

title: Positive Behaviour Support Practitioner
description:
Join our awesome tribe of allied health and disability professionals working 100% from home with flexible hours to suit your lifestyle!

  • Competitive salary with flexible working arrangements
  • Career development and advancement opportunities
  • Growing organisation with a fantastic work culture

Who We Are

One Tribe Australia is a modern and progressive registered NDIS provider specialising in mental health, intellectual disability and neurodiversity. We have a steadfast belief in the unique and amazing capabilities of each and every person we support and we place a strong focus on advocating for social inclusion and social justice.  We also invest in our people and have a friendly and open culture that encourages new ideas and creativity.

About The Role

We recently gained NDIS registration to provide positive behaviour support services so we are seeking an exceptional Behaviour Support Practitioner to join our allied health team and become an integral part of our expansion. This is a unique and exciting time to join a growing organisation where you will have the opportunity to help shape our current service delivery and create your perfect role.

The Behaviour Support Practitioner will undertake the following activities:

  • Develop and implement behaviour support plans and functional behaviour assessments
  • Identify, report and monitor restrictive practices
  • Provide direct therapeutic and behaviour interventions and post-incident support
  • Work collaboratively with participants, families, informal supports and external providers
  • Lead, mentor and facilitate skill development within the service
  • Participate in the strategic direction of the organisation
  • Identify and implement strategies to influence positive change within our industry

This role is also available on a part time basis.

Key Selection Criteria

  • Tertiary qualifications in allied health eg Developmental Education, Social Work, Psychology, Behavioural Science or related discipline
  • Assessed as Core Practitioner or above against the PBS capability framework
  • A strong understanding of the NDIS and Practice Standards
  • At least two years experience providing positive behaviour support services
  • Proven experience working with people living with complex disability
  • Thorough understanding of intellectual disability, neurodiversity, mental health and trauma
  • Demonstrated ability to utilise data collection tools, collate information and analyse and prepare reports
  • Excellent time management and organisational skills with ability to prioritise key demands
  • Assess service delivery risks and implement risk mitigation strategies
  • Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work autonomously and as part of a team
  • Demonstrated management skills and vision for future growth are highly desirable
  • Valid driving licence and willingness to use own vehicle for travel
  • NDIS worker screening, DHS Working with Children and Criminal History Check (or willingness to obtain)

What We Can Offer

  • Work from home for a rapidly growing and passionate organisation with a strong commitment to our tribe
  • A fantastic multi-disciplinary team of allied health professionals and disability specialists
  • Regular support from our Clinical Consultant and Behaviour Support Practitioner
  • Career development and advancement opportunities
  • Reward and recognition at work celebrating achievements year round
  • Excellent remuneration with realistic KPI’s and a bonus scheme for high performance
  • Training subsidy to gain a Certificate IV in Leadership and Management or towards further post graduate university study in Positive Behaviour Support

How to apply

Please submit your application including a copy of your CV and a cover letter outlining what interests you about the position and addressing the designated criteria.

Please note that interviews will be conducted as appropriate applications are received. To assist with preparations for the interview, shortlisted candidates will be provided with interview questions in advance. Should the right applicant be found prior to the expiration of the advertisement, no further interviews will be arranged.

Applications close at 5pm on Tuesday 31 May 2022.

title: Software Developer (Junior) – Defence
description:
SYPAQ is an industry leader in C4ISR and autonomous systems integration, product and software development, and consulting services, with established engineering teams across projects in Canberra, Melbourne, Adelaide, Sydney and Brisbane. Our rich history of partnering with the Australian Defence and National Security community continues to deliver a true sovereign industrial capability through advanced engineering and technology services and solutions.

SYPAQ currently has multiple long term Defence opportunities to join our existing Team of Software Developers, with all of these roles based in Adelaide. These positions will see you assist the Joint & Operations Analysis Division (JOAD) in research and continued development of prototype applications in support of operational decision making within Defence Joint Force Headquarters.

These prototypes use cloud-native approaches comprising of a microservice architectural style, containerisation and DevSecOps pipelines to compose applications dynamically. These prototypes will inform requirements and architectural considerations for Joint Projects and wider Defence as part of risk reduction and demonstration activities.

The prototype is developed using Spring Boot, PostGIS and Elastic for data storage. The user interface is developed through web components and utilises frameworks such as Angular, React and OpenLayers. The team use Red Hat OpenShift for on-premises deployment and also utilise Microsoft Azure for cloud based R&D.

In order to apply, applicants must be eligible to hold a Defence Security Clearance, be an Australian Citizen and demonstrate the following:
  • Proficiency in programming using Java
  • Proficiency in developing web applications with JavaScript frameworks e.g. React, Angular or Similar

Exposure to and/or experience with one or more is of advantage:
  • Geospatial servers and mapping libraries e.g. GeoServer, ArcGIS, OpenLayers, Cesium or similar
  • Infrastructure automation and virtualisation e.g. Terraform, Ansible or similar
  • Serverless technologies e.g. OpenFAAS, Knative, AWS Lambda, Azure Functions
  • Monitoring and observability tools and dashboards e.g. Dynatrace, Splunk, Grafana, Prometheus or similar
  • Linux operating systems

About you
  • Tertiary qualifications in Engineering, Science or Information Technology
  • Australian Citizen
  • Ability to hold and maintain a Defence security clearance NV1
  • Ability to work in a team or independently


Please follow the links to apply direct, for a confidential discussion contact Mark Pengilly on 0419 814 728 or email: MPengilly@SYPAQ.com.au . Visit our corporate website for other opportunities with SYPAQ www.sypaq.com.au/careers-portal

SYPAQ’s Culture
We take pride in being a 100% Australian family owned business delivering world leading solutions to our clients locally and internationally. Our culture and values are important to us, hence we encourage people with the same vision to discuss how we can jointly achieve your personal and professional goals as part of our team.
We strongly believe in our VALUES, they underpin everything we do:
  • See something. Do something!
  • Achieve more together – share success.
  • Be Courageous – be innovative! See the opportunity, manage the risk.
  • Strive for excellence – master your craft.
  • We are family – we value honesty, respect, and compassion.

Staff Benefits
  • Generous professional development and study options
  • Loyalty leave scheme
  • ADF reserve leave
  • Flexible work arrangements
  • Referral bonuses
  • Salary sacrifice and novated leasing

Queensland License: LHL02458-W2B3Z
Victorian License: LHL 03075
ACT License: LHL 00000102

title: Industrial Radiographer
description:
12 month minimum contract Research into using Xrays to detect defects in Defences explosive weapons.

  • Requires Industrial Radiography Level 2 certification and Australian Citizenship essential (for security Clearances)
  • $ Based on Experience
  • Edinburgh South Australia

Your Next Employer...

You'll be working with the R&D department for the Department of Defence (Defence Science Technology Group, DTSG) in Edinburgh. DSTG is currently supporting research into guided weapons prototyping.

The Role...

The Radiographer will, under direction, undertake the following major duties:

1. Develop item specific radiographic inspection specifications.

2. Conduct/lead radiographic inspection of EO, identify and interpret defects and assess these against an agreed defect criteria.

3. Develop new radiographic inspection processes/facilities (consisting of radiographic system specifications, image acquisition, radiographic equipment, image analysis and facility design and commissioning).

4. Assist in the development of radiographic data acquisition aspects of experiments and trials design, and assist in developing trials plans and other documentation

5. Management of radiographic equipment and facilities as appropriate to maintain and develop capabilities

6. Provide radiography and radiation safety subject matter advice and expertise.

You will IDEALLY have

Demonstrated experience, knowledge & skills in the following areas:

1. Radiographic testing and interpretation of x-ray images to identify components.

2. Identify assembly and EO defects from X-ray images.

3. Ionising radiation safety procedures

4. Safe working practices in workshops, laboratories, or processing facilities.

5. Safe handling of hazardous materials, and particularly the hazards associated with handling explosive materials.

6. Preparation of and compliance with safety documentation including process instructions and risk assessments

7. Industrial Radiography Level 2 certification (essential)

8. Industrial Radiography level 3 certification (desirable)

To be an Australian Citizen (ESSENTIAL)

For more information, call Soyuz on 03 9573 1500

title: Online Quality Control
description:
About us:

Mexex was originally established in 1991 as a Mexican commissary and has since grown into an industry leading food manufacturer, specialising in aseptic sauces and fillings. At Mexex we are passionate about creating healthy, quality food that we would serve our families and are proud to supply some of Australia’s leading brands.

The opportunity:

We are looking for a talented and passionate individual to join our team in Dudley Park.  As the Online Quality Control person, you will be assisting in implementing and monitoring all QA and QC systems for our busy food manufacturing business in Dudley Park.

The successful person will:

  • Ensure products meet all safety, quality regulatory and customer requirements and expectations.
  • To clearly communicate with the team and record required production data, temperature, batch codes, start and finish times.
  • Taste, visualize and compare reference product to current production to assist cooks.
  • Check Cooks job cards to ensure no issues with pH, Bostwick, brix, sending temperatures etc
  • Record on job cards and notify QA / R&D of any deviations or issues.
  • Hot fill CCP checks & QA Retention Pouches.
  • Assisting with traceability, VFFS label, seal and weight checks.
  • Retention samples – prepare labels, collect samples, segregate, store, manage and dispose
  • Perform daily GMP inspections, report findings and ensure suitable corrective actions are implemented in a timely manner
  • Monitor chemicals & consumables
  • Carry out & ensure calibrations of pH meter
  • Monitoring traceability
  • Assist in the creation and amendment of work instructions and training materials as part of continuous improvement.
  • Assist the QA Officer & Product Development Officer in investigating customer complaints, non-conformances and out of specification product.
  • Assist QA Department with verification activities.
  • To ensure compliance with all food safety, quality and regulatory requirements, as detailed in the Quality Manual.
  • To promote good communication between all team members

Skills and experience

  • Degree in Food Science and Technology or equivalent
  • Minimum 3 years' experience in food industry or a degree in Food Science and Technology or equivalent
  • Have thorough understanding of GMP and HACCP
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Reliable car and licence
  • Ability to work autonomously and is self-motivated

You will be a key member of the quality team ensuring that all quality standards are upheld at all times and that all manufacturing practices are compliant with best practice food safety standards.

If you are looking to embrace a challenge within a supportive environment and believe that you can add value to our team, please click the "Apply Now" button to submit your application.

title: Senior Social Planner - Wellbeing
description:
Who we are:

The City of Salisbury is the second largest council in South Australia by population with over

140,000 residents spanning an area of 16,000 hectares across the northern suburbs of Adelaide. Our vision is to be a progressive, sustainable and connected community.

Our community is diverse and growing and our future is exciting. Understanding our demographics and residents, our strengths and challenges, is critically important to framing and influencing organisational approaches to ensure we have a strong and vibrant community.

Our values (ReACH) of Respect, Accountability, Collaboration and Helpfulness underpin our culture and reflects an aspiration to be a great place to work and an organisation respected by its community for achieving valued outcomes.

The role:

The Senior Social Planner - Wellbeing works as part of an integrated team leading important initiatives aimed at strengthening our community. The role leads the development of innovative responses and creating positive relationships and partnerships to support an improved quality of life for the Salisbury community.

The Senior Social Planner will influence significant community impact by both leading specific social policy initiatives as well as working within a high performing team with shared objectives.

A key area of responsibility will be to lead the City's approach to community wellbeing. Working across the organisation, the Senior Social Planner - Wellbeing will lead and drive a range of initiatives aimed at improving quality of life outcomes, ranging from physical inactivity to social isolation.

This exciting and critical role will be integral to shaping the future of the City and will have an opportunity to influence at an enterprise and community level.

Who you are:

Our ideal candidate will have a passion for great community outcomes and a belief in evidence-based approaches. They will also have the enthusiasm and skills to navigate complex environments.

  • Tertiary qualifications and experience in a relevant Social Science field.
  • Experience in leading organisational wide strategies that influence and deliver 'step change' impact.
  • Experience in undertaking complex research projects, the preparation of reports and submissions, and the use of data to inform decision making.
  • Experience in project management and project delivery.
  • Experience in stakeholder management and developing partnerships.
  • Sound knowledge of the major social issues, policy, programming and roles facing Government, communities and the `non-Government sector.

Respect, accountability, collaboration and helpfulness should be values that align with the way you work and your interactions whilst meaningful impact should be your personal measure.

What's in it for you?

This is a great opportunity to be a part of the City of Salisbury's future where you can learn, teach, experience, influence and create.

Our state-of-the-art office forms the heart of Salisbury's city, underpinned by a major redevelopment of the City centre. We have a strong focus on personal development, provide a flexible working environment, and are committed to doing things better through our significant investment in business transformation.  Our City is unique and diverse providing a range of opportunities for you to ply your craft and make a difference.

Further information is available by accessing the Position Description .

Specific enquiries can be made to Andrew Hamilton on 0403 002 732 .

Applications close at 5.00pm, Monday 23 May 2022.

Specific enquiries can be made to Andrew Hamilton on 0403 002 732 .

Applications close at 5.00pm, Monday 23 May 2022.

title: Research Officer
description:
(HE05) $72832.00-$80983.00 per annum plus an employer contribution of up to 17% superannuation may apply

2 year fixed term position available immediately

An exciting opportunity for a Research Officer to join the Department of Chemistry in the School of Physical Sciences as part of the newly established Faculty of Sciences, Engineering and Technology.  Join a vibrant research team led by Prof Greg Metha to develop an exciting renewable energy technology to drive decarbonisation of industry.

We are seeking an enthusiastic and motivated researcher, whose research in the laboratory will be focussed on the development of photocatalysis technologies for water splitting to produce hydrogen.

The successful candidate will work under routine supervision whilst undertaking research characterisation and performance measurements for an industry funded project progressing photocatalytic water-splitting technology to produce hydrogen.   The successful candidate will also develop testing procedures, prepare reports, maintain records and provide administrative support to the project.

To be successful you will need:

  • Proficiency in using instrumentation for chemical analysis and testing, as well as general software (e.g. Microsoft Office) and bespoke software for data analysis (e.g. Origin, MATLAB).
  • Ability to work productively and harmoniously in a team environment, and willingness to help others achieve project/experimental objectives.
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret and analyse data.
  • Ability to work well under pressure to meet deadlines and an ability to prioritise tasks.
  • Ability to communicate effectively, seek understanding and ask questions to clarify meaning.

The ability to develop software-to-hardware interfaces (e.g LabView coding) will be highly desirable.

Enjoy an outstanding career environment

The University of Adelaide is a uniquely rewarding workplace. The size, breadth and quality of our education and research programs - including significant industry, government and community collaborations - offers you vast scope and opportunity for a long, fulfilling career.

It also enables us to attract high-calibre people in all facets of our operations, ensuring you will be surrounded by talented colleagues, many world-leading. Our work's cutting-edge nature - not just in your own area, but across virtually the full spectrum of human endeavour - provides a constant source of inspiration.

Our culture is one that welcomes all and embraces diversity consistent with our Staff Values and Behaviour Framework and our Values of integrity, respect, collegiality, excellence and discovery. We firmly believe that our people are our most valuable asset, so we work to grow and diversify the skills, knowledge and capability of all our staff.

We embrace flexibility as a key principle to allow our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal and family life.

In addition, we offer a wide range of attractive staff benefits. These include: salary packaging; flexible work arrangements; high-quality professional development programs and activities; and an on-campus health clinic, gym and other fitness facilities.

Learn more at: adelaide.edu.au/jobs

Your faculty's broader role

The Faculty of Sciences, Engineering and Technology is a multidisciplinary hub of cutting-edge teaching and research. Many of its academic staff are world leaders in their fields and graduates are highly regarded by employers. The Faculty actively partners with innovative industries to solve problems of global significance.

Learn more at: set.adelaide.edu.au

If you have the talent, we'll give you the opportunity. Together, let's make history.

Click on the link below to view the position description and to apply for this opportunity.

https://careers.adelaide.edu.au/cw/en/job/509160/research-officer

Please ensure you submit a cover letter, resume, and upload a document that includes your responses to all of the selection criteria for the position as contained in the position description or selection criteria document.

Applications close 11:55pm, 24 May 2022.

For further information

For a confidential discussion regarding this position, contact:

Greg Metha
Professor of Chemistry, Sciences, Engineering & Technology
P: +61 (8) 313 5943
E: gregory.metha@adelaide.edu.au

The University of Adelaide is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people who meet the requirements of this position are strongly encouraged to apply.

#LI-UOA

title: Site Operations Manager - Darwin
description:
• Leading FMCG organisation
  • Hands on operational leadership role
  • Darwin Based - Relocation Package on offer for the right candidate

At Goodman Fielder our purpose is to make everyday food better for everyone. We own a host of iconic brands that generations of Australians have grown up with and put in their supermarket trolleys every week, including Helga's, Wonder White, Praise, White Wings, Meadow Lea, La Famiglia and many more.

At Goodman Fielder our aspiration is to be the leading integrated food business in the region. We are a team that believes that anything is possible. A team that understands our business and focuses on the right things that make the biggest difference and one that considers our end to end value chain when making decisions to optimize our business. We drive change as an opportunity for us to innovate and transform our business and to achieve beyond what we think is possible.

About the Opportunity:

Due to an internal promotion, we are now looking for an influential and passionate Operations Manager to lead the team at our Darwin baking facility. This is a key role requiring a leader who will build team capability whilst also driving process excellence to be best in class. The facility manufactures and distributes some of our most trusted brands.

You will be responsible for:

  • Leading the Site Leadership Team to deliver the strategy and aspiration with a continuous improvement focus
  • Develop people-centred culture with a focus on the growth and development of the team
  • Ensure all improvement projects are geared to delivering the production, safety and quality objectives
  • Develop a culture of safety and quality, implementing HSE & quality standards to ensure a safe workplace with a focus on quality, to deliver sustainable operations
  • Deliver and beat financial objectives and overall site performance measures
  • Set and deliver on clear expectations and goals for all members of the site team that are aligned with the objectives of the strategic plan and the sites objectives
  • Develop a data-driven decision making process that is aligned to the objectives
  • Lead from the front, setting safety, environmental, quality and behavioural expectations

To be successful in this role you will need:

  • Tertiary qualification in engineering, food science or business management
  • 3+ years in an operational leadership role
  • Experience in FMCG business
  • Experience with continuous high-speed processing and packaging equipment in a bakery or industrial food production environment or relevant experience in daily fresh environment
  • Experience in leading Enterprise Agreement negotiations
  • Proven ability to drive a positive and results oriented culture

What can we offer you?

With operations sites spanning across Australia, working as part of a highly driven team at Goodman Fielder, you can expect the opportunity to build your own home grown career across functions, locations and brands. This role offers valuable insight into daily fresh, made to order production which will challenge and develop you professionally and personally.

At Goodman Fielder, we aim to be a destination employer in the food industry where we don't just offer jobs - we offer long term careers.

For more information about us or to learn about other roles available at Goodman Fielder, please visit our careers page and register your details so that we can notify you of jobs which interest you.

What are you waiting for? Apply now.

title: IT Graduate Program 2023
description:
Are you ready to kickstart your innovation and technology career with one of Australia’s most innovative companies?

SA Power Networks delivers energy solutions to empower South Australia today and in the future. We are always seeking to build a more sustainable, efficient and innovative business that creates real value for our customers.

As one of the State’s largest employers, we have a commitment to integrity and take pride in doing the right thing for our people, customers and community.

Progress your career and help us in empowering South Australia.

We offer award-winning training, an outstanding culture of safety and a supportive environment that encourages you to contribute and recognise your achievements.

Empowering opportunities for Innovation and Technology graduates

We are seeking Innovation and Technology (IT) graduates to join our Graduate Development Program, commencing in February 2023.

Our Graduate Development Program is a two-year fixed term contract where you will have the opportunity to join one of the State’s largest, industry-leading IT teams, offering unmatched opportunities for professional and personal development across our business.

The program includes structured rotations within Innovation and Technology, technical training and experience, mentoring, ongoing support and real career opportunities.

About you:

  • You love to learn and apply new skills in innovative ways
  • You enjoy problem solving with data
  • You have a passion for emerging technologies
  • You are a great communicator and can translate complex solutions to stakeholders
  • You are excited to learn a variety of disciplines, including: project management, automation, Microsoft, SAP, IT operations, cyber security, user experience design and more

To be eligible, you will need to:

  • Have completed your degree or be graduating at the end 2022
  • Be an Australian citizen or permanent resident
  • Be prepared to undertake a pre-employment medical

We are particularly interested in receiving applications from graduates who have specialised in Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Analytics, Information Technology, Cyber Security or similar.

What we offer:

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. The benefits we offer our employees will allow you to be your best every day. They include:

  • Mentoring opportunities to increase your knowledge and business networks
  • Technical training and experience, including your participation in our graduate rotation
  • Unlimited potential to grow your career
  • Exposure to world-leading projects in digital transformation and future energy
  • Very completive salary package with access to flexible working conditions

Candidates will need to be prepared to undertake a pre-employment medical. Applicants must be Australian citizens or Permanent Residents to apply.

For further information on our graduate program go to https://www.sapowernetworks.com.au/about-us/careers/our-programs/

Or email recruitment@sapowernetworks.com.au

title: Graduate Officer
description:
Are you a recent or soon-to-be graduate looking to start your professional career in one of South Australia’s most diverse departments? The Department of Human Services (DHS) is now recruiting for the 2022 mid-year Graduate Program. We are looking for talented graduates who share our mission to make a difference in the lives of South Australian individuals, families and communities.

DHS offers a dynamic and inclusive work environment. We are seeking graduates to be employed over a 12-month program, where you will have the opportunities to participate in a range of diverse projects drawing on the key skills acquired through your degree. You may have the opportunity to rotate across business areas to learn about different functions of the department. You will work on developing and implementing a range of policies and services designed to support either our frontline staff, or in turn some of the most vulnerable people within the community.

Successful applicants will be able to demonstrate an ability to complete research and analysis, strong written and verbal communication skills, problem solving, time management skills, attention to detail and the ability to interact with a range of software applications.

Graduate Officers will participate in a structured calendar of induction, professional development and mentoring sessions.

Graduate opportunities are provided across Adelaide metropolitan areas and the CBD; some travel between office locations may be required.

Employment will commence in August 2022 and will be for 12 months with the possibility of further employment. Attractive working conditions apply.

To be eligible to register for the program:
You will either have completed a minimum three-year degree within the last three years (2019-2021 ), or will complete your degree by July 2022 from a registered university in one of the following career streams:

  • Behavioural sciences / Social Sciences
  • Communications
  • Computer Science / Data and Statistics
  • Economics / Health Economics / Population Science
  • Social Policy / Public Policy
  • Human Resources
  • Commerce / Business
  • Law / Legal Studies
  • Psychology
  • Social work

You must be an Australian citizen or legally entitled to work in Australia.

How to apply:
You will be required to attach a 1-2 page cover letter addressing the role specific capabilities (see Role Description) using examples from your work, studies, or volunteering. You are also asked to provide three referees in your current resume.

You will be asked to select a primary career stream that you are applying for during the application process. If you are interested to apply for more than one career streams, please indicate in your cover letter.

Special Conditions:
National Police Check required.
Employment-related Screening Check required.
Some out of hours work may be required.
Some interstate and intrastate travel may be required.
Multiple Vacancies.

Additional Information: You are required to submit a cover letter, up to a maximum of 2 pages, addressing the role specific capabilities (see Role Description) using examples from your work, study or volunteering. You are also asked to provide three referees in your current resume, and attach your resume via the online application form. For further information and how to apply for this role please visit our DHS website www.dhs.sa.gov.au/careers

Enquiries to: Wendy Liu (08) 8207 0671 Email: wendy.liu@sa.gov.au

Vacancy ID:  484561

Applications close:  30/05/2022

title: C++ Engineer
description:
Actively looking for a highly skilled C++ Engineer (ideally with minimum 2+ years of experience) for a Defence software tech partner , currently delivering a cutting-edge software solution within DST Group Edinburgh .

The successful applicant will form part of an existing high-performance engineering team, contributing to all aspects of the software development life cycle. Will enjoy a variety of innovative and exciting projects that have real impact, in real time. These innovative projects are in early stages of research and development, with many opportunities to make a difference.

The project seeks to improve access to a library of recorded data using web technologies, to support future analysis and studies. Aspects of this project will require database management and system deployment expertise, with future opportunities in machine learning.

Experience & Qualifications
  • Mandatory – Holding an Australian Citizenship & be willing to obtain an AGSVA security clearance - Baseline, NV1, or NV2
  • Mandatory – Proven programming experience with C++ (or Python)
  • Intermediate SQL knowledge
  • Effective communication skills across teams and stakeholders
  • Degree in software engineering, computer science, computer systems engineering, or related discipline
Desirable:
  • Understanding of Agile/Scrum methodologies
  • Experience with Django framework
  • Experience with Linux or containerised environments
What is on offer?
  • Bases salary of $60-150k plus super per annum (dependent on experience)
  • Exposure to unique Defence projects and rewarding work that will have a real impact
  • Work with some of Australia’s brightest minds

title: Cloud Engineer
company: Cognizant Technology Solutions Australia Pty Ltd
description:
About Cognizant

Cognizant (NASDAQ: CTSH) is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. Headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey (U.S.), Cognizant combines a passion for client satisfaction, technology innovation, deep industry and business process expertise, and a global, collaborative workforce that embodies the future of work. Cognizant is a member of the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500, the Forbes Global 2000, and the Fortune 500 and is ranked among the top performing and fastest growing companies in the world.

Our Culture

Your passion, integrity and experience are integral to Cognizant's success. You will be welcomed into a dynamic and expanding global leader in IT and Business consultancy where you will be valued for who you are. We take pride in our partnership with our clients, so your ability to add value and provide exceptional service to our clients are fundamental to your success. In return, you will be empowered with opportunities to develop your career and collaborate with talented colleagues in a supportive, diverse environment.

At Cognizant we recognize that companies that are open and welcoming to a multi - cultural diverse workforce will thrive with fresh perspectives and collaborative knowledge. Cognizant is focused on promoting & increasing gender diversity and providing a workplace which encourages great participation and an equal playing field, where merit and accomplishment are the only criteria for success.

Required Skills

  • Required strong experience in cloud infrastructure engineering on AWS or Azure
  • Experience with Cloud Automation Development Tool such as Gitlab CI/CD, Terraform Cloud/Enterprise, Ansible, AWS Cloud formation, Azure DevOps, Python/Bash/ Power shell Scripting
  • AWS containerization experience
  • Knowledge of Agile/Iterative development, test-driven development
  • Mastery of collaborative software development using Git, Jira, Confluence
  • Experience implementing best practice Cybersecurity controls in cloud environments and CI/CD pipeline
  • Experience in working with multi-cultural, diverse and virtual across different time zones
  • Highly Desirable: Previous Experience in one or more Infrastructure or Application Development domain such as: Network Engineering, IaaS Engineering, DevSecOps, Automation Tools Engineering, Web Application Development, Mobile Application Development, Data Science

Responsibilities

  • Engage with customers to provide consultation and guidance with architecture, design and implementation of Cloud Services
  • Develop and implement re-usable cloud Infrastructure modules and templates using Dev SecOps practices (Infrastructure as Code, CI/CD, Agile Work Methods, Policy-as-code, secure by design)
  • Deploy and modify existing templates to deliver production grade Cloud Infrastructure for consumers of the service
  • Contribute to architecture and design processes to ensure new services and solutions meet stakeholder requirements and expectations

Next steps

If you feel this opportunity suits you, or Cognizant is the type of organization you would like to join, we want to have a conversation with you! Please apply directly with us. #LI-GC1COGTAG

For a complete list of open opportunities with Cognizant, visit http://www.cognizant.com/careers

Cognizant is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities. Successful candidates will be required to undergo a background check.

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
About Us

Bridgestone is a global leader in sustainable mobility and advanced solutions, providing products, services and solutions for a world in motion. We have a long-held tradition of excellence supported by a commitment to offer the highest quality products and services to all customers. Through our mission of "Serving Society with Superior Quality" Bridgestone strives to be a company trusted by the community and valued by its employees.

About the role

Reporting directly to the SAP Business Applications Manager, you will work closely with the Business Systems team to provide high levels of customer service to the company’s end users. Your key responsibilities will include interpreting, analysing and documenting business reporting requirements, identifying solutions to fulfil business needs and developing solutions to contribute to the continuous improvement of business processes and procedures primarily focused on SAP ERP and SAP BW systems. You will also be responsible for designing specification documents, writing test cases, processing and implementing change requests and assisting management with the implementation of various systems projects as required.

About you

This is an excellent opportunity to build on your prior business analyst experience with a multi-national organisation. This role offers broad scope and will require exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities, coupled with high-level written and oral communication skills. Your flexibility, initiative and outstanding ability to develop and maintain relationships at all levels will add further to your success.

  • Tertiary qualifications in IT, Computer Science or a Business related discipline are highly desirable.
  • Experience in Data Modelling with SAP BW and business reporting within SAP Business Objects will be very well regarded.

This is an excellent opportunity for an enthusiastic, dynamic and proactive individual to join a National icon that provides exceptional working conditions and a positive and engaged organisational culture.

What we offer

The successful candidate will be rewarded with a competitive salary and staff discounts. You will also join a globally recognised company that values its employees. Working in a City Fringe location with your own undercover carpark.

To apply, please provide a Cover Letter and Resume quoting reference number: S21215

title: Animal Research Technician
description:
vivo Pharm is a contract research organisation (CRO) supporting the preclinical research needs of the biotechnology/pharmaceutical sectors, world-wide. It offers an extensive portfolio of contract services for preclinical drug development and clinical support including efficacy testing, safety and toxicology of new therapeutic drugs and bio‑analytical services with operations in Australia, North America and Europe.

An opportunity exists for a skilled and experienced Animal Research Assistant to join our in vivo toxicology team in South Australia. The successful applicant will be an independent, efficient, and self-motivated individual capable of working to time-sensitive deadlines while maintaining industry standards in accordance with Good Laboratory Practice (GLP), international regulatory guidelines, and vivo Pharm's quality system.

Duties and Responsibilities

The Animal Technician role is primarily responsible for the daily care of animals in accordance with applicable laws and regulations. Duties include experimental work ( in vivo ), data acquisition in accordance to established procedures, maintaining equipment and animal housing areas according to standard operating procedures (SOPs) and in compliance with regulatory requirements (Australian Code of Practice), documenting activities and maintaining records such as animal health surveillance, feed logs, temperature/humidity charts, animal receipt, and disposition logs.

Specific duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Monitor and ensure availability of animal care supplies, food, bedding, chemical supplies, and equipment.
  • Maintain animal rooms, equipment, and facility in a clean and organised manner.
  • Comply with applicable regulations, policies, and standards for the humane care and use of laboratory animals.
  • Recognize and report animal health and welfare conditions that are at variance from normal.
  • Identify and report signs of animal illness, injury, and other abnormalities to appropriate personnel.
  • Handle animals and perform procedures including injections (s.c., i.p., i.v.) blood collection, necropsy, organ and sample collection and tumor inoculation.
  • Perform treatments and assist scientific staff as instructed.
  • Maintain accurate and legible documentation and records as needed (mainly electronic).
  • Good time management
  • Ability to solve problems as they arise.
  • Rotate with co-workers to coordinate routine team tasks over a 7-day week.
  • Participate in writing and updating pertinent SOPs.
  • Assist with training of co-workers to perform tasks according to SOPs.
  • Participate in on-the-job training required to develop new skills, learn new techniques, and implement new policies.
  • Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Experience and Qualifications

  • To be successful in the role, you should have a Diploma in Animal Technology or equivalent  with 2  years experience or an university degree.
  • Extensive experience with rodent handling.
  • Experience working in contract research, maintaining records in compliance with GLP, and infectious disease models would be an advantage.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Ability to follow oral and written instructions.
  • Demonstrated high level oral and written communication skills.
  • Possess the technical knowledge and expertise relevant to the position.
  • Collaborate with staff to maintain and develop procedures and guidelines, including providing advice and support to management.
  • Commitment to professional learning and growth for both self and others.
  • Clear understanding and knowledge of animal research and the methods, materials, equipment, and monitoring programs used in animal care activities.
  • Ability to follow departmental policies and SOPs in a reliable and safe manner.
  • Basic proficiency with digital technology, including Microsoft Office and iPhone or equivalent.
  • Enthusiasm for working in a team-based culture.
  • Respect and compassion for animals and others.
  • Enjoy working as part of a close team.
  • Familiar with the Australian Code for care and use of animals for scientific purposes
  • Experience with Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) or other similar databases

Working Conditions/Physical Demands

This position requires full mobility. This role may be exposed to dust, dirt, odours, laboratory animals, animal excreta, and warm and humid surroundings; Protective equipment including uniforms, close-toe shoes, masks, aprons, gloves and head covers are provided and required for specific activities.

The job involves the ability to wear personal protective equipment as required; includes protective clothing, protective glasses, safety shoes and gloves daily, face masks as required, push and pull heavy objects and ability to safely move and or lift heavy loads as per OH&S requirements.

Additional Information

  • Vaccinations may be required to meet the expectations of this role.
  • Tasks to be undertaken are of a physical and could be of repetitive nature.
  • Participation in a weekend and public holiday roster may be required.
  • This position is not suitable for individuals with existing allergic conditions.
  • Able to walk or stand for up to an entire eight-hour shift, excluding scheduled breaks. Able to perform repetitive motions over extended periods of time.
  • Able to perform in a workplace environment with exposure to animals, animal dander, animal by-products, and bedding materials for prolonged periods of time.

This position is a permanent full-time position.

Applications, which do not address the selection criteria may not be considered for the position.

Please note: The successful applicant must have rights to live and work in Australia

Remuneration is subject on qualifications and experience.

The position will be based at vivo Pharm's operation in Gilles Plains, South Australia.

Company

  • Australian company with domestic and international operations.

Benefits

  • Attractive basic salary.
  • Performance depending annual salary review.
  • Potential for individual growth and development as company expands

General enquiries can be directed to Lynne Clapham ( Lynne.clapham@vivopharm.com.au )

Applications should address the key selection criteria. Apply online or send cv with cover letter to hr@vivopharm.com

No Recruitment Agencies please

Note: Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted

You must have the right to live and work in this location to apply for this job.
