title: Laboratory Technician
description:
The Australian Wine Research Institute (AWRI) is the Australian grape and wine industry’s own research organisation. It supports a sustainable and successful grape and wine industry through world-class research, practical solutions and knowledge transfer. The AWRI has strong links with the wine industry and other research organisations both nationally and internationally and provides a stimulating and challenging work environment.

Applications are invited for a full-time position of Laboratory Technician at the AWRI within the Trace Analysis Laboratory as part of AWRI Commercial Services. The ideal candidate will have a degree in science with exposure to analytical chemistry techniques or equivalent commercial laboratory experience, be an excellent communicator and will need to work well within a busy team environment. Experience in gas chromatography (GC-MS, GC/MS/MS) and liquid chromatography (LC, LC/MS/MS) is highly desirable. AWRI Commercial Services is NATA ISO17025 accredited in the field of chemical testing and the laboratory is GLP recognised. Knowledge in these areas is preferred but not essential.

The laboratory performs a large range of analyses using various chromatographic techniques and analytical capabilities. The successful candidate will perform analysis of samples by GC/MS, GC/MS/MS, HPLC and LC/MS/MS, including sample preparation, sample extraction and data analysis. Support for fermentation projects and other non-routine experiments will also be required.

The role will be suitable for a graduate (preferably with honours) or a laboratory technician with one to two years’ laboratory experience. The ideal candidate will have a laboratory background in a commercial environment. Candidates should outline their experience with the relevant equipment as well as any experience within an accredited laboratory environment in their application.

For a position description please visit www.awri.com.au and for further information on the position please contact the Team Leader Trace Laboratory, Pamela Solomon ( pamela.solomon@awri.com.au ) or AWRICareers@awri.com.au

Applications should be completed via the online application form at http://www.awri.com.au by Friday, 13 May 2022. Only applications that are completed via the online application form will be considered. Please note applications will be reviewed as received. Candidates may be interviewed prior to the job closing date. We encourage candidates to apply as soon as possible. The AWRI reserves the right to close this application process early .

title: Survey Drafter
description:
Fyfe is a multi-disciplinary consultancy providing comprehensive engineering, environmental, planning, and surveying services throughout Australia. Fyfe work with a wide range of clients in the Energy & Resources, Infrastructure and Property sectors to provide high quality, commercially pragmatic solutions with a strong focus on client service and delivery.

As the successful applicant you will be an ambitious, proactive individual, with a strong interest in the survey industry and have demonstrated initiative. You will also have good experience in field practices and methodologies.

Key responsibilities:

  • Drafting Land Subdivision plans, Topographic Survey plans, Contour Maps, Feature Layout Plans, Set-Out and As-Constructed surveys, and Presentation drawings.
  • Compile and confirm field survey data
  • Survey Calculations

Key requirements:

  • Exposure to and a strong interest in the survey industry, with field experience
  • Certificate IV / Diploma in Spatial Science preferred
  • Competency in CAD and survey software (AutoCAD, TBC, Carlson, 12D or similar)
  • Strong time management and organisation skills
  • Ability to work with a group and also autonomously, with strong attention to detail
  • Flexible approach to work and work delivery and ability to work effectively with others

This is an excellent opportunity for a surveyor wanting to make the switch into the office, or for a survey drafter wanting to progress your career with a national engineering consultancy. Fyfe can offer an environment committed to workplace diversity with a team of dedicated and experienced professionals.

Culture

Fyfe values our clients and our people and has a culture built on respect, integrity and the delivery of value. This is achieved through a combination of flexible and contemporary working conditions supported by an inclusive management style which sees all levels of management being accessible through an open-door policy applicable to everyone. Fyfe has also engaged various corporate entities to offer benefits to staff, have a social club and encourage an innovative and pro-active approach to projects. With 14 offices nationally, staff are encouraged to tap into the wealth of knowledge that we have, welcoming information sharing and troubleshooting among colleagues.

Benefits

  • Professional career development; the company promotes talent within
  • Competitive Salary
  • Flexible working conditions and hours

How to apply

To discuss this position further, please contact SA Survey Manager Daniel Cooper on 0458 550 110 .

Follow us on LinkedIn to keep up to date with our news and projects.

title: Lead Technical Officer
description:
Founded by Jerry Stoller, over 50 years ago, Stoller has grown rapidly and now employs over 900 employees in more than 50 countries worldwide. Jerry’s desire to understand the genetic expression of plants, forged the foundation of Stoller and the business has continued to invest heavily in not only product research and development areas but equally on the people and culture. Stoller is a certified Great Place To Work® and achieving our certification verifies that we celebrate, encourage and support our people.

Stoller Australia manufactures high quality liquid fertilizers and specialty nutrient products that assist crops to reach their full potential. Stoller products are distributed through a network of dealers nationwide.

Stoller Australia has representatives and distributors throughout the country. Our team's detailed knowledge of plant physiology and advanced understanding of how crops respond to the environment, allows us to constantly innovate and develop our products. Our team undertake trials and demonstrations throughout the country to grow our understanding of how our products impact plant potential in a variety of conditions. Stoller employ skilled representatives who work nationwide with growers, agronomists and distributors. We share our detailed knowledge to assist growers in maximising yield potential.

The Lead Technical Officer assists in managing and leading the technical team and to ensure an advanced level of technical and product support is provided to customers, dealers, technical staff and territory managers.

Key Responsibilities

  • Planning to maximise efficiencies and to ensure deadlines are achieved
  • Organising and monitoring department priorities
  • Ensuring the team is achieving required standards of performance, including quality of work performed and accurate completion of tasks
  • Supporting the team and sales departments to allow them to achieve a consistent high level of performance
  • Establishing, supporting and maintaining strong relationships with growers and dealers
  • Building and maintaining strong relationships with key internal customers
  • Adhering to business policies and procedures, including safe work practices
  • Create and deliver key presentations and support to the sales team
  • Face to face networking with up to 50% of the role conducted on road
  • Manage trial work including coordination of research data, application and delivery of results according to protocols
  • Develop trial protocols to ensure objectives, trial design, assessments and treatments are relevant to the research plan
  • Manage and provide tech support on technical content of published materials
  • Provide high level technical and administrative support to the Technical Manager
  • Manage the quality review of the compatibilities of Stoller products with each other and including commercial mixes with insecticides, fungicides and herbicides r

Skills, Knowledge & Experience

  • Degree in Agricultural Science or equivilent
  • Min 4 years experience in a similar role within the Agriculture industry.
  • Highly effective presentation and public speaking abilities.
  • Substantial knowledge of plant nutrition and nutrition programs
  • Experience in leading a team
  • Highly developed organisational skills and demonstrated ability to set priorities and meet deadlines.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with strong internal and external customer focus
  • A high level of proficiency of computing skills including word processing, PowerPoint, Excel, databases and Outlook.
  • Current Driver’s license is essential and a requirement of the role
  • Flexibility to travel inter and intrastate.
  • Agsafe/ Fertcare certification is desirable.

What else is on offer?

  • Be part of a dynamic global business
  • Opportunity for further development and promotion
  • A flexible work environment
  • Motor Vehicle and other tools of trade provided

Apply now or for a confidential discussion, please contact the Stoller HR Department on (08) 8169 0900 .

title: PhD Scholarship: Considering shapes for granular materials in civil engineering
description:
The University of South Australia (UniSA) is Australia’s University of Enterprise. We are South Australia’s largest university and one of the very best young universities in the world. At UniSA, we are authentic, resilient, and influential - and we deliver results. We pride ourselves on our dynamic and agile culture, which embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Plus, we are committed to the principles of excellence and equity.

Our people are critical to our success. They are creative, enterprising and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm.

We educate global professionals ready to create and inspire change, through more than 200 world-class degrees. We deliver outcomes-focused research that is inspired by global challenges and opportunities, to deliver economic and social prosperity.

Our strategic plan, Enterprise25, focusses on our people, programs and precincts, and sets out our path to ensure that we continue to deliver quality teaching, research and student outcomes.

  • 100% of our assessed research rated at or above world-class - 2018 Excellence in Research for Australia (ERA), 4-digit Fields of Research.
  • No. 1 in Australia for industry research income - 2019 THE World University Rankings.
  • No. 1 in Australia for research impact & engagement - 2018 ARC Engagement and Impact Assessment (EI), Combined Impact – Approach to Impact and Engagement on Assessed Fields.
  • Athena Swan Bronze Award.

About the research degree project:

PhD Project - Considering realistic shapes for granular materials in civil engineering

Advance knowledge in granular materials

If you are seeking to advance your career in civil engineering and interested in granular materials, the University of South Australia – Australia’s University of Enterprise – is offering a unique project-based PhD in partnership with CMW Geosciences.

Civil infrastructures are built on granular materials. The loss of granular materials’ shear strength can lead to catastrophic failures of civil infrastructures and result in significant casualties, so it is important to understanding how and why this occurs.

The particle shape is said to play an important role in the shear strength of granular materials. Most studies have considered a very idealised particle shape. This research project will seek to understand the current challenges around digitising particle shape and propose a modified discrete element model which can handle complex particle shapes within a reasonable computational time.

Through this research, you will provide insight into the interactions between discrete particles and develop a quantitative framework to assess granular material strength. The CT scan technique will be used to visualise the microstructure of granular material and this information will be transferred to the discrete element model for further analysis.

Join a dynamic team within geotechnical research, comprised of world-class researchers and a strong cohort of PhD students. We are currently collaborating with more than 35 local, national and international organisations so you will have ample opportunity to grow your professional and industry network.

What you’ll do

In this project-based research degree, you will be trained to use numerical programs for discrete element modelling and digital image processing. You will also perform triaxial and simple shear tests to validate the results from the numerical analyses.

The expertise you gain in both numerical programming and laboratory experiment will give you a competitive edge as there is a deficit of researchers within this area.

You will be encouraged and supported to attend a conference to present your research.

Where you’ll be based

You will be based in UniSA STEM . We link engineering, mathematics, science, defence, cybersecurity, construction management, environmental science, aviation, information management, information technology, and project management, harnessing the connections across disciplines to bring big ideas to fruition.

Our researchers deliver technical expertise and advice to industry, government and community groups to make commercially viable and sustainable impacts. The Future Industries Institute , Innovation and Collaboration Centre , and Australian Research Centre for Interactive and Virtual Environments all provide consultancy and access to advanced technology.

In an information-rich world, our people think big, combatting problems, testing solutions and making data-driven decisions. Our graduates are entrepreneurs and trailblazers, who design and build the world they want to live in.

Supervisory Team

  • Dr Khoi Nguyen - Principal Supervisor
  • Professor Md Mizanur Rahman - Co-Supervisor
  • Dr Rajibul Karim – Co-Supervisor

Dr Nick Barnett (CMW Geosciences)

Financial Support

This project is funded for reasonable research expenses.  Additionally, a living allowance scholarship of $28,854 per annum is available to eligible applicants. A fee-offset or waiver for the standard term of the program is also included. For full terms and benefits of the scholarship please refer to our scholarship information for domestic students or international students.

Eligibility and Selection

This project is open to application from both domestic and international applicants.

Applicants must meet the eligibility criteria for entrance into a PhD. Additionally applicants must meet the projects selection criteria:

  • a strong background in Civil and Geotechnical Engineering or related disciplines


Applicant who can also demonstrate the following will be highly regarded:

  • Good numerical and computational skills
  • Demonstrate good research capability


All applications that meet the eligibility and selection criteria will be considered for this project. A merit selection process will be used to determine the successful candidate.

The successful applicant is expected to study full-time and to be based at our Mawson Lakes Campus in the north of Adelaide.  Additionally applications from students studying externally will also be considered.  Note that international students on a student visa will need to study full-time.

Essential Dates

Applicants are expected to start in a timely fashion upon receipt of an offer.  Extended deferral periods are not available. Applications close on Tuesday, 7th June.

title: WHSE Systems and Governance Advisor
description:

The WHSE Systems and Governance Advisor will support the continuous improvement effort from a reporting, process and system perspective in accordance with the WHSE strategy. Desirable competencies and experiences

ASC will also adhere to any relevant health directives that may be made that affects our workforce.

We offer more than just a challenging and rewarding career.  We have put together a range of programs, initiatives and benefits that help empower our employees to reach their personal and professional goals to ensure their career with us is both challenging and rewarding.

With more than 1,300 employees based at two world-class facilities in South Australia and Western Australia, ASC has the expertise and resources unparalleled within Australia’s defence industry.

The opportunities are endless, and it has never been a more exciting time to come on board.

title: Research Associate Medical Biotechnology
description:
JR0000004514

Availability:
Fixed-Term until May 2023 | Full-Time

Compensation:
Research Academic Level A

Salary Range:
$88,592 - $94,938 p.a.

Reporting to:
Associate Professor, Medical Biotechnology
College of Medicine and Public Health

Position Information:
The salary range is reflective of the incumbent having completed a PhD.
This position may attract further funding for extension beyond the availability end date.

About the College of Medicine and Public Health
At the College of Medicine and Public Health, we deliver clinical, population and lab-based research, integrated teaching programs and high-quality clinical services. Our footprint reaches out from our world class teaching hospital at the Flinders Medical Centre in South Australia to multiple rural clinical locations all the way to Darwin in the Northern Territory. Our research and teaching equip the next generation of leaders and innovators with the skill, commitment, and vision to protect vulnerable communities and truly advance health outcomes. It's at the heart of everything we do.

About the Role

An exciting research opportunity is available for a postdoctoral researcher in the team of Associate Professor Munish Puri, based at Flinders' Medical Biotechnology research facilities. We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated postdoctoral researcher, who will conduct research in an Industry supported research project aimed at producing single cell microbial oil.

The project focuses on screening microbial strains (fungal/microalgae) for single cell oil production. The novel microbial oils would be produced through fermentation and evaluated for their transformed structures. This opportunity provides an effective and innovative means to rapidly identify and solve industry-relevant problems at a commercially relevant pace, while maintaining the academic rigour.

In working with the chief investigators, you will also contribute to the design and execution of the experiments in the university laboratory and sites of the industry partner, implementation of downstream processing methods and data analysis, and preparation of publication and reports within the scope of the project.

You will actively perform hands-on research and support reporting of new research findings through generation of high-quality publications and conference presentations. You will contribute towards attracting externally funded grants and assist in the supervision and training of research higher degree students. In addition, you will also assist the investigators in maintaining a close relationship with industry to ensure research in the bioprocessing area is relevant and industry focused.

About You

You will be able to demonstrate your well-developed interpersonal skills, critical in your work to collaborate with colleagues and engage with key stakeholders, including your assistance in developing and fostering industrial research partnerships. Further, you'll have ability to assist with co-supervision of HDR students, develop strong teamwork skills in a multicultural environment, and lead and manage research programs and those teams. Critical to the role, you will demonstrate:

  • research experience in carrying heterotrophic fermentation with regards to single cell oil producing microorganism, and relevant publications in high quality scientific journals;
  • experience in performing mutagenesis using oleaginous microbes (experience with fungus strains); and
  • experience in instrumentation GC-MS/HPLC for carrying fatty acid analysis, lipids analysis (fractionation of lipid classes, TLC-GC) and sugar analysis.

You must also show evidence of completion of a PhD in one of the following areas: biotechnology, industrial biotechnology, bioprocess engineering, biochemical engineering, chemical engineering, chemistry and biochemistry, or equivalent qualification in an appropriate and relevant field.

Life at Flinders

We're transforming, and investing in people and facilities, to create contemporary, stimulating and satisfying learning and work environments that reflect our core values of excellence, innovation, courage, and integrity. Flinders is refocusing its strategic priorities with the aim of elevating its performance to be a top ten Australian university, and amongst the top 1% in the world.

Reaching beyond the limits of buildings, borders, and backgrounds, ours is an inclusive culture that believes absolutely in equality and opportunity for all. We don't just accommodate differences; we embrace and celebrate them. So, why work at Flinders?

  • 17% Superannuation + salary packaging options
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Wide range of professional development activities and services
  • We embrace diversity and promote equity and inclusion for students and staff with disabilities and health conditions , we are committed to Indigenous education and engagement and support initiatives such as The Pride Network
  • Vibrant campus life and amenities including on campus health care services , gym and childcare centre

Prescribed Conditions for Employment
A valid National Police Certificate which is satisfactory to the University will also be required before the successful applicant can commence in this position.

Flinders University has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that requires all new staff members to be up to date with their COVID-19 vaccinations, subject to medical exemptions and limited exemptions.

Candidates with current rights to work in Australia (citizens, PRs, and temporary visa holders) will be considered in the first instance, however, we are happy to review international applications.

How to Apply and Information

Candidates are encouraged to have discussion with the hiring manager, Associate Professor Munish Puri , prior to submitting an application. Please do not forward applications to the contact.

To view the full position description and apply online , please visit the Jobs@Flinders website via the job portal: JR0000004514 Research Associate Medical Biotechnology .

Applications to be submitted before 11:59pm Wednesday, 1 June 2022

Please note, late applications and applications sent via agencies will not be accepted .
